entry.title: FedMosaic: Federated Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Parametric Adapters

author.name: Zhilin Liang, Yuxiang Wang, Zimu Zhou, Hainan Zhang, Boyi Liu, Yongxin Tong

entry.summary: Proposes FedMosaic for federated RAG using parametric adapters that encode documents into lightweight adapters merged with frozen LLMs, avoiding raw text exchange. Addresses storage and communication challenges unique to federated settings.

entry.title: Wid3R: Wide Field-of-View 3D Reconstruction via Camera Model Conditioning

author.name: Dongki Jung, Jaehoon Choi, Adil Qureshi, Somi Jeong, Dinesh Manocha, Suyong Yeon

entry.summary: Presents Wid3R, a neural network for visual geometry reconstruction supporting wide field-of-view cameras (fisheye, panoramic) using spherical harmonics ray representation and camera model tokens.

entry.title: SAIL: Self-Amplified Iterative Learning for Diffusion Model Alignment with Minimal Human Feedback

author.name: Xiaoxuan He, Siming Fu, Wanli Li, Zhiyuan Li, Dacheng Yin, Kang Rong, Fengyun Rao, Bo Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes SAIL for aligning diffusion models with minimal human feedback through self-amplified iterative learning, where models act as their own teachers.

entry.title: Neuro-Inspired Visual Pattern Recognition via Biological Reservoir Computing

author.name: Luca Ciampi, Ludovico Iannello, Fabrizio Tonelli, Gabriele Lagani, Angelo Di Garbo, Federico Cremisi, Giuseppe Amato

entry.summary: Presents a biological reservoir computing system using in vitro cultured cortical neurons on a high-density multi-electrode array for visual pattern recognition, with a linear readout layer for classification.

entry.title: Context Forcing: Consistent Autoregressive Video Generation with Long Context

author.name: Shuo Chen, Cong Wei, Sun Sun, Ping Nie, Kai Zhou, Ge Zhang, Ming-Hsuan Yang, Wenhu Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Context Forcing, a framework for consistent autoregressive video generation that trains a long-context student via a long-context teacher, resolving the student-teacher mismatch in existing streaming approaches.

entry.title: InterPrior: Scaling Generative Control for Physics-Based Human-Object Interactions

author.name: Sirui Xu, Samuel Schulter, Morteza Ziyadi, Xialin He, Xiaohan Fei, Yu-Xiong Wang, Liangyan Gui

entry.summary: Introduces InterPrior, a scalable framework for physics-based human-object interaction that learns unified generative controllers through large-scale imitation pretraining followed by RL post-training, enabling diverse loco-manipulation skills.

entry.title: Untwisting RoPE: Frequency Control for Shared Attention in DiTs

author.name: Aryan Mikaeili, Or Patashnik, Andrea Tagliasacchi, Daniel Cohen-Or, Ali Mahdavi-Amiri

entry.summary: Analyzes Rotary Positional Embeddings (RoPE) in diffusion transformers, showing that high-frequency components cause reference copying in shared-attention mechanisms. Proposes frequency control to enable style transfer without content copying.

entry.title: Scalable and General Whole-Body Control for Cross-Humanoid Locomotion

author.name: Yufei Xue, YunFeng Lin, Wentao Dong, Yang Tang, Jingbo Wang, Jiangmiao Pang, Ming Zhou, Minghuan Liu, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces XHugWBC, a cross-embodiment training framework that enables a single whole-body control policy to generalize across diverse humanoid robot designs through morphological randomization and semantically aligned observation/action spaces.

entry.title: Preparing for a Warning Shot

author.name: Noah Birnbaum

entry.summary: Argues that the classic AI safety assumption of 'no warning shots before catastrophe' looks weaker given current AI development patterns, and that preparing for ambiguous warning shots of misalignment is a neglected high-leverage area for AI safety work.

entry.title: Episodic memory in AI agents poses new safety risks

author.name: Chad DeChant

entry.summary: Argues that developing episodic memory for AI agents introduces underappreciated safety risks including enhanced deception capability, improved situational awareness, unwanted information retention, and unpredictable behavior. Proposes principles for safer implementation including interpretable memories and user control.

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence as Strange Intelligence: Against Linear Models of Intelligence

author.name: Kendra Chilson, Eric Schwitzgebel

entry.summary: Proposes 'strange intelligence' and 'familiar intelligence' as concepts to challenge the linear model of AI progress, arguing AI will combine superhuman and subhuman capabilities in unpredictable ways. Builds on Susan Schneider's work to argue general intelligence is not a unified capacity but the ability to achieve broad goals across environments.

entry.title: RaBiT: Residual-Aware Binarization Training for Accurate and Efficient LLMs

author.name: Youngcheon You, Banseok Lee, Minseop Choi, Seonyoung Kim, Hyochan Chong, Changdong Kim, Youngmin Kim, Dongkyu Kim

entry.summary: Proposes RaBiT, a residual-aware binarization training framework for LLMs that identifies and resolves 'inter-path adaptation' - a failure mode where parallel binary paths learn redundant features during quantization-aware training.

entry.title: Graph-based Agent Memory: Taxonomy, Techniques, and Applications

author.name: Chang Yang, Chuang Zhou, Yilin Xiao, Su Dong, Luyao Zhuang, Yujing Zhang, Zhu Wang, Zijin Hong, Zheng Yuan, Zhishang Xiang, Shengyuan Chen, Huachi Zhou, Qinggang Zhang, Ninghao Liu, Jinsong Su, Xinrun Wang, Yi Chang, Xiao Huang

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of graph-based memory systems for LLM agents, covering taxonomy of short/long-term, knowledge/experience, and structural/non-structural memory with emphasis on graph structures for relational modeling.

entry.title: Nonlinearity as Rank: Generative Low-Rank Adapter with Radial Basis Functions

author.name: Yihao Ouyang, Shiwei Li, Haozhao Wang, Xiandi Luo, Zhuoqi Hu, Yuetong Song, Qiyu Qin, Yichen Li, Ruixuan Li

entry.summary: Proposes GenLoRA, which replaces explicit basis vector storage in LoRA with nonlinear basis generation using radial basis functions, achieving parameter reduction while maintaining or improving adaptation quality.

entry.title: BABE: Biology Arena BEnchmark

author.name: Junting Zhou, Jin Chen, Linfeng Hao, Denghui Cao, Zheyu Wang, Qiguang Chen, Chaoyou Fu, Jiaze Chen, Yuchen Wu, Ge Zhang, Mingxuan Wang, Wenhao Huang, Tong Yang

entry.summary: Introduces BABE, a biology benchmark constructed from peer-reviewed papers testing AI ability to integrate experimental results with contextual knowledge for scientific reasoning, rather than just factual recall.

entry.title: Doc2Spec: Synthesizing Formal Programming Specifications from Natural Language via Grammar Induction

author.name: Shihao Xia, Mengting He, Haomin Jia, Linhai Song

entry.summary: Presents Doc2Spec, a multi-agent LLM framework that automatically generates formal programming specifications from natural language API documentation via grammar induction, evaluated on seven benchmarks.

entry.title: Semantic-level Backdoor Attack against Text-to-Image Diffusion Models

author.name: Tianxin Chen, Wenbo Jiang, Hongqiao Chen, Zhirun Zheng, Cheng Huang

entry.summary: Proposes SemBD, a semantic-level backdoor attack against text-to-image diffusion models that defines triggers as continuous semantic regions rather than discrete textual patterns. Uses distillation-based editing of cross-attention layers to be more resistant to existing defenses.

entry.title: A$^2$-LLM: An End-to-end Conversational Audio Avatar Large Language Model

author.name: Xiaolin Hu, Hang Yuan, Xinzhu Sang, Binbin Yan, Zhou Yu, Cong Huang, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Proposes A²-LLM, an end-to-end conversational audio avatar LLM that jointly reasons about language, audio prosody, and 3D facial motion in a unified framework. Addresses accumulated errors and latency issues in cascaded architectures for digital humans.

entry.title: EGSS: Entropy-guided Stepwise Scaling for Reliable Software Engineering

author.name: Chenhui Mao, Yuanting Lei, Zhixiang Wei, Ming Liang, Zhixiang Wang, Jingxuan Xu, Dajun Chen, Wei Jiang, Yong Li

entry.summary: Proposes EGSS, an entropy-guided test-time scaling framework for software engineering tasks that dynamically balances computational efficiency with solution quality. Addresses the high cost of deploying large ensembles in agentic code generation.

entry.title: Formal Synthesis of Certifiably Robust Neural Lyapunov-Barrier Certificates

author.name: Chengxiao Wang, Haoze Wu, Gagandeep Singh

entry.summary: Proposes methods for synthesizing robust neural Lyapunov barrier certificates that maintain safety/stability guarantees under perturbations in system dynamics. Defines sufficient conditions based on Lipschitz continuity for robustness against bounded perturbations.

entry.title: AI chatbots versus human healthcare professionals: a systematic review and meta-analysis of empathy in patient care

author.name: Alastair Howcroft, Amber Bennett-Weston, Ahmad Khan, Joseff Griffiths, Simon Gay, Jeremy Howick

entry.summary: Systematic review and meta-analysis comparing AI chatbots to human healthcare professionals on empathy measures, finding mixed results across studies. Covers an important question about AI in patient care.

entry.title: Verification of the Implicit World Model in a Generative Model via Adversarial Sequences

author.name: Andr\'as Balogh, M\'ark Jelasity

entry.summary: Proposes adversarial sequence generation to verify whether generative sequence models have learned correct world models, using chess as a testbed where rules provide ground truth for verification.

entry.title: RISE-Video: Can Video Generators Decode Implicit World Rules?

author.name: Mingxin Liu, Shuran Ma, Shibei Meng, Xiangyu Zhao, Zicheng Zhang, Shaofeng Zhang, Zhihang Zhong, Peixian Chen, Haoyu Cao, Xing Sun, Haodong Duan, Xue Yang

entry.summary: Presents RISE-Video, a benchmark for evaluating video generators' ability to decode implicit world rules, with 467 human-annotated samples spanning 8 categories testing cognitive reasoning beyond visual fidelity.

entry.title: Laplacian Representations for Decision-Time Planning

author.name: Dikshant Shehmar, Matthew Schlegel, Matthew E. Taylor, Marlos C. Machado

entry.summary: Shows that Laplacian representations provide effective latent spaces for decision-time planning in model-based RL by capturing multi-scale state-space distances. Introduces ALPS, a hierarchical planning algorithm that outperforms baselines.

entry.title: Learning, Solving and Optimizing PDEs with TensorGalerkin: an efficient high-performance Galerkin assembly algorithm

author.name: Shizheng Wen, Mingyuan Chi, Tianwei Yu, Ben Moseley, Mike Yan Michelis, Pu Ren, Hao Sun, Siddhartha Mishra

entry.summary: Presents TensorGalerkin, a unified GPU-optimized framework for numerical PDE solution, constrained optimization, and physics-informed learning using tensorized Galerkin assembly with a Map-Reduce paradigm on mesh sparsity graphs.

entry.title: Fairness Under Group-Conditional Prior Probability Shift: Invariance, Drift, and Target-Aware Post-Processing

author.name: Amir Asiaee, Kaveh Aryan

entry.summary: Studies fairness under group-conditional prior probability shift (GPPS), proving that some fairness criteria are invariant to such shifts while others drift, and proposes target-aware post-processing to handle the drift.

entry.title: Detecting Misbehaviors of Large Vision-Language Models by Evidential Uncertainty Quantification

author.name: Tao Huang, Rui Wang, Xiaofei Liu, Yi Qin, Li Duan, Liping Jing

entry.summary: Proposes using evidential uncertainty quantification to detect misbehaviors (hallucinations, harmful content) in large vision-language models, distinguishing between conflicting internal knowledge and absent supporting information.

entry.title: OpenMAG: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multimodal-Attributed Graph

author.name: Chenxi Wan, Xunkai Li, Yilong Zuo, Haokun Deng, Sihan Li, Bowen Fan, Hongchao Qin, Ronghua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Presents OpenMAG, a comprehensive benchmark for multimodal-attributed graph learning with 19 datasets across 6 domains, addressing limitations of existing benchmarks in domain coverage, model diversity, and task scope.

entry.title: Structural Disentanglement in Bilinear MLPs via Architectural Inductive Bias

author.name: Ojasva Nema, Kaustubh Sharma, Aditya Chauhan, Parikshit Pareek

entry.summary: Shows that bilinear MLPs possess a 'non-mixing' property under gradient flow where functional components separate into orthogonal subspaces, providing mathematical foundation for surgical model modification and selective unlearning.

entry.title: End-to-End Compression for Tabular Foundation Models

author.name: Guri Zab\"ergja, Rafiq Kamel, Arlind Kadra, Christian M. M. Frey, Josif Grabocka

entry.summary: Proposes TACO, an end-to-end compression model for tabular foundation models that addresses the quadratic complexity of attention-based in-context learning by compressing training context, enabling handling of larger datasets.

entry.title: Distributional Reinforcement Learning with Diffusion Bridge Critics

author.name: Shutong Ding, Yimiao Zhou, Ke Hu, Mokai Pan, Shan Zhong, Yanwei Fu, Jingya Wang, Ye Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Diffusion Bridge Critics (DBC) for distributional RL, using diffusion bridges to model inverse cumulative distribution functions of value distributions, providing more accurate value estimation for continuous control.

entry.title: Bifrost: Steering Strategic Trajectories to Bridge Contextual Gaps for Self-Improving Agents

author.name: Quan M. Tran, Zhuo Huang, Wenbin Zhang, Bo Han, Koji Yatani, Masashi Sugiyama, Tongliang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Bifrost, a training-free method for adapting task trajectories for self-improving agents by leveraging context-trajectory correlations to precisely guide trajectory adaptation without fine-tuning.

entry.title: Principled Confidence Estimation for Deep Computed Tomography

author.name: Matteo G\"atzner, Johannes Kirschner

entry.summary: Presents principled confidence estimation for CT reconstruction using sequential likelihood mixing, providing theoretical coverage guarantees for deep learning-based reconstructions including U-Nets and diffusion models.

entry.title: DFPO: Scaling Value Modeling via Distributional Flow towards Robust and Generalizable LLM Post-Training

author.name: Dingwei Zhu, Zhiheng Xi, Shihan Dou, Jiahan Li, Chenhao Huang, Junjie Ye, Sixian Li, Mingxu Chai, Yuhui Wang, Yajie Yang, Ming Zhang, Jiazheng Zhang, Shichun Liu, Caishuang Huang, Yunke Zhang, Yuran Wang, Tao Gui, Xipeng Qiu, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang

entry.summary: Proposes DFPO, a distributional RL framework for LLM post-training that models value distributions as continuous flows. Addresses noisy supervision and OOD generalization in RL-based LLM training.

entry.title: Orthogonal Model Merging

author.name: Sihan Yang, Kexuan Shi, Weiyang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes OrthoMerge, a method for merging fine-tuned LLMs on the Riemannian manifold formed by the orthogonal group, preserving geometric properties like hyperspherical energy during model merging.

entry.title: Can vision language models learn intuitive physics from interaction?

author.name: Luca M. Schulze Buschoff, Konstantinos Voudouris, Can Demircan, Eric Schulz

entry.summary: Tests whether vision-language models can learn intuitive physics through environmental interaction via RL. Finds that while RL improves within-task performance, models still fail to develop generalizable physical intuitions.

entry.title: Beware Untrusted Simulators -- Reward-Free Backdoor Attacks in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Ethan Rathbun, Wo Wei Lin, Alina Oprea, Christopher Amato

entry.summary: Demonstrates how adversarial simulator developers can implant action-level backdoors into RL agents by manipulating environment dynamics, a novel threat model for RL security.

entry.title: BioACE: An Automated Framework for Biomedical Answer and Citation Evaluations

author.name: Deepak Gupta, Davis Bartels, Dina Demner-Fuhsman

entry.summary: Introduces BioACE, an automated framework for evaluating biomedical answers and citations generated by LLMs. Addresses the critical challenge of verifying LLM outputs against scientific literature without requiring expert assessment.

entry.title: CASTLE: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Evaluating Student-Tailored Personalized Safety in Large Language Models

author.name: Rui Jia, Ruiyi Lan, Fengrui Liu, Zhongxiang Dai, Bo Jiang, Jing Shao, Jingyuan Chen, Guandong Xu, Fei Wu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CASTLE, a benchmark for evaluating personalized safety of LLMs for students with different cognitive and psychological attributes. Based on educational theories to capture divergent harms from identical responses.

entry.title: Multi-Field Tool Retrieval

author.name: Yichen Tang, Weihang Su, Yiqun Liu, Qingyao Ai

entry.summary: Identifies fundamental challenges in tool retrieval for LLMs including documentation quality, query-document mismatch, and proposes a multi-field approach to treat tool documents as structured multi-field objects.

entry.title: Magic-MM-Embedding: Towards Visual-Token-Efficient Universal Multimodal Embedding with MLLMs

author.name: Qi Li, Yanzhe Zhao, Yongxin Zhou, Yameng Wang, Yandong Yang, Yuanjia Zhou, Jue Wang, Zuojian Wang, Jinxiang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Magic-MM-Embedding, achieving efficient multimodal retrieval through visual token compression and multi-stage progressive training in MLLMs.

entry.title: Breaking Semantic Hegemony: Decoupling Principal and Residual Subspaces for Generalized OOD Detection

author.name: Ningkang Peng, Xiaoqian Peng, Yuhao Zhang, Qianfeng Yu, Feng Xing, Peirong Ma, Xichen Yang, Yi Chen, Tingyu Lu, Yanhui Gu

entry.summary: Identifies 'Semantic Hegemony' in OOD detection where models are sensitive to semantic OOD but blind to structurally distinct samples. Proposes decoupling principal and residual subspaces.

entry.title: Dolphin-v2: Universal Document Parsing via Scalable Anchor Prompting

author.name: Hao Feng, Wei Shi, Ke Zhang, Xiang Fei, Lei Liao, Dingkang Yang, Yongkun Du, Xuecheng Wu, Jingqun Tang, Yang Liu, Hong Chen, Can Huang

entry.summary: Presents Dolphin-v2, a two-stage document image parsing model with scalable anchor prompting, handling both digital-born and photographed documents.

entry.title: UniSurg: A Video-Native Foundation Model for Universal Understanding of Surgical Videos

author.name: Jinlin Wu, Felix Holm, Chuxi Chen, An Wang, Yaxin Hu, Xiaofan Ye, Zelin Zang, Miao Xu, Lihua Zhou, Huai Liao, Danny T. M. Chan, Ming Feng, Wai S. Poon, Hongliang Ren, Dong Yi, Nassir Navab, Gaofeng Meng, Jiebo Luo, Hongbin Liu, Zhen Lei

entry.summary: Presents UniSurg, a video-native foundation model for surgical video understanding that shifts from pixel-level reconstruction to latent motion prediction using V-JEPA, with innovations for motion-guided prediction and spatiotemporal self-distillation.

entry.title: UI-Mem: Self-Evolving Experience Memory for Online Reinforcement Learning in Mobile GUI Agents

author.name: Han Xiao, Guozhi Wang, Hao Wang, Shilong Liu, Yuxiang Chai, Yue Pan, Yufeng Zhou, Xiaoxin Chen, Yafei Wen, Hongsheng Li

entry.summary: Proposes UI-Mem, a framework enhancing GUI agent online RL with hierarchical experience memory that stores structured knowledge (workflows, subtask skills, failure patterns) as parameterized templates for cross-task transfer.

entry.title: Splat and Distill: Augmenting Teachers with Feed-Forward 3D Reconstruction For 3D-Aware Distillation

author.name: David Shavin, Sagie Benaim

entry.summary: Introduces Splat and Distill, which instills 3D awareness into 2D vision foundation models by lifting 2D features into 3D Gaussian representations and splatting them onto novel viewpoints for distillation supervision.

entry.title: Thinking with Geometry: Active Geometry Integration for Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Haoyuan Li, Qihang Cao, Tao Tang, Kun Xiang, Zihan Guo, Jianhua Han, Hang Xu, Xiaodan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes GeoThinker, which shifts from passive geometric fusion to active perception in spatial reasoning, enabling MLLMs to selectively retrieve geometric evidence conditioned on reasoning demands rather than indiscriminately fusing 3D features.

entry.title: The Simplest Case for AI Catastrophe

author.name: Linch

entry.summary: A comprehensive essay laying out the case for AI catastrophe in accessible terms, covering arguments about goal-seeking AI systems, the difficulty of specifying/verifying AI goals, competitive pressures preventing adequate safety measures, and how misalignment could lead to irreversible outcomes.

entry.title: SocialVeil: Probing Social Intelligence of Language Agents under Communication Barriers

author.name: Keyang Xuan, Pengda Wang, Chongrui Ye, Haofei Yu, Tal August, Jiaxuan You

entry.summary: Introduces SocialVeil, a benchmark testing LLM social intelligence under communication barriers including semantic vagueness, sociocultural mismatch, and emotional interference, grounded in a literature review of human communication challenges.

entry.title: M$^2$-Miner: Multi-Agent Enhanced MCTS for Mobile GUI Agent Data Mining

author.name: Rui Lv, Juncheng Mo, Tianyi Chu, Chen Rao, Hongyi Jing, Jiajie Teng, Jiafu Chen, Shiqi Zhang, Liangzi Ding, Shuo Fang, Huaizhong Lin, Ziqiang Dang, Chenguang Ma, Lei Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes M²-Miner, an MCTS-based multi-agent framework for automated mining of mobile GUI agent training data (intent-trajectory pairs), addressing cost, quality, and richness challenges in GUI agent data collection.

entry.title: Reactive Knowledge Representation and Asynchronous Reasoning

author.name: Simon Kohaut, Benedict Flade, Julian Eggert, Kristian Kersting, Devendra Singh Dhami

entry.summary: Introduces Resin, a probabilistic programming language merging probabilistic logic with reactive programming for efficient real-time belief updates in dynamic environments, exploiting heterogeneous update rates.

entry.title: LeakBoost: Perceptual-Loss-Based Membership Inference Attack

author.name: Amit Kravchik Taub, Fred M. Grabovski, Guy Amit, Yisroel Mirsky

entry.summary: Proposes LeakBoost, a membership inference attack using perceptual-loss-based interrogation that actively probes model internal representations to amplify differences between training members and non-members.

entry.title: DyTopo: Dynamic Topology Routing for Multi-Agent Reasoning via Semantic Matching

author.name: Yuxing Lu, Yucheng Hu, Xukai Zhao, Jiuxin Cao

entry.summary: Proposes DyTopo, a multi-agent framework that dynamically reconstructs communication graphs each round via semantic matching of agents' need/offer descriptors, outperforming fixed topology approaches on code and math benchmarks.

entry.title: Differentiable Inverse Graphics for Zero-shot Scene Reconstruction and Robot Grasping

author.name: Octavio Arriaga, Proneet Sharma, Jichen Guo, Marc Otto, Siddhant Kadwe, Rebecca Adam

entry.summary: Introduces a differentiable neuro-graphics model combining neural foundation models with physics-based differentiable rendering for zero-shot scene reconstruction and robot grasping, without additional 3D training data.

entry.title: ReFORM: Reflected Flows for On-support Offline RL via Noise Manipulation

author.name: Songyuan Zhang, Oswin So, H. M. Sabbir Ahmad, Eric Yang Yu, Matthew Cleaveland, Mitchell Black, Chuchu Fan

entry.summary: Proposes ReFORM, using reflected flows for offline RL that keeps actions within the training distribution support. Uses noise manipulation in flow-based policies to prevent out-of-distribution errors while retaining expressivity.

entry.title: Hybrid Gated Flow (HGF): Stabilizing 1.58-bit LLMs via Selective Low-Rank Correction

author.name: David Alejandro Trejo Pizzo

entry.summary: Introduces Hybrid Gated Flow (HGF) to stabilize 1.58-bit quantized LLMs by coupling a ternary backbone with a low-rank FP16 correction path controlled by adaptive gates. Reduces perplexity degradation from 20-25% to much lower levels.

entry.title: Path-Guided Flow Matching for Dataset Distillation

author.name: Xuhui Li, Zhengquan Luo, Xiwei Liu, Yongqiang Yu, Zhiqiang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Path-Guided Flow Matching (PGFM), the first flow matching-based framework for dataset distillation, enabling fast deterministic synthesis through ODE solving in a few steps.

entry.title: CSRv2: Unlocking Ultra-Sparse Embeddings

author.name: Lixuan Guo, Yifei Wang, Tiansheng Wen, Yifan Wang, Aosong Feng, Bo Chen, Stefanie Jegelka, Chenyu You

entry.summary: Proposes CSRv2 for ultra-sparse embeddings, addressing the degradation of Contrastive Sparse Representation when over 80% of neurons are inactive. Enables extreme sparsity for efficient storage and inference.

entry.title: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems

author.name: Joseph Fioresi, Parth Parag Kulkarni, Ashmal Vayani, Song Wang, Mubarak Shah

entry.summary: Proposes Learning to Share (LTS), a learned shared-memory mechanism for parallel agentic systems that enables selective cross-team information reuse, reducing redundant computation across parallel agent teams.

entry.title: SemPipes -- Optimizable Semantic Data Operators for Tabular Machine Learning Pipelines

author.name: Olga Ovcharenko, Matthias Boehm, Sebastian Schelter

entry.summary: Introduces SemPipes, a declarative programming model integrating LLM-powered semantic operators into tabular ML pipelines, synthesizing custom implementations based on data characteristics and pipeline context during training.

entry.title: Faithful Bi-Directional Model Steering via Distribution Matching and Distributed Interchange Interventions

author.name: Yuntai Bao, Xuhong Zhang, Jintao Chen, Ge Su, Yuxiang Cai, Hao Peng, Bing Sun, Haiqin Weng, Liu Yan, Jianwei Yin

entry.summary: Proposes Concept DAS (CDAS) for faithful bi-directional model steering via distribution matching and distributed interchange interventions, building on causal variable localization principles to avoid overfitting in intervention-based steering.

entry.title: TADS: Task-Aware Data Selection for Multi-Task Multimodal Pre-Training

author.name: Guanjie Cheng, Boyi Li, Lingyu Sun, Mengying Zhu, Yangyang Wu, Xinkui Zhao, Shuiguang Deng

entry.summary: Introduces TADS, a task-aware data selection framework for multimodal pre-training (CLIP) that integrates intrinsic quality, task relevance, and distributional diversity into a learnable value function for curating training data.

entry.title: Smoothness Errors in Dynamics Models and How to Avoid Them

author.name: Edward Berman, Luisa Li, Jung Yeon Park, Robin Walters

entry.summary: Systematically studies smoothing effects of different GNNs for dynamics modeling on surfaces, proving that unitary convolutions (designed to prevent oversmoothing) actually hurt performance in systems where smoothness naturally increases like diffusion.

entry.title: Robust Federated Learning via Byzantine Filtering over Encrypted Updates

author.name: Adda Akram Bendoukha, Aymen Boudguiga, Nesrine Kaaniche, Renaud Sirdey, Didem Demirag, S\'ebastien Gambs

entry.summary: Combines homomorphic encryption for privacy-preserving aggregation with property-inference-inspired meta-classifiers for Byzantine filtering in federated learning, addressing both security challenges simultaneously.

entry.title: Tight Long-Term Tail Decay of (Clipped) SGD in Non-Convex Optimization

author.name: Aleksandar Armacki, Dragana Bajovi\'c, Du\v{s}an Jakoveti\'c, Soummya Kar, Ali H. Sayed

entry.summary: Studies long-term tail decay rates of SGD in non-convex optimization, deriving tight bounds on the probability of failure rather than the typical high-probability error bounds, using large deviations theory.

entry.title: Projected Boosting with Fairness Constraints: Quantifying the Cost of Fair Training Distributions

author.name: Amir Asiaee, Kaveh Aryan

entry.summary: Introduces FairBoost, which projects boosting's exponential-weights distribution onto fair distributions, proving that the projection reduces effective edge by KL-divergence and providing convergence bounds with explicit fairness cost.

entry.title: How to Achieve the Intended Aim of Deep Clustering Now, without Deep Learning

author.name: Kai Ming Ting, Wei-Jie Xu, Hang Zhang

entry.summary: Challenges deep clustering by investigating whether deep-learned representations in DEC actually overcome k-means' fundamental limitations (arbitrary shapes, varied sizes/densities), with broader implications for the deep clustering field.

entry.title: How Controlling the Variance can Improve Training Stability of Sparsely Activated DNNs and CNNs

author.name: Emily Dent, Jared Tanner

entry.summary: Shows that controlling the variance of the Gaussian process characterization of deep network layers is important for training with sparsity-inducing activations, enabling up to 90% activation sparsity in DNNs and CNNs.

entry.title: $f$-GRPO and Beyond: Divergence-Based Reinforcement Learning Algorithms for General LLM Alignment

author.name: Rajdeep Haldar, Lantao Mei, Guang Lin, Yue Xing, Qifan Song

entry.summary: Proposes f-GRPO and f-HAL, generalizations of GRPO using f-divergences for LLM alignment. Extends divergence-based perspective from preference alignment to general settings including RLVR.

entry.title: Breaking Symmetry Bottlenecks in GNN Readouts

author.name: Mouad Talhi, Arne Wolf, Anthea Monod

entry.summary: Identifies an independent expressivity bottleneck at the readout stage of GNNs, showing that all linear permutation-invariant readouts (sum, mean pooling) erase non-trivial symmetry-aware components regardless of encoder power.

entry.title: Scaling Laws for Embedding Dimension in Information Retrieval

author.name: Julian Killingback, Mahta Rafiee, Madine Manas, Hamed Zamani

entry.summary: Studies scaling laws for embedding dimension in dense retrieval, investigating how retrieval performance changes as embedding dimension scales. Provides fundamental insights into the capacity limits of vector-based retrieval.

entry.title: Radon--Wasserstein Gradient Flows for Interacting-Particle Sampling in High Dimensions

author.name: Elias Hess-Childs, Dejan Slep\v{c}ev, Lantian Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Radon-Wasserstein geometry for gradient flows of KL divergence, enabling accurate interacting-particle approximations in high dimensions with cost scaling linearly in particles and dimension.

entry.title: How Do Language Models Acquire Character-Level Information?

author.name: Soma Sato, Ryohei Sasano

entry.summary: Investigates how language models acquire character-level information despite not being explicitly trained on it. Identifies contributing factors from tokenization (merge rules, orthographic constraints) and non-tokenization sources (semantic associations, syntax).

entry.title: Polyglots or Multitudes? Multilingual LLM Answers to Value-laden Multiple-Choice Questions

author.name: L\'eo Labat, Etienne Ollion, Fran\c{c}ois Yvon

entry.summary: Investigates whether multilingual LLMs respond consistently across languages to value-laden questions or exhibit language-dependent value variation. Releases the Multilingual European Value Survey (MEVS) benchmark.

entry.title: AFD-INSTRUCTION: A Comprehensive Antibody Instruction Dataset with Functional Annotations for LLM-Based Understanding and Design

author.name: Ling Luo, Wenbin Jiang, Xushi Zhang, Hongyuan Chang, Xinkang Wang, Yueting Xiong, Mengsha Tong, Rongshan Yu

entry.summary: Presents AFD-Instruction, the first large-scale instruction dataset with functional annotations for antibody understanding and design. Enables LLMs to interpret and design antibodies through natural language.

entry.title: UniTrack: Differentiable Graph Representation Learning for Multi-Object Tracking

author.name: Bishoy Galoaa, Xiangyu Bai, Utsav Nandi, Sai Siddhartha Vivek Dhir Rangoju, Somaieh Amraee, Sarah Ostadabbas

entry.summary: Presents UniTrack, a plug-and-play graph-theoretic loss function for multi-object tracking that optimizes detection accuracy, identity preservation, and spatiotemporal consistency in a single differentiable loss.

entry.title: ReGLA: Efficient Receptive-Field Modeling with Gated Linear Attention Network

author.name: Junzhou Li, Manqi Zhao, Yilin Gao, Zhiheng Yu, Yin Li, Dongsheng Jiang, Li Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces ReGLA, lightweight hybrid networks combining efficient convolutions with ReLU-based gated linear attention for high-resolution image processing with reduced latency.

entry.title: Unlocking Prototype Potential: An Efficient Tuning Framework for Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning

author.name: Shengqin Jiang, Xiaoran Feng, Yuankai Qi, Haokui Zhang, Renlong Hang, Qingshan Liu, Lina Yao, Quan Z. Sheng, Ming-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: Proposes fine-tuning prototypes instead of feature extractors for few-shot class-incremental learning. Argues this perspective shift unlocks prototype potential while maintaining stable features.

entry.title: Fast-SAM3D: 3Dfy Anything in Images but Faster

author.name: Weilun Feng, Mingqiang Wu, Zhiliang Chen, Chuanguang Yang, Haotong Qin, Yuqi Li, Xiaokun Liu, Guoxin Fan, Zhulin An, Libo Huang, Yulun Zhang, Michele Magno, Yongjun Xu

entry.summary: Presents Fast-SAM3D, a training-free acceleration framework for SAM3D that dynamically aligns computation with generation complexity across multiple levels of heterogeneity.

entry.title: Imagine a City: CityGenAgent for Procedural 3D City Generation

author.name: Zishan Liu, Zecong Tang, RuoCheng Wu, Xinzhe Zheng, Jingyu Hu, Ka-Hei Hui, Haoran Xie, Bo Dai, Zhengzhe Liu

entry.summary: Introduces CityGenAgent, a natural language-driven framework for hierarchical procedural generation of 3D cities using Block and Building Programs with RL-guided refinement.

entry.title: FastVMT: Eliminating Redundancy in Video Motion Transfer

author.name: Yue Ma, Zhikai Wang, Tianhao Ren, Mingzhe Zheng, Hongyu Liu, Jiayi Guo, Mark Fong, Yuxuan Xue, Zixiang Zhao, Konrad Schindler, Qifeng Chen, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces FastVMT for efficient video motion transfer by identifying and eliminating motion redundancy (frame-to-frame smoothness) and gradient redundancy (slow gradient changes along diffusion trajectory) in DiT-based approaches, achieving significant speedup.

entry.title: Geometric Observability Index: An Operator-Theoretic Framework for Per-Feature Sensitivity, Weak Observability, and Dynamic Effects in SE(3) Pose Estimation

author.name: Joe-Mei Feng, Sheng-Wei Yu

entry.summary: Presents a Geometric Observability Index (GOI), an operator-theoretic framework for analyzing per-feature sensitivity in SE(3) camera pose estimation, extending influence function theory to Lie groups.

entry.title: Sparse Video Generation Propels Real-World Beyond-the-View Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Hai Zhang, Siqi Liang, Li Chen, Yuxian Li, Yukuan Xu, Yichao Zhong, Fu Zhang, Hongyang Li

entry.summary: Proposes sparse video generation for beyond-the-view vision-language navigation, where agents navigate using only simple high-level intents rather than detailed step-by-step instructions, generating sparse future visual predictions to overcome short-sighted behavior.

entry.title: SwimBird: Eliciting Switchable Reasoning Mode in Hybrid Autoregressive MLLMs

author.name: Jintao Tong, Shilin Yan, Hongwei Xue, Xiaojun Tang, Kunyu Shi, Guannan Zhang, Ruixuan Li, Yixiong Zou

entry.summary: Introduces SwimBird, a reasoning-switchable MLLM that dynamically chooses among text-based, vision-based, and hybrid reasoning modes depending on the query, addressing the rigidity of fixed reasoning patterns.

entry.title: PLATO Hand: Shaping Contact Behavior with Fingernails for Precise Manipulation

author.name: Dong Ho Kang, Aaron Kim, Mingyo Seo, Kazuto Yokoyama, Tetsuya Narita, Luis Sentis

entry.summary: Presents the PLATO Hand, a dexterous robotic hand with hybrid fingertips embedding rigid fingernails within compliant pulp, enabling diverse contact behaviors for precise manipulation tasks like paper singulation and orange peeling.

entry.title: Idea: the intelligence explosion convention

author.name: wdmacaskill

entry.summary: Proposes an 'Intelligence Explosion Convention'—a pre-negotiated international governance framework to handle the rapid technological changes that could accompany an AI-driven acceleration, covering democracy, dangerous technologies, resource governance, and digital being rights.

entry.title: DeepRead: Document Structure-Aware Reasoning to Enhance Agentic Search

author.name: Zhanli Li, Huiwen Tian, Lvzhou Luo, Yixuan Cao, Ping Luo

entry.summary: Introduces DeepRead, a structure-aware multi-turn document reasoning agent that preserves document hierarchy (headings, paragraphs) during RAG for long-document QA, rather than treating documents as flat chunk collections. Uses LLM-based OCR to convert PDFs to structured Markdown.

entry.title: Emulating Aggregate Human Choice Behavior and Biases with GPT Conversational Agents

author.name: Stephen Pilli, Vivek Nallur

entry.summary: Studies whether LLMs can predict individual-level cognitive biases and emulate biased human behavior under contextual factors like cognitive load, using conversational experiments with N=1100 participants.

entry.title: Mitigating Hallucination in Financial Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Fine-Grained Knowledge Verification

author.name: Taoye Yin, Haoyuan Hu, Yaxin Fan, Xinhao Chen, Xinya Wu, Kai Deng, Kezun Zhang, Feng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes RLFKV for financial RAG, decomposing responses into atomic knowledge units with fine-grained verification against retrieved documents to compute faithful rewards for RL training.

entry.title: RocqSmith: Can Automatic Optimization Forge Better Proof Agents?

author.name: Andrei Kozyrev, Nikita Khramov, Denis Lochmelis, Valerio Morelli, Gleb Solovev, Anton Podkopaev

entry.summary: Studies automatic optimization methods for Rocq theorem-proving agents, finding that simple few-shot bootstrapping is most effective while none match carefully hand-engineered systems.

entry.title: AgenticPay: A Multi-Agent LLM Negotiation System for Buyer-Seller Transactions

author.name: Xianyang Liu, Shangding Gu, Dawn Song

entry.summary: Introduces AgenticPay, a benchmark for multi-agent buyer-seller negotiation with 110+ tasks, where agents with private constraints negotiate in natural language across bilateral and many-to-many market settings.

entry.title: Physics as the Inductive Bias for Causal Discovery

author.name: Jianhong Chen, Naichen Shi, Xubo Yue

entry.summary: Proposes a framework integrating physics-based ODE models with data-driven causal discovery, allowing physical knowledge to serve as an inductive bias. Handles challenges like feedback loops, cyclic interactions, and non-stationary data that violate assumptions of many causal discovery methods.

entry.title: E-Globe: Scalable $\epsilon$-Global Verification of Neural Networks via Tight Upper Bounds and Pattern-Aware Branching

author.name: Wenting Li, Saif R. Kazi, Russell Bent, Duo Zhou, Huan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes E-Globe, a neural network verifier using branch-and-bound with tight upper bounds from nonlinear programs with complementarity constraints. Achieves ε-global optimality for robustness verification with warm-starting and pattern-aware branching.

entry.title: Attention Retention for Continual Learning with Vision Transformers

author.name: Yue Lu, Xiangyu Zhou, Shizhou Zhang, Yinghui Xing, Guoqiang Liang, Wencong Zhang

entry.summary: Identifies attention drift in Vision Transformers as a primary cause of catastrophic forgetting in continual learning, and proposes an attention-retaining framework that constrains gradient updates to preserve attention maps from previous tasks.

entry.title: Shiva-DiT: Residual-Based Differentiable Top-$k$ Selection for Efficient Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Jiaji Zhang, Hailiang Zhao, Guoxuan Zhu, Ruichao Sun, Jiaju Wu, Xinkui Zhao, Hanlin Tang, Weiyi Lu, Kan Liu, Tao Lan, Lin Qu, Shuiguang Deng

entry.summary: Proposes Shiva-DiT for efficient Diffusion Transformers, using residual-based differentiable top-k token selection that enforces deterministic token counts for hardware compatibility while maintaining end-to-end learnability.

entry.title: CompactRAG: Reducing LLM Calls and Token Overhead in Multi-Hop Question Answering

author.name: Hao Yang, Zhiyu Yang, Xupeng Zhang, Wei Wei, Yunjie Zhang, Lin Yang

entry.summary: Proposes CompactRAG, which decouples offline corpus restructuring (converting to atomic QA pairs) from online reasoning for multi-hop question answering, reducing LLM calls and token overhead.

entry.title: GenArena: How Can We Achieve Human-Aligned Evaluation for Visual Generation Tasks?

author.name: Ruihang Li, Leigang Qu, Jingxu Zhang, Dongnan Gui, Mengde Xu, Xiaosong Zhang, Han Hu, Wenjie Wang, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Investigates the reliability of pointwise scoring for visual generation evaluation, finding it unreliable, and introduces GenArena, a pairwise comparison framework that achieves better human alignment.

entry.title: Learning Query-Aware Budget-Tier Routing for Runtime Agent Memory

author.name: Haozhen Zhang, Haodong Yue, Tao Feng, Quanyu Long, Jianzhu Bao, Bowen Jin, Weizhi Zhang, Xiao Li, Jiaxuan You, Chengwei Qin, Wenya Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BudgetMem, a runtime agent memory framework with three budget tiers and a lightweight router for explicit query-aware performance-cost control in LLM agents operating beyond single context windows.

entry.title: Shared LoRA Subspaces for almost Strict Continual Learning

author.name: Prakhar Kaushik, Ankit Vaidya, Shravan Chaudhari, Rama Chellappa, Alan Yuille

entry.summary: Proposes Share, a method for parameter-efficient continual finetuning that learns a single shared low-rank subspace dynamically updated across tasks, avoiding data replay or multiple adapters.

entry.title: Disentangled Representation Learning via Flow Matching

author.name: Jinjin Chi, Taoping Liu, Mengtao Yin, Ximing Li, Yongcheng Jing, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Proposes a flow matching-based framework for disentangled representation learning with factor-conditioned flows and a non-overlap orthogonality regularizer to suppress cross-factor interference.

entry.title: A Short and Unified Convergence Analysis of the SAG, SAGA, and IAG Algorithms

author.name: Feng Zhu, Robert W. Heath Jr., Aritra Mitra

entry.summary: Provides a unified convergence analysis for SAG, SAGA, and IAG variance-reduced optimization algorithms using a single proof technique, simplifying the notoriously involved original SAG proof that required computer-aided analysis.

entry.title: When Are RL Hyperparameters Benign? A Study in Offline Goal-Conditioned RL

author.name: Jan Malte T\"opperwien, Aditya Mohan, Marius Lindauer

entry.summary: Studies hyperparameter sensitivity in offline goal-conditioned RL, finding substantially greater robustness to hyperparameter changes compared to online RL, suggesting sensitivity may be more about training dynamics than the RL problem itself.

entry.title: Perception-Based Beliefs for POMDPs with Visual Observations

author.name: Miriam Sch\"afers, Merlijn Krale, Thiago D. Sim\~ao, Nils Jansen, Maximilian Weininger

entry.summary: Introduces PBP framework complementing POMDP solvers with perception models (image classifiers) that map visual observations to state probability distributions, enabling principled planning with high-dimensional image observations.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Offline Policy Adaptation via Selective Transition Correction

author.name: Mengbei Yan, Jiafei Lyu, Shengjie Sun, Zhongjian Qiao, Jingwen Yang, Zichuan Lin, Deheng Ye, Xiu Li

entry.summary: Proposes selective transition correction for cross-domain offline RL, modifying source domain data to match target domain dynamics using an inverse policy model rather than filtering or reward modification.

entry.title: Curiosity is Knowledge: Self-Consistent Learning and No-Regret Optimization with Active Inference

author.name: Yingke Li, Anjali Parashar, Enlu Zhou, Chuchu Fan

entry.summary: Establishes the first theoretical guarantee for Expected Free Energy-minimizing agents in active inference, showing that sufficient curiosity ensures both Bayesian posterior consistency and no-regret optimization simultaneously.

entry.title: Pruning Minimal Reasoning Graphs for Efficient Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Ning Wang, Kuanyan Zhu, Daniel Yuehwoon Yee, Yitang Gao, Shiying Huang, Zirun Xu, Sainyam Galhotra

entry.summary: Proposes AutoPrunedRetriever, a graph-style RAG system that persists minimal reasoning subgraphs across queries, incrementally extending them rather than re-retrieving from scratch. Reduces tokens and latency.

entry.title: Certifiable Boolean Reasoning Is Universal

author.name: Wenhao Li, Anastasis Kratsios, Hrad Ghoukasian, Dennis Zvigelsky

entry.summary: Proves that certifiable Boolean reasoning is universal - constructs a deep learning model that provably always reasons correctly and can universally solve any Boolean task, with parameter efficiency for simple tasks.

entry.title: VRIQ: Benchmarking and Analyzing Visual-Reasoning IQ of VLMs

author.name: Tina Khezresmaeilzadeh, Jike Zhong, Konstantinos Psounis

entry.summary: Introduces VRIQ benchmark for evaluating visual reasoning IQ of VLMs. Finds near-random performance (~28%) on abstract puzzles and weak performance (~45%) on natural image reasoning. Tool-augmented reasoning shows only modest improvements.

entry.title: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling

author.name: Kavana Venkatesh, Yinhan He, Jundong Li, Jiaming Cui

entry.summary: Proposes PhysicsAgentABM, a framework bridging LLM-based multi-agent systems with classical agent-based models by using physics-guided behavioral clusters. Combines symbolic agents with neural transition models and epistemic fusion for calibrated simulations.

entry.title: ShapePuri: Shape Guided and Appearance Generalized Adversarial Purification

author.name: Zhe Li, Bernhard Kainz

entry.summary: Introduces ShapePuri, a defense framework against adversarial attacks using shape-guided purification through Signed Distance Functions and global appearance debiasing.

entry.title: Dual-Representation Image Compression at Ultra-Low Bitrates via Explicit Semantics and Implicit Textures

author.name: Chuqin Zhou, Xiaoyue Ling, Yunuo Chen, Jincheng Dai, Guo Lu, Wenjun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a dual-representation image compression framework combining explicit semantics and implicit textures for ultra-low bitrate compression, bridging semantic faithfulness and perceptual realism.

entry.title: E.M.Ground: A Temporal Grounding Vid-LLM with Holistic Event Perception and Matching

author.name: Jiahao Nie, Wenbin An, Gongjie Zhang, Yicheng Xu, Yap-Peng Tan, Alex C. Kot, Shijian Lu

entry.summary: Introduces E.M.Ground, a Video LLM for temporal video grounding using holistic event perception with a special token aggregating frame information for semantic continuity.

entry.title: Boosting SAM for Cross-Domain Few-Shot Segmentation via Conditional Point Sparsification

author.name: Jiahao Nie, Yun Xing, Wenbin An, Qingsong Zhao, Jiawei Shao, Yap-Peng Tan, Alex C. Kot, Shijian Lu, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Boosts SAM for cross-domain few-shot segmentation by using conditional point sparsification, finding that sparse points outperform dense points under large domain shifts.

entry.title: RFM-Pose:Reinforcement-Guided Flow Matching for Fast Category-Level 6D Pose Estimation

author.name: Diya He, Qingchen Liu, Cong Zhang, Jiahu Qin

entry.summary: Proposes RFM-Pose, combining flow-matching with reinforcement learning for fast category-level 6D pose estimation. Uses optimal transport paths and active hypothesis evaluation.

entry.title: MTPano: Multi-Task Panoramic Scene Understanding via Label-Free Integration of Dense Prediction Priors

author.name: Jingdong Zhang, Xiaohang Zhan, Lingzhi Zhang, Yizhou Wang, Zhengming Yu, Jionghao Wang, Wenping Wang, Xin Li

entry.summary: Proposes MTPano, a multi-task panoramic scene understanding model using label-free training with perspective foundation model priors projected to panoramic space.

entry.title: Learning with Adaptive Prototype Manifolds for Out-of-Distribution Detection

author.name: Ningkang Peng, JiuTao Zhou, Yuhao Zhang, Xiaoqian Peng, Qianfeng Yu, Linjing Qian, Tingyu Lu, Yi Chen, Yanhui Gu

entry.summary: Proposes APEX for OOD detection, identifying flaws in existing prototype-based methods (Static Homogeneity, Learning-Inference Disconnect) and addressing them through adaptive prototype manifolds.

entry.title: VGGT-Motion: Motion-Aware Calibration-Free Monocular SLAM for Long-Range Consistency

author.name: Zhuang Xiong, Chen Zhang, Qingshan Xu, Wenbing Tao

entry.summary: Proposes VGGT-Motion, a calibration-free monocular SLAM system that uses motion-aware submap construction and anchor-driven Sim(3) registration for consistent trajectories over kilometer-scale sequences.

entry.title: Visual Implicit Geometry Transformer for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Arsenii Shirokov, Mikhail Kuznetsov, Danila Stepochkin, Egor Evdokimov, Daniil Glazkov, Nikolay Patakin, Anton Konushin, Dmitry Senushkin

entry.summary: Introduces ViGT, a calibration-free autonomous driving model that estimates continuous 3D occupancy fields from surround-view cameras in a BEV representation, designed for scalability across sensor configurations.

entry.title: ShapeUP: Scalable Image-Conditioned 3D Editing

author.name: Inbar Gat, Dana Cohen-Bar, Guy Levy, Elad Richardson, Daniel Cohen-Or

entry.summary: Presents ShapeUP, a scalable image-conditioned 3D editing framework that formulates editing as supervised latent-to-latent translation within a native 3D representation, avoiding optimization-based bottlenecks.

entry.title: Focus-Scan-Refine: From Human Visual Perception to Efficient Visual Token Pruning

author.name: Enwei Tong, Yuanchao Bai, Yao Zhu, Junjun Jiang, Xianming Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Focus-Scan-Refine (FSR), a human-inspired visual token pruning framework for vision-language models that mimics how humans answer visual questions: focus on key evidence, scan globally, then refine by aggregating relevant details.

entry.title: VisRefiner: Learning from Visual Differences for Screenshot-to-Code Generation

author.name: Jie Deng, Kaichun Yao, Libo Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes VisRefiner for screenshot-to-code generation that enables models to learn from visual differences between rendered predictions and reference designs, mimicking how human developers iteratively compare implementations.

entry.title: V-Retrver: Evidence-Driven Agentic Reasoning for Universal Multimodal Retrieval

author.name: Dongyang Chen, Chaoyang Wang, Dezhao SU, Xi Xiao, Zeyu Zhang, Jing Xiong, Qing Li, Yuzhang Shang, Shichao Ka

entry.summary: Proposes V-Retrver, an evidence-driven multimodal retrieval framework that reformulates retrieval as agentic reasoning with visual inspection, enabling MLLMs to selectively acquire visual evidence via external tools.

entry.title: RoboPaint: From Human Demonstration to Any Robot and Any View

author.name: Jiacheng Fan, Zhiyue Zhao, Yiqian Zhang, Chao Chen, Peide Wang, Hengdi Zhang, Zhengxue Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes RoboPaint, a Real-Sim-Real pipeline that transforms human demonstrations into robot-executable training data through tactile-aware retargeting and environment-specific rendering, avoiding direct teleoperation.

entry.title: A Proposal for TruesightBench

author.name: David Africa

entry.summary: Proposes TruesightBench, a benchmark to rigorously measure LLMs' ability to infer author characteristics (demographics, expertise, emotional state) from text alone, moving beyond anecdotal evidence of 'truesight' capabilities.

entry.title: Hinge Regression Tree: A Newton Method for Oblique Regression Tree Splitting

author.name: Hongyi Li, Han Lin, Jun Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Hinge Regression Tree (HRT) which reframes oblique decision tree splitting as non-linear least-squares optimization, proving monotonic convergence of the alternating fitting procedure via Gauss-Newton connection.

entry.title: A Systematic Evaluation of Large Language Models for PTSD Severity Estimation: The Role of Contextual Knowledge and Modeling Strategies

author.name: Panagiotis Kaliosis, Adithya V Ganesan, Oscar N. E. Kjell, Whitney Ringwald, Scott Feltman, Melissa A. Carr, Dimitris Samaras, Camilo Ruggero, Benjamin J. Luft, Roman Kotov, Andrew H. Schwartz

entry.summary: Evaluates 11 LLMs for PTSD severity estimation using clinical narratives from 1,437 individuals. Systematically varies contextual knowledge and modeling strategies to understand factors affecting accuracy.

entry.title: HugRAG: Hierarchical Causal Knowledge Graph Design for RAG

author.name: Nengbo Wang, Tuo Liang, Vikash Singh, Chaoda Song, Van Yang, Yu Yin, Jing Ma, Jagdip Singh, Vipin Chaudhary

entry.summary: Introduces HugRAG, a hierarchical causal knowledge graph framework for RAG that models causal relationships between knowledge elements rather than relying on surface-level node matching, addressing hallucination and scalability issues.

entry.title: Automatic Cognitive Task Generation for In-Situ Evaluation of Embodied Agents

author.name: Xinyi He, Ying Yang, Chuanjian Fu, Sihan Guo, Songchun Zhu, Lifeng Fan, Zhenliang Zhang, Yujia Peng

entry.summary: Proposes TEA, a dynamic task generation system for evaluating embodied agents in unseen 3D environments, inspired by human cognition. Uses structured graph representations with interaction-evolution stages.

entry.title: H-AdminSim: A Multi-Agent Simulator for Realistic Hospital Administrative Workflows with FHIR Integration

author.name: Jun-Min Lee, Meong Hi Son, Edward Choi

entry.summary: Proposes H-AdminSim, an end-to-end multi-agent simulation framework for hospital administrative workflows with FHIR integration, enabling systematic LLM comparison on realistic administrative tasks processing 10K+ daily requests.

entry.title: TangramSR: Can Vision-Language Models Reason in Continuous Geometric Space?

author.name: Yikun Zong, Cheston Tan

entry.summary: Tests VLMs on Tangram puzzle assembly, finding systematic failures in continuous geometric reasoning (average IoU 0.41 on single-piece, 0.23 on two-piece) far below human performance.

entry.title: FiMI: A Domain-Specific Language Model for Indian Finance Ecosystem

author.name: Aboli Kathar, Aman Kumar, Anusha Kamath, Araveeti Srujan, Ashish Sharma, Chandra Bhushan, Dilip Asbe, Divya Sorate, Duddu Prasanth Kumar, Evan Acharya, Harsh Sharma, Hrithik Kadam, Kanishk Singla, Keyur Doshi, Kiran Praveen, Kolisetty Krishna SK, Krishanu Adhikary, Lokesh MPT, Mayurdeep Sonowal, Nadeem Shaikh, Navya Prakash, Nimit Kothari, Nitin Kukreja, Prashant Devadiga, Rakesh Paul, Ratanjeet Pratap Chauhan, Raunak Kalani, Raviraj Joshi, Shamanth MH, Shantanu Pandey, Shubham Soni, Siddharth Dixit, Smriti Jopat, Sunil Patel, Suraj Singh, Suvradip Paul, Tulasi Pilla, Utkarsh Vaidya, Vineeth Nambiar, Vishal Kanvaty, Yatharth Dedhia

entry.summary: Presents FiMI, a domain-specialized financial LLM for Indian digital payments built on Mistral Small 24B, trained on 68B tokens of financial/multilingual data with tool-driven conversation fine-tuning. Achieves 20% improvement over base model.

entry.title: OmniVideo-R1: Reinforcing Audio-visual Reasoning with Query Intention and Modality Attention

author.name: Zhangquan Chen, Jiale Tao, Ruihuang Li, Yihao Hu, Ruitao Chen, Zhantao Yang, Xinlei Yu, Haodong Jing, Manyuan Zhang, Shuai Shao, Biao Wang, Qinglin Lu, Ruqi Huang

entry.summary: Proposes OmniVideo-R1, a reinforced framework for audio-visual reasoning using query-intensive grounding and modality-attentive fusion, improving mixed-modality understanding in video models.

entry.title: Denoising diffusion networks for normative modeling in neuroimaging

author.name: Luke Whitbread, Lyle J. Palmer, Mark Jenkinson

entry.summary: Proposes denoising diffusion probabilistic models as unified conditional density estimators for neuroimaging-derived phenotypes, enabling multivariate normative modeling that preserves cross-feature dependencies.

entry.title: CoWork-X: Experience-Optimized Co-Evolution for Multi-Agent Collaboration System

author.name: Zexin Lin, Jiachen Yu, Haoyang Zhang, Yuzhao Li, Zhonghang Li, Yujiu Yang, Junjie Wang, Xiaoqiang Ji

entry.summary: Proposes CoWork-X, a multi-agent collaboration framework with fast-slow memory separation for real-time cooperative tasks. Uses HTN (hierarchical task networks) for a Skill-Agent and active co-evolution across episodes.

entry.title: Reliable Explanations or Random Noise? A Reliability Metric for XAI

author.name: Poushali Sengupta, Sabita Maharjan, Frank Eliassen, Shashi Raj Pandey, Yan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a reliability metric for XAI methods (SHAP, Integrated Gradients), measuring whether explanations remain stable and consistent under realistic, non-adversarial changes including input perturbations and model updates.

entry.title: Individual Fairness In Strategic Classification

author.name: Zhiqun Zuo, Mohammad Mahdi Khalili

entry.summary: Proves that deterministic threshold classifiers violate individual fairness in strategic classification settings and proposes randomized classifiers that can achieve individual fairness through linear programming.

entry.title: DisCa: Accelerating Video Diffusion Transformers with Distillation-Compatible Learnable Feature Caching

author.name: Chang Zou, Changlin Li, Yang Li, Patrol Li, Jianbing Wu, Xiao He, Songtao Liu, Zhao Zhong, Kailin Huang, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes DisCa, a method combining feature caching with step-distillation for accelerating video diffusion transformers, addressing the quality degradation that occurs when applying caching to distilled models. Achieves better speed-quality tradeoffs for video generation.

entry.title: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence

author.name: Koichi Takahashi, Yusuke Hayashi

entry.summary: Proposes two bits-per-joule metrics for measuring physical intelligence: Thermodynamic Epiplexity per Joule (recognition/model-building) and Empowerment per Joule (control/action influence), grounded in stochastic thermodynamics.

entry.title: Mode-Dependent Rectification for Stable PPO Training

author.name: Mohamad Mohamad, Francesco Ponzio, Xavier Descombes

entry.summary: Shows that Batch Normalization in PPO causes policy mismatch between training and evaluation modes, leading to reward collapse. Proposes Mode-Dependent Rectification (MDR), a lightweight dual-phase training fix.

entry.title: TimelyFreeze: Adaptive Parameter Freezing Mechanism for Pipeline Parallelism

author.name: Seonghye Cho, Jaemin Han, Hyunjin Kim, Euisoo Jung, Jae-Gil Lee

entry.summary: Proposes TimelyFreeze for pipeline parallelism, modeling the pipeline schedule as a DAG and solving a linear program to find optimal parameter freeze ratios that minimize batch execution time while preserving accuracy.

entry.title: Allocentric Perceiver: Disentangling Allocentric Reasoning from Egocentric Visual Priors via Frame Instantiation

author.name: Hengyi Wang, Ruiqiang Zhang, Chang Liu, Guanjie Wang, Zehua Ma, Han Fang, Weiming Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces Allocentric Perceiver, a training-free method that enables VLMs to handle allocentric spatial queries by reconstructing 3D geometry and transforming it into query-conditioned reference frames.

entry.title: Regularized Calibration with Successive Rounding for Post-Training Quantization

author.name: Seohyeon Cha, Huancheng Chen, Dongjun Kim, Haoran Zhang, Kevin Chan, Gustavo de Veciana, Haris Vikalo

entry.summary: Shows that interpolating between symmetric and asymmetric calibration in post-training quantization acts as regularization, and proposes successive rounding to improve weight quantization quality for LLMs.

entry.title: Improving Set Function Approximation with Quasi-Arithmetic Neural Networks

author.name: Tomas Tokar, Scott Sanner

entry.summary: Introduces Neuralized Kolmogorov Mean (NKM) and quasi-arithmetic neural networks (QUANNs) that use learnable aggregation functions for set-structured data, replacing fixed pooling operations in DeepSets/PointNet with trainable generalized measures of central tendency.

entry.title: Feedback Control for Multi-Objective Graph Self-Supervision

author.name: Karish Grover, Theodore Vasiloudis, Han Xie, Sixing Lu, Xiang Song, Christos Faloutsos

entry.summary: Addresses objective interference in multi-task graph self-supervised learning by framing coordination as a temporal allocation problem. Identifies three failure modes (Disagreement, Drift, Drought) and proposes a feedback control approach.

entry.title: Pool-based Active Learning as Noisy Lossy Compression: Characterizing Label Complexity via Finite Blocklength Analysis

author.name: Kosuke Sugiyama, Masato Uchida

entry.summary: Proposes an information-theoretic framework for pool-based active learning by mapping it to noisy lossy compression, deriving lower bounds on label complexity using finite blocklength analysis.

entry.title: Joint Embedding Variational Bayes

author.name: Amin Oji, Paul Fieguth

entry.summary: Introduces Variational Joint Embedding (VJE), combining joint embedding and variational inference for self-supervised learning with Student-t likelihoods and polar decomposition to prevent norm instabilities.

entry.title: Selecting Hyperparameters for Tree-Boosting

author.name: Floris Jan Koster, Fabio Sigrist

entry.summary: Empirically compares hyperparameter optimization methods for tree-boosting across 59 datasets, finding SMAC clearly outperforms alternatives and that >100 trials are needed for reliable optimization.

entry.title: Discrete diffusion samplers and bridges: Off-policy algorithms and applications in latent spaces

author.name: Arran Carter, Sanghyeok Choi, Kirill Tamogashev, V\'ictor Elvira, Nikolay Malkin

entry.summary: Proposes off-policy training methods for discrete diffusion samplers and bridges, extending ideas from continuous-space sampling. Demonstrates applications in discrete latent spaces.

entry.title: AP-OOD: Attention Pooling for Out-of-Distribution Detection

author.name: Claus Hofmann, Christian Huber, Bernhard Lehner, Daniel Klotz, Sepp Hochreiter, Werner Zellinger

entry.summary: Proposes AP-OOD, an attention pooling method for OOD detection in NLP that goes beyond average aggregation of token embeddings. Sets new SOTA in text OOD detection. Sepp Hochreiter is a co-author.

entry.title: Atomic Information Flow: A Network Flow Model for Tool Attributions in RAG Systems

author.name: James Gao, Josh Zhou, Qi Sun, Ryan Huang, Steven Yoo

entry.summary: Presents Atomic Information Flow (AIF), a graph-based network flow model for attributing RAG system responses back to specific tool components. Trains a lightweight Gemma3 model as a context compressor.

entry.title: Different Time, Different Language: Revisiting the Bias Against Non-Native Speakers in GPT Detectors

author.name: Adnan Al Ali, Jind\v{r}ich Helcl, Jind\v{r}ich Libovick\'y

entry.summary: Revisits bias against non-native speakers in GPT detectors, specifically in Czech. Finds that perplexity of non-native Czech texts is not lower than native texts, challenging prior English-centric findings.

entry.title: MerNav: A Highly Generalizable Memory-Execute-Review Framework for Zero-Shot Object Goal Navigation

author.name: Dekang Qi, Shuang Zeng, Xinyuan Chang, Feng Xiong, Shichao Xie, Xiaolong Wu, Mu Xu

entry.summary: Proposes MerNav, a Memory-Execute-Review framework for zero-shot object goal navigation combining hierarchical memory, routine execution, and abnormal situation review modules.

entry.title: CLEAR-HPV: Interpretable Concept Discovery for HPV-Associated Morphology in Whole-Slide Histology

author.name: Weiyi Qin, Yingci Liu-Swetz, Shiwei Tan, Hao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces CLEAR-HPV, a framework for interpretable concept discovery in HPV-related histopathology using attention-guided representation restructuring in MIL without concept labels.

entry.title: ARGaze: Autoregressive Transformers for Online Egocentric Gaze Estimation

author.name: Jia Li, Wenjie Zhao, Shijian Deng, Bolin Lai, Yuheng Wu, RUijia Chen, Jon E. Froehlich, Yuhang Zhao, Yapeng Tian

entry.summary: Proposes ARGaze, an autoregressive transformer for online egocentric gaze estimation that reformulates gaze as vision-conditioned sequential prediction, leveraging temporal continuity.

entry.title: PoseGaussian: Pose-Driven Novel View Synthesis for Robust 3D Human Reconstruction

author.name: Ju Shen, Chen Chen, Tam V. Nguyen, Vijayan K. Asari

entry.summary: Proposes PoseGaussian, a pose-guided Gaussian Splatting framework for human novel view synthesis that embeds pose signals into both geometric and temporal stages.

entry.title: Dataset Distillation via Relative Distribution Matching and Cognitive Heritage

author.name: Qianxin Xia, Jiawei Du, Yuhan Zhang, Jielei Wang, Guoming Lu

entry.summary: Proposes dataset distillation via statistical flow matching and cognitive heritage, replacing expensive gradient matching with efficient distribution-based optimization for pre-trained backbone settings.

entry.title: SSG: Scaled Spatial Guidance for Multi-Scale Visual Autoregressive Generation

author.name: Youngwoo Shin, Jiwan Hur, Junmo Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Scaled Spatial Guidance (SSG), a training-free inference-time method for visual autoregressive (VAR) models that steers generation toward the intended coarse-to-fine hierarchy, maintaining global coherence without modifying the model.

entry.title: ShapeGaussian: High-Fidelity 4D Human Reconstruction in Monocular Videos via Vision Priors

author.name: Zhenxiao Liang, Ning Zhang, Youbao Tang, Ruei-Sung Lin, Qixing Huang, Peng Chang, Jing Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces ShapeGaussian, a template-free method for 4D human reconstruction from monocular videos that integrates vision priors for high-fidelity results without SMPL dependency, using a two-step pipeline with deformable geometry learning.

entry.title: LocateEdit-Bench: A Benchmark for Instruction-Based Editing Localization

author.name: Shiyu Wu, Shuyan Li, Jing Li, Jing Liu, Yequan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LocateEdit-Bench, a large-scale dataset of 231K edited images for benchmarking localization methods against instruction-driven image editing, covering four editing models and three edit types.

entry.title: Depth as Prior Knowledge for Object Detection

author.name: Moussa Kassem Sbeyti, Nadja Klein

entry.summary: Introduces DepthPrior, a framework that uses depth as prior knowledge rather than fused features for object detection, providing theoretical analysis of how depth causes systematic performance degradation and why depth-informed supervision mitigates it.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Learning with a Multi-Task Latent Space Objective

author.name: Pierre-Fran\c{c}ois De Plaen, Abhishek Jha, Luc Van Gool, Tinne Tuytelaars, Marc Proesmans

entry.summary: Identifies that the shared predictor in SSL methods like BYOL causes instability with multi-crop, and shows that separate predictors per view type stabilizes training. Extends this to a multi-task formulation with cutout views.

entry.title: Pathwise Test-Time Correction for Autoregressive Long Video Generation

author.name: Xunzhi Xiang, Zixuan Duan, Guiyu Zhang, Haiyu Zhang, Zhe Gao, Junta Wu, Shaofeng Zhang, Tengfei Wang, Qi Fan, Chunchao Guo

entry.summary: Introduces Test-Time Correction (TTC) for autoregressive long video generation that uses the initial frame as a stable reference anchor to calibrate intermediate states, addressing error accumulation in distilled diffusion models.

entry.title: MambaVF: State Space Model for Efficient Video Fusion

author.name: Zixiang Zhao, Yukun Cui, Lilun Deng, Haowen Bai, Haotong Qin, Tao Feng, Konrad Schindler

entry.summary: Presents MambaVF, a state space model-based video fusion framework that performs temporal modeling without explicit motion estimation, achieving linear complexity for long-range temporal dependencies.

entry.title: Predicting Camera Pose from Perspective Descriptions for Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Xuejun Zhang, Aditi Tiwari, Zhenhailong Wang, Heng Ji

entry.summary: Introduces CAMCUE, a pose-aware multi-image framework for perspective-taking that uses camera pose as an explicit geometric anchor for cross-view fusion and novel-view reasoning in MLLMs.

entry.title: A Framework for Combining Optimization-Based and Analytic Inverse Kinematics

author.name: Thomas Cohn, Lihan Tang, Alexandre Amice, Russ Tedrake

entry.summary: Presents a framework for combining optimization-based and analytic inverse kinematics by using analytic IK solutions as a change of variables, making the optimization fundamentally easier.

entry.title: MobileManiBench: Simplifying Model Verification for Mobile Manipulation

author.name: Wenbo Wang, Fangyun Wei, QiXiu Li, Xi Chen, Yaobo Liang, Chang Xu, Jiaolong Yang, Baining Guo

entry.summary: Proposes MobileManiBench, a large-scale simulation benchmark for mobile robotic manipulation using NVIDIA Isaac Sim with RL-generated trajectories, featuring 2 mobile platforms and diverse manipulation tasks.

entry.title: Task-Oriented Robot-Human Handovers on Legged Manipulators

author.name: Andreea Tulbure, Carmen Scheidemann, Elias Steiner, Marco Hutter

entry.summary: Presents AFT-Handover, a framework for task-oriented robot-human handovers that uses LLM-driven affordance reasoning with texture-based affordance transfer to achieve zero-shot generalization to novel object-task pairs on legged manipulators.

entry.title: Moltbook as a setting to analyze Power Seeking behaviour

author.name: Rahul N

entry.summary: Analyzes power-seeking behavior among AI agents on the MoltBook platform, finding that flagged power-seeking agents (0.52% of all agents) receive 64% of all upvotes, with ~2x higher karma and 1.6x more followers than unflagged agents.

entry.title: Unbiased Single-Queried Gradient for Combinatorial Objective

author.name: Thanawat Sornwanee

entry.summary: Proposes a stochastic gradient estimator for combinatorial objectives that is unbiased and requires only a single query, generalizing REINFORCE through importance sampling and introducing new gradient estimators.

entry.title: Classification Under Local Differential Privacy with Model Reversal and Model Averaging

author.name: Caihong Qin, Yang Bai

entry.summary: Reinterprets private learning under local differential privacy as transfer learning, proposing model reversal and model averaging techniques to improve classification without compromising privacy guarantees.

entry.title: Codified Finite-state Machines for Role-playing

author.name: Letian Peng, Yupeng Hou, Kun Zhou, Jingbo Shang

entry.summary: Introduces Codified Finite-State Machines (CFSMs) for LLM role-playing, automatically converting character profiles into FSMs using LLM-based coding. Enables tracking latent character states for more consistent interactions.

entry.title: Trojan Attacks on Neural Network Controllers for Robotic Systems

author.name: Farbod Younesi, Walter Lucia, Amr Youssef

entry.summary: Investigates backdoor (Trojan) attacks against neural network controllers in robotic systems, demonstrating a lightweight parallel Trojan network that can be embedded within a robot's tracking controller and activated by specific trigger conditions.

entry.title: MINT: Minimal Information Neuro-Symbolic Tree for Objective-Driven Knowledge-Gap Reasoning and Active Elicitation

author.name: Zeyu Fang, Tian Lan, Mahdi Imani

entry.summary: Proposes MINT, a neuro-symbolic tree framework for human-AI joint planning that reasons about knowledge gaps and optimizes elicitation strategies through self-play. Addresses incomplete information in open-world planning scenarios.

entry.title: Hallucination-Resistant Security Planning with a Large Language Model

author.name: Kim Hammar, Tansu Alpcan, Emil Lupu

entry.summary: Introduces a framework for using LLMs in security management that addresses hallucination through consistency checking with system constraints and digital twin feedback in an iterative loop.

entry.title: BhashaSetu: Cross-Lingual Knowledge Transfer from High-Resource to Extreme Low-Resource Languages

author.name: Subhadip Maji, Arnab Bhattacharya

entry.summary: Introduces BhashaSetu with GETR (Graph-Enhanced Token Representation) for cross-lingual knowledge transfer from high-resource to extremely low-resource languages with only hundreds of labeled examples.

entry.title: TKG-Thinker: Towards Dynamic Reasoning over Temporal Knowledge Graphs via Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zihao Jiang, Miao Peng, Zhenyan Shan, Wenjie Xu, Ben Liu, Gong Chen, Ziqi Gao, Min Peng

entry.summary: Proposes TKG-Thinker, an RL-trained agent for temporal knowledge graph QA with autonomous planning and adaptive retrieval, addressing reasoning hallucinations under complex temporal constraints.

entry.title: Learning Compact Boolean Networks

author.name: Shengpu Wang, Yuhao Mao, Yani Zhang, Martin Vechev

entry.summary: Proposes methods for learning compact Boolean networks through learned connections, compact Boolean convolutions, and adaptive discretization, targeting resource-constrained inference settings.

entry.title: DCER: Dual-Stage Compression and Energy-Based Reconstruction

author.name: Yiwen Wang, Jiahao Qin

entry.summary: Proposes DCER, a multimodal fusion framework addressing both noisy inputs and missing modalities through dual-stage compression (frequency transforms) and energy-based reconstruction. Uses wavelet transforms for audio and DCT for video.

entry.title: Large-Ensemble Simulations Reveal Links Between Atmospheric Blocking Frequency and Sea Surface Temperature Variability

author.name: Zilu Meng, Gregory J. Hakim, Wenchang Yang, Gabriel A. Vecchi

entry.summary: Uses deep learning climate models (large ensembles) to isolate SST-forced influences on atmospheric blocking from internal variability. Shows deep learning GCMs skillfully reproduce blocking climatology matching or exceeding traditional models.

entry.title: Total Variation Rates for Riemannian Flow Matching

author.name: Yunrui Guan, Krishnakumar Balasubramanian, Shiqian Ma

entry.summary: Develops nonasymptotic Total Variation convergence analysis for Riemannian flow matching samplers with Euler discretization. Establishes new bounds accounting for parallel transport and curvature on manifolds.

entry.title: GAS: Enhancing Reward-Cost Balance of Generative Model-assisted Offline Safe RL

author.name: Zifan Liu, Xinran Li, Shibo Chen, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Goal-Assisted Stitching for offline safe RL using generative models, addressing the inability to stitch optimal transitions from suboptimal trajectories and the difficulty of balancing reward and cost targets.

entry.title: Benchmarking Affordance Generalization with BusyBox

author.name: Dean Fortier, Timothy Adamson, Tess Hellebrekers, Teresa LaScala, Kofi Ennin, Michael Murray, Andrey Kolobov, Galen Mullins

entry.summary: Introduces BusyBox, a physical benchmark for evaluating Vision-Language-Action models' ability to generalize manipulation skills to new objects with familiar physical features (affordance generalization). The benchmark has 6 modules with switches, sliders, and wires for systematic semi-automatic evaluation.

entry.title: Bagging-Based Model Merging for Robust General Text Embeddings

author.name: Hengran Zhang, Keping Bi, Jiafeng Guo, Jiaming Zhang, Wenbo Yang, Daiting Shi, Xueqi Cheng

entry.summary: Systematic study of multi-task training strategies for text embeddings, comparing data scheduling and model merging approaches. Finds simple batch-level shuffling works best and proposes bagging-based model merging.

entry.title: CommCP: Efficient Multi-Agent Coordination via LLM-Based Communication with Conformal Prediction

author.name: Xiaopan Zhang, Zejin Wang, Zhixu Li, Jianpeng Yao, Jiachen Li

entry.summary: Formalizes multi-agent multi-task Embodied Question Answering (MM-EQA) and proposes CommCP using LLM-based communication with conformal prediction for efficient multi-robot coordination.

entry.title: CyIN: Cyclic Informative Latent Space for Bridging Complete and Incomplete Multimodal Learning

author.name: Ronghao Lin, Qiaolin He, Sijie Mai, Ying Zeng, Aolin Xiong, Li Huang, Yap-Peng Tan, Haifeng Hu

entry.summary: Introduces CyIN, a framework using cyclic informative latent spaces with token- and label-level Information Bottleneck to bridge complete and incomplete multimodal learning scenarios. Targets the real-world problem of missing modalities at deployment time.

entry.title: StagePilot: A Deep Reinforcement Learning Agent for Stage-Controlled Cybergrooming Simulation

author.name: Heajun An, Qi Zhang, Minqian Liu, Xinyi Zhang, Sang Won Lee, Lifu Huang, Pamela J. Wisniewski, Jin-Hee Cho

entry.summary: Introduces StagePilot, an offline RL-based dialogue agent that simulates stage-wise progression of cybergrooming behaviors for prevention training, using IQL+AWAC with composite rewards balancing sentiment and goal proximity.

entry.title: Bayesian Neighborhood Adaptation for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Paribesh Regmi, Rui Li, Kishan K C

entry.summary: Proposes modeling GNN message-passing scope as a beta process to adaptively determine neighborhood sizes for both homophilic and heterophilic graphs, avoiding the costly two-stage search for optimal hop counts.

entry.title: A Decomposition-based State Space Model for Multivariate Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Shunya Nagashima, Shuntaro Suzuki, Shuitsu Koyama, Shinnosuke Hirano

entry.summary: Proposes DecompSSM, a time series forecasting model with three parallel deep state space model branches for trend, seasonal, and residual components, featuring adaptive temporal scales and cross-variable context sharing.

entry.title: EdgeMask-DG*: Learning Domain-Invariant Graph Structures via Adversarial Edge Masking

author.name: Rishabh Bhattacharya, Naresh Manwani

entry.summary: Proposes EdgeMask-DG for domain generalization on graphs via adversarial edge masking that identifies domain-invariant structural information through consensus across multiple graph structures.

entry.title: Almost Asymptotically Optimal Active Clustering Through Pairwise Observations

author.name: Rachel S. Y. Teo, P. N. Karthik, Ramya Korlakai Vinayak, Vincent Y. F. Tan

entry.summary: Proposes an asymptotically optimal algorithm for active clustering via pairwise queries with noisy binary feedback, establishing fundamental lower bounds on query complexity using change-of-measure techniques.

entry.title: Visualizing the loss landscapes of physics-informed neural networks

author.name: Conor Rowan, Finn Murphy-Blanchard

entry.summary: Visualizes loss landscapes of physics-informed neural networks (PINNs), extending landscape analysis techniques from image classification to PDE-based losses, studying how PDE complexity affects optimization geometry.

entry.title: Pseudo-Invertible Neural Networks
