author.name: Yamit Ehrlich, Nimrod Berman, Assaf Shocher

entry.summary: Introduces Surjective Pseudo-invertible Neural Networks (SPNN), generalizing the Moore-Penrose pseudo-inverse to nonlinear neural networks. Enables Non-Linear Back-Projection with consistency guarantees.

entry.title: Data Kernel Perspective Space Performance Guarantees for Synthetic Data from Transformer Models

author.name: Michael Browder, Kevin Duh, J. David Harris, Vince Lyzinski, Paul McNamee, Youngser Park, Carey E. Priebe, Peter Viechnicki

entry.summary: Proposes Data Kernel Perspective Space (DKPS) to provide statistical guarantees for the quality of synthetic data generated by LLMs for downstream tasks.

entry.title: Efficient Algorithms for Robust Markov Decision Processes with $s$-Rectangular Ambiguity Sets

author.name: Chin Pang Ho, Marek Petrik, Wolfram Wiesemann

entry.summary: Develops a unified solution framework for robust MDPs with s-rectangular ambiguity sets, providing efficient algorithms that match the complexity of classical (non-robust) MDPs.

entry.title: Broken neural scaling laws in materials science

author.name: Max Gro{\ss}mann, Malte Grunert, Erich Runge

entry.summary: Investigates neural scaling laws for materials science, specifically predicting dielectric functions of metals. Studies broken power-law behavior in both data and model scaling regimes.

entry.title: IESR:Efficient MCTS-Based Modular Reasoning for Text-to-SQL with Large Language Models

author.name: Tao Liu, Jiafan Lu, Bohan Yu, Pengcheng Wu, Liu Haixin, Guoyu Xu, Li Xiangheng, Lixiao Li, Jiaming Hou, Zhao Shijun, Xinglin Lyu, Kunli Zhang, Yuxiang Jia, Hongyin Zan

entry.summary: Proposes IESR, an MCTS-based modular reasoning framework for Text-to-SQL that decouples mathematical computation from SQL generation. Targets lightweight LLMs for enterprise deployment.

entry.title: Consensus-Aligned Neuron Efficient Fine-Tuning Large Language Models for Multi-Domain Machine Translation

author.name: Shuting Jiang, Ran Song, Yuxin Huang, Yan Xiang, Yantuan Xian, Shengxiang Gao, Zhengtao Yu

entry.summary: Proposes a neuron-efficient fine-tuning framework for multi-domain machine translation that identifies consensus-aligned neurons by maximizing mutual information between neuron behavior and domain features.

entry.title: Cost-Efficient RAG for Entity Matching with LLMs: A Blocking-based Exploration

author.name: Chuangtao Ma, Zeyu Zhang, Arijit Khan, Sebastian Schelter, Paul Groth

entry.summary: Introduces CE-RAG4EM, a cost-efficient RAG architecture for entity matching that reduces computation through blocking-based batch retrieval and generation.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Few-Shot Segmentation via Multi-view Progressive Adaptation

author.name: Jiahao Nie, Guanqiao Fu, Wenbin An, Yap-Peng Tan, Alex C. Kot, Shijian Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-view Progressive Adaptation for cross-domain few-shot segmentation that progressively adapts from data and strategy perspectives to handle domain gaps.

entry.title: NeVStereo: A NeRF-Driven NVS-Stereo Architecture for High-Fidelity 3D Tasks

author.name: Pengcheng Chen, Yue Hu, Wenhao Li, Nicole M Gunderson, Andrew Feng, Zhenglong Sun, Peter Beerel, Eric J Seibel

entry.summary: Presents NeVStereo, a unified NeRF-driven framework that jointly delivers camera poses, multi-view depth, novel view synthesis, and surface reconstruction from multi-view RGB images. Bridges the gap between feed-forward reconstruction systems and neural rendering approaches.

entry.title: SOMA-1M: A Large-Scale SAR-Optical Multi-resolution Alignment Dataset for Multi-Task Remote Sensing

author.name: Peihao Wu, Yongxiang Yao, Yi Wan, Wenfei Zhang, Ruipeng Zhao, Jiayuan Li, Yongjun Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SOMA-1M, a large-scale SAR-optical multi-resolution alignment dataset with 1.3M image pairs at pixel-level precision, spanning multiple spatial resolutions. Designed for training multi-scale foundation models for remote sensing.

entry.title: Unified Sensor Simulation for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Nikolay Patakin, Arsenii Shirokov, Anton Konushin, Dmitry Senushkin

entry.summary: Introduces XSIM, a sensor simulation framework for autonomous driving that extends 3DGUT splatting with rolling-shutter modeling and handles spherical cameras (LiDARs) as a critical edge case.

entry.title: FMPose3D: monocular 3D pose estimation via flow matching

author.name: Ti Wang, Xiaohang Yu, Mackenzie Weygandt Mathis

entry.summary: Proposes FMPose3D, which applies Flow Matching to monocular 3D pose estimation, enabling efficient generation of multiple plausible 3D pose hypotheses with fewer integration steps compared to diffusion-based methods.

entry.title: CLIP-Map: Structured Matrix Mapping for Parameter-Efficient CLIP Compression

author.name: Kangjie Zhang, Wenxuan Huang, Xin Zhou, Boxiang Zhou, Dejia Song, Yuan Xie, Baochang Zhang, Lizhuang Ma, Nemo Chen, Xu Tang, Yao Hu, Shaohui Lin

entry.summary: Proposes CLIP-Map, a mapping-based CLIP compression framework using structured matrix mapping to transform pre-trained weights to a compact model, avoiding the information loss of select-based weight inheritance.

entry.title: Gabor Fields: Orientation-Selective Level-of-Detail for Volume Rendering

author.name: Jorge Condor, Nicolai Hermann, Mehmet Ata Yurtsever, Piotr Didyk

entry.summary: Proposes Gabor Fields, an orientation-selective level-of-detail approach for Gaussian-based volume rendering that enables hierarchical representations similar to mipmaps for voxel grids, reducing aliasing and rendering time.

entry.title: TaSA: Two-Phased Deep Predictive Learning of Tactile Sensory Attenuation for Improving In-Grasp Manipulation

author.name: Pranav Ponnivalavan, Satoshi Funabashi, Alexander Schmitz, Tetsuya Ogata, Shigeki Sugano

entry.summary: Proposes TaSA for learning tactile sensory attenuation in robots, enabling distinction between self-contact and external contact sensations during dexterous manipulation, inspired by human self-touch perception.

entry.title: TOLEBI: Learning Fault-Tolerant Bipedal Locomotion via Online Status Estimation and Fallibility Rewards

author.name: Hokyun Lee, Woo-Jeong Baek, Junhyeok Cha, Jaeheung Park

entry.summary: Presents TOLEBI, a reinforcement learning framework for bipedal robot locomotion that can handle hardware faults (joint locking, power loss) during operation through online status estimation and fallibility-aware rewards. This addresses a practical but understudied gap in humanoid robotics where hardware failures during locomotion could have severe consequences.

entry.title: Asymptotically optimal sequential change detection for bounded means

author.name: Ashwin Ram, Aaditya Ramdas

entry.summary: Derives universal sharp lower bounds for changepoint detection under composite hypotheses and provides asymptotically optimal detection procedures for bounded mean changes, addressing the challenge when the hardest pre-change law depends on the unknown post-change law.

entry.title: Understanding LLM Evaluator Behavior: A Structured Multi-Evaluator Framework for Merchant Risk Assessment

author.name: Liang Wang, Junpeng Wang, Chin-chia Michael Yeh, Yan Zheng, Jiarui Sun, Xiran Fan, Xin Dai, Yujie Fan, Yiwei Cai

entry.summary: Introduces a structured multi-evaluator framework for assessing LLM reasoning in merchant risk assessment (MCC classification), using Monte Carlo scoring and consensus-deviation metrics to evaluate evaluator stability and bias.

entry.title: THOR: Inductive Link Prediction over Hyper-Relational Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Weijian Yu, Yuhuan Lu, Dingqi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes THOR for inductive link prediction over hyper-relational knowledge graphs, addressing the limitation that existing methods only work in transductive settings with fixed vocabularies.

entry.title: Refine and Purify: Orthogonal Basis Optimization with Null-Space Denoising for Conditional Representation Learning

author.name: Jiaquan Wang, Yan Lyu, Chen Li, Yuheng Jia

entry.summary: Proposes OD-CRL for conditional representation learning, using adaptive orthogonal basis optimization via SVD and null-space denoising to address sensitivity to subspace basis and inter-subspace interference.

entry.title: A Guide to Large Language Models in Modeling and Simulation: From Core Techniques to Critical Challenges

author.name: Philippe J. Giabbanelli

entry.summary: Provides a practical guide for using LLMs in Modeling & Simulation workflows, highlighting subtle pitfalls like model collapse, unnecessary fine-tuning, non-determinism at temperature 0, and information overload.

entry.title: A logical re-conception of neural networks: Hamiltonian bitwise part-whole architecture

author.name: E Bowen, R Granger, A Rodriguez

entry.summary: Introduces a neural network architecture where relations (part-whole) are directly represented via graph structures with Hamiltonian energy operators. Uses radically low-precision arithmetic and fundamentally different operating principles from standard neural networks.

entry.title: ARCHI-TTS: A flow-matching-based Text-to-Speech Model with Self-supervised Semantic Aligner and Accelerated Inference

author.name: Chunyat Wu, Jiajun Deng, Zhengxi Liu, Zheqi Dai, Haolin He, Qiuqiang Kong

entry.summary: Proposes ARCHI-TTS, a flow-matching-based text-to-speech system with a self-supervised semantic aligner for text-speech alignment and an efficient inference strategy reusing encoder features across denoising steps.

entry.title: Assessing Electricity Demand Forecasting with Exogenous Data in Time Series Foundation Models

author.name: Wei Soon Cheong (Institute for Infocomm Research, Agency for Science, Technology, Research), Lian Lian Jiang (Institute for Infocomm Research, Agency for Science, Technology, Research), Jamie Ng Suat Ling (Institute for Infocomm Research, Agency for Science, Technology, Research)

entry.summary: Evaluates time-series foundation models for electricity demand forecasting, comparing MOIRAI, MOMENT, TinyTimeMixers, ChronosX, and Chronos-2 against LSTM baseline. Finds highly variable effectiveness of exogenous features across models.

entry.title: Disco: Densely-overlapping Cell Instance Segmentation via Adjacency-aware Collaborative Coloring

author.name: Rui Sun, Yiwen Yang, Kaiyu Guo, Chen Jiang, Dongli Xu, Zhaonan Liu, Tan Pan, Limei Han, Xue Jiang, Wu Wei, Yuan Cheng

entry.summary: Releases GBC-FS 2025, a large-scale dataset for dense cell instance segmentation, and proposes Disco, a graph coloring-based method for handling densely overlapping cells. Reveals that most real-world cell adjacency graphs have small chromatic numbers.

entry.title: Towards Green AI: Decoding the Energy of LLM Inference in Software Development

author.name: Lola Solovyeva, Fernando Castor

entry.summary: Conducts phase-level analysis of LLM inference energy consumption, distinguishing prefill and decoding phases across 6-7B and 3-4B models on code generation benchmarks.

entry.title: xList-Hate: A Checklist-Based Framework for Interpretable and Generalizable Hate Speech Detection

author.name: Adri\'an Gir\'on, Pablo Miralles, Javier Huertas-Tato, Sergio D'Antonio, David Camacho

entry.summary: Introduces xList-Hate, a framework decomposing hate speech detection into a checklist of concept-level questions answered by LLMs, producing diagnostic representations that generalize across annotation schemes.

entry.title: Optimism Stabilizes Thompson Sampling for Adaptive Inference

author.name: Shunxing Yan, Han Zhong

entry.summary: Studies Thompson sampling stability for multi-armed bandits, proving that variance-inflated TS is stable for any number of arms including when multiple arms are optimal, enabling valid asymptotic inference.

entry.title: Knowing When to Answer: Adaptive Confidence Refinement for Reliable Audio-Visual Question Answering

author.name: Dinh Phu Tran, Jihoon Jeong, Saad Wazir, Seongah Kim, Thao Do, Cem Subakan, Daeyoung Kim

entry.summary: Formalizes 'Reliable' Audio-Visual Question Answering where abstention is preferred over incorrect answers, and proposes Adaptive Confidence Refinement (ACR) to enhance model reliability. Identifies that Maximum Softmax Probability is only Bayes-optimal under strong calibration.

entry.title: Adaptive Exploration for Latent-State Bandits

author.name: Jikai Jin, Kenneth Hung, Sanath Kumar Krishnamurthy, Baoyi Shi, Congshan Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces state-model-free bandit algorithms for environments with hidden time-varying states, using lagged contextual features and coordinated probing to implicitly track latent states without explicit state modeling.

entry.title: Extreme Weather Nowcasting via Local Precipitation Pattern Prediction

author.name: Changhoon Song, Teng Yuan Chang, Youngjoon Hong

entry.summary: Proposes a deterministic nowcasting model focused on extreme weather events (heavy rainfall) that uses local precipitation pattern prediction, addressing the bias of deterministic models toward normal rainfall conditions.

entry.title: MAGPrompt: Message-Adaptive Graph Prompt Tuning for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Long D. Nguyen, Binh P. Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes message-adaptive graph prompt tuning (MAGPrompt) that injects learnable prompts into the message passing step of GNNs to reweight neighbor messages, going beyond input/representation-only modifications.

entry.title: Synthesizing Realistic Test Data without Breaking Privacy

author.name: Laura Plein, Alexi Turcotte, Arina Hallemans, Andreas Zeller

entry.summary: Explores generating synthetic test datasets that replicate statistical distributions without directly using original data in generation, inspired by GANs but designed to resist membership inference and reconstruction attacks.

entry.title: Beyond Independent Genes: Learning Module-Inductive Representations for Gene Perturbation Prediction

author.name: Jiafa Ruan, Ruijie Quan, Zongxin Yang, Liyang Xu, Yi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes scBIG, a framework for gene perturbation prediction that explicitly models coordinated gene programs rather than treating genes independently. Uses data-driven gene clustering and inter-program interactions.

entry.title: Finite-Particle Rates for Regularized Stein Variational Gradient Descent

author.name: Ye He, Krishnakumar Balasubramanian, Sayan Banerjee, Promit Ghosal

entry.summary: Derives finite-particle convergence rates for regularized Stein Variational Gradient Descent, establishing explicit non-asymptotic bounds for the corrected R-SVGD algorithm.

entry.title: Consistency-Preserving Concept Erasure via Unsafe-Safe Pairing and Directional Fisher-weighted Adaptation

author.name: Yongwoo Kim, Sungmin Cha, Hyunsoo Kim, Jaewon Lee, Donghyun Kim

entry.summary: Proposes PAIRed Erasing (PAIR) for concept erasure in diffusion models that preserves structural and semantic consistency by reframing erasure as semantic realignment using unsafe-safe pairs.

entry.title: Wedge Sampling: Efficient Tensor Completion with Nearly-Linear Sample Complexity

author.name: Hengrui Luo, Anna Ma, Ludovic Stephan, Yizhe Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Wedge Sampling for low-rank tensor completion with nearly-linear sample complexity, using structured sampling patterns to strengthen spectral signal.

entry.title: GreekMMLU: A Native-Sourced Multitask Benchmark for Evaluating Language Models in Greek

author.name: Yang Zhang, Mersin Konomi, Christos Xypolopoulos, Konstantinos Divriotis, Konstantinos Skianis, Giannis Nikolentzos, Giorgos Stamou, Guokan Shang, Michalis Vazirgiannis

entry.summary: Introduces GreekMMLU, a native-sourced benchmark with 21,805 questions across 45 subjects for evaluating LLMs in Greek. Unlike machine-translated benchmarks, it captures Greek linguistic and cultural characteristics.

entry.title: A Human-in-the-Loop, LLM-Centered Architecture for Knowledge-Graph Question Answering

author.name: Larissa Pusch, Alexandre Courtiol, Tim Conrad

entry.summary: Introduces a human-in-the-loop framework where LLMs generate and explain Cypher graph queries, and users iteratively refine them through natural language for knowledge graph question answering.

entry.title: VMF-GOS: Geometry-guided virtual Outlier Synthesis for Long-Tailed OOD Detection

author.name: Ningkang Peng, Qianfeng Yu, Yuhao Zhang, Yafei Liu, Xiaoqian Peng, Peirong Ma, Yi Chen, Peiheng Li, Yanhui Gu

entry.summary: Proposes VMF-GOS, a data-free framework for out-of-distribution detection under long-tailed distributions that eliminates reliance on external datasets by using geometry-guided virtual outlier synthesis. Uses von Mises-Fisher distributions to generate virtual outliers on the feature manifold.

entry.title: Signal or 'Noise': Human Reactions to Robot Errors in the Wild

author.name: Maia Stiber, Sameer Khan, Russell Taylor, Chien-Ming Huang

entry.summary: Studies human social responses to robot errors in a public field deployment (N=49) with a coffee robot, finding that participants consistently express varied social signals in response to errors, particularly during group interactions.

entry.title: Affordance-Aware Interactive Decision-Making and Execution for Ambiguous Instructions

author.name: Hengxuan Xu, Fengbo Lan, Zhixin Zhao, Shengjie Wang, Mengqiao Liu, Jieqian Sun, Yu Cheng, Tao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes AIDE, a dual-stream framework for handling ambiguous human instructions in robotic manipulation through affordance-aware interactive exploration with VLM reasoning.

entry.title: Learning Soccer Skills for Humanoid Robots: A Progressive Perception-Action Framework

author.name: Jipeng Kong, Xinzhe Liu, Yuhang Lin, Jinrui Han, S\"oren Schwertfeger, Chenjia Bai, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Proposes PAiD, a progressive perception-action architecture for humanoid robot soccer that decomposes skill acquisition into motion tracking, perception-action integration, and sim-to-real transfer stages.

entry.title: HiCrowd: Hierarchical Crowd Flow Alignment for Dense Human Environments

author.name: Yufei Zhu, Shih-Min Yang, Martin Magnusson, Allan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes HiCrowd, a hierarchical framework combining RL with model predictive control for robot navigation in dense crowds. The system addresses the 'freezing robot problem' by having the robot align with compatible pedestrian crowd flows rather than trying to navigate independently.

entry.title: A Data Driven Structural Decomposition of Dynamic Games via Best Response Maps

author.name: Mahdis Rabbani, Navid Mojahed, Shima Nazari

entry.summary: Proposes a novel formulation for computing Nash equilibria in dynamic games by decomposing the joint game into interconnected best-response maps, potentially making equilibrium computation more tractable while maintaining consistency.

entry.title: An Asymptotic Law of the Iterated Logarithm for $\mathrm{KL}_{\inf}$

author.name: Ashwin Ram, Aaditya Ramdas

entry.summary: Establishes an asymptotic law of the iterated logarithm for the empirical KL_inf statistic, which is fundamental to optimal regret bounds in pure-exploration bandits and optimal stopping times in sequential testing.

entry.title: CAST-CKT: Chaos-Aware Spatio-Temporal and Cross-City Knowledge Transfer for Traffic Flow Prediction

author.name: Abdul Joseph Fofanah, Lian Wen, David Chen, Alpha Alimamy Kamara, Zhongyi Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CAST-CKT, a framework for cross-city traffic prediction that uses chaos theory to characterize traffic dynamics, enabling chaos-aware attention and cross-city knowledge transfer for data-scarce settings.

entry.title: Advancing Opinion Dynamics Modeling with Neural Diffusion-Convection-Reaction Equation

author.name: Chenghua Gong, Yihang Jiang, Hao Li, Rui Sun, Juyuan Zhang, Tianjun Gu, Liming Pan, Linyuan L\"u

entry.summary: Models opinion dynamics using neural diffusion-convection-reaction equations within a Physics-Informed Neural Network framework, integrating local, global, and endogenous dynamics levels.

entry.title: Phi-Former: A Pairwise Hierarchical Approach for Compound-Protein Interactions Prediction

author.name: Zhe Wang, Zijing Liu, Chencheng Xu, Yuan Yao

entry.summary: Proposes Phi-former for compound-protein interaction prediction that operates at the molecular fragment level rather than atomic level, better aligning with how biological recognition and binding actually work.

entry.title: STProtein: predicting spatial protein expression from multi-omics data

author.name: Zhaorui Jiang, Yingfang Yuan, Lei Hu, Wei Pang

entry.summary: Proposes STProtein, a graph neural network framework with multi-task learning for predicting spatial protein expression from more accessible spatial transcriptomics data, addressing scarcity of spatial proteomics.

entry.title: From Fragmentation to Integration: Exploring the Design Space of AI Agents for Human-as-the-Unit Privacy Management

author.name: Eryue Xu, Tianshi Li

entry.summary: Explores the design space of AI agents for cross-platform privacy management through interviews and a speed-dating survey. Identifies nine privacy-management challenges and evaluates nine AI agent concepts for helping users manage digital footprints.

entry.title: Quality Model for Machine Learning Components

author.name: Grace A. Lewis, Rachel Brower-Sinning, Robert Edman, Ipek Ozkaya, Sebasti\'an Echeverr\'ia, Alex Derr, Collin Beaudoin, Katherine R. Maffey

entry.summary: Proposes a quality model for ML components extending ISO 25010/25059 standards, defining quality attributes and metrics for ML systems beyond just model performance (including throughput, resource consumption, robustness).

entry.title: Aligning Large Language Model Behavior with Human Citation Preferences

author.name: Kenichiro Ando, Tatsuya Harada

entry.summary: Studies LLM citation behavior, constructing a dataset categorizing cite-worthy content into eight types and evaluating pairwise citation preferences. Aims to align LLM citation patterns with human preferences.

entry.title: Balanced Anomaly-guided Ego-graph Diffusion Model for Inductive Graph Anomaly Detection

author.name: Chunyu Wei, Siyuan He, Yu Wang, Yueguo Chen, Yunhai Wang, Bing Bai, Yidong Zhang, Yong Xie, Shunming Zhang, Fei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a balanced anomaly-guided ego-graph diffusion model for inductive graph anomaly detection, addressing both transductive learning limitations and class imbalance through data-centric augmentation.

entry.title: HyperPotter: Spell the Charm of High-Order Interactions in Audio Deepfake Detection

author.name: Qing Wen, Haohao Li, Zhongjie Ba, Peng Cheng, Miao He, Li Lu, Kui Ren

entry.summary: Proposes HyperPotter, a hypergraph-based framework for audio deepfake detection that models high-order interactions between features through clustering-based hyperedges with class-aware prototype initialization.

entry.title: Exploring AI-Augmented Sensemaking of Patient-Generated Health Data: A Mixed-Method Study with Healthcare Professionals in Cardiac Risk Reduction

author.name: Pavithren V S Pakianathan, Rania Islambouli, Diogo Branco, Albrecht Schmidt, Tiago Guerreiro, Jan David Smeddinck

entry.summary: Explores LLM-augmented sensemaking of patient-generated health data with 16 healthcare professionals, finding that LLM summaries and conversational interfaces help clinicians work with multimodal wearable data.

entry.title: Automated Customization of LLMs for Enterprise Code Repositories Using Semantic Scopes

author.name: Ulrich Finkler, Irene Manotas, Wei Zhang, Geert Janssen, Octavian Popescu, Shyam Ramji

entry.summary: Presents an approach for automated LLM customization to private enterprise code repositories using semantic scopes, evaluating RAG and fine-tuning strategies on real industry codebases.

entry.title: LSA: Localized Semantic Alignment for Enhancing Temporal Consistency in Traffic Video Generation

author.name: Mirlan Karimov, Teodora Spasojevic, Markus Braun, Julian Wiederer, Vasileios Belagiannis, Marc Pollefeys

entry.summary: Proposes Localized Semantic Alignment (LSA) for fine-tuning video generation models to improve temporal consistency of dynamic objects in traffic scenarios, comparing semantic features between ground-truth and generated clips.

entry.title: A Simple Reduction Scheme for Constrained Contextual Bandits with Adversarial Contexts via Regression

author.name: Dhruv Sarkar, Abhishek Sinha

entry.summary: Studies constrained contextual bandits with adversarial contexts, proposing a modular algorithm based on the SquareCB framework that uses online regression oracles to control both regret and constraint violation simultaneously.

entry.title: FedRandom: Sampling Consistent and Accurate Contribution Values in Federated Learning

author.name: Arno Geimer, Beltran Fiz Pontiveros, Radu State

entry.summary: Proposes FedRandom for more consistent contribution estimation in federated learning, addressing inherent instability in participant contribution assessments across different aggregation strategies.

entry.title: Tuning Out-of-Distribution (OOD) Detectors Without Given OOD Data

author.name: Sudeepta Mondal, Xinyi Mary Xie, Ruxiao Duan, Alex Wong, Ganesh Sundaramoorthi

entry.summary: Proposes methods for tuning OOD detectors without requiring a separate OOD dataset. Shows significant variance in detector performance based on the ad-hoc OOD dataset choice.

entry.title: Are Open-Weight LLMs Ready for Social Media Moderation? A Comparative Study on Bluesky

author.name: Hsuan-Yu Chou, Wajiha Naveed, Shuyan Zhou, Xiaowei Yang

entry.summary: Evaluates seven LLMs (proprietary and open-weight) for social media moderation on Bluesky. Finds considerable overlap between model decisions and human annotations, but open-weight models lag behind proprietary ones.

entry.title: Decision-Focused Sequential Experimental Design: A Directional Uncertainty-Guided Approach

author.name: Beichen Wan, Mo Liu, Paul Grigas, Zuo-Jun Max Shen

entry.summary: Proposes a decision-focused sequential experimental design approach for predict-then-optimize settings, using directional uncertainty to align data collection with downstream optimization objectives.

entry.title: Cross-Lingual Empirical Evaluation of Large Language Models for Arabic Medical Tasks

author.name: Chaimae Abouzahir, Congbo Ma, Nizar Habash, Farah E. Shamout

entry.summary: Conducts cross-lingual evaluation of LLMs on Arabic vs English medical QA. Finds persistent language-driven performance gaps that intensify with task complexity, with tokenization as a key factor.

entry.title: Convergence Rate of the Last Iterate of Stochastic Proximal Algorithms

author.name: Kevin Kurian Thomas Vaidyan, Michael P. Friedlander, Ahmet Alacaoglu

entry.summary: Proves optimal O(1/√T) last-iterate convergence rates for proximal stochastic gradient methods under relaxed (non-bounded-variance) assumptions using componentwise convexity.

entry.title: Fast Rates for Nonstationary Weighted Risk Minimization

author.name: Tobias Brock, Thomas Nagler

entry.summary: Provides fast rates for nonstationary weighted empirical risk minimization under distribution drift, with oracle inequalities under mixing conditions.

entry.title: Distribution-free two-sample testing with blurred total variation distance

author.name: Rohan Hore, Rina Foygel Barber

entry.summary: Introduces blurred total variation distance for distribution-free two-sample testing, providing theoretical guarantees for upper and lower bounds without distributional assumptions.

entry.title: Multilingual Extraction and Recognition of Implicit Discourse Relations in Speech and Text

author.name: Ahmed Ruby, Christian Hardmeier, Sara Stymne

entry.summary: Introduces a method for constructing multilingual multimodal datasets for implicit discourse relation classification using Qwen2-Audio. Proposes a multimodal approach integrating textual and acoustic information across English, French, and Spanish.

entry.title: Grammatical Error Correction Evaluation by Optimally Transporting Edit Representation

author.name: Takumi Goto, Yusuke Sakai, Taro Watanabe

entry.summary: Proposes UOT-ERRANT, a new GEC evaluation metric that computes similarity over edits using optimal transport of edit vector representations, rather than comparing full sentences.

entry.title: Mapper-GIN: Lightweight Structural Graph Abstraction for Corrupted 3D Point Cloud Classification

author.name: Jeongbin You, Donggun Kim, Sejun Park, Seungsang Oh

entry.summary: Proposes Mapper-GIN, a lightweight topology-inspired pipeline for 3D point cloud classification that uses the Mapper algorithm to create structural graph abstractions, achieving robustness to corruptions with only 0.5M parameters.

entry.title: LoGoSeg: Integrating Local and Global Features for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Junyang Chen, Xiangbo Lv, Zhiqiang Kou, Xingdong Sheng, Ning Xu, Yiguo Qiao

entry.summary: Proposes LoGoSeg for open-vocabulary semantic segmentation that integrates local and global features through object existence scoring, region-aware loss, and global-local feature alignment to address spatial misalignment issues in CLIP-based methods.

entry.title: NVS-HO: A Benchmark for Novel View Synthesis of Handheld Objects

author.name: Musawar Ali, Manuel Carranza-Garc\'ia, Nicola Fioraio, Samuele Salti, Luigi Di Stefano

entry.summary: Proposes NVS-HO, the first benchmark for novel view synthesis of handheld objects from RGB inputs, using paired handheld and board sequences for training and evaluation with accurate ground-truth poses.

entry.title: Informative Path Planning with Guaranteed Estimation Uncertainty

author.name: Kalvik Jakkala, Saurav Agarwal, Jason O'Kane, Srinivas Akella

entry.summary: Addresses informative path planning with guaranteed estimation uncertainty for environmental monitoring robots, computing shortest paths that ensure Gaussian process posterior variance bounds.

entry.title: From Vision to Decision: Neuromorphic Control for Autonomous Navigation and Tracking

author.name: Chuwei Wang, Eduardo Sebasti\'an, Amanda Prorok, Anastasia Bizyaeva

entry.summary: Proposes a neuromorphic control framework for vision-guided robot navigation that uses dynamic neuronal populations to transform visual inputs directly into motion commands, with a bifurcation mechanism to resolve decision ambiguity without heavy computational planners.

entry.title: Piecewise Deterministic Markov Processes for Bayesian Inference of PDE Coefficients

author.name: Leon Riccius, Iuri B. C. M. Rocha, Joris Bierkens, Hanne Kekkonen, Frans P. van der Meer

entry.summary: Develops a framework for using piecewise deterministic Markov process (PDMP) samplers for Bayesian inference in inverse problems with expensive likelihoods, using surrogate-assisted thinning with automatic correction for bound violations.

entry.title: Modelling the Morphology of Verbal Paradigms: A Case Study in the Tokenization of Turkish and Hebrew

author.name: Giuseppe Samo, Paola Merlo

entry.summary: Investigates how tokenization strategies affect transformer models' ability to represent complex verb paradigms in Turkish and Hebrew. Shows that morpheme-aware segmentation is critical for non-concatenative morphology.

entry.title: Evaluating Large Language Models on Solved and Unsolved Problems in Graph Theory: Implications for Computing Education

author.name: Adithya Kulkarni, Mohna Chakraborty, Jay Bagga

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM performance on solved and unsolved graph theory problems using an eight-stage mathematical inquiry protocol. Finds strong performance on solved problems but reveals limitations on open problems where no solution exists.

entry.title: GAMMS: Graph based Adversarial Multiagent Modeling Simulator

author.name: Rohan Patil, Jai Malegaonkar, Xiao Jiang, Andre Dion, Gaurav S. Sukhatme, Henrik I. Christensen

entry.summary: Presents GAMMS, a lightweight graph-based simulator for multi-agent adversarial modeling that prioritizes scalability, ease of use, and fast visualization for rapid prototyping of agent behaviors.

entry.title: Reasoning-guided Collaborative Filtering with Language Models for Explainable Recommendation

author.name: Fahad Anwaar, Adil Mehmood Khan, Muhammad Khalid, Usman Zia, Kezhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes RGCF-XRec, a hybrid framework integrating reasoning-guided collaborative filtering into language models for explainable sequential recommendations in a single step.

entry.title: Generative Ontology: When Structured Knowledge Learns to Create

author.name: Benny Cheung

entry.summary: Proposes Generative Ontology, combining traditional ontology structures with LLM generation via executable Pydantic schemas and DSPy signatures, using multi-agent pipelines for constrained creative generation.

entry.title: Learning Event-Based Shooter Models from Virtual Reality Experiments

author.name: Christopher A. McClurg, Alan R. Wagner

entry.summary: Develops a data-driven discrete-event simulator modeling shooter behavior learned from VR studies, enabling evaluation of school security interventions without requiring new participant cohorts.

entry.title: A General-Purpose Diversified 2D Seismic Image Dataset from NAMSS

author.name: Lucas de Magalh\~aes Araujo, Ot\'avio Oliveira Napoli, Sandra Avila, Edson Borin

entry.summary: Introduces the Unicamp-NAMSS dataset: 2588 standardized 2D seismic sections from 122 survey areas for ML research in geophysics, with balanced distribution across surveys.

entry.title: PriMod4AI: Lifecycle-Aware Privacy Threat Modeling for AI Systems using LLM

author.name: Gautam Savaliya, Robert Aufschl\"ager, Abhishek Subedi, Michael Heigl, Martin Schramm

entry.summary: Introduces PriMod4AI, a hybrid privacy threat modeling approach that extends the LINDDUN framework with AI-specific privacy attacks like membership inference and model inversion. Uses LLMs to assist in the threat modeling process.

entry.title: AI-Based Detection of In-Treatment Changes from Prostate MR-Linac Images

author.name: Seungbin Park, Peilin Wang, Ryan Pennell, Emily S. Weg, Himanshu Nagar, Timothy McClure, Mert R. Sabuncu, Daniel Margolis, Heejong Kim

entry.summary: Develops a deep learning model to detect treatment-induced changes from longitudinal MR-Linac images during prostate radiotherapy. The model predicts temporal ordering of image pairs, detecting subtle inter-fraction changes over 2-day intervals.

entry.title: Laws of Learning Dynamics and the Core of Learners

author.name: Inkee Jung, Siu Cheong Lau

entry.summary: Formulates fundamental laws of learning dynamics (conservation law, entropy decrease) and introduces an entropy-based lifelong ensemble learning method. Demonstrates an immunization mechanism against adversarial attacks on CIFAR-10.

entry.title: Autodiscover: A reinforcement learning recommendation system for the cold-start imbalance challenge in active learning, powered by graph-aware thompson sampling

author.name: Parsa Vares

entry.summary: Introduces AutoDiscover, an active learning framework using graph-aware Thompson sampling for systematic literature reviews. Models literature as a heterogeneous graph and uses adaptive query strategies instead of fixed ones.

entry.title: HealthMamba: An Uncertainty-aware Spatiotemporal Graph State Space Model for Effective and Reliable Healthcare Facility Visit Prediction

author.name: Dahai Yu, Lin Jiang, Rongchao Xu, Guang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes HealthMamba, combining Mamba state-space models with spatiotemporal graphs and uncertainty quantification for healthcare facility visit prediction. Addresses both spatial dependencies across facility types and reliability under abnormal situations.

entry.title: Beyond Length: Context-Aware Expansion and Independence as Developmentally Sensitive Evaluation in Child Utterances

author.name: Jiyun Chun, Eric Fosler-Lussier, Michael White, Andrew Perrault

entry.summary: Introduces an LLM-as-judge framework for evaluating children's utterances in adult-child dialogue along two axes: Expansion (contextual elaboration) and Independence (discourse contribution). Addresses limitations of length-based metrics like MLU.

entry.title: Towards Segmenting the Invisible: An End-to-End Registration and Segmentation Framework for Weakly Supervised Tumour Analysis

author.name: Budhaditya Mukhopadhyay, Chirag Mandal, Pavan Tummala, Naghmeh Mahmoodian, Andreas N\"urnberger, Soumick Chatterjee

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid registration-segmentation framework for liver tumor analysis that transfers tumor visibility from pre-operative MRI to intra-operative CT where tumors are invisible. Uses cross-modality weak supervision with MSCGUNet for registration and UNet for segmentation.

entry.title: CAViT -- Channel-Aware Vision Transformer for Dynamic Feature Fusion

author.name: Aon Safdar, Mohamed Saadeldin

entry.summary: Introduces CAViT, a Vision Transformer variant that replaces static MLP layers with dynamic channel-wise self-attention, enabling content-aware feature mixing based on global image context.

entry.title: Clifford Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks

author.name: Matthias Wolff, Francesco Alesiani, Christof Duhme, Xiaoyi Jiang

entry.summary: Introduces Clifford Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (ClKAN) for function approximation in Clifford algebra spaces, using Randomized Quasi Monte Carlo grid generation to handle dimensional scaling.

entry.title: LISA: Laplacian In-context Spectral Analysis

author.name: Julio Candanedo

entry.summary: Proposes LISA, combining Laplacian spectral learning with delay-coordinate embeddings for inference-time adaptation of time-series models using lightweight latent-space residual adapters.

entry.title: Accelerating Benchmarking of Functional Connectivity Modeling via Structure-aware Core-set Selection

author.name: Ling Zhan, Zhen Li, Junjie Huang, Tao Jia

entry.summary: Proposes a structure-aware core-set selection method (SCLCS) for accelerating benchmarking of functional connectivity modeling methods on fMRI datasets, preserving relative performance rankings with small representative subsets.

entry.title: Large-scale Score-based Variational Posterior Inference for Bayesian Deep Neural Networks

author.name: Minyoung Kim

entry.summary: Introduces a score-based variational inference method for Bayesian deep neural networks that scales to large models. Avoids ELBO computation and instead uses score matching for posterior approximation.

entry.title: Escaping Local Minima Provably in Non-convex Matrix Sensing: A Deterministic Framework via Simulated Lifting

author.name: Tianqi Shen, Jinji Yang, Junze He, Kunhan Gao, Ziye Ma

entry.summary: Proposes Simulated Oracle Direction (SOD) to escape local minima in non-convex matrix sensing by simulating the landscape benefits of over-parameterization without actually lifting the problem dimensionality.

entry.title: Layer-wise LoRA fine-tuning: a similarity metric approach

author.name: Keith Ando Ogawa, Bruno Lopes Yamamoto, Lucas Lauton de Alcantara, Lucas Pellicer, Rosimeire Pereira Costa, Edson Bollis, Anna Helena Reali Costa, Artur Jordao

entry.summary: Proposes a similarity metric-based approach for selectively applying LoRA to different layers, reducing parameter count beyond standard LoRA while maintaining performance.

entry.title: Instance-optimal high-precision shadow tomography with few-copy measurements: A metrological approach

author.name: Senrui Chen, Weiyuan Gong, Sisi Zhou

entry.summary: Studies sample complexity of shadow tomography in the high-precision regime with realistic measurement constraints. Provides instance-optimal characterization of sample complexity.

entry.title: SIDeR: Semantic Identity Decoupling for Unrestricted Face Privacy

author.name: Zhuosen Bao, Xia Du, Zheng Lin, Jizhe Zhou, Zihan Fang, Jiening Wu, Yuxin Zhang, Zhe Chen, Chi-man Pun, Wei Ni, Jun Luo

entry.summary: Proposes SIDeR, a framework for face privacy protection that decomposes facial images into identity feature vectors and semantic appearance components, generating visually anonymous adversarial faces.

entry.title: Variance Reduction Based Experience Replay for Policy Optimization

author.name: Hua Zheng, Wei Xie, M. Ben Feng, Keilung Choy

entry.summary: Proposes Variance Reduction Experience Replay (VRER), a principled framework for selectively reusing informative historical samples in policy optimization with theoretical convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Solving Stochastic Variational Inequalities without the Bounded Variance Assumption

author.name: Ahmet Alacaoglu, Jun-Hyun Kim

entry.summary: Analyzes stochastic variational inequality algorithms without bounded variance or bounded domain assumptions, achieving Õ(ε⁻⁴) complexity for monotone and structured nonmonotone settings.

entry.title: Reducing the Complexity of Matrix Multiplication to $O(N^2log_2N)$ by an Asymptotically Optimal Quantum Algorithm

author.name: Jiaqi Yao, Ding Liu

entry.summary: Claims a quantum matrix multiplication algorithm achieving O(N²log₂N) complexity, outperforming classical O(N^2.37) bounds.

entry.title: Adaptive Global and Fine-Grained Perceptual Fusion for MLLM Embeddings Compatible with Hard Negative Amplification

author.name: Lexiang Hu, Youze Xue, Dian Li, Gang Liu, Zhouchen Lin

entry.summary: Proposes AGFF-Embed for MLLM embeddings that adaptively fuses global and fine-grained perceptual features, addressing the limitation of capturing only global semantic information.

entry.title: Causal Inference on Stopped Random Walks in Online Advertising

author.name: Jia Yuan Yu

entry.summary: Formulates causal inference for online advertising systems where treatment affects user trajectories and advertiser bidding policies, modeling these as stopped random walks.

entry.title: Reasoning under Ambiguity: Uncertainty-Aware Multilingual Emotion Classification under Partial Supervision

author.name: Md. Mithun Hossaina, Mashary N. Alrasheedy, Nirban Bhowmick, Shamim Forhad, Md. Shakil Hossain, Sudipto Chaki, Md Shafiqul Islam

entry.summary: Proposes an uncertainty-aware framework for multilingual multi-label emotion classification under partial supervision. Addresses co-occurring emotions and missing labels through probabilistic modeling.

entry.title: SciDef: Automating Definition Extraction from Academic Literature with Large Language Models

author.name: Filip Ku\v{c}era, Christoph Mandl, Isao Echizen, Radu Timofte, Timo Spinde

entry.summary: Introduces SciDef, an LLM-based pipeline for automated definition extraction from scientific literature. Tests on novel datasets with 16 LMs across prompting strategies.

entry.title: AirGlove: Exploring Egocentric 3D Hand Tracking and Appearance Generalization for Sensing Gloves

author.name: Wenhui Cui, Ziyi Kou, Chuan Qin, Ergys Ristani, Li Guan

entry.summary: Presents first systematic evaluation of vision-based hand tracking on sensing gloves, exploring appearance generalization from bare hands to gloved hands.

entry.title: Explainable Pathomics Feature Visualization via Correlation-aware Conditional Feature Editing

author.name: Yuechen Yang, Junlin Guo, Ruining Deng, Junchao Zhu, Zhengyi Lu, Chongyu Qu, Yanfan Zhu, Xingyi Guo, Yu Wang, Shilin Zhao, Haichun Yang, Yuankai Huo

entry.summary: Proposes a correlation-aware conditional diffusion model for editing pathomics features while maintaining biological plausibility, addressing the issue that standard feature editing assumes independence among correlated features. This improves explainability of quantitative pathology biomarkers.

entry.title: TSBOW: Traffic Surveillance Benchmark for Occluded Vehicles Under Various Weather Conditions

author.name: Ngoc Doan-Minh Huynh, Duong Nguyen-Ngoc Tran, Long Hoang Pham, Tai Huu-Phuong Tran, Hyung-Joon Jeon, Huy-Hung Nguyen, Duong Khac Vu, Hyung-Min Jeon, Son Hong Phan, Quoc Pham-Nam Ho, Chi Dai Tran, Trinh Le Ba Khanh, Jae Wook Jeon

entry.summary: Introduces TSBOW, a large-scale traffic surveillance dataset for occluded vehicle detection under extreme weather conditions, comprising 32+ hours of real-world data with 48K manually annotated and 3.2M semi-labeled frames. Fills a gap in existing datasets that lack extreme weather scenarios.

entry.title: EgoPoseVR: Spatiotemporal Multi-Modal Reasoning for Egocentric Full-Body Pose in Virtual Reality

author.name: Haojie Cheng, Shaun Jing Heng Ong, Shaoyu Cai, Aiden Tat Yang Koh, Fuxi Ouyang, Eng Tat Khoo

entry.summary: Presents EgoPoseVR, an end-to-end framework for egocentric full-body pose estimation in VR that fuses headset motion cues with RGB-D observations through spatiotemporal encoding and cross-attention.

entry.title: ROMAN: Reward-Orchestrated Multi-Head Attention Network for Autonomous Driving System Testing

author.name: Jianlei Chi, Yuzhen Wu, Jiaxuan Hou, Xiaodong Zhang, Ming Fan, Suhui Sun, Weijun Dai, Bo Li, Jianguo Sun, Jun Sun

entry.summary: Proposes ROMAN, a scenario generation approach for autonomous driving system testing that combines multi-head attention with reward-based optimization to generate complex law-breaking scenarios.

entry.title: Multi-Scale Global-Instance Prompt Tuning for Continual Test-time Adaptation in Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Lingrui Li, Yanfeng Zhou, Nan Pu, Xin Chen, Zhun Zhong

entry.summary: Proposes multi-scale global-instance prompt tuning for continual test-time adaptation in medical image segmentation, addressing error accumulation and catastrophic forgetting through prompt-based adaptation.

entry.title: QuantumGS: Quantum Encoding Framework for Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Grzegorz Wilczy\'nski, Rafa{\l} Tobiasz, Pawe{\l} Gora, Marcin Mazur, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek

entry.summary: Introduces QuantumGS, a hybrid framework integrating variational quantum circuits into Gaussian splatting to better capture view-dependent effects like reflections and transparency.

entry.title: VLN-Pilot: Large Vision-Language Model as an Autonomous Indoor Drone Operator

author.name: Bessie Dominguez-Dager, Sergio Suescun-Ferrandiz, Felix Escalona, Francisco Gomez-Donoso, Miguel Cazorla

entry.summary: Introduces VLN-Pilot, a framework using large vision-language models as autonomous indoor drone operators that interpret natural language instructions and ground them in visual observations for navigation.

entry.title: Virtual-Tube-Based Cooperative Transport Control for Multi-UAV Systems in Constrained Environments

author.name: Runxiao Liu, Pengda Mao, Xiangli Le, Shuang Gu, Yapeng Chen, Quan Quan

entry.summary: Proposes a virtual tube-based control framework for multi-UAV cooperative transportation of cable-suspended loads in obstacle-rich environments, using dissipative systems theory for stability guarantees.

entry.title: From Bench to Flight: Translating Drone Impact Tests into Operational Safety Limits

author.name: Aziz Mohamed Mili, Louis Catar, Paul G\'erard, Ilyass Tabiai, David St-Onge

entry.summary: Presents an end-to-end open toolchain that converts benchtop drone impact tests into deployable safety speed governors, including an impact rig, data-driven models mapping speed to impulse, and a ROS2 node for online enforcement.

entry.title: Metric space valued Fr{\'e}chet regression

author.name: L\'aszl\'o Gy\"orfi (DCSIT), Pierre Humbert (LaMME), Batiste Le Bars (MAGNET)

entry.summary: Introduces a computable estimator for the Fréchet mean in separable metric spaces using random quantization, proving universal consistency. Also proposes a conditional Fréchet mean estimator using data-driven partitioning for Banach space outputs.

entry.title: AI #154: Claw Your Way To The Top

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi Moshowitz's weekly AI roundup covering OpenClaw, MoltBook, Dario Amodei's 'Adolescence of Technology' essay, and various AI industry developments. Provides high-level commentary on the state of AI agents, social networks, and safety concerns.

entry.title: Clinical Validation of Medical-based Large Language Model Chatbots on Ophthalmic Patient Queries with LLM-based Evaluation

author.name: Ting Fang Tan, Kabilan Elangovan, Andreas Pollreisz, Kevin Bryan Dy, Wei Yan Ng, Joy Le Yi Wong, Jin Liyuan, Chrystie Quek Wan Ning, Ashley Shuen Ying Hong, Arun James Thirunavukarasu, Shelley Yin-His Chang, Jie Yao, Dylan Hong, Wang Zhaoran, Amrita Gupta, Daniel SW Ting

entry.summary: Evaluates four small medical LLMs (under 10B parameters) on ophthalmology patient queries, assessing feasibility of LLM-based evaluation against clinician grading across 2160 responses.

entry.title: Day-Ahead Electricity Price Forecasting for Volatile Markets Using Foundation Models with Regularization Strategy

author.name: Kritchanat Ponyuenyong, Pengyu Tu, Jia Wei Tan, Wei Soon Cheong, Jamie Ng Suat Ling, Lianlian Jiang

entry.summary: Evaluates time series foundation models for day-ahead electricity price forecasting in volatile markets, proposing a spike regularization strategy to handle price volatility.

entry.title: Geographically-aware Transformer-based Traffic Forecasting for Urban Motorway Digital Twins

author.name: Kre\v{s}imir Ku\v{s}i\'c, Vinny Cahill, Ivana Dusparic

entry.summary: Proposes a geographically-aware transformer for motorway traffic forecasting in digital twin systems, addressing limitations in capturing spatial dependencies for traffic management.

entry.title: Speech Emotion Recognition Leveraging OpenAI's Whisper Representations and Attentive Pooling Methods

author.name: Ali Shendabadi, Parnia Izadirad, Mostafa Salehi, Mahmoud Bijankhan

entry.summary: Explores Whisper ASR representations for speech emotion recognition with two attention-based pooling methods, achieving SOTA on Persian ShEMO dataset.

entry.title: Enabling Automatic Disordered Speech Recognition: An Impaired Speech Dataset in the Akan Language

author.name: Isaac Wiafe, Akon Obu Ekpezu, Sumaya Ahmed Salihs, Elikem Doe Atsakpo, Fiifi Baffoe Payin Winful, Jamal-Deen Abdulai

entry.summary: Presents a curated corpus of 50 hours of impaired speech from Akan speakers covering stammering, cerebral palsy, cleft palate, and stroke-induced disorders. Addresses the lack of impaired speech data for low-resource languages.

entry.title: XEmoGPT: An Explainable Multimodal Emotion Recognition Framework with Cue-Level Perception and Reasoning

author.name: Hanwen Zhang, Yao Liu, Peiyuan Jiang, Lang Junjie, Xie Jun, Yihui He, Yajiao Deng, Siyu Du, Qiao Liu

entry.summary: Introduces XEmoGPT for explainable multimodal emotion recognition, addressing limitations in cue-level perception and reasoning with specialized encoders for emotional signals and new evaluation metrics.

entry.title: ReText: Text Boosts Generalization in Image-Based Person Re-identification

author.name: Timur Mamedov, Karina Kvanchiani, Anton Konushin, Vadim Konushin

entry.summary: Proposes ReText for person re-identification, using textual descriptions to supplement single-camera training data, jointly optimizing Re-ID, image-text matching, and image-text fusion objectives.

entry.title: Multi-Aspect Mining and Anomaly Detection for Heterogeneous Tensor Streams

author.name: Soshi Kakio, Yasuko Matsubara, Ren Fujiwara, Yasushi Sakurai

entry.summary: Proposes methods for analysis and anomaly detection in heterogeneous tensor streams containing both categorical and continuous attributes, avoiding the need to discretize or homogenize attribute types.

entry.title: Comparing Euclidean and Hyperbolic K-Means for Generalized Category Discovery

author.name: Mohamad Dalal, Thomas B. Moeslund, Joakim Bruslund Haurum

entry.summary: Presents HC-GCD, which performs both representation learning and clustering in hyperbolic space for Generalized Category Discovery. Finds that hyperbolic clustering performs on par with but doesn't clearly outperform Euclidean approaches.

entry.title: Learning False Discovery Rate Control via Model-Based Neural Networks

author.name: Arnau Vilella, Jasin Machkour, Michael Muma, Daniel P. Palomar

entry.summary: Introduces a learning-augmented enhancement of the T-Rex Selector for FDR control using neural networks trained on synthetic data to better approximate false discovery proportion.

entry.title: Active Label Cleaning for Reliable Detection of Electron Dense Deposits in Transmission Electron Microscopy Images

author.name: Jieyun Tan, Shuo Liu, Guibin Zhang, Ziqi Li, Jian Geng, Lei Zhang, Lei Cao

entry.summary: Proposes an active label cleaning method for crowdsourced electron dense deposit detection in TEM images, using active learning to select noisy samples for expert re-annotation.

entry.title: Multi-instance robust fitting for non-classical geometric models

author.name: Zongliang Zhang, Shuxiang Li, Xingwang Huang, Zongyue Wang

entry.summary: Proposes methods for multi-instance robust fitting of non-classical geometric models (spiral curves, free-form surfaces) from noisy data, formulated as an optimization problem with a novel outlier-handling estimator.

entry.title: Exploring the Temporal Consistency for Point-Level Weakly-Supervised Temporal Action Localization

author.name: Yunchuan Ma, Laiyun Qing, Guorong Li, Yuqing Liu, Yuankai Qi, Qingming Huang

entry.summary: Designs a multi-task learning framework for point-supervised temporal action localization that explicitly models temporal relationships among frames through temporal consistency learning.

entry.title: EoCD: Encoder only Remote Sensing Change Detection

author.name: Mubashir Noman, Mustansar Fiaz, Hiyam Debary, Abdul Hannan, Shah Nawaz, Fahad Shahbaz Khan, Salman Khan

entry.summary: Proposes EoCD, an encoder-only architecture for remote sensing change detection that eliminates the need for sophisticated decoders, reducing computational cost while maintaining performance.

entry.title: Rule-Based Spatial Mixture-of-Experts U-Net for Explainable Edge Detection

author.name: Bharadwaj Dogga, Kaaustaaub Shankar, Gibin Raju, Wilhelm Louw, Kelly Cohen

entry.summary: Proposes a Rule-Based Spatial Mixture-of-Experts U-Net for explainable edge detection, integrating spatially-adaptive MoE blocks for interpretability in safety-critical applications.

entry.title: Optimizing Mission Planning for Multi-Debris Rendezvous Using Reinforcement Learning with Refueling and Adaptive Collision Avoidance

author.name: Agni Bandyopadhyay, Gunther Waxenegger-Wilfing

entry.summary: Applies reinforcement learning to optimize multi-debris removal mission planning for small satellites, integrating refueling strategies and adaptive collision avoidance in orbital environments.

entry.title: Traceable Cross-Source RAG for Chinese Tibetan Medicine Question Answering

author.name: Fengxian Chen, Zhilong Tao, Jiaxuan Li, Yunlong Li, Qingguo Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes traceable cross-source RAG methods for Chinese Tibetan medicine QA, using knowledge-base routing and budgeted retrieval across encyclopedia, classics, and clinical paper sources to reduce density-driven bias.

entry.title: Quantum Reinforcement Learning with Transformers for the Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem

author.name: Eva Andr\'es

entry.summary: Compares classical, hybrid, and full quantum reinforcement learning approaches for the Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem using A2C with transformer architectures.

entry.title: Cold Start Problem: An Experimental Study of Knowledge Tracing Models with New Students

author.name: Indronil Bhattacharjee, Christabel Wayllace

entry.summary: Studies the cold start problem in knowledge tracing by training models exclusively on historical students and testing on entirely new students, finding significant performance degradation across DKT, DKVMN, and SAKT models.

entry.title: Evaluating Kubernetes Performance for GenAI Inference: From Automatic Speech Recognition to LLM Summarization

author.name: Sai Sindhur Malleni, Ra\'ul Sevilla, Aleksei Vasilevskii, Jos\'e Castillo Lema, Andr\'e Bauer

entry.summary: Industry paper evaluating Kubernetes-native tools for GenAI inference workloads, combining automatic speech recognition (Whisper) and LLM summarization. Tests Kueue for batch job management and vLLM for online inference with Dynamic Accelerator Slicer.

entry.title: Graph--Theoretic Analysis of Phase Optimization Complexity in Variational Wave Functions for Heisenberg Antiferromagnets

author.name: Mahmud Ashraf Shamim, Moshiur Rahman, Mohamed Hibat-Allah, Paulo T Araujo

entry.summary: Maps frustrated Heisenberg antiferromagnet wavefunctions to graph theory, showing phase reconstruction reduces to a weighted Max-Cut instance. Uses this to characterize computational complexity of variational wavefunction optimization.

entry.title: LMMRec: LLM-driven Motivation-aware Multimodal Recommendation

author.name: Yicheng Di, Zhanjie Zhang, Yun Wangc, Jinren Liue, Jiaqi Yanf, Jiyu Wei, Xiangyu Chend, Yuan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes LMMRec, a model-agnostic recommendation framework that uses LLMs to understand user motivations from multimodal data including review text, addressing challenges of cross-modal alignment and motivation identification.

entry.title: LinguistAgent: A Reflective Multi-Model Platform for Automated Linguistic Annotation

author.name: Bingru Li

entry.summary: Introduces LinguistAgent, a platform using dual-agent (Annotator + Reviewer) architecture to automate linguistic annotation tasks like metaphor identification, supporting prompt engineering, RAG, and fine-tuning paradigms.

entry.title: DARWIN: Dynamic Agentically Rewriting Self-Improving Network

author.name: Henry Jiang

entry.summary: DARWIN uses a genetic algorithm-like optimization with multiple GPT agents that modify each other's training code to improve performance, demonstrated with nanoGPT framework.

entry.title: Neural Implicit 3D Cardiac Shape Reconstruction from Sparse CT Angiography Slices Mimicking 2D Transthoracic Echocardiography Views

author.name: Gino E. Jansen, Carolina Br\'as, R. Nils Planken, Mark J. Schuuring, Berto J. Bouma, Ivana I\v{s}gum

entry.summary: Proposes neural implicit function-based 3D cardiac shape reconstruction from sparse CT angiography planes mimicking 2D echocardiography views, learning shape priors from 3D segmentations.

entry.title: Quantile-Physics Hybrid Framework for Safe-Speed Recommendation under Diverse Weather Conditions Leveraging Connected Vehicle and Road Weather Information Systems Data

author.name: Wen Zhang, Adel W. Sadek, Chunming Qiao

entry.summary: Proposes a hybrid framework combining Quantile Regression Forests with physics-based models to recommend safe speed intervals for freeway travel under diverse weather conditions, using large-scale connected vehicle data.

entry.title: Exact Recovery in the Data Block Model

author.name: Amir R. Asadi, Akbar Davoodi, Ramin Javadi, Farzad Parvaresh

entry.summary: Studies exact recovery in the Data Block Model (DBM), extending the stochastic block model with node-associated data. Characterizes phase transitions for community detection when additional node attributes are available.

entry.title: Learning fermionic linear optics with Heisenberg scaling and physical operations

author.name: Aria Christensen, Andrew Zhao

entry.summary: Establishes efficient protocols for learning fermionic linear optics that obey superselection rules, use minimal ancilla, and achieve improved scaling in both system size and precision.

entry.title: SHaSaM: Submodular Hard Sample Mining for Fair Facial Attribute Recognition

author.name: Anay Majee, Rishabh Iyer

entry.summary: Proposes SHaSaM, a submodular hard sample mining approach for fair facial attribute recognition that models fairness-driven representation learning as a combinatorial optimization problem.

entry.title: Ethology of Latent Spaces

author.name: Philippe Boisnard

entry.summary: Adopts an ethological perspective on VLM latent spaces, analyzing how different CLIP variants (OpenAI CLIP, OpenCLIP LAION, SigLIP) diverge in attributing political and cultural categories to artworks.

entry.title: Non-Stationary Inventory Control with Lead Times

author.name: Nele H. Amiri, Sean R. Sinclair, Maximiliano Udenio

entry.summary: Studies non-stationary inventory control with unknown, changing demand distributions. Shows a sharp separation between backlogging and lost-sales models with lead times in terms of adaptability to demand changes.

entry.title: LD-SLRO: Latent Diffusion Structured Light for 3-D Reconstruction of Highly Reflective Objects

author.name: Sanghoon Jeon, Gihyun Jung, Suhyeon Ka, Jae-Sang Hyun

entry.summary: Proposes LD-SLRO, a latent diffusion-based method for 3D reconstruction of highly reflective objects using structured light, addressing specular reflection artifacts in fringe projection profilometry.

entry.title: Generalization of Self-Supervised Vision Transformers for Protein Localization Across Microscopy Domains

author.name: Ben Isselmann, Dilara G\"oksu, Andreas Weinmann

entry.summary: Investigates cross-domain transferability of DINO-pretrained Vision Transformers for protein localization across microscopy domains, finding that all pretrained models transfer well to OpenCell with domain-specific pretraining offering marginal gains.

entry.title: PIRATR: Parametric Object Inference for Robotic Applications with Transformers in 3D Point Clouds

author.name: Michael Schwingshackl, Fabio F. Oberweger, Mario Niedermeyer, Huemer Johannes, Markus Murschitz

entry.summary: Presents PIRATR, an end-to-end 3D object detection framework for robotic use cases that jointly estimates multi-class 6-DoF poses and class-specific parametric attributes from point cloud data.

entry.title: A Hybrid CNN and ML Framework for Multi-modal Classification of Movement Disorders Using MRI and Brain Structural Features

author.name: Mengyu Li, Ingibj\"org Kristj\'ansd\'ottir, Thilo van Eimeren, Kathrin Giehl, Lotta M. Ellingsen, the ASAP Neuroimaging Initiative

entry.summary: Proposes a hybrid CNN-ML framework for classifying atypical Parkinsonian disorders (PSP and MSA) vs. Parkinson's disease using multi-modal MRI data including T1-weighted images and brain structural features.

entry.title: Context-Aware Asymmetric Ensembling for Interpretable Retinopathy of Prematurity Screening via Active Query and Vascular Attention

author.name: Md. Mehedi Hassan, Taufiq Hasan

entry.summary: Proposes a context-aware asymmetric ensemble model for retinopathy of prematurity screening that simulates clinical reasoning through specialized streams for structural staging and vascular analysis.

entry.title: Optimization is Not Enough: Why Problem Formulation Deserves Equal Attention

author.name: Iv\'an Olarte Rodr\'iguez, Gokhan Serhat, Mariusz Bujny, Fabian Duddeck, Thomas B\"ack, Elena Raponi

entry.summary: Argues that problem formulation deserves equal attention as optimization algorithm choice, demonstrated through a topology optimization case study of laminated composite structures.

entry.title: Applying Ground Robot Fleets in Urban Search: Understanding Professionals' Operational Challenges and Design Opportunities

author.name: Puqi Zhou (George Mason University, USA), Charles R. Twardy (George Mason University, USA), Cynthia Lum (George Mason University, USA), Myeong Lee (George Mason University, USA), David J. Porfirio (George Mason University, USA), Michael R. Hieb (George Mason University, USA), Chris Thomas (Virginia Tech, USA), Xuesu Xiao (George Mason University, USA), Sungsoo Ray Hong (George Mason University, USA)

entry.summary: Conducts focus groups with public safety professionals to understand how ground-robot fleets with CV and LLM interfaces could be integrated into urban search operations, identifying operational challenges and design opportunities.

entry.title: Biotech Startup Stats

author.name: sarahconstantin

entry.summary: Uses Claude Code to analyze SEC filings and stock data for 803 biotech companies founded after 2000, examining predictors of biotech startup success including founding location, exchange listing, and financial metrics over time.

entry.title: Evaluating Robustness and Adaptability in Learning-Based Mission Planning for Active Debris Removal

author.name: Agni Bandyopadhyay, G\"unther Waxenegger-Wilfing

entry.summary: Compares three planners (nominal PPO, domain-randomized PPO, and MCTS) for constrained multi-debris rendezvous in LEO, evaluating robustness under varying fuel and time constraints across 300 test cases.

entry.title: Aspect-Aware MOOC Recommendation in a Heterogeneous Network

author.name: Seongyeub Chu, Jongwoo Kim, Mun Yong Yi

entry.summary: Proposes AMR, a MOOC recommendation framework that models path-specific multiple aspects in heterogeneous networks without manually predefined metapaths.

entry.title: Stochastic hierarchical data-driven optimization: application to plasma-surface kinetics

author.name: Jos\'e Afonso, Vasco Guerra, Pedro Viegas

entry.summary: Introduces a stochastic hierarchical optimization framework for calibrating physical models, using reduced Hessian approximation to identify stiff parameter subspaces. Applied to plasma-surface interactions.

entry.title: Cross-talk based multi-task learning for fault classification of physically coupled machine system

author.name: Wonjun Yi, Rismaya Kumar Mishra, Yong-Hwa Park

entry.summary: Proposes cross-talk based multi-task learning for fault classification in physically coupled machine systems, jointly learning fault conditions and related physical variables through controlled information exchange between tasks.

entry.title: Reduced-Order Surrogates for Forced Flexible Mesh Coastal-Ocean Models

author.name: Freja H{\o}gholm Petersen, Jesper Sandvig Mariegaard, Rocco Palmitessa, Allan P. Engsig-Karup

entry.summary: Introduces a flexible Koopman autoencoder for coastal-ocean modeling that incorporates meteorological forcings and boundary conditions, comparing against POD-based surrogates across three test cases.

entry.title: Sovereign-by-Design A Reference Architecture for AI and Blockchain Enabled Systems

author.name: Matteo Esposito, Lodovica Marchesi, Roberto Tonelli, Valentina Lenarduzzi

entry.summary: Proposes a Sovereign Reference Architecture integrating self-sovereign identity, blockchain-based trust, sovereign data governance, and GenAI deployment patterns to operationalize digital sovereignty at the architectural level.

entry.title: AI Agent Systems for Supply Chains: Structured Decision Prompts and Memory Retrieval

author.name: Konosuke Yoshizato, Kazuma Shimizu, Ryota Higa, Takanobu Otsuka

entry.summary: Investigates LLM-based multi-agent systems for supply chain inventory management, examining whether they can derive optimal ordering policies using structured decision prompts and memory retrieval mechanisms.

entry.title: Probabilistic Multi-Regional Solar Power Forecasting with Any-Quantile Recurrent Neural Networks

author.name: Slawek Smyl, Pawe{\l} Pe{\l}ka, Grzegorz Dudek

entry.summary: Proposes an any-quantile probabilistic forecasting framework for multi-regional solar power generation using a dual-track RNN architecture that processes series-specific and cross-regional information.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning Enhancement Using Vector Semantic Representation and Symbolic Reasoning for Human-Centered Autonomous Emergency Braking

author.name: Vinal Asodia, Iman Sharifi, Saber Fallah

entry.summary: Proposes a neuro-symbolic pipeline for autonomous emergency braking that integrates semantic, spatial, and shape information with a Soft First-Order Logic reward function for RL.

entry.title: Universal approximation with signatures of non-geometric rough paths

author.name: Mihriban Ceylan, Anna P. Kwossek, David J. Pr\"omel

entry.summary: Extends universal approximation theorems for signatures of rough paths beyond the weakly geometric case, with applications to stochastic integration.

entry.title: Characterizing Human Semantic Navigation in Concept Production as Trajectories in Embedding Space

author.name: Felipe D. Toro-Hern\'andez, Jesuino Vieira Filho, Rodrigo M. Cabral-Carvalho

entry.summary: Introduces a framework for representing human semantic concept production as navigation through embedding space, extracting geometric metrics like velocity, acceleration, and entropy from semantic trajectories.

entry.title: LOBSTgER-enhance: an underwater image enhancement pipeline

author.name: Andreas Mentzelopoulos, Keith Ellenbogen

entry.summary: Develops LOBSTgER-enhance, an underwater image enhancement pipeline using synthetic corruption and diffusion-based generation for reversing underwater degradations.

entry.title: Multi-AD: Cross-Domain Unsupervised Anomaly Detection for Medical and Industrial Applications

author.name: Wahyu Rahmaniar, Kenji Suzuki

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-AD, a CNN model using squeeze-and-excitation blocks and knowledge distillation for unsupervised anomaly detection across medical and industrial imaging domains. Aims for cross-domain generalization without domain-specific fine-tuning.

entry.title: IndustryShapes: An RGB-D Benchmark dataset for 6D object pose estimation of industrial assembly components and tools

author.name: Panagiotis Sapoutzoglou, Orestis Vaggelis, Athina Zacharia, Evangelos Sartinas, Maria Pateraki

entry.summary: Introduces IndustryShapes, an RGB-D benchmark dataset of industrial tools and components for 6D pose estimation, featuring five new object types with challenging properties captured in realistic industrial settings.

entry.title: Contour Refinement using Discrete Diffusion in Low Data Regime

author.name: Fei Yu Guan, Ian Keefe, Sophie Wilkinson, Daniel D. B. Perrakis, Steven Waslander

entry.summary: Presents a lightweight discrete diffusion contour refinement pipeline for boundary detection in low data regimes, using CNN with self-attention conditioned on segmentation masks.

entry.title: Variable Search Stepsize for Randomized Local Search in Multi-Objective Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Xuepeng Ren, Maocai Wang, Guangming Dai, Zimin Liang, Qianrong Liu, Shengxiang Yang, Miqing Li

entry.summary: Proposes variable search stepsize for randomized local search in multi-objective combinatorial optimization, adapting variation neighborhood size during search.

entry.title: Low-Cost Underwater In-Pipe Centering and Inspection Using a Minimal-Sensing Robot

author.name: Kalvik Jakkala, Jason O'Kane

entry.summary: Presents a minimal-sensing strategy for underwater pipe inspection using only IMU, pressure sensor, and two sonars, with efficient algorithms for pipe centering and traversal.

entry.title: Modelling Pedestrian Behaviour in Autonomous Vehicle Encounters Using Naturalistic Dataset

author.name: Rulla Al-Haideri, Bilal Farooq

entry.summary: Studies micro-level pedestrian behavior during midblock encounters with autonomous vehicles using the NuScenes dataset and a hybrid discrete choice-machine learning framework (ResLogit model) incorporating temporal, spatial, and kinematic features.

entry.title: Explainable AI: A Combined XAI Framework for Explaining Brain Tumour Detection Models

author.name: Patrick McGonagle, William Farrelly, Kevin Curran

entry.summary: Combines GRAD-CAM, LRP, and SHAP explainability techniques for brain tumor detection CNNs, achieving 91.24% accuracy on BraTS 2021 while providing layered explanations.

entry.title: A Unified Multimodal Framework for Dataset Construction and Model-Based Diagnosis of Ameloblastoma

author.name: Ajo Babu George, Anna Mariam John, Athul Anoop, Balu Bhasuran

entry.summary: Presents a multimodal dataset and deep learning model for ameloblastoma diagnosis, integrating radiological, histopathological, and clinical images with NLP-extracted features from case reports.

entry.title: Smart Diagnosis and Early Intervention in PCOS: A Deep Learning Approach to Women's Reproductive Health

author.name: Shayan Abrar, Samura Rahman, Ishrat Jahan Momo, Mahjabin Tasnim Samiha, B. M. Shahria Alam, Mohammad Tahmid Noor, Nishat Tasnim Niloy

entry.summary: Applies transfer learning with DenseNet201 and ResNet50 for classifying ovarian ultrasound images to detect PCOS. Uses MixUp and CutMix augmentation on a 3856-image dataset.

entry.title: Benchmarking Artificial Intelligence Models for Daily Coastal Hypoxia Forecasting

author.name: Magesh Rajasekaran, Md Saiful Sajol, Chris Alvin, Supratik Mukhopadhyay, Yanda Ou, Z. George Xue

entry.summary: Benchmarks deep learning architectures (BiLSTM, transformers, TCN) for daily coastal hypoxia forecasting in the Gulf of Mexico, using 12 years of hindcast data from a coupled hydrodynamic-biogeochemical model.

entry.title: Ontology-Driven Robotic Specification Synthesis

author.name: Maksym Figat, Ryan M. Mackey, Michel D. Ingham

entry.summary: Proposes RSTM2, an ontology-driven methodology for bridging high-level objectives and formal specifications in safety-critical robotic systems, using stochastic timed Petri nets and Monte Carlo simulations.

entry.title: Enhancing Personality Recognition by Comparing the Predictive Power of Traits, Facets, and Nuances

author.name: Amir Ansari, Jana Subirana, Bruna Silva, Sergio Escalera, David Gallardo-Pujol, Cristina Palmero

entry.summary: Explores using finer-grained personality hierarchical levels (facets and nuances beyond broad traits) for personality recognition from audiovisual data, using a transformer-based model on the UDIVA dataset.

entry.title: CFRecs: Counterfactual Recommendations on Real Estate User Listing Interaction Graphs

author.name: Seyedmasoud Mousavi, Ruomeng Xu, Xiaojing Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces CFRecs, a framework that transforms counterfactual graph explanations into actionable recommendations for real estate platforms. Combines GNN learning with counterfactual reasoning for user-listing interactions.

entry.title: VEXA: Evidence-Grounded and Persona-Adaptive Explanations for Scam Risk Sensemaking

author.name: Heajun An, Connor Ng, Sandesh Sharma Dulal, Junghwan Kim, Jin-Hee Cho

entry.summary: Proposes VEXA, a framework for generating evidence-grounded, persona-adaptive explanations for scam detection that integrates GradientSHAP attribution with vulnerability personas.

entry.title: PatchFlow: Leveraging a Flow-Based Model with Patch Features

author.name: Boxiang Zhang, Baijian Yang, Xiaoming Wang, Corey Vian

entry.summary: Combines patch features with normalizing flow models for industrial anomaly detection in die casting, achieving 20% error rate reduction on MVTec AD dataset.

entry.title: Parallel Swin Transformer-Enhanced 3D MRI-to-CT Synthesis for MRI-Only Radiotherapy Planning

author.name: Zolnamar Dorjsembe, Hung-Yi Chen, Furen Xiao, Hsing-Kuo Pao

entry.summary: Proposes a parallel Swin Transformer architecture for 3D MRI-to-CT synthesis, combining convolutional encoding with dual Swin Transformer branches for radiotherapy planning.

entry.title: Quantifying the Knowledge Proximity Between Academic and Industry Research: An Entity and Semantic Perspective

author.name: Hongye Zhao, Yi Zhao, Chengzhi Zhang

entry.summary: Quantifies knowledge proximity between academic and industry research using entity and semantic analysis. Moves beyond macro indicators like paper counts to analyze fine-grained knowledge units in the literature.

entry.title: ArkTS-CodeSearch: A Open-Source ArkTS Dataset for Code Retrieval

author.name: Yulong He, Artem Ermakov, Sergey Kovalchuk, Artem Aliev, Dmitry Shalymov

entry.summary: Presents ArkTS-CodeSearch, a dataset for code retrieval in the ArkTS language (OpenHarmony ecosystem). Evaluates existing code embedding models on this new language.

entry.title: A Comparative Study of 3D Person Detection: Sensor Modalities and Robustness in Diverse Indoor and Outdoor Environments

author.name: Malaz Tamim, Andrea Matic-Flierl, Karsten Roscher

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of 3D person detection comparing camera-only, LiDAR-only, and fusion approaches across indoor and outdoor environments using the JRDB dataset, with analysis under varying occlusion and distance conditions.

entry.title: Disc-Centric Contrastive Learning for Lumbar Spine Severity Grading

author.name: Sajjan Acharya, Pralisha Kansakar

entry.summary: Presents a disc-centric approach for automated lumbar spine stenosis grading combining contrastive pretraining with disc-level fine-tuning, achieving 78.1% balanced accuracy.

entry.title: Residual Reinforcement Learning for Waste-Container Lifting Using Large-Scale Cranes with Underactuated Tools

author.name: Qi Li, Karsten Berns

entry.summary: Proposes a residual reinforcement learning approach for precise container lifting with hydraulic loader cranes, combining a nominal Cartesian controller with a learned residual policy to handle tight geometric tolerances in simulation.

entry.title: Food Portion Estimation: From Pixels to Calories

author.name: Gautham Vinod, Fengqing Zhu

entry.summary: Survey paper exploring food portion estimation from images for dietary assessment, covering methods from depth maps and multi-view inputs to deep learning approaches for predicting food volume from 2D images.

entry.title: Metric Hedonic Games on the Line

author.name: Merlin de la Haye, Pascal Lenzner, Farehe Soheil, Marcus Wunderlich

entry.summary: Studies metric hedonic games where agents on a line form coalitions based on type-value differences, extending modified fractional hedonic games with a succinct representation variant.

entry.title: PMT Waveform Simulation and Reconstruction with Conditional Diffusion Network

author.name: Kainan Liu, Jingyu Huang, Guihong Huang, Jianyi Luo

entry.summary: Proposes a conditional diffusion network for PMT waveform simulation and reconstruction in particle physics, using a weakly supervised approach to handle lack of ground truth.

entry.title: A Hybrid Autoencoder for Robust Heightmap Generation from Fused Lidar and Depth Data for Humanoid Robot Locomotion

author.name: Dennis Bank, Joost Cordes, Thomas Seel, Simon F. G. Ehlers

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid autoencoder fusing LiDAR and depth camera data for terrain heightmap generation for humanoid robot locomotion.

entry.title: A Mixed Reality System for Robust Manikin Localization in Childbirth Training

author.name: Haojie Cheng, Chang Liu, Abhiram Kanneganti, Mahesh Arjandas Choolani, Arundhati Tushar Gosavi, Eng Tat Khoo

entry.summary: Introduces a mixed reality system for childbirth training that combines virtual guidance with physical manikin interaction, using spatial calibration of an external RGB-D camera with a commercial HMD.

entry.title: Location-Aware Dispersion on Anonymous Graphs

author.name: Himani, Supantha Pandit, Gokarna Sharma

entry.summary: Introduces Location-Aware Dispersion, a generalization of the classic robot dispersion problem where color-labeled robots must settle at matching-color nodes in anonymous graphs, with algorithms for various graph topologies.

entry.title: Beyond Manual Planning: Seating Allocation for Large Organizations

author.name: Anton Ipsen, Michael Cashmore, Kirsty Fielding, Nicolas Marchesotti, Parisa Zehtabi, Daniele Magazzeni, Manuela Veloso

entry.summary: Introduces the Hierarchical Seating Allocation Problem (HSAP) for large organizations and proposes an end-to-end framework using probabilistic road maps and optimization.

entry.title: Enhanced QKNorm normalization for neural transformers with the Lp norm

author.name: Ezequiel Lopez-Rubio, Javier Montes-Perez, Esteban Jose Palomo
