author.name: Jind\v{r}ich Libovick\'y

entry.summary: Identifies methodological limitations in evaluating LLM value orientation via surveys, showing prompting methods and decoding strategies significantly affect results. Introduces self-correlation distance metric.

entry.title: Natural Language Instructions for Scene-Responsive Human-in-the-Loop Motion Planning in Autonomous Driving using Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Angel Martinez-Sanchez, Parthib Roy, Ross Greer

entry.summary: Adapts OpenEMMA, an open-source MLLM-based driving framework, to support instruction-conditioned trajectory planning using the doScenes dataset, enabling vehicles to follow free-form natural language commands for navigation.

entry.title: Beyond Static Cropping: Layer-Adaptive Visual Localization and Decoding Enhancement

author.name: Zipeng Zhu, Zhanghao Hu, Qinglin Zhu, Yuxi Hong, Yijun Liu, Jingyong Su, Yulan He, Lin Gui

entry.summary: Proposes dynamic layer-adaptive visual localization for Large Vision-Language Models, showing that optimal visual grounding layers vary by task rather than being fixed to a single 'magic layer'.

entry.title: Is Micro Domain-Adaptive Pre-Training Effective for Real-World Operations? Multi-Step Evaluation Reveals Potential and Bottlenecks

author.name: Masaya Tsunokake, Yuta Koreeda, Terufumi Morishita, Koichi Nagatsuka, Hikaru Tomonari, Yasuhiro Sogawa

entry.summary: Evaluates micro domain-adaptive pre-training (mDAPT) effectiveness for generative tasks by disentangling the answering process into eliciting, selecting, and utilizing subtasks.

entry.title: From Evaluation to Design: Using Potential Energy Surface Smoothness Metrics to Guide Machine Learning Interatomic Potential Architectures

author.name: Ryan Liu, Eric Qu, Tobias Kreiman, Samuel M. Blau, Aditi S. Krishnapriyan

entry.summary: Introduces Bond Smoothness Characterization Test (BSCT) to evaluate machine learning interatomic potentials via controlled bond deformations, detecting non-smoothness issues that standard evaluations miss.

entry.title: Grables: Tabular Learning Beyond Independent Rows

author.name: Tamara Cucumides, Floris Geerts

entry.summary: Introduces grables, a modular interface separating how tables are lifted to graphs from how predictions are computed. Shows that row-wise prediction provably fails on targets depending on global counts and relational patterns.

entry.title: A Probabilistic Framework for Solving High-Frequency Helmholtz Equations via Diffusion Models

author.name: Yicheng Zou, Samuel Lanthaler, Hossein Salahshoor

entry.summary: Develops score-based conditional diffusion operator for solving high-frequency Helmholtz equations, arguing probabilistic approach handles strong input-to-output sensitivity better than deterministic methods.

entry.title: Benchmarking Uncertainty Quantification of Plug-and-Play Diffusion Priors for Inverse Problems Solving

author.name: Xiaoyu Qiu, Taewon Yang, Zhanhao Liu, Guanyang Wang, Liyue Shen

entry.summary: Conducts systematic benchmarking study of uncertainty quantification in plug-and-play diffusion priors for inverse problems, addressing mismatch between point-estimate evaluations and distributional nature of methods.

entry.title: Stochastic Decision Horizons for Constrained Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Nikola Milosevic, Leonard Franz, Daniel Haeufle, Georg Martius, Nico Scherf, Pavel Kolev

entry.summary: Proposes a novel Control as Inference formulation for constrained MDPs using stochastic decision horizons, where constraint violations shorten effective planning horizons. This enables replay-compatible off-policy learning while maintaining constraint satisfaction.

entry.title: DMFlow: Disordered Materials Generation by Flow Matching

author.name: Liming Wu, Rui Jiao, Qi Li, Mingze Li, Songyou Li, Shifeng Jin, Wenbing Huang

entry.summary: DMFlow is a generative framework for disordered crystals using Riemannian flow matching with spherical reparameterization, enabling generation of substitutionally and positionally disordered materials.

entry.title: Evolving Afferent Architectures: Biologically-inspired Models for Damage-Avoidance Learning

author.name: Wolfgang Maass, Sabine Janzen, Prajvi Saxena, Sach Mukherjee

entry.summary: Introduces Afferent Learning framework producing computational afferent traces as internal risk signals for damage-avoidance learning, using two-level evolutionary-RL architecture with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Anytime-Valid Conformal Risk Control

author.name: Bror Hultberg, Dave Zachariah, Ant\^onio H. Ribeiro

entry.summary: Extends conformal risk control to remain valid with high probability over cumulatively growing calibration data at any time point, with matching lower bounds.

entry.title: Less Finetuning, Better Retrieval: Rethinking LLM Adaptation for Biomedical Retrievers via Synthetic Data and Model Merging

author.name: Sameh Khattab, Jean-Philippe Corbeil, Osman Alperen Kora\c{s}, Amin Dada, Julian Friedrich, Fran\c{c}ois Beaulieu, Paul Vozila, Jens Kleesiek

entry.summary: Introduces STM (Synthesize-Train-Merge) framework for adapting LLMs into biomedical retrievers using synthetic hard negatives and model merging. Demonstrates gains on medical retrieval benchmarks.

entry.title: Beyond Unimodal Shortcuts: MLLMs as Cross-Modal Reasoners for Grounded Named Entity Recognition

author.name: Jinlong Ma, Yu Zhang, Xuefeng Bai, Kehai Chen, Yuwei Wang, Zeming Liu, Jun Yu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Reveals modality bias in MLLMs for grounded NER where models take unimodal shortcuts rather than cross-modal verification. Proposes Modality-aware Consistency Reasoning to enforce structured cross-modal reasoning.

entry.title: OmniSIFT: Modality-Asymmetric Token Compression for Efficient Omni-modal Large Language Models

author.name: Yue Ding, Yiyan Ji, Jungang Li, Xuyang Liu, Xinlong Chen, Junfei Wu, Bozhou Li, Bohan Zeng, Yang Shi, Yushuo Guan, Yuanxing Zhang, Jiaheng Liu, Qiang Liu, Pengfei Wan, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes OmniSIFT for omni-modal LLM token compression using spatio-temporal video pruning and vision-guided audio selection, reducing computational overhead while maintaining performance.

entry.title: iSight: Towards expert-AI co-assessment for improved immunohistochemistry staining interpretation

author.name: Jacob S. Leiby, Jialu Yao, Pan Lu, George Hu, Anna Davidian, Shunsuke Koga, Olivia Leung, Pravin Patel, Isabella Tondi Resta, Rebecca Rojansky, Derek Sung, Eric Yang, Paul J. Zhang, Emma Lundberg, Dokyoon Kim, Serena Yeung-Levy, James Zou, Thomas Montine, Jeffrey Nirschl, Zhi Huang

entry.summary: Introduces HPA10M dataset (10.5M IHC images) and iSight framework for automated IHC staining assessment combining whole-slide features with tissue metadata through multi-task learning.

entry.title: JOintGS: Joint Optimization of Cameras, Bodies and 3D Gaussians for In-the-Wild Monocular Reconstruction

author.name: Zihan Lou, Jinlong Fan, Sihan Ma, Yuxiang Yang, Jing Zhang

entry.summary: JOintGS jointly optimizes camera extrinsics, human poses, and 3D Gaussian representations from monocular RGB video, enabling robust human avatar reconstruction in unconstrained settings where off-the-shelf methods provide inaccurate initialization.

entry.title: LCUDiff: Latent Capacity Upgrade Diffusion for Faithful Human Body Restoration

author.name: Jue Gong, Zihan Zhou, Jingkai Wang, Shu Li, Libo Liu, Jianliang Lan, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: LCUDiff upgrades pretrained latent diffusion models from 4 to 16-channel latent space for human body restoration using channel splitting distillation to maintain alignment with pretrained priors while adding high-frequency detail capacity.

entry.title: Understanding Degradation with Vision Language Model

author.name: Guanzhou Lan, Chenyi Liao, Yuqi Yang, Qianli Ma, Zhigang Wang, Dong Wang, Bin Zhao, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: DU-VLM redefines degradation understanding as hierarchical structured prediction, proving that degradation type, parameter keys, and continuous values can be unified under autoregressive prediction with bounded quantization error.

entry.title: Mitigating Long-Tail Bias via Prompt-Controlled Diffusion Augmentation

author.name: Buddhi Wijenayake, Nichula Wasalathilake, Roshan Godaliyadda, Vijitha Herath, Parakrama Ekanayake, Vishal M. Patel

entry.summary: Presents prompt-controlled diffusion augmentation to mitigate long-tail pixel imbalance in semantic segmentation, using discrete diffusion for layout generation and image translation with domain and class-ratio control.

entry.title: Self-evolving Embodied AI

author.name: Tongtong Feng, Xin Wang, Wenwu Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces self-evolving embodied AI paradigm where agents operate with memory self-updating, task self-switching, environment self-prediction, and embodiment self-adaptation for dynamic open environments.

entry.title: Real-time processing of analog signals on accelerated neuromorphic hardware

author.name: Yannik Stradmann, Johannes Schemmel, Mihai A. Petrovici, Laura Kriener

entry.summary: Demonstrates real-time analog signal processing on BrainScaleS-2 neuromorphic hardware with direct microphone interface, using spiking neural networks at 1000x acceleration for interaural time difference processing.

entry.title: Reshaping Action Error Distributions for Reliable Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Shuanghao Bai, Dakai Wang, Cheng Chi, Wanqi Zhou, Jing Lyu, Xiaoguang Zhao, Pengwei Wang, Zhongyuan Wang, Lei Xing, Shanghang Zhang, Badong Chen

entry.summary: Applies Minimum Error Entropy to VLA training to reshape action error distributions, proposing trajectory-level MEE objective and weighted variants for more reliable continuous action prediction.

entry.title: Viewpoint Matters: Dynamically Optimizing Viewpoints with Masked Autoencoder for Visual Manipulation

author.name: Pengfei Yi, Yifan Han, Junyan Li, Litao Liu, Wenzhao Lian

entry.summary: MAE-Select proposes active viewpoint selection for robotic manipulation using pretrained multi-view MAE representations to dynamically select most informative camera viewpoints without labeled data.

entry.title: Integrated Exploration and Sequential Manipulation on Scene Graph with LLM-based Situated Replanning

author.name: Heqing Yang, Ziyuan Jiao, Shu Wang, Yida Niu, Si Liu, Hangxin Liu

entry.summary: EPoG integrates exploration with sequential manipulation planning using scene graphs, combining graph-based global planner with LLM-based local planner for partially known environments.

entry.title: Towards X-embodiment safety: A control theory perspective on transferring safety certificates across dynamical systems

author.name: Nikolaos Bousias, George Pappas

entry.summary: Proposes transferred control barrier functions (tCBF) framework that enables safety constraints defined on one robot system to be systematically enforced on another with mismatched dynamics. Addresses the x-embodiment problem from a safety perspective.

entry.title: HybridQuestion: Human-AI Collaboration for Identifying High-Impact Research Questions

author.name: Keyu Zhao, Fengli Xu, Yong Li, Tie-Yan Liu

entry.summary: Explores human-AI hybrid approach for identifying high-impact research questions, combining LLM data processing with human expert value judgment to assess past breakthroughs and future directions.

entry.title: Transformers perform adaptive partial pooling

author.name: Vsevolod Kapatsinski

entry.summary: Demonstrates GPT-2 performs adaptive partial pooling of evidence across contexts, with pooling decreasing over training and varying by context similarity—behavior analogous to hierarchical regression.

entry.title: History-Guided Iterative Visual Reasoning with Self-Correction

author.name: Xinglong Yang, Zhilin Peng, Zhanzhan Liu, Haochen Shi, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes H-GIVR framework for multimodal LLM reasoning that reuses historical reasoning information for iterative verification and dynamic error correction, inspired by human reasoning behavior.

entry.title: Adaptive Prompt Elicitation for Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Xinyi Wen, Lena Hegemann, Xiaofu Jin, Shuai Ma, Antti Oulasvirta

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Prompt Elicitation (APE) for text-to-image generation that adaptively asks visual queries to refine user intent using information-theoretic framework.

entry.title: NeuroCanvas: VLLM-Powered Robust Seizure Detection by Reformulating Multichannel EEG as Image

author.name: Yan Chen, Jie Peng, Moajjem Hossain Chowdhury, Tianlong Chen, Yunmei Liu

entry.summary: NeuroCanvas reformulates multi-channel EEG as images for VLLM-based seizure detection, using entropy-guided channel selection to address heterogeneity while improving computational efficiency.

entry.title: Maximin Relative Improvement: Fair Learning as a Bargaining Problem

author.name: Jiwoo Han, Moulinath Banerjee, Yuekai Sun

entry.summary: Interprets group fairness as bargaining problem among subpopulations, showing relative improvement corresponds to Kalai-Smorodinsky solution with axiomatic justification including scale invariance.

entry.title: Disentangling meaning from language in LLM-based machine translation

author.name: Th\'eo Lasnier, Armel Zebaze, Djam\'e Seddah, Rachel Bawden, Beno\^it Sagot

entry.summary: Analyzes machine translation in LLMs mechanistically, finding distinct sparse sets of attention heads specialize in target language identification vs. meaning preservation.

entry.title: InterPReT: Interactive Policy Restructuring and Training Enable Effective Imitation Learning from Laypersons

author.name: Feiyu Gavin Zhu, Jean Oh, Reid Simmons

entry.summary: Introduces InterPReT for interactive imitation learning from non-experts, allowing laypersons to teach agents through instructions that update policy structure and demonstrations that optimize parameters. Validated with N=34 user study.

entry.title: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow

author.name: Jiying Zhang, Shuhao Zhang, Pierre Vandergheynst, Patrick Barth

entry.summary: Introduces GPCRLMD for efficient all-atom GPCR-ligand molecular dynamics simulation using Harmonic-Prior VAE with physics-informed constraints and Residual Latent Flow.

entry.title: DeXposure-FM: A Time-series, Graph Foundation Model for Credit Exposures and Stability on Decentralized Financial Networks

author.name: Aijie Shu, Wenbin Wu, Gbenga Ibikunle, Fengxiang He

entry.summary: Introduces DeXposure-FM, first time-series graph foundation model for DeFi credit exposure measurement using graph-tabular encoder with pre-trained weights and task-specific heads.

entry.title: Enforcing Monotonic Progress in Legal Cross-Examination: Preventing Long-Horizon Stagnation in LLM-Based Inquiry

author.name: Hsien-Jyh Liao

entry.summary: Proposes Soft-FSM, a neuro-symbolic architecture that enforces monotonic procedural progress in legal cross-examination tasks by using an external state controller. Achieves 97% completeness vs 40% for baselines on Taiwanese criminal cases.

entry.title: Enabling Real-Time Colonoscopic Polyp Segmentation on Commodity CPUs via Ultra-Lightweight Architecture

author.name: Weihao Gao, Zhuo Deng, Zheng Gong, Lan Ma

entry.summary: Introduces UltraSeg, ultra-lightweight (<0.3M params) polyp segmentation models achieving 90 FPS on commodity CPUs, enabling real-time colonoscopy in resource-limited settings.

entry.title: DRMOT: A Dataset and Framework for RGBD Referring Multi-Object Tracking

author.name: Sijia Chen, Lijuan Ma, Yanqiu Yu, En Yu, Liman Liu, Wenbing Tao

entry.summary: Proposes DRMOT, a novel task combining RGB, Depth, and Language modalities for referring multi-object tracking with explicit 3D spatial reasoning.

entry.title: REDistill: Robust Estimator Distillation for Balancing Robustness and Efficiency

author.name: Ondrej Tybl, Lukas Neumann

entry.summary: REDistill replaces standard KL-based knowledge distillation with power divergence loss to adaptively downweight unreliable teacher predictions. Provides principled robustness grounded in robust statistics.

entry.title: A Multi-Modal Foundational Model for Wireless Communication and Sensing

author.name: Vahid Yazdnian, Yasaman Ghasempour

entry.summary: Introduces task-agnostic multi-modal foundational model for physical-layer wireless systems using physics-guided self-supervised pretraining for cross-modal representation learning.

entry.title: ECG-R1: Protocol-Guided and Modality-Agnostic MLLM for Reliable ECG Interpretation

author.name: Jiarui Jin, Haoyu Wang, Xingliang Wu, Xiaocheng Fang, Xiang Lan, Zihan Wang, Deyun Zhang, Bo Liu, Yingying Zhang, Xian Wu, Hongyan Li, Shenda Hong

entry.summary: Introduces ECG-R1, first reasoning MLLM for ECG interpretation using protocol-guided instruction generation grounded in measurable features and clinical thresholds, with modality dropout for robustness.

entry.title: LiteToken: Removing Intermediate Merge Residues From BPE Tokenizers

author.name: Yike Sun, Haotong Yang, Zhouchen Lin, Muhan Zhang

entry.summary: Identifies 'intermediate merge residues' in BPE vocabularies - tokens retained but rarely emitted - and proposes LiteToken to remove these, improving efficiency and robustness to adversarial inputs.

entry.title: VideoBrain: Learning Adaptive Frame Sampling for Long Video Understanding

author.name: Junbo Zou, Ziheng Huang, Shengjie Zhang, Liwen Zhang, Weining Shen

entry.summary: Proposes VideoBrain for adaptive frame sampling in long video understanding with dual CLIP-based semantic retrieval and uniform temporal sampling agents.

entry.title: Adaptive Test-Time Compute Allocation via Learned Heuristics over Categorical Structure

author.name: Shuhui Qu

entry.summary: Studies verification-cost-limited reasoning by proposing state-level selective verification that combines feasibility gating, learned state-distance ranking, and adaptive verifier allocation to reduce redundant calls.

entry.title: From Assumptions to Actions: Turning LLM Reasoning into Uncertainty-Aware Planning for Embodied Agents

author.name: SeungWon Seo, SooBin Lim, SeongRae Noh, Haneul Kim, HyeongYeop Kang

entry.summary: Introduces PCE framework converting implicit LLM reasoning assumptions into structured decision trees for uncertainty-aware planning in multi-agent, partially observable environments without excessive communication.

entry.title: Structural shifts in institutional participation and collaboration within the AI arXiv preprint research ecosystem

author.name: Shama Magnur, Mayank Kejriwal

entry.summary: Analyzes structural shifts in AI arXiv preprint ecosystem 2021-2025, using LLM-based institution classification to examine publication volumes, team sizes, and academic-industry collaboration patterns.

entry.title: MA3DSG: Multi-Agent 3D Scene Graph Generation for Large-Scale Indoor Environments

author.name: Yirum Kim, Jaewoo Kim, Ue-Hwan Kim

entry.summary: Introduces MA3DSG, first multi-agent framework for 3D scene graph generation with training-free graph alignment algorithm merging partial graphs from individual agents.

entry.title: Topology-Aware Revival for Efficient Sparse Training

author.name: Meiling Jin, Fei Wang, Xiaoyun Yuan, Chen Qian, Yuan Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces Topology-Aware Revival (TAR), a lightweight post-pruning procedure that improves static sparse neural networks by selectively reactivating pruned connections based on topology needs. Particularly relevant for deep reinforcement learning where evolving policies shift training distributions.

entry.title: Fine-tuning Pre-trained Vision-Language Models in a Human-Annotation-Free Manner

author.name: Qian-Wei Wang, Guanghao Meng, Ren Cai, Yaguang Song, Shu-Tao Xia

entry.summary: Introduces CoFT (Collaborative Fine-Tuning) for unsupervised adaptation of VLMs like CLIP using dual positive/negative prompts and cross-modal collaboration without labeled data.

entry.title: BrainVista: Modeling Naturalistic Brain Dynamics as Multimodal Next-Token Prediction

author.name: Xuanhua Yin, Runkai Zhao, Lina Yao, Weidong Cai

entry.summary: Introduces BrainVista for modeling naturalistic brain dynamics as multimodal next-token prediction, with Network-wise Tokenizers and Spatial Mixer Head for inter-network information flow.

entry.title: Active Asymmetric Multi-Agent Multimodal Learning under Uncertainty

author.name: Rui Liu, Pratap Tokekar, Ming Lin

entry.summary: Proposes A2MAML for uncertainty-aware, modality-level collaboration in multi-agent systems with heterogeneous sensors. Uses Bayesian inverse-variance weighting to aggregate information from reliable agent-modality pairs.

entry.title: Safe Urban Traffic Control via Uncertainty-Aware Conformal Prediction and World-Model Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Joydeep Chandra, Satyam Kumar Navneet, Aleksandr Algazinov, Yong Zhang

entry.summary: Presents STREAM-RL framework combining uncertainty-guided forecasting, anomaly detection with FDR control, and safe world-model RL for urban traffic management with distribution-free coverage guarantees.

entry.title: NeuroPareto: Calibrated Acquisition for Costly Many-Goal Search in Vast Parameter Spaces

author.name: Rong Fu, Wenxin Zhang, Chunlei Meng, Youjin Wang, Haoyu Zhao, Jiaxuan Lu, Kun Liu, JiaBao Dou, Simon James Fong

entry.summary: Proposes NeuroPareto for many-objective Bayesian optimization using rank-centric filtering, uncertainty disentanglement, and history-conditioned acquisition for expensive black-box optimization.

entry.title: Representation Geometry as a Diagnostic for Out-of-Distribution Robustness

author.name: Ali Zia, Farid Hazratian

entry.summary: Proposes geometry-based diagnostic framework using class-conditional k-nearest-neighbor graphs to extract spectral complexity proxies as post-hoc signals of out-of-distribution robustness.

entry.title: Rate-Optimal Noise Annealing in Semi-Dual Neural Optimal Transport: Tangential Identifiability, Off-Manifold Ambiguity, and Guaranteed Recovery

author.name: Raymond Chu, Jaewoong Choi, Dohyun Kwon

entry.summary: Characterizes spurious solutions in semi-dual neural optimal transport when data lies on low-dimensional manifolds. Proves map recovery guarantees with optimal statistical rate depending on intrinsic dimension.

entry.title: Generative Neural Operators through Diffusion Last Layer

author.name: Sungwon Park, Anthony Zhou, Hongjoong Kim, Amir Barati Farimani

entry.summary: Introduces Diffusion Last Layer, a lightweight probabilistic head attachable to neural operator backbones for uncertainty quantification using low-rank Karhunen-Loève expansion.

entry.title: LORE: Jointly Learning the Intrinsic Dimensionality and Relative Similarity Structure From Ordinal Data

author.name: Vivek Anand, Alec Helbling, Mark Davenport, Gordon Berman, Sankar Alagapan, Christopher Rozell

entry.summary: Introduces LORE for jointly learning intrinsic dimensionality and ordinal embedding from triplet comparisons using Schatten-p quasi norm regularization with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Multi-scale hypergraph meets LLMs: Aligning large language models for time series analysis

author.name: Zongjiang Shang, Dongliang Cui, Binqing Wu, Ling Chen

entry.summary: Proposes MSH-LLM using multi-scale hypergraph to enhance modality alignment between natural language and time series for LLM-based time series analysis.

entry.title: Greedy-Gnorm: A Gradient Matrix Norm-Based Alternative to Attention Entropy for Head Pruning

author.name: Yuxi Guo, Paul Sheridan

entry.summary: Proposes Greedy-Gnorm for dynamic attention head pruning using gradient l2-norms of Q/K/V blocks recalculated after each pruning step.

entry.title: RIGA-Fold: A General Framework for Protein Inverse Folding via Recurrent Interaction and Geometric Awareness

author.name: Sisi Yuan, Jiehuang Chen, Junchuang Cai, Dong Xu, Xueliang Li, Zexuan Zhu, Junkai Ji

entry.summary: RIGA-Fold introduces a framework for protein inverse folding that combines recurrent interaction with geometric awareness, addressing GNN limitations of restricted receptive fields and error accumulation.

entry.title: Rationality Measurement and Theory for Reinforcement Learning Agents

author.name: Kejiang Qian, Amos Storkey, Fengxiang He

entry.summary: Proposes formal measures of rationality for RL agents, decomposing rational risk gap into extrinsic (environment shift) and intrinsic (algorithm generalizability) components.

entry.title: Functional Stochastic Localization

author.name: Anming Gu, Bobby Shi, Kevin Tian

entry.summary: Develops functional generalization of Eldan's stochastic localization replacing Gaussian regularization with log-Laplace transforms, with application to differentially private convex optimization.

entry.title: Aortic Valve Disease Detection from PPG via Physiology-Informed Self-Supervised Learning

author.name: Jiaze Wang, Qinghao Zhao, Zizheng Chen, Zhejun Sun, Deyun Zhang, Yuxi Zhou, Shenda Hong

entry.summary: Proposes Physiology-Guided Self-Supervised Learning for aortic valve disease detection from PPG using 170K+ unlabeled samples, achieving efficient screening for aortic stenosis and regurgitation.

entry.title: Abstraction Induces the Brain Alignment of Language and Speech Models

author.name: Emily Cheng, Aditya R. Vaidya, Richard Antonello

entry.summary: Provides evidence that brain alignment of language and speech models stems from shared meaning abstraction in intermediate layers, not next-word prediction. Links intrinsic dimensionality peaks to brain prediction performance.

entry.title: Swordsman: Entropy-Driven Adaptive Block Partition for Efficient Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Yu Zhang, Xinchen Li, Jialei Zhou, Hongnan Ma, Zhongwei Wan, Yiwei Shi, Duoqian Miao, Qi Zhang, Longbing Cao

entry.summary: Proposes Swordsman, entropy-driven adaptive block partitioning for diffusion language models that identifies semantic constituent boundaries for more natural decoding.

entry.title: BASS: Benchmarking Audio LMs for Musical Structure and Semantic Reasoning

author.name: Min Jang, Orevaoghene Ahia, Nazif Tamer, Sachin Kumar, Yulia Tsvetkov, Noah A. Smith

entry.summary: Introduces BASS benchmark for music understanding in audio LMs with 2658 questions across 12 tasks spanning structural, lyrical, musicological, and collaborative analysis over 138 hours of music.

entry.title: Continuous Degradation Modeling via Latent Flow Matching for Real-World Super-Resolution

author.name: Hyeonjae Kim, Dongjin Kim, Eugene Jin, Tae Hyun Kim

entry.summary: Proposes a flow matching approach to synthesize realistic low-resolution images from high-resolution inputs by learning continuous degradation in latent space. Addresses the gap between synthetic training degradations and real-world image corruption patterns.

entry.title: Light Up Your Face: A Physically Consistent Dataset and Diffusion Model for Face Fill-Light Enhancement

author.name: Jue Gong, Zihan Zhou, Jingkai Wang, Xiaohong Liu, Yulun Zhang, Xiaokang Yang

entry.summary: Introduces LightYourFace-160K dataset and method for face fill-light enhancement with physically consistent rendering using 6 disentangled lighting parameters. Uses physics-aware lighting prompts and a diffusion-based approach.

entry.title: Temporal Slowness in Central Vision Drives Semantic Object Learning

author.name: Timothy Schauml\"offel, Arthur Aubret, Gemma Roig, Jochen Triesch

entry.summary: Studies how human central vision and temporal slowness principles contribute to semantic object representation learning, using simulated egocentric visual experience from Ego4D with gaze-predicted crops.

entry.title: PEPR: Privileged Event-based Predictive Regularization for Domain Generalization

author.name: Gabriele Magrini, Federico Becattini, Niccol\`o Biondi, Pietro Pala

entry.summary: PEPR uses event cameras as privileged information during training to improve domain generalization of RGB-only models, leveraging the domain-invariant nature of event streams through predictive regularization.

entry.title: DINO-AD: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection with Frozen DINO-V3 Features

author.name: Jiayu Huo, Jingyuan Hong, Liyun Chen

entry.summary: DINO-AD proposes anomaly detection using frozen DINO-V3 features with embedding similarity matching for support image selection and foreground-aware K-means for normal feature modeling.

entry.title: AtlasPatch: An Efficient and Scalable Tool for Whole Slide Image Preprocessing in Computational Pathology

author.name: Ahmed Alagha, Christopher Leclerc, Yousef Kotp, Omar Metwally, Calvin Moras, Peter Rentopoulos, Ghodsiyeh Rostami, Bich Ngoc Nguyen, Jumanah Baig, Abdelhakim Khellaf, Vincent Quoc-Huy Trinh, Rabeb Mizouni, Hadi Otrok, Jamal Bentahar, Mahdi S. Hosseini

entry.summary: AtlasPatch provides efficient WSI preprocessing framework with AI-based tissue detection trained on 30,000 diverse slides and high-throughput patch extraction for computational pathology workflows.

entry.title: PDF-HR: Pose Distance Fields for Humanoid Robots

author.name: Yi Gu, Yukang Gao, Yangchen Zhou, Xingyu Chen, Yixiao Feng, Mingle Zhao, Yunyang Mo, Zhaorui Wang, Lixin Xu, Renjing Xu

entry.summary: PDF-HR introduces pose distance fields for humanoid robots as lightweight pose priors, predicting distance of arbitrary poses to distribution of retargeted robot poses for use in optimization and control.

entry.title: Evolutionary Mapping of Neural Networks to Spatial Accelerators

author.name: Alessandro Pierro, Jonathan Timcheck, Jason Yik, Marius Lindauer, Eyke H\"ullermeier, Marcel Wever

entry.summary: Introduces evolutionary hardware-in-the-loop framework for mapping neural networks to neuromorphic spatial accelerators like Intel Loihi 2, automating expert-driven mapping as black-box optimization.

entry.title: How Users Understand Robot Foundation Model Performance through Task Success Rates and Beyond

author.name: Isaac Sheidlower, Jindan Huang, James Staley, Bingyu Wu, Qicong Chen, Reuben Aronson, Elaine Short

entry.summary: Studies how non-roboticists interpret robot foundation model performance metrics, finding that task success rates alone may not convey capability understanding, suggesting need for better performance communication.

entry.title: GeoLanG: Geometry-Aware Language-Guided Grasping with Unified RGB-D Multimodal Learning

author.name: Rui Tang, Guankun Wang, Long Bai, Huxin Gao, Jiewen Lai, Chi Kit Ng, Jiazheng Wang, Fan Zhang, Hongliang Ren

entry.summary: GeoLanG proposes end-to-end multi-task framework for language-guided grasping built on CLIP, unifying visual and linguistic inputs with depth-guided semantic enhancement for cluttered/occluded scenes.

entry.title: Safe and Stylized Trajectory Planning for Autonomous Driving via Diffusion Model

author.name: Shuo Pei, Yong Wang, Yuanchen Zhu, Chen Sun, Qin Li, Yanan Zhao, Huachun Tan

entry.summary: SDD Planner proposes diffusion-based trajectory planning reconciling safety constraints with driving styles using multi-source style-aware encoding and style-guided dynamic trajectory generation.

entry.title: Act, Sense, Act: Learning Non-Markovian Active Perception Strategies from Large-Scale Egocentric Human Data

author.name: Jialiang Li, Yi Qiao, Yunhan Guo, Changwen Chen, Wenzhao Lian

entry.summary: Introduces CoMe-VLA, a cognitive and memory-aware vision-language-action framework that learns active perception from large-scale human egocentric data. Formalizes active perception as a non-Markovian process driven by information gain.

entry.title: Ralph-wiggum is Bad and Anthropic Should Fix It

author.name: d4hines

entry.summary: Criticizes Anthropic's ralph-wiggum plugin for language that Claude Opus 4.5 itself identifies as concerning for model welfare - specifically the instruction to never exit loops even when believing tasks are impossible.

entry.title: Axiomatic Foundations of Counterfactual Explanations

author.name: Leila Amgoud, Martin Cooper

entry.summary: Develops an axiomatic framework for counterfactual explainability with formal properties, extending beyond local explanations to global counterfactuals that reveal system-level reasoning patterns.

entry.title: Fixed Budget is No Harder Than Fixed Confidence in Best-Arm Identification up to Logarithmic Factors

author.name: Kapilan Balagopalan, Yinan Li, Yao Zhao, Tuan Nguyen, Anton Daitche, Houssam Nassif, Kwang-Sung Jun

entry.summary: Shows fixed-budget BAI is no harder than fixed-confidence up to log factors, proposing FC2FB meta-algorithm that converts any fixed-confidence algorithm to fixed-budget setting.

entry.title: KGLAMP: Knowledge Graph-guided Language model for Adaptive Multi-robot Planning and Replanning

author.name: Chak Lam Shek, Faizan M. Tariq, Sangjae Bae, David Isele, Piyush Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces KGLAMP, knowledge graph-guided LLM framework for heterogeneous multi-robot planning, maintaining structured KG of object relations and robot capabilities to generate accurate PDDL specifications.

entry.title: AppleVLM: End-to-end Autonomous Driving with Advanced Perception and Planning-Enhanced Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yuxuan Han, Kunyuan Wu, Qianyi Shao, Renxiang Xiao, Zilu Wang, Cansen Jiang, Yi Xiao, Liang Hu, Yunjiang Lou

entry.summary: Proposes AppleVLM for end-to-end autonomous driving, introducing a novel vision encoder and planning strategy encoder to address lane perception issues, language understanding biases, and corner cases in VLM-based driving.

entry.title: Growth First, Care Second? Tracing the Landscape of LLM Value Preferences in Everyday Dilemmas

author.name: Zhiyi Chen, Eun Cheol Choi, Yingjia Luo, Xinyi Wang, Yulei Xiao, Aizi Yang, Luca Luceri

entry.summary: Characterizes how LLMs navigate value trade-offs in advice-seeking contexts using data from Reddit subreddits. Constructs hierarchical value framework and value co-occurrence networks.

entry.title: Generalized Schr\"odinger Bridge on Graphs

author.name: Panagiotis Theodoropoulos, Juno Nam, Evangelos Theodorou, Jaemoo Choi

entry.summary: Introduces Generalized Schrödinger Bridge on Graphs for learning executable policies on arbitrary graphs under continuous-time Markov chain dynamics. Scales better than existing graph-transport methods.

entry.title: PENGUIN: General Vital Sign Reconstruction from PPG with Flow Matching State Space Model

author.name: Shuntaro Suzuki, Shuitsu Koyama, Shinnosuke Hirano, Shunya Nagashima

entry.summary: PENGUIN proposes generative flow-matching framework extending deep state space models for PPG vital sign reconstruction, enabling unified approach across diverse decoding scenarios.

entry.title: Attack-Resistant Uniform Fairness for Linear and Smooth Contextual Bandits

author.name: Qingwen Zhang, Wenjia Wang

entry.summary: Studies contextual bandits under uniform fairness constraint with resistance to strategic manipulation, achieving minimax-optimal regret for linear and smooth reward functions.

entry.title: HoRD: Robust Humanoid Control via History-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning and Online Distillation

author.name: Puyue Wang, Jiawei Hu, Yan Gao, Junyan Wang, Yu Zhang, Gillian Dobbie, Tao Gu, Wafa Johal, Ting Dang, Hong Jia

entry.summary: HoRD combines history-conditioned RL with online distillation for robust humanoid control under domain shift, transferring to transformer student operating on sparse keypoint trajectories.

entry.title: Evaluating the Presence of Sex Bias in Clinical Reasoning by Large Language Models

author.name: Isabel Tsintsiper, Sheng Wong, Beth Albert, Shaun P Brennecke, Gabriel Davis Jones

entry.summary: Systematically examines sex-specific biases in clinical reasoning across 4 LLMs using 50 clinician-authored vignettes where sex was non-informative, evaluating how model configuration influences bias.

entry.title: Textual Planning with Explicit Latent Transitions

author.name: Eliezer Shlomi, Ido Levy, Eilam Shapira, Michael Katz, Guy Uziel, Segev Shlomov, Nir Mashkif, Roi Reichart, Sarah Keren

entry.summary: Proposes EmbedPlan for LLM planning using lightweight transition models in embedding space with nearest-neighbor retrieval, avoiding autoregressive generation overhead.

entry.title: Entropy Reveals Block Importance in Masked Self-Supervised Vision Transformers

author.name: Peihao Xiang, Kaida Wu, Ou Bai

entry.summary: Shows information entropy of pretrained block weights in masked ViTs correlates with oracle sensitivity, enabling data-free, one-shot block pruning without finetuning.

entry.title: Partial Ring Scan: Revisiting Scan Order in Vision State Space Models

author.name: Yi-Kuan Hsieh, Jun-Wei Hsieh, Xin li, Ming-Ching Chang, Yu-Chee Tseng

entry.summary: Proposes PRISMamba with rotation-robust ring scan for Vision SSMs that partitions images into concentric rings with order-agnostic aggregation, improving robustness to geometric transformations.

entry.title: DiGAN: Diffusion-Guided Attention Network for Early Alzheimer's Disease Detection

author.name: Maxx Richard Rahman, Mostafa Hammouda, Wolfgang Maass

entry.summary: Proposes DiGAN combining latent diffusion modeling with attention-guided convnet for early Alzheimer's detection, synthesizing longitudinal imaging trajectories from limited data.

entry.title: VecSet-Edit: Unleashing Pre-trained LRM for Mesh Editing from Single Image

author.name: Teng-Fang Hsiao, Bo-Kai Ruan, Yu-Lun Liu, Hong-Han Shuai

entry.summary: Proposes VecSet-Edit, the first pipeline leveraging VecSet Large Reconstruction Models for direct 3D mesh editing from single images, discovering that token subsets govern distinct geometric regions.

entry.title: Towards Structured, State-Aware, and Execution-Grounded Reasoning for Software Engineering Agents

author.name: Tse-Hsun (Peter), Chen

entry.summary: Position paper arguing SE agents need to move beyond reactive behavior toward structured, state-aware reasoning with explicit memory and execution feedback integration.

entry.title: Bounded-Abstention Multi-horizon Time-series Forecasting

author.name: Luca Stradiotti, Laurens Devos, Anna Monreale, Jesse Davis, Andrea Pugnana

entry.summary: Formalizes bounded-abstention for multi-horizon time-series forecasting, allowing models to selectively abstain from predictions when facing elevated misprediction risk across correlated forecast horizons.

entry.title: Piece of CAKE: Adaptive Execution Engines via Microsecond-Scale Learning

author.name: Zijie Zhao, Ryan Marcus

entry.summary: CAKE proposes microsecond-scale contextual multi-armed bandit for adaptive database kernel selection, exploiting cheapness of counterfactuals to learn optimal kernel per data morsel.

entry.title: Targeted Synthetic Control Method

author.name: Yuxin Wang, Dennis Frauen, Emil Javurek, Konstantin Hess, Yuchen Ma, Stefan Feuerriegel

entry.summary: Introduces Targeted Synthetic Control estimating counterfactual outcomes through two-stage process yielding debiased convex combination weights with interpretable synthetic controls.

entry.title: LEAD: Layer-wise Expert-aligned Decoding for Faithful Radiology Report Generation

author.name: Ruixiao Yang, Yuanhe Tian, Xu Yang, Huiqi Li, Yan Song

entry.summary: Proposes LEAD for radiology report generation using layer-wise expert-aligned decoding to modify LVLM trajectories, addressing hallucination through inherent decoding modification rather than external guidance.

entry.title: "Be My Cheese?": Cultural Nuance Benchmarking for Machine Translation in Multilingual LLMs

author.name: Madison Van Doren, Casey Ford, Jennifer Barajas, Cory Holland

entry.summary: Presents large-scale human evaluation benchmark for cultural localization in MT from multilingual LLMs across 15 languages with native speaker ratings on idioms, puns, and culturally embedded concepts.

entry.title: A Black Box Made Less Opaque (part 2)

author.name: Matthew McDonnell

entry.summary: Uses sparse autoencoders on GPT-2 Small to analyze whether SAE features respond more to syntax or semantics. Finds specialist features react primarily to syntax, with minimal overlap between syntactically different but semantically identical texts.

entry.title: Knowledge Model Prompting Increases LLM Performance on Planning Tasks

author.name: Erik Goh, John Kos, Ashok Goel

entry.summary: Applies the Task-Method-Knowledge (TMK) framework from cognitive science to improve LLM planning and reasoning capabilities. The approach captures causal, teleological, and hierarchical reasoning structures with explicit task decomposition.

entry.title: OMG-Agent: Toward Robust Missing Modality Generation with Decoupled Coarse-to-Fine Agentic Workflows

author.name: Ruiting Dai, Zheyu Wang, Haoyu Yang, Yihan Liu, Chengzhi Wang, Zekun Zhang, Zishan Huang, Jiaman Cen, Lisi Mo

entry.summary: Proposes OMG-Agent for missing modality generation using a coarse-to-fine agentic workflow that decouples semantic reasoning from signal synthesis to address hallucination and retrieval rigidity issues.

entry.title: Agentic AI in Healthcare & Medicine: A Seven-Dimensional Taxonomy for Empirical Evaluation of LLM-based Agents

author.name: Shubham Vatsal, Harsh Dubey, Aditi Singh

entry.summary: Reviews 49 studies on LLM-based healthcare agents using a seven-dimensional taxonomy covering cognitive capabilities, knowledge management, safety/ethics, and 29 operational sub-dimensions.

entry.title: Rational ANOVA Networks

author.name: Jusheng Zhang, Ningyuan Liu, Qinhan Lyu, Jing Yang, Keze Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Rational-ANOVA Network (RAN) using functional ANOVA decomposition with stable Padé-style rational units, modeling main effects and sparse pairwise interactions.

entry.title: Improving 2D Diffusion Models for 3D Medical Imaging with Inter-Slice Consistent Stochasticity

author.name: Chenhe Du, Qing Wu, Xuanyu Tian, Jingyi Yu, Hongjiang Wei, Yuyao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a method to address inter-slice discontinuities in 3D medical imaging when using 2D diffusion models by introducing inter-slice consistent stochasticity. This enables better 3D volume reconstruction without the computational burden of training full 3D models.

entry.title: Explicit Uncertainty Modeling for Active CLIP Adaptation with Dual Prompt Tuning

author.name: Qian-Wei Wang, Yaguang Song, Shu-Tao Xia

entry.summary: Proposes dual-prompt tuning framework for active learning with CLIP, using positive and negative prompts to explicitly model uncertainty for sample selection.

entry.title: SPEAR: An Engineering Case Study of Multi-Agent Coordination for Smart Contract Auditing

author.name: Arnab Mallick, Indraveni Chebolu, Harmesh Rana

entry.summary: Presents SPEAR, a multi-agent coordination framework for smart contract auditing using established MAS patterns including Contract Net protocol and AGM-compliant belief revision.

entry.title: Team, Then Trim: An Assembly-Line LLM Framework for High-Quality Tabular Data Generation

author.name: Congjing Zhang, Ryan Feng Lin, Ruoxuan Bao, Shuai Huang

entry.summary: Introduces Team-then-Trim (T²) framework using collaborative LLM teams for tabular data synthesis followed by three-stage quality control pipeline addressing class imbalance, selection bias, and low fidelity.

entry.title: Causal Discovery for Cross-Sectional Data Based on Super-Structure and Divide-and-Conquer

author.name: Wenyu Wang (University of South China), Yaping Wan (University of South China)

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight causal discovery framework using weakly constrained Super-Structures with efficient graph partitioning to reduce conditional independence test overhead.

entry.title: Partition Trees: Conditional Density Estimation over General Outcome Spaces

author.name: Felipe Angelim, Alessandro Leite

entry.summary: Proposes Partition Trees for conditional density estimation over general outcome spaces supporting both continuous and categorical variables, learned by directly minimizing negative log-likelihood.

entry.title: Agentic AI-Empowered Dynamic Survey Framework

author.name: Furkan Mumcu, Lokman Bekit, Michael J. Jones, Anoop Cherian, Yasin Yilmaz

entry.summary: Proposes agentic Dynamic Survey Framework treating surveys as living documents requiring continuous maintenance, using LLM agents for incremental integration of new work.

entry.title: Turning mechanistic models into forecasters by using machine learning

author.name: Amit K. Chakraborty, Hao Wang, Pouria Ramazi

entry.summary: Proposes framework combining mechanistic models with ML by learning time-varying parameters from data and predicting their future evolution for forecasting.

entry.title: From Sparse Sensors to Continuous Fields: STRIDE for Spatiotemporal Reconstruction

author.name: Yanjie Tong, Peng Chen

entry.summary: Proposes STRIDE for reconstructing spatiotemporal fields from sparse sensors using two-stage framework with temporal encoder and modulated implicit neural representation decoder.

entry.title: From Ambiguity to Action: A POMDP Perspective on Partial Multi-Label Ambiguity and Its Horizon-One Resolution

author.name: Hanlin Pan, Yuhao Tang, Wanfu Gao

entry.summary: Models partial multi-label learning as POMDP to jointly handle disambiguation and feature selection via reinforcement learning with interpretable global feature ranking.

entry.title: On the use of LLMs to generate a dataset of Neural Networks

author.name: Nadia Daoudi, Jordi Cabot

entry.summary: Leverages LLMs to automatically generate diverse neural network code datasets for evaluating verification, refactoring, and migration tools.

entry.title: Probabilistic Label Spreading: Efficient and Consistent Estimation of Soft Labels with Epistemic Uncertainty on Graphs

author.name: Jonathan Klees, Tobias Riedlinger, Peter Stehr, Bennet B\"oddecker, Daniel Kondermann, Matthias Rottmann

entry.summary: Introduces probabilistic label spreading method providing reliable estimates of aleatoric and epistemic uncertainty of labels through graph-based diffusion with consistency proofs.

entry.title: Jacobian Regularization Stabilizes Long-Term Integration of Neural Differential Equations

author.name: Maya Janvier, Julien Salomon, Etienne Meunier

entry.summary: Demonstrates that regularizing the Jacobian of Neural Differential Equations via directional derivatives stabilizes long-term integration, even with short training rollouts. Addresses a key challenge in hybrid physics-ML modeling.

entry.title: Improved Dimension Dependence for Bandit Convex Optimization with Gradient Variations

author.name: Hang Yu, Yu-Hu Yan, Peng Zhao

entry.summary: Improves dimension dependence bounds for bandit convex optimization with gradient variations through refined analysis of non-consecutive gradient variation.

entry.title: Online unsupervised Hebbian learning in deep photonic neuromorphic networks

author.name: Xi Li, Disha Biswas, Peng Zhou, Wesley H. Brigner, Anna Capuano, Joseph S. Friedman, Qing Gu

entry.summary: Demonstrates online unsupervised Hebbian learning in deep photonic neuromorphic networks, moving beyond supervised learning limitations in optical neural network implementations.

entry.title: Efficient Subgroup Analysis via Optimal Trees with Global Parameter Fusion

author.name: Zhongming Xie, Joseph Giorgio, Jingshen Wang

entry.summary: Proposes fused optimal causal tree for subgroup analysis that addresses greedy partitioning and overfitting limitations of traditional recursive partitioning methods.

entry.title: SPOT-Occ: Sparse Prototype-guided Transformer for Camera-based 3D Occupancy Prediction

author.name: Suzeyu Chen, Leheng Li, Ying-Cong Chen

entry.summary: SPOT-Occ introduces prototype-guided sparse transformer decoder for camera-based 3D occupancy prediction, achieving efficient aggregation from sparse voxel features without dense attention.

entry.title: Geometry-Aware Optimal Transport: Fast Intrinsic Dimension and Wasserstein Distance Estimation

author.name: Ferdinand Genans (SU, LPSM), Olivier Wintenberger (SU, LPSM)

entry.summary: Introduces tuning-free estimator for optimal transport sampling error and intrinsic dimension using semi-dual OT functional, requiring no OT solver.

entry.title: Beyond Learning on Molecules by Weakly Supervising on Molecules

author.name: Gordan Prastalo, Kevin Maik Jablonka

entry.summary: Introduces ACE-Mol, a molecular encoder that uses weak supervision from programmatically derived molecular motifs paired with natural language descriptors, avoiding expensive labeled data. Achieves state-of-the-art on molecular property prediction by enabling task-conditioned representations.

entry.title: Can Vision Replace Text in Working Memory? Evidence from Spatial n-Back in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Sichu Liang, Hongyu Zhu, Wenwen Wang, Deyu Zhou

entry.summary: Evaluates working memory in VLMs using spatial n-back tasks, finding text input significantly outperforms visual input and models struggle with visual working memory operations.

entry.title: Seeing Through Clutter: Structured 3D Scene Reconstruction via Iterative Object Removal

author.name: Rio Aguina-Kang, Kevin James Blackburn-Matzen, Thibault Groueix, Vladimir Kim, Matheus Gadelha

entry.summary: Proposes SeeingThroughClutter for structured 3D reconstruction via iterative object removal using VLMs as orchestrators, improving segmentation in cluttered scenes.

entry.title: Depth-Guided Metric-Aware Temporal Consistency for Monocular Video Human Mesh Recovery

author.name: Jiaxin Cen, Xudong Mao, Guanghui Yue, Wei Zhou, Ruomei Wang, Fan Zhou, Baoquan Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes a depth-guided framework for human mesh recovery from monocular video, addressing metric consistency and temporal stability through depth-aware fusion, calibrated pose estimation, and differentiable temporal rendering.

entry.title: Multiview Self-Representation Learning across Heterogeneous Views

author.name: Jie Chen, Zhu Wang, Chuanbin Liu, Xi Peng

entry.summary: MSRL proposes learning invariant representations from heterogeneous pretrained model features through multiview self-representation, addressing the challenge of different feature distributions from different model architectures.

entry.title: SALAD-Pan: Sensor-Agnostic Latent Adaptive Diffusion for Pan-Sharpening

author.name: Junjie Li, Congyang Ou, Haokui Zhang, Guoting Wei, Shengqin Jiang, Ying Li, Chunhua Shen

entry.summary: SALAD-Pan presents a sensor-agnostic latent space diffusion method for pan-sharpening that trains a band-wise VAE to handle multispectral images with varying channel counts across different sensors.

entry.title: Annotation Free Spacecraft Detection and Segmentation using Vision Language Models

author.name: Samet Hicsonmez, Jose Sosa, Dan Pineau, Inder Pal Singh, Arunkumar Rathinam, Abd El Rahman Shabayek, Djamila Aouada

entry.summary: Demonstrates annotation-free spacecraft detection and segmentation using VLMs to generate pseudo-labels for space domain where manual annotation is particularly challenging due to visibility and illumination issues.

entry.title: Quantile Transfer for Reliable Operating Point Selection in Visual Place Recognition

author.name: Dhyey Manish Rajani, Michael Milford, Tobias Fischer

entry.summary: Proposes quantile transfer method for automatic operating point selection in visual place recognition, using calibration traversal to transfer thresholds via quantile normalization of similarity distributions.

entry.title: An Anatomy-specific Guidewire Shaping Robot for Improved Vascular Navigation

author.name: Aabha Tamhankar, Jay Patil, Giovanni Pittiglio

entry.summary: Presents guidewire shaping robot for neuroendovascular surgery that produces anatomy-specific wire configurations, with model mapping desired shapes to robot commands for standardized autonomous shaping.

entry.title: GenMRP: A Generative Multi-Route Planning Framework for Efficient and Personalized Real-Time Industrial Navigation

author.name: Chengzhang Wang, Chao Chen, Jun Tao, Tengfei Liu, He Bai, Song Wang, Longfei Xu, Kaikui Liu, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: GenMRP proposes generative framework for industrial multi-route planning using skeleton-to-capillary approach for efficient generation while maintaining real-time performance at scale.

entry.title: Gust Estimation and Rejection with a Disturbance Observer for Proprioceptive Underwater Soft Morphing Wings

author.name: Tobias Cook, Leo Micklem, Huazhi Dong, Yunjie Yang, Michael Mistry, Francesco Giorgio Serchi

entry.summary: Proposes disturbance rejection for underwater soft morphing wings using proprioceptive sensing, inferring gusts from wing camber changes to improve stability in turbulent conditions.

entry.title: Capturing Visual Environment Structure Correlates with Control Performance

author.name: Jiahua Dong, Yunze Man, Pavel Tokmakov, Yu-Xiong Wang

entry.summary: Shows that measuring how well visual encoders support decoding of environment state (geometry, object structure, physical attributes) strongly correlates with downstream robot policy performance. Proposes this probing accuracy as a cheaper alternative to policy rollouts.

entry.title: Post-AGI Economics As If Nothing Ever Happens

author.name: Jan_Kulveit

entry.summary: Critiques economic modeling of post-AGI scenarios for assuming fundamental structures remain unchanged. Argues that AGI will invalidate the projection-based reasoning that economists use, making such models misleading.

entry.title: Reversible Deep Learning for 13C NMR in Chemoinformatics: On Structures and Spectra

author.name: Stefan Kuhn, Vandana Dwarka, Przemyslaw Karol Grenda, Eero Vainikko

entry.summary: Introduces reversible deep learning model for 13C NMR using conditional invertible neural networks, enabling both spectrum prediction from structure and structure generation from spectrum.

entry.title: PromptSplit: Revealing Prompt-Level Disagreement in Generative Models

author.name: Mehdi Lotfian, Mohammad Jalali, Farzan Farnia

entry.summary: Proposes PromptSplit, kernel-based framework for detecting prompt-dependent disagreement between generative models using tensor-product embeddings and eigenspace analysis.

entry.title: Learning the Value Systems of Agents with Preference-based and Inverse Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Andr\'es Holgado-S\'anchez, Holger Billhardt, Alberto Fern\'andez, Sascha Ossowski

entry.summary: Explores preference-based and inverse reinforcement learning for learning value systems of agents, addressing the challenge of specifying moral values computationally.

entry.title: Exploiting contextual information to improve stance detection in informal political discourse with LLMs

author.name: Arman Engin Sucu, Yixiang Zhou, Mario A. Nascimento, Tony Mullen

entry.summary: Investigates using LLMs with user profile context for political stance detection in informal online discourse, showing contextual prompts boost accuracy 7-15% across 7 SOTA LLMs.

entry.title: Interval-Based AUC (iAUC): Extending ROC Analysis to Uncertainty-Aware Classification

author.name: Yuqi Li, Matthew M. Engelhard

entry.summary: Introduces interval-based AUC metrics for uncertainty-aware classification, extending ROC analysis to interval-valued predictions with three-region decomposition for selective prediction.

entry.title: C-IDS: Solving Contextual POMDP via Information-Directed Objective

author.name: Chongyang Shi, Michael Dorothy, Jie Fu

entry.summary: C-IDS introduces information-directed objective for contextual POMDPs that balances reward maximization with reducing latent context uncertainty, with theoretical connection to linear information ratio.

entry.title: Lyapunov Constrained Soft Actor-Critic (LC-SAC) using Koopman Operator Theory for Quadrotor Trajectory Tracking

author.name: Dhruv S. Kushwaha, Zoleikha A. Biron

entry.summary: Proposes Lyapunov-constrained Soft Actor-Critic using Koopman operator theory for quadrotor trajectory tracking, addressing stability guarantees in safety-critical RL applications.

entry.title: Journey to the Centre of Cluster: Harnessing Interior Nodes for A/B Testing under Network Interference

author.name: Qianyi Chen, Anpeng Wu, Bo Li, Lu Deng, Yong Wang

entry.summary: Shows interior nodes (neighbors all in same cluster) dominate post-trimming subpopulation in cluster-randomized A/B tests, proposing simpler estimator with improved variance properties.

entry.title: Point2Insert: Video Object Insertion via Sparse Point Guidance

author.name: Yu Zhou, Xiaoyan Yang, Bojia Zi, Lihan Zhang, Ruijie Sun, Weishi Zheng, Haibin Huang, Chi Zhang, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Proposes Point2Insert for video object insertion using sparse positive/negative points instead of dense masks, enabling fine-grained user control with minimal annotation effort.

entry.title: Decoding Ambiguous Emotions with Test-Time Scaling in Audio-Language Models

author.name: Hong Jia, Weibin Li, Jingyao Wu, Xiaofeng Yu, Yan Gao, Jintao Cheng, Xiaoyu Tang, Feng Xia, Ting Dang

entry.summary: Explores test-time scaling for ambiguous emotion recognition in speech, investigating whether TTS methods can improve audio-language model performance on context-dependent affective states.

entry.title: Audit After Segmentation: Reference-Free Mask Quality Assessment for Language-Referred Audio-Visual Segmentation

author.name: Jinxing Zhou, Yanghao Zhou, Yaoting Wang, Zongyan Han, Jiaqi Ma, Henghui Ding, Rao Muhammad Anwer, Hisham Cholakkal

entry.summary: Introduces MQA-RefAVS task for reference-free mask quality assessment in audio-visual segmentation, estimating IoU, identifying error types, and recommending quality grades without ground truth.

entry.title: DMS2F-HAD: A Dual-branch Mamba-based Spatial-Spectral Fusion Network for Hyperspectral Anomaly Detection

author.name: Aayushma Pant, Lakpa Tamang, Tsz-Kwan Lee, Sunil Aryal

entry.summary: Proposes DMS2F-HAD, dual-branch Mamba-based model for hyperspectral anomaly detection with linear-time modeling of spatial and spectral features and dynamic gated fusion.

entry.title: SkeletonGaussian: Editable 4D Generation through Gaussian Skeletonization

author.name: Lifan Wu, Ruijie Zhu, Yubo Ai, Tianzhu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes SkeletonGaussian for generating editable 4D dynamic 3D Gaussians from monocular video by decomposing motion into skeleton-driven rigid motion and non-rigid deformations.

entry.title: VILLAIN at AVerImaTeC: Verifying Image-Text Claims via Multi-Agent Collaboration

author.name: Jaeyoon Jung, Yejun Yoon, Seunghyun Yoon, Kunwoo Park

entry.summary: Describes VILLAIN, a multimodal fact-checking system using vision-language model agents for verifying image-text claims through multi-stage collaboration and web evidence retrieval.

entry.title: Supporting software engineering tasks with agentic AI: Demonstration on document retrieval and test scenario generation

author.name: Marian Kica, Lukas Radosky, David Slivka, Karin Kubinova, Daniel Dovhun, Tomas Uhercik, Erik Bircak, Ivan Polasek

entry.summary: Introduces agentic AI solutions for software engineering tasks: multi-agent system for test scenario generation and document retrieval using star topology with supervisor agent.

entry.title: CRoSS: A Continual Robotic Simulation Suite for Scalable Reinforcement Learning with High Task Diversity and Realistic Physics Simulation

author.name: Yannick Denker, Alexander Gepperth

entry.summary: Introduces CRoSS benchmark suite for continual RL using realistically simulated robots in Gazebo, featuring differential-drive robot and robotic arm in various scenarios.

entry.title: SEIS: Subspace-based Equivariance and Invariance Scores for Neural Representations

author.name: Huahua Lin, Katayoun Farrahi, Xiaohao Cai

entry.summary: Introduces SEIS, subspace-based metrics for analyzing layer-wise neural representations under geometric transformations, disentangling equivariance from invariance without requiring labels.

entry.title: Benchmarking and Enhancing PPG-Based Cuffless Blood Pressure Estimation Methods

author.name: Neville Mathew, Yidan Shen, Renjie Hu, Maham Rahimi, George Zouridakis

entry.summary: Creates NBPDB, a standardized benchmark for PPG-based cuffless blood pressure estimation with physiologically controlled conditions, addressing inconsistent evaluation in prior work.

entry.title: Majorization-Minimization Networks for Inverse Problems: An Application to EEG Imaging

author.name: Le Minh Triet Tran (IMT Atlantique, LaTIM), Sarah Reynaud (IMT Atlantique, LaTIM), Ronan Fablet (IMT Atlantique, Lab-STICC), Adrien Merlini (IMT Atlantique, Lab-STICC), Fran\c{c}ois Rousseau (IMT Atlantique, LaTIM), Mai Quyen Pham (IMT Atlantique, Lab-STICC)

entry.summary: Proposes learned Majorization-Minimization framework for inverse problems within bilevel optimization, learning structured curvature majorant while preserving classical MM descent guarantees.

entry.title: Learning Multi-type heterogeneous interacting particle systems

author.name: Quanjun Lang, Xiong Wang, Fei Lu, Mauro Maggioni

entry.summary: Proposes framework for jointly inferring network topology, interaction kernels, and type assignments in heterogeneous interacting particle systems using matrix sensing and clustering.

entry.title: Bures-Wasserstein Importance-Weighted Evidence Lower Bound: Exposition and Applications

author.name: Peiwen Jiang, Takuo Matsubara, Minh-Ngoc Tran

entry.summary: Formulates IW-ELBO optimization in Bures-Wasserstein space using 2-Wasserstein metric, deriving gradient with improved stability properties compared to Euclidean optimization.

entry.title: Causal explanations of outliers in systems with lagged time-dependencies

author.name: Philipp Alexander Schwarz, Johannes Oberpriller, Sven Klaassen

entry.summary: Adapts causal root-cause analysis to time-dependent systems with lagged effects, proposing two truncation approaches for handling infinite dependency graphs in energy systems.

entry.title: Linguistically Informed Evaluation of Multilingual ASR for African Languages

author.name: Fei-Yueh Chen, Lateef Adeleke, C. M. Downey

entry.summary: Evaluates ASR models on African languages using Feature Error Rate and Tone Error Rate alongside WER, revealing linguistically meaningful error patterns obscured by word-level metrics.

entry.title: AnyStyle: Single-Pass Multimodal Stylization for 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Joanna Kaleta, Bartosz \'Swirta, Kacper Kania, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek, Marek Kowalski

entry.summary: Introduces AnyStyle for pose-free 3DGS reconstruction with zero-shot stylization through multimodal conditioning supporting both text and image style inputs.

entry.title: Decoupled Hierarchical Distillation for Multimodal Emotion Recognition

author.name: Yong Li, Yuanzhi Wang, Yi Ding, Shiqing Zhang, Ke Lu, Cuntai Guan

entry.summary: DHMD framework decouples multimodal features into homogeneous and heterogeneous components for emotion recognition, using a two-stage knowledge distillation strategy with graph-based coarse distillation and metric-based fine distillation.

entry.title: Interactive Spatial-Frequency Fusion Mamba for Multi-Modal Image Fusion

author.name: Yixin Zhu, Long Lv, Pingping Zhang, Xuehu Liu, Tongdan Tang, Feng Tian, Weibing Sun, Huchuan Lu

entry.summary: ISFM introduces Interactive Spatial-Frequency Fusion Mamba framework for multi-modal image fusion, using modality-specific extraction with Mamba and cross-domain attention for spatial-frequency interaction.

entry.title: Beyond the Vehicle: Cooperative Localization by Fusing Point Clouds for GPS-Challenged Urban Scenarios

author.name: Kuo-Yi Chao, Ralph Rasshofer, Alois Christian Knoll

entry.summary: Presents cooperative localization approach fusing V2V and V2I data with point cloud SLAM for GPS-denied urban environments, integrating diverse sensor modalities including LiDAR and stereo cameras.

entry.title: MS-SCANet: A Multiscale Transformer-Based Architecture with Dual Attention for No-Reference Image Quality Assessment

author.name: Mayesha Maliha R. Mithila, Mylene C. Q. Farias

entry.summary: MS-SCANet presents multi-scale transformer architecture with dual spatial-channel attention and cross-branch attention for no-reference image quality assessment, introducing consistency loss functions.

entry.title: Control and State Estimation of Vehicle-Mounted Aerial Systems in GPS-Denied, Non-Inertial Environments

author.name: Riming Xu, Obadah Wali, Yasmine Marani, Eric Feron

entry.summary: Presents control and estimation framework for quadrotors in GPS-denied non-inertial environments where IMUs are unreliable, using EKF with unknown inputs relying only on external position measurements.

entry.title: Comparative Analysis of Autonomous Robotic and Manual Techniques for Ultrasonic Sacral Osteotomy: A Preliminary Study

author.name: Daniyal Maroufi, Yash Kulkarni, Justin E. Bird, Jeffrey H. Siewerdsen, Farshid Alambeigi

entry.summary: Compares autonomous ultrasonic sacral osteotomy robot with manual technique, achieving sub-millimeter trajectory accuracy (0.11mm vs 1.10mm RMSE) and precise depth control.

entry.title: Who does a right to compute actually protect?

author.name: TFD

entry.summary: Analyzes 'right to compute' legislation being considered in several states, questioning who these laws actually protect and examining the framing that equates compute access with fundamental rights like free speech.

entry.title: PriorProbe: Recovering Individual-Level Priors for Personalizing Neural Networks in Facial Expression Recognition

author.name: Haijiang Yan, Nick Chater, Adam Sanborn

entry.summary: Introduces PriorProbe for eliciting individual-level cognitive priors via MCMC with People, demonstrating improved personalized facial expression recognition.

entry.title: Pruning for Generalization: A Transfer-Oriented Spatiotemporal Graph Framework

author.name: Zihao Jing, Yuxi Long, Ganlin Feng

entry.summary: Proposes TL-GPSTGN for transfer-oriented spatiotemporal forecasting using information-theoretic graph pruning to extract structurally informative subgraphs for improved generalization.

entry.title: SLUM-i: Semi-supervised Learning for Urban Mapping of Informal Settlements and Data Quality Benchmarking

author.name: Muhammad Taha Mukhtar (National University of Sciences and Technology, German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence), Syed Musa Ali Kazmi (National University of Sciences and Technology), Khola Naseem (German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence), Muhammad Ali Chattha (German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence), Andreas Dengel (German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence), Sheraz Ahmed (German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence), Muhammad Naseer Bajwa (National University of Sciences and Technology), Muhammad Imran Malik (National University of Sciences and Technology)

entry.summary: Introduces SLUM-i for semi-supervised mapping of informal settlements using satellite imagery, with benchmark datasets for Lahore, Karachi, and Mumbai totaling 1,869 km².

entry.title: Prenatal Stress Detection from Electrocardiography Using Self-Supervised Deep Learning: Development and External Validation

author.name: Martin G. Frasch, Marlene J. E. Mayer, Clara Becker, Peter Zimmermann, Camilla Zelgert, Marta C. Antonelli, Silvia M. Lobmaier

entry.summary: Develops self-supervised deep learning models for prenatal stress detection from maternal/fetal ECG using SimCLR pretraining, with external validation on separate cohort and ECG device.

entry.title: AGMA: Adaptive Gaussian Mixture Anchors for Prior-Guided Multimodal Human Trajectory Forecasting

author.name: Chao Li, Rui Zhang, Siyuan Huang, Xian Zhong, Hongbo Jiang

entry.summary: AGMA constructs adaptive Gaussian mixture priors for trajectory forecasting through two stages: extracting behavioral patterns from training data and distilling scene-adaptive priors.

entry.title: Optimal Rates for Feasible Payoff Set Estimation in Games

author.name: Annalisa Barbara, Riccardo Poiani, Martino Bernasconi, Andrea Celli

entry.summary: Studies optimal rates for estimating feasible payoff sets in games from observing Nash equilibrium play, enabling inverse game theory applications in mechanism design.

entry.title: LinGO: A Linguistic Graph Optimization Framework with LLMs for Interpreting Intents of Online Uncivil Discourse

author.name: Yuan Zhang, Thales Bertaglia

entry.summary: Proposes LinGO framework using linguistic structure and LLM optimization for classifying intents behind uncivil discourse, distinguishing civil intents expressed with uncivil cues.

entry.title: Active Epistemic Control for Query-Efficient Verified Planning

author.name: Shuhui Qu

entry.summary: Presents Active Epistemic Control (AEC), a planning layer that maintains separate grounded and belief stores to handle partial observability while ensuring feasibility through categorical checks.

entry.title: Vibe AIGC: A New Paradigm for Content Generation via Agentic Orchestration

author.name: Jiaheng Liu, Yuanxing Zhang, Shihao Li, Xinping Lei

entry.summary: Proposes Vibe AIGC paradigm treating content generation as agentic orchestration rather than single-shot model inference, where users become 'creative directors' rather than prompt engineers.

entry.title: Linguistic Blind Spots in Clinical Decision Extraction

author.name: Mohamed Elgaar, Hadi Amiri

entry.summary: Analyzes linguistic characteristics that cause clinical decision extraction failures, finding category-specific patterns where drug decisions are telegraphic while advice decisions require discourse modeling.

entry.title: Scalable Explainability-as-a-Service (XaaS) for Edge AI Systems

author.name: Samaresh Kumar Singh, Joyjit Roy

entry.summary: Proposes XaaS distributed architecture decoupling inference from explanation generation, allowing edge devices to request and cache explanations as a system service.

entry.title: ACIL: Active Class Incremental Learning for Image Classification

author.name: Aditya R. Bhattacharya, Debanjan Goswami, Shayok Chakraborty

entry.summary: Introduces ACIL (Active Class Incremental Learning) which combines continual learning with active learning to reduce annotation costs in episodic learning scenarios where previous data is inaccessible.

entry.title: Let Experts Feel Uncertainty: A Multi-Expert Label Distribution Approach to Probabilistic Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Zhen Zhou, Zhirui Wang, Qi Hong, Yunyang Shi, Ziyuan Gu, Zhiyuan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Expert Label Distribution Learning framework for probabilistic time series forecasting, combining mixture-of-experts with distributional learning for uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: Skin Tokens: A Learned Compact Representation for Unified Autoregressive Rigging

author.name: Jia-peng Zhang, Cheng-Feng Pu, Meng-Hao Guo, Yan-Pei Cao, Shi-Min Hu

entry.summary: Introduces SkinTokens, a learned discrete representation for skinning weights in 3D animation, reframing continuous regression as token sequence prediction via FSQ-CVAE.

entry.title: Multi-Integration of Labels across Categories for Component Identification (MILCCI)

author.name: Noga Mudrik, Yuxi Chen, Gal Mishne, Adam S. Charles

entry.summary: Presents MILCCI for analyzing multi-trial temporal data with metadata labels, identifying interpretable components while disentangling effects of different label categories.

entry.title: Convolution Operator Network for Forward and Inverse Problems (FI-Conv): Application to Plasma Turbulence Simulations

author.name: Xingzhuo Chen, Anthony Poole, Ionut-Gabriel Farcas, David R. Hatch, Ulisses Braga-Neto

entry.summary: Proposes FI-Conv using U-Net with ConvNeXt V2 blocks for predicting plasma turbulence evolution from initial state and PDE parameters.

entry.title: EXaMCaP: Subset Selection with Entropy Gain Maximization for Probing Capability Gains of Large Chart Understanding Training Sets

author.name: Jiapeng Liu, Liang Li, Bing Li, Peng Fu, Xiyan Gao, Chengyang Fang, Xiaoshuai Hao, Can Ma

entry.summary: Proposes EXaMCaP using entropy gain maximization to select training subsets for probing chart understanding capability gains in MLLMs without full-set fine-tuning.

entry.title: Resilient Load Forecasting under Climate Change: Adaptive Conditional Neural Processes for Few-Shot Extreme Load Forecasting

author.name: Chenxi Hu, Yue Ma, Yifan Wu, Yunhe Hou

entry.summary: Introduces AdaCNP, an adaptive conditional neural process for extreme weather load forecasting that handles rare events and regime shifts. Addresses critical infrastructure resilience under climate change.

entry.title: A Hitchhiker's Guide to Poisson Gradient Estimation

author.name: Michael Ibrahim, Hanqi Zhao, Eli Sennesh, Zhi Li, Anqi Wu, Jacob L. Yates, Chengrui Li, Hadi Vafaii

entry.summary: Provides systematic comparison of Poisson gradient estimation methods (EAT vs Gumbel-SoftMax) for computational neuroscience, with modified EAT guaranteeing unbiased first moment.

entry.title: Statistical Guarantees for Reasoning Probes on Looped Boolean Circuits

author.name: Anastasis Kratsios, Giulia Livieri, A. Martina Neuman

entry.summary: Analyzes statistical behavior of reasoning probes on looped Boolean circuits, establishing generalization bounds for transductive learning under partial observability.

entry.title: Universal Robust Speech Adaptation for Cross-Domain Speech Recognition and Enhancement

author.name: Chien-Chun Wang, Hung-Shin Lee, Hsin-Min Wang, Berlin Chen

entry.summary: URSA-GAN presents unified generative framework for speech domain adaptation using dual noise/channel encoders to mitigate mismatches for both ASR and speech enhancement.

entry.title: DELTA: Deliberative Multi-Agent Reasoning with Reinforcement Learning for Multimodal Psychological Counseling

author.name: Jiangnan Yang, Junjie Chen, Fei Wang, Yiqi Nie, Yuxin Liu, Zhangling Duan, Jie Chen

entry.summary: Introduces DELTA, a multi-agent framework for multimodal psychological counseling that models counseling as structured reasoning over visual and vocal cues, with RL guided by emotion attunement scoring.

entry.title: Deconstructing sentence disambiguation by joint latent modeling of reading paradigms: LLM surprisal is not enough

author.name: Dario Paape, Tal Linzen, Shravan Vasishth

entry.summary: Presents latent-process mixture model of human reading behavior across four paradigms, distinguishing garden-path probability, cost, and reanalysis cost. Shows LLM surprisal alone is insufficient.

entry.title: AIANO: Enhancing Information Retrieval with AI-Augmented Annotation

author.name: Sameh Khattab, Marie Bauer, Lukas Heine, Till Rostalski, Jens Kleesiek, Julian Friedrich

entry.summary: Introduces AIANO, an AI-augmented annotation tool for information retrieval datasets that integrates human expertise with LLM assistance, nearly doubling annotation throughput.

entry.title: Impact of diversity on bounded archives for multi-objective local search

author.name: Amadeu A. Coco, Cyprien Bor\'ee, Julien Baste, Laetitia Jourdan, Lucien Mousin

entry.summary: Studies diversity algorithms for bounded archives in multi-objective optimization, introducing methods for diversity in decision space rather than just objective space to improve Pareto front coverage.

entry.title: FDA Flocking: Future Direction-Aware Flocking via Velocity Prediction

author.name: Hossein B. Jond, Martin Saska

entry.summary: FDA Flocking introduces future direction-aware flocking by blending reactive alignment with predictive term based on short-term velocity predictions, inspired by bird postural signals and multirotor attitude tilts.

entry.title: Relational Scene Graphs for Object Grounding of Natural Language Commands

author.name: Julia Kuhn, Francesco Verdoja, Tsvetomila Mihaylova, Ville Kyrki

entry.summary: Proposes using relational scene graphs that include explicit spatial relations between objects to improve grounding of natural language robot commands. Combines LLM language understanding with 3D scene graphs for better spatial reasoning.

entry.title: Beyond the Control Equations: An Artifact Study of Implementation Quality in Robot Control Software

author.name: Nils Chur, Thorsten Berger, Einar Broch Johnsen, Andrzej W\k{a}sowski

entry.summary: Studies 184 real-world controller implementations in open-source robot software, investigating how theoretical control guarantees are ensured when implementing continuous-space controllers in discrete software systems.

entry.title: Chess bots do not have goals

author.name: zulupineapple

entry.summary: Argues that chess bots do not truly have goals because they receive no reward after training, cannot react to illegal moves, and cannot take actions outside their narrow training domain like seeking more games to win.

entry.title: PaperX: A Unified Framework for Multimodal Academic Presentation Generation with Scholar DAG

author.name: Tao Yu, Minghui Zhang, Zhiqing Cui, Hao Wang, Zhongtian Luo, Shenghua Chai, Junhao Gong, Yuzhao Peng, Yuxuan Zhou, Yujia Yang, Zhenghao Zhang, Haopeng Jin, Xinming Wang, Yufei Xiong, Jiabing Yang, Jiahao Yuan, Hanqing Wang, Hongzhu Yi, YiFan Zhang, Yan Huang, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces PaperX framework using Scholar DAG intermediate representation to transform scientific papers into diverse presentation formats through structural transformation and rendering.

entry.title: Sounding Highlights: Dual-Pathway Audio Encoders for Audio-Visual Video Highlight Detection

author.name: Seohyun Joo, Yoori Oh

entry.summary: Proposes DAViHD with dual-pathway audio encoders (semantic + dynamic) for video highlight detection, capturing both content understanding and spectro-temporal dynamics.

entry.title: Semantic Rate Distortion and Posterior Design: Compute Constraints, Multimodality, and Strategic Inference

author.name: Emrah Akyol

entry.summary: Studies strategic Gaussian semantic compression under rate and compute constraints, deriving semantic waterfilling solutions and showing compute limits act as implicit rate constraints.

entry.title: Counterfactual Explanations for Hypergraph Neural Networks

author.name: Fabiano Veglianti, Lorenzo Antonelli, Gabriele Tolomei

entry.summary: Introduces CF-HyperGNNExplainer for counterfactual explanations of Hypergraph Neural Networks, identifying minimal structural changes needed to alter predictions.

entry.title: Transcendental Regularization of Finite Mixtures:Theoretical Guarantees and Practical Limitations

author.name: Ernest Fokou\'e

entry.summary: Introduces transcendental regularization for finite mixture models using analytic barrier functions to prevent degeneracy while maintaining asymptotic efficiency, though classification improvements are modest.

entry.title: Privacy utility trade offs for parameter estimation in degree heterogeneous higher order networks

author.name: Bibhabasu Mandal, Sagnik Nandy

entry.summary: Establishes minimax-optimal rates for parameter estimation in degree heterogeneous networks under local and central differential privacy constraints.

entry.title: Thermodynamic assessment of machine learning models for solid-state synthesis prediction

author.name: Jane Schlesinger, Simon Hjaltason, Nathan J. Szymanski, Christopher J. Bartel

entry.summary: Assesses alignment of synthesis prediction ML models with material and reaction thermodynamics, establishing likely thermodynamic bounds for synthesizability.

entry.title: Bayesian PINNs for uncertainty-aware inverse problems (BPINN-IP)

author.name: Ali Mohammad-Djafari
