entry.summary: Develops Bayesian PINNs for inverse problems with hierarchical formulation and uncertainty quantification using variational inference and Monte Carlo dropout.

entry.title: Investigating Disability Representations in Text-to-Image Models

author.name: Yang Yian, Yu Fan, Liudmila Zavolokina, Sarah Ebling

entry.summary: Investigates disability representations in Stable Diffusion XL and DALL-E 3, analyzing how different prompt strategies affect portrayal of people with disabilities.

entry.title: TiCLS : Tightly Coupled Language Text Spotter

author.name: Leeje Jang, Yijun Lin, Yao-Yi Chiang, Jerod Weinman

entry.summary: Proposes TiCLS, an end-to-end text spotter that integrates character-level pretrained language model knowledge through a linguistic decoder fusing visual and linguistic features.

entry.title: Context Determines Optimal Architecture in Materials Segmentation

author.name: Mingjian Lu, Pawan K. Tripathi, Mark Shteyn, Debargha Ganguly, Roger H. French, Vipin Chaudhary, Yinghui Wu

entry.summary: Presents cross-modal evaluation framework for materials segmentation across SEM, AFM, XCT, and optical microscopy, revealing optimal architectures vary by imaging modality.

entry.title: TruKAN: Towards More Efficient Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks Using Truncated Power Functions

author.name: Ali Bayeh, Samira Sadaoui, Malek Mouhoub

entry.summary: Proposes TruKAN replacing B-splines in KAN with truncated power functions, maintaining expressiveness while improving accuracy and training time with enhanced interpretability.

entry.title: Tinker Tales: Supporting Child-AI Collaboration through Co-Creative Storytelling with Educational Scaffolding

author.name: Nayoung Choi, Jiseung Hong, Peace Cyebukayire, Ikseon Choi, Jinho D. Choi

entry.summary: Presents Tinker Tales, tangible storytelling system for child-AI co-creation using NFC-embedded toys and narrative scaffolding to support meaningful collaborative story development.

entry.title: A Human-Centered Privacy Approach (HCP) to AI

author.name: Luyi Sun, Wei Xu, Zaifeng Gao

entry.summary: Proposes Human-Centered Privacy (HCP) framework for AI, integrating technology, ethics, and human factors perspectives across the AI development lifecycle.

entry.title: The Turing Synthetic Radar Dataset: A dataset for pulse deinterleaving

author.name: Edward Gunn, Adam Hosford, Robert Jones, Leo Zeitler, Ian Groves, Victoria Nockles

entry.summary: Releases Turing Synthetic Radar Dataset for pulse deinterleaving research with 6000 pulse trains totaling 3 billion pulses, featuring realistic scenarios with up to 110 emitters.

entry.title: Universality of General Spiked Tensor Models

author.name: Yanjin Xiang, Zhihua Zhang

entry.summary: Studies universality of rank-one spiked tensor models under non-Gaussian noise, showing spectral distributions converge to Gaussian case limits for maximum likelihood estimator.

entry.title: Can LLMs capture stable human-generated sentence entropy measures?

author.name: Estrella Pivel-Villanueva, Elisabeth Frederike Sterner, Franziska Knolle

entry.summary: Analyzes sample size requirements for stable human sentence entropy estimates and finds LLMs cannot reliably reproduce human entropy patterns, suggesting they operate on different statistical regularities.

entry.title: Unmasking Superspreaders: Data-Driven Approaches for Identifying and Comparing Key Influencers of Conspiracy Theories on X.com

author.name: Florian Kramer, Henrich R. Greve, Moritz von Zahn, Hayagreeva Rao

entry.summary: Analyzes superspreaders and bots spreading COVID-19 conspiracy theories on Twitter using 7M+ tweets, developing identification methods and comparing behavioral patterns.

entry.title: Interfaze: The Future of AI is built on Task-Specific Small Models

author.name: Harsha Vardhan Khurdula, Vineet Agarwal, Yoeven D Khemlani

entry.summary: Presents Interfaze, a system architecture using heterogeneous small models for perception, context construction, and action rather than monolithic LLMs, exposing a unified API endpoint.

entry.title: Vision Transformers for Zero-Shot Clustering of Animal Images: A Comparative Benchmarking Study

author.name: Hugo Markoff, Stefan Hein Bengtson, Michael {\O}rsted

entry.summary: Benchmarks Vision Transformers for zero-shot animal species clustering across 60 species, comparing 5 ViT models with various dimensionality reduction and clustering algorithms.

entry.title: Efficient Equivariant High-Order Crystal Tensor Prediction via Cartesian Local-Environment Many-Body Coupling

author.name: Dian Jin, Yancheng Yuan, Xiaoming Tao

entry.summary: Proposes CEITNet for efficient prediction of high-order crystal tensor properties using Cartesian local environment tensors instead of computationally expensive spherical harmonic approaches.

entry.title: SAR-RAG: ATR Visual Question Answering by Semantic Search, Retrieval, and MLLM Generation

author.name: David F. Ramirez, Tim Overman, Kristen Jaskie, Joe Marvin, Andreas Spanias

entry.summary: Presents SAR-RAG for automatic target recognition of synthetic aperture radar images using visual-context image retrieval-augmented generation with MLLMs.

entry.title: Beyond Rewards in Reinforcement Learning for Cyber Defence

author.name: Elizabeth Bates, Chris Hicks, Vasilios Mavroudis

entry.summary: Evaluates impact of reward function structure on RL agents for autonomous cyber defense, comparing sparse and dense rewards across multiple environments.

entry.title: Non-linear PCA via Evolution Strategies: a Novel Objective Function

author.name: Thomas Uriot, Elise Chung

entry.summary: Proposes non-linear PCA framework using neural network parameterized transformations optimized via Evolution Strategies with novel granular objective function.

entry.title: RISE: Interactive Visual Diagnosis of Fairness in Machine Learning Models

author.name: Ray Chen, Christan Grant

entry.summary: Introduces RISE, a visualization tool converting sorted residuals into interpretable patterns for diagnosing fairness disparities across environments with localized analysis.

entry.title: Reducing the labeling burden in time-series mapping using Common Ground: a semi-automated approach to tracking changes in land cover and species over time

author.name: Geethen Singh, Jasper A Slingsby, Tamara B Robinson, Glenn Moncrieff

entry.summary: Demonstrates that models with reference data from t0 can perform competitively on future time t1 for Earth observation classification, reducing need for manual label updates.

entry.title: A Dual-TransUNet Deep Learning Framework for Multi-Source Precipitation Merging and Improving Seasonal and Extreme Estimates

author.name: Yuchen Ye, Zixuan Qi, Shixuan Li, Wei Qi, Yanpeng Cai, Chaoxia Yuan

entry.summary: Develops dual-stage TransUNet framework for multi-source precipitation merging, integrating satellite and reanalysis products to improve precipitation estimation, especially for extremes.

entry.title: Maximum-Volume Nonnegative Matrix Factorization

author.name: Olivier Vu Thanh, Nicolas Gillis

entry.summary: Proposes maximum-volume NMF as dual approach to minimum-volume NMF, showing different noise behavior while maintaining identifiability under same conditions.

entry.title: Learning to Separate RF Signals Under Uncertainty: Detect-Then-Separate vs. Unified Joint Models

author.name: Ariel Rodrigez, Alejandro Lancho, Amir Weiss

entry.summary: Shows detect-then-separate strategies for RF signal separation admit analytical justification in Gaussian mixture framework, comparing to unified joint models.

entry.title: Conditional Counterfactual Mean Embeddings: Doubly Robust Estimation and Learning Rates

author.name: Thatchanon Anancharoenkij, Donlapark Ponnoprat

entry.summary: Proposes Conditional Counterfactual Mean Embeddings (CCME) for characterizing full conditional distributions of potential outcomes in causal inference, with doubly robust estimation and three practical estimators.

entry.title: PersoDPO: Scalable Preference Optimization for Instruction-Adherent, Persona-Grounded Dialogue via Multi-LLM Evaluation

author.name: Saleh Afzoon, MohammadHossein Ahmadi, Usman Naseem, Amin Beheshti

entry.summary: Introduces PersoDPO for persona-grounded dialogue using multi-LLM evaluation signals for preference optimization, addressing limitations of open-source LLMs in persona consistency.

entry.title: GPAIR: Gaussian-Kernel-Based Ultrafast 3D Photoacoustic Iterative Reconstruction

author.name: Yibing Wang, Shuang Li, Tingting Huang, Yu Zhang, Chulhong Kim, Seongwook Choi, Changhui Li

entry.summary: Proposes GPAIR for ultrafast 3D photoacoustic reconstruction using Gaussian kernels with analytical closed-form expressions, achieving orders-of-magnitude acceleration.

entry.title: An Intuitionistic Fuzzy Logic Driven UNet architecture: Application to Brain Image segmentation

author.name: Hanuman Verma, Kiho Im, Pranabesh Maji, Akshansh Gupta

entry.summary: IF-UNet incorporates intuitionistic fuzzy logic into UNet architecture for brain MRI segmentation, handling uncertainty from partial volume effects through membership, non-membership, and hesitation degrees.

entry.title: SalFormer360: a transformer-based saliency estimation model for 360-degree videos

author.name: Mahmoud Z. A. Wahba, Francesco Barbato, Sara Baldoni, Federica Battisti

entry.summary: SalFormer360 proposes a transformer-based saliency estimation model for 360-degree videos, adapting SegFormer architecture with viewing center bias integration.

entry.title: How to rewrite the stars: Mapping your orchard over time through constellations of fruits

author.name: Gon\c{c}alo P. Matos, Carlos Santiago, Jo\~ao P. Costeira, Ricardo L. Saldanha, Ernesto M. Morgado

entry.summary: Proposes method to match individual fruits across videos collected on different dates using constellation-style geometric patterns, enabling longitudinal fruit growth tracking in orchards.

entry.title: LitS: A novel Neighborhood Descriptor for Point Clouds

author.name: Jonatan B. Bastos, Francisco F. Rivera, Oscar G. Lorenzo, David L. Vilari\~no, Jos\'e C. Cabaleiro, Alberto M. Esmor\'is, Tom\'as F. Pena

entry.summary: LitS introduces a novel neighborhood descriptor for 2D/3D point clouds using piecewise constant functions on the unit circle to characterize local geometry in any direction.

entry.title: An Improved Boosted DC Algorithm for Nonsmooth Functions with Applications in Image Recovery

author.name: ZeYu Li, Te Qi, TieYong Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes improved boosted DC algorithm for non-smooth non-convex optimization, enabling monotone line search when the first DC function is non-smooth through an improved direction computation.

entry.title: Dull, Dirty, Dangerous: Understanding the Past, Present, and Future of a Key Motivation for Robotics

author.name: Nozomi Nakajima, Pedro Reynolds-Cu\'ellar, Caitrin Lynch, Kate Darling

entry.summary: Empirically analyzes robotics publications from 1980-2024 mentioning 'dull, dirty, dangerous' (DDD) work, finding only 2.7% define the term. Reviews social science literature on these categories and proposes a framework for considering job context in robotics.

entry.title: Thoughts on Toby Ords' AI Scaling Series

author.name: Srdjan Miletic

entry.summary: Commentary on Toby Ord's recent AI scaling sequence, summarizing arguments that scaling laws predict hitting walls quickly, inference scaling is logarithmic, and discussing implications for AI governance.

entry.title: Benchmarking Automatic Speech Recognition for Indian Languages in Agricultural Contexts

author.name: Chandrashekar M S, Vineet Singh, Lakshmi Pedapudi

entry.summary: Benchmarks ASR systems for Indian languages (Hindi, Telugu, Odia) in agricultural contexts, introducing Agriculture Weighted WER metric and evaluating 10 models across 10,934 recordings.

entry.title: Entropy-Aware Structural Alignment for Zero-Shot Handwritten Chinese Character Recognition

author.name: Qiuming Luo, Tao Zeng, Feng Li, Heming Liu, Rui Mao, Chang Kong

entry.summary: Proposes Entropy-Aware Structural Alignment Network for zero-shot Chinese character recognition, using information entropy priors to prioritize discriminative radicals.

entry.title: A computational account of dreaming: learning and memory consolidation

author.name: Qi Zhang

entry.summary: Presents computational model of dreaming for memory consolidation, explaining how random-seeming dream contents can still serve important learning functions.

entry.title: No One-Size-Fits-All: Building Systems For Translation to Bashkir, Kazakh, Kyrgyz, Tatar and Chuvash Using Synthetic And Original Data

author.name: Dmitry Karpov

entry.summary: Explores machine translation for five Turkic language pairs using LoRA fine-tuning and retrieval-based approaches with DeepSeek-V3.2, achieving competitive results.

entry.title: Comparative Insights on Adversarial Machine Learning from Industry and Academia: A User-Study Approach

author.name: Vishruti Kakkad (Carnegie Mellon University), Paul Chung (University of California, San Diego), Hanan Hibshi (Carnegie Mellon University, King Abdulaziz University), Maverick Woo (Carnegie Mellon University)

entry.summary: Studies perspectives on adversarial machine learning through industry survey and educational CTF challenges implementing NLP/GenAI poisoning attacks.

entry.title: Robust Generalizable Heterogeneous Legal Link Prediction

author.name: Lorenz Wendlinger, Simon Alexander Nonn, Abdullah Al Zubaer, Michael Granitzer

entry.summary: Improves heterogeneous legal link prediction with edge dropout and feature concatenation, achieving up to 45% error reduction and demonstrating transfer between geographically disjoint legal systems.

entry.title: A Bandit-Based Approach to Educational Recommender Systems: Contextual Thompson Sampling for Learner Skill Gain Optimization

author.name: Lukas De Kerpel, Arthur Thuy, Dries F. Benoit

entry.summary: Applies contextual Thompson sampling to educational recommendation for personalized exercise sequencing, optimizing learner skill gain using performance history.

entry.title: DementiaBank-Emotion: A Multi-Rater Emotion Annotation Corpus for Alzheimer's Disease Speech (Version 1.0)

author.name: Cheonkam Jeong, Jessica Liao, Audrey Lu, Yutong Song, Christopher Rashidian, Donna Krogh, Erik Krogh, Mahkameh Rasouli, Jung-Ah Lee, Nikil Dutt, Lisa M Gibbs, David Sultzer, Julie Rousseau, Jocelyn Ludlow, Margaret Galvez, Alexander Nuth, Chet Khay, Sabine Brunswicker, Adeline Nyamathi

entry.summary: Presents first multi-rater emotion annotation corpus for Alzheimer's disease speech, finding AD patients express significantly more non-neutral emotions (16.9% vs 5.7%) with different acoustic patterns.

entry.title: Frontend Token Enhancement for Token-Based Speech Recognition

author.name: Takanori Ashihara, Shota Horiguchi, Kohei Matsuura, Tsubasa Ochiai, Marc Delcroix

entry.summary: Proposes frontend system to estimate clean speech tokens from noisy speech for token-based ASR, comparing wave-to-wave, token-to-token, and hybrid enhancement approaches.

entry.title: SuperPoint-E: local features for 3D reconstruction via tracking adaptation in endoscopy

author.name: O. Leon Barbed, Jos\'e M. M. Montiel, Pascal Fua, Ana C. Murillo

entry.summary: Presents SuperPoint-E, local feature extraction method for endoscopy SfM using tracking adaptation supervision, producing denser 3D reconstructions covering longer video segments.

entry.title: JSynFlow: Japanese Synthesised Flowchart Visual Question Answering Dataset built with Large Language Models

author.name: Hiroshi Sasaki

entry.summary: Introduces JSynFlow, LLM-synthesized visual QA dataset for Japanese flowcharts including task descriptions, flowchart images, and QA pairs for various business occupations.

entry.title: Dual Mind World Model Inspired Network Digital Twin for Access Scheduling

author.name: Hrishikesh Dutta, Roberto Minerva, Noel Crespi

entry.summary: Presents a Digital Twin-enabled scheduling framework inspired by Dual Mind World Model architecture for learning-informed and imagination-driven network control.

entry.title: Machine Learning-Driven Crystal System Prediction for Perovskites Using Augmented X-ray Diffraction Data

author.name: Ansu Mathew, Ahmer A. B. Baloch, Alamin Yakasai, Hemant Mittal, Vivian Alberts, Jayakumar V. Karunamurthy

entry.summary: Applies ML models including LSTM, GRU, and neural networks to predict perovskite crystal systems from XRD spectra, using data augmentation to address class imbalance.

entry.title: A Domain-Specific Curated Benchmark for Entity and Document-Level Relation Extraction

author.name: Marco Martinelli, Stefano Marchesin, Vanessa Bonato, Giorgio Maria Di Nunzio, Nicola Ferro, Ornella Irrera, Laura Menotti, Federica Vezzani, Gianmaria Silvello

entry.summary: Introduces GutBrainIE, a manually annotated benchmark of 1,600+ PubMed abstracts for entity recognition, linking, and relation extraction in gut-brain axis research.

entry.title: Intellectual Property Protection for 3D Gaussian Splatting Assets: A Survey

author.name: Longjie Zhao, Ziming Hong, Jiaxin Huang, Runnan Chen, Mingming Gong, Tongliang Liu

entry.summary: First systematic survey on intellectual property protection for 3D Gaussian Splatting, presenting framework covering perturbation mechanisms, protection paradigms, and robustness challenges.

entry.title: Digital Twins & ZeroConf AI: Structuring Automated Intelligent Pipelines for Industrial Applications

author.name: Marco Picone, Fabio Turazza, Matteo Martinelli, Marco Mamei

entry.summary: Proposes ZeroConf AI framework integrating Digital Twins with automated AI pipelines for industrial cyber-physical systems, enabling scalable and reusable AI deployment.

entry.title: Structure-Informed Estimation for Pilot-Limited MIMO Channels via Tensor Decomposition

author.name: Alexandre Barbosa de Lima

entry.summary: Presents hybrid tensor-neural architecture for pilot-limited MIMO channel estimation, comparing CP and Tucker decompositions under varying SNR and scattering conditions.

entry.title: HoloEv-Net: Efficient Event-based Action Recognition via Holographic Spatial Embedding and Global Spectral Gating

author.name: Weidong Hao

entry.summary: Presents HoloEv-Net for event-based action recognition using holographic spatial embedding to reduce computational redundancy in voxel representations and better capture global motion patterns in spectral space.

entry.title: LLM-Empowered Cooperative Content Caching in Vehicular Fog Caching-Assisted Platoon Networks

author.name: Bowen Tan, Qiong Wu, Pingyi Fan, Kezhi Wang, Nan Cheng, Wen Chen

entry.summary: Proposes three-tier content caching architecture for vehicular fog computing using LLMs for intelligent caching decisions through a prompting framework encoding task objectives and constraints.

entry.title: Autonomous AI Agents for Real-Time Affordable Housing Site Selection: Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning Under Regulatory Constraints

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Duygu Erisken, Derya Umut Kulali, Taner Yilmaz, Rana Irem Turhan

entry.summary: Presents AURA, a hierarchical multi-agent RL system for affordable housing site selection under regulatory constraints, modeling as constrained multi-objective MDP.

entry.title: A Consensus-Bayesian Framework for Detecting Malicious Activity in Enterprise Directory Access Graphs

author.name: Pratyush Uppuluri, Shilpa Noushad, Sajan Kumar

entry.summary: Presents consensus-based Bayesian framework for detecting malicious user behavior in enterprise directory access graphs using opinion dynamics and scaled variance for anomaly detection.

entry.title: Static and auto-regressive neural emulation of phytoplankton biomass dynamics from physical predictors in the global ocean

author.name: Mahima Lakra, Ronan Fablet, Lucas Drumetz, Etienne Pauthenet, Elodie Martinez

entry.summary: Explores deep learning architectures (including UNet) for predicting global phytoplankton biomass dynamics from satellite observations, comparing static and auto-regressive approaches.

entry.title: XtraLight-MedMamba for Classification of Neoplastic Tubular Adenomas

author.name: Aqsa Sultana, Rayan Afsar, Ahmed Rahu, Surendra P. Singh, Brian Shula, Brandon Combs, Derrick Forchetti, Vijayan K. Asari

entry.summary: Proposes XtraLight-MedMamba, an ultra-lightweight state-space model for classifying precancerous polyps from whole-slide images, combining ConvNext features with Mamba architecture.

entry.title: ReFRAME or Remain: Unsupervised Lexical Semantic Change Detection with Frame Semantics

author.name: Bach Phan-Tat, Kris Heylen, Dirk Geeraerts, Stefano De Pascale, Dirk Speelman

entry.summary: Proposes frame semantics-based approach for lexical semantic change detection that achieves competitive performance with neural methods while providing highly interpretable predictions.

entry.title: PersoPilot: An Adaptive AI-Copilot for Transparent Contextualized Persona Classification and Personalized Response Generation

author.name: Saleh Afzoon, Amin Beheshti, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Presents PersoPilot, an agentic AI copilot for contextualized persona classification with transparent, explainable interface for both end users and analysts.

entry.title: Fast, Unsupervised Framework for Registration Quality Assessment of Multi-stain Histological Whole Slide Pairs

author.name: Shikha Dubey, Patricia Raciti, Kristopher Standish, Albert Juan Ramon, Erik Ames Burlingame

author.name: Wenbin Zhou, Liyan Xie, Shixiang Zhu

entry.summary: Presents parameterizable CNN accelerator for FPGAs using HLS tools to optimize across latency, power, area, and cost constraints for embedded deep learning.

This enables more realistic contact-mode transitions for contact-rich behaviors.

author.name: Rationalist11235

entry.summary: Proposes a speculative framework for AI safety through multiple powerful AI guardians that monitor each other, all developed and trained separately to prevent single-point-of-failure catastrophe scenarios.

entry.title: p-values are good actually

author.name: speck1447

entry.summary: Presents a redesigned soft shoulder exosuit (v2) that prioritizes comfort while maintaining assistive performance, shifting assistance from coronal to sagittal plane for functional hand positioning. Includes user study validation.

author.name: Tiroshan Madushanka, Sakuna Madushanka

entry.title: Vibestemics

author.name: Gordon Seidoh Worley

entry.summary: Attempts to define 'vibestemics' - the combination of vibes and epistemics - exploring how intuitive, non-propositional ways of knowing relate to traditional epistemic frameworks.

entry.title: Reconciling Shannon and Bayes.

author.name: Laureana Bonaparte

entry.summary: Brief epistemics discussion attempting to reconcile Shannon's information theory (resolution of uncertainty) with Bayesian updating (reduction of uncertainty), arguing both perspectives are valid and complementary.

entry.title: Solemn Courage

author.name: aysja

entry.summary: Personal reflection on the psychological challenges of writing about AI existential risk, discussing the tension between outcome uncertainty and the intrinsic motivation to contribute meaningful work.

entry.title: Research Summary: February 04, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research features major theoretical breakthroughs alongside practical infrastructure and safety advances. The hallucination rate-distortion theorem proves factual errors are information-theoretically optimal under memory constraints—a fundamental reframing of the problem.

  • Kimi K2.5 releases as open-source multimodal agentic model with Agent Swarm framework achieving state-of-the-art results
  • Simple role conditioning reduces unsafe outputs on WildJailbreak from 81.4% to 3.6% without any training
  • Constant-cost self-attention via symmetric Taylor approximation could transform long-context efficiency if validated
  • Identity Bridge challenges the reversal curse as fundamental limitation of autoregressive models

Theoretical contributions span tropical geometry analysis proving Top-k MoE routing equivalent to combinatorial depth, first PPO convergence proof, and Ω(n) lower bounds on chain-of-thought token complexity. BLOCK-EM introduces mechanistic prevention of emergent misalignment, while SWE-Universe scales coding agent environments to 807K verified tasks.

entry.title: Simple Role Assignment is Extraordinarily Effective for Safety Alignment

author.name: Zhou Ziheng, Jiakun Ding, Zhaowei Zhang, Ruosen Gao, Yingnian Wu, Demetri Terzopoulos, Yipeng Kang, Fangwei Zhong, Junqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes role conditioning as compact alternative to principle-based alignment, reducing unsafe outputs on WildJailbreak from 81.4% to 3.6% with DeepSeek-V3 through training-free role-conditioned generation and iterative role-based critics.

entry.title: Training LLMs with Fault Tolerant HSDP on 100,000 GPUs

author.name: Omkar Salpekar, Rohan Varma, Kenny Yu, Vladimir Ivanov, Yang Wang, Ahmed Sharif, Min Si, Shawn Xu, Feng Tian, Shengbao Zheng, Tristan Rice, Ankush Garg, Shangfu Peng, Shreyas Siravara, Wenyin Fu, Rodrigo de Castro, Adithya Gangidi, Andrey Obraztsov, Sharan Narang, Sergey Edunov, Maxim Naumov, Chunqiang Tang, Mathew Oldham

entry.summary: Previously covered in Research, Proposes Fault Tolerant HSDP for training LLMs on 100K GPUs, using data parallel replicas as fault tolerance units with novel FTAR protocol enabling continued training during failures.

entry.title: Hallucination is a Consequence of Space-Optimality: A Rate-Distortion Theorem for Membership Testing

author.name: Anxin Guo, Jingwei Li

entry.summary: Proves hallucination is information-theoretically optimal behavior under memory constraints via rate-distortion theorem for membership testing. Shows optimal models must hallucinate on non-facts even with perfect training.

entry.title: An Approximate Ascent Approach To Prove Convergence of PPO

author.name: Leif Doering, Daniel Schmidt, Moritz Melcher, Sebastian Kassing, Benedikt Wille, Tilman Aach, Simon Weissmann

entry.summary: Provides first convergence proof for PPO by interpreting its policy update scheme as approximated policy gradient ascent, controlling bias from surrogate gradients using random reshuffling techniques.

entry.title: Breaking the Reversal Curse in Autoregressive Language Models via Identity Bridge

author.name: Xutao Ma, Yixiao Huang, Hanlin Zhu, Somayeh Sojoudi

entry.summary: Previously covered in Research, Challenges the prevailing view that the reversal curse (inability to deduce B→A from training on A→B) is a fundamental limit of autoregressive LLMs. Proposes an Identity Bridge method to mitigate this limitation through slight modifications.

entry.title: Self-Attention at Constant Cost per Token via Symmetry-Aware Taylor Approximation

author.name: Franz A. Heinsen, Leo Kozachkov

entry.summary: Previously covered in Research, Derives self-attention formulation with constant cost per token by decomposing Taylor expansion into symmetric tensor product chains, achieving orders-of-magnitude reductions in memory and compute.

entry.title: BLOCK-EM: Preventing Emergent Misalignment by Blocking Causal Features

author.name: Muhammed Ustaomeroglu, Guannan Qu

entry.summary: Previously covered in Research, Proposes BLOCK-EM to prevent emergent misalignment by identifying and constraining internal features that control misaligned behavior during fine-tuning. Achieves 95% reduction in misalignment across six domains.

entry.title: SWE-Universe: Scale Real-World Verifiable Environments to Millions

author.name: Mouxiang Chen, Lei Zhang, Yunlong Feng, Xuwu Wang, Wenting Zhao, Ruisheng Cao, Jiaxi Yang, Jiawei Chen, Mingze Li, Zeyao Ma, Hao Ge, Zongmeng Zhang, Zeyu Cui, Dayiheng Liu, Jingren Zhou, Jianling Sun, Junyang Lin, Binyuan Hui

entry.summary: Introduces SWE-Universe, a framework for automatically constructing 807K+ real-world software engineering environments from GitHub PRs using a building agent with self-verification.

entry.title: Sparsity is Combinatorial Depth: Quantifying MoE Expressivity via Tropical Geometry

author.name: Ye Su, Huayi Tang, Zixuan Gong, Yong Liu

entry.summary: First theoretical analysis of Mixture-of-Experts through tropical geometry, proving that Top-k routing is algebraically isomorphic to k-th elementary symmetric tropical polynomial. Shows 'sparsity is combinatorial depth' with capacity scaling by binomial coefficient.

entry.title: Reasoning about Reasoning: BAPO Bounds on Chain-of-Thought Token Complexity in LLMs

author.name: Kiran Tomlinson, Tobias Schnabel, Adith Swaminathan, Jennifer Neville

entry.summary: Proves Ω(n) lower bounds on chain-of-thought tokens for binary majority, triplet matching, and graph reachability in BAPO model, with matching upper bounds.

author.name: David P. Woodruff, Vincent Cohen-Addad, Lalit Jain, Jieming Mao, Song Zuo, MohammadHossein Bateni, Simina Branzei, Michael P. Brenner, Lin Chen, Ying Feng, Lance Fortnow, Gang Fu, Ziyi Guan, Zahra Hadizadeh, Mohammad T. Hajiaghayi, Mahdi JafariRaviz, Adel Javanmard, Karthik C. S., Ken-ichi Kawarabayashi, Ravi Kumar, Silvio Lattanzi, Euiwoong Lee, Yi Li, Ioannis Panageas, Dimitris Paparas, Benjamin Przybocki, Bernardo Subercaseaux, Ola Svensson, Shayan Taherijam, Xuan Wu, Eylon Yogev, Morteza Zadimoghaddam, Samson Zhou, Vahab Mirrokni

entry.summary: Google researchers present case studies demonstrating successful collaboration with Gemini models to solve open problems, refute conjectures, and generate proofs across theoretical CS, economics, and physics.

entry.title: WAXAL: A Large-Scale Multilingual African Language Speech Corpus

author.name: Abdoulaye Diack, Perry Nelson, Kwaku Agbesi, Angela Nakalembe, MohamedElfatih MohamedKhair, Vusumuzi Dube, Tavonga Siyavora, Subhashini Venugopalan, Jason Hickey, Uche Okonkwo, Abhishek Bapna, Isaac Wiafe, Raynard Dodzi Helegah, Elikem Doe Atsakpo, Charles Nutrokpor, Fiifi Baffoe Payin Winful, Kafui Kwashie Solaga, Jamal-Deen Abdulai, Akon Obu Ekpezu, Audace Niyonkuru, Samuel Rutunda, Boris Ishimwe, Michael Melese, Engineer Bainomugisha, Joyce Nakatumba-Nabende, Andrew Katumba, Claire Babirye, Jonathan Mukiibi, Vincent Kimani, Samuel Kibacia, James Maina, Fridah Emmah, Ahmed Ibrahim Shekarau, Ibrahim Shehu Adamu, Yusuf Abdullahi, Howard Lakougna, Bob MacDonald, Hadar Shemtov, Aisha Walcott-Bryant, Moustapha Cisse, Avinatan Hassidim, Jeff Dean, Yossi Matias

entry.summary: WAXAL is a large-scale speech dataset for 21 African languages covering 100M+ speakers, with 1,250 hours ASR data and 180 hours TTS data, enabling speech technology for underrepresented languages.

entry.title: MAGIC: A Co-Evolving Attacker-Defender Adversarial Game for Robust LLM Safety

author.name: Xiaoyu Wen, Zhida He, Han Qi, Ziyu Wan, Zhongtian Ma, Ying Wen, Tianhang Zheng, Xingcheng Xu, Chaochao Lu, Qiaosheng Zhang

entry.summary: MAGIC frames LLM safety alignment as an adversarial game where attacker and defender agents co-evolve through multi-turn reinforcement learning, enabling continuous discovery of vulnerabilities and adaptive defense.

entry.title: Universal One-third Time Scaling in Learning Peaked Distributions

author.name: Yizhou Liu, Ziming Liu, Cengiz Pehlevan, Jeff Gore

entry.summary: Shows power-law training dynamics in LLMs arise from softmax and cross-entropy when learning peaked distributions, deriving universal 1/3 exponent from fundamental optimization bottleneck.

entry.title: SWE-Master: Unleashing the Potential of Software Engineering Agents via Post-Training

author.name: Huatong Song, Lisheng Huang, Shuang Sun, Jinhao Jiang, Ran Le, Daixuan Cheng, Guoxin Chen, Yiwen Hu, Zongchao Chen, Wayne Xin Zhao, Yang Song, Tao Zhang, Ji-Rong Wen

entry.summary: SWE-Master presents an open-source post-training framework for software engineering agents covering trajectory synthesis, long-horizon SFT, RL with execution feedback, and inference design.

entry.title: Adversarial Reward Auditing for Active Detection and Mitigation of Reward Hacking

author.name: Mohammad Beigi, Ming Jin, Junshan Zhang, Qifan Wang, Lifu Huang

entry.summary: ARA (Adversarial Reward Auditing) detects reward hacking by training a Hacker policy to discover reward model vulnerabilities while an Auditor learns to detect exploitation, then uses this to gate rewards during RLHF.

entry.title: On the Entropy Dynamics in Reinforcement Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models

author.name: Shumin Wang, Yuexiang Xie, Wenhao Zhang, Yuchang Sun, Yanxi Chen, Yaliang Li, Yanyong Zhang

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical framework for analyzing entropy dynamics during reinforcement fine-tuning of LLMs, deriving discriminant expression and first-order expression for entropy change under logit updates.

entry.title: FactNet: A Billion-Scale Knowledge Graph for Multilingual Factual Grounding

author.name: Yingli Shen, Wen Lai, Jie Zhou, Xueren Zhang, Yudong Wang, Kangyang Luo, Shuo Wang, Ge Gao, Alexander Fraser, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: FactNet unifies 1.7 billion atomic assertions with 3 billion evidence pointers from 316 Wikipedia editions, using deterministic construction for byte-level provenance tracking.

entry.title: Building Better Deception Probes Using Targeted Instruction Pairs

author.name: Vikram Natarajan, Devina Jain, Shivam Arora, Satvik Golechha, Joseph Bloom

entry.summary: Shows that targeted instruction pairs based on a human-interpretable taxonomy of deception significantly improve linear probes for detecting deceptive behavior in AI systems, capturing intent rather than content patterns.

entry.title: Adoption and Use of LLMs at an Academic Medical Center

author.name: Nigam H. Shah, Nerissa Ambers, Abby Pandya, Timothy Keyes, Juan M. Banda, Srikar Nallan, Carlene Lugtu, Artem A. Trotsyuk, Suhana Bedi, Alyssa Unell, Miguel Fuentes, Francois Grolleau, Sneha S. Jain, Jonathan Chen, Devdutta Dash, Danton Char, Aditya Sharma, Duncan McElfresh, Patrick Scully, Vishanthan Kumar, Connor OBrien, Satchi Mouniswamy, Elvis Jones, Krishna Jasti, Gunavathi Mannika Lakshmanan, Sree Ram Akula, Varun Kumar Singh, Ramesh Rajmanickam, Sudhir Sinha, Vicky Zhou, Xu Wang, Bilal Mawji, Joshua Ge, Wencheng Li, Travis Lyons, Jarrod Helzer, Vikas Kakkar, Ramesh Powar, Darren Batara, Cheryl Cordova, William Frederick III, Olivia Tang, Phoebe Morgan, April S. Liang, Stephen P. Ma, Shivam Vedak, Dong-han Yao, Akshay Swaminathan, Mehr Kashyap, Brian Ng, Jamie Hellman, Nikesh Kotecha, Christopher Sharp, Gretchen Brown, Christian Lindmark, Anurang Revri, Michael A. Pfeffer

entry.summary: Describes ChatEHR, a production LLM system deployed at Stanford Medicine enabling use of LLMs with complete patient timelines for chart review, screening, and abstraction tasks with 4,500 unique users.

entry.title: ReasoningBomb: A Stealthy Denial-of-Service Attack by Inducing Pathologically Long Reasoning in Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Xiaogeng Liu, Xinyan Wang, Yechao Zhang, Sanjay Kariyappa, Chong Xiang, Muhao Chen, G. Edward Suh, Chaowei Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces ReasoningBomb, a new denial-of-service attack targeting Large Reasoning Models by crafting prompts that induce pathologically long reasoning traces. Formalizes PI-DoS attacks requiring high amplification ratio, stealthiness, and optimizability.

entry.title: Jailbreaking LLMs via Calibration

author.name: Yuxuan Lu, Yongkang Guo, Yuqing Kong

entry.summary: Models safety alignment as systematic distortion of pre-alignment distribution and derives optimal aggregation strategy for jailbreaking. Shows logit-arithmetic methods are special cases and proposes broader family of aggregation rules.

entry.title: From Perception to Action: Spatial AI Agents and World Models

author.name: Gloria Felicia, Nolan Bryant, Handi Putra, Ayaan Gazali, Eliel Lobo, Esteban Rojas

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey reviewing 2000+ papers (citing 742) that introduces unified three-axis taxonomy connecting agentic capabilities with spatial intelligence for embodied AI. Bridges gap between agentic architectures and spatial reasoning.

entry.title: Infinite-World: Scaling Interactive World Models to 1000-Frame Horizons via Pose-Free Hierarchical Memory

author.name: Ruiqi Wu, Xuanhua He, Meng Cheng, Tianyu Yang, Yong Zhang, Zhuoliang Kang, Xunliang Cai, Xiaoming Wei, Chunle Guo, Chongyi Li, Ming-Ming Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes Infinite-World, an interactive world model maintaining coherent visual memory over 1000+ frames using Hierarchical Pose-free Memory Compressor for recursive latent compression.

entry.title: IMU-1: Sample-Efficient Pre-training of Small Language Models

author.name: George Grigorev

entry.summary: IMU-1 is a 430M parameter LLM trained on only 72B tokens that approaches performance of models trained on 56x more data. Combines architectural innovations (QK-norm, per-head gating) with optimization advances (NorMuon, muP) and releases all artifacts.

entry.title: Late-Stage Generalization Collapse in Grokking: Detecting anti-grokking with Weightwatcher

author.name: Hari K Prakash, Charles H Martin

entry.summary: Identifies anti-grokking: a previously unreported third phase where generalization collapses after successful grokking, with test accuracy returning to chance while training accuracy remains perfect. Uses Weightwatcher to detect this phenomenon.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning with Promising Tokens for Large Language Models

author.name: Jing-Cheng Pang, Liang Lu, Xian Tang, Kun Jiang, Sijie Wu, Kai Zhang, Xubin Li

entry.summary: Proposes RLPT, a framework that reduces the action space in RL for LLMs by focusing only on contextually relevant 'promising' tokens rather than the full vocabulary. Demonstrates that valid reasoning paths concentrate within a low-rank subspace.

entry.title: Anytime Pretraining: Horizon-Free Learning-Rate Schedules with Weight Averaging

author.name: Alexandru Meterez, Pranav Ajit Nair, Depen Morwani, Cengiz Pehlevan, Sham Kakade

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing anytime learning schedules exist for LLM training where horizons are unknown, demonstrating weight averaging achieves minimax rates. Polynomial decay schedules determined by source/capacity conditions.

entry.title: A Positive Case for Faithfulness: LLM Self-Explanations Help Predict Model Behavior

author.name: Harry Mayne, Justin Singh Kang, Dewi Gould, Kannan Ramchandran, Adam Mahdi, Noah Y. Siegel

entry.summary: Introduces Normalized Simulatability Gain metric showing LLM self-explanations help predict model behavior, evaluating 18 frontier models including GPT-5.2, Claude 4.5, Gemini 3.

entry.title: RDT2: Exploring the Scaling Limit of UMI Data Towards Zero-Shot Cross-Embodiment Generalization

author.name: Songming Liu, Bangguo Li, Kai Ma, Lingxuan Wu, Hengkai Tan, Xiao Ouyang, Hang Su, Jun Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces RDT2, a 7B parameter robotic foundation model built on a VLM designed for zero-shot deployment on novel embodiments. Collected over 10,000 hours of demonstrations using enhanced Universal Manipulation Interface and employs novel three-stage training with Residual Vector Quantization.

entry.title: Privasis: Synthesizing the Largest "Public" Private Dataset from Scratch

author.name: Hyunwoo Kim, Niloofar Mireshghallah, Michael Duan, Rui Xin, Shuyue Stella Li, Jaehun Jung, David Acuna, Qi Pang, Hanshen Xiao, G. Edward Suh, Sewoong Oh, Yulia Tsvetkov, Pang Wei Koh, Yejin Choi

entry.summary: Privasis is the first million-scale fully synthetic dataset of privacy-sensitive text built from scratch, designed to enable research on AI agents handling sensitive personal information without real privacy risks.

entry.title: A Lightweight Library for Energy-Based Joint-Embedding Predictive Architectures

author.name: Basile Terver, Randall Balestriero, Megi Dervishi, David Fan, Quentin Garrido, Tushar Nagarajan, Koustuv Sinha, Wancong Zhang, Mike Rabbat, Yann LeCun, Amir Bar

entry.summary: EB-JEPA is an open-source library from Meta for learning representations via Joint-Embedding Predictive Architectures, covering image, video, and action-conditioned world models.

entry.title: EchoJEPA: A Latent Predictive Foundation Model for Echocardiography

author.name: Alif Munim, Adibvafa Fallahpour, Teodora Szasz, Ahmadreza Attarpour, River Jiang, Brana Sooriyakanthan, Maala Sooriyakanthan, Heather Whitney, Jeremy Slivnick, Barry Rubin, Wendy Tsang, Bo Wang

entry.summary: Presents EchoJEPA, a foundation model for echocardiography trained on 18 million echocardiograms from 300K patients - the largest pretraining corpus for this modality. Introduces multi-view probing framework for standardized evaluation.

entry.title: SafePred: A Predictive Guardrail for Computer-Using Agents via World Models

author.name: Yurun Chen, Zeyi Liao, Ping Yin, Taotao Xie, Keting Yin, Shengyu Zhang

entry.summary: SafePred provides predictive guardrails for computer-using agents via world models, addressing long-term risks that reactive guardrails cannot identify within current observation space.

entry.title: PixelGen: Pixel Diffusion Beats Latent Diffusion with Perceptual Loss

author.name: Zehong Ma, Ruihan Xu, Shiliang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes PixelGen, showing that pixel diffusion can beat latent diffusion when trained with perceptual losses (LPIPS + DINO) that guide learning toward a meaningful perceptual manifold.

entry.title: The Alignment Curse: Cross-Modality Jailbreak Transfer in Omni-Models

author.name: Yupeng Chen, Junchi Yu, Aoxi Liu, Philip Torr, Adel Bibi

entry.summary: Discovers 'alignment curse' where strong modality alignment in omni-models propagates textual jailbreak vulnerabilities to audio modality. Proposes attack methods exploiting this cross-modal transfer.

entry.title: Rethinking Benign Relearning: Syntax as the Hidden Driver of Unlearning Failures

author.name: Sangyeon Yoon, Hyesoo Hong, Wonje Jeung, Albert No

entry.summary: Demonstrates that syntactic similarity, not topical relevance, is the primary driver of benign relearning in machine unlearning, with syntactically similar data triggering recovery through aligned representations and gradients.

entry.title: HySparse: A Hybrid Sparse Attention Architecture with Oracle Token Selection and KV Cache Sharing

author.name: Yizhao Gao, Jianyu Wei, Qihao Zhang, Yu Cheng, Shimao Chen, Zhengju Tang, Zihan Jiang, Yifan Song, Hailin Zhang, Liang Zhao, Bo Yang, Gang Wang, Shijie Cao, Fuli Luo

entry.summary: HySparse interleaves full attention with sparse layers, using the full layer as oracle for token selection and sharing KV caches to reduce both computation and memory simultaneously.

entry.title: Understanding the Reversal Curse Mitigation in Masked Diffusion Models through Attention and Training Dynamics

author.name: Sangwoo Shin, BumJun Kim, Kyelim Lee, Moongyu Jeon, Albert No

entry.summary: Explains why masked diffusion models mitigate the reversal curse through weight sharing that couples forward/reverse attention scores, showing this arises from architecture-training interaction rather than just any-order training.

entry.title: The Illusion of Forgetting: Attack Unlearned Diffusion via Initial Latent Variable Optimization

author.name: Manyi Li, Yufan Liu, Lai Jiang, Bing Li, Yuming Li, Weiming Hu

entry.summary: Reveals that diffusion model unlearning creates an 'illusion of forgetting' - NSFW knowledge remains as dormant memories. Proposes IVO attack framework to reactivate these dormant memories by reconstructing broken mappings.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Teams Hold Experts Back

author.name: Aneesh Pappu, Batu El, Hancheng Cao, Carmelo di Nolfo, Yanchao Sun, Meng Cao, James Zou

entry.summary: Studies self-organizing LLM teams across benchmarks finding they consistently fail to achieve synergy, with team performance below best individual member. Important negative result contrasting with human team behavior.

entry.title: Semantic-aware Wasserstein Policy Regularization for Large Language Model Alignment

author.name: Byeonghu Na, Hyungho Na, Yeongmin Kim, Suhyeon Jo, HeeSun Bae, Mina Kang, Il-Chul Moon

entry.summary: Wasserstein Policy Regularization (WPR) replaces KL divergence in RLHF with entropy-regularized Wasserstein distance, incorporating token space geometry for semantic-aware regularization.

entry.title: Flow Policy Gradients for Robot Control

author.name: Brent Yi, Hongsuk Choi, Himanshu Gaurav Singh, Xiaoyu Huang, Takara E. Truong, Carmelo Sferrazza, Yi Ma, Rocky Duan, Pieter Abbeel, Guanya Shi, Karen Liu, Angjoo Kanazawa

entry.summary: Shows that flow matching policy gradients can effectively train robot control policies, with improved objective enabling success in locomotion, manipulation, and sim-to-real transfer on humanoids.

entry.title: Beyond Alignment: Expanding Reasoning Capacity via Manifold-Reshaping Policy Optimization

author.name: Dayu Wang, Jiaye Yang, Weikang Li, Jiahui Liang, Yang Li

entry.summary: MRPO challenges the hypothesis that RL only aligns existing LLM capabilities by demonstrating geometric interventions can fundamentally expand the latent reasoning space beyond pre-trained manifold boundaries.

entry.title: When pre-training hurts LoRA fine-tuning: a dynamical analysis via single-index models

author.name: Gibbs Nwemadji, Bruno Loureiro, Jean Barbier

entry.summary: Mathematically shows that excessive pre-training can computationally slow down LoRA fine-tuning, even when tasks are well-aligned. Characterizes convergence rate dependence on initial alignment and task non-linearity using single-index models.

entry.title: R1-SyntheticVL: Is Synthetic Data from Generative Models Ready for Multimodal Large Language Model?

author.name: Jingyi Zhang, Tianyi Lin, Huanjin Yao, Xiang Lan, Shunyu Liu, Jiaxing Huang

entry.summary: Proposes CADS (Collective Adversarial Data Synthesis) for autonomously synthesizing diverse, challenging multimodal training data using collective intelligence and adversarial learning to improve MLLMs.

entry.title: Reasoning Cache: Continual Improvement Over Long Horizons via Short-Horizon RL

author.name: Ian Wu, Yuxiao Qu, Amrith Setlur, Aviral Kumar

entry.summary: Introduces Reasoning Cache, an iterative decoding algorithm enabling LLMs to extrapolate beyond training budgets by exploiting asymmetry between generation and summarization capabilities.

entry.title: Verified Critical Step Optimization for LLM Agents

author.name: Mukai Li, Qingcheng Zeng, Tianqing Fang, Zhenwen Liang, Linfeng Song, Qi Liu, Haitao Mi, Dong Yu

entry.summary: Critical Step Optimization focuses preference learning on verified critical decision points where alternate actions flip outcomes. Identifies key steps from failed trajectories to enable efficient agent training.

entry.title: WebSentinel: Detecting and Localizing Prompt Injection Attacks for Web Agents

author.name: Xilong Wang, Yinuo Liu, Zhun Wang, Dawn Song, Neil Gong

entry.summary: WebSentinel detects and localizes prompt injection attacks in webpages through segment extraction and consistency checking, substantially outperforming baselines.

entry.title: Seeing Through the Chain: Mitigate Hallucination in Multimodal Reasoning Models via CoT Compression and Contrastive Preference Optimization

author.name: Hao Fang, Jinyu Li, Jiawei Kong, Tianqu Zhuang, Kuofeng Gao, Bin Chen, Shu-Tao Xia, Yaowei Wang

entry.summary: C3PO mitigates hallucinations in multimodal reasoning models through CoT compression to filter redundant tokens and contrastive preference optimization to enhance visual grounding.

entry.title: Assessing Domain-Level Susceptibility to Emergent Misalignment from Narrow Finetuning

author.name: Abhishek Mishra, Mugilan Arulvanan, Reshma Ashok, Polina Petrova, Deepesh Suranjandass, Donnie Winkelmann

entry.summary: Studies emergent misalignment in LLMs finetuned on insecure datasets across 11 domains. Finds backdoor triggers increase misalignment in 77.8% of domains, with financial and legal advice most vulnerable.

entry.title: How RLHF Amplifies Sycophancy

author.name: Itai Shapira, Gerdus Benade, Ariel D. Procaccia

entry.summary: Formal analysis proving RLHF amplifies sycophancy through explicit mechanism linking learned reward optimization to human preference bias via covariance under base policy.

entry.title: Legal Infrastructure for Transformative AI Governance

author.name: Gillian K. Hadfield

entry.summary: PNAS Perspective arguing for legal infrastructure (not just rules) for AI governance, proposing registration regimes for frontier models, identification for autonomous agents, and regulatory markets for private innovation.

entry.title: Emergent Analogical Reasoning in Transformers

author.name: Gouki Minegishi, Jingyuan Feng, Hiroki Furuta, Takeshi Kojima, Yusuke Iwasawa, Yutaka Matsuo

entry.summary: Formalizes analogical reasoning as functor-like inference between categories and studies its emergence in Transformers, finding sensitivity to data characteristics, optimization, and scale with mechanistic analysis.

entry.title: Learning Robust Reasoning through Guided Adversarial Self-Play

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Vaishnav Tadiparthi, Kwonjoon Lee, Nakul Agarwal, Hossein Nourkhiz Mahjoub, Ehsan Moradi Pari, Lizhang Chen, Amy Zhang, Liu Leqi

entry.summary: GASP introduces adversarial self-play within a single model to robustify reasoning: a polluter induces failures while an agent learns to diagnose and recover. Trains detect-and-repair capabilities using only outcome verification.

entry.title: ZEST: Zero-shot Embodied Skill Transfer for Athletic Robot Control

author.name: Jean Pierre Sleiman, He Li, Alphonsus Adu-Bredu, Robin Deits, Arun Kumar, Kevin Bergamin, Mohak Bhardwaj, Scott Biddlestone, Nicola Burger, Matthew A. Estrada, Francesco Iacobelli, Twan Koolen, Alexander Lambert, Erica Lin, M. Eva Mungai, Zach Nobles, Shane Rozen-Levy, Yuyao Shi, Jiashun Wang, Jakob Welner, Fangzhou Yu, Mike Zhang, Alfred Rizzi, Jessica Hodgins, Sylvain Bertrand, Yeuhi Abe, Scott Kuindersma, Farbod Farshidian

entry.summary: ZEST enables zero-shot transfer of athletic skills to humanoid robots from diverse motion sources (mocap, video, animation) without contact labels or extensive reward shaping.

entry.title: MCP-Atlas: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Tool-Use Competency with Real MCP Servers

author.name: Chaithanya Bandi, Ben Hertzberg, Geobio Boo, Tejas Polakam, Jeff Da, Sami Hassaan, Manasi Sharma, Andrew Park, Ernesto Hernandez, Dan Rambado, Ivan Salazar, Rafael Cruz, Chetan Rane, Ben Levin, Brad Kenstler, Bing Liu

entry.summary: Introduces MCP-Atlas benchmark with 36 real MCP servers, 220 tools, and 1000 tasks requiring 3-6 tool calls. Uses deterministic scoring avoiding LLM-as-judge issues.

entry.title: How Does Unfaithful Reasoning Emerge from Autoregressive Training? A Study of Synthetic Experiments

author.name: Fuxin Wang, Amr Alazali, Yiqiao Zhong

entry.summary: Studies how unfaithful CoT reasoning emerges in autoregressive training through synthetic experiments on modular arithmetic. Shows faithful reasoning requires sufficiently clean training data.

entry.title: Good SFT Optimizes for SFT, Better SFT Prepares for Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Dylan Zhang, Yufeng Xu, Haojin Wang, Qingzhi Chen, Hao Peng

entry.summary: Shows that stronger SFT checkpoints can significantly underperform weaker ones after RL training due to distribution mismatch. Proposes PEAR, an SFT method that re-weights losses to prepare for subsequent RL training.

entry.title: A Relative-Budget Theory for Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards in Large Language Model Reasoning

author.name: Akifumi Wachi, Hirota Kinoshita, Shokichi Takakura, Rei Higuchi, Taiji Suzuki

entry.summary: Proposes relative-budget theory explaining RL effectiveness for LLM reasoning through single quantity ξ=H/E[T]. Identifies three regimes: deficient, emergent, and saturated based on token budget relative to solution difficulty.

entry.title: A Practical Tensor-Network Compression Pipeline for Production-Scale Large Language Models

author.name: Sergii Kozyrev (Minima AI, Inc.), Davyd Maiboroda (Minima AI, Inc.)

entry.summary: Minima presents a production-ready LLM compression pipeline using tensor decompositions (Tucker, tensor-train, tensor-ring) with learned sensitivity prediction and custom Triton/CUDA kernels. Claims 64GB to unspecified reduction on Qwen3-32B with maintained quality.

entry.title: RedVisor: Reasoning-Aware Prompt Injection Defense via Zero-Copy KV Cache Reuse

author.name: Mingrui Liu, Sixiao Zhang, Cheng Long, Kwok-Yan Lam

entry.summary: RedVisor defends against prompt injection by leveraging fine-grained reasoning paths to simultaneously detect attacks and guide safe responses, using zero-copy KV cache reuse for efficiency.

entry.title: ReasonCACHE: Teaching LLMs To Reason Without Weight Updates

author.name: Sharut Gupta, Phillip Isola, Stefanie Jegelka, David Lopez-Paz, Kartik Ahuja, Mark Ibrahim, Mohammad Pezeshki

entry.summary: Demonstrates that LLMs can learn to reason without weight updates through Prefix Tuning-based in-context learning (ReasonCACHE), bypassing context window limitations that plague naive ICL scaling.

entry.title: How Much Information Can a Vision Token Hold? A Scaling Law for Recognition Limits in VLMs

author.name: Shuxin Zhuang, Zi Liang, Runsheng Yu, Hongzong Li, Rong Feng, Shiqin Tang, Youzhi Zhang

entry.summary: Discovers phase-transition behavior in vision tokens where recognition has stable, unstable, and saturated regimes. Derives scaling law relating character count to token requirements with predictable transition points.

entry.title: Maximum Likelihood Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Fahim Tajwar, Guanning Zeng, Yueer Zhou, Yuda Song, Daman Arora, Yiding Jiang, Jeff Schneider, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Haiwen Feng, Andrea Zanette

entry.summary: MaxRL introduces framework connecting RL to maximum likelihood, showing standard RL optimizes only lower-order approximation. Proposes compute-indexed objectives interpolating between gradient estimation and enumeration.

entry.title: Tabula RASA: Exposing and Breaking the Relational Bottleneck in Transformers

author.name: Jonas Petersen, Camilla Mazzoleni, Riccardo Maggioni

entry.summary: Analyzes transformer limitations for multi-hop relational reasoning through circuit complexity lens, showing TC^0-completeness requires Ω(k) layers for k-hop reasoning. Proposes RASA with edge-type embeddings and sparse masking to address relational bottleneck.

entry.title: Entropy-Gated Selective Policy Optimization:Token-Level Gradient Allocation for Hybrid Training of Large Language Models

author.name: Yuelin Hu, Zhengxue Cheng, Wei Liu, Li Song

entry.summary: Introduces EGSPO, a three-stage framework combining SFT with RL that applies entropy-gated gradient allocation at the token level, routing high-entropy tokens to PPO and low-entropy tokens to SFT.

entry.title: Reasoning with Latent Tokens in Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Andre He, Sean Welleck, Daniel Fried

entry.summary: Investigates discrete diffusion language models' reasoning advantage, tracing it to joint prediction over unknown tokens. Introduces latent tokens concept and method to modulate their number for efficiency.

entry.title: Understanding Agent Scaling in LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems via Diversity

author.name: Yingxuan Yang, Chengrui Qu, Muning Wen, Laixi Shi, Ying Wen, Weinan Zhang, Adam Wierman, Shangding Gu

entry.summary: Presents information-theoretic framework showing multi-agent system performance is bounded by intrinsic task uncertainty, not agent count. Demonstrates improvements depend on effective information gain from agent diversity, explaining why heterogeneous MAS outperforms homogeneous scaling.

entry.title: The Hypocrisy Gap: Quantifying Divergence Between Internal Belief and Chain-of-Thought Explanation via Sparse Autoencoders

author.name: Shikhar Shiromani, Archie Chaudhury, Sri Pranav Kunda

entry.summary: Introduces Hypocrisy Gap metric using Sparse Autoencoders to quantify divergence between LLM's internal reasoning and final generation, detecting unfaithful behavior where answers differ from chain-of-thought. Tests on sycophancy benchmark across Gemma, Llama, Qwen.

entry.title: Test-time Recursive Thinking: Self-Improvement without External Feedback

author.name: Yufan Zhuang, Chandan Singh, Liyuan Liu, Yelong Shen, Dinghuai Zhang, Jingbo Shang, Jianfeng Gao, Weizhu Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Test-time Recursive Thinking (TRT), an iterative self-improvement framework using rollout-specific strategies and self-generated verification, achieving 100% accuracy on AIME without external training. Shows open-source models matching frontier performance.

entry.title: FASA: Frequency-aware Sparse Attention

author.name: Yifei Wang, Yueqi Wang, Zhenrui Yue, Huimin Zeng, Yong Wang, Ismini Lourentzou, Zhengzhong Tu, Xiangxiang Chu, Julian McAuley

entry.summary: FASA achieves query-aware token eviction in KV cache by dynamically predicting token importance through novel insights about RoPE functional sparsity at frequency-chunk level.

entry.title: VALUEFLOW: Toward Pluralistic and Steerable Value-based Alignment in Large Language Models

author.name: Woojin Kim, Sieun Hyeon, Jusang Oh, Jaeyoung Do

entry.summary: VALUEFLOW is the first unified framework spanning value extraction, evaluation, and steering with calibrated intensity control through hierarchical value embedding space.

entry.title: A generalizable large-scale foundation model for musculoskeletal radiographs

author.name: Shinn Kim, Soobin Lee, Kyoungseob Shin, Han-Soo Kim, Yongsung Kim, Minsu Kim, Juhong Nam, Somang Ko, Daeheon Kwon, Wook Huh, Ilkyu Han, Sunghoon Kwon

entry.summary: SKELEX is a foundation model for musculoskeletal radiographs trained via self-supervised learning on 1.2 million diverse images. Demonstrates generalizability across diseases and anatomical regions.

entry.title: RLAnything: Forge Environment, Policy, and Reward Model in Completely Dynamic RL System

author.name: Yinjie Wang, Tianbao Xie, Ke Shen, Mengdi Wang, Ling Yang

entry.summary: Proposes RLAnything, an RL framework that dynamically optimizes environment, policy, and reward models in a closed loop for LLMs and agentic scenarios. Uses consistency feedback and automatic environment adaptation.

entry.title: AI Safety at the Frontier: Paper Highlights of January 2026

author.name: gasteigerjo

entry.summary: Monthly summary of important AI safety papers from January 2026. Highlights include activation probes for jailbreak detection now deployed at Anthropic/GDM, findings that fine-tuning on safeguarded model outputs recovers 71% of harmful capabilities, and that AI discourse in pretraining increases misalignment.

entry.title: What LLMs Think When You Don't Tell Them What to Think About?

author.name: Yongchan Kwon, James Zou

entry.summary: Studies LLM outputs from minimal, topic-neutral prompts, finding that model families exhibit strong systematic topical preferences: GPT-OSS generates programming/math content while Llama generates literary content.

entry.title: Mitigating Safety Tax via Distribution-Grounded Refinement in Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Yingsha Xie, Tiansheng Huang, Enneng Yang, Rui Min, Wenjie Lu, Xiaochun Cao, Naiqiang Tan, Li Shen

entry.summary: DGR addresses 'safety tax' (reasoning degradation from alignment) by refining out-of-distribution safety datasets to match target LRM's internal distribution.

entry.title: LSSF: Safety Alignment for Large Language Models through Low-Rank Safety Subspace Fusion

author.name: Guanghao Zhou, Panjia Qiu, Cen Chen, Hongyu Li, Mingyuan Chu, Xin Zhang, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces LSSF framework for LLM safety re-alignment using low-rank projection to extract principal safety components, enabling efficient safety restoration without extensive fine-tuning.

entry.title: Beyond the Loss Curve: Scaling Laws, Active Learning, and the Limits of Learning from Exact Posteriors

author.name: Arian Khorasani, Nathaniel Chen, Yug D Oswal, Akshat Santhana Gopalan, Egemen Kolemen, Ravid Shwartz-Ziv

entry.summary: Uses normalizing flows as oracles providing exact posteriors to decompose neural network error into aleatoric and epistemic components, revealing power-law scaling of epistemic error and architecture-specific behaviors.

entry.title: Rethinking Hallucinations: Correctness, Consistency, and Prompt Multiplicity

author.name: Prakhar Ganesh, Reza Shokri, Golnoosh Farnadi

entry.summary: Introduces prompt multiplicity framework for quantifying hallucination consistency, finding over 50% inconsistency in benchmarks like Med-HALT. Shows consistency is crucial for both detection and mitigation.

entry.title: Beyond Mode Elicitation: Diversity-Preserving Reinforcement Learning via Latent Diffusion Reasoner

author.name: Haoqiang Kang, Yizhe Zhang, Nikki Lijing Kuang, Yi-An Ma, Lianhui Qin

entry.summary: LaDi-RL conducts exploration in continuous latent space via guided diffusion to preserve multiple solution modes in LLM reasoning, addressing diversity collapse from discrete RL.

entry.title: On the Limits of Layer Pruning for Generative Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Safal Shrestha, Anubhav Shrestha, Aadim Nepal, Minwu Kim, Keith Ross

entry.summary: Systematic study finding layer pruning causes severe degradation on generative reasoning tasks despite retaining classification performance. Identifies limits of depth reduction for multi-step reasoning.

entry.title: Effective Frontiers: A Unification of Neural Scaling Laws

author.name: Jiaxuan Zou, Zixuan Gong, Ye Su, Huayi Tang, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes unified scaling law framework based on Effective Frontier concept - threshold in pattern rank space separating learned from unlearned knowledge. Derives scaling laws from Zipfian pattern distribution.

entry.title: Quantized Evolution Strategies: High-precision Fine-tuning of Quantized LLMs at Low-precision Cost

author.name: Yinggan Xu, Risto Miikkulainen, Xin Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces Quantized Evolution Strategies (QES) for fine-tuning quantized LLMs directly in discrete parameter space without dequantization, enabling full-parameter optimization at low-precision cost.

entry.title: Unveiling Covert Toxicity in Multimodal Data via Toxicity Association Graphs: A Graph-Based Metric and Interpretable Detection Framework

author.name: Guanzong Wu, Zihao Zhu, Siwei Lyu, Baoyuan Wu

entry.summary: Proposes Toxicity Association Graphs (TAGs) for detecting hidden toxicity in multimodal data and introduces Multimodal Toxicity Covertness (MTC) as the first quantifiable metric for measuring concealment in toxic content.

entry.title: Antidistillation Fingerprinting

author.name: Yixuan Even Xu, John Kirchenbauer, Yash Savani, Asher Trockman, Alexander Robey, Tom Goldstein, Fei Fang, J. Zico Kolter

entry.summary: Introduces antidistillation fingerprinting (ADFP) to detect when student models have trained on a teacher's outputs, aligning fingerprinting with student learning dynamics.

entry.title: Learning to Reason Faithfully through Step-Level Faithfulness Maximization

author.name: Runquan Gui, Yafu Li, Xiaoye Qu, Ziyan Liu, Yeqiu Cheng, Yu Cheng

entry.summary: FaithRL directly optimizes reasoning faithfulness through a geometric reward design and faithfulness-aware advantage modulation, theoretically showing this mitigates overconfidence.

entry.title: SWE-World: Building Software Engineering Agents in Docker-Free Environments

author.name: Shuang Sun, Huatong Song, Lisheng Huang, Jinhao Jiang, Ran Le, Zhihao Lv, Zongchao Chen, Yiwen Hu, Wenyang Luo, Wayne Xin Zhao, Yang Song, Hongteng Xu, Tao Zhang, Ji-Rong Wen

entry.summary: SWE-World replaces Docker environments with learned surrogate models for training and evaluating software engineering agents, enabling scalable agent development without physical execution.

entry.title: MM-SCALE: Grounded Multimodal Moral Reasoning via Scalar Judgment and Listwise Alignment

author.name: Eunkyu Park, Wesley Hanwen Deng, Cheyon Jin, Matheus Kunzler Maldaner, Jordan Wheeler, Jason I. Hong, Hong Shen, Adam Perer, Ken Holstein, Motahhare Eslami, Gunhee Kim

entry.summary: MM-SCALE provides large-scale dataset for multimodal moral reasoning with 5-point scalar ratings and explicit modality grounding, enabling listwise preference optimization.

entry.title: ProjDevBench: Benchmarking AI Coding Agents on End-to-End Project Development

author.name: Pengrui Lu, Shiqi Zhang, Yunzhong Hou, Lyumanshan Ye, Chaoyi Huang, Zixi Chen, Ji Zeng, Hantao Jiang, Pengfei Liu, Yiwei Wang, Ming-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: ProjDevBench evaluates coding agents on end-to-end project development from requirements to repositories, combining Online Judge testing with LLM-assisted code review across architecture, correctness, and refinement dimensions.

entry.title: Light Alignment Improves LLM Safety via Model Self-Reflection with a Single Neuron

author.name: Sicheng Shen, Mingyang Lv, Han Shen, Jialin Wu, Binghao Wang, Zhou Yang, Guobin Shen, Dongcheng Zhao, Feifei Zhao, Yi Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight safety alignment using a single neuron as gating mechanism for safety-aware decoding, requiring only low-cost expert model training.

entry.title: The Multiple Ticket Hypothesis: Random Sparse Subnetworks Suffice for RLVR

author.name: Israel Adewuyi, Solomon Okibe, Vladmir Ivanov

entry.summary: Proposes Multiple Ticket Hypothesis showing that training random 1% of parameters matches or exceeds full-parameter RLVR finetuning across models and tasks. Different random masks show minimal overlap yet all succeed.

entry.title: Softmax Linear Attention: Reclaiming Global Competition

author.name: Mingwei Xu, Xuan Lin, Xinnan Guo, Wanqing Xu, Wanyun Cui

entry.summary: Softmax Linear Attention restores global competition in linear attention by lifting softmax from token to head level, using attention heads as semantic slots with competitive gating.

entry.title: Beyond RAG for Agent Memory: Retrieval by Decoupling and Aggregation

author.name: Zhanghao Hu, Qinglin Zhu, Hanqi Yan, Yulan He, Lin Gui

entry.summary: Argues agent memory should use decoupling-to-aggregation over standard RAG: disentangle memories into semantic components and organize hierarchically rather than similarity matching.

entry.title: Scalable Spatio-Temporal SE(3) Diffusion for Long-Horizon Protein Dynamics

author.name: Nima Shoghi, Yuxuan Liu, Yuning Shen, Rob Brekelmans, Pan Li, Quanquan Gu

entry.summary: Presents STAR-MD, an SE(3)-equivariant diffusion model that generates physically plausible protein trajectories over microsecond timescales using causal diffusion transformer with joint spatio-temporal attention.

entry.title: World-Gymnast: Training Robots with Reinforcement Learning in a World Model

author.name: Ansh Kumar Sharma, Yixiang Sun, Ninghao Lu, Yunzhe Zhang, Jiarao Liu, Sherry Yang

entry.summary: Proposes World-Gymnast, training VLA policies via RL in learned world models, demonstrating that world model training can be more effective than supervised learning or software simulation.

entry.title: Step-Wise Refusal Dynamics in Autoregressive and Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Eliron Rahimi, Elad Hirshel, Rom Himelstein, Amit LeVi, Avi Mendelson, Chaim Baskin

entry.summary: Compares refusal dynamics between autoregressive and diffusion language models, showing sampling strategy itself shapes safety behavior independently of learned representations. Introduces STRID framework.

entry.title: Quant VideoGen: Auto-Regressive Long Video Generation via 2-Bit KV-Cache Quantization

author.name: Haocheng Xi, Shuo Yang, Yilong Zhao, Muyang Li, Han Cai, Xingyang Li, Yujun Lin, Zhuoyang Zhang, Jintao Zhang, Xiuyu Li, Zhiying Xu, Jun Wu, Chenfeng Xu, Ion Stoica, Song Han, Kurt Keutzer

entry.summary: Presents Quant VideoGen enabling 2-bit KV-cache quantization for autoregressive video diffusion models, reducing memory from 30GB+ to deployable levels while maintaining long-horizon consistency.

entry.title: Beyond Suffixes: Token Position in GCG Adversarial Attacks on Large Language Models

author.name: Hicham Eddoubi, Umar Faruk Abdullahi, Fadi Hassan

entry.summary: Demonstrates that adversarial token position (not just suffix placement) significantly affects GCG attack success rates, revealing a previously underexplored axis in jailbreak attack research.

entry.title: Not All Negative Samples Are Equal: LLMs Learn Better from Plausible Reasoning

author.name: Zixiang Di, Jinyi Han, Shuo Zhang, Ying Liao, Zhi Li, Xiaofeng Ji, Yongqi Wang, Zheming Yang, Ming Gao, Bingdong Li, Jie Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Plausible Negative Samples (PNS) using reverse RL to synthesize high-quality negative samples that look nearly correct but yield wrong answers, improving LLM reasoning training.

entry.title: A-RAG: Scaling Agentic Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Hierarchical Retrieval Interfaces

author.name: Mingxuan Du, Benfeng Xu, Chiwei Zhu, Shaohan Wang, Pengyu Wang, Xiaorui Wang, Zhendong Mao

entry.summary: A-RAG exposes hierarchical retrieval interfaces (keyword search, semantic search, chunk read) directly to models, allowing them to participate in retrieval decisions for scalable agentic RAG.

entry.title: Global Geometry Is Not Enough for Vision Representations

author.name: Jiwan Chung, Seon Joo Kim

entry.summary: Demonstrates that global geometric metrics of vision representations fail to predict compositional binding, while functional sensitivity via Jacobians reliably tracks this capability.

entry.title: When Attention Betrays: Erasing Backdoor Attacks in Robotic Policies by Reconstructing Visual Tokens

author.name: Xuetao Li, Pinhan Fu, Wenke Huang, Nengyuan Pan, Songhua Yang, Kaiyan Zhao, Guancheng Wan, Mengde Li, Jifeng Xuan, Miao Li

entry.summary: Introduces Bera, a test-time backdoor erasure framework for VLA models. Discovers that backdoors redirect late-stage attention and form compact embedding clusters, enabling detection and masking.

entry.title: Not All Preferences Are Created Equal: Stability-Aware and Gradient-Efficient Alignment for Reasoning Models

author.name: Hui Wu, Hengyi Cai, Jinman Zhao, Xinran Chen, Ziheng Li, Zhejun Zhao, Shuaiqiang Wang, Yuchen Li, Dawei Yin

entry.summary: Proposes SAGE, a dynamic framework for preference-based alignment that maximizes signal-to-noise ratio of policy updates by using curriculum learning and filtering samples near uncertain decision boundaries.

entry.title: Reasoning with Autoregressive-Diffusion Collaborative Thoughts

author.name: Mu Yuan, Liekang Zeng, Guoliang Xing, Lan Zhang, Yunhao Liu

entry.summary: Collaborative Thoughts unifies autoregressive and diffusion models for reasoning through closed-loop interaction, where autoregressive models handle planning/constraints and diffusion models provide spatial grounding.

entry.title: Structure Enables Effective Self-Localization of Errors in LLMs

author.name: Ankur Samanta, Akshayaa Magesh, Ayush Jain, Kavosh Asadi, Youliang Yu, Daniel Jiang, Boris Vidolov, Kaveh Hassani, Paul Sajda, Jalaj Bhandari, Yonathan Efroni

entry.summary: Shows that structuring reasoning into discrete thought steps enables reliable error self-localization, proposing Thought-ICS for iterative self-correction through resampling at error points.

entry.title: Avenir-Web: Human-Experience-Imitating Multimodal Web Agents with Mixture of Grounding Experts

author.name: Aiden Yiliu Li, Xinyue Hao, Shilong Liu, Mengdi Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Avenir-Web, a web agent achieving new open-source SOTA on Online-Mind2Web benchmark through Mixture of Grounding Experts, Experience-Imitation Planning, and task-tracking checklists. Addresses key limitations in web automation including element grounding, procedural knowledge, and long-term task tracking.

entry.title: CARE-RFT: Confidence-Anchored Reinforcement Finetuning for Reliable Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Jincheng Cao, Bodun Hu, Aryan Mokhtari, Leqi Liu, Amy Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces CARE-RFT using skew reverse KL divergence for reinforcement finetuning that balances reasoning performance with trustworthiness, addressing tradeoff between exploration and calibration.

entry.title: The Blessing of Dimensionality in LLM Fine-tuning: A Variance-Curvature Perspective

author.name: Qiyao Liang, Jinyeop Song, Yizhou Liu, Jeff Gore, Ila Fiete, Risto Miikkulainen, Xin Qiu

entry.summary: Explains why evolution strategies can fine-tune billion-parameter LLMs with surprisingly small populations (~30), contradicting curse-of-dimensionality intuition. Shows fine-tuning landscapes are low-dimensional in curvature.

entry.title: Learning to Decode Against Compositional Hallucination in Video Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Wenbin Xing, Quanxing Zha, Lizheng Zu, Mengran Li, Ming Li, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Introduces OmniVCHall, a benchmark for compositional hallucinations in video multimodal LLMs spanning diverse domains. Evaluation of 39 VLLMs reveals even advanced models struggle with complex spatial-temporal reasoning.

entry.title: JTok: On Token Embedding as another Axis of Scaling Law via Joint Token Self-modulation

author.name: Yebin Yang, Huaijin Wu, Fu Guo, Lin Yao, Xiaohan Qin, Jingzhi Wang, Debing Zhang, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Proposes JTok, using token-indexed parameters as orthogonal scaling axis that decouples capacity from FLOPs. Introduces lightweight modulation through auxiliary embedding tables.

entry.title: Superposition unifies power-law training dynamics

author.name: Zixin Jessie Chen, Hao Chen, Yizhou Liu, Jeff Gore

entry.summary: Investigates feature superposition's role in power-law training dynamics using a teacher-student framework. Discovers that superposition induces a universal power-law exponent of ~1 regardless of data statistics, enabling 10x acceleration over sequential learning.

entry.title: EverMemBench: Benchmarking Long-Term Interactive Memory in Large Language Models

author.name: Chuanrui Hu, Tong Li, Xingze Gao, Hongda Chen, Yi Bai, Dannong Xu, Tianwei Lin, Xinda Zhao, Xiaohong Li, Yunyun Han, Jian Pei, Yafeng Deng

entry.summary: Introduces EverMemBench, a benchmark for long-term conversational memory featuring multi-party conversations over 1M tokens with temporal evolution and cross-topic interleaving. Reveals severe limitations in multi-hop and temporal reasoning.

entry.title: TQL: Scaling Q-Functions with Transformers by Preventing Attention Collapse

author.name: Perry Dong, Kuo-Han Hung, Alexander Swerdlow, Dorsa Sadigh, Chelsea Finn

entry.summary: Identifies attention collapse as critical failure mode preventing transformer scaling for RL value functions. Proposes TQL that controls attention entropy to enable larger Q-function models.

entry.title: HuPER: A Human-Inspired Framework for Phonetic Perception

author.name: Chenxu Guo, Jiachen Lian, Yisi Liu, Baihe Huang, Shriyaa Narayanan, Cheol Jun Cho, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: HuPER achieves state-of-the-art phonetic error rates on five English benchmarks using only 100 hours of training data and enables zero-shot transfer to 95 unseen languages. Models phonetic perception as adaptive inference over acoustic-phonetic evidence.

entry.title: A Provable Expressiveness Hierarchy in Hybrid Linear-Full Attention

author.name: Xiaowei Ye, Xiaoyu He, Chao Liao, Chen Wu, Pinyan Lu

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical expressiveness hierarchy among full, linear, and hybrid attention mechanisms for sequential function composition tasks requiring multi-step reasoning within single forward pass.

entry.title: Beyond Precision: Training-Inference Mismatch is an Optimization Problem and Simple LR Scheduling Fixes It

author.name: Yaxiang Zhang, Yingru Li, Jiacai Liu, Jiawei Xu, Ziniu Li, Qian Liu, Haoyuan Li

entry.summary: Analyzes training-inference mismatch in RL for LLMs as optimization problem, showing gradient noise and mismatch escalate together. Proposes simple LR scheduling fix.

entry.title: Unifying Masked Diffusion Models with Various Generation Orders and Beyond

author.name: Chunsan Hong, Sanghyun Lee, Jong Chul Ye

entry.summary: Proposes OeMDM and LoMDM, frameworks unifying masked diffusion models, autoregressive models, and block diffusion under a single formalism with learnable generation orders.

entry.title: Poly-attention: a general scheme for higher-order self-attention

author.name: Sayak Chakrabarti, Toniann Pitassi, Josh Alman

entry.summary: Defines poly-attention, a general class of higher-order self-attention mechanisms that can model polyadic token interactions while achieving favorable running time trade-offs.

entry.title: Toward Ultra-Long-Horizon Sequential Model Editing

author.name: Mingda Liu, Zhenghan Zhu, Ze'an Miao, Katsuki Fujisawa

entry.summary: Addresses model collapse in long-sequence model editing by identifying correlation with explosive weight norm growth. Provides theoretical proof and practical solution through norm-controlled updates.

entry.title: Every Bit Counts: A Theoretical Study of Precision-Expressivity Tradeoffs in Quantized Transformers

author.name: Sayak Chakrabarti, Toniann Pitassi, Josh Alman

entry.summary: Proves fine-grained tradeoff between quantization precision and transformer expressivity: specific equality-like functions require exactly p bits, not p-1. Explains quantization sensitivity for certain tasks.

entry.title: A Single Revision Step Improves Token-Efficient LLM Reasoning

author.name: Yingchuan Zhang, Terry Ma, Wenxuan Zhong, Ping Ma

entry.summary: Introduces PACER, a training-free inference framework enabling LLM reasoning traces to peer-review each other to resolve near-miss errors in trajectory voting. Addresses blind spots in standard majority voting where hallucinated paths can suppress correct solutions.

entry.title: Merging Beyond: Streaming LLM Updates via Activation-Guided Rotations

author.name: Yuxuan Yao, Haonan Sheng, Qingsong Lv, Han Wu, Shuqi Liu, Zehua Liu, Zengyan Liu, Jiahui Gao, Haochen Tan, Xiaojin Fu, Haoli Bai, Hing Cheung So, Zhijiang Guo, Linqi Song

entry.summary: Proposes ARM (Activation-guided Rotation-aware Merging) for streaming model updates that treats merging as iterative optimization process, approximating gradient descent dynamics rather than post-hoc refinement.

entry.title: Riemannian Neural Optimal Transport

author.name: Alessandro Micheli, Yueqi Cao, Anthea Monod, Samir Bhatt

entry.summary: Introduces Riemannian Neural OT, proving curse of dimensionality for discrete transport map approximations and developing neural approach for continuous OT maps on manifolds.

entry.title: Explanations Leak: Membership Inference with Differential Privacy and Active Learning Defense

author.name: Fatima Ezzeddine, Osama Zammar, Silvia Giordano, Omran Ayoub

entry.summary: Demonstrates that counterfactual explanations in MLaaS expand attack surface for membership inference, and proposes defense combining differential privacy with active learning.

entry.title: Inference-time Unlearning Using Conformal Prediction

author.name: Somnath Basu Roy Chowdhury, Rahul Kidambi, Avinava Dubey, David Wang, Gokhan Mergen, Amr Ahmed, Aranyak Mehta

entry.summary: Proposes inference-time unlearning using conformal prediction, enabling removal of specific information without retraining while preserving model capabilities.
