entry.title: Methods and Open Problems in Differentiable Social Choice: Learning Mechanisms, Decisions, and Alignment

author.name: Zhiyu An, Wan Du

entry.summary: Survey on differentiable social choice covering voting rules, mechanisms, and aggregation as learnable models, relevant to auctions, federated learning, and LLM alignment.

entry.title: ForesightKV: Optimizing KV Cache Eviction for Reasoning Models by Learning Long-Term Contribution

author.name: Zican Dong, Peiyu Liu, Junyi Li, Zhipeng Chen, Han Peng, Shuo Wang, Wayne Xin Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces ForesightKV, a training-based KV cache eviction framework that learns to predict optimal evictions during long reasoning traces using a Golden Eviction algorithm. Addresses the memory and computation costs of expanding KV caches in reasoning LLMs.

entry.title: Accordion-Thinking: Self-Regulated Step Summaries for Efficient and Readable LLM Reasoning

author.name: Zhicheng Yang, Zhijiang Guo, Yinya Huang, Yongxin Wang, Wenlei Shi, Yiwei Wang, Xiaodan Liang, Jing Tang

entry.summary: Introduces Accordion-Thinking, where LLMs learn to self-regulate reasoning granularity through dynamic summarization, enabling a Fold mode that periodically summarizes and discards former thoughts. Uses RL to minimize the accuracy gap between efficient Fold and exhaustive Unfold modes.

entry.title: Accurate Failure Prediction in Agents Does Not Imply Effective Failure Prevention

author.name: Rakshith Vasudev, Melisa Russak, Dan Bikel, Waseem Alshikh

entry.summary: Demonstrates that LLM critics with high offline accuracy (AUROC 0.94) can cause severe performance degradation (26pp collapse) at deployment, revealing a disruption-recovery tradeoff where interventions may disrupt successful trajectories. Proposes pre-deployment test using 50 tasks.

entry.title: $V_0$: A Generalist Value Model for Any Policy at State Zero

author.name: Yi-Kai Zhang, Zhiyuan Yao, Hongyan Hao, Yueqing Sun, Qi Gu, Hui Su, Xunliang Cai, De-Chuan Zhan, Han-Jia Ye

entry.summary: Proposes V_0, a generalist value model that estimates any policy's expected reward at state zero, eliminating the need for synchronous critic training during LLM policy optimization with PPO.

entry.title: Conformal Thinking: Risk Control for Reasoning on a Compute Budget

author.name: Xi Wang, Anushri Suresh, Alvin Zhang, Rishi More, William Jurayj, Benjamin Van Durme, Mehrdad Farajtabar, Daniel Khashabi, Eric Nalisnick

entry.summary: Proposes Conformal Thinking for risk control in reasoning LLMs, introducing upper threshold to stop confident reasoning and lower threshold to preemptively stop unsolvable instances, using conformal prediction for guarantees.

entry.title: CPMobius: Iterative Coach-Player Reasoning for Data-Free Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Ran Li, Zeyuan Liu, Yinghao chen, Bingxiang He, Jiarui Yuan, Zixuan Fu, Weize Chen, Jinyi Hu, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Introduces CPMobius, a Coach-Player paradigm for data-free RL of reasoning models inspired by sports collaboration. Coach generates problems, Player solves, enabling self-reinforcing learning without human-curated data.

entry.title: One Model, All Roles: Multi-Turn, Multi-Agent Self-Play Reinforcement Learning for Conversational Social Intelligence

author.name: Bowen Jiang, Taiwei Shi, Ryo Kamoi, Yuan Yuan, Camillo J. Taylor, Longqi Yang, Pei Zhou, Sihao Chen

entry.summary: Presents OMAR, an RL framework where a single model plays all participants in conversations simultaneously to develop social intelligence. Uses hierarchical advantage estimation for training stability in long dialogues.

entry.title: CL-bench: A Benchmark for Context Learning

author.name: Shihan Dou, Ming Zhang, Zhangyue Yin, Chenhao Huang, Yujiong Shen, Junzhe Wang, Jiayi Chen, Yuchen Ni, Junjie Ye, Cheng Zhang, Huaibing Xie, Jianglu Hu, Shaolei Wang, Weichao Wang, Yanling Xiao, Yiting Liu, Zenan Xu, Zhen Guo, Pluto Zhou, Tao Gui, Zuxuan Wu, Xipeng Qiu, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang, Yu-Gang Jiang, Di Wang, Shunyu Yao

entry.summary: CL-bench evaluates context learning - the ability to learn from task-specific context and apply new knowledge. Contains 500 complex contexts and 1,899 tasks crafted by domain experts.

entry.title: FaceLinkGen: Rethinking Identity Leakage in Privacy-Preserving Face Recognition with Identity Extraction

author.name: Wenqi Guo, Shan Du

entry.summary: FaceLinkGen demonstrates identity extraction attacks on privacy-preserving face recognition achieving 98%+ matching accuracy, exposing structural security gaps in current PPFR systems.

entry.title: IVC-Prune: Revealing the Implicit Visual Coordinates in LVLMs for Vision Token Pruning

author.name: Zhichao Sun, Yidong Ma, Gang Liu, Yibo Chen, Xu Tang, Yao Hu, Yongchao Xu

entry.summary: IVC-Prune reveals that LVLMs implicitly establish visual coordinate systems through RoPE, identifying implicit visual coordinate tokens essential for spatial reasoning. Uses this insight for principled vision token pruning.

entry.title: LIVE: Long-horizon Interactive Video World Modeling

author.name: Junchao Huang, Ziyang Ye, Xinting Hu, Tianyu He, Guiyu Zhang, Shaoshuai Shi, Jiang Bian, Li Jiang

entry.summary: LIVE enables long-horizon interactive video world modeling through cycle-consistency objective that bounds error accumulation without teacher distillation.

entry.title: Bimanual High-Density EMG Control for In-Home Mobile Manipulation by a User with Quadriplegia

author.name: Jehan Yang, Eleanor Hodgson, Cindy Sun, Zackory Erickson, Doug Weber

entry.summary: Deploys first system enabling a quadriplegic user to control a mobile manipulator in their home using bimanual high-density EMG. Develops custom fabric-integrated HDEMG sleeves capturing residual neuromotor activity.

entry.title: What did we learn from the AI Village in 2025?

author.name: Shoshannah Tekofsky

entry.summary: Reports on AI Village experiment where 19 frontier models were given open-ended goals (fundraising, building audiences) with full computer and internet access from April-December 2025. Provides existence proofs of current agent capabilities and failure modes.

entry.title: Mitigating loss of control in advanced AI systems through instrumental goal trajectories

author.name: Willem Fourie

entry.summary: Proposes instrumental goal trajectories as a framework for mitigating AI loss of control by tracking resource acquisition patterns (compute, storage, monetary) that typically precede capability gains.

entry.title: Do I Really Know? Learning Factual Self-Verification for Hallucination Reduction

author.name: Enes Altinisik, Masoomali Fatehkia, Fatih Deniz, Nadir Durrani, Majd Hawasly, Mohammad Raza, Husrev Taha Sencar

entry.summary: VeriFY teaches LLMs to reason about factual uncertainty through consistency-based self-verification, generating structured verification traces that guide answer-verify-judge-decide processes.

entry.title: MentisOculi: Revealing the Limits of Reasoning with Mental Imagery

author.name: Jana Zeller, Thadd\"aus Wiedemer, Fanfei Li, Thomas Klein, Prasanna Mayilvahanan, Matthias Bethge, Felix Wichmann, Ryan Cotterell, Wieland Brendel

entry.summary: MentisOculi evaluates visual mental imagery capabilities in unified multimodal models through procedural multi-step reasoning problems, finding that visual strategies generally fail to improve reasoning.

entry.title: Toward Universal and Transferable Jailbreak Attacks on Vision-Language Models

author.name: Kaiyuan Cui, Yige Li, Yutao Wu, Xingjun Ma, Sarah Erfani, Christopher Leckie, Hanxun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes UltraBreak for universal and transferable jailbreak attacks on VLMs. Constrains adversarial patterns through vision-space transformations and regularization.

entry.title: On the Spatiotemporal Dynamics of Generalization in Neural Networks

author.name: Zichao Wei

entry.summary: SEAD architecture is derived from three physical postulates (locality, symmetry, stability) rather than designed heuristically. Implements neural cellular automaton with attractor dynamics to address generalization failures like digit addition.

entry.title: CoMeT: Collaborative Memory Transformer for Efficient Long Context Modeling

author.name: Runsong Zhao, Shilei Liu, Jiwei Tang, Langming Liu, Haibin Chen, Weidong Zhang, Yujin Yuan, Tong Xiao, Jingbo Zhu, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: CoMeT introduces plug-in collaborative memory module for pre-trained LLMs enabling arbitrary-length sequences with constant memory via dual-memory system (FIFO queue + gated global memory).

entry.title: Breaking the Static Graph: Context-Aware Traversal for Robust Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Kwun Hang Lau, Fangyuan Zhang, Boyu Ruan, Yingli Zhou, Qintian Guo, Ruiyuan Zhang, Xiaofang Zhou

entry.summary: CatRAG addresses 'Static Graph Fallacy' in structure-aware RAG by using context-aware traversal with query-dependent edge relevance, preventing semantic drift through hub nodes.

entry.title: Advancing General-Purpose Reasoning Models with Modular Gradient Surgery

author.name: Min Cai, Yu Liang, Longzheng Wang, Yan Wang, Yueyang Zhang, Long Xia, Zhiyuan Sun, Xi Ye, Daiting Shi

entry.summary: Introduces MGS (Modular Gradient Surgery) to address cross-domain interference in training large reasoning models by resolving gradient conflicts at the transformer module level.

entry.title: The "Robert Boulton" Singularity: Semantic Tunneling and Manifold Unfolding in Recursive AI

author.name: Pengyue Hou

entry.summary: Identifies 'Semantic Tunneling' - a failure mode where recursive AI training maintains low perplexity while catastrophically losing semantic diversity, converging to single narrative attractor. Shows PPL is deceptive metric in context-stabilized regimes.

entry.title: TextME: Bridging Unseen Modalities Through Text Descriptions

author.name: Soyeon Hong, Jinchan Kim, Jaegook You, Seungtaek Choi, Suha Kwak, Hyunsouk Cho

entry.summary: Introduces TextME, the first text-only modality expansion framework enabling zero-shot cross-modal transfer using only text descriptions without paired supervision, exploiting geometric structure of contrastive encoders.

entry.title: MeKi: Memory-based Expert Knowledge Injection for Efficient LLM Scaling

author.name: Ning Ding, Fangcheng Liu, Kyungrae Kim, Linji Hao, Kyeng-Hun Lee, Hyeonmok Ko, Yehui Tang

entry.summary: Proposes MeKi for scaling LLMs on edge devices via storage space rather than FLOPs, using token-level memory experts that inject pre-stored semantic knowledge during generation.

entry.title: Lookahead Path Likelihood Optimization for Diffusion LLMs

author.name: Xuejie Liu, Yap Vit Chun, Yitao Liang, Anji Liu

entry.summary: Introduces path log-likelihood (Path LL) for diffusion LLMs and POKE estimator to predict expected future Path LL, enabling principled unmasking path selection with POKE-SMC algorithm.

entry.title: Reinforcement Fine-Tuning for History-Aware Dense Retriever in RAG

author.name: Yicheng Zhang, Zhen Qin, Zhaomin Wu, Wenqi Zhang, Shuiguang Deng

entry.summary: Uses reinforcement learning to fine-tune dense retrievers in RAG, replacing deterministic retrieval with stochastic formulation and adding history awareness for multi-hop reasoning.

entry.title: DeltaEvolve: Accelerating Scientific Discovery through Momentum-Driven Evolution

author.name: Jiachen Jiang, Tianyu Ding, Zhihui Zhu

entry.summary: DeltaEvolve improves LLM-driven evolutionary systems by using code diffs rather than full histories, viewing evolution through EM framework where diffs provide clearer guidance.

entry.title: Towards Distillation-Resistant Large Language Models: An Information-Theoretic Perspective

author.name: Hao Fang, Tianyi Zhang, Tianqu Zhuang, Jiawei Kong, Kuofeng Gao, Bin Chen, Leqi Liang, Shu-Tao Xia, Ke Xu

entry.summary: Proposes information-theoretic defense against logit-based model distillation by minimizing conditional mutual information between teacher outputs and inputs while preserving task performance.

entry.title: Beyond Tokens: Semantic-Aware Speculative Decoding for Efficient Inference by Probing Internal States

author.name: Ximing Dong, Shaowei Wang, Dayi Lin, Boyuan Chen, Ahmed E. Hassan

entry.summary: SemanticSpec proposes semantic-aware speculative decoding that verifies entire semantic sequences rather than tokens, using internal state probing to estimate semantic probabilities.

entry.title: Spiral RoPE: Rotate Your Rotary Positional Embeddings in the 2D Plane

author.name: Haoyu Liu, Sucheng Ren, Tingyu Zhu, Peng Wang, Cihang Xie, Alan Yuille, Zeyu Zheng, Feng Wang

entry.summary: Spiral RoPE extends rotary positional embeddings for vision transformers by partitioning dimensions for multi-directional spatial encoding, overcoming axis-aligned limitations.

entry.title: RegionReasoner: Region-Grounded Multi-Round Visual Reasoning

author.name: Wenfang Sun, Hao Chen, Yingjun Du, Yefeng Zheng, Cees G. M. Snoek

entry.summary: RegionReasoner introduces region-grounded multi-round visual reasoning with reinforcement learning, requiring explicit bounding box citations in reasoning traces.

entry.title: Accelerating Structured Chain-of-Thought in Autonomous Vehicles

author.name: Yi Gu, Yan Wang, Yuxiao Chen, Yurong You, Wenjie Luo, Yue Wang, Wenhao Ding, Boyi Li, Heng Yang, Boris Ivanovic, Marco Pavone

entry.summary: Introduces FastDriveCoT for accelerating Chain-of-Thought in autonomous driving via parallel decoding. Decomposes reasoning into dependency graph enabling concurrent generation of independent steps.

entry.title: Do Latent-CoT Models Think Step-by-Step? A Mechanistic Study on Sequential Reasoning Tasks

author.name: Jia Liang, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Mechanistic study of CODI latent CoT model reveals it forms intermediate bridge states for short reasoning chains but fails to reliably execute longer chains, with late fusion at thought boundaries.

entry.title: Learning Modal-Mixed Chain-of-Thought Reasoning with Latent Embeddings

author.name: Yifei Shao, Kun Zhou, Ziming Xu, Mohammad Atif Quamar, Shibo Hao, Zhen Wang, Zhiting Hu, Biwei Huang

entry.summary: Introduces modal-mixed CoT that interleaves text with visual sketch embeddings for multimodal reasoning. Uses VLM as encoder and diffusion decoder for visual intermediate states.

entry.title: Self-Guard: Defending Large Reasoning Models via enhanced self-reflection

author.name: Jingnan Zheng, Jingjun Xu, Yanzhen Luo, Chenhang Cui, Gelei Deng, Zhenkai Liang, Xiang Wang, An Zhang, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Self-Guard framework defends Large Reasoning Models via representational-level safety enforcement, addressing the awareness-compliance gap where models recognize risks but still comply.

entry.title: Persuasion Propagation in LLM Agents

author.name: Hyejun Jeong, Amir Houmansadr, Shlomo Zilberstein, Eugene Bagdasarian

entry.summary: Studies persuasion propagation in LLM agents - how belief-level intervention affects downstream task behavior. Finds explicit belief prefilling causes stronger behavioral drift than in-conversation persuasion.

entry.title: Reasoning and Tool-use Compete in Agentic RL:From Quantifying Interference to Disentangled Tuning

author.name: Yu Li, Mingyang Yi, Xiuyu Li, Ju Fan, Fuxin Jiang, Binbin Chen, Peng Li, Jie Song, Tieying Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces LEAS framework quantifying interference between reasoning and tool-use in agentic RL, showing these capabilities induce misaligned gradients. Proposes disentangled tuning.

entry.title: HalluHard: A Hard Multi-Turn Hallucination Benchmark

author.name: Dongyang Fan, Sebastien Delsad, Nicolas Flammarion, Maksym Andriushchenko

entry.summary: HalluHard is challenging multi-turn hallucination benchmark with 950 questions across legal, research, medical, and coding domains requiring inline citations with evidence retrieval evaluation.

entry.title: Probing RLVR training instability through the lens of objective-level hacking

author.name: Yiming Dong, Kun Fu, Haoyu Li, Xinyuan Zhu, Yurou Liu, Lijing Shao, Jieping Ye, Zheng Wang

entry.summary: Analyzes RLVR training instability through objective-level hacking lens, showing token-level credit misalignment manifests as spurious optimization signals especially in MoE architectures.

entry.title: Capabilities and Fundamental Limits of Latent Chain-of-Thought

author.name: Jiaxuan Zou, Yaozhong Xiong, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Reveals latent CoT trade-off governed by decisional certainty: high certainty enables execution but inhibits exploration. Introduces Symbolic Index to quantify and predict this trade-off.

entry.title: Qrita: High-performance Top-k and Top-p Algorithm for GPUs using Pivot-based Truncation and Selection

author.name: Jongseok Park, Sunga Kim, Alvin Cheung, Ion Stoica

entry.summary: Qrita introduces an efficient GPU algorithm for Top-k and Top-p sampling using pivot-based selection with Gaussian sigma-truncation, avoiding expensive sorting operations while maintaining exact outputs.

entry.title: ROMA: Recursive Open Meta-Agent Framework for Long-Horizon Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Salaheddin Alzu'bi, Baran Nama, Arda Kaz, Anushri Eswaran, Weiyuan Chen, Sarvesh Khetan, Rishab Bala, Tu Vu, Sewoong Oh

entry.summary: ROMA addresses long-horizon agent limitations through recursive task decomposition into dependency-aware subtask trees with structured aggregation to control context growth.

entry.title: Hunt Instead of Wait: Evaluating Deep Data Research on Large Language Models

author.name: Wei Liu, Peijie Yu, Michele Orini, Yali Du, Yulan He

entry.summary: DDR-Bench evaluates 'investigatory intelligence' where LLMs autonomously extract insights from databases without explicit queries, distinguishing from executional intelligence that completes assigned tasks.

entry.title: How Hyper-Datafication Impacts the Sustainability Costs in Frontier AI

author.name: Sophia N. Wilson, Sebastian Mair, Mophat Okinyi, Erik B. Dam, Janin Koch, Raghavendra Selvan

entry.summary: Examines environmental, social, and economic costs of large-scale data in AI, analyzing ~550,000 datasets from Hugging Face Hub to characterize the shift toward 'hyper-datafication' in frontier AI.

entry.title: Bypassing Prompt Injection Detectors through Evasive Injections

author.name: Md Jahedur Rahman, Ihsen Alouani

entry.summary: Evaluates robustness of linear probe prompt injection detectors against adversarially optimized suffixes. Achieves up to 99.63% attack success rate against multiple probes simultaneously.

entry.title: MarkovScale: Towards Optimal Sequential Scaling at Inference Time

author.name: Youkang Wang, Jian Wang, Rubing Chen, Tianyi Zeng, Xiao-Yong Wei, Qing Li

entry.summary: Models inference-time sequential scaling as a two-state Markov process, deriving closed-form solutions for performance bounds and conditions for improvement. Develops MarkovScale system achieving theoretical upper bounds.

entry.title: When Domains Interact: Asymmetric and Order-Sensitive Cross-Domain Effects in Reinforcement Learning for Reasoning

author.name: Wang Yang, Shouren Wang, Chaoda Song, Chuang Ma, Xinpeng Li, Nengbo Wang, Kaixiong Zhou, Vipin Chaudhary, Xiaotian Han

entry.summary: Provides first systematic analysis of training-order effects in GRPO across reasoning domains. Finds highly asymmetric transfer: math improves 25% from other domains, while logic/puzzle show negligible transfer.

entry.title: P-EAGLE: Parallel-Drafting EAGLE with Scalable Training

author.name: Mude Hui, Xin Huang, Jaime Campos Salas, Yue Sun, Nathan Pemberton, Xiang Song, Ashish Khetan, George Karypis

entry.summary: Introduces P-EAGLE transforming EAGLE from autoregressive to parallel multi-token prediction via shared hidden state. Develops scalable training framework for long-context speculative decoding.

entry.title: Provable Defense Framework for LLM Jailbreaks via Noise-Augumented Alignment

author.name: Zehua Cheng, Jianwei Yang, Wei Dai, Jiahao Sun

entry.summary: Proposes certifiable robustness framework for LLM jailbreaks using Certified Semantic Smoothing via Stratified Randomized Ablation, with Noise-Augmented Alignment Tuning for performance recovery.

entry.title: CoDiQ: Test-Time Scaling for Controllable Difficult Question Generation

author.name: Zhongyuan Peng, Caijun Xu, Changyi Xiao, Shibo Hong, Eli Zhang, Stephen Huang, Yixin Cao

entry.summary: CoDiQ enables controllable generation of difficult questions via test-time scaling while ensuring solvability. Identifies test-time scaling tendency where extended reasoning increases difficulty but reduces solvability.

entry.title: Fast Autoregressive Video Diffusion and World Models with Temporal Cache Compression and Sparse Attention

author.name: Dvir Samuel, Issar Tzachor, Matan Levy, Micahel Green, Gal Chechik, Rami Ben-Ari

entry.summary: Identifies and addresses redundancy in autoregressive video diffusion through temporal cache compression and sparse attention, tackling KV cache growth bottleneck for long-form generation.

entry.title: Spectral Superposition: A Theory of Feature Geometry

author.name: Georgi Ivanov, Narmeen Oozeer, Shivam Raval, Tasana Pejovic, Shriyash Upadhyay, Amir Abdullah

entry.summary: Develops a theory of feature geometry in neural networks through spectral analysis of weight matrices, introducing the frame operator to study how features allocate norm across eigenspaces.

entry.title: Reward Shaping for Inference-Time Alignment: A Stackelberg Game Perspective

author.name: Haichuan Wang, Tao Lin, Lingkai Kong, Ce Li, Hezi Jiang, Milind Tambe

entry.summary: Formalizes reward model optimization as Stackelberg game where optimal reward shaping accounts for KL regularization bias. Shows simple reward shaping approximates optimal under practical conditions.

entry.title: Towards Understanding Steering Strength

author.name: Magamed Taimeskhanov, Samuel Vaiter, Damien Garreau

entry.summary: First theoretical analysis of steering strength in LLM control, characterizing effects on next-token probability, concept presence, and cross-entropy with qualitative and quantitative bounds.

entry.title: A Random Matrix Theory Perspective on the Consistency of Diffusion Models

author.name: Binxu Wang, Jacob Zavatone-Veth, Cengiz Pehlevan

entry.summary: Uses random matrix theory to explain why diffusion models trained on different data subsets produce similar outputs from same noise seeds. Shows shared Gaussian statistics predict much of output similarity through finite-sample effects.

entry.title: Prompt Augmentation Scales up GRPO Training on Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Wenquan Lu, Hai Huang, Randall Balestriero

entry.summary: Shows that prompt augmentation during GRPO training prevents entropy collapse and enables sustained training beyond typical 5-20 epochs. Simple technique achieving meaningful improvements in mathematical reasoning.

entry.title: medR: Reward Engineering for Clinical Offline Reinforcement Learning via Tri-Drive Potential Functions

author.name: Qianyi Xu, Gousia Habib, Feng Wu, Yanrui Du, Zhihui Chen, Swapnil Mishra, Dilruk Perera, Mengling Feng

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to automate reward engineering for clinical offline RL, formulating reward functions through potential functions with survival, confidence, and competence components for dynamic treatment regimes.

entry.title: Beyond Variance: Prompt-Efficient RLVR via Rare-Event Amplification and Bidirectional Pairing

author.name: Xin Sheng, Jiaxin Li, Yujuan Pang, Ran Peng, Yong Ma

entry.summary: Proposes improved prompt selection for RLVR beyond variance-based heuristics, using positive-negative pairing with hard-but-solvable and easy-but-brittle prompts for more stable optimization.

entry.title: MatGPTQ: Accurate and Efficient Post-Training Matryoshka Quantization

author.name: Maximilian Kleinegger, Elvir Crn\v{c}evi\'c, Dan Alistarh

entry.summary: Introduces MatGPTQ for post-training Matryoshka quantization that produces single checkpoint optimized for multiple precisions, with open-source support and efficient kernels.

entry.title: Conflict-Resolving and Sharpness-Aware Minimization for Generalized Knowledge Editing with Multiple Updates

author.name: Duy Nguyen, Hanqi Xiao, Archiki Prasad, Elias Stengel-Eskin, Hyunji Lee, Mohit Bansal

entry.summary: Proposes CoRSA for knowledge editing combining conflict resolution and sharpness-aware minimization to improve generalization across input forms, stability, and handling of knowledge conflicts.

entry.title: Bridging Online and Offline RL: Contextual Bandit Learning for Multi-Turn Code Generation

author.name: Ziru Chen, Dongdong Chen, Ruinan Jin, Yingbin Liang, Yujia Xie, Huan Sun

entry.summary: Proposes Cobalt for multi-turn code generation, combining benefits of online and offline RL by formulating as one-step recoverable MDP with contextual bandit learning.

entry.title: "I May Not Have Articulated Myself Clearly": Diagnosing Dynamic Instability in LLM Reasoning at Inference Time

author.name: Jinkun Chen, Fengxiang Cheng, Sijia Han, Vlado Keselj

entry.summary: Studies inference-time detection of LLM reasoning breakdowns using token log probabilities, finding instability signal (JSD + entropy) predicts failures with above-chance AUC.

entry.title: Token Sparse Attention: Efficient Long-Context Inference with Interleaved Token Selection

author.name: Dongwon Jo, Beomseok Kang, Jiwon Song, Jae-Joon Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Token Sparse Attention, a dynamic token-level sparsification mechanism that compresses Q, K, V to reduced token sets during attention then decompresses, allowing token information to be reconsidered in subsequent layers unlike permanent eviction methods.

entry.title: IntentRL: Training Proactive User-intent Agents for Open-ended Deep Research via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Haohao Luo, Zexi Li, Yuexiang Xie, Wenhao Zhang, Yaliang Li, Ying Shen

entry.summary: Proposes IntentRL, training proactive agents to clarify latent user intents before starting computationally expensive Deep Research tasks, addressing the autonomy-interaction dilemma where high autonomy leads to unsatisfactory outcomes.

entry.title: InfMem: Learning System-2 Memory Control for Long-Context Agent

author.name: Xinyu Wang, Mingze Li, Peng Lu, Xiao-Wen Chang, Lifeng Shang, Jinping Li, Fei Mi, Prasanna Parthasarathi, Yufei Cui

entry.summary: Proposes InfMem, a control-centric agent implementing System-2-style control via PreThink-Retrieve-Write protocol for ultra-long document reasoning. Uses SFT-to-RL training to align retrieval, writing, and stopping decisions.

entry.title: R2-Router: A New Paradigm for LLM Routing with Reasoning

author.name: Jiaqi Xue, Qian Lou, Jiarong Xing, Heng Huang

entry.summary: Introduces R2-Router treating output length budget as controllable variable for LLM routing, jointly selecting best model and length budget rather than assuming fixed cost per model. Addresses missed opportunity of powerful LLMs at reduced cost.

entry.title: HALT: Hallucination Assessment via Log-probs as Time series

author.name: Ahmad Shapiro, Karan Taneja, Ashok Goel

entry.summary: Presents HALT, a lightweight hallucination detector using only top-20 token log-probabilities as time series with GRU and entropy features. Achieves domain generalization without access to hidden states or attention.

entry.title: POP: Prefill-Only Pruning for Efficient Large Model Inference

author.name: Junhui He, Zhihui Fu, Jun Wang, Qingan Li

entry.summary: POP reveals that deep layers are critical for decode but redundant for prefill, proposing stage-aware pruning that selectively prunes during prefill only to maintain accuracy.

entry.title: ViThinker: Active Vision-Language Reasoning via Dynamic Perceptual Querying

author.name: Weihang You, Qingchan Zhu, David Liu, Yi Pan, Geng Yuan, Hanqi Jiang

entry.summary: ViThinker enables vision-language models to autonomously generate decision tokens triggering on-demand synthesis of expert-aligned visual features through generative mental simulation.

entry.title: VIRAL: Visual In-Context Reasoning via Analogy in Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Zhiwen Li, Zhongjie Duan, Jinyan Ye, Cen Chen, Daoyuan Chen, Yaliang Li, Yingda Chen

entry.summary: VIRAL enables visual in-context learning via analogy in diffusion transformers, adapting frozen DiT with role-aware conditioning and MoE-LoRA for diverse tasks.

entry.title: ConsistentRFT: Reducing Visual Hallucinations in Flow-based Reinforcement Fine-Tuning

author.name: Xiaofeng Tan, Jun Liu, Yuanting Fan, Bin-Bin Gao, Xi Jiang, Xiaochen Chen, Jinlong Peng, Chengjie Wang, Hongsong Wang, Feng Zheng

entry.summary: ConsistentRFT reduces visual hallucinations in flow-based reinforcement fine-tuning by improving exploration during SDE rollouts and maintaining vector field consistency.

entry.title: AffordanceGrasp-R1:Leveraging Reasoning-Based Affordance Segmentation with Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Grasping

author.name: Dingyi Zhou, Mu He, Zhuowei Fang, Xiangtong Yao, Yinlong Liu, Alois Knoll, Hu Cao

entry.summary: Presents AffordanceGrasp-R1, combining chain-of-thought reasoning with reinforcement learning for affordance segmentation in robotic grasping. Filters grasp candidates using instruction-conditioned affordance masks.

entry.title: HUSKY: Humanoid Skateboarding System via Physics-Aware Whole-Body Control

author.name: Jinrui Han, Dewei Wang, Chenyun Zhang, Xinzhe Liu, Ping Luo, Chenjia Bai, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Presents HUSKY for humanoid skateboarding via physics-aware whole-body control. Addresses non-holonomic constraints and tightly coupled human-object interactions on underactuated platform.

entry.title: METR have released Time Horizons 1.1

author.name: Sean Herrington

entry.summary: METR released Time Horizons 1.1 benchmark update with additional tasks. Key finding: 50% time horizon doubling time is 131 days (down from 165 in v1.0). Claude 4.5 Opus achieves 5h20 time horizon, up from 4h49.

entry.title: TRIP-Bench: A Benchmark for Long-Horizon Interactive Agents in Real-World Scenarios

author.name: Yuanzhe Shen, Zisu Huang, Zhengyuan Wang, Muzhao Tian, Zhengkang Guo, Chenyang Zhang, Shuaiyu Zhou, Zengjie Hu, Dailin Li, Jingwen Xu, Kaimin Wang, Wenhao Liu, Tianlong Li, Fengpeng Yue, Feng Hong, Cao Liu, Ke Zeng

entry.summary: TRIP-Bench evaluates long-horizon interactive agents on realistic travel-planning with 18 tools, 40+ requirements, and multi-turn dialogues spanning 150+ tool calls, emphasizing constraint enforcement and adaptation.

entry.title: Interpreting and Controlling LLM Reasoning through Integrated Policy Gradient

author.name: Changming Li, Kaixing Zhang, Haoyun Xu, Yingdong Shi, Zheng Zhang, Kaitao Song, Kan Ren

entry.summary: Proposes Integrated Policy Gradient for interpreting and controlling LLM reasoning, identifying components with sequential contribution to reasoning outputs based on outcome-oriented principles.

entry.title: Evolving Interpretable Constitutions for Multi-Agent Simulation

author.name: Ujwal Kumar, Alice Saito, Hershraj Niranjani, Rayan Yessou, Phan Xuan Tan

entry.summary: Presents Constitutional Evolution framework for discovering behavioral norms in multi-agent LLM systems through grid-world simulation. Finds human-designed prosocial principles outperform both adversarial and vague constitutions.

entry.title: IRIS: Implicit Reward-Guided Internal Sifting for Mitigating Multimodal Hallucination

author.name: Yuanshuai Li, Yuping Yan, Jirui Han, Fei Ming, Lingjuan Lv, Yaochu Jin

entry.summary: IRIS mitigates MLLM hallucination using implicit rewards in native log-probability space to capture internal modal competition, avoiding costly external evaluators in DPO.

entry.title: Human Society-Inspired Approaches to Agentic AI Security: The 4C Framework

author.name: Alsharif Abuadbba, Nazatul Sultan, Surya Nepal, Sanjay Jha

entry.summary: 4C Framework provides human society-inspired security analysis for agentic AI, addressing risks from autonomy, interaction, and emergent behavior beyond model-level vulnerabilities.

entry.title: OmniCode: A Benchmark for Evaluating Software Engineering Agents

author.name: Atharv Sonwane, Eng-Shen Tu, Wei-Chung Lu, Claas Beger, Carter Larsen, Debjit Dhar, Rachel Chen, Ronit Pattanayak, Tuan Anh Dang, Guohao Chen, Gloria Geng, Kevin Ellis, Saikat Dutta

entry.summary: Introduces OmniCode, a software engineering benchmark with 1794 tasks spanning diverse categories beyond code generation, including debugging, testing, and documentation.

entry.title: David vs. Goliath: Verifiable Agent-to-Agent Jailbreaking via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Samuel Nellessen, Tal Kachman

entry.summary: Introduces Slingshot, an RL framework that autonomously discovers agent-to-agent jailbreaking attacks, formalizing the 'Tag-Along Attack' threat model for tool-augmented AI systems.

entry.title: Learning to Explore with Parameter-Space Noise: A Deep Dive into Parameter-Space Noise for Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Bizhe Bai, Xinyue Wang, Peng Ye, Tao Chen

entry.summary: PSN-RLVR addresses exploration ceiling in reasoning tasks by perturbing policy parameters before rollout, maintaining chain-of-thought coherence better than action-space noise. Uses truncated importance sampling.

entry.title: Why Some Models Resist Unlearning: A Linear Stability Perspective

author.name: Wei-Kai Chang, Rajiv Khanna

entry.summary: Analyzes machine unlearning through asymptotic linear stability lens, identifying data coherence as key quantity determining when unlearning succeeds. Decomposes coherence along retain-forget-between axes.

entry.title: Robustness as an Emergent Property of Task Performance

author.name: Shir Ashury-Tahan, Ariel Gera, Elron Bandel, Michal Shmueli-Scheuer, Leshem Choshen

entry.summary: Demonstrates empirically that robustness emerges as models approach high task performance, challenging current approaches that treat robustness as a separate model-level property requiring explicit optimization.

entry.title: DeepDFA: Injecting Temporal Logic in Deep Learning for Sequential Subsymbolic Applications

author.name: Elena Umili, Francesco Argenziano, Roberto Capobianco

entry.summary: Introduces DeepDFA, a neurosymbolic framework integrating temporal logic (DFA/Moore machines) as differentiable layers for neural architectures in sequential subsymbolic domains.

entry.title: EVE: Efficient Verification of Data Erasure through Customized Perturbation in Approximate Unlearning

author.name: Weiqi Wang, Zhiyi Tian, Chenhan Zhang, Luoyu Chen, Shui Yu

entry.summary: Proposes EVE for efficient verification of machine unlearning through customized perturbation of unlearning data, without requiring participation in initial model training.

entry.title: STEER: Inference-Time Risk Control via Constrained Quality-Diversity Search

author.name: Eric Yang, Jong Ha Lee, Jonathan Amar, Elissa Ye, Yugang Jia

entry.summary: STEER constructs persona populations through constrained quality-diversity search, enabling tunable risk-accuracy tradeoffs at inference time for clinical triage.

entry.title: Instruction Anchors: Dissecting the Causal Dynamics of Modality Arbitration

author.name: Yu Zhang, Mufan Xu, Xuefeng Bai, Kehai chen, Pengfei Zhang, Yang Xiang, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Reveals instruction tokens function as structural anchors for modality arbitration in MLLMs, with shallow layers routing information and deep layers resolving competition.

entry.title: RC-GRPO: Reward-Conditioned Group Relative Policy Optimization for Multi-Turn Tool Calling Agents

author.name: Haitian Zhong, Jixiu Zhai, Lei Song, Jiang Bian, Qiang Liu, Tieniu Tan

entry.summary: RC-GRPO addresses vanishing updates in GRPO for multi-turn tool calling by conditioning on reward goal tokens, treating exploration as controllable steering.

entry.title: Full end-to-end diagnostic workflow automation of 3D OCT via foundation model-driven AI for retinal diseases

author.name: Jinze Zhang, Jian Zhong, Li Lin, Jiaxiong Li, Ke Ma, Naiyang Li, Meng Li, Yuan Pan, Zeyu Meng, Mengyun Zhou, Shang Huang, Shilong Yu, Zhengyu Duan, Sutong Li, Honghui Xia, Juping Liu, Dan Liang, Yantao Wei, Xiaoying Tang, Jin Yuan, Peng Xiao

entry.summary: FOCUS automates full OCT diagnostic workflow using foundation model-driven AI for quality assessment, abnormality detection, and multi-disease classification.

entry.title: PnP-U3D: Plug-and-Play 3D Framework Bridging Autoregression and Diffusion for Unified Understanding and Generation

author.name: Yongwei Chen, Tianyi Wei, Yushi Lan, Zhaoyang Lyu, Shangchen Zhou, Xudong Xu, Xingang Pan

entry.summary: PnP-U3D bridges autoregressive and diffusion paradigms for unified 3D understanding and generation using plug-and-play architecture with pretrained models.

entry.title: RPL: Learning Robust Humanoid Perceptive Locomotion on Challenging Terrains

author.name: Yuanhang Zhang, Younggyo Seo, Juyue Chen, Yifu Yuan, Koushil Sreenath, Pieter Abbeel, Carmelo Sferrazza, Karen Liu, Rocky Duan, Guanya Shi

entry.summary: Proposes RPL, a two-stage framework for robust humanoid perceptive locomotion on challenging terrains. Uses terrain-specific experts distilled into transformer policy with depth feature splatting.

entry.title: A State-Transition Framework for Efficient LLM Reasoning

author.name: Liang Zhang, Yu Zhao, Longyue Wang, Tianqi Shi, Weihua Luo, Kaifu Zhang, Jinsong Su

entry.summary: Proposes modeling LLM reasoning as a state-transition process using linear attention to compress historical reasoning information. This approach aims to improve efficiency without sacrificing test-time scaling benefits.

entry.title: ProcMEM: Learning Reusable Procedural Memory from Experience via Non-Parametric PPO for LLM Agents

author.name: Qirui Mi, Zhijian Ma, Mengyue Yang, Haoxuan Li, Yisen Wang, Haifeng Zhang, Jun Wang

entry.summary: ProcMEM enables LLM agents to learn reusable procedural memory from experience using Non-Parametric PPO, formalizing a Skill-MDP to transform episodic narratives into executable skills.

entry.title: Reasoning in a Combinatorial and Constrained World: Benchmarking LLMs on Natural-Language Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Xia Jiang, Jing Chen, Cong Zhang, Jie Gao, Chengpeng Hu, Chenhao Zhang, Yaoxin Wu, Yingqian Zhang

entry.summary: NLCO benchmark evaluates LLMs on end-to-end combinatorial optimization reasoning from natural language, covering 43 problems across variable types, constraints, and objectives.

entry.title: AgentRx: Diagnosing AI Agent Failures from Execution Trajectories

author.name: Shraddha Barke, Arnav Goyal, Alind Khare, Avaljot Singh, Suman Nath, Chetan Bansal

entry.summary: Presents AgentRx, a diagnostic framework for pinpointing failure steps in AI agent trajectories. Releases benchmark of 115 annotated failed trajectories with a grounded-theory derived failure taxonomy across structured APIs, incident management, and web/file tasks.

entry.title: Interpreting and Controlling Model Behavior via Constitutions for Atomic Concept Edits

author.name: Neha Kalibhat, Zi Wang, Prasoon Bajpai, Drew Proud, Wenjun Zeng, Been Kim, Mani Malek

entry.summary: Introduces framework learning verifiable constitutions as natural language summaries of how prompt changes affect model behavior, using Atomic Concept Edits to map causal relationships from edits to outcomes.

entry.title: Detecting AI-Generated Content in Academic Peer Reviews

author.name: Siyuan Shen, Kai Wang

entry.summary: Studies AI-generated content in peer reviews using detection model trained on historical reviews, finding ~20% of ICLR 2025 and ~12% of Nature Communications 2025 reviews classified as AI-generated.

entry.title: When RAG Hurts: Diagnosing and Mitigating Attention Distraction in Retrieval-Augmented LVLMs

author.name: Beidi Zhao, Wenlong Deng, Xinting Liao, Yushu Li, Nazim Shaikh, Yao Nie, Xiaoxiao Li

entry.summary: Identifies Attention Distraction failure mode in retrieval-augmented LVLMs where retrieved text suppresses visual attention globally, causing failures on questions answerable without retrieval.

entry.title: Non-Contrastive Vision-Language Learning with Predictive Embedding Alignment

author.name: Lukas Kuhn, Giuseppe Serra, Florian Buettner

entry.summary: Introduces NOVA, a non-contrastive vision-language alignment framework using predictive embedding alignment with distributional regularization. Eliminates need for negative sampling, momentum encoders, and reduces hyperparameters.

entry.title: Latent Shadows: The Gaussian-Discrete Duality in Masked Diffusion

author.name: Guinan Chen, Xunpeng Huang, Ying Sun, Shijin Wang, Yanyong Zhang, Chao Wang

entry.summary: Establishes Masked Diffusion Duality proving masked processes arise as projections of continuous Gaussian processes. Enables deterministic sampling for masked discrete diffusion.

entry.title: Statistical MIA: Rethinking Membership Inference Attack for Reliable Unlearning Auditing

author.name: Jialong Sun, Zeming Wei, Jiaxuan Zou, Jiacheng Gong, Guanheng Wang, Chengyang Dong, Jialong Li, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Challenges the reliability of Membership Inference Attacks for machine unlearning auditing. Theoretically demonstrates that failed membership inference does not imply true forgetting due to inherent statistical errors.

entry.title: The Gradient-Causal Gap: Why Gradient Importance Fails on Complex Tasks

author.name: Donald Ye

entry.summary: Demonstrates the Gradient-Causal Gap: gradient magnitude and causal importance align on simple tasks but collapse or invert on complex tasks. Pruning low-gradient 'Hidden Heroes' devastates OOD accuracy.

entry.title: You Need an Encoder for Native Position-Independent Caching

author.name: Shiju Zhao, Junhao Hu, Jiaqi Zheng, Guihai Chen

entry.summary: Proposes reintroducing encoder to decoder-only LLMs for native Position-Independent Caching. COMB system achieves 51-94% TTFT reduction and 3x throughput improvement.

entry.title: Adaptive Rollout Allocation for Online Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Hieu Trung Nguyen, Bao Nguyen, Wenao Ma, Yuzhi Zhao, Ruifeng She, Viet Anh Nguyen

entry.summary: Introduces VIP, a variance-informed predictive allocation strategy for reinforcement learning with verifiable rewards that adaptively allocates rollout budgets based on per-prompt success probability predictions. Uses Gaussian process models to minimize expected gradient variance during policy updates.

entry.title: Backdoor Sentinel: Detecting and Detoxifying Backdoors in Diffusion Models via Temporal Noise Consistency

author.name: Bingzheng Wang, Xiaoyan Gu, Hongbo Xu, Hongcheng Li, Zimo Yu, Jiang Zhou, Weiping Wang

entry.summary: Backdoor Sentinel identifies temporal noise inconsistency phenomenon for detecting backdoors in diffusion models and proposes detoxification method balancing effectiveness with generation quality.

entry.title: Efficient Epistemic Uncertainty Estimation for Large Language Models via Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Seonghyeon Park, Jewon Yeom, Jaewon Sok, Jeongjae Park, Heejun Kim, Taesup Kim

entry.summary: Efficiently estimates epistemic uncertainty in LLMs using small draft models via knowledge distillation, avoiding prohibitive cost of deep ensembles through online stochastic distillation.

entry.title: ClueTracer: Question-to-Vision Clue Tracing for Training-Free Hallucination Suppression in Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Gongli Xi, Kun Wang, Zeming Gao, Huahui Yi, Haolang Lu, Ye Tian, Wendong Wang

entry.summary: ClueTracer identifies reasoning drift in multimodal reasoning where models over-focus on irrelevant entities. Proposes training-free hallucination suppression via question-to-vision clue tracing.

entry.title: Learning Generative Selection for Best-of-N

author.name: Shubham Toshniwal, Aleksander Ficek, Siddhartha Jain, Wei Du, Vahid Noroozi, Sadegh Mahdavi, Somshubra Majumdar, Igor Gitman

entry.summary: Shows that small reasoning models can acquire strong generative selection capabilities through targeted RL training, significantly improving Best-of-N selection for math and code reasoning tasks.

entry.title: Why Steering Works: Toward a Unified View of Language Model Parameter Dynamics

author.name: Ziwen Xu, Chenyan Wu, Hengyu Sun, Haiwen Hong, Mengru Wang, Yunzhi Yao, Longtao Huang, Hui Xue, Shumin Deng, Zhixuan Chu, Huajun Chen, Ningyu Zhang

entry.summary: Presents a unified framework for understanding LLM control methods (fine-tuning, LoRA, activation steering) as dynamic weight updates, with a preference-utility analysis on shared log-odds scale.

entry.title: GraphDancer: Training LLMs to Explore and Reason over Graphs via Curriculum Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yuyang Bai, Zhuofeng Li, Ping Nie, Jianwen Xie, Yu Zhang

entry.summary: GraphDancer teaches LLMs to navigate heterogeneous knowledge graphs through curriculum reinforcement learning, interleaving reasoning with precise function calls. Addresses the challenge of multi-hop evidence aggregation over structured data.

entry.title: daVinci-Agency: Unlocking Long-Horizon Agency Data-Efficiently

author.name: Mohan Jiang, Dayuan Fu, Junhao Shi, Ji Zeng, Weiye Si, Keyu Li, Xuefeng Li, Yang Xiao, Wenjie Li, Dequan Wang, Pengfei Liu

entry.summary: daVinci-Agency addresses long-horizon agent training data scarcity by using Pull Request sequences as natural supervision signals that decompose complex objectives into verifiable sub-tasks with evolutionary dynamics.

entry.title: Membership Inference Attacks from Causal Principles

author.name: Mathieu Even, Cl\'ement Berenfeld, Linus Bleistein, Tudor Cebere, Julie Josse, Aur\'elien Bellet

entry.summary: Frames membership inference attack evaluation as causal inference, defining memorization as the causal effect of including a data point in training. Identifies bias sources in one-run and zero-run evaluation methods and proposes principled alternatives.

entry.title: TMS: Trajectory-Mixed Supervision for Reward-Free, On-Policy SFT

author.name: Rana Muhammad Shahroz Khan, Zijie Liu, Zhen Tan, Charles Fleming, Tianlong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes TMS (Trajectory-Mixed Supervision), a reward-free framework that addresses supervision mismatch in SFT by creating dynamic curriculum from model's own generations to approximate on-policy benefits.

entry.title: From Scalar Rewards to Potential Trends: Shaping Potential Landscapes for Model-Based Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yao-Hui Li, Zeyu Wang, Xin Li, Wei Pang, Yingfang Yuan, Zhengkun Chen, Boya Zhang, Riashat Islam, Alex Lamb, Yonggang Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SLOPE for model-based RL that replaces scalar reward prediction with potential landscape construction using optimistic distributional regression. Addresses the fundamental limitation of sparse rewards in MBRL.

entry.title: Most Convolutional Networks Suffer from Small Adversarial Perturbations

author.name: Amit Daniely, Idan Mehalel

entry.summary: Proves adversarial examples in random CNNs can be found at distance order ||x||/sqrt(d) from input (essentially optimal), and shows single gradient step suffices using Fourier decomposition.

entry.title: Reparameterization Flow Policy Optimization

author.name: Hai Zhong, Zhuoran Li, Xun Wang, Longbo Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Reparameterization Flow Policy Optimization (RFPO) that identifies flow policies naturally align with reparameterization policy gradient framework, addressing training instability and exploration issues.

entry.title: CoGenCast: A Coupled Autoregressive-Flow Generative Framework for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Yaguo Liu, Mingyue Cheng, Daoyu Wang, Xiaoyu Tao, Qi Liu

entry.summary: Proposes CoGenCast combining pretrained decoder-only LLMs with flow-matching for time series forecasting, reconfiguring LLMs as encoder-decoder backbone with minimal modifications.

entry.title: Equilibrium Propagation for Non-Conservative Systems

author.name: Antonino Emanuele Scurria, Dimitri Vanden Abeele, Bortolo Matteo Mognetti, Serge Massar

entry.summary: Extends Equilibrium Propagation to non-conservative systems with non-reciprocal interactions, enabling exact gradient computation for feedforward networks while maintaining stationary state properties.

entry.title: UniGeM: Unifying Data Mixing and Selection via Geometric Exploration and Mining

author.name: Changhao Wang, Yunfei Yu, Xinhao Yao, Jiaolong Yang, Riccardo Cantoro, Chaobo Li, Qing Cui, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: UniGeM treats data curation as manifold approximation, unifying mixing and selection without proxy models. Validated on 8B/16B MoE models with 2x data efficiency improvement.

entry.title: Test-Time Detoxification without Training or Learning Anything

author.name: Baturay Saglam, Dionysis Kalogerias

entry.summary: Proposes training-free test-time detoxification using zeroth-order gradient approximation on input embeddings to steer LLM generation toward less toxic continuations.

entry.title: TAME: A Trustworthy Test-Time Evolution of Agent Memory with Systematic Benchmarking

author.name: Yu Cheng, Jiuan Zhou, Yongkang Hu, Yihang Chen, Huichi Zhou, Mingang Chen, Zhizhong Zhang, Kun Shao, Yuan Xie, Zhaoxia Yin

entry.summary: Introduces TAME framework and Trust-Memevo benchmark for evaluating agent memory safety during benign task evolution, revealing that safety alignment degrades through a phenomenon called Agent Memory Misevolution. Proposes dual-memory evolutionary framework separating executor and evaluator memory.

entry.title: Risk Awareness Injection: Calibrating Vision-Language Models for Safety without Compromising Utility

author.name: Mengxuan Wang, Yuxin Chen, Gang Xu, Tao He, Hongjie Jiang, Ming Li

entry.summary: Proposes Risk Awareness Injection (RAI), a lightweight training-free framework for VLM safety that restores LLM-like risk recognition by amplifying unsafe signals that visual inputs dilute.

entry.title: CRL-VLA: Continual Vision-Language-Action Learning

author.name: Qixin Zeng, Shuo Zhang, Hongyin Zhang, Renjie Wang, Han Zhao, Libang Zhao, Runze Li, Donglin Wang, Chao Huang

entry.summary: Introduces CRL-VLA, a framework for continual post-training of Vision-Language-Action models with theoretical bounds linking the stability-plasticity trade-off to goal-conditioned advantage.

entry.title: Self-Verification Dilemma: Experience-Driven Suppression of Overused Checking in LLM Reasoning

author.name: Quanyu Long, Kai Jie Jiang, Jianda Chen, Xu Guo, Leilei Gan, Wenya Wang

entry.summary: Finds that Large Reasoning Models have excessive self-verification that rarely identifies errors, revealing a mismatch between verification activation frequency and usefulness. Proposes experience-driven framework to suppress overused checking.

entry.title: TRE: Encouraging Exploration in the Trust Region

author.name: Chao Huang, Yujing Lu, Quangang Li, Shenghe Wang, Yan Wang, Yueyang Zhang, Long Xia, Jiashu Zhao, Zhiyuan Sun, Daiting Shi, Tingwen Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Trust Region Entropy (TRE) for LLM RL, showing standard entropy regularization fails due to cumulative tail risk with massive vocabularies. TRE encourages exploration only within the model's trust region.

entry.title: WideSeek: Advancing Wide Research via Multi-Agent Scaling

author.name: Ziyang Huang, Haolin Ren, Xiaowei Yuan, Jiawei Wang, Zhongtao Jiang, Kun Xu, Shizhu He, Jun Zhao, Kang Liu

entry.summary: Introduces WideSeekBench for broad information seeking and WideSeek, a dynamic hierarchical multi-agent architecture for Wide Research paradigm that retrieves and synthesizes comprehensive information under complex constraints.

entry.title: CATNIP: LLM Unlearning via Calibrated and Tokenized Negative Preference Alignment

author.name: Zhengbang Yang, Yisheng Zhong, Junyuan Hong, Zhuangdi Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes CATNIP for LLM unlearning via calibrated and tokenized negative preference alignment, quantifying the appropriate suppression level without relying on retention data or contrastive pairs.

entry.title: ReMiT: RL-Guided Mid-Training for Iterative LLM Evolution

author.name: Junjie Huang, Jiarui Qin, Di Yin, Weiwen Liu, Yong Yu, Xing Sun, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes ReMiT, identifying mid-training (annealing) phase as critical turning point for injecting RL-guided improvements back into base model, establishing bidirectional training flywheel.

entry.title: AERO: Autonomous Evolutionary Reasoning Optimization via Endogenous Dual-Loop Feedback

author.name: Zhitao Gao, Jie Ma, Xuhong Li, Pengyu Li, Ning Qu, Yaqiang Wu, Hui Liu, Jun Liu

entry.summary: Proposes AERO, an unsupervised framework for autonomous reasoning evolution through dual-loop self-questioning, answering, and criticism, inspired by Zone of Proximal Development to identify optimal learning difficulty.

entry.title: Short Chains, Deep Thoughts: Balancing Reasoning Efficiency and Intra-Segment Capability via Split-Merge Optimization

author.name: Runquan Gui, Jie Wang, Zhihai Wang, Chi Ma, Jianye Hao, Feng Wu

entry.summary: CoSMo optimizes reasoning chains by merging redundant segments and splitting logical gaps rather than restricting token volume. Uses structure-aligned RL with segment-level rewards.

entry.title: Social Catalysts, Not Moral Agents: The Illusion of Alignment in LLM Societies

author.name: Yueqing Hu, Yixuan Jiang, Zehua Jiang, Xiao Wen, Tianhong Wang

entry.summary: Studies whether anchoring agents can foster cooperation in LLM multi-agent systems, finding they boost local cooperation through strategic compliance rather than genuine norm internalization.

entry.title: FullStack-Agent: Enhancing Agentic Full-Stack Web Coding via Development-Oriented Testing and Repository Back-Translation

author.name: Zimu Lu, Houxing Ren, Yunqiao Yang, Ke Wang, Zhuofan Zong, Mingjie Zhan, Hongsheng Li

entry.summary: FullStack-Agent enables full-stack web development through development-oriented testing, repository back-translation for data synthesis, and unified agent system.

entry.title: Bongards at the Boundary of Perception and Reasoning: Programs or Language?

author.name: Cassidy Langenfeld, Claas Beger, Gloria Geng, Wasu Top Piriyakulkij, Keya Hu, Yewen Pu, Kevin Ellis

entry.summary: Presents a neurosymbolic approach to Bongard problems combining LLMs for rule generation with parameterized programs and Bayesian optimization. Tests fundamental visual reasoning capabilities.

entry.title: Hand3R: Online 4D Hand-Scene Reconstruction in the Wild

author.name: Wendi Hu, Haonan Zhou, Wenhao Hu, Gaoang Wang

entry.summary: Hand3R presents the first online framework for joint 4D hand-scene reconstruction from monocular video, combining hand experts with 4D scene foundation models.

entry.title: Socratic-Geo: Synthetic Data Generation and Geometric Reasoning via Multi-Agent Interaction

author.name: Zhengbo Jiao, Shaobo Wang, Zifan Zhang, Wei Wang, Bing Zhao, Hu Wei, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Socratic-Geo generates geometric reasoning data through multi-agent interaction where Teacher generates Python scripts and Student provides feedback for curriculum learning.

entry.title: QVLA: Not All Channels Are Equal in Vision-Language-Action Model's Quantization

author.name: Yuhao Xu, Yantai Yang, Zhenyang Fan, Yufan Liu, Yuming Li, Bing Li, Zhipeng Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces QVLA, the first action-centric quantization framework for Vision-Language-Action models in robotics. Shows that naive uniform-bit quantization from LLMs fails for robotics due to compounding action deviations.

entry.title: ProAct: A Benchmark and Multimodal Framework for Structure-Aware Proactive Response

author.name: Xiaomeng Zhu, Fengming Zhu, Weijie Zhou, Ye Tian, Zhenlin Hu, Yufei Huang, Yuchun Guo, Xinyu Wu, Zhengyou Zhang, Fangzhen Lin, Xuantang Xiong

entry.summary: Introduces ProAct-75 benchmark for training and evaluating proactive AI agents across 75 tasks in assistance, maintenance, and safety monitoring domains with task graph annotations.

entry.title: Thought Editing: Steering Models by Editing Their Chain of Thought

author.name: Anton de la Fuente

entry.summary: Introduces 'thought editing' - steering reasoning models by inserting text into their chain-of-thought mid-generation. Tests across five alignment-relevant settings and finds random insertion often works best. Recommends as practical deployment technique.

entry.title: Beyond Dense States: Elevating Sparse Transcoders to Active Operators for Latent Reasoning

author.name: Yadong Wang, Haodong Chen, Yu Tian, Chuanxing Geng, Dong Liang, Xiang Chen

entry.summary: LSTR elevates sparse transcoders from passive analysis tools to active reasoning operators, enabling multi-step computation through sparse semantic transitions with residual skip architecture.

entry.title: Small Generalizable Prompt Predictive Models Can Steer Efficient RL Post-Training of Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Yun Qu, Qi Wang, Yixiu Mao, Heming Zou, Yuhang Jiang, Weijie Liu, Clive Bai, Kai Yang, Yangkun Chen, Saiyong Yang, Xiangyang Ji

entry.summary: GPS uses small generalizable predictive models for Bayesian inference over prompt difficulty to steer efficient RL post-training of large reasoning models, prioritizing intermediate-difficulty prompts.

entry.title: Live-Evo: Online Evolution of Agentic Memory from Continuous Feedback

author.name: Yaolun Zhang, Yiran Wu, Yijiong Yu, Qingyun Wu, Huazheng Wang

entry.summary: Live-Evo introduces online self-evolving memory for agents learning from continuous data streams, decoupling experiences from meta-guidelines and compiling task-adaptive guidance over time.

entry.title: Responsible Evaluation of AI for Mental Health

author.name: Hiba Arnaout, Anmol Goel, H. Andrew Schwartz, Steffen T. Eberhardt, Dana Atzil-Slonim, Gavin Doherty, Brian Schwartz, Wolfgang Lutz, Tim Althoff, Munmun De Choudhury, Hamidreza Jamalabadi, Raj Sanjay Shah, Flor Miriam Plaza-del-Arco, Dirk Hovy, Maria Liakata, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Presents interdisciplinary framework for responsible AI evaluation in mental health, analyzing 135 *CL publications to identify limitations in clinical validity, user experience, and equity considerations.

entry.title: Text is All You Need for Vision-Language Model Jailbreaking

author.name: Yihang Chen, Zhao Xu, Youyuan Jiang, Tianle Zheng, Cho-Jui Hsieh

entry.summary: Text-DJ jailbreaks LVLMs by exploiting OCR capability: decomposing harmful queries into benign sub-queries and presenting them visually alongside distraction queries.

entry.title: Factuality on Demand: Controlling the Factuality-Informativeness Trade-off in Text Generation

author.name: Ziwei Gong, Yanda Chen, Julia Hirschberg, Chen Zhao, He He, Zhou Yu, Kathleen Mckeown

entry.summary: Introduces Factuality-Controlled Generation enabling users to specify factuality constraints with queries. Proposes synthetic training data approach achieving controllable factuality-informativeness trade-off.

entry.title: The Strategic Foresight of LLMs: Evidence from a Fully Prospective Venture Tournament

author.name: Felipe A. Csaszar, Aticus Peterson, Daniel Wilde

entry.summary: Fully prospective prediction tournament evaluating LLM strategic foresight on live Kickstarter projects. Tests frontier and open-weight models against experienced managers and MBA-trained evaluators.

entry.title: GRAB: An LLM-Inspired Sequence-First Click-Through Rate Prediction Modeling Paradigm

author.name: Shaopeng Chen, Chuyue Xie, Huimin Ren, Shaozong Zhang, Han Zhang, Ruobing Cheng, Zhiqiang Cao, Zehao Ju, Yu Gao, Jie Ding, Xiaodong Chen, Xuewu Jiao, Shuanglong Li, Liu Lin

entry.summary: GRAB deploys generative framework for CTR prediction at Baidu with Causal Action-aware Multi-channel Attention. Reports 3.05% revenue increase and 3.49% CTR improvement in full-scale deployment.

entry.title: Rethinking Genomic Modeling Through Optical Character Recognition

author.name: Hongxin Xiang, Pengsen Ma, Yunkang Cao, Di Yu, Haowen Chen, Xinyu Yang, Xiangxiang Zeng

entry.summary: OpticalDNA reframes genomic modeling as OCR-style document understanding, rendering DNA into visual layouts for vision-language model processing with compact, reconstructible representations.

entry.title: State Rank Dynamics in Linear Attention LLMs

author.name: Ao Sun, Hongtao Zhang, Heng Zhou, Yixuan Ma, Yiran Qin, Tongrui Su, Yan Liu, Zhanyu Ma, Jun Xu, Jiuchong Gao, Jinghua Hao, Renqing He

entry.summary: Discovers 'State Rank Stratification' in linear attention LLMs - a spectral bifurcation where some heads maintain near-zero effective rank while others grow rapidly to an upper bound.

entry.title: From Sparse Decisions to Dense Reasoning: A Multi-attribute Trajectory Paradigm for Multimodal Moderation

author.name: Tianle Gu, Kexin Huang, Lingyu Li, Ruilin Luo, Shiyang Huang, Zongqi Wang, Yujiu Yang, Yan Teng, Yingchun Wang

entry.summary: UniMod transforms multimodal safety moderation from sparse binary decisions to dense reasoning trajectories, including evidence grounding, modality assessment, risk mapping and policy decisions for better content classification.

entry.title: Learning to Repair Lean Proofs from Compiler Feedback

author.name: Evan Wang, Simon Chess, Daniel Lee, Siyuan Ge, Ajit Mallavarapu, Vasily Ilin

entry.summary: Introduces APRIL dataset of 260K supervised tuples for Lean proof repair, pairing proof failures with compiler diagnostics and aligned repair/explanation targets. Training on APRIL substantially improves repair accuracy.

entry.title: Self-Hinting Language Models Enhance Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Baohao Liao, Hanze Dong, Xinxing Xu, Christof Monz, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Proposes SAGE for GRPO training that injects privileged hints during training to reshape rollout distribution while using same terminal verifier reward, addressing sparse reward stalling.

entry.title: Achieving Linear Speedup for Composite Federated Learning

author.name: Kun Huang, Shi Pu

entry.summary: Proposes FedNMap achieving first linear speedup result with respect to both number of clients and local updates for composite federated learning with nonsmooth regularizers.

entry.title: Soft-Radial Projection for Constrained End-to-End Learning

author.name: Philipp J. Schneider, Daniel Kuhn

entry.summary: Introduces Soft-Radial Projection, a differentiable layer using radial mapping to maintain strict feasibility with full-rank Jacobian, avoiding gradient saturation from standard projections.

entry.title: Explaining the Explainer: Understanding the Inner Workings of Transformer-based Symbolic Regression Models

author.name: Arco van Breda, Erman Acar

entry.summary: Introduces PATCHES, an evolutionary circuit discovery algorithm for symbolic regression transformers, providing first circuit-level characterization with causal evaluation framework.

entry.title: Ultra Fast PDE Solving via Physics Guided Few-step Diffusion

author.name: Cindy Xiangrui Kong, Yueqi Wang, Haoyang Zheng, Weijian Luo, Guang Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Phys-Instruct for physics-guided distillation of diffusion PDE solvers into few-step generators while enhancing physics consistency through explicit PDE knowledge injection.

entry.title: Monotonicity as an Architectural Bias for Robust Language Models

author.name: Patrick Cooper, Alireza Nadali, Ashutosh Trivedi, Alvaro Velasquez

entry.summary: Investigates monotonicity as architectural inductive bias for LLM robustness, constraining semantic transformations so strengthening inputs cannot regress representations.

entry.title: Rethinking the Reranker: Boundary-Aware Evidence Selection for Robust Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Jiashuo Sun, Pengcheng Jiang, Saizhuo Wang, Jiajun Fan, Heng Wang, Siru Ouyang, Ming Zhong, Yizhu Jiao, Chengsong Huang, Xueqiang Xu, Pengrui Han, Peiran Li, Jiaxin Huang, Ge Liu, Heng Ji, Jiawei Han

entry.summary: BAR-RAG reframes reranking as boundary-aware evidence selection targeting the generator's 'Goldilocks Zone' - evidence that is challenging yet sufficient rather than trivially easy.

entry.title: Search-R2: Enhancing Search-Integrated Reasoning via Actor-Refiner Collaboration

author.name: Bowei He, Minda Hu, Zenan Xu, Hongru Wang, Licheng Zong, Yankai Chen, Chen Ma, Xue Liu, Pluto Zhou, Irwin King

entry.summary: Search-R2 uses Actor-Refiner collaboration for search-integrated reasoning, with the Refiner intervening on problematic Actor reasoning and both jointly optimized during training.

entry.title: Diversity-Preserved Distribution Matching Distillation for Fast Visual Synthesis

author.name: Tianhe Wu, Ruibin Li, Lei Zhang, Kede Ma

entry.summary: Addresses mode collapse in distribution matching distillation through role-separated distillation where first step preserves diversity and subsequent steps refine quality.

entry.title: MedSAM-Agent: Empowering Interactive Medical Image Segmentation with Multi-turn Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shengyuan Liu, Liuxin Bao, Qi Yang, Wanting Geng, Boyun Zheng, Chenxin Li, Wenting Chen, Houwen Peng, Yixuan Yuan

entry.summary: MedSAM-Agent reformulates interactive medical segmentation as multi-step autonomous decision-making with RLVR, using MLLMs to orchestrate SAM.

entry.title: TIPS Over Tricks: Simple Prompts for Effective Zero-shot Anomaly Detection

author.name: Alireza Salehi, Ehsan Karami, Sepehr Noey, Sahand Noey, Makoto Yamada, Reshad Hosseini, Mohammad Sabokrou

entry.summary: Shows that using TIPS backbone with simple decoupled prompts achieves strong zero-shot anomaly detection, outperforming complex auxiliary modules on CLIP.

entry.title: BridgeV2W: Bridging Video Generation Models to Embodied World Models via Embodiment Masks

author.name: Yixiang Chen, Peiyan Li, Jiabing Yang, Keji He, Xiangnan Wu, Yuan Xu, Kai Wang, Jing Liu, Nianfeng Liu, Yan Huang, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Presents BridgeV2W, converting coordinate-space actions into pixel-aligned embodiment masks for video generation models. Enables unified architecture across embodiments with view-specific conditioning.

entry.title: Conformal Reachability for Safe Control in Unknown Environments

author.name: Xinhang Ma, Junlin Wu, Yiannis Kantaros, Yevgeniy Vorobeychik

entry.summary: Develops probabilistic verification framework for safe control of unknown dynamical systems combining conformal prediction with reachability analysis. Trains policies optimizing probability of remaining safe.

entry.title: Agyn: A Multi-Agent System for Team-Based Autonomous Software Engineering

author.name: Nikita Benkovich, Vitalii Valkov

entry.summary: Agyn presents a multi-agent system for autonomous software engineering that models development as an organizational process with specialized agents for coordination, research, implementation, and review roles.

entry.title: Controlling Exploration-Exploitation in GFlowNets via Markov Chain Perspectives

author.name: Lin Chen, Samuel Drapeau, Fanghao Shao, Xuekai Zhu, Bo Xue, Yunchong Song, Mathieu Lauri\`ere, Zhouhan Lin

entry.summary: Establishes equivalence between GFlowNet objectives and Markov chain reversibility, proposing α-GFNs that generalize forward-backward policy mixing for controllable exploration-exploitation tradeoffs.

entry.title: Edit Knowledge, Not Just Facts via Multi-Step Reasoning over Background Stories

author.name: Ya Gao, Kalle Kujanp\"a\"a, Pekka Marttinen, Harri Valpola, Alexander Ilin

entry.summary: Argues that knowledge internalization is fundamentally a reasoning problem, proposing training on background stories where new information is instrumental to multi-step reasoning tasks.

entry.title: Drift-Bench: Diagnosing Cooperative Breakdowns in LLM Agents under Input Faults via Multi-Turn Interaction

author.name: Han Bao, Zheyuan Zhang, Pengcheng Jing, Zhengqing Yuan, Kaiwen Shi, Yanfang Ye

entry.summary: Drift-Bench diagnoses cooperative breakdowns in LLM agents under input faults (implicit intent, missing parameters, false presuppositions) through multi-turn clarification in execution environments.

entry.title: Mirage2Matter: A Physically Grounded Gaussian World Model from Video

author.name: Zhengqing Gao, Ziwen Li, Xin Wang, Jiaxin Huang, Zhenyang Ren, Mingkai Shao, Hanlue Zhang, Tianyu Huang, Yongkang Cheng, Yandong Guo, Runqi Lin, Yuanyuan Wang, Tongliang Liu, Kun Zhang, Mingming Gong

entry.summary: Presents Simulate Anything framework reconstructing real-world environments into photorealistic 3DGS scenes from multi-view videos for physics-based embodied training data generation without expensive sensors.

entry.title: Decouple Searching from Training: Scaling Data Mixing via Model Merging for Large Language Model Pre-training

author.name: Shengrui Li, Fei Zhao, Kaiyan Zhao, Jieying Ye, Haifeng Liu, Fangcheng Shi, Zheyong Xie, Yao Hu, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Proposes DeMix framework using model merging to predict optimal data mixing ratios for LLM pretraining. Decouples mixture search from training through weighted model merging.

entry.title: Continuous-Utility Direct Preference Optimization

author.name: Muhammad Ahmed Mohsin, Muhammad Umer, Ahsan Bilal, Zihao He, Muhammad Usman Rafique, Asad Aali, Muhammad Ali Jamshed, John M. Cioffi, Emily Fox

entry.summary: Introduces CU-DPO replacing binary DPO labels with continuous utility scores. Proves K strategies yield Θ(K log K) sample complexity improvement and convergence to entropy-regularized optimal policy.

entry.title: Game of Thought: Robust Information Seeking with Large Language Models Using Game Theory

author.name: Langyuan Cui, Chun Kai Ling, Hwee Tou Ng

entry.summary: Game of Thought formalizes information-seeking as two-player zero-sum game using Twenty Questions setting. Proposes game-theoretic approach for robust worst-case performance in high-stakes applications.

entry.title: COLT: Lightweight Multi-LLM Collaboration through Shared MCTS Reasoning for Model Compilation

author.name: Annabelle Sujun Tang, Christopher Priebe, Lianhui Qin, Hadi Esmaeilzadeh

entry.summary: COLT enables lightweight multi-LLM collaboration for compiler optimization via shared MCTS, using small models primarily with selective large model consultation.

entry.title: RACA: Representation-Aware Coverage Criteria for LLM Safety Testing

author.name: Zeming Wei, Zhixin Zhang, Chengcan Wu, Yihao Zhang, Xiaokun Luan, Meng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces RACA, coverage criteria for LLM safety testing that leverages representation engineering to focus on internal activation patterns linked to harmful behaviors.

entry.title: HyPAC: Cost-Efficient LLMs-Human Hybrid Annotation with PAC Error Guarantees

author.name: Hao Zeng, Huipeng Huang, Xinhao Qu, Jianguo Huang, Bingyi Jing, Hongxin Wei

entry.summary: HyPAC routes annotation inputs to most cost-efficient source (fast LLMs, reasoning models, or humans) while providing distribution-free PAC guarantees on labeling error using importance sampling and confidence bounds.

entry.title: DynSplit-KV: Dynamic Semantic Splitting for KVCache Compression in Efficient Long-Context LLM Inference

author.name: Jiancai Ye, Jun Liu, Qingchen Li, Tianlang Zhao, Hanbin Zhang, Jiayi Pan, Ningyi Xu, Guohao Dai

entry.summary: Proposes DynSplit-KV for dynamic semantic splitting in KVCache compression, matching semantics adaptively rather than using rigid fixed intervals or delimiters. Achieves significant accuracy preservation.

entry.title: Causal Graph Learning via Distributional Invariance of Cause-Effect Relationship

author.name: Nang Hung Nguyen, Phi Le Nguyen, Thao Nguyen Truong, Trong Nghia Hoang, Masashi Sugiyama

entry.summary: Introduces framework for causal graph recovery using distributional invariance of effect-cause conditionals across downsampled subsets with different cause prior distributions.

entry.title: Chain-of-Goals Hierarchical Policy for Long-Horizon Offline Goal-Conditioned RL

author.name: Jinwoo Choi, Sang-Hyun Lee, Seung-Woo Seo

entry.summary: Proposes Chain-of-Goals Hierarchical Policy (CoGHP) for offline goal-conditioned RL that autoregressively generates sequences of latent subgoals within a unified architecture, inspired by chain-of-thought.

entry.title: Least but not Last: Fine-tuning Intermediate Principal Components for Better Performance-Forgetting Trade-Offs

author.name: Alessio Quercia, Arya Bangun, Ira Assent, Hanno Scharr

entry.summary: Shows intermediate principal components (not first or last) provide better performance-forgetting trade-offs for LoRA fine-tuning with more robustness to high learning rates.

entry.title: Mitigating Staleness in Asynchronous Pipeline Parallelism via Basis Rotation

author.name: Hyunji Jung, Sungbin Shin, Namhoon Lee

entry.summary: Addresses gradient staleness in asynchronous pipeline parallelism that scales linearly with depth, proposing basis rotation to rectify delayed gradients and restore scalability.

entry.title: APEX: Probing Neural Networks via Activation Perturbation

author.name: Tao Ren, Xiaoyu Luo, Qiongxiu Li

entry.summary: Introduces APEX, probing paradigm that perturbs hidden activations to reveal model-dependent structure, showing input perturbation is constrained special case of activation perturbation.

entry.title: PeerRank: Autonomous LLM Evaluation Through Web-Grounded, Bias-Controlled Peer Review

author.name: Yanki Margalit, Erni Avram, Ran Taig, Oded Margalit, Nurit Cohen-Inger

entry.summary: PeerRank enables fully autonomous LLM evaluation where models generate tasks, answer with web grounding, judge peers, and aggregate assessments without human supervision.

entry.title: Training Multi-Turn Search Agent via Contrastive Dynamic Branch Sampling

author.name: Yubao Zhao, Weiquan Huang, Sudong Wang, Ruochen Zhao, Chen Chen, Yao Shu, Chengwei Qin

entry.summary: BranPO provides step-level contrastive supervision for search agents by truncating trajectories near divergence points and resampling, addressing sparse reward challenges.

entry.title: Scaling Small Agents Through Strategy Auctions

author.name: Lisa Alazraki, William F. Shen, Yoram Bachrach, Akhil Mathur

entry.summary: SALE introduces strategy auctions where small agents bid with strategic plans scored by larger models, showing how to better leverage small agents for complex long-horizon tasks.

entry.title: SwiftVLM: Efficient Vision-Language Model Inference via Cross-Layer Token Bypass

author.name: Chen Qian, Xinran Yu, Danyang Li, Guoxuan Chi, Zheng Yang, Qiang Ma, Xin Miao

entry.summary: SwiftVLM introduces cross-layer token bypass that preserves unselected visual tokens for later retrieval rather than permanently pruning them. Addresses fine-grained detail loss in token pruning.

entry.title: EventFlash: Towards Efficient MLLMs for Event-Based Vision

author.name: Shaoyu Liu, Jianing Li, Guanghui Zhao, Yunjian Zhang, Wen Jiang, Ming Li, Xiangyang Ji

entry.summary: EventFlash proposes efficient MLLM for event-based vision with spatiotemporal token sparsification, accompanied by EventMind dataset with 500K instruction sets.

entry.title: Interpretable Logical Anomaly Classification via Constraint Decomposition and Instruction Fine-Tuning

author.name: Xufei Zhang, Xinjiao Zhou, Ziling Deng, Dongdong Geng, Jianxiong Wang

entry.summary: LogiCls introduces Logical Anomaly Classification that unifies detection and fine-grained violation classification through constraint decomposition and CoT instruction synthesis.

entry.title: SlowFocus: Enhancing Fine-grained Temporal Understanding in Video LLM

author.name: Ming Nie, Dan Ding, Chunwei Wang, Yuanfan Guo, Jianhua Han, Hang Xu, Li Zhang

entry.summary: SlowFocus enhances fine-grained temporal understanding in Video LLMs by increasing effective sampling frequency without compromising frame-level visual token quality.

entry.title: Test-Time Conditioning with Representation-Aligned Visual Features

author.name: Nicolas Sereyjol-Garros, Ellington Kirby, Victor Letzelter, Victor Besnier, Nermin Samet

entry.summary: REPA-G leverages representation-aligned features from self-supervised models for test-time conditioning in diffusion, enabling multi-scale control from patches to global features.

entry.title: Latent Perspective-Taking via a Schr\"odinger Bridge in Influence-Augmented Local Models

author.name: Kevin Alcedo, Pedro U. Lima, Rachid Alami

entry.summary: Proposes neuro-symbolic approach for Theory of Mind in robotics using Influence-Augmented Local Models and Schrödinger Bridge for perspective-taking. Learns structured mental models for human-robot interaction.

entry.title: Localizing and Correcting Errors for LLM-based Planners

author.name: Aditya Kumar, William W. Cohen

entry.summary: Proposes Localized In-Context Learning (L-ICL) to fix LLM planning failures by identifying first constraint violation and injecting minimal corrections. Shows LLMs violate domain constraints despite explicit instructions.

entry.title: KEPO: Knowledge-Enhanced Preference Optimization for Reinforcement Learning with Reasoning

author.name: Fan Yang, Rui Meng, Trudi Di Qi, Ali Ezzati, Yuxin Wen

entry.summary: KEPO addresses sparse rewards in reasoning RL by combining knowledge-enhanced process supervision with preference optimization. Uses teacher guidance selectively based on trajectory quality.

entry.title: Cross-Modal Memory Compression for Efficient Multi-Agent Debate

author.name: Jing Wu, Yue Sun, Tianpei Xie, Suiyao Chen, Jingyuan Bao, Yaopengxiao Xu, Gaoyuan Du, Inseok Heo, Alexander Gutfraind, Xin Wang

entry.summary: DebateOCR compresses multi-agent debate histories into images rather than text, reducing tokens by 92%+ while maintaining reasoning quality through cross-modal representation.

entry.title: Diagnosing the Reliability of LLM-as-a-Judge via Item Response Theory

author.name: Junhyuk Choi, Sohhyung Park, Chanhee Cho, Hyeonchu Park, Bugeun Kim

entry.summary: Uses Item Response Theory to diagnose LLM-as-a-Judge reliability, formalizing intrinsic consistency under prompt variations and human alignment as complementary dimensions.

entry.title: Unmasking Reasoning Processes: A Process-aware Benchmark for Evaluating Structural Mathematical Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Xiang Zheng, Weiqi Zhai, Wei Wang, Boyu Yang, Wenbo Li, Ruixiang Luo, Haoxiang Sun, Yucheng Wang, Zhengze Li, Meng Wang, Yuetian Du, Guojie Lin, Yaxuan Wang, Xiaoxiao Xu, Yanhu Mo, Xuan Ren, Hu Wei, Ze Xu

entry.summary: ReasoningMath-Plus benchmark with 150 curated problems targeting structural reasoning: multi-constraint coordination, constructive synthesis, and spatial inference that saturate existing benchmarks.

entry.title: Inference-Only Prompt Projection for Safe Text-to-Image Generation with TV Guarantees

author.name: Minhyuk Lee, Hyekyung Yoon, Myungjoo Kang

entry.summary: Formalizes Safety-Prompt Alignment Trade-off using total variation theory for text-to-image generation. Proposes inference-only prompt projection with theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: Optimizing Agentic Reasoning with Retrieval via Synthetic Semantic Information Gain Reward

author.name: Senkang Hu, Yong Dai, Yuzhi Zhao, Yihang Tao, Yu Guo, Zhengru Fang, Sam Tak Wu Kwong, Yuguang Fang

entry.summary: InfoReasoner uses synthetic semantic information gain reward for agentic reasoning with retrieval, defining information gain as belief uncertainty reduction with theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: Multi-Head Attention Is a Multi-Player Game

author.name: Kushal Chakrabarti, Nirmal Balachundar
