entry.summary: Frames multi-head attention as multi-player game where heads compete/coordinate. Proves Price of Anarchy bounds relate to hallucination probability and head redundancy.

entry.title: Learning Abstractions for Hierarchical Planning in Program-Synthesis Agents

author.name: Zergham Ahmed, Kazuki Irie, Joshua B. Tenenbaum, Christopher J. Bates, Samuel J. Gershman

entry.summary: TheoryCoder-2 learns reusable abstractions for hierarchical planning using LLM in-context learning, inspired by cognitive science of how humans form intuitive theories.

entry.title: MindGuard: Guardrail Classifiers for Multi-Turn Mental Health Support

author.name: Ant\'onio Farinhas, Nuno M. Guerreiro, Jos\'e Pombal, Pedro Henrique Martins, Laura Melton, Alex Conway, Cara Dochat, Maya D'Eon, Ricardo Rei

entry.summary: MindGuard introduces clinically grounded risk taxonomy for mental health LLM guardrails distinguishing therapeutic disclosure from genuine crises, with expert-annotated test set.

entry.title: Discovering Process-Outcome Credit in Multi-Step LLM Reasoning

author.name: Xiangwei Wang, Wei Wang, Ken Chen, Nanduni Nimalsiri, Saman Halgamuge

entry.summary: Proposes Step-wise Marginal Information Gain for continuous reward signals in reasoning RL, with decoupled masking applying process rewards to CoT and outcome rewards to full completion.

entry.title: Hard Constraints Meet Soft Generation: Guaranteed Feasibility for LLM-based Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Yang Liu, Chuan Zhou, Yancheng Chen, Shuai Zhang, Xixun Lin, Xiaoqing Wang

entry.summary: FALCON ensures 100% feasibility in LLM-based combinatorial optimization through grammar-constrained decoding, feasibility repair layer, and adaptive Best-of-N sampling with BOPO training.

entry.title: PersistBench: When Should Long-Term Memories Be Forgotten by LLMs?

author.name: Sidharth Pulipaka, Oliver Chen, Manas Sharma, Taaha S Bajwa, Vyas Raina, Ivaxi Sheth

entry.summary: PersistBench measures long-term memory safety risks: cross-domain leakage and memory-induced sycophancy. Evaluates 18 LLMs finding surprisingly high failure rates on memory persistence issues.

entry.title: Do All Individual Layers Help? An Empirical Study of Task-Interfering Layers in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Zhiming Liu, Yujie Wei, Lei Feng, Xiu Su, Xiaobo Xia, Weili Guan, Zeke Xie, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Discovers that certain layers in Vision-Language Models actually hurt performance on downstream tasks ('task-interfering layers'), and that bypassing them improves results. This finding generalizes across models and datasets, suggesting potential for model efficiency improvements.

entry.title: Predictive Scheduling for Efficient Inference-Time Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Katrina Brown, Aneesh Muppidi, Rana Shahout

entry.summary: Introduces predictive scheduling that estimates query difficulty before generation using lightweight predictors, then dynamically allocates token budgets across queries to maximize accuracy. Shows gains on GSM8K benchmark.

entry.title: Evolving from Tool User to Creator via Training-Free Experience Reuse in Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Xintian Shen, Jiawei Chen, Lihao Zheng, Hao Ma, Tao Wei, Kun Zhan

entry.summary: UCT transforms LLM agents from tool users to tool creators by harvesting and parameterizing reasoning traces into reusable tools, enabling self-optimization without training.

entry.title: Thinking with Comics: Enhancing Multimodal Reasoning through Structured Visual Storytelling

author.name: Andong Chen, Wenxin Zhu, Qiuyu Ding, Yuchen Song, Muyun Yang, Tiejun Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes 'Thinking with Comics' as visual reasoning paradigm between images and videos, preserving temporal structure with lower computational cost while maintaining narrative coherence.

entry.title: G-MemLLM: Gated Latent Memory Augmentation for Long-Context Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Xun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes G-MemLLM, a memory-augmented LLM architecture with a trainable Latent Memory Bank using GRU-style gated updates to selectively preserve or overwrite memory slots, addressing context rot in long-horizon reasoning.

entry.title: AI-Generated Image Detectors Overrely on Global Artifacts: Evidence from Inpainting Exchange

author.name: Elif Nebioglu, Emirhan Bilgi\c{c}, Adrian Popescu

entry.summary: Shows AI-generated image detectors primarily rely on global VAE-induced spectral artifacts rather than locally synthesized content. Introduces INP-X benchmark isolating inpainted regions from reconstruction artifacts.

entry.title: Semantics-Preserving Evasion of LLM Vulnerability Detectors

author.name: Luze Sun, Alina Oprea, Eric Wong

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM vulnerability detectors under semantics-preserving adversarial transformations, finding systemic failure where predictions flip under behavior-equivalent code edits.

entry.title: Post-Training Probability Manifold Correction via Structured SVD Pruning and Self-Referential Distillation

author.name: Aaron R. Flouro, Shawn P. Chadwick

entry.summary: SparseKD combines SVD pruning with self-referential knowledge distillation, finding 39% quality improvement from self-distillation alone even on converged checkpoints.

entry.title: Data Distribution as a Lever for Guiding Optimizers Toward Superior Generalization in LLMs

author.name: Tushaar Gangavarapu, Jiping Li, Christopher Vattheuer, Zhangyang Wang, Baharan Mirzasoleiman

entry.summary: Theoretically analyzes how training data distribution affects optimizer generalization in LLMs, comparing gradient descent with sharpness-aware minimization. Shows SAM induces lower simplicity bias and proposes data distribution modifications to achieve similar effects.

entry.title: Adaptive Ability Decomposing for Unlocking Large Reasoning Model Effective Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhipeng Chen, Xiaobo Qin, Wayne Xin Zhao, Youbin Wu, Ji-Rong Wen

entry.summary: Proposes A²D for enhancing RLVR by training a decomposer to break complex questions into simpler sub-questions without teacher model distillation. Provides additional guidance for blind exploration.

entry.title: An Odd Estimator for Shapley Values

author.name: Fabian Fumagalli, Landon Butler, Justin Singh Kang, Kannan Ramchandran, R. Teal Witter

entry.summary: Proves that Shapley values depend exclusively on the odd component of set functions, explaining why paired sampling reduces estimation error. Proposes improved odd estimator leveraging this insight.

entry.title: Generative Visual Code Mobile World Models

author.name: Woosung Koh, Sungjun Han, Segyu Lee, Se-Young Yun, Jamin Shin

entry.summary: Proposes visual world modeling via renderable code generation for mobile GUIs, where VLMs predict next GUI state as executable web code rather than pixels directly.

entry.title: The Effect of Mini-Batch Noise on the Implicit Bias of Adam

author.name: Matias D. Cattaneo, Boris Shigida

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework for understanding how mini-batch noise influences Adam's implicit bias toward sharper or flatter loss regions. Particularly relevant for multi-epoch training where generalization correlates with landscape flatness.

entry.title: Rethinking LoRA for Data Heterogeneous Federated Learning: Subspace and State Alignment

author.name: Hongyi Peng, Han Yu, Xiaoxiao Li, Qiang Yang

entry.summary: FedGaLore combines GaLore-style gradient subspace optimization with server-side state synchronization to address update-space and optimizer-state mismatch in federated LoRA.

entry.title: SAME: Stabilized Mixture-of-Experts for Multimodal Continual Instruction Tuning

author.name: Zhen-Hao Xie, Jun-Tao Tang, Yu-Cheng Shi, Han-Jia Ye, De-Chuan Zhan, Da-Wei Zhou

entry.summary: SAME addresses router drift and expert forgetting in multimodal continual instruction tuning through stabilized MoE with drift-robust synchronization.

entry.title: Probabilistic Performance Guarantees for Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yannik Schnitzer, Mathias Jackermeier, Alessandro Abate, David Parker

entry.summary: Presents a method for computing high-confidence performance guarantees for multi-task RL policies on unseen tasks, combining per-task confidence bounds with task-level generalization bounds.

entry.title: RE-TRAC: REcursive TRAjectory Compression for Deep Search Agents

author.name: Jialiang Zhu, Gongrui Zhang, Xiaolong Ma, Lin Xu, Miaosen Zhang, Ruiqi Yang, Song Wang, Kai Qiu, Zhirong Wu, Qi Dai, Ruichun Ma, Bei Liu, Yifan Yang, Chong Luo, Zhengyuan Yang, Linjie Li, Lijuan Wang, Weizhu Chen, Xin Geng, Baining Guo

entry.summary: Proposes RE-TRAC, an agentic framework for deep research that generates structured state representations after each trajectory to enable cross-trajectory exploration and iterative refinement.

entry.title: Product Interaction: An Algebraic Formalism for Deep Learning Architectures

author.name: Haonan Dong, Chun-Wun Cheng, Angelica I. Aviles-Rivero

entry.summary: Product interactions provide algebraic formalism showing neural network layers arise from compositions of multiplication operators over algebras. Unifies convolutions, equivariant networks, attention, and Mamba.

entry.title: Controlled disagreement improves generalization in decentralized training

author.name: Zesen Wang, Mikael Johansson

entry.summary: Introduces DSGD-AC which intentionally preserves non-vanishing consensus errors in decentralized training. Proves these errors align with dominant Hessian subspace, guiding optimization toward flatter minima.

entry.title: Spectral Evolution Search: Efficient Inference-Time Scaling for Reward-Aligned Image Generation

author.name: Jinyan Ye, Zhongjie Duan, Zhiwen Li, Cen Chen, Daoyuan Chen, Yaliang Li, Yingda Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Spectral Evolution Search for inference-time scaling of image generation, discovering that model sensitivity to initial perturbations diminishes rapidly at higher frequencies. Enables efficient gradient-free search in low-frequency subspace.

entry.title: Causal Inference on Networks under Misspecified Exposure Mappings: A Partial Identification Framework

author.name: Maresa Schr\"oder, Miruna Oprescu, Stefan Feuerriegel, Nathan Kallus

entry.summary: Develops partial identification framework for causal inference on networks under misspecified exposure mappings, deriving sharp bounds on direct and spillover effects.

entry.title: Rank-Learner: Orthogonal Ranking of Treatment Effects

author.name: Henri Arno, Dennis Frauen, Emil Javurek, Thomas Demeester, Stefan Feuerriegel

entry.summary: Introduces Rank-Learner, a two-stage approach to directly learn treatment effect rankings from observational data, avoiding the harder problem of precise effect estimation.

entry.title: Sequential Group Composition: A Window into the Mechanics of Deep Learning

author.name: Giovanni Luca Marchetti, Daniel Kunin, Adele Myers, Francisco Acosta, Nina Miolane

entry.summary: Studies how networks learn structured group operations through sequential composition task, proving networks learn one irreducible representation at a time ordered by Fourier statistics.

entry.title: Should I use Synthetic Data for That? An Analysis of the Suitability of Synthetic Data for Data Sharing and Augmentation

author.name: Bogdan Kulynych, Theresa Stadler, Jean Louis Raisaro, Carmela Troncoso

entry.summary: Formally analyzes three synthetic data use cases (privacy-preserving sharing, ML augmentation, variance reduction), identifying conditions where synthetic data achieves intended objectives.

entry.title: MathlibLemma: Folklore Lemma Generation and Benchmark for Formal Mathematics

author.name: Xinyu Liu, Zixuan Xie, Amir Moeini, Claire Chen, Shuze Daniel Liu, Yu Meng, Aidong Zhang, Shangtong Zhang

entry.summary: MathlibLemma is first LLM multi-agent system to automate discovery and formalization of mathematical folklore lemmas, with contributions already merged into Mathlib.

entry.title: Fully Kolmogorov-Arnold Deep Model in Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Xingyu Qiu, Xinghua Ma, Dong Liang, Gongning Luo, Wei Wang, Kuanquan Wang, Shuo Li

entry.summary: Introduces Share-activation KAN (SaKAN), the first fully Kolmogorov-Arnold based deep model, overcoming training difficulties and memory requirements that previously limited KAN adoption. Demonstrates that KA-based layers can entirely replace traditional architectures in medical image segmentation with superior learning capacity.

entry.title: Agentic Proposing: Enhancing Large Language Model Reasoning via Compositional Skill Synthesis

author.name: Zhengbo Jiao, Shaobo Wang, Zifan Zhang, Xuan Ren, Wei Wang, Bing Zhao, Hu Wei, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Agentic Proposing, modeling problem synthesis as a goal-driven sequential decision process where an agent dynamically selects and composes modular reasoning skills. Develops Agentic-Proposer-4B using Multi-Granularity training for generating high-quality reasoning datasets.

entry.title: EHRWorld: A Patient-Centric Medical World Model for Long-Horizon Clinical Trajectories

author.name: Linjie Mu, Zhongzhen Huang, Yannian Gu, Shengqian Qin, Shaoting Zhang, Xiaofan Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces EHRWorld, a patient-centric medical world model showing LLMs struggle to maintain consistent patient states under sequential interventions. Addresses error accumulation in long-horizon clinical simulation.

entry.title: Neural Attention Search Linear: Towards Adaptive Token-Level Hybrid Attention Models

author.name: Difan Deng, Andreas Bentzen Winje, Lukas Fehring, Marius Lindauer

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Attention Search Linear, enabling adaptive token-level hybrid attention between softmax and linear attention, addressing the expressivity-efficiency tradeoff. Previous hybrid approaches still bottlenecked by softmax layers.

entry.title: Fast-Slow Efficient Training for Multimodal Large Language Models via Visual Token Pruning

author.name: Dingkun Zhang, Shuhan Qi, Yulin Wu, Xinyu Xiao, Xuan Wang, Long Chen

entry.summary: Proposes DualSpeed, a fast-slow framework for efficient MLLM training via visual token pruning, addressing training-inference mismatch where pruning-trained models perform poorly on full token sequences.

entry.title: Parallel-Probe: Towards Efficient Parallel Thinking via 2D Probing

author.name: Tong Zheng, Chengsong Huang, Runpeng Dai, Yun He, Rui Liu, Xin Ni, Huiwen Bao, Kaishen Wang, Hongtu Zhu, Jiaxin Huang, Furong Huang, Heng Huang

entry.summary: Parallel-Probe exposes width-depth dynamics of parallel thinking through periodic probing, revealing non-monotonic scaling and early consensus to enable training-free optimization.

entry.title: Agent Primitives: Reusable Latent Building Blocks for Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Haibo Jin, Kuang Peng, Ye Yu, Xiaopeng Yuan, Haohan Wang

entry.summary: Agent Primitives proposes reusable latent building blocks for multi-agent systems inspired by neural network design, reducing task-specific complexity and improving stability.

entry.title: SharpTimeGS: Sharp and Stable Dynamic Gaussian Splatting via Lifespan Modulation

author.name: Zhanfeng Liao, Jiajun Zhang, Hanzhang Tu, Zhixi Wang, Yunqi Gao, Hongwen Zhang, Yebin Liu

entry.summary: SharpTimeGS introduces lifespan-aware 4D Gaussian splatting that adaptively models static and dynamic regions through learnable temporal visibility parameters. The flat-top profile formulation allows better handling of long-term static content.

entry.title: Composable Visual Tokenizers with Generator-Free Diagnostics of Learnability

author.name: Bingchen Zhao, Qiushan Guo, Ye Wang, Yixuan Huang, Zhonghua Zhai, Yu Tian

entry.summary: CompTok introduces composable visual tokenizers using token-conditioned diffusion decoders with InfoGAN-style objectives and token swapping for compositional control.

entry.title: Cut to the Mix: Simple Data Augmentation Outperforms Elaborate Ones in Limited Organ Segmentation Datasets

author.name: Chang Liu, Fuxin Fan, Annette Schwarz, Andreas Maier

entry.summary: Demonstrates that simple data augmentation (CutMix) outperforms elaborate methods for multi-organ segmentation with limited data, challenging complexity assumptions.

entry.title: Refer-Agent: A Collaborative Multi-Agent System with Reasoning and Reflection for Referring Video Object Segmentation

author.name: Haichao Jiang, Tianming Liang, Wei-Shi Zheng, Jian-Fang Hu

entry.summary: Refer-Agent is a collaborative multi-agent system for referring video object segmentation with alternating reasoning-reflection mechanisms.

entry.title: Referring Industrial Anomaly Segmentation

author.name: Pengfei Yue, Xiaokang Jiang, Yilin Lu, Jianghang Lin, Shengchuan Zhang, Liujuan Cao

entry.summary: RIAS introduces referring industrial anomaly segmentation paradigm with MVTec-Ref dataset featuring 9x more precise localization than existing benchmarks.

entry.title: MVP-LAM: Learning Action-Centric Latent Action via Cross-Viewpoint Reconstruction

author.name: Jung Min Lee, Dohyeok Lee, Seokhun Ju, Taehyun Cho, Jin Woo Koo, Li Zhao, Sangwoo Hong, Jungwoo Lee

entry.summary: Proposes MVP-LAM for learning latent actions from multi-viewpoint videos using cross-viewpoint reconstruction. Enables VLA pretraining without ground-truth action labels.

entry.title: Moving On, Even When You're Broken: Fail-Active Trajectory Generation via Diffusion Policies Conditioned on Embodiment and Task

author.name: Gilberto G. Briscoe-Martinez, Yaashia Gautam, Rahul Shetty, Anuj Pasricha, Marco M. Nicotra, Alessandro Roncone

entry.summary: Presents DEFT, a diffusion-based trajectory generator for fail-active robot operation under actuator failures. Conditioned on current embodiment and task constraints to enable task completion despite failures.

entry.title: Unless That Claw Is The Famous OpenClaw

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's analysis of OpenClaw, an autonomous AI agent system with access to user accounts that can manage various life tasks. Discusses safety considerations, practical limitations, and comparisons to Moltbook.

entry.title: SimGym: Traffic-Grounded Browser Agents for Offline A/B Testing in E-Commerce

author.name: Alberto Castelo, Zahra Zanjani Foumani, Ailin Fan, Keat Yang Koay, Vibhor Malik, Yuanzheng Zhu, Han Li, Meysam Feghhi, Ronie Uliana, Shuang Xie, Zhaoyu Zhang, Angelo Ocana Martins, Mingyu Zhao, Francis Pelland, Jonathan Faerman, Nikolas LeBlanc, Aaron Glazer, Andrew McNamara, Lingyun Wang, Zhong Wu

entry.summary: SimGym enables offline A/B testing for e-commerce by simulating traffic-grounded synthetic buyers using LLM agents in live browsers. Validated against real human outcomes on a major e-commerce platform.

entry.title: Optimizing Prompts for Large Language Models: A Causal Approach

author.name: Wei Chen, Yanbin Fang, Shuran Fu, Fasheng Xu, Xuan Wei

entry.summary: CPO (Causal Prompt Optimization) reframes prompt design as causal estimation, learning offline causal effects of prompt strategies then using them for test-time adaptation to heterogeneous queries.

entry.title: Geometric Analysis of Token Selection in Multi-Head Attention

author.name: Timur Mudarisov, Mikhal Burtsev, Tatiana Petrova, Radu State

entry.summary: Develops geometric framework for analyzing multi-head attention through top-N selection lens, defining Precision/Recall/F-score metrics with non-asymptotic bounds for token separability.

entry.title: Position: Explaining Behavioral Shifts in Large Language Models Requires a Comparative Approach

author.name: Martino Ciaperoni, Marzio Di Vece, Luca Pappalardo, Fosca Giannotti, Francesco Giannini

entry.summary: Position paper arguing behavioral shifts in LLMs should be explained comparatively, targeting intervention-induced changes between reference and intervened models rather than single checkpoints.

entry.title: When LLMs Imagine People: A Human-Centered Persona Brainstorm Audit for Bias and Fairness in Creative Applications

author.name: Hongliu Cao, Eoin Thomas, Rodrigo Acuna Agost

entry.summary: Introduces Persona Brainstorm Audit for detecting LLM bias through open-ended persona generation, evaluating 12 SOTA models across social dimensions with longitudinal tracking capability.

entry.title: Reversible Diffusion Decoding for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Xinyun Wang, Min Zhang, Sen Cui, Zhikang Chen, Bo Jiang, Kun Kuang, Mingbao Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Reversible Diffusion Decoding for diffusion language models, enabling backtracking from stagnation states via cached model states and confidence-guided re-masking for selective token reinitialization.

entry.title: When Agents "Misremember" Collectively: Exploring the Mandela Effect in LLM-based Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Naen Xu, Hengyu An, Shuo Shi, Jinghuai Zhang, Chunyi Zhou, Changjiang Li, Tianyu Du, Zhihui Fu, Jun Wang, Shouling Ji

entry.summary: Studies the Mandela effect in multi-agent LLM systems where agents collectively misremember due to false details reinforced through social influence and internalized misinformation.

entry.title: Neural FOXP2 -- Language Specific Neuron Steering for Targeted Language Improvement in LLMs

author.name: Anusa Saha, Tanmay Joshi, Vinija Jain, Aman Chadha, Amitava Das

entry.summary: Introduces Neural FOXP2 for mechanistically steering LLM language preferences via sparse feature circuits. Uses SAEs to isolate language-specific neurons and make chosen language primary.

entry.title: Contribution-aware Token Compression for Efficient Video Understanding via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yinchao Ma, Qiang Zhou, Zhibin Wang, Xianing Chen, Hanqing Yang, Jun Song, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: CaCoVID uses reinforcement learning to learn contribution-aware token compression for video LLMs, optimizing token selection based on actual contribution to correct answers rather than attention scores.

entry.title: Learning Sparse Visual Representations via Spatial-Semantic Factorization

author.name: Theodore Zhengde Zhao, Sid Kiblawi, Jianwei Yang, Naoto Usuyama, Reuben Tan, Noel C Codella, Tristan Naumann, Hoifung Poon, Mu Wei

entry.summary: STELLAR factorizes visual features into low-rank product of semantic concepts and spatial distributions, resolving conflict between semantic SSL (DINO) and generative SSL (MAE).

entry.title: Your AI-Generated Image Detector Can Secretly Achieve SOTA Accuracy, If Calibrated

author.name: Muli Yang, Gabriel James Goenawan, Henan Wang, Huaiyuan Qin, Chenghao Xu, Yanhua Yang, Fen Fang, Ying Sun, Joo-Hwee Lim, Hongyuan Zhu

entry.summary: Shows AI-generated image detectors exhibit systematic bias from distributional shift. Proposes Bayesian calibration framework achieving SOTA through learnable logit correction.

entry.title: Preserve-Then-Quantize: Balancing Rank Budgets for Quantization Error Reconstruction in LLMs

author.name: Yoonjun Cho, Dongjae Jeon, Soeun Kim, Moongyu Jeon, Albert No

entry.summary: Structured Residual Reconstruction allocates rank budget between preserving top-k singular subspace and error reconstruction in LLM quantization, with theory-guided selection criterion.

entry.title: TTT-Parkour: Rapid Test-Time Training for Perceptive Robot Parkour

author.name: Shaoting Zhu, Baijun Ye, Jiaxuan Wang, Jiakang Chen, Ziwen Zhuang, Linzhan Mou, Runhan Huang, Hang Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes TTT-Parkour, a real-to-sim-to-real framework using rapid test-time training for humanoid parkour on novel terrains via high-fidelity mesh reconstruction.

entry.title: Reward-free Alignment for Conflicting Objectives

author.name: Peter Chen, Xiaopeng Li, Xi Chen, Tianyi Lin

entry.summary: Introduces RACO, a reward-free alignment framework for conflicting objectives that directly uses preference data without reward models while resolving multi-objective trade-offs.

entry.title: SPA-Cache: Singular Proxies for Adaptive Caching in Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Wenhao Sun, Rong-Cheng Tu, Yifu Ding, Zhao Jin, Jingyi Liao, Yongcheng Jing, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: SPA-Cache introduces efficient KV-caching for Diffusion Language Models via low-dimensional singular proxies for identifying update-critical tokens and adaptive budget allocation.

entry.title: QuantLRM: Quantization of Large Reasoning Models via Fine-Tuning Signals

author.name: Nan Zhang, Eugene Kwek, Yusen Zhang, Muyu Pan, Suhang Wang, Prasenjit Mitra, Rui Zhang

entry.summary: QuantLRM uses fine-tuning weight update magnitudes to guide quantization of Large Reasoning Models, finding that both smallest and largest updates are important ('protecting both ends').

entry.title: Causal Flow Q-Learning for Robust Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Mingxuan Li, Junzhe Zhang, Elias Bareinboim

entry.summary: Develops Causal Flow Q-Learning for offline RL that addresses confounded observations from sensor capability mismatch between demonstrator and learner. Optimizes worst-case policy performance under unmeasured confounding.

entry.title: CoBA-RL: Capability-Oriented Budget Allocation for Reinforcement Learning in LLMs

author.name: Zhiyuan Yao, Yi-Kai Zhang, Yuxin Chen, Yueqing Sun, Zishan Xu, Yu Yang, Tianhao Hu, Qi Gu, Hui Su, Xunliang Cai

entry.summary: Proposes CoBA-RL for adaptive rollout budget allocation in RLVR using capability-oriented value function to map tasks to training gains, with heap-based greedy allocation strategy.

entry.title: Lookahead Sample Reward Guidance for Test-Time Scaling of Diffusion Models

author.name: Yeongmin Kim, Donghyeok Shin, Byeonghu Na, Minsang Park, Richard Lee Kim, Il-Chul Moon

entry.summary: Develops a method to compute expected future reward at intermediate diffusion steps using only marginal samples, enabling parallelizable reward-guided sampling without sequential neural backpropagation.

entry.title: Bayesian Conformal Prediction as a Decision Risk Problem

author.name: Fanyi Wu, Veronika Lohmanova, Samuel Kaski, Michele Caprio

entry.summary: Uses Bayesian posterior predictive densities as conformal scores with Bayesian quadrature to minimize expected prediction set size, providing valid coverage even under model misspecification with lower variance.

entry.title: A Minimal Task Reveals Emergent Path Integration and Object-Location Binding in a Predictive Sequence Model

author.name: Linda Ariel Ventura, Victoria Bosch, Tim C Kietzmann, Sushrut Thorat

entry.summary: Shows recurrent neural networks trained on sequential prediction develop emergent path integration and dynamic object-location binding, providing insights into world model formation.

entry.title: When Single Answer Is Not Enough: Rethinking Single-Step Retrosynthesis Benchmarks for LLMs

author.name: Bogdan Zagribelnyy, Ivan Ilin, Maksim Kuznetsov, Nikita Bondarev, Roman Schutski, Thomas MacDougall, Rim Shayakhmetov, Zulfat Miftakhutdinov, Mikolaj Mizera, Vladimir Aladinskiy, Alex Aliper, Alex Zhavoronkov

entry.summary: Proposes new benchmarking framework for retrosynthesis using ChemCensor metric for chemical plausibility rather than exact match, and introduces CREED dataset.

entry.title: LLM-Inspired Pretrain-Then-Finetune for Small-Data, Large-Scale Optimization

author.name: Zishi Zhang, Jinhui Han, Ming Hu, Yijie Peng

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-inspired pretrain-then-finetune approach for small-data, large-scale optimization using Transformer pretrained on domain-informed synthetic data then fine-tuned on real observations.

entry.title: Uncertainty and Fairness Awareness in LLM-Based Recommendation Systems

author.name: Chandan Kumar Sah, Xiaoli Lian, Li Zhang, Tony Xu, Syed Shazaib Shah

entry.summary: Studies uncertainty and fairness in LLM recommendations, finding systematic unfairness in Gemini 1.5 Flash for certain demographic attributes with quantified similarity-based gaps.

entry.title: LatentMem: Customizing Latent Memory for Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Muxin Fu, Guibin Zhang, Xiangyuan Xue, Yafu Li, Zefeng He, Siyuan Huang, Xiaoye Qu, Yu Cheng, Yang Yang

entry.summary: LatentMem provides learnable multi-agent memory addressing homogenization and information overload through role-aware customization in latent space.

entry.title: Can Large Language Models Generalize Procedures Across Representations?

author.name: Fangru Lin, Valentin Hofmann, Xingchen Wan, Weixing Wang, Zifeng Ding, Anthony G. Cohn, Janet B. Pierrehumbert

entry.summary: Studies whether LLMs can generalize procedures across code, graphs, and natural language representations, finding training on symbolic representations alone doesn't transfer to natural language. Proposes two-stage curriculum training first on symbolic then natural language.

entry.title: Mitigating Conversational Inertia in Multi-Turn Agents

author.name: Yang Wan, Zheng Cao, Zhenhao Zhang, Zhengwen Zeng, Shuheng Shen, Changhua Meng, Linchao Zhu

entry.summary: Identifies conversational inertia in multi-turn agents where LLMs erroneously mimic their own previous responses as few-shot examples, creating imitation bias. Through attention analysis, reveals tension between context length for exploitation and inertia undermining exploration.

entry.title: Use Graph When It Needs: Efficiently and Adaptively Integrating Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Graphs

author.name: Su Dong, Qinggang Zhang, Yilin Xiao, Shengyuan Chen, Chuang Zhou, Xiao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive GraphRAG that selectively applies graph-based retrieval only when needed, addressing performance drops and latency issues of rigid GraphRAG application.

entry.title: Fine-Tuning Language Models to Know What They Know

author.name: Sangjun Park, Elliot Meyerson, Xin Qiu, Risto Miikkulainen

entry.summary: ESMA uses evolution strategies to improve metacognitive alignment - making models better aware of their own knowledge. Shows improvement generalizes to untrained settings.

entry.title: MAS-ProVe: Understanding the Process Verification of Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Vishal Venkataramani, Haizhou Shi, Zixuan Ke, Austin Xu, Xiaoxiao He, Yingbo Zhou, Semih Yavuz, Hao Wang, Shafiq Joty

entry.summary: MAS-ProVe systematically studies process verification for multi-agent systems across three paradigms and two granularities, clarifying when and how verification helps MAS.

entry.title: AOrchestra: Automating Sub-Agent Creation for Agentic Orchestration

author.name: Jianhao Ruan, Zhihao Xu, Yiran Peng, Fashen Ren, Zhaoyang Yu, Xinbing Liang, Jinyu Xiang, Bang Liu, Chenglin Wu, Yuyu Luo, Jiayi Zhang

entry.summary: AOrchestra automates sub-agent creation through unified agent abstraction tuple (Instruction, Context, Tools, Model), enabling dynamic orchestration for complex tasks.

entry.title: Beyond Cropping and Rotation: Automated Evolution of Powerful Task-Specific Augmentations with Generative Models

author.name: Judah Goldfeder, Shreyes Kaliyur, Vaibhav Sourirajan, Patrick Minwan Puma, Philippe Martin Wyder, Yuhang Hu, Jiong Lin, Hod Lipson

entry.summary: EvoAug uses evolutionary optimization to automatically design task-specific augmentation pipelines leveraging generative models like diffusion and NeRFs. Addresses the challenge of matching augmentations to tasks.

entry.title: LaVPR: Benchmarking Language and Vision for Place Recognition

author.name: Ofer Idan, Dan Badur, Yosi Keller, Yoli Shavit

entry.summary: LaVPR introduces a large-scale benchmark with 650K language descriptions for visual place recognition, enabling language-based localization for applications like emergency response.

entry.title: Unifying Watermarking via Dimension-Aware Mapping

author.name: Jiale Meng, Runyi Hu, Jie Zhang, Zheming Lu, Ivor Tsang, Tianwei Zhang

entry.summary: DiM unifies watermarking methods as dimension-aware mapping, modeling payloads as 1D messages, 2D masks, or 3D spatiotemporal structures.

entry.title: Contextualized Visual Personalization in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yeongtak Oh, Sangwon Yu, Junsung Park, Han Cheol Moon, Jisoo Mok, Sungroh Yoon

entry.summary: CoViP enables contextualized visual personalization in VLMs through reinforcement learning post-training for image captioning with user-specific visual context.

entry.title: PlanTRansformer: Unified Prediction and Planning with Goal-conditioned Transformer

author.name: Constantin Selzer, Fabina B. Flohr

entry.summary: Introduces PlanTransformer (PTR), unifying trajectory prediction and planning in autonomous driving through goal-conditioned Gaussian Mixture Transformer. Addresses mismatch between multimodal prediction and deterministic planning.

entry.title: Language Movement Primitives: Grounding Language Models in Robot Motion

author.name: Yinlong Dai, Benjamin A. Christie, Daniel J. Evans, Dylan P. Losey, Simon Stepputtis

entry.summary: Proposes Language Movement Primitives for grounding language models in robot motion. Bridges gap between VLM task decomposition and actionable robot motion through motion primitives.

entry.title: CMR: Contractive Mapping Embeddings for Robust Humanoid Locomotion on Unstructured Terrains

author.name: Qixin Zeng, Hongyin Zhang, Shangke Lyu, Junxi Jin, Donglin Wang, Chao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes CMR framework for robust humanoid locomotion using contractive mapping embeddings. Provides theoretical bounds on return gap under observation noise.

entry.title: Aggregation Queries over Unstructured Text: Benchmark and Agentic Method

author.name: Haojia Zhu, Qinyuan Xu, Haoyu Li, Yuxi Liu, Hanchen Qiu, Jiaoyan Chen, Jiahui Jin

entry.summary: Introduces AGGBench for evaluating completeness-oriented aggregation queries over text, where systems must 'find all' rather than 'find one'. Proposes DFA (Disambiguation-Filtering-Aggregation) as a modular baseline.

entry.title: S1-NexusAgent: a Self-Evolving Agent Framework for Multidisciplinary Scientific Research

author.name: NexusAgent Team

entry.summary: S1-NexusAgent is a self-evolving agent framework for scientific research using hierarchical Plan-and-CodeAct execution, supporting thousands of tools via Model Context Protocol for complex research workflows.

entry.title: PRISM: Parametrically Refactoring Inference for Speculative Sampling Draft Models

author.name: Xuliang Wang, Yuetao Chen, Maochan Zhen, Fang Liu, Xinzhou Zheng, Xingwu Liu, Hong Xu, Ming Li

entry.summary: PRISM improves speculative decoding by disaggregating computation across different parameter sets, refactoring the inference process to balance draft quality and compute overhead.

entry.title: Rethinking the Role of Entropy in Optimizing Tool-Use Behaviors for Large Language Model Agents

author.name: Zeping Li, Hongru Wang, Yiwen Zhao, Guanhua Chen, Yixia Li, Keyang Chen, Yixin Cao, Guangnan Ye, Hongfeng Chai, Mengdi Wang, Zhenfei Yin

entry.summary: Finds strong positive correlation between entropy reduction and high-quality tool calls, proposing entropy-based reward strategies for optimizing tool-use behavior in LLM agents.

entry.title: SafeGround: Know When to Trust GUI Grounding Models via Uncertainty Calibration

author.name: Qingni Wang, Yue Fan, Xin Eric Wang

entry.summary: SafeGround provides uncertainty calibration for GUI grounding models, enabling risk-aware predictions through distribution-aware uncertainty quantification and calibrated decision thresholds.

entry.title: AutoBinder Agent: An MCP-Based Agent for End-to-End Protein Binder Design

author.name: Fukang Ge, Jiarui Zhu, Linjie Zhang, Haowen Xiao, Xiangcheng Bao, Fangnan Xie, Danyang Chen, Yanrui Lu, Yuting Wang, Ziqian Guan, Lin Gu, Jinhao Bi, Yingying Zhu

entry.summary: Presents AutoBinder, an MCP-based agent leveraging LLMs to coordinate protein binder design by integrating MaSIF for PPI site identification, Rosetta for grafting, RFdiffusion for backbone generation, and ProteinMPNN for sequence design.

entry.title: Learning Physics-Grounded 4D Dynamics with Neural Gaussian Force Fields

author.name: Shiqian Li, Ruihong Shen, Junfeng Ni, Chang Pan, Chi Zhang, Yixin Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Neural Gaussian Force Field integrating 3D Gaussian perception with physics-based modeling for generating interactive, physically realistic dynamics from visual observations.

entry.title: In-Run Data Shapley for Adam Optimizer

author.name: Meng Ding, Zeqing Zhang, Di Wang, Lijie Hu

entry.summary: Proposes Adam-Aware data attribution method, demonstrating that SGD-based Shapley proxies diverge significantly (R≈0.11) from true contributions under Adam optimization.

entry.title: DISPO: Enhancing Training Efficiency and Stability in Reinforcement Learning for Large Language Model Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Batuhan K. Karaman, Aditya Rawal, Suhaila Shakiah, Mohammad Ghavamzadeh, Mingyi Hong, Arijit Biswas, Ruida Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes DISPO for efficient RLVR training, decoupling clipping from gradient computation. Addresses trade-off between PPO stability and REINFORCE efficiency.

entry.title: FreshMem: Brain-Inspired Frequency-Space Hybrid Memory for Streaming Video Understanding

author.name: Kangcong Li, Peng Ye, Lin Zhang, Chao Wang, Huafeng Qin, Tao Chen

entry.summary: FreshMem introduces brain-inspired frequency-space hybrid memory for streaming video understanding in MLLMs, combining multi-scale frequency memory for global history with space thumbnail memory for recent events.

entry.title: VLM-Guided Experience Replay

author.name: Elad Sharony, Tom Jurgenson, Orr Krupnik, Dotan Di Castro, Shie Mannor

entry.summary: Uses frozen pre-trained VLMs to guide experience replay prioritization in RL, identifying promising sub-trajectories without fine-tuning.

entry.title: IntraSlice: Towards High-Performance Structural Pruning with Block-Intra PCA for LLMs

author.name: Meng Li, Peisong Wang, Yuantian Shao, Qinghao Hu, Hongjian Fang, Yifan Zhang, Zhihui Wei, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: IntraSlice applies block-wise module-intra PCA compression for LLM structural pruning, avoiding activation distribution disruption from inter-module methods.

entry.title: Backpropagation as Physical Relaxation: Exact Gradients in Finite Time

author.name: Antonino Emanuele Scurria

entry.summary: Shows that backpropagation emerges exactly as the finite-time relaxation of a physical dynamical system, deriving a global energy functional whose saddle-point dynamics perform inference and credit assignment.

entry.title: MemSkill: Learning and Evolving Memory Skills for Self-Evolving Agents

author.name: Haozhen Zhang, Quanyu Long, Jianzhu Bao, Tao Feng, Weizhi Zhang, Haodong Yue, Wenya Wang

entry.summary: Introduces MemSkill, reframing memory operations as learnable skills that can evolve, enabling LLM agents to adapt memory strategies to diverse interaction patterns.

entry.title: Enhancing Post-Training Quantization via Future Activation Awareness

author.name: Zheqi Lv, Zhenxuan Fan, Qi Tian, Wenqiao Zhang, Yueting Zhuang

entry.summary: FAQ (Future-Aware Quantization) uses activations from future layers to guide PTQ hyperparameter selection, better preserving important weights and reducing sensitivity to calibration noise.

entry.title: RAP: KV-Cache Compression via RoPE-Aligned Pruning

author.name: Jihao Xin, Tian Lvu, Hatem Ltaief, David Keyes, Marco Canini

entry.summary: RAP addresses incompatibility between RoPE and KV-cache low-rank factorization by pruning entire RoPE-aligned column pairs, enabling true absorption and eliminating reconstruction overhead.

entry.title: Search-Augmented Masked Diffusion Models for Constrained Generation

author.name: Huu Binh Ta (University of Virginia), Michael Cardei (University of Virginia), Alvaro Velasquez (University of Colorado at Boulder), Ferdinando Fioretto (University of Virginia)

entry.summary: SearchDiff integrates informed search into masked diffusion denoising for constrained generation, allowing hard constraint enforcement and non-differentiable property optimization without training.

entry.title: Adaptive Batch Sizes Using Non-Euclidean Gradient Noise Scales for Stochastic Sign and Spectral Descent

author.name: Hiroki Naganuma, Shagun Gupta, Youssef Briki, Ioannis Mitliagkas, Irina Rish, Parameswaran Raman, Hao-Jun Michael Shi

entry.summary: Derives gradient noise scales for signSGD and specSGD from dual norm geometry, proposing efficient estimators for adaptive batch sizing with these optimizers.

entry.title: From Inexact Gradients to Byzantine Robustness: Acceleration and Optimization under Similarity

author.name: Renaud Gaucher, Aymeric Dieuleveut, Hadrien Hendrikx

entry.summary: Shows Byzantine-robust distributed optimization can be cast as optimization with inexact gradient oracles under standard assumptions, enabling development of more complex robust algorithms including accelerated ones.

entry.title: The Label Horizon Paradox: Rethinking Supervision Targets in Financial Forecasting

author.name: Chen-Hui Song, Shuoling Liu, Liyuan Chen

entry.summary: Challenges the assumption that training labels must match inference targets in financial forecasting, uncovering the 'Label Horizon Paradox' where optimal supervision signals deviate from prediction goals.

entry.title: Scaling Continual Learning with Bi-Level Routing Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Meng Lou, Yunxiang Fu, Yizhou Yu

entry.summary: Proposes CaRE with Bi-Level Routing MoE for continual learning, using router selection followed by expert routing to learn discriminative and comprehensive features over long task sequences.

entry.title: WARP Logic Neural Networks

author.name: Lino Gerlach, Thore Gerlach, Liv V{\aa}ge, Elliott Kauffman, Isobel Ojalvo

entry.summary: Introduces WARP logic neural networks for efficient gradient-based learning of hardware-native logic blocks, showing most parameter-efficient representation for Boolean functions.

entry.title: From Task Solving to Robust Real-World Adaptation in LLM Agents

author.name: Pouya Pezeshkpour, Estevam Hruschka

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM agent robustness under realistic deployment conditions: partial observability, unreliable tools, shifting environments, and implicit multi-stakeholder goals.

entry.title: Embodiment-Aware Generalist Specialist Distillation for Unified Humanoid Whole-Body Control

author.name: Quanquan Peng, Yunfeng Lin, Yufei Xue, Jiangmiao Pang, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: EAGLE uses generalist-specialist distillation to train single policy controlling multiple heterogeneous humanoids without per-robot reward tuning.

entry.title: OmniRAG-Agent: Agentic Omnimodal Reasoning for Low-Resource Long Audio-Video Question Answering

author.name: Yifan Zhu, Xinyu Mu, Tao Feng, Zhonghong Ou, Yuning Gong, Haoran Luo

entry.summary: OmniRAG-Agent enables low-resource long audio-video QA through image-audio RAG and agent loops for planning and evidence merging, with GRPO optimization.

entry.title: N\"uwa: Mending the Spatial Integrity Torn by VLM Token Pruning

author.name: Yihong Huang, Fei Ma, Yihua Shao, Jingcai Guo, Zitong Yu, Laizhong Cui, Qi Tian

entry.summary: Nüwa is a token pruning framework for VLMs that maintains spatial integrity through two-stage processing, addressing performance degradation on visual grounding tasks.

entry.title: JRDB-Pose3D: A Multi-person 3D Human Pose and Shape Estimation Dataset for Robotics

author.name: Sandika Biswas, Kian Izadpanah, Hamid Rezatofighi

entry.summary: JRDB-Pose3D provides multi-person 3D pose annotations from a mobile robotic platform in crowded indoor/outdoor environments. Addresses the gap between lab-collected and real-world pose datasets.

entry.title: Z3D: Zero-Shot 3D Visual Grounding from Images

author.name: Nikita Drozdov, Andrey Lemeshko, Nikita Gavrilov, Anton Konushin, Danila Rukhovich, Maksim Kolodiazhnyi

entry.summary: Z3D enables zero-shot 3D visual grounding from multi-view images without geometric supervision, using advanced instance segmentation and VLM reasoning.

entry.title: Semantic Routing: Exploring Multi-Layer LLM Feature Weighting for Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Bozhou Li, Yushuo Guan, Haolin Li, Bohan Zeng, Yiyan Ji, Yue Ding, Pengfei Wan, Kun Gai, Yuanxing Zhang, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Explores multi-layer LLM feature weighting for DiT conditioning, finding depth-wise semantic routing as optimal strategy for dynamic text-image alignment.

entry.title: ELIQ: A Label-Free Framework for Quality Assessment of Evolving AI-Generated Images

author.name: Xinyue Li, Zhiming Xu, Zhichao Zhang, Zhaolin Cai, Sijing Wu, Xiongkuo Min, Yitong Chen, Guangtao Zhai

entry.summary: ELIQ provides label-free quality assessment for AI-generated images by constructing contrastive pairs covering AIGC-specific distortions without human annotations.

entry.title: Automatic Design of Optimization Test Problems with Large Language Models

author.name: Wojciech Achtelik, Hubert Guzowski, Maciej Smo{\l}ka, Jacek Ma\'ndziuk

entry.summary: Introduces EoTF, using LLM-driven evolutionary search to automatically generate optimization test functions matching target ELA feature vectors. Addresses bias in hand-crafted benchmark suites like BBOB.

entry.title: Kino-PAX$^+$: Near-Optimal Massively Parallel Kinodynamic Sampling-based Motion Planner

author.name: Nicolas Perrault, Qi Heng Ho, Morteza Lahijanian

entry.summary: Introduces Kino-PAX+, a massively parallel kinodynamic motion planner with asymptotic near-optimal guarantees. Decomposes serial operations into parallel subroutines for GPU execution.

entry.title: Input-to-State Safe Backstepping: Robust Safety-Critical Control with Unmatched Uncertainties

author.name: Max H. Cohen, Pio Ong, Aaron D. Ames

entry.summary: Presents constructive approach to safety-critical control with unmatched disturbances using Input-to-State Safe CBFs. Outlines procedure for strict-feedback and dual-relative-degree systems.

entry.title: Workflow-R1: Group Sub-sequence Policy Optimization for Multi-turn Workflow Construction

author.name: Mingze Kong, Zikun Qu, Zhongquan Zhou, Pengyu Liang, Xiang Li, Zhiwei Shang, Zhi Hong, Kaiyu Huang, Zhiyong Wang, Zhongxiang Dai

entry.summary: Presents Workflow-R1, which reformulates agentic workflow construction as multi-turn natural language decision-making rather than one-shot code generation. Introduces Group Sub-sequence Policy Optimization (GSsPO) for training.

entry.title: Entropy-Guided Data-Efficient Training for Multimodal Reasoning Reward Models

author.name: Shidong Yang, Tongwen Huang, Hao Wen, Yong Wang, Li Chen, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Identifies strong correlation between response entropy and accuracy in multimodal reward models, proposing Entropy-Guided Training to filter noisy samples and handle difficulty variations.

entry.title: TIDE: Trajectory-based Diagnostic Evaluation of Test-Time Improvement in LLM Agents

author.name: Hang Yan, Xinyu Che, Fangzhi Xu, Qiushi Sun, Zichen Ding, Kanzhi Cheng, Jian Zhang, Tao Qin, Jun Liu, Qika Lin

entry.summary: TIDE provides diagnostic evaluation framework for test-time improvement in agents, measuring temporal dynamics, behavior adaptation after errors, and working memory utility.

entry.title: Happy Young Women, Grumpy Old Men? Emotion-Driven Demographic Biases in Synthetic Face Generation

author.name: Mengting Wei, Aditya Gulati, Guoying Zhao, Nuria Oliver

entry.summary: Systematically audits 8 SOTA text-to-image models for demographic biases influenced by emotional prompts, examining how models trained in different cultural contexts vary in output distributions.

entry.title: SPARC-RAG: Adaptive Sequential-Parallel Scaling with Context Management for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Yuxin Yang, Gangda Deng, \"Omer Faruk Akg\"ul, Nima Chitsazan, Yash Govilkar, Akasha Tigalappanavara, Shi-Xiong Zhang, Sambit Sahu, Viktor Prasanna

entry.summary: Proposes SPARC-RAG framework coordinating sequential and parallel inference-time scaling for multi-hop QA with unified context management to prevent contamination and improve scaling efficiency.

entry.title: Block removal for large language models through constrained binary optimization

author.name: David Jansen, Roman Rausch, David Montero, Roman Orus

entry.summary: Formulates LLM block removal as a constrained binary optimization problem mappable to an Ising model, enabling efficient ranking of block-removal configurations. Outperforms state-of-the-art block pruning methods.

entry.title: DIVERGE: Diversity-Enhanced RAG for Open-Ended Information Seeking

author.name: Tianyi Hu, Niket Tandon, Akhil Arora

entry.summary: DIVERGE addresses RAG systems' failure to produce diverse outputs for open-ended queries by introducing reflection-guided generation and memory-augmented retrieval as a plug-and-play framework.

entry.title: TimeBlind: A Spatio-Temporal Compositionality Benchmark for Video LLMs

author.name: Baiqi Li, Kangyi Zhao, Ce Zhang, Chancharik Mitra, Jean de Dieu Nyandwi, Gedas Bertasius

entry.summary: TimeBlind benchmark for video LLM spatio-temporal understanding using minimal-pairs paradigm where video pairs share static content but differ only in temporal structure.

entry.title: LatentLens: Revealing Highly Interpretable Visual Tokens in LLMs

author.name: Benno Krojer, Shravan Nayak, Oscar Ma\~nas, Vaibhav Adlakha, Desmond Elliott, Siva Reddy, Marius Mosbach

entry.summary: LatentLens maps VLM latent representations to natural language descriptions by comparing visual tokens to contextualized embeddings from a text corpus, revealing what's encoded at each layer.

entry.title: Convergent World Representations and Divergent Tasks

author.name: Core Francisco Park

entry.summary: Studies how neural networks develop world representations through controlled experiments with city coordinates and geometric tasks. Finds multi-task training drives convergence of world representations even across non-overlapping tasks.

entry.title: Deep Time-series Forecasting Needs Kernelized Moment Balancing

author.name: Licheng Pan, Hao Wang, Haocheng Yang, Yuqi Li, Qingsong Wen, Xiaoxi Li, Zhichao Chen, Haoxuan Li, Zhixuan Chu, Yuan Lu

entry.summary: Proves existing time series forecasting objectives fail to achieve true distribution balance and proposes KMB-DF using kernelized moment balancing in RKHS. Provides theoretical foundation for forecasting objective design.

entry.title: Autoregressive, Yet Revisable: In Decoding Revision for Secure Code Generation

author.name: Chengran Yang, Zichao Wei, Heminghao Deng, Jinfeng Jiang, Zhensu Sun, Ting Zhang, Tianyi Wu, Ming Wen, David Lo

entry.summary: Proposes Stream of Revision for secure code generation, introducing action tokens that enable LLMs to revise previously generated code during decoding rather than monotonic token generation.

entry.title: PACER: Blockwise Pre-verification for Speculative Decoding with Adaptive Length

author.name: Situo Zhang, Yifan Zhang, Zichen Zhu, Hankun Wang, Da Ma, Danyang Zhang, Lu Chen, Kai Yu

entry.summary: Proposes PACER for speculative decoding that dynamically controls draft length using a trainable pre-verification layer, adapting to varying optimal draft lengths across decoding steps.

entry.title: InfoTok: Regulating Information Flow for Capacity-Constrained Shared Visual Tokenization in Unified MLLMs

author.name: Lv Tang, Tianyi Zheng, Bo Li, Xingyu Li

entry.summary: Introduces capacity-constrained perspective for visual tokenization in unified MLLMs. Proposes InfoTok that prioritizes reusable structure over high-entropy variations through information-theoretic lens.

entry.title: Boosting Maximum Entropy Reinforcement Learning via One-Step Flow Matching

author.name: Zeqiao Li, Yijing Wang, Haoyu Wang, Zheng Li, Zhiqiang Zuo

entry.summary: FLAME integrates flow matching with maximum entropy RL, enabling one-step generation while maintaining exploration-exploitation balance. Introduces Q-reweighted flow matching and decoupled entropy estimator to handle intractable energy-based distributions.

entry.title: : One LLM Token for Explicit Graph Structural Understanding

author.name: Jingyao Wu, Bin Lu, Zijun Di, Xiaoying Gan, Meng Jin, Luoyi Fu, Xinbing Wang, Chenghu Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes special token to represent graph structure within unified token space via topology-aware structural tokenizer, addressing structural hallucination in LLMs processing graphs.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Off-Policy Learning

author.name: Arip Asadulaev, Maksim Bobrin, Salem Lahlou, Dmitry Dylov, Fakhri Karray, Martin Takac

entry.summary: Discovers theoretical connection between successor measures and stationary density ratios for zero-shot off-policy learning, enabling optimal importance sampling without additional training.

entry.title: Vision-DeepResearch Benchmark: Rethinking Visual and Textual Search for Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Yu Zeng, Wenxuan Huang, Zhen Fang, Shuang Chen, Yufan Shen, Yishuo Cai, Xiaoman Wang, Zhenfei Yin, Lin Chen, Zehui Chen, Shiting Huang, Yiming Zhao, Yao Hu, Philip Torr, Wanli Ouyang, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Introduces Vision-DeepResearch Benchmark for evaluating visual and textual search capabilities in MLLMs, addressing limitations where answers can be leaked through text or prior knowledge.

entry.title: Didactic to Constructive: Turning Expert Solutions into Learnable Reasoning

author.name: Ethan Mendes, Jungsoo Park, Alan Ritter

entry.summary: Proposes converting expert didactic solutions into constructive learnable reasoning, addressing the out-of-distribution problem when training on high-quality human solutions.

entry.title: Scaled Dot-Product Attention implements projection of inputs onto a common surface

author.name: Terence D Sanger

entry.summary: Provides alternative mathematical interpretation of scaled dot-product attention as projection onto input-determined surfaces, rather than query-key-value database operations. Shows SDPA discovers time/context-dependent nonlinear dependencies.

entry.title: Trajectory Consistency for One-Step Generation on Euler Mean Flows

author.name: Zhiqi Li, Yuchen Sun, Duowen Chen, Jinjin He, Bo Zhu

entry.summary: Euler Mean Flows enforce long-range trajectory consistency for one/few-step diffusion generation via linear surrogate objective, enabling direct data supervision without JVP computation.

entry.title: Privately Fine-Tuned LLMs Preserve Temporal Dynamics in Tabular Data

author.name: Lucas Rosenblatt, Peihan Liu, Ryan McKenna, Natalia Ponomareva

entry.summary: PATH framework for differentially private synthetic tabular data that preserves temporal coherence in longitudinal data, treating full user histories as generation targets rather than flattening.

entry.title: Structure-Preserving Learning Improves Geometry Generalization in Neural PDEs

author.name: Benjamin D. Shaffer, Shawn Koohy, Brooks Kinch, M. Ani Hsieh, Nathaniel Trask

entry.summary: Introduces Geo-NeW, a data-driven finite element method that jointly learns differential operators and compatible finite element spaces while exactly preserving physical conservation laws. Achieves geometry generalization through structure-preserving learning.

entry.title: Self-Soupervision: Cooking Model Soups without Labels

author.name: Anthony Fuller, James R. Green, Evan Shelhamer

entry.summary: Generalizes model soups to self-supervised learning, enabling parameter mixing without labels. Shows Self-Souping on corrupted data improves robustness by +3.5% on ImageNet-C and +7% on LAION-C.

entry.title: Contrastive Concept-Tree Search for LLM-Assisted Algorithm Discovery

author.name: Timothee Leleu, Sudeera Gunathilaka, Federico Ghimenti, Surya Ganguli

entry.summary: Proposes Contrastive Concept-Tree Search for LLM-assisted algorithm discovery, extracting hierarchical concept representation from programs and learning contrastive model for parent selection.

entry.title: Topology Matters: A Cautionary Case Study of Graph SSL on Neuro-Inspired Benchmarks

author.name: May Kristine Jonson Carlon, Su Myat Noe, Haojiong Wang, Yasuo Kuniyoshi

entry.summary: Reveals that invariance-based self-supervised learning fundamentally fails on brain-connectome-like topological benchmarks, being outperformed by classical topology-aware heuristics. Identifies objective mismatch between SSL and topological properties.

entry.title: A Function-Space Stability Boundary for Generalization in Interpolating Learning Systems

author.name: Ronald Katende

entry.summary: Proposes function-space stability framework for understanding generalization in interpolating systems, introducing contractive propagation condition and stability certificate that predicts generalization.

entry.title: Quantization-Aware Regularizers for Deep Neural Networks Compression

author.name: Dario Malchiodi, Mattia Ferraretto, Marco Frasca

entry.summary: Introduces quantization-aware regularizers that drive weights to form clusters during training, integrating quantization awareness into the learning phase rather than post-hoc application.

entry.title: Efficient Estimation of Kernel Surrogate Models for Task Attribution

author.name: Zhenshuo Zhang, Minxuan Duan, Hongyang R. Zhang

entry.summary: Develops kernel surrogate models to quantify how individual training tasks influence LLM performance on target tasks, capturing nonlinear interactions like synergy beyond prior linear approaches.

entry.title: WorldVQA: Measuring Atomic World Knowledge in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Runjie Zhou, Youbo Shao, Haoyu Lu, Bowei Xing, Tongtong Bai, Yujie Chen, Jie Zhao, Lin Sui, Haotian Yao, Zijia Zhao, Hao Yang, Haoning Wu, Zaida Zhou, Jinguo Zhu, Zhiqi Huang, Yiping Bao, Yangyang Liu, Y. Charles, Xinyu Zhou

entry.summary: WorldVQA benchmark evaluates MLLMs on atomic visual world knowledge, decoupling visual retrieval from reasoning to measure factual visual memory across head-to-tail entities.

entry.title: Training-Free Self-Correction for Multimodal Masked Diffusion Models

author.name: Yidong Ouyang, Panwen Hu, Zhengyan Wan, Zhe Wang, Liyan Xie, Dmitriy Bespalov, Ying Nian Wu, Guang Cheng, Hongyuan Zha, Qiang Sun

entry.summary: Proposes training-free self-correction for masked diffusion models that exploits pretrained model inductive biases without modifying parameters or auxiliary evaluators.

entry.title: GFlowPO: Generative Flow Network as a Language Model Prompt Optimizer

author.name: Junmo Cho, Suhan Kim, Sangjune An, Minsu Kim, Dong Bok Lee, Heejun Lee, Sung Ju Hwang, Hae Beom Lee

entry.summary: Proposes GFlowPO, using Generative Flow Networks for LLM prompt optimization by casting prompt search as posterior inference over latent prompts. Uses off-policy training with replay to improve sample efficiency over existing on-policy RL methods.

entry.title: DiscoverLLM: From Executing Intents to Discovering Them

author.name: Tae Soo Kim, Yoonjoo Lee, Jaesang Yu, John Joon Young Chung, Juho Kim

entry.summary: Introduces DiscoverLLM, a framework training LLMs to help users discover and form intents they haven't yet expressed, using a novel user simulator modeling cognitive state with a hierarchy of progressively concretizing intents.

entry.title: DALI: A Workload-Aware Offloading Framework for Efficient MoE Inference on Local PCs

author.name: Zeyu Zhu, Gang Li, Peisong Wang, Zitao Mo, Minnan Pei, Zhuoran Song, Xiaoyao Liang, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes DALI, a workload-aware MoE offloading framework addressing CPU-GPU load imbalance and inaccurate prefetching in existing approaches by dynamically matching expert workloads.

entry.title: STEMVerse: A Dual-Axis Diagnostic Framework for STEM Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Xuzhao Li, Xuchen Li, Jian Zhao, Shiyu Hu

entry.summary: Proposes STEMVerse, a diagnostic framework for STEM reasoning in LLMs that goes beyond aggregate scores to distinguish whether errors stem from insufficient domain knowledge or cognitive capacity deficiencies.

entry.title: Equal Access, Unequal Interaction: A Counterfactual Audit of LLM Fairness

author.name: Alireza Amiri-Margavi, Arshia Gharagozlou, Amin Gholami Davodi, Seyed Pouyan Mousavi Davoudi, Hamidreza Hasani Balyani

entry.summary: Conducts fairness audit showing equitable LLM access doesn't ensure equitable interaction quality, finding differences in tone, uncertainty, and linguistic framing across demographic identities after access is granted.

entry.title: SAES-SVD: Self-Adaptive Suppression of Accumulated and Local Errors for SVD-based LLM Compression

author.name: Xing Hu, Dawei Yang, Yuan Cheng, Zhixuan Chen, Zukang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes SAES-SVD for LLM compression that jointly optimizes intra-layer reconstruction and inter-layer error compensation, addressing the accumulation of reconstruction error through the network.

entry.title: ATACompressor: Adaptive Task-Aware Compression for Efficient Long-Context Processing in LLMs

author.name: Xuancheng Li, Haitao Li, Yujia Zhou, Qingyao Ai, Yiqun Liu

entry.summary: ATACompressor dynamically adjusts compression based on task requirements, using a selective encoder that compresses only task-relevant portions to address the 'lost in the middle' problem.

entry.title: Aligning Language Model Benchmarks with Pairwise Preferences

author.name: Marco Gutierrez, Xinyi Leng, Hannah Cyberey, Jonathan Richard Schwarz, Ahmed Alaa, Thomas Hartvigsen

entry.summary: BenchAlign learns preference-aligned weightings for benchmark questions using model pairwise preferences to produce benchmarks that better predict real-world utility.

entry.title: AutoFigure: Generating and Refining Publication-Ready Scientific Illustrations

author.name: Minjun Zhu, Zhen Lin, Yixuan Weng, Panzhong Lu, Qiujie Xie, Yifan Wei, Sifan Liu, Qiyao Sun, Yue Zhang

entry.summary: AutoFigure and FigureBench enable automated generation of scientific illustrations from long-form text through agentic framework with extensive planning before rendering.

entry.title: MUSE: A Multi-agent Framework for Unconstrained Story Envisioning via Closed-Loop Cognitive Orchestration

author.name: Wenzhang Sun, Zhenyu Wang, Zhangchi Hu, Chunfeng Wang, Hao Li, Wei Chen

entry.summary: MUSE is a multi-agent framework for long-form story generation using a closed-loop plan-execute-verify-revise cycle. Addresses semantic drift and identity inconsistency in extended narrative generation.

entry.title: Invisible Clean-Label Backdoor Attacks for Generative Data Augmentation

author.name: Ting Xiang, Jinhui Zhao, Changjian Chen, Zhuo Tang

entry.summary: InvLBA proposes invisible clean-label backdoor attacks targeting generative data augmentation by operating at the latent feature level rather than pixels.

entry.title: Constrained Dynamic Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Zihan Zheng, Zhenglong Wu, Xuanxuan Wang, Houqiang Zhong, Xiaoyun Zhang, Qiang Hu, Guangtao Zhai, Wenjun Zhang

entry.summary: CDGS formulates dynamic Gaussian splatting as budget-constrained optimization with differentiable budget controller and multi-modal importance scoring.

entry.title: 3D-Aware Implicit Motion Control for View-Adaptive Human Video Generation

author.name: Zhixue Fang, Xu He, Songlin Tang, Haoxian Zhang, Qingfeng Li, Xiaoqiang Liu, Pengfei Wan, Kun Gai

entry.summary: Presents a 3D-aware implicit motion control approach for human video generation that avoids the limitations of 2D poses (view-locked) and explicit 3D models (inaccurate). Enables novel-view synthesis while respecting video generator priors.

entry.title: Time Is All It Takes: Spike-Retiming Attacks on Event-Driven Spiking Neural Networks

author.name: Yi Yu, Qixin Zhang, Shuhan Ye, Xun Lin, Qianshan Wei, Kun Wang, Wenhan Yang, Dacheng Tao, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Studies timing-only adversarial attacks on spiking neural networks that retime existing spikes while preserving counts and amplitudes. Formalizes spike-retiming threat model with unified budget constraints.

entry.title: Collision Detection with Analytical Derivatives of Contact Kinematics

author.name: Anup Teejo Mathew, Anees Peringal, Daniele Caradonna, Frederic Boyer, Federico Renda

entry.summary: Develops iDCOL, differentiable collision detection framework with analytical contact kinematics derivatives. Uses geometric regularization to handle degenerate configurations.

entry.title: FlowSteer: Interactive Agentic Workflow Orchestration via End-to-End Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Mingda Zhang, Haoran Luo, Tiesunlong Shen, Qika Lin, Xiaoying Tang, Rui Mao, Erik Cambria

entry.summary: FlowSteer uses end-to-end reinforcement learning with a lightweight policy model to automate agentic workflow orchestration through multi-turn interaction with an executable canvas environment.

entry.title: INDIBATOR: Diverse and Fact-Grounded Individuality for Multi-Agent Debate in Molecular Discovery

author.name: Yunhui Jang, Seonghyun Park, Jaehyung Kim, Sungsoo Ahn

entry.summary: INDIBATOR grounds multi-agent debate in individualized scientist profiles constructed from publication and molecular history, enabling more nuanced agent differentiation for molecular discovery.

entry.title: More Than a Quick Glance: Overcoming the Greedy Bias in KV-Cache Compression

author.name: Aryan Sood, Tanvi Sharma, Vansh Agrawal

entry.summary: LASER-KV addresses KV-cache compression with block-wise accumulation strategy and protection divisor, testing compression limits while isolating effects from sliding window artifacts.

entry.title: TextBFGS: Quasi-Newton Optimization for Discrete Executable Text via Gradient-Operator Retrieval

author.name: Zizheng Zhang, Yuyang Liao, Chen Chen, Jian He, Dun Wu, Qianjin Yu, Yanqin Gao, Jin Yang, Kailai Zhang, Eng Siong Chng, Xionghu Zhong

entry.summary: Introduces TextBFGS, a second-order quasi-Newton optimization framework for discrete text that approximates inverse Hessian by retrieving Gradient-Operators, addressing slow convergence of first-order prompt optimization.

entry.title: BBPE16: UTF-16-based byte-level byte-pair encoding for improved multilingual speech recognition

author.name: Hyunsik Kim, Haeri Kim, Munhak Lee, Kyungmin Lee

entry.summary: BBPE16 proposes UTF-16-based byte-level BPE tokenization for multilingual ASR, providing uniform 2-byte encoding for non-Latin scripts while maintaining language-agnostic properties.

entry.title: T-LLM: Teaching Large Language Models to Forecast Time Series via Temporal Distillation

author.name: Suhan Guo, Bingxu Wang, Shaodan Zhang, Furao Shen

entry.summary: T-LLM teaches general-purpose LLMs time series forecasting via temporal distillation, addressing time-bound constraint where scale-driven pretraining alone is insufficient.

entry.title: SoMA: A Real-to-Sim Neural Simulator for Robotic Soft-body Manipulation

author.name: Mu Huang, Hui Wang, Kerui Ren, Linning Xu, Yunsong Zhou, Mulin Yu, Bo Dai, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: Presents SoMA, a 3D Gaussian Splat simulator for soft-body manipulation that couples deformable dynamics with robot actions in a unified neural space for end-to-end real-to-sim simulation.

entry.title: ToolTok: Tool Tokenization for Efficient and Generalizable GUI Agents

author.name: Xiaoce Wang, Guibin Zhang, Junzhe Li, Jinzhe Tu, Chun Li, Ming Li

entry.summary: ToolTok represents GUI operations as sequences of learnable tool tokens rather than coordinates, using semantic anchoring to enable efficient learning under limited supervision for GUI agents.

entry.title: FlexRank: Nested Low-Rank Knowledge Decomposition for Adaptive Model Deployment

author.name: Riccardo Zaccone, Stefanos Laskaridis, Marco Ciccone, Samuel Horv\'ath

entry.summary: FlexRank extracts nested, importance-ordered submodels from pretrained networks via low-rank decomposition, enabling adaptive deployment across different compute budgets without retraining.

entry.title: Distance Marching for Generative Modeling

author.name: Zimo Wang, Ishit Mehta, Haolin Lu, Chung-En Sun, Ge Yan, Tsui-Wei Weng, Tzu-Mao Li

entry.summary: Proposes Distance Marching, a time-unconditional generative approach inspired by distance fields. Designs losses focusing on closer targets, improving FID by 13.5% on CIFAR-10 over time-unconditional baselines.

entry.title: Evaluating LLMs When They Do Not Know the Answer: Statistical Evaluation of Mathematical Reasoning via Comparative Signals

author.name: Zihan Dong, Zhixian Zhang, Yang Zhou, Can Jin, Ruijia Wu, Linjun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes statistical framework for evaluating LLM math reasoning using pairwise comparison signals as control variates, developing semiparametric estimator based on efficient influence function.

entry.title: Periodic Regularized Q-Learning

author.name: Hyukjun Yang, Han-Dong Lim, Donghwan Lee

entry.summary: Proposes Periodic Regularized Q-learning (PRQ) that introduces regularization at the projection operator level to ensure stable convergence of Q-learning under linear function approximation.

entry.title: Sparse Training of Neural Networks based on Multilevel Mirror Descent

author.name: Yannick Lunk, Sebastian J. Scott, Leon Bungert

entry.summary: Proposes sparse training algorithm based on linearized Bregman iterations with alternating static and dynamic sparsity updates, providing convergence guarantees in multilevel optimization framework.

entry.title: SAGE-5GC: Security-Aware Guidelines for Evaluating Anomaly Detection in the 5G Core Network

author.name: Cristian Manca, Christian Scano, Giorgio Piras, Fabio Brau, Maura Pintor, Battista Biggio

entry.summary: Proposes SAGE-5GC guidelines for evaluating anomaly detection in 5G Core networks under realistic deployment conditions with adaptive attackers and non-IID data.

entry.title: Chain of Simulation: A Dual-Mode Reasoning Framework for Large Language Models with Dynamic Problem Routing

author.name: Saeid Sheikhi

entry.summary: Chain of Simulation framework routes problems to specialized reasoning modes: computational flow for math, symbolic state tracking for spatial, hybrid fact-extraction for multi-hop.

entry.title: Learning Query-Specific Rubrics from Human Preferences for DeepResearch Report Generation

author.name: Changze Lv, Jie Zhou, Wentao Zhao, Jingwen Xu, Zisu Huang, Muzhao Tian, Shihan Dou, Tao Gui, Le Tian, Xiao Zhou, Xiaoqing Zheng, Xuanjing Huang, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: Trains query-specific rubric generators for DeepResearch report evaluation using RL with hybrid human preference and LLM judgment rewards.

entry.title: TRACE: Temporal Radiology with Anatomical Change Explanation for Grounded X-ray Report Generation

author.name: OFM Riaz Rahman Aranya, Kevin Desai

entry.summary: TRACE is the first model jointly performing temporal X-ray comparison, change classification, and spatial localization for grounded interval change reporting.

entry.title: UnHype: CLIP-Guided Hypernetworks for Dynamic LoRA Unlearning

author.name: Piotr W\'ojcik, Maksym Petrenko, Wojciech Gromski, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek, Maciej Zieba

entry.summary: UnHype uses CLIP-guided hypernetworks for dynamic LoRA unlearning in diffusion models, enabling semantic-aware concept removal.

entry.title: SPWOOD: Sparse Partial Weakly-Supervised Oriented Object Detection

author.name: Wei Zhang, Xiang Liu, Ningjing Liu, Mingxin Liu, Wei Liao, Chunyan Xu, Xue Yang

entry.summary: SPWOOD introduces sparse partial weakly-supervised oriented object detection for remote sensing, significantly reducing annotation requirements.

entry.title: StepNav: Structured Trajectory Priors for Efficient and Multimodal Visual Navigation

author.name: Xubo Luo, Aodi Wu, Haodong Han, Xue Wan, Wei Zhang, Leizheng Shu, Ruisuo Wang

entry.summary: Proposes StepNav with structured multimodal trajectory priors for visual navigation. Learns geometry-aware success probability fields to identify feasible corridors, then uses conditional flow-matching for trajectory generation.

entry.title: Self-supervised Physics-Informed Manipulation of Deformable Linear Objects with Non-negligible Dynamics

author.name: Youyuan Long, Gokhan Solak, Sara Zeynalpour, Heng Zhang, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Presents SPiD, physics-informed self-supervised learning for dynamic deformable linear object manipulation. Extends mass-spring model and introduces self-supervised DAgger variant.

entry.title: Complete Identification of Deep ReLU Neural Networks by Many-Valued Logic

author.name: Yani Zhang, Helmut B\"olcskei

entry.summary: Formalizes the complete identification problem for ReLU networks using Lukasiewicz logic, showing how to derive all equivalent architectures for a given function.

entry.title: SayNext-Bench: Why Do LLMs Struggle with Next-Utterance Prediction?

author.name: Yueyi Yang, Haotian Liu, Fang Kang, Mengqi Zhang, Zheng Lian, Hao Tang, Haoyu Chen

entry.summary: Introduces SayNext-Bench to evaluate LLM ability to predict next human utterances in dialogue. Shows leading models struggle despite conversational fluency, testing multimodal cue understanding.

entry.title: MHDash: An Online Platform for Benchmarking Mental Health-Aware AI Assistants

author.name: Yihe Zhang, Cheyenne N Mohawk, Kaiying Han, Vijay Srinivas Tida, Manyu Li, Xiali Hei

entry.summary: MHDash is an open-source platform for developing mental health AI systems with data collection, annotation, multi-turn dialogue generation, and baseline evaluation in a unified pipeline.

entry.title: RobustDebias: Debiasing Language Models using Distributionally Robust Optimization

author.name: Deep Gandhi, Katyani Singh, Nidhi Hegde

entry.summary: RobustDebias uses distributionally robust optimization to prevent bias amplification during BERT fine-tuning, addressing scalability issues of pretraining-based debiasing.

entry.title: PolarMem: A Training-Free Polarized Latent Graph Memory for Verifiable Multimodal Agents

author.name: Zhisheng Chen, Tingyu Wu, Zijie Zhou, Zhengwei Xie, Ziyan Weng, Yingwei Zhang

entry.summary: PolarMem introduces a training-free memory system for multimodal agents that transforms probabilistic perceptions into discrete logical constraints and encodes negative constraints explicitly.

entry.title: Dual Latent Memory for Visual Multi-agent System

author.name: Xinlei Yu, Chengming Xu, Zhangquan Chen, Bo Yin, Cheng Yang, Yongbo He, Yihao Hu, Jiangning Zhang, Cheng Tan, Xiaobin Hu, Shuicheng Yan

entry.summary: L²-VMAS addresses the 'scaling wall' in visual multi-agent systems where more turns degrade performance. Uses dual latent memories to enable inter-agent collaboration without text bottleneck.

entry.title: Replacing Parameters with Preferences: Federated Alignment of Heterogeneous Vision-Language Models

author.name: Shule Lu, Yujing Wang, Hainan Zhang, Xiaoshan Yang, Hongwei Zheng, Yongxin Tong, Changsheng Xu, Zhiming Zheng

entry.summary: MoR framework enables federated alignment of heterogeneous VLMs using GRPO with Mixture-of-Rewards, replacing parameter sharing with preference sharing for better privacy and scalability.

entry.title: How Far Are LLMs from Professional Poker Players? Revisiting Game-Theoretic Reasoning with Agentic Tool Use

author.name: Minhua Lin, Enyan Dai, Hui Liu, Xianfeng Tang, Yuliang Yan, Zhenwei Dai, Jingying Zeng, Zhiwei Zhang, Fali Wang, Hongcheng Gao, Chen Luo, Xiang Zhang, Qi He, Suhang Wang

entry.summary: Systematic study of LLMs on poker tasks reveals three failure modes: heuristic reliance, factual misunderstanding, and 'knowing-doing gap'. Proposes tool-augmented agents for game-theoretic reasoning.

entry.title: Scalable Generative Game Engine: Breaking the Resolution Wall via Hardware-Algorithm Co-Design

author.name: Wei Zeng, Xuchen Li, Ruili Feng, Zhen Liu, Fengwei An, Jian Zhao

entry.summary: Hardware-algorithm co-design framework for high-resolution generative game engines, breaking the 'Memory Wall' by decoupling compute-bound world models from memory-bound decoders.

entry.title: HumanStudy-Bench: Towards AI Agent Design for Participant Simulation

author.name: Xuan Liu, Haoyang Shang, Zizhang Liu, Xinyan Liu, Yunze Xiao, Yiwen Tu, Haojian Jin

entry.summary: HumanStudy-Bench frames participant simulation as agent design problem, providing benchmark and engine to reconstruct human-subject experiments with LLM-based agents.

entry.title: Learning More from Less: Unlocking Internal Representations for Benchmark Compression

author.name: Yueqi Zhang, Jin Hu, Shaoxiong Feng, Peiwen Yuan, Xinglin Wang, Yiwei Li, Jiayi Shi, Chuyi Tan, Ji Zhang, Boyuan Pan, Yao Hu, Kan Li

entry.summary: REPCORE uses hidden state representations rather than correctness labels to select benchmark coresets, enabling reliable compression even with limited source model evaluation data.

entry.title: Environment-Aware Adaptive Pruning with Interleaved Inference Orchestration for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Yuting Huang, Leilei Ding, Zhipeng Tang, Zenghuan Zhu, Jiajun Deng, Xinrui Lin, Shuo Liu, Haojie Ren, Jianmin Ji, Yanyong Zhang

entry.summary: EcoVLA is training-free adaptive pruning framework for Vision-Language-Action models with environment-aware sparsity adjustment and interleaved inference orchestration.

entry.title: World Models as an Intermediary between Agents and the Real World

author.name: Sherry Yang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing world models should serve as intermediary between RL agents and real world to address high interaction costs in robotics, ML engineering, and scientific experiments.

entry.title: Resource-Efficient Reinforcement for Reasoning Large Language Models via Dynamic One-Shot Policy Refinement

author.name: Yunjian Zhang, Sudong Wang, Yang Li, Peiran Xu, Conghao Zhou, Xiaoyue Ma, Jianing Li, Yao Zhu

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical lower bound on sample complexity for RLVR reasoning and proposes efficient one-shot policy refinement achieving strong performance with minimal training instances.

entry.title: Beyond Output Critique: Self-Correction via Task Distillation

author.name: Hossein A. Rahmani, Mengting Wan, Pei Zhou, Longqi Yang, Nick Craswell, Emine Yilmaz, Sujay Kumar Jauhar

entry.summary: SELF-THOUGHT introduces task abstraction before refinement in LLM self-correction, distilling task into structured template to guide solution and reduce error propagation.

entry.title: Supervised sparse auto-encoders as unconstrained feature models for semantic composition

author.name: Ouns El Harzli, Hugo Wallner, Yoonsoo Nam, Haixuan Xavier Tao

entry.summary: Adapts unconstrained feature models from neural collapse theory for supervised sparse autoencoders, demonstrating compositional generalization in Stable Diffusion 3.5.

entry.title: Small-Margin Preferences Still Matter-If You Train Them Right

author.name: Jinlong Pang, Zhaowei Zhu, Na Di, Yichi Zhang, Yaxuan Wang, Chen Qian, Yang Liu

entry.summary: MixDPO shows small-margin preference pairs destabilize DPO training but contain useful signal for SFT. Proposes difficulty-aware training routing pairs to appropriate objectives.

entry.title: SetPO: Set-Level Policy Optimization for Diversity-Preserving LLM Reasoning

author.name: Chenyi Li, Yuan Zhang, Bo Wang, Guoqing Ma, Wei Tang, Haoyang Huang, Nan Duan

entry.summary: SetPO introduces set-level diversity objective for LLM reasoning using kernelized similarity, deriving leave-one-out marginal contributions as advantage shaping term.

entry.title: ConvexBench: Can LLMs Recognize Convex Functions?

author.name: Yepeng Liu, Yu Huang, Yu-Xiang Wang, Yingbin Liang, Yuheng Bu

entry.summary: ConvexBench tests LLM ability to identify convexity under deep functional composition. Reveals sharp degradation from F1=1.0 at depth 2 to 0.2 at depth 100 with parsing and reasoning failures.
