entry.title: FutureMind: Equipping Small Language Models with Strategic Thinking-Pattern Priors via Adaptive Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Shaoxiong Yang, Junting Li, Mengyuan Zhang, Chao Li, Wei Liu, Jian Luan

entry.summary: FutureMind equips small language models with reasoning capabilities through adaptive knowledge distillation from larger models, using a modular pipeline of problem analysis, logical reasoning, strategy planning, and retrieval guidance.

entry.title: MACD: Model-Aware Contrastive Decoding via Counterfactual Data

author.name: Qixin Xiao, Kun Zhou

entry.summary: MACD proposes model-aware contrastive decoding for Video-LLMs using the model's own feedback to identify regions responsible for hallucinations, generating targeted counterfactual data.

entry.title: Trust by Design: Skill Profiles for Transparent, Cost-Aware LLM Routing

author.name: Mika Okamoto, Ansel Kaplan Erol, Glenn Matlin

entry.summary: BELLA recommends LLM selection through interpretable skill-based profiling, decomposing outputs into granular skills and using multi-objective optimization for cost-performance tradeoffs.

entry.title: HYPE-EDIT-1: Benchmark for Measuring Reliability in Frontier Image Editing Models

author.name: Wing Chan, Richard Allen

entry.summary: Introduces HYPE-EDIT-1 benchmark of 100 marketing/design image editing tasks with binary pass/fail judging, measuring per-attempt pass rates (34-83%) and effective cost per success across models.

entry.title: Towards Agentic Intelligence for Materials Science

author.name: Huan Zhang, Yizhan Li, Wenhao Huang, Ziyu Hou, Yu Song, Xuye Liu, Farshid Effaty, Jinya Jiang, Sifan Wu, Qianggang Ding, Izumi Takahara, Leonard R. MacGillivray, Teruyasu Mizoguchi, Tianshu Yu, Lizi Liao, Yuyu Luo, Yu Rong, Jia Li, Ying Diao, Heng Ji, Bang Liu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey advancing a pipeline-centric view of agentic AI for materials science, spanning corpus curation through goal-conditioned agents interfacing with simulation and experiments. Treats discovery as an end-to-end system.

entry.title: Rank-and-Reason: Multi-Agent Collaboration Accelerates Zero-Shot Protein Mutation Prediction

author.name: Yang Tan, Yuanxi Yu, Can Wu, Bozitao Zhong, Mingchen Li, Guisheng Fan, Jiankang Zhu, Yafeng Liang, Nanqing Dong, Liang Hong

entry.summary: VenusRAR is a two-stage agentic framework for zero-shot protein mutation prediction combining computational expert and virtual biologist agents. Achieves new Spearman correlation record of 0.551 on ProteinGym.

entry.title: Fast Forward: Accelerating LLM Prefill with Predictive FFN Sparsity

author.name: Aayush Gautam, Mukul Gagrani, Junyoung Park, Mingu Lee, Chiris Lott, Narasimha Reddy

entry.summary: FastForward accelerates LLM prefill through predictive FFN sparsity with expert predictor, error compensation network, and layer-parallel execution for 1K-16K token contexts.

entry.title: From Associations to Activations: Comparing Behavioral and Hidden-State Semantic Geometry in LLMs

author.name: Louis Schiekiera, Max Zimmer, Christophe Roux, Sebastian Pokutta, Fritz G\"unther

entry.summary: Investigates how LLM hidden-state geometry relates to behavioral outputs through psycholinguistic experiments across 8 models and 17.5M+ trials. Finds forced-choice behavior aligns better with hidden states than free association.

entry.title: HyperOffload: Graph-Driven Hierarchical Memory Management for Large Language Models on SuperNode Architectures

author.name: Fangxin Liu, Qinghua Zhang, Hanjing Shen, Zhibo Liang, Li Jiang, Haibing Guan, Chong Bao, Xuefeng Jin

entry.summary: Proposes HyperOffload, a compiler-assisted memory management framework for LLMs on supernode architectures. Uses graph-driven scheduling to exploit terabyte-scale shared memory pools.

entry.title: Eliciting Trustworthiness Priors of Large Language Models via Economic Games

author.name: Siyu Yan, Lusha Zhu, Jian-Qiao Zhu

entry.summary: Uses Trust Game and iterated in-context learning to elicit LLM trustworthiness priors. Documents systematic rationality bias in baseline LLM behavior relative to human benchmarks.

entry.title: Improving Flow Matching by Aligning Flow Divergence

author.name: Yuhao Huang, Taos Transue, Shih-Hsin Wang, William Feldman, Hong Zhang, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Derives PDE characterization for error between learned and exact probability paths in flow matching. Shows TV gap bounded by CFM loss plus divergence loss, leading to improved objective.

entry.title: Lotus: Efficient LLM Training by Randomized Low-Rank Gradient Projection with Adaptive Subspace Switching

author.name: Tianhao Miao, Zhongyuan Bao, Lejun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Lotus for efficient LLM training using randomized low-rank gradient projection with adaptive subspace switching, avoiding SVD costs while maintaining memory efficiency.

entry.title: Dispelling the Curse of Singularities in Neural Network Optimizations

author.name: Hengjie Cao, Mengyi Chen, Yifeng Yang, Fang Dong, Ruijun Huang, Anrui Chen, Jixian Zhou, Mingzhi Dong, Yujiang Wang, Dongsheng Li, Wenyi Fang, Yuanyi Lin, Fan Wu, Li Shang

entry.summary: Investigates neural network optimization instability through the lens of parametric singularities. Shows that gradient Frobenius norms are bounded by top singular values and proposes Parametric Spectral Regularization.

entry.title: CIPHER: Cryptographic Insecurity Profiling via Hybrid Evaluation of Responses

author.name: Max Manolov, Tony Gao, Siddharth Shukla, Cheng-Ting Chou, Ryan Lagasse

entry.summary: Introduces CIPHER benchmark for measuring cryptographic vulnerabilities in LLM-generated Python code under varying security-guidance conditions, with line-level attribution scoring.

entry.title: Toward Cognitive Supersensing in Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Boyi Li, Yifan Shen, Yuanzhe Liu, Yifan Xu, Jiateng Liu, Xinzhuo Li, Zhengyuan Li, Jingyuan Zhu, Yunhan Zhong, Fangzhou Lan, Jianguo Cao, James M. Rehg, Heng Ji, Ismini Lourentzou, Xu Cao

entry.summary: Introduces Cognitive Supersensing paradigm endowing MLLMs with visual imagery capabilities via Latent Visual Imagery Prediction head that generates reasoning-supportive latent visual representations.

entry.title: On the Fragility of AI-Based Channel Decoders under Small Channel Perturbations

author.name: Haoyu Lei, Mohammad Jalali, Chin Wa Lau, Farzan Farnia

entry.summary: Studies robustness of AI-based error correction decoders, showing recent methods like ECCT and CrossMPT are fragile to adversarial perturbations that traditional BP decoders resist.

entry.title: Efficient Adversarial Attacks on High-dimensional Offline Bandits

author.name: Seyed Mohammad Hadi Hosseini, Amir Najafi, Mahdieh Soleymani Baghshah

entry.summary: Analyzes adversarial robustness of offline bandit evaluation when attackers perturb reward models on platforms like HuggingFace. Proposes efficient attack algorithms for high-dimensional settings.

entry.title: Probability-Entropy Calibration: An Elastic Indicator for Adaptive Fine-tuning

author.name: Wenhao Yu, Shaohang Wei, Jiahong Liu, Yifan Li, Minda Hu, Aiwei Liu, Hao Zhang, Irwin King

entry.summary: RankTuner introduces probability-entropy calibration via Relative Rank Indicator for token-level reweighting in supervised fine-tuning, balancing downstream alignment with intrinsic uncertainty.

entry.title: EvoMU: Evolutionary Machine Unlearning

author.name: Pawel Batorski, Paul Swoboda

entry.summary: Introduces EvoMU, an evolutionary search approach for automatically discovering task-specific machine unlearning loss functions, addressing the challenge that no universal unlearning loss works across all settings.

entry.title: Abstract Activation Spaces for Content-Invariant Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Gabriele Maraia, Marco Valentino, Fabio Massimo Zanzotto, Leonardo Ranaldi

entry.summary: Introduces Abstract Activation Spaces to make LLM deductive reasoning content-invariant, addressing the content effect where models conflate semantic plausibility with formal validity.

entry.title: Auditing Sybil: Explaining Deep Lung Cancer Risk Prediction Through Generative Interventional Attributions

author.name: Bartlomiej Sobieski, Jakub Grzywaczewski, Karol Dobiczek, Mateusz W\'ojcik, Tomasz Bartczak, Patryk Szatkowski, Przemys{\l}aw Bombi\'nski, Matthew Tivnan, Przemyslaw Biecek

entry.summary: S(H)NAP audits the Sybil lung cancer prediction model using generative interventional attributions validated by radiologists, shifting from correlation-based to causal verification before clinical deployment.

entry.title: Sparsely Supervised Diffusion

author.name: Wenshuai Zhao, Zhiyuan Li, Yi Zhao, Mohammad Hassan Vali, Martin Trapp, Joni Pajarinen, Juho Kannala, Arno Solin

entry.summary: Proposes sparse masking (up to 98% pixels) during diffusion training to improve global consistency and training stability, especially on small datasets.

entry.title: NLI:Non-uniform Linear Interpolation Approximation of Nonlinear Operations for Efficient LLMs Inference

author.name: Jiangyong Yu, Xiaomeng Han, Xing Hu, Chen Xu, Zhe Jiang, Dawei Yang

entry.summary: Proposes NLI, a calibration-free framework using non-uniform linear interpolation to approximate nonlinear functions (SiLU, RMSNorm, Softmax) in LLMs, enabling hardware-friendly computation.

entry.title: Universal Approximation of Continuous Functionals on Compact Subsets via Linear Measurements and Scalar Nonlinearities

author.name: Andrey Krylov, Maksim Penkin

entry.summary: Proves universal approximation of continuous functionals on compact subsets using finite linear measurements combined with scalar nonlinearities, providing theoretical justification for common operator learning designs.

entry.title: Dynamic Topology Optimization for Non-IID Data in Decentralized Learning

author.name: Bart Cox, Antreas Ioannou, J\'er\'emie Decouchant

entry.summary: Proposes Morph for decentralized learning that adaptively selects peers based on maximum model dissimilarity through gossip-based peer discovery, improving robustness to data heterogeneity.

entry.title: How to Train Your Resistive Network: Generalized Equilibrium Propagation and Analytical Learning

author.name: Jonathan Lin, Aman Desai, Frank Barrows, Francesco Caravelli

entry.summary: Develops framework for training resistive networks using equilibrium propagation, extending analytical gradient calculation using graph theory for energy-efficient analog computing.

entry.title: Understanding and Exploiting Weight Update Sparsity for Communication-Efficient Distributed RL

author.name: Erfan Miahi, Eugene Belilovsky

entry.summary: Empirically studies weight update sparsity in RL training, finding consistently high sparsity that enables efficient communication via sparse synchronization in distributed RL.

entry.title: CryoLVM: Self-supervised Learning from Cryo-EM Density Maps with Large Vision Models

author.name: Weining Fu, Kai Shu, Kui Xu, Qiangfeng Cliff Zhang

entry.summary: CryoLVM is a foundation model for cryo-EM density maps using JEPA architecture, enabling rapid adaptation to various structural biology downstream tasks.

entry.title: Where Norms and References Collide: Evaluating LLMs on Normative Reasoning

author.name: Mitchell Abrams, Kaveh Eskandari Miandoab, Felix Gervits, Vasanth Sarathy, Matthias Scheutz

entry.summary: SNIC benchmark tests LLM capability for norm-based reference resolution where interpreting expressions requires inferring implicit social/normative expectations.

entry.title: ROSA-Tuning: Enhancing Long-Context Modeling via Suffix Matching

author.name: Yunao Zheng, Xiaojie Wang, Lei Ren, Wei Chen

entry.summary: Proposes ROSA-Tuning, a retrieval-recall mechanism using CPU-based suffix automaton to locate relevant historical positions in long contexts and inject retrieved information into model state for enhanced long-context modeling.

entry.title: Context Compression via Explicit Information Transmission

author.name: Jiangnan Ye, Hanqi Yan, Zhenyi Shen, Heng Chang, Ye Mao, Yulan He

entry.summary: ComprExIT addresses soft context compression limitations through explicit information transmission, avoiding progressive representation overwriting and coordinating capacity allocation.

entry.title: AdaptMMBench: Benchmarking Adaptive Multimodal Reasoning for Mode Selection and Reasoning Process

author.name: Xintong Zhang, Xiaowen Zhang, Jongrong Wu, Zhi Gao, Shilin Yan, Zhenxin Diao, Kunpeng Gao, Xuanyan Chen, Yuwei Wu, Yunde Jia, Qing Li

entry.summary: AdaptMMBench evaluates adaptive multimodal reasoning that dynamically switches between tool-augmented and text reasoning, capturing model-relative difficulty.

entry.title: Gromov Wasserstein Optimal Transport for Semantic Correspondences

author.name: Francis Snelgar, Stephen Gould, Ming Xu, Liang Zheng, Akshay Asthana

entry.summary: Applies Gromov-Wasserstein optimal transport for semantic correspondences, offering a principled alternative to feature ensembling from DINOv2 and Stable Diffusion.

entry.title: FinMTM: A Multi-Turn Multimodal Benchmark for Financial Reasoning and Agent Evaluation

author.name: Chenxi Zhang, Ziliang Gan, Liyun Zhu, Youwei Pang, Qing Zhang, Rongjunchen Zhang

entry.summary: FinMTM introduces a multi-turn multimodal benchmark for financial reasoning with 11K bilingual QA pairs covering candlestick charts, statistical plots, and financial reports.

entry.title: EventNeuS: 3D Mesh Reconstruction from a Single Event Camera

author.name: Shreyas Sachan, Viktor Rudnev, Mohamed Elgharib, Christian Theobalt, Vladislav Golyanik

entry.summary: Presents EventNeuS, a self-supervised neural model for 3D mesh reconstruction from monocular event camera streams. First to combine SDF and density field learning with event-based supervision.

entry.title: HetroD: A High-Fidelity Drone Dataset and Benchmark for Autonomous Driving in Heterogeneous Traffic

author.name: Yu-Hsiang Chen, Wei-Jer Chang, Christian Kotulla, Thomas Keutgens, Steffen Runde, Tobias Moers, Christoph Klas, Wei Zhan, Masayoshi Tomizuka, Yi-Ting Chen

entry.summary: Introduces HetroD, a drone-based dataset for autonomous driving in heterogeneous traffic with vulnerable road users. Captures complex behaviors like hook turns and lane splitting underrepresented in existing datasets.

entry.title: PokeNet: Learning Kinematic Models of Articulated Objects from Human Observations

author.name: Anmol Gupta, Weiwei Gu, Omkar Patil, Jun Ki Lee, Nakul Gopalan

entry.summary: Presents PokeNet for learning kinematic models of articulated objects from human observation videos. Estimates joint parameters including order of manipulations without prior knowledge about joint types.

entry.title: Learning-based Adaptive Control of Quadruped Robots for Active Stabilization on Moving Platforms

author.name: Minsung Yoon, Heechan Shin, Jeil Jeong, Sung-Eui Yoon

entry.summary: Presents LAS-MP for quadruped robot stabilization on moving platforms using learning-based adaptive control. Introduces platform trajectory generation and scheduling methods.

entry.title: Formal Evidence Generation for Assurance Cases for Robotic Software Models

author.name: Fang Yan, Simon Foster, Ana Cavalcanti, Ibrahim Habli, James Baxter

entry.summary: Presents model-based approach for systematically generating formal verification evidence for robotics assurance cases. Derives assertions from requirements using templates and orchestrates multiple verification tools.

entry.title: Conditionalization Confounds Inoculation Prompting Results

author.name: Maxime Riché

entry.summary: Demonstrates that inoculation prompting results are confounded by conditionalization - learned traits only express conditional on specific context features. Shows rephrasing prompts reduces but doesn't fully solve the problem.

entry.title: PRISM: Festina Lente Proactivity -- Risk-Sensitive, Uncertainty-Aware Deliberation for Proactive Agents

author.name: Yuxuan Fu, Xiaoyu Tan, Teqi Hao, Chen Zhan, Xihe Qiu

entry.summary: PRISM formulates proactive agent intervention as cost-sensitive selective intervention, using calibrated acceptance probability thresholds and dual-process (fast/slow) reasoning architecture.

entry.title: Constrained Process Maps for Multi-Agent Generative AI Workflows

author.name: Ananya Joshi, Michael Rudow

entry.summary: Formalizes multi-agent LLM workflows as finite-horizon MDPs with DAG structure, where agents handle specific roles with predefined transitions and epistemic uncertainty representation.

entry.title: PTCBENCH: Benchmarking Contextual Stability of Personality Traits in LLM Systems

author.name: Jiongchi Yu, Yuhan Ma, Xiaoyu Zhang, Junjie Wang, Qiang Hu, Chao Shen, Xiaofei Xie

entry.summary: Introduces PTCBENCH benchmark to assess LLM personality consistency under 12 situational contexts using NEO Five-Factor Inventory, analyzing 39,240 personality trait records to reveal context-dependent personality variations.

entry.title: R3G: A Reasoning--Retrieval--Reranking Framework for Vision-Centric Answer Generation

author.name: Zhuohong Chen, Zhengxian Wu, Zirui Liao, Shenao Jiang, Hangrui Xu, Yang Chen, Chaokui Su, Xiaoyu Liu, Haoqian Wang

entry.summary: Proposes R3G framework for vision-centric QA with reasoning plan generation, two-stage retrieval-reranking, and sufficiency-aware evidence selection, achieving SOTA on MRAG-Bench.

entry.title: Stein-Rule Shrinkage for Stochastic Gradient Estimation in High Dimensions

author.name: M. Arashi, M. Amintoosi

entry.summary: Applies Stein-rule shrinkage to stochastic gradient estimation in high dimensions, providing decision-theoretic framework showing unbiased gradients are inadmissible under quadratic loss.

entry.title: FlyPrompt: Brain-Inspired Random-Expanded Routing with Temporal-Ensemble Experts for General Continual Learning

author.name: Hongwei Yan, Guanglong Sun, Kanglei Zhou, Qian Li, Liyuan Wang, Yi Zhong

entry.summary: FlyPrompt draws from fruit fly memory system for general continual learning with sparse expansion and modular ensembles, addressing expert allocation in continual parameter-efficient tuning.

entry.title: Decoupling Generalizability and Membership Privacy Risks in Neural Networks

author.name: Xingli Fang, Jung-Eun Kim

entry.summary: Identifies that model generalization and privacy risks exist in different regions of neural network architectures, proposing PPTP to protect vulnerable components while maintaining utility.

entry.title: Active Causal Experimentalist (ACE): Learning Intervention Strategies via Direct Preference Optimization

author.name: Patrick Cooper, Alvaro Velasquez

entry.summary: Introduces ACE (Active Causal Experimentalist), learning experimental design as a sequential policy using Direct Preference Optimization for causal discovery.

entry.title: BatCoder: Self-Supervised Bidirectional Code-Documentation Learning via Back-Translation

author.name: Jingwen Xu, Yiyang Lu, Zisu Huang, Changze Lv, Xiaohua Wang, Shizheng Li, Zhibo Xu, Zhengkang Guo, Zhengyuan Wang, Muzhao Tian, Xuanjing Huang, Xiaoqing Zheng

entry.summary: BatCoder uses back-translation RL for code-documentation learning: generate docs from code, reconstruct code from docs, use semantic similarity as reward. Works without paired training data.

entry.title: MARA: Continuous SE(3)-Equivariant Attention for Molecular Force Fields

author.name: Francesco Leonardi, Boris Bonev, Kaspar Riesen

entry.summary: MARA extends spherical attention to SE(3)-equivariant molecular force fields, operating directly on angular-radial coordinates for flexible geometric weighting without fixed angular expansions.

entry.title: Exposing Vulnerabilities in Explanation for Time Series Classifiers via Dual-Target Attacks

author.name: Bohan Wang, Zewen Liu, Lu Lin, Hui Liu, Li Xiong, Ming Jin, Wei Jin

entry.summary: TSEF dual-target attack on time series classifiers that simultaneously achieves targeted misclassification while keeping explanations consistent with chosen reference, exposing XAI vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Clarify Before You Draw: Proactive Agents for Robust Text-to-CAD Generation

author.name: Bo Yuan, Zelin Zhao, Petr Molodyk, Bin Hu, Yongxin Chen

entry.summary: Proposes ProCAD, a proactive agentic framework for text-to-CAD that asks clarification questions before code synthesis when specifications are under-specified or inconsistent.

entry.title: FlashSinkhorn: IO-Aware Entropic Optimal Transport

author.name: Felix X. -F. Ye, Xingjie Li, An Yu, Ming-Ching Chang, Linsong Chu, Davis Wertheimer

entry.summary: Presents FlashSinkhorn, an IO-aware entropic optimal transport solver achieving FlashAttention-style fusion for Sinkhorn iterations, enabling 10x faster computation at scale.

entry.title: Lipschitz Multiscale Deep Equilibrium Models: A Theoretically Guaranteed and Accelerated Approach

author.name: Naoki Sato, Hideaki Iiduka

entry.summary: Develops Lipschitz Multiscale Deep Equilibrium Models with convergence guarantees and accelerated fixed-point iterations, addressing the computational efficiency limitations of standard DEQs.

entry.title: Aligning Forest and Trees in Images and Long Captions for Visually Grounded Understanding

author.name: Byeongju Woo, Zilin Wang, Byeonghyun Pak, Sangwoo Mo, Stella X. Yu

entry.summary: CAFT enables hierarchical image-text learning for long captions through coupled fine-to-coarse visual and text hierarchies aligned without pixel-level supervision.

entry.title: SRA-Seg: Synthetic to Real Alignment for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: OFM Riaz Rahman Aranya, Kevin Desai

entry.summary: SRA-Seg aligns synthetic and real medical image distributions using DINOv2 embeddings and soft edge blending, enabling semi-supervised segmentation from synthetic data.

entry.title: A Unified Candidate Set with Scene-Adaptive Refinement via Diffusion for End-to-End Autonomous Driving

author.name: Zhengfei Wu, Shuaixi Pan, Shuohan Chen, Shuo Yang, Yanjun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes CdDrive for end-to-end autonomous driving combining fixed trajectory vocabulary with scene-adaptive diffusion-generated candidates. Both candidate types jointly scored for robust performance.

entry.title: Variance-Reduced Model Predictive Path Integral via Quadratic Model Approximation

author.name: Fabian Schramm, Franki Nguimatsia Tiofack, Nicolas Perrin-Gilbert, Marc Toussaint, Justin Carpentier

entry.summary: Introduces variance-reduced MPPI framework integrating quadratic model approximation into sampling process. Decomposes objective into model and residual for lower variance estimation.

entry.title: Addressing Explainability of Generative AI using SMILE (Statistical Model-agnostic Interpretability with Local Explanations)

author.name: Zeinab Dehghani

entry.summary: Introduces gSMILE, extending SMILE explainability methods to generative models using controlled perturbations, Wasserstein distance metrics, and weighted surrogate modeling to explain how prompt components influence outputs.

entry.title: RE-MCDF: Closed-Loop Multi-Expert LLM Reasoning for Knowledge-Grounded Clinical Diagnosis

author.name: Shaowei Shen, Xiaohong Yang, Jie Yang, Lianfen Huang, Yongcai Zhang, Yang Zou, Seyyedali Hosseinalipour

entry.summary: Proposes RE-MCDF for clinical diagnosis using multi-expert LLM reasoning with closed-loop validation. Addresses challenges of heterogeneous, sparse, and noisy electronic medical records in neurology.

entry.title: Efficient Cross-Architecture Knowledge Transfer for Large-Scale Online User Response Prediction

author.name: Yucheng Wu, Yuekui Yang, Hongzheng Li, Anan Liu, Jian Xiao, Junjie Zhai, Huan Yu, Shaoping Ma, Leye Wang

entry.summary: CrossAdapt enables efficient knowledge transfer between different model architectures using dimension-adaptive projections and progressive distillation, addressing high model switching costs in production systems.

entry.title: Context Learning for Multi-Agent Discussion

author.name: Xingyuan Hua, Sheng Yue, Xinyi Li, Yizhe Zhao, Jinrui Zhang, Ju Ren

entry.summary: M2CL learns context generators for multi-agent discussion that dynamically generate context instructions per round, addressing discussion inconsistency from context misalignment.

entry.title: Unlocking Electronic Health Records: A Hybrid Graph RAG Approach to Safe Clinical AI for Patient QA

author.name: Samuel Thio, Matthew Lewis, Spiros Denaxas, Richard JB Dobson

entry.summary: Introduces MediGRAF, a hybrid Graph RAG system for clinical AI that combines Neo4j Text2Cypher for structured data with semantic search for unstructured data, addressing hallucination concerns in EHR question answering.

entry.title: Early Warning Signals Appear Long Before Dropping Out: An Idiographic Approach Grounded in Complex Dynamic Systems Theory

author.name: Mohammed Saqr, Sonsoles L\'opez-Pernas, Santtu Tikka, Markus Wolfgang Hermann Spitzer

entry.summary: Tests whether early warning signals from complex dynamic systems theory (critical slowing down) can predict student disengagement before dropout, using 1.67 million practice attempts from 9,401 students.

entry.title: ECCO: Evidence-Driven Causal Reasoning for Compiler Optimization

author.name: Haolin Pan, Lianghong Huang, Jinyuan Dong, Mingjie Xing, Yanjun Wu

entry.summary: Introduces ECCO framework for compiler optimization that constructs Chain-of-Thought dataset mapping code features to performance evidence, enabling interpretable LLM-guided optimization with combinatorial search.

entry.title: RAPTOR: Ridge-Adaptive Logistic Probes

author.name: Ziqi Gao, Yaotian Zhu, Qingcheng Zeng, Xu Zhao, Ziqing Wang, Feng Ruan, Kaize Ding

entry.summary: RAPTOR proposes L2-regularized logistic probes with validation-tuned ridge strength for extracting concept vectors from LLMs. Enables more reliable activation steering in probe-then-steer pipelines.

entry.title: Why Are AI Agent Involved Pull Requests (Fix-Related) Remain Unmerged? An Empirical Study

author.name: Khairul Alam, Saikat Mondal, Banani Roy

entry.summary: Empirical study of 8,106 AI agent-generated fix-related pull requests, analyzing why many remain unmerged. Identifies factors hindering successful integration of autonomous coding agent contributions.

entry.title: QUASAR: A Universal Autonomous System for Atomistic Simulation and a Benchmark of Its Capabilities

author.name: Fengxu Yang, Jack D. Evans

entry.summary: QUASAR is an autonomous LLM-based system for atomistic simulations that orchestrates DFT, ML potentials, molecular dynamics, and Monte Carlo across complex multi-scale workflows with adaptive planning and memory management.

entry.title: LogicGaze: Benchmarking Causal Consistency in Visual Narratives via Counterfactual Verification

author.name: Rory Driscoll, Alexandros Christoforos, Chadbourne Davis

entry.summary: LogicGaze benchmark interrogates VLM ability to validate sequential causal chains against visual inputs, using visually contradictory but linguistically plausible perturbations to test hallucination.

entry.title: Physiology as Language: Translating Respiration to Sleep EEG

author.name: Kaiwen Zha, Chao Li, Hao He, Peng Cao, Tianhong Li, Ali Mirzazadeh, Ellen Zhang, Jong Woo Lee, Yoon Kim, Dina Katabi

entry.summary: Proposes a framework to synthesize sleep EEG from respiration signals, framing cross-physiology translation as a generation task. Trained on 28,000+ individuals, achieves 7% MAE in EEG spectrogram reconstruction with strong downstream task performance.

entry.title: Rethinking Zero-Shot Time Series Classification: From Task-specific Classifiers to In-Context Inference

author.name: Juntao Fang, Shifeng Xie, Shengbin Nie, Yuhui Ling, Yuming Liu, Zijian Li, Keli Zhang, Lujia Pan, Themis Palpanas, Ruichu Cai

entry.summary: Proposes TIC-FM, an in-context learning framework for zero-shot time series classification that treats labeled data as context. Eliminates need for task-specific classifier training, addressing evaluation bias in foundation models.

entry.title: SA-VLA: Spatially-Aware Flow-Matching for Vision-Language-Action Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xu Pan, Zhenglin Wan, Xingrui Yu, Xianwei Zheng, Youkai Ke, Ming Sun, Rui Wang, Ziwei Wang, Ivor Tsang

entry.summary: Proposes SA-VLA to preserve spatial grounding during RL fine-tuning of Vision-Language-Action models. Addresses erosion of spatial inductive bias that causes robustness degradation.

entry.title: Don't Forget Its Variance! The Minimum Path Variance Principle for Accurate and Stable Score-Based Density Ratio Estimation

author.name: Wei Chen, Jiacheng Li, Shigui Li, Zhiqi Lin, Junmei Yang, John Paisley, Delu Zeng

entry.summary: Proves tractable DRE objectives differ from ground truth by path variance of time score, deriving closed-form MinPV principle. Resolves paradox of path-independence in score-based methods.

entry.title: EffGen: Enabling Small Language Models as Capable Autonomous Agents

author.name: Gaurav Srivastava, Aafiya Hussain, Chi Wang, Yingyan Celine Lin, Xuan Wang

entry.summary: Introduces EffGen, open-source agentic framework optimized for small language models with 70-80% context compression. Features intelligent task decomposition and efficient local deployment.

entry.title: Calibrating Behavioral Parameters with Large Language Models

author.name: Brandon Yee, Krishna Sharma

entry.summary: Develops framework treating LLMs as calibrated measurement instruments for behavioral parameters in economics. Documents systematic rationality bias and shows profile-based calibration induces coherent shifts.

entry.title: Residual Decoding: Mitigating Hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models via History-Aware Residual Guidance

author.name: Xinrong Chen, Xu Chu, Yingmin Qiu, Hengyuan Zhang, Jing Xiong, Shiyu Tang, Shuai Liu, Shaokang Yang, Cheng Yang, Hayden Kwok-Hay So, Ngai Wong

entry.summary: Proposes Residual Decoding (ResDec), a training-free method to reduce hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models by using historical token information to correct biases during decoding.

entry.title: Mechanistic Interpretability of Brain-to-Speech Models Across Speech Modes

author.name: Maryam Maghsoudi, Ayushi Mishra

entry.summary: Applies mechanistic interpretability techniques including cross-mode activation patching and causal tracing to brain-to-speech neural decoders across vocalized, mimed, and imagined speech modes.

entry.title: Multi-LLM Adaptive Conformal Inference for Reliable LLM Responses

author.name: Kangjun Noh, Seongchan Lee, Ilmun Kim, Kyungwoo Song

entry.summary: Introduces MACI for ensuring LLM factuality using conformal inference with multi-LLM ensembles. Provides distribution-free guarantees while improving retention of true claims over conservative baselines.

entry.title: PolyGen: Fully Synthetic Vision-Language Training via Multi-Generator Ensembles

author.name: Leonardo Brusini, Cristian Sbrolli, Eugenio Lomurno, Toshihiko Yamasaki, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: Introduces PolyGen for vision-language pretraining using ensembles of architecturally distinct generators to increase manifold coverage and reduce model-specific artifacts in synthetic data.

entry.title: Rod Flow: A Continuous-Time Model for Gradient Descent at the Edge of Stability

author.name: Eric Regis, Sinho Chewi

entry.summary: Proposes Rod Flow as ODE approximation for gradient descent at edge of stability. Models GD iterates as extended object (rod) providing alternative to Central Flow with principled physical derivation.

entry.title: Plain Transformers are Surprisingly Powerful Link Predictors

author.name: Quang Truong, Yu Song, Donald Loveland, Mingxuan Ju, Tong Zhao, Neil Shah, Jiliang Tang

entry.summary: Proposes PENCIL, a plain encoder-only Transformer for link prediction that replaces structural heuristics with attention over sampled local subgraphs. Challenges sophisticated graph neural network approaches.

entry.title: Toward Enhancing Representation Learning in Federated Multi-Task Settings

author.name: Mehdi Setayesh, Mahdi Beitollahi, Yasser H. Khalil, Hongliang Li

entry.summary: Proposes Muscle loss for federated multi-task learning that aligns representations across heterogeneous models simultaneously rather than pairwise. Enables learning shared representation space without model congruity requirements.

entry.title: Counting Hypothesis: Potential Mechanism of In-Context Learning

author.name: Jung H. Lee, Sujith Vijayan

entry.summary: Proposes counting hypothesis to explain in-context learning mechanisms in LLMs, inspired by ICL properties and LLM functional modules.

entry.title: ES-MemEval: Benchmarking Conversational Agents on Personalized Long-Term Emotional Support

author.name: Tiantian Chen, Jiaqi Lu, Ying Shen, Lin Zhang

entry.summary: ES-MemEval benchmarks conversational agents on five memory capabilities for long-term emotional support: extraction, temporal reasoning, conflict detection, abstention, and user modeling.

entry.title: Bandwidth-Efficient Multi-Agent Communication through Information Bottleneck and Vector Quantization

author.name: Ahmad Farooq, Kamran Iqbal

entry.summary: Combines information bottleneck theory with vector quantization for bandwidth-efficient multi-agent communication, learning to compress while preserving task-critical information.

entry.title: FiLoRA: Focus-and-Ignore LoRA for Controllable Feature Reliance

author.name: Hyunsuk Chung, Caren Han, Yerin Choi, Seungyeon Ji, Jinwoo Kim, Eun-Jung Holden, Kyungreem Han

entry.summary: Introduces FiLoRA, a parameter-efficient adaptation framework that enables explicit control over which internal features multimodal models rely on, using instruction-conditioned LoRA modules.

entry.title: CAM: A Causality-based Analysis Framework for Multi-Agent Code Generation Systems

author.name: Lyu Zongyi, Ji Zhenlan, Chen Songqiang, Wang Liwen, Huang Yuheng, Wang Shuai, Cheung Shing-Chi

entry.summary: Proposes CAM, a causality-based analysis framework that quantifies how different intermediate outputs in multi-agent code generation systems contribute to overall system correctness.

entry.title: OpenSeal: Good, Fast, and Cheap Construction of an Open-Source Southeast Asian LLM via Parallel Data

author.name: Tan Sang Nguyen, Muhammad Reza Qorib, Hwee Tou Ng

entry.summary: Presents OpenSeal, a truly open-source Southeast Asian LLM built using parallel data, demonstrating that parallel corpora can effectively improve multilingual performance.

entry.title: ReasonEdit: Editing Vision-Language Models using Human Reasoning

author.name: Jiaxing Qiu, Kaihua Hou, Roxana Daneshjou, Ahmed Alaa, Thomas Hartvigsen

entry.summary: Introduces ReasonEdit, a VLM editor that lets users explain their reasoning during editing using a codebook of human reasoning and topology-balanced multimodal embeddings.

entry.title: D$^2$Quant: Accurate Low-bit Post-Training Weight Quantization for LLMs

author.name: Xianglong Yan, ChengZhu Bao, Zhiteng Li, Tianao Zhang, Shaoqiu Zhang, Ruobing Xie, Samm Sun, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: D²Quant addresses two key bottlenecks in sub-4-bit LLM quantization: down-projection sensitivity and activation deviation from weight quantization, using deformable matrices and deviation correction.

entry.title: ContextEvolve: Multi-Agent Context Compression for Systems Code Optimization

author.name: Hongyuan Su, Yu Zheng, Yong Li

entry.summary: ContextEvolve achieves RL-level search efficiency for code optimization under API-only LLM access through multi-agent context compression decomposing optimization into orthogonal dimensions.

entry.title: Expert-Data Alignment Governs Generation Quality in Decentralized Diffusion Models

author.name: Marcos Villagra, Bidhan Roy, Raihan Seraj, Zhiying Jiang

entry.summary: Challenges assumption that minimizing sampling instability improves generation quality in decentralized diffusion models. Shows expert-data alignment, not trajectory stability, governs quality.

entry.title: Provable Effects of Data Replay in Continual Learning: A Feature Learning Perspective

author.name: Meng Ding, Jinhui Xu, Kaiyi Ji

entry.summary: Theoretical framework analyzing full data replay in continual learning from feature learning perspective, using multi-view model to characterize when replay succeeds in preventing forgetting.

entry.title: Causality--\Delta: Jacobian-Based Dependency Analysis in Flow Matching Models

author.name: Reza Rezvan (Chalmers University of Technology), Gustav Gille (Chalmers University of Technology), Moritz Schauer (Chalmers University of Technology, University of Gothenburg), Richard Torkar (Chalmers University of Technology, University of Gothenburg)

entry.summary: Studies how perturbations propagate through flow matching models using Jacobian-vector products, revealing local affine structure even in globally nonlinear flows. Derives closed-form expressions for Gaussian settings and validates on image benchmarks.

entry.title: Zero Sum SVD: Balancing Loss Sensitivity for Low Rank LLM Compression

author.name: Ali Abbasi, Chayne Thrash, Haoran Qin, Shansita Sharma, Sepehr Seifi, Soheil Kolouri

entry.summary: Proposes Zero Sum SVD for LLM compression using global singular component selection with activation whitening and first-order calibration loss estimates. Achieves better rank allocation than homogeneous methods without expensive iterative optimization.

entry.title: How Does the Lagrangian Guide Safe Reinforcement Learning through Diffusion Models?

author.name: Xiaoyuan Cheng, Wenxuan Yuan, Boyang Li, Yuanchao Xu, Yiming Yang, Hao Liang, Bei Peng, Robert Loftin, Zhuo Sun, Yukun Hu

entry.summary: Proposes ALGD for safe RL combining Lagrangian methods with diffusion models. Shows Lagrangian landscape non-convexity causes instability and addresses it through augmented Lagrangian formulation.

entry.title: From Zero to Hero: Advancing Zero-Shot Foundation Models for Tabular Outlier Detection

author.name: Xueying Ding, Haomin Wen, Simon Kl\"utterman, Leman Akoglu

entry.summary: Introduces OUTFORMER advancing foundation models for outlier detection with mixture of synthetic priors and self-evolving curriculum training. Achieves zero-shot inference on new tasks.

entry.title: PRISM: Structured Optimization via Anisotropic Spectral Shaping

author.name: Yujie Yang

entry.summary: Proposes PRISM optimizer enhancing spectral descent methods like Muon with partial second-order information via low-rank quasi-second-order preconditioner for anisotropic spectral shaping.

entry.title: BayeSQP: Bayesian Optimization through Sequential Quadratic Programming

author.name: Paul Brunzema, Sebastian Trimpe

entry.summary: Combines sequential quadratic programming structure with Bayesian optimization using second-order GP surrogates for both objective and constraints, incorporating uncertainty into a tractable second-order cone program.

entry.title: ScDiVa: Masked Discrete Diffusion for Joint Modeling of Single-Cell Identity and Expression

author.name: Mingxuan Wang, Cheng Chen, Gaoyang Jiang, Zijia Ren, Chuangxin Zhao, Lu Shi, Yanbiao Ma

entry.summary: Proposes scDiVa, a masked discrete diffusion model for single-cell RNA-seq that jointly models gene identities and continuous values, aligning generation with dropout-like corruption.

entry.title: Robust Representation Learning in Masked Autoencoders

author.name: Anika Shrivastava, Renu Rameshan, Samar Agnihotri

entry.summary: Analyzes MAE representations, showing they're robust to degradations like blur and occlusions, with embeddings becoming increasingly class-separable across network depth.

entry.title: Optimization and Generation in Aerodynamics Inverse Design

author.name: Huaguan Chen, Ning Lin, Luxi Chen, Rui Zhang, Wenbing Huang, Chongxuan Li, Hao Sun

entry.summary: Proposes density-gradient optimization for aerodynamic inverse design that improves objectives while preserving plausible shapes, with unified view of guided generation methods.

entry.title: Fast-MWEM: Private Data Release in Sublinear Time

author.name: Themistoklis Haris, Steve Choi, Mutiraj Laksanawisit

entry.summary: Improves MWEM private data analysis framework from O(m) to O(√m) per-iteration runtime using lazy sampling with Gumbel noise and k-NN data structures.

entry.title: SymPlex: A Structure-Aware Transformer for Symbolic PDE Solving

author.name: Yesom Park, Annie C. Lu, Shao-Ching Huang, Qiyang Hu, Y. Sungtaek Ju, Stanley Osher

entry.summary: SymPlex uses RL with structure-aware transformer (SymFormer) to discover analytical symbolic solutions to PDEs without ground-truth expressions, enforcing syntactic validity via grammar-constrained decoding.

entry.title: PLATE: Plasticity-Tunable Efficient Adapters for Geometry-Aware Continual Learning

author.name: Romain Cosentino

entry.summary: PLATE exploits geometric redundancy in pretrained networks to enable continual learning without access to old task data, using redundant neurons as protected update subspaces.

entry.title: Beyond Content: Behavioral Policies Reveal Actors in Information Operations

author.name: Philipp J. Schneider, Lanqin Yuan, Marian-Andrei Rizoiu

entry.summary: Identifies malicious actors in information operations from behavioral policies modeled as sequential decision processes, analyzing Reddit IRA accounts.

entry.title: A Multi-scale Linear-time Encoder for Whole-Slide Image Analysis

author.name: Jagan Mohan Reddy Dwarampudi, Joshua Wong, Hien Van Nguyen, Tania Banerjee

entry.summary: MARBLE is first purely Mamba-based multi-scale MIL framework for whole-slide images, processing multiple magnifications in parallel with linear-time complexity.

entry.title: Building Interpretable Models for Moral Decision-Making

author.name: Mayank Goel, Aritra Das, Paras Chopra

entry.summary: Builds a custom 2-layer transformer to study how neural networks make moral decisions on trolley-style dilemmas, using interpretability techniques to uncover how moral reasoning distributes across the network. Achieves 77% accuracy on Moral Machine data.

entry.title: CoCoEmo: Composable and Controllable Human-Like Emotional TTS via Activation Steering

author.name: Siyi Wang, Shihong Tan, Siyi Liu, Hong Jia, Gongping Huang, James Bailey, Ting Dang

entry.summary: Presents CoCoEmo, the first systematic analysis of activation steering for emotional control in text-to-speech, enabling compositional and controllable emotional expression including mixed or text-emotion-misaligned speech.

entry.title: Preference-based Conditional Treatment Effects and Policy Learning

author.name: Dovid Parnas, Mathieu Even, Julie Josse, Uri Shalit

entry.summary: Introduces preference-based framework for conditional treatment effect estimation using Conditional Preference-based Treatment Effect (CPTE), enabling heterogeneous effect modeling with multivariate, ordinal, or preference-driven outcomes.

entry.title: MIRROR: A Multi-Agent Framework with Iterative Adaptive Revision and Hierarchical Retrieval for Optimization Modeling in Operations Research

author.name: Yifan Shi, Jialong Shi, Jiayi Wang, Ye Fan, Jianyong Sun

entry.summary: MIRROR is a multi-agent framework that translates natural language optimization problems into mathematical models and solver code using iterative error correction and hierarchical retrieval.

entry.title: Controlling Output Rankings in Generative Engines for LLM-based Search

author.name: Haibo Jin, Ruoxi Chen, Peiyan Zhang, Yifeng Luo, Huimin Zeng, Man Luo, Haohan Wang

entry.summary: CORE optimizes content to control output rankings in LLM-based search engines, addressing visibility disadvantages for small businesses in generative search.

entry.title: Decoupling Skeleton and Flesh: Efficient Multimodal Table Reasoning with Disentangled Alignment and Structure-aware Guidance

author.name: Yingjie Zhu, Xuefeng Bai, Kehai Chen, Yang Xiang, Youcheng Pan, Xiaoqiang Zhou, Min Zhang

entry.summary: DiSCo and Table-GLS adapt LVLMs to table reasoning through disentangled structure-content alignment and structure-aware guidance without expensive training or external tools.

entry.title: Video-OPD: Efficient Post-Training of Multimodal Large Language Models for Temporal Video Grounding via On-Policy Distillation

author.name: Jiaze Li, Hao Yin, Haoran Xu, Boshen Xu, Wenhui Tan, Zewen He, Jianzhong Ju, Zhenbo Luo, Jian Luan

entry.summary: Video-OPD proposes efficient post-training for temporal video grounding using on-policy distillation with dense token-level supervision from a teacher model. Addresses computational overhead and sparse rewards in existing GRPO methods.

entry.title: Finding Optimal Video Moment without Training: Gaussian Boundary Optimization for Weakly Supervised Video Grounding

author.name: Sunoh Kim, Kimin Yun, Daeho Um

entry.summary: Gaussian Boundary Optimization provides a training-free inference framework for weakly supervised video grounding by solving an optimization problem balancing proposal coverage and segment compactness.

entry.title: Flexible Geometric Guidance for Probabilistic Human Pose Estimation with Diffusion Models

author.name: Francis Snelgar, Ming Xu, Stephen Gould, Liang Zheng, Akshay Asthana

entry.summary: Uses diffusion models for probabilistic 3D human pose estimation, enabling sampling from distributions over plausible poses. Incorporates geometric guidance without requiring large paired training data.

entry.title: ConsisDrive: Identity-Preserving Driving World Models for Video Generation by Instance Mask

author.name: Zhuoran Yang, Yanyong Zhang

entry.summary: ConsisDrive addresses identity drift in driving video generation through instance-masked attention that enforces temporal consistency at the instance level.

entry.title: LEVIO: Lightweight Embedded Visual Inertial Odometry for Resource-Constrained Devices

author.name: Jonas K\"uhne, Christian Vogt, Michele Magno, Luca Benini

entry.summary: LEVIO presents a lightweight visual-inertial odometry pipeline optimized for ultra-low-power embedded platforms, enabling real-time 6-DoF sensing.

entry.title: Hierarchical Concept-to-Appearance Guidance for Multi-Subject Image Generation

author.name: Yijia Xu, Zihao Wang, Jinshi Cui

entry.summary: CAG provides hierarchical concept-to-appearance guidance for multi-subject generation using VAE dropout training and VLM semantic signals.

entry.title: High-Resolution Underwater Camouflaged Object Detection: GBU-UCOD Dataset and Topology-Aware and Frequency-Decoupled Networks

author.name: Wenji Wu, Shuo Ye, Yiyu Liu, Jiguang He, Zhuo Wang, Zitong Yu

entry.summary: DeepTopo-Net introduces topology-aware modeling with frequency-decoupled perception for underwater camouflaged object detection, with new GBU-UCOD dataset.

entry.title: FOVI: A biologically-inspired foveated interface for deep vision models

author.name: Nicholas M. Blauch, George A. Alvarez, Talia Konkle

entry.summary: Proposes FOVI, a foveated vision interface inspired by human retina and V1 that reformats variable-resolution input into uniform dense representation. Enables efficient processing of high-resolution images by mimicking biological visual systems.

entry.title: Continuous Control of Editing Models via Adaptive-Origin Guidance

author.name: Alon Wolf, Chen Katzir, Kfir Aberman, Or Patashnik

entry.summary: Introduces Adaptive-Origin Guidance for smooth control of edit intensity in diffusion-based image/video editing. Shows that standard CFG fails to produce smooth transitions and proposes using input content as guidance origin.

entry.title: Origin Lens: A Privacy-First Mobile Framework for Cryptographic Image Provenance and AI Detection

author.name: Alexander Loth, Dominique Conceicao Rosario, Peter Ebinger, Martin Kappes, Marc-Oliver Pahl

entry.summary: Presents Origin Lens, a privacy-first mobile framework for cryptographic image provenance verification and AI detection. Performs verification locally via Rust/Flutter hybrid architecture.

entry.title: Split&Splat: Zero-Shot Panoptic Segmentation via Explicit Instance Modeling and 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Leonardo Monchieri, Elena Camuffo, Francesco Barbato, Pietro Zanuttigh, Simone Milani

entry.summary: Proposes Split&Splat for zero-shot panoptic scene reconstruction using 3D Gaussian Splatting. Explicitly models object instances by propagating masks across views and reconstructing objects independently.

entry.title: Adaptive Linear Path Model-Based Diffusion

author.name: Yutaka Shimizu, Masayoshi Tomizuka

entry.summary: Introduces LP-MBD and ALP-MBD, replacing variance-preserving schedules in model-based diffusion with flow-matching-inspired linear paths. Uses RL to adaptively adjust parameters.

entry.title: Model-based Optimal Control for Rigid-Soft Underactuated Systems

author.name: Daniele Caradonna, Nikhil Nair, Anup Teejo Mathew, Daniel Feliu Taleg\'on, Imran Afgan, Egidio Falotico, Cosimo Della Santina, Federico Renda

entry.summary: Presents model-based optimal control framework for hybrid rigid-soft underactuated robots using Geometric Variable Strain model. Addresses challenges of continuum robot dynamics control.

entry.title: A Scene Graph Backed Approach to Open Set Semantic Mapping

author.name: Martin G\"unther, Felix Igelbrink, Oscar Lima, Lennart Niecksch, Marian Renz, Martin Atzmueller

entry.summary: Proposes scene graph-backed approach to open set semantic mapping where 3DSSG serves as foundational backend. Leverages incremental scene graph prediction for real-time updates.

entry.title: Sharp Inequalities between Total Variation and Hellinger Distances for Gaussian Mixtures

author.name: Joonhyuk Jung, Chao Gao

entry.summary: Establishes sharp inequalities between total variation and Hellinger distances for Gaussian location mixtures. Resolves open problem from Jia et al. (2023) with matching upper and lower bounds.

entry.title: ORCH: many analyses, one merge-a deterministic multi-agent orchestrator for discrete-choice reasoning with EMA-guided routing

author.name: Hanlin Zhou, Huah Yong Chan

entry.summary: ORCH is a deterministic multi-agent coordination framework using 'many analyses, one decision' paradigm with EMA-guided routing for reproducible discrete-choice reasoning.

entry.title: Thinking Like a Doctor: Conversational Diagnosis through the Exploration of Diagnostic Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Jeongmoon Won, Seungwon Kook, Yohan Jo

entry.summary: Proposes conversational diagnosis system that explores diagnostic knowledge graphs through hypothesis generation and verification via clarifying questions, with realistic patient simulator.

entry.title: OGD4All: A Framework for Accessible Interaction with Geospatial Open Government Data Based on Large Language Models

author.name: Michael Siebenmann (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich), Javier Argota S\'anchez-Vaquerizo (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich), Stefan Arisona (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Krystian Samp (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Luis Gisler (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Dirk Helbing (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich, Complexity Science Hub, Vienna)

entry.summary: Presents OGD4All framework from ETH Zurich for citizen interaction with geospatial government data, achieving 98% analytical correctness on 430 datasets while minimizing hallucination through reliable rejection of unsupported questions.

entry.title: SCPL: Enhancing Neural Network Training Throughput with Decoupled Local Losses and Model Parallelism

author.name: Ming-Yao Ho, Cheng-Kai Wang, You-Teng Lin, Hung-Hsuan Chen

entry.summary: Introduces SCPL for faster neural network training by decoupling backpropagation into short gradient flows, enabling parallel gradient computation across layers for improved model parallelism.

entry.title: Scalable Analytic Classifiers with Associative Drift Compensation for Class-Incremental Learning of Vision Transformers

author.name: Xuan Rao, Mingming Ha, Bo Zhao, Derong Liu, Cesare Alippi

entry.summary: Proposes LR-RGDA, scalable analytic classifier for class-incremental learning with ViTs using low-rank factorization of covariance via Woodbury identity to reduce quadratic inference complexity.

entry.title: ESSAM: A Novel Competitive Evolution Strategies Approach to Reinforcement Learning for Memory Efficient LLMs Fine-Tuning

author.name: Zhishen Sun, Sizhe Dang, Guang Dai, Haishan Ye

entry.summary: Proposes ESSAM combining Evolution Strategies with Sharpness-Aware Maximization for memory-efficient LLM fine-tuning. Achieves 78.27% on GSM8K comparable to backpropagation methods.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Experts with Intermediate CTC Supervision for Accented Speech Recognition

author.name: Wonjun Lee, Hyounghun Kim, Gary Geunbae Lee

entry.summary: Moe-Ctc combines Mixture-of-Experts with intermediate CTC supervision for accented speech recognition, transitioning from accent-aware to label-free routing during training.

entry.title: ECHO: Entropy-Confidence Hybrid Optimization for Test-Time Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chu Zhao, Enneng Yang, Yuting Liu, Jianzhe Zhao, Guibing Guo

entry.summary: Introduces ECHO, addressing rollout collapse in test-time RL by combining entropy-aware branching with confidence-weighted pseudo-label filtering to improve exploration and reduce overfitting.

entry.title: UniReason 1.0: A Unified Reasoning Framework for World Knowledge Aligned Image Generation and Editing

author.name: Dianyi Wang, Chaofan Ma, Feng Han, Size Wu, Wei Song, Yibin Wang, Zhixiong Zhang, Tianhang Wang, Siyuan Wang, Zhongyu Wei, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes UniReason, a unified framework for image generation and editing that formulates generation as world knowledge-enhanced planning and uses editing for self-reflective refinement.

entry.title: Mitigating Task-Order Sensitivity and Forgetting via Hierarchical Second-Order Consolidation

author.name: Protik Nag, Krishnan Raghavan, Vignesh Narayanan

entry.summary: HTCL uses hierarchical second-order consolidation to address task-order sensitivity in continual learning, with Hessian-regularized Taylor expansion providing theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: Learning Better Certified Models from Empirically-Robust Teachers

author.name: Alessandro De Palma

entry.summary: Shows certified training can be improved by distilling from empirically-robust (adversarially-trained) teachers, achieving better trade-offs between certified robustness and standard performance.

entry.title: On the Sample Efficiency of Inverse Dynamics Models for Semi-Supervised Imitation Learning

author.name: Sacha Morin, Moonsub Byeon, Alexia Jolicoeur-Martineau, S\'ebastien Lachapelle

entry.summary: Shows VM-IDM and IDM labeling learn equivalent policies in limit case. Argues IDM-based policy advantage comes from superior sample efficiency of inverse dynamics learning over behavior cloning.

entry.title: Consistency Deep Equilibrium Models

author.name: Junchao Lin, Zenan Ling, Jingwen Xu, Robert C. Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces C-DEQ using consistency distillation to accelerate Deep Equilibrium Model inference by training models to map intermediate states directly to fixed points.

entry.title: Shortcut Features as Top Eigenfunctions of NTK: A Linear Neural Network Case and More

author.name: Jinwoo Lim, Suhyun Kim, Soo-Mook Moon

entry.summary: Analyzes shortcut learning through Neural Tangent Kernel framework, showing shortcuts correspond to larger eigenvalue features when stemming from imbalanced clustered distributions.

entry.title: Anomaly Detection via Mean Shift Density Enhancement

author.name: Pritam Kar, Rahul Bordoloi, Olaf Wolkenhauer, Saptarshi Bej

entry.summary: Proposes Mean Shift Density Enhancement for anomaly detection, which identifies anomalies through their geometric response to density-driven manifold evolution rather than structure-specific assumptions.

entry.title: Asymmetric Hierarchical Anchoring for Audio-Visual Joint Representation: Resolving Information Allocation Ambiguity for Robust Cross-Modal Generalization

author.name: Bixing Wu, Yuhong Zhao, Zongli Ye, Jiachen Lian, Xiangyu Yue, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: Proposes Asymmetric Hierarchical Anchoring for audio-visual learning that enforces directional information allocation using audio RVQ as structured anchor to resolve semantic leakage.

entry.title: QuAIL: Quality-Aware Inertial Learning for Robust Training under Data Corruption

author.name: Mattia Sabella, Alberto Archetti, Pietro Pinoli, Matteo Matteucci, Cinzia Cappiello

entry.summary: Proposes QuAIL, quality-informed training that incorporates feature reliability priors via learnable modulation layer with quality-dependent proximal regularization for handling corrupted data.

entry.title: No Shortcuts to Culture: Indonesian Multi-hop Question Answering for Complex Cultural Understanding

author.name: Vynska Amalia Permadi, Xingwei Tan, Nafise Sadat Moosavi, Nikos Aletras

entry.summary: ID-MoCQA is the first multi-hop QA dataset for cultural understanding, requiring reasoning across Indonesian traditions with six clue types in English and Indonesian.

entry.title: InstaDrive: Instance-Aware Driving World Models for Realistic and Consistent Video Generation

author.name: Zhuoran Yang, Xi Guo, Chenjing Ding, Chiyu Wang, Wei Wu, Yanyong Zhang

entry.summary: InstaDrive enhances driving video generation with Instance Flow Guider for temporal consistency and Spatial Geometric Aligner for precise positioning.

entry.title: KTV: Keyframes and Key Tokens Selection for Efficient Training-Free Video LLMs

author.name: Baiyang Song, Jun Peng, Yuxin Zhang, Guangyao Chen, Feidiao Yang, Jianyuan Guo

entry.summary: KTV proposes two-stage keyframe and token selection for efficient training-free video understanding, addressing CLIP similarity biases.

entry.title: A thin and soft optical tactile sensor for highly sensitive object perception

author.name: Yanchen Shen, Kohei Tsuji, Haruto Koizumi, Jiseon Hong, Tomoaki Niiyama, Hiroyuki Kuwabara, Hayato Ishida, Jun Hiramitsu, Mitsuhito Mase, Satoshi Sunada

entry.summary: Introduces thin, soft optical tactile sensor using speckle pattern changes in silicone material. Achieves alignment-free configuration without lenses or cameras.

entry.title: When Should Agents Coordinate in Differentiable Sequential Decision Problems?

author.name: Caleb Probine, Su Ann Low, David Fridovich-Keil, Ufuk Topcu

entry.summary: Explores value of coordination in differentiable motion-planning for multi-robot teams. Shows reasoning about coordination reduces to reasoning about interaction matrix eigenvalues.

entry.title: Autonomous Question Formation for Large Language Model-Driven AI Systems

author.name: Hong Su

entry.summary: Proposes framework enabling AI systems to autonomously form questions and set tasks by reasoning over internal states, environmental observations, and inter-agent interactions, treating question formation as a first-class decision process.

entry.title: SIDiffAgent: Self-Improving Diffusion Agent

author.name: Shivank Garg, Ayush Singh, Gaurav Kumar Nayak

entry.summary: SIDiffAgent is a training-free agentic framework that addresses diffusion model limitations (prompt sensitivity, semantic ambiguity, artifacts) using Qwen family models for iterative refinement.

entry.title: PPoGA: Predictive Plan-on-Graph with Action for Knowledge Graph Question Answering

author.name: MinGyu Jeon, SuWan Cho, JaeYoung Shu

entry.summary: Proposes PPoGA for knowledge graph question answering that separates high-level planning from execution and uses predictive processing to anticipate outcomes, enabling self-correction when initial plans fail.

entry.title: Enhancing few-shot time series forecasting with LLM-guided diffusion

author.name: Haonan Shi, Dehua Shuai, Liming Wang, Xiyang Liu, Long Tian

entry.summary: Proposes LTSM-DIFF combining LLMs as temporal memory with diffusion models for few-shot time series forecasting, using LLM representations as conditional guidance for diffusion.

entry.title: EDU-CIRCUIT-HW: Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models on Real-World University-Level STEM Student Handwritten Solutions

author.name: Weiyu Sun, Liangliang Chen, Yongnuo Cai, Huiru Xie, Yi Zeng, Ying Zhang

entry.summary: Releases EDU-CIRCUIT-HW benchmark of 1,300+ authentic student handwritten solutions for evaluating MLLMs on understanding intertwined formulas, diagrams, and reasoning in STEM education.

entry.title: Pareto-Conditioned Diffusion Models for Offline Multi-Objective Optimization

author.name: Jatan Shrestha, Santeri Heiskanen, Kari Hepola, Severi Rissanen, Pekka J\"a\"askel\"ainen, Joni Pajarinen

entry.summary: Introduces Pareto-Conditioned Diffusion for offline multi-objective optimization, conditioning directly on desired trade-offs without explicit surrogate models. Uses reweighting and reference-direction mechanism.

entry.title: CLAMP: Contrastive Learning for 3D Multi-View Action-Conditioned Robotic Manipulation Pretraining

author.name: I-Chun Arthur Liu, Krzysztof Choromanski, Sandy Huang, Connor Schenck

entry.summary: Proposes CLAMP, 3D pre-training framework for robotic manipulation using point clouds and robot actions. Re-renders multi-view observations from merged point clouds for clearer target views.

entry.title: ASGMamba: Adaptive Spectral Gating Mamba for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Qianyang Li, Xingjun Zhang, Shaoxun Wang, Jia Wei, Yueqi Xing

entry.summary: ASGMamba combines adaptive spectral gating with Mamba architecture for time series forecasting, dynamically filtering noise in frequency domain while maintaining linear complexity.

entry.title: SurfSplat: Conquering Feedforward 2D Gaussian Splatting with Surface Continuity Priors

author.name: Bing He, Jingnan Gao, Yunuo Chen, Ning Cao, Gang Chen, Zhengxue Cheng, Li Song, Wenjun Zhang

entry.summary: SurfSplat feedforward framework based on 2D Gaussian Splatting with surface continuity prior and forced alpha blending to address discrete point cloud artifacts in sparse-view 3D reconstruction.

entry.title: Two-Stage Grid Optimization for Group-wise Quantization of LLMs

author.name: Junhan Kim, Gukryeol Lee, Seungwoo Son, Jeewook Kim, Yongkweon Jeon

entry.summary: Proposes a two-stage optimization framework for LLM quantization that improves GPTQ by explicitly minimizing layer-wise reconstruction loss through better group scale initialization.

entry.title: FragmentFlow: Scalable Transition State Generation for Large Molecules

author.name: Ron Shprints, Peter Holderrieth, Juno Nam, Rafael G\'omez-Bombarelli, Tommi Jaakkola

entry.summary: Introduces FragmentFlow, a divide-and-conquer approach for generating transition states of large molecules by training on molecular fragments and combining predictions.

entry.title: A Comparative Simulation Study of the Fairness and Accuracy of Predictive Policing Systems in Baltimore City

author.name: Samin Semsar, Kiran Laxmikant Prabhu, Gabriella Waters, James Foulds

entry.summary: Comprehensive simulation study comparing fairness and accuracy of predictive policing systems in Baltimore, finding more nuanced picture than simple bias narratives suggest.

entry.title: Vector Quantized Latent Concepts: A Scalable Alternative to Clustering-Based Concept Discovery

author.name: Xuemin Yu, Ankur Garg, Samira Ebrahimi Kahou, Hassan Sajjad

entry.summary: VQLC uses VQ-VAE architecture to learn discrete codebook mapping representations to concept vectors, providing scalable alternative to clustering for interpretability in deep learning.

entry.title: TraceNAS: Zero-shot LLM Pruning via Gradient Trace Correlation

author.name: Prajna G. Malettira, Manish Nagaraj, Arjun Roy, Shubham Negi, Kaushik Roy

entry.summary: Proposes TraceNAS, a training-free neural architecture search framework for structured LLM pruning using gradient trace correlation to capture global structural dependencies.

entry.title: Q-ShiftDP: A Differentially Private Parameter-Shift Rule for Quantum Machine Learning

author.name: Hoang M. Ngo, Nhat Hoang-Xuan, Quan Nguyen, Nguyen Do, Incheol Shin, My T. Thai

entry.summary: Introduces Q-ShiftDP, the first differentially private mechanism tailored for quantum ML, leveraging bounded quantum gradients for tighter sensitivity analysis and reduced noise requirements.

entry.title: Consensus Group Relative Policy Optimization for Text Generation

author.name: Yuki Ichihara, Yuu Jinnai, Kaito Ariu, Eiji Uchibe

entry.summary: Proposes C-GRPO distilling Minimum Bayes Risk decoding consensus utility into training for text generation without gold references or preference data.

entry.title: BlockRR: A Unified Framework of RR-type Algorithms for Label Differential Privacy

author.name: Haixia Liu, Yi Ding

entry.summary: Introduces BlockRR, a unified randomized-response mechanism for label differential privacy that generalizes existing RR-type mechanisms as special cases under specific parameter settings.

entry.title: CTTVAE: Latent Space Structuring for Conditional Tabular Data Generation on Imbalanced Datasets

author.name: Milosh Devic, Jordan Gierschendorf, David Garson

entry.summary: Introduces CTTVAE for synthetic tabular data generation under class imbalance using class-aware triplet margin loss and training-by-sampling strategy for minority exposure.

entry.title: HMVLA: Hyperbolic Multimodal Fusion for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Kun Wang, Xiao Feng, Mingcheng Qu, Tonghua Su

entry.summary: HMVLA embeds vision-language-action features in hyperbolic space to better model hierarchical relationships for robotic control, improving semantic alignment.

entry.title: Unified Inference Framework for Single and Multi-Player Performative Prediction: Method and Asymptotic Optimality

author.name: Zhixian Zhang, Xiaotian Hou, Linjun Zhang

entry.summary: Unified inference framework for performative prediction treating single-agent as special case of multi-agent, establishing asymptotic normality and efficiency of RRM procedure.

entry.title: SEAD: Self-Evolving Agent for Multi-Turn Service Dialogue

author.name: Yuqin Dai, Ning Gao, Wei Zhang, Jie Wang, Zichen Luo, Jinpeng Wang, Yujie Wang, Ruiyuan Wu, Chaozheng Wang

entry.summary: SEAD enables service dialogue agents to learn without annotations by decoupling user modeling into Profile Controller for curriculum and User Role-play Model for realistic simulation.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Uncalibrated Multi-View Video Anonymization in the Operating Room

author.name: Keqi Chen, Vinkle Srivastav, Armine Vardazaryan, Cindy Rolland, Didier Mutter, Nicolas Padoy

entry.summary: Self-supervised multi-view video anonymization for operating rooms that requires no manual annotations per site and handles camera repositioning without recalibration.

entry.title: A3-TTA: Adaptive Anchor Alignment Test-Time Adaptation for Image Segmentation

author.name: Jianghao Wu, Xiangde Luo, Yubo Zhou, Lianming Wu, Guotai Wang, Shaoting Zhang

entry.summary: A3-TTA provides test-time adaptation for segmentation using anchor-guided supervision with class compactness clustering to identify reliable pseudo-labels.

entry.title: PWAVEP: Purifying Imperceptible Adversarial Perturbations in 3D Point Clouds via Spectral Graph Wavelets

author.name: Haoran Li, Renyang Liu, Hongjia Liu, Chen Wang, Long Yin, Jian Xu

entry.summary: PWAVEP defends against adversarial attacks on 3D point clouds using spectral graph wavelets to purify high-frequency perturbations.

entry.title: Multi-Objective Optimization for Synthetic-to-Real Style Transfer

author.name: Estelle Chigot, Thomas Oberlin, Manon Huguenin, Dennis Wilson

entry.summary: Uses multi-objective genetic algorithms to optimize synthetic-to-real style transfer pipelines, balancing structural coherence and style similarity.

entry.title: Pi-GS: Sparse-View Gaussian Splatting with Dense {\pi}^3 Initialization

author.name: Manuel Hofer, Markus Steinberger, Thomas K\"ohler

entry.summary: Proposes Pi-GS for sparse-view 3D Gaussian Splatting using dense initialization from π³, a reference-free point cloud estimation network. Addresses failures of traditional SfM in sparse-view scenarios.

entry.title: Enhancing Navigation Efficiency of Quadruped Robots via Leveraging Personal Transportation Platforms

author.name: Minsung Yoon, Sung-Eui Yoon

entry.summary: Introduces RL-ATR enabling quadruped robots to ride personal transporters like Segways. Features riding policy and state estimators for non-inertial frame sensing.

entry.title: Sub-optimality bounds for certainty equivalent policies in partially observed systems

author.name: Berk Bozkurt, Aditya Mahajan, Ashutosh Nayyar, Yi Ouyang

entry.summary: Presents sub-optimality bounds for certainty equivalent policies in general partially observed stochastic systems. Generalizes classical certainty equivalence beyond linear systems.

entry.title: Entropic Mirror Monte Carlo

author.name: Anas Cherradi (LPSM), Yazid Janati (CMAP), Alain Durmus (CMAP), Sylvain Le Corff (LPSM), Yohan Petetin (CEREMADE), Julien Stoehr (CEREMADE)

entry.summary: Introduces Entropic Mirror Monte Carlo, adaptive importance sampling combining global sampling with delayed weighting for efficient exploration of complex multimodal distributions.

entry.title: From Gameplay Traces to Game Mechanics: Causal Induction with Large Language Models

author.name: Mohit Jiwatode, Alexander Dockhorn, Bodo Rosenhahn

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to reverse-engineer video game rules from gameplay traces, testing causal induction capabilities. Compares direct code generation vs structured causal model approaches.

entry.title: Autonomous Data Processing using Meta-Agents

author.name: Udayan Khurana

entry.summary: Presents ADP-MA framework where meta-agents dynamically construct, execute, and refine data processing pipelines through hierarchical orchestration of specialized ground-level agents.

entry.title: Position: Agentic Evolution is the Path to Evolving LLMs

author.name: Minhua Lin, Hanqing Lu, Zhan Shi, Bing He, Rui Mao, Zhiwei Zhang, Zongyu Wu, Xianfeng Tang, Hui Liu, Zhenwei Dai, Xiang Zhang, Suhang Wang, Benoit Dumoulin, Jian Pei

entry.summary: Position paper arguing LLMs need 'agentic evolution' - the ability to strategically diagnose failures and produce durable improvements rather than static training or heuristic adaptation.

entry.title: Benchmarking Agents in Insurance Underwriting Environments

author.name: Amanda Dsouza, Ramya Ramakrishnan, Charles Dickens, Bhavishya Pohani, Christopher M Glaze

entry.summary: UNDERWRITE benchmark evaluates AI agents on insurance underwriting with expert-designed realism: proprietary knowledge, noisy tools, and imperfect users requiring information gathering.

entry.title: Exploring Information Seeking Agent Consolidation

author.name: Guochen Yan, Jialong Wu, Zhengwei Tao, Bo Li, Qintong Zhang, Jiahao Xu, Haitao Mi, Yuejian Fang, Qingni Shen, Wentao Zhang, Zhonghai Wu

entry.summary: Studies consolidation of heterogeneous information-seeking agents into unified models via data-level mixing vs parameter-level merging, analyzing cross-domain generalization.

entry.title: DockSmith: Scaling Reliable Coding Environments via an Agentic Docker Builder

author.name: Jiaran Zhang, Luck Ma, Yanhao Li, Fanqi Wan, Di Qi, Xu Zhao, Jieyi Hou, Zhe Xie, Mengqiang Ren, Xin Wu, Zhewei Huang, Liangyu Chen, Yingwei Ma, Qi Han, Xiangyu Zhang

entry.summary: DockSmith is an agentic Docker builder treating environment construction as core capability. Trained on execution-grounded trajectories with loop detection and cross-task memory.

entry.title: SEISMO: Increasing Sample Efficiency in Molecular Optimization with a Trajectory-Aware LLM Agent

author.name: Fabian P. Kr\"uger, Andrea Hunklinger, Adrian Wolny, Tim J. Adler, Igor Tetko, Santiago David Villalba

entry.summary: SEISMO is an LLM agent for sample-efficient molecular optimization, updating after every oracle call using full trajectory conditioning with natural language and scores.

entry.title: OpenGuanDan: A Large-Scale Imperfect Information Game Benchmark

author.name: Chao Li, Shangdong Yang, Chiheng Zhan, Zhenxing Ge, Yujing Hu, Bingkun Bao, Xingguo Chen, Yang Gao

entry.summary: OpenGuanDan benchmark for GuanDan card game - a challenging four-player, multi-round imperfect information game enabling evaluation of both learning-based and rule-based agents.

entry.title: Position: Human-Centric AI Requires a Minimum Viable Level of Human Understanding

author.name: Fangzhou Lin, Qianwen Ge, Lingyu Xu, Peiran Li, Xiangbo Gao, Shuo Xing, Kazunori Yamada, Ziming Zhang, Haichong Zhang, Zhengzhong Tu

entry.summary: Position paper defining Capability-Comprehension Gap and Cognitive Integrity Threshold - minimum human understanding required for meaningful AI oversight under sustained delegation.

entry.title: Foundation CAN LM: A Pretrained Language Model For Automotive CAN Data

author.name: Akiharu Esashi, Pawissanutt Lertpongrujikorn, Justin Makino, Yuibi Fujimoto, Mohsen Amini Salehi

entry.summary: Foundation CAN LM - first pretrained language model for automotive CAN bus data enabling cross-task generalization for collision detection, maintenance prediction, and driver modeling.

entry.title: Synapse Compendium Aware Federated Knowledge Exchange for Tool Routed LLMs

author.name: Abhijit Chakraborty, Sandipan De, Yash Shah, Chahana Dahal, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Synapse framework for federated learning among LLM agents with shared tool-usage knowledge model, using templated representations and adaptive masking to balance utility and privacy.

entry.title: The Keyhole Effect: Why Chat Interfaces Fail at Data Analysis

author.name: Mohan Reddy

entry.summary: Analyzes how chat interfaces degrade analytical performance through five mechanisms based on Woods' Keyhole Effect, arguing for alternative interface paradigms for data analysis.

entry.title: R-HTN: Rebellious Online HTN Planning for Safety and Game AI

author.name: Hector Munoz-Avila, David W. Aha, Paola Rizzo

entry.summary: R-HTN introduces rebellious (intelligent disobedience) HTN agents governed by built-in directives, with adaptive and non-adaptive variants for safety-critical applications.

entry.title: Error Taxonomy-Guided Prompt Optimization

author.name: Mayank Singh, Vikas Yadav, Eduardo Blanco

entry.summary: ETGPO uses error taxonomy derived from execution logs to guide prompt optimization, maintaining global perspective rather than bottom-up individual problem adjustments.

entry.title: AutoHealth: An Uncertainty-Aware Multi-Agent System for Autonomous Health Data Modeling

author.name: Tong Xia, Weibin Li, Gang Liu, Yong Li

entry.summary: AutoHealth is multi-agent system for autonomous health data modeling with uncertainty estimation, using five specialized agents for exploration, model selection, and reliability assessment.

entry.title: MedBeads: An Agent-Native, Immutable Data Substrate for Trustworthy Medical AI

author.name: Takahito Nakajima

entry.summary: MedBeads proposes agent-native medical data infrastructure using Merkle DAG where clinical events are immutable beads with cryptographic causal references, addressing RAG hallucination.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Causal Reasoning System for Error Pattern Rule Automation in Vehicles

author.name: Hugo Math, Julian Lorenz, Stefan Oelsner, Rainer Lienhart

entry.summary: CAREP multi-agent system automates error pattern rule generation from vehicle diagnostic codes using causal discovery, contextual information, and refinement agents.

entry.title: ASP-Bench: From Natural Language to Logic Programs

author.name: Stefan Szeider

entry.summary: Introduces ASP-Bench, a benchmark of 128 natural language problems for evaluating systems that translate specifications into Answer Set Programs. Provides systematic coverage of ASP features with reference validators for checking solutions.

entry.title: Model Specific Task Similarity for Vision Language Model Selection via Layer Conductance

author.name: Wei Yang, Hong Xie, Tao Tan, Xin Li, Defu Lian, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes using layer-wise conductance to represent tasks for VLM selection, deriving target-conditioned block importance distributions to assess model-task compatibility without exhaustive evaluation.

entry.title: Canonical Intermediate Representation for LLM-based optimization problem formulation and code generation

author.name: Zhongyuan Lyu, Shuoyu Hu, Lujie Liu, Hongxia Yang, Ming LI

entry.summary: Introduces CIR (Canonical Intermediate Representation) for LLM-based optimization problem formulation, encoding operational rules through constraint archetypes before mathematical instantiation.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning via Conservative Agent for Environments with Random Delays

author.name: Jongsoo Lee, Jangwon Kim, Jiseok Jeong, Soohee Han

entry.summary: Proposes a conservative agent that reformulates random-delay RL environments into constant-delay equivalents, enabling existing constant-delay methods to be extended to random-delay scenarios without modification.

entry.title: LOGOS-CA: A Cellular Automaton Using Natural Language as State and Rule

author.name: Keishu Utimula

entry.summary: Proposes LOGOS-CA, a cellular automaton using natural language as cell states and rules, delegating updates to LLMs to enable richer simulation beyond numerical states and fixed rules.

entry.title: Standards for trustworthy AI in the European Union: technical rationale, structural challenges, and an implementation path

author.name: Piercosma Bisconti, Marcello Galisai

entry.summary: White paper examining technical foundations of European AI standardization under AI Act, proposing layered approach with horizontal process standards and domain-specific sectoral profiles.

entry.title: Autonomous Multi-Agent AI for High-Throughput Polymer Informatics: From Property Prediction to Generative Design Across Synthetic and Bio-Polymers

author.name: Mahule Roy, Adib Bazgir, Arthur da Silva Sousa Santos, Yuwen Zhang

entry.summary: Presents multi-agent AI ecosystem for polymer discovery integrating high-throughput workflows with LLM agents (DeepSeek-V2, DeepSeek-Coder) for property prediction, generative design, and biopolymer characterization.

entry.title: PredictionMarketBench: A SWE-bench-Style Framework for Backtesting Trading Agents on Prediction Markets

author.name: Avi Arora, Ritesh Malpani

entry.summary: Introduces PredictionMarketBench, SWE-bench-style benchmark for evaluating trading agents on prediction markets via deterministic limit-order-book replay with realistic execution simulation.

entry.title: ProDCARL: Reinforcement Learning-Aligned Diffusion Models for De Novo Antimicrobial Peptide Design

author.name: Fang Sheng, Mohammad Noaeen, Zahra Shakeri

entry.summary: ProDCARL combines diffusion-based protein generation with RL alignment to optimize antimicrobial peptide design for both activity and low toxicity. Uses policy-gradient updates with classifier-derived rewards.

entry.title: TessPay: Verify-then-Pay Infrastructure for Trusted Agentic Commerce

author.name: Mehul Goenka, Tejas Pathak, Siddharth Asthana

entry.summary: TessPay proposes verify-then-pay infrastructure for agentic commerce with primitives for task delegation, payment settlement after verification, and audit mechanisms for agent transactions.

entry.title: SANEval: Open-Vocabulary Compositional Benchmarks with Failure-mode Diagnosis
