author.name: Rishav Pramanik, Ian E. Nielsen, Jeff Smith, Saurav Pandit, Ravi P. Ramachandran, Zhaozheng Yin

entry.summary: SANEval benchmark for text-to-image compositional evaluation with scalable open-vocabulary pipeline and fine-grained diagnostic capabilities for spatial, attribute, and numeracy failures.

entry.title: TokenTrim: Inference-Time Token Pruning for Autoregressive Long Video Generation

author.name: Ariel Shaulov, Eitan Shaar, Amit Edenzon, Lior Wolf

entry.summary: TokenTrim mitigates temporal drift in autoregressive video generation by identifying and removing unstable latent tokens during inference, addressing error propagation over long horizons.

entry.title: VoxServe: Streaming-Centric Serving System for Speech Language Models

author.name: Keisuke Kamahori, Wei-Tzu Lee, Atindra Jha, Rohan Kadekodi, Stephanie Wang, Arvind Krishnamurthy, Baris Kasikci

entry.summary: VoxServe is a unified serving system for Speech Language Models with streaming-aware scheduling and asynchronous inference pipeline, supporting diverse SpeechLM architectures.

entry.title: Multi-Speaker Conversational Audio Deepfake: Taxonomy, Dataset and Pilot Study

author.name: Alabi Ahmed, Vandana Janeja, Sanjay Purushotham

entry.summary: Proposes taxonomy of multi-speaker conversational audio deepfakes and introduces MsCADD dataset of 2,830 clips covering partial and full manipulation scenarios.

entry.title: AdaFuse: Adaptive Multimodal Fusion for Lung Cancer Risk Prediction via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chongyu Qu, Zhengyi Lu, Yuxiang Lai, Thomas Z. Li, Junchao Zhu, Junlin Guo, Juming Xiong, Yanfan Zhu, Yuechen Yang, Allen J. Luna, Kim L. Sandler, Bennett A. Landman, Yuankai Huo

entry.summary: AdaFuse uses reinforcement learning to learn patient-specific modality selection and fusion strategies for lung cancer risk prediction, questioning whether all modalities should be used.

entry.title: LLMs as High-Dimensional Nonlinear Autoregressive Models with Attention: Training, Alignment and Inference

author.name: Vikram Krishnamurthy

entry.summary: Mathematical reference formulating LLMs as high-dimensional nonlinear autoregressive models with attention, covering pretraining, RLHF, DPO, RSFT, and RLVR.

entry.title: From Junior to Senior: Allocating Agency and Navigating Professional Growth in Agentic AI-Mediated Software Engineering

author.name: Dana Feng, Bhada Yun, April Wang

entry.summary: Mixed-methods study of junior and senior software engineers using agentic AI, finding agency primarily constrained by organizational policies with seniors delegating through detailed prompts.

entry.title: RAG-GNN: Integrating Retrieved Knowledge with Graph Neural Networks for Precision Medicine

author.name: Hasi Hays, William J. Richardson

entry.summary: Combines RAG embeddings with graph neural network representations through contrastive learning for precision medicine. Shows topology-focused methods excel at link prediction while RAG-GNN uniquely achieves positive clustering scores.

entry.title: EchoReview: Learning Peer Review from the Echoes of Scientific Citations

author.name: Yinuo Zhang, Dingcheng Huang, Haifeng Suo, Yizhuo Li, Ziya Zhao, Junhao Xu, Zhiying Tu, Dianhui Chu, Deming Zhai, Xianming Liu, Xiaoyan Yu, Dianbo Sui

entry.summary: Proposes EchoReview, using citation context signals to synthesize peer review training data. Transforms collective evaluation signals from citations into structured review feedback.

entry.title: RMFlow: Refined Mean Flow by a Noise-Injection Step for Multimodal Generation

author.name: Yuhao Huang, Shih-Hsin Wang, Andrea L. Bertozzi, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes RMFlow combining coarse MeanFlow transport with noise-injection refinement for efficient multimodal generation. Achieves near SOTA results on text-to-image and time-series with 1-NFE.

entry.title: GradingAttack: Attacking Large Language Models Towards Short Answer Grading Ability

author.name: Xueyi Li, Zhuoneng Zhou, Zitao Liu, Yongdong Wu, Weiqi Luo

entry.summary: Introduces GradingAttack, adversarial framework for manipulating LLM-based short answer grading. Designs token and prompt-level attacks maintaining high camouflage.

entry.title: LASS-ODE: Scaling ODE Computations to Connect Foundation Models with Dynamical Physical Systems

author.name: Haoran Li, Chenhan Xiao, Lihao Mai, Yang Weng, Erik Blasch

entry.summary: Proposes LASS-ODE scaling ODE computations for foundation models through token-wise locally linear representation. Addresses physics-computation scalability challenge.

entry.title: VEQ: Modality-Adaptive Quantization for MoE Vision-Language Models

author.name: Guangshuo Qin, Zhiteng Li, Zheng Chen, Weihang Zhang, Linghe Kong, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces VEQ, a quantization framework for MoE Vision-Language Models that accounts for both cross-modal differences (vision vs. language tokens) and heterogeneous expert contributions. Addresses memory and compute overhead in large VLMs.

entry.title: OLion: Approaching the Hadamard Ideal by Intersecting Spectral and $\ell_{\infty}$ Implicit Biases

author.name: Zixiao Wang, Yifei Shen, Huishuai Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces OLion optimizer combining spectral control from orthogonalized updates with L-infinity coordinate control from sign updates. Provides convergence proofs under mild assumptions.

entry.title: Supervised Fine-Tuning Needs to Unlock the Potential of Token Priority

author.name: Zhanming Shen, Zeyu Qin, Jiaqi Hu, Wentao Ye, Hao Chen, Xiaomeng Hu, Haokai Xu, Gang Chen, Yi R. Fung, Haobo Wang

entry.summary: Position paper advocating Token Priority as a bridge between autoregressive generation and alignment, formalizing SFT as distribution reshaping. Categorizes recent breakthroughs into Positive and Signed Priority regimes.

entry.title: Beyond Pixels: Visual Metaphor Transfer via Schema-Driven Agentic Reasoning

author.name: Yu Xu, Yuxin Zhang, Juan Cao, Lin Gao, Chunyu Wang, Oliver Deussen, Tong-Yee Lee, Fan Tang

entry.summary: Introduces Visual Metaphor Transfer task challenging models to decouple creative essence from reference images and apply abstract logic to new targets. Proposes cognitive-inspired multi-agent framework.

entry.title: Context Dependence and Reliability in Autoregressive Language Models

author.name: Poushali Sengupta, Shashi Raj Pandey, Sabita Maharjan, Frank Eliassen

entry.summary: Introduces RISE method for quantifying unique influence of context elements in LLMs, handling redundancy in prompts and retrieved passages. Addresses interpretability for prompt injection risks.

entry.title: DCD: Decomposition-based Causal Discovery from Autocorrelated and Non-Stationary Temporal Data

author.name: Muhammad Hasan Ferdous, Md Osman Gani

entry.summary: Introduces decomposition-based causal discovery framework for non-stationary time series, separating trend, seasonal, and residual components for component-specific causal analysis.

entry.title: Causal Preference Elicitation

author.name: Edwin V. Bonilla, He Zhao, Daniel M. Steinberg

entry.summary: Introduces causal preference elicitation framework using Bayesian active learning for causal discovery with expert-in-the-loop. Models noisy expert judgments on edge relations.

entry.title: MarkCleaner: High-Fidelity Watermark Removal via Imperceptible Micro-Geometric Perturbation

author.name: Xiaoxi Kong, Jieyu Yuan, Pengdi Chen, Yuanlin Zhang, Chongyi Li, Bin Li

entry.summary: Introduces MarkCleaner for watermark removal via micro-geometric perturbations, showing semantic watermarks are vulnerable to spatial displacements that break phase alignment.

entry.title: Multimodal UNcommonsense: From Odd to Ordinary and Ordinary to Odd

author.name: Yejin Son, Saejin Kim, Dongjun Min, Younjae Yu

entry.summary: Introduces Multimodal UNcommonsense benchmark for evaluating models on scenarios deviating from typical expectations, with retrieval-based ICL framework for capability transfer.

entry.title: SUSD: Structured Unsupervised Skill Discovery through State Factorization

author.name: Seyed Mohammad Hadi Hosseini, Mahdieh Soleymani Baghshah

entry.summary: SUSD introduces structured unsupervised skill discovery that leverages compositional structure of environments via state factorization. Addresses limitations of MI-based methods that favor static skills.

entry.title: Meta Engine: A Unified Semantic Query Engine on Heterogeneous LLM-Based Query Systems

author.name: Ruyu Li, Tinghui Zhang, Haodi Ma, Daisy Zhe Wang, Yifan Wang

entry.summary: Meta Engine provides unified semantic query interface over heterogeneous LLM-based query systems, addressing integration challenges across disparate APIs for multimodal data management.

entry.title: CloDS: Visual-Only Unsupervised Cloth Dynamics Learning in Unknown Conditions

author.name: Yuliang Zhan, Jian Li, Wenbing Huang, Wenbing Huang, Yang Liu, Hao Sun

entry.summary: CloDS introduces unsupervised cloth dynamics learning from multi-view visual observations without known physical properties, using video-to-geometry grounding pipeline.

entry.title: The Verification Crisis: Expert Perceptions of GenAI Disinformation and the Case for Reproducible Provenance

author.name: Alexander Loth, Martin Kappes, Marc-Oliver Pahl

entry.summary: Reports findings from expert survey on GenAI disinformation threats, revealing that text generation poses systemic 'epistemic fragmentation' risks while deepfake video provides immediate shock value.

entry.title: Hierarchical Adaptive Eviction for KV Cache Management in Multimodal Language Models

author.name: Xindian Ma, Yidi Lu, Peng Zhang, Jing Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes HAE, a KV cache eviction framework for multimodal LLMs that implements dual-attention pruning and dynamic decoding eviction to handle heterogeneous visual and text token attention patterns.

entry.title: Sparse Adapter Fusion for Continual Learning in NLP

author.name: Min Zeng, Xi Chen, Haiqin Yang, Yike Guo

entry.summary: Proposes SAFM for continual learning that dynamically decides whether to add new adapters or reuse existing ones, using sparse fusion to prevent catastrophic forgetting.

entry.title: TabularMath: Evaluating Computational Extrapolation in Tabular Learning via Program-Verified Synthesis

author.name: Zerui Cheng, Jiashuo Liu, Jianzhu Yao, Pramod Viswanath, Ge Zhang, Wenhao Huang

entry.summary: TabularMath benchmark evaluates whether tabular ML models can extrapolate deterministic computational relationships rather than just interpolate statistical patterns. Tests 9 models on 114 problems derived from GSM8K/AIME.

entry.title: Label Curation Using Agentic AI

author.name: Subhodeep Ghosh, Bayan Divaaniaazar, Md Ishat-E-Rabban, Spencer Clarke, Senjuti Basu Roy

entry.summary: AURA coordinates multiple AI agents for large-scale multimodal data annotation without ground truth, using EM to jointly infer true labels and annotator reliability via confusion matrices.

entry.title: Hierarchical Entity-centric Reinforcement Learning with Factored Subgoal Diffusion

author.name: Dan Haramati, Carl Qi, Tal Daniel, Amy Zhang, Aviv Tamar, George Konidaris

entry.summary: Hierarchical framework for offline goal-conditioned RL combining value-based GCRL with factored subgoal diffusion to handle long-horizon tasks in multi-entity domains with combinatorial complexity.

entry.title: LEMON: Local Explanations via Modality-aware OptimizatioN

author.name: Yu Qin, Phillip Sloan, Raul Santos-Rodriguez, Majid Mirmehdi, Telmo de Menezes e Silva Filho

entry.summary: Introduces LEMON, a model-agnostic explainability framework for multimodal predictions that produces unified explanations disentangling modality-level and feature-level contributions using sparse surrogates.

entry.title: Recurrent Equivariant Constraint Modulation: Learning Per-Layer Symmetry Relaxation from Data

author.name: Stefanos Pertigkiozoglou, Mircea Petrache, Shubhendu Trivedi, Kostas Daniilidis

entry.summary: Proposes RECM, a mechanism that learns appropriate equivariance relaxation levels per layer from training signal alone, without requiring prior knowledge about task-dependent relaxation targets.

entry.title: FedKRSO: Communication and Memory Efficient Federated Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models

author.name: Guohao Yang, Tongle Wu, Yuanxiong Guo, Ying Sun, Yanmin Gong

entry.summary: Proposes FedKRSO for communication and memory efficient federated LLM fine-tuning using K-seed random subspace optimization to enable full-parameter fine-tuning at reduced cost.

entry.title: Neural Predictor-Corrector: Solving Homotopy Problems with Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jiayao Mai, Bangyan Liao, Zhenjun Zhao, Yingping Zeng, Haoang Li, Javier Civera, Tailin Wu, Yi Zhou, Peidong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Predictor-Corrector (NPC) replacing hand-crafted heuristics in homotopy solvers with learned policies via reinforcement learning, unifying diverse homotopy problems under single framework.

entry.title: GraDE: A Graph Diffusion Estimator for Frequent Subgraph Discovery in Neural Architectures

author.name: Yikang Yang, Zhengxin Yang, Minghao Luo, Luzhou Peng, Hongxiao Li, Wanling Gao, Lei Wang, Jianfeng Zhan

entry.summary: Introduces GraDE, a diffusion-guided framework for finding frequent subgraph patterns in neural architectures that balances computational feasibility with discovery capability as subgraph size increases.

entry.title: NPCNet: Navigator-Driven Pseudo Text for Deep Clustering of Early Sepsis Phenotyping

author.name: Pi-Ju Tsai, Charkkri Limbud, Kuan-Fu Chen, Yi-Ju Tseng

entry.summary: Introduces NPCNet for deep clustering of sepsis phenotypes using target navigator with temporal EHRs, identifying four clinically distinct phenotypes with different SOFA trajectories.

entry.title: ContraLog: Log File Anomaly Detection with Contrastive Learning and Masked Language Modeling

author.name: Simon Dietz, Kai Klede, An Nguyen, Bjoern M Eskofier

entry.summary: Proposes ContraLog, a parser-free self-supervised method for log anomaly detection using message embeddings and contrastive learning with masked language modeling.

entry.title: Decision-oriented benchmarking to transform AI weather forecast access: Application to the Indian monsoon

author.name: Rajat Masiwal, Colin Aitken, Adam Marchakitus, Mayank Gupta, Katherine Kowal, Hamid A. Pahlavan, Tyler Yang, Y. Qiang Sun, Michael Kremer, Amir Jina, William R. Boos, Pedram Hassanzadeh

entry.summary: Introduces decision-oriented framework for evaluating AI weather prediction that connects meteorology, AI, and social sciences, applied to Indian monsoon forecasting for stakeholder-relevant outcomes.

entry.title: Reward Redistribution for CVaR MDPs using a Bellman Operator on L-infinity

author.name: Aneri Muni, Vincent Taboga, Esther Derman, Pierre-Luc Bacon, Erick Delage

entry.summary: Proposes novel CVaR MDP formulation with Bellman operator in L-infinity space, achieving dense per-step rewards rather than sparse trajectory-based signals for risk-sensitive RL.

entry.title: CreditAudit: 2D Auditing for LLM Evaluation and Selection

author.name: Yiliang Song, Hongjun An, Jiangong Xiao, Haofei Zhao, Jiawei Shao, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: CreditAudit evaluates LLMs under semantic variations of system prompts to measure robustness, reporting mean ability and stability for deployment decisions.

entry.title: Scaling-Aware Adapter for Structure-Grounded LLM Reasoning

author.name: Zihao Jing, Qiuhao Zeng, Ruiyi Fang, Yan Yi Li, Yan Sun, Boyu Wang, Pingzhao Hu

entry.summary: Cuttlefish introduces Scaling-Aware Patching for unified all-atom LLM reasoning over biomolecular structures, scaling modality tokens with structural complexity.

entry.title: Physics-inspired transformer quantum states via latent imaginary-time evolution

author.name: Kimihiro Yamazaki, Itsushi Sakata, Takuya Konishi, Yoshinobu Kawahara

entry.summary: PITQS treats neural quantum states as approximations to imaginary-time evolution with static effective Hamiltonians via weight sharing and Trotter-Suzuki decomposition.

entry.title: Tiled Prompts: Overcoming Prompt Underspecification in Image and Video Super-Resolution

author.name: Bryan Sangwoo Kim, Jonghyun Park, Jong Chul Ye

entry.summary: Proposes Tiled Prompts for image and video super-resolution, generating tile-specific prompts for each latent tile to address prompt underspecification where global captions miss localized details or provide irrelevant guidance.

entry.title: Improving the Linearized Laplace Approximation via Quadratic Approximations

author.name: Pedro Jim\'enez, Luis A. Ortega, Pablo Morales-\'Alvarez, Daniel Hern\'andez-Lobato

entry.summary: Proposes Quadratic Laplace Approximation (QLA) to improve the Linearized Laplace Approximation for Bayesian uncertainty in deep neural networks, using rank-one factors from power iterations to better capture the posterior.

entry.title: Efficient Variance-reduced Estimation from Generative EHR Models: The SCOPE and REACH Estimators

author.name: Luke Solo, Matthew B. A. McDermott, William F. Parker, Bashar Ramadan, Michael C. Burkhart, Brett K. Beaulieu-Jones

entry.summary: Proposes SCOPE and REACH estimators for clinical outcome prediction from generative EHR models, leveraging next-token probability distributions to reduce variance while proving both are unbiased.

entry.title: Fast Sampling for Flows and Diffusions with Lazy and Point Mass Stochastic Interpolants

author.name: Gabriel Damsholt, Jes Frellsen, Susanne Ditlevsen

entry.summary: Proves how to convert sample paths between stochastic differential equations with arbitrary schedules and diffusion coefficients, extending stochastic interpolants to point mass schedules. Identifies lazy schedule families that simplify drift.

entry.title: Task--Specificity Score: Measuring How Much Instructions Really Matter for Supervision

author.name: Pritam Kadasi, Abhishek Upperwal, Mayank Singh

entry.summary: Proposes Task-Specificity Score (TSS) to quantify how much an instruction matters for predicting output by contrasting against plausible alternatives, measuring instruction dataset quality.

entry.title: PEGRL: Improving Machine Translation by Post-Editing Guided Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yunzhi Shen, Hao Zhou, Xin Huang, Xue Han, Junlan Feng, Shujian Huang

entry.summary: PEGRL uses post-editing as an auxiliary task in a two-stage RL framework to stabilize machine translation training and guide optimization with better return estimation.

entry.title: CUBO: Self-Contained Retrieval-Augmented Generation on Consumer Laptops 10 GB Corpora, 16 GB RAM, Single-Device Deployment

author.name: Paolo Astrino

entry.summary: CUBO enables RAG on consumer laptops with 16GB RAM for 10GB corpora through streaming ingestion, tiered retrieval, and hardware-aware orchestration while maintaining GDPR compliance.

entry.title: SVD-ViT: Does SVD Make Vision Transformers Attend More to the Foreground?

author.name: Haruhiko Murata, Kazuhiro Hotta

entry.summary: SVD-ViT uses singular value decomposition to extract and aggregate foreground-capturing singular vectors, suppressing background noise in Vision Transformers.

entry.title: FSOD-VFM: Few-Shot Object Detection with Vision Foundation Models and Graph Diffusion

author.name: Chen-Bin Feng, Youyang Sha, Longfei Liu, Yongjun Yu, Chi Man Vong, Xuanlong Yu, Xi Shen

entry.summary: FSOD-VFM combines SAM2, DINOv2, and graph diffusion for few-shot object detection, addressing overfragmentation in foundation model proposals.

entry.title: BinaryDemoire: Moir\'e-Aware Binarization for Image Demoir\'eing

author.name: Zheng Chen, Zhi Yang, Xiaoyang Liu, Weihang Zhang, Mengfan Wang, Yifan Fu, Linghe Kong, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: BinaryDemoire applies extreme 1-bit quantization to image demoireing with moire-aware binary gates that leverage frequency structure of degradations.

entry.title: From Single Scan to Sequential Consistency: A New Paradigm for LIDAR Relocalization

author.name: Minghang Zhu, Zhijing Wang, Yuxin Guo, Wen Li, Sheng Ao, Cheng Wang

entry.summary: TempLoc improves LiDAR relocalization robustness by modeling sequential consistency through global coordinate estimation and inter-frame correspondence attention.

entry.title: Inlier-Centric Post-Training Quantization for Object Detection Models

author.name: Minsu Kim, Dongyeun Lee, Jaemyung Yu, Jiwan Hur, Giseop Kim, Junmo Kim

entry.summary: InlierQ proposes inlier-centric post-training quantization for object detection that separates anomalous activations from informative inliers using gradient-based criteria.

entry.title: See-through: Single-image Layer Decomposition for Anime Characters

author.name: Jian Lin, Chengze Li, Haoyun Qin, Kwun Wang Chan, Yanghua Jin, Hanyuan Liu, Stephen Chun Wang Choy, Xueting Liu

entry.summary: See-through automates transformation of anime illustrations into 2.5D models by decomposing images into inpainted semantic layers with inferred drawing orders.

entry.title: Progressive Checkerboards for Autoregressive Multiscale Image Generation

author.name: David Eigen

entry.summary: Examines progressive checkerboards for multiscale autoregressive image generation, enabling parallel sampling while maintaining dependencies. Shows intriguing patterns where semantics emerge bottom-up within scales but top-down between scales.

entry.title: WebSplatter: Enabling Cross-Device Efficient Gaussian Splatting in Web Browsers via WebGPU

author.name: Yudong Han, Chao Xu, Xiaodan Ye, Weichen Bi, Zilong Dong, Yun Ma

entry.summary: Introduces WebSplatter, an efficient GPU rendering pipeline for 3D Gaussian Splatting in web browsers using WebGPU. Achieves 1.2-4.5x speedups through wait-free hierarchical radix sort and opacity-aware culling.

entry.title: Depth Completion in Unseen Field Robotics Environments Using Extremely Sparse Depth Measurements

author.name: Marco Job, Thomas Stastny, Eleni Kelasidi, Roland Siegwart, Michael Pantic

entry.summary: Proposes depth completion model training on synthetic data using extremely sparse depth measurements for field robotics. Addresses scale ambiguity and low-texture challenges.

entry.title: Learning-based Initialization of Trajectory Optimization for Path-following Problems of Redundant Manipulators

author.name: Minsung Yoon, Mincheul Kang, Daehyung Park, Sung-Eui Yoon

entry.summary: Proposes learning-based initial trajectory generation for redundant manipulator path-following using example-guided RL and null-space projected imitation.

entry.title: Multi-Player, Multi-Strategy Quantum Game Model for Interaction-Aware Decision-Making in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Karim Essalmi, Fernando Garrido, Fawzi Nashashibi

entry.summary: Proposes Quantum Game Decision-Making model for autonomous driving combining classical game theory with quantum mechanics principles. Handles irrational human behavior through superposition and entanglement.

entry.title: Towards Considerate Embodied AI: Co-Designing Situated Multi-Site Healthcare Robots from Abstract Concepts to High-Fidelity Prototypes

author.name: Yuanchen Bai, Ruixiang Han, Niti Parikh, Wendy Ju, Angelique Taylor

entry.summary: Conducts 14-week co-design workshop with 22 participants designing embodied AI for three healthcare settings. Advances from abstract concepts to high-fidelity prototypes.

entry.title: Concrete research ideas on AI personas

author.name: nielsrolf

entry.summary: Presents concrete research agenda for understanding how AI personas emerge in LLMs, including work on goal misgeneralization, evaluating AI self-concepts, and basic science of personas. Seeks collaborators and feedback on research directions.

entry.title: Design international AI projects with DAID in mind

author.name: wdmacaskill

entry.summary: Proposes that international AI governance projects should incorporate Differential AI Development (DAID) - accelerating beneficial/safety-relevant capabilities while limiting dangerous ones, rather than uniformly restricting frontier development.

entry.title: Increasing AI Strategic Competence as a Safety Approach

author.name: Wei Dai

entry.summary: Wei Dai proposes increasing AI strategic competence as a safety approach: sufficiently strategic AIs might realize recursive self-improvement is too dangerous and help implement AI pause. Alternative to pure philosophical competence approach.

entry.title: SOPRAG: Multi-view Graph Experts Retrieval for Industrial Standard Operating Procedures

author.name: Liangtao Lin, Zhaomeng Zhu, Tianwei Zhang, Yonggang Wen

entry.summary: SOPRAG uses mixture-of-experts style graph retrieval for Standard Operating Procedures, combining Entity, Causal, and Flow graph experts to handle industrial structural and logical complexities.

entry.title: Orchestrating Heterogeneous Experts: A Scalable MoE Framework with Anisotropy-Preserving Fusion

author.name: Ye Liu, Xu Chen, Wuji Chen, Mang Li

entry.summary: Proposes a coarse-grained Mixture-of-Experts framework for cross-border e-commerce search that orchestrates heterogeneous open-source LLMs (Qwen, Gemma) to handle linguistic diversity without expensive pre-training.

entry.title: Explore Brain-Inspired Machine Intelligence for Connecting Dots on Graphs Through Holographic Blueprint of Oscillatory Synchronization

author.name: Tingting Dan, Jiaqi Ding, Guorong Wu

entry.summary: Proposes HoloBrain modeling brain rhythms through synchronized neural oscillations, then HoloGraph applying these principles to graph learning as brain-inspired machine intelligence.

entry.title: From Numbers to Prompts: A Cognitive Symbolic Transition Mechanism for Lightweight Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Namkyung Yoon, Hwangnam Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Symbolic Transition Mechanism bridging numeric time series and LLMs through cognitive-inspired quantization into symbol tokens, enabling lightweight prompt-based predictions.

entry.title: 1S-DAug: One-Shot Data Augmentation for Robust Few-Shot Generalization

author.name: Yunwei Bai, Ying Kiat Tan, Yao Shu, Tsuhan Chen

entry.summary: Introduces 1S-DAug, a one-shot generative augmentation for few-shot learning using diffusion denoising conditioned on original image, improving FSL across standard benchmarks as training-free plugin.

entry.title: Action-Free Offline-to-Online RL via Discretised State Policies

author.name: Natinael Solomon Neggatu, Jeremie Houssineau, Giovanni Montana

entry.summary: Formalizes action-free offline-to-online RL where agents learn from (s,r,s') tuples without action labels. Proposes state discretization and Offline State-Only DecQN for pre-training state policies.

entry.title: Multi-Objective Multi-Fidelity Bayesian Optimization with Causal Priors

author.name: Md Abir Hossen, Mohammad Ali Javidian, Vignesh Narayanan, Jason M. O'Kane, Pooyan Jamshidi

entry.summary: Proposes RESCUE, incorporating causal calculus into multi-fidelity Bayesian optimization to handle poorly aligned low-fidelity proxies. Addresses limitation of existing MFBO methods.

entry.title: DeALOG: Decentralized Multi-Agents Log-Mediated Reasoning Framework

author.name: Abhijit Chakraborty, Ashish Raj Shekhar, Shiven Agarwal, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces DeALOG, decentralized multi-agent framework for multimodal QA using shared natural-language log memory. Specialized agents collaborate without central control.

entry.title: Physics Informed Generative AI Enabling Labour Free Segmentation For Microscopy Analysis

author.name: Salma Zahran, Zhou Ao, Zhengyang Zhang, Chen Chi, Chenchen Yuan, Yanming Wang

entry.summary: Framework using phase-field simulations and generative AI to enable label-free semantic segmentation of microscopy images, bridging simulation-to-reality gap.

entry.title: Towards Exploratory and Focused Manipulation with Bimanual Active Perception: A New Problem, Benchmark and Strategy

author.name: Yuxin He, Ruihao Zhang, Tianao Shen, Cheng Liu, Qiang Nie

entry.summary: Introduces Exploratory and Focused Manipulation problem and EFM-10 benchmark for bimanual active perception, addressing visual occlusion in manipulation tasks.

entry.title: Self-Evolving Coordination Protocol in Multi-Agent AI Systems: An Exploratory Systems Feasibility Study

author.name: Jose Manuel de la Chica Rodriguez, Juan Manuel Vera D\'iaz

entry.summary: Presents a feasibility study of Self-Evolving Coordination Protocols (SECP) for multi-agent systems that permit limited self-modification while preserving formal invariants for safety-critical domains.

entry.title: Generating Physically Sound Designs from Text and a Set of Physical Constraints

author.name: Gregory Barber, Todd C. Henry, Mulugeta A. Haile

entry.summary: Presents TIDES, a text-informed design approach that jointly optimizes structural topology and visual properties using pretrained text-image models with differentiable physics simulation.

entry.title: UNSO: Unified Newton Schulz Orthogonalization

author.name: Chen Hu, Qianxi Zhao, Yuming Li, Mingyu Zhou, Xiyin Li

entry.summary: Proposes UNSO, a unified Newton-Schulz orthogonalization framework that consolidates iterative structures for improved efficiency in the Muon optimizer and Stiefel manifold optimization.

entry.title: Beyond Experience Retrieval: Learning to Generate Utility-Optimized Structured Experience for Frozen LLMs

author.name: Xuancheng Li, Haitao Li, Yujia Zhou, Yiqun Liu, Qingyao Ai

entry.summary: SEAM is a lightweight adapter that stores experience in parameters and generates structured, instance-tailored experience for frozen LLM executors, trained via GRPO rollouts.

entry.title: A Reduction from Delayed to Immediate Feedback for Online Convex Optimization with Improved Guarantees

author.name: Alexander Ryabchenko, Idan Attias, Daniel M. Roy

entry.summary: Reduction-based framework for online learning with delayed feedback using continuous-time model. Achieves state-of-the-art regret bounds for bandit convex optimization with simpler unified analysis.

entry.title: From Tokens to Numbers: Continuous Number Modeling for SVG Generation

author.name: Michael Ogezi, Martin Bell, Freda Shi, Ethan Smith

entry.summary: Proposes Continuous Number Modeling (CNM) for SVG generation that treats numerical parameters as first-class continuous values rather than discrete tokens. Shows faster training, improved accuracy, and better generalization.

entry.title: Manifold-Constrained Energy-Based Transition Models for Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zeyu Fang, Zuyuan Zhang, Mahdi Imani, Tian Lan

entry.summary: Proposes MC-ETM using energy-based transition models with manifold projection for offline RL. Generates near-manifold hard negatives to sharpen energy landscape and improve OOD sensitivity.

entry.title: SAFE-KD: Risk-Controlled Early-Exit Distillation for Vision Backbones

author.name: Salim Khazem

entry.summary: Proposes SAFE-KD combining multi-exit knowledge distillation with conformal risk control for vision backbones, providing guarantees on selective misclassification risk for early exits.

entry.title: MemCast: Memory-Driven Time Series Forecasting with Experience-Conditioned Reasoning

author.name: Xiaoyu Tao, Mingyue Cheng, Ze Guo, Shuo Yu, Yaguo Liu, Qi Liu, Shijin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes MemCast for time series forecasting using LLMs with hierarchical memory organizing experience as patterns, reasoning wisdom, and general laws, enabling experience-conditioned reasoning.

entry.title: Live or Lie: Action-Aware Capsule Multiple Instance Learning for Risk Assessment in Live Streaming Platforms

author.name: Yiran Qiao, Jing Chen, Xiang Ao, Qiwei Zhong, Yang Liu, Qing He

entry.summary: Formulates live streaming risk assessment as Multiple Instance Learning with user-timeslot capsules, addressing weak supervision challenge where only room-level labels are available.

entry.title: GASTON: Graph-Aware Social Transformer for Online Networks

author.name: Olha Wloch, Liam Hebert, Robin Cohen, Lukasz Golab

entry.summary: GASTON learns text and user embeddings grounded in local community norms using contrastive pretraining on user membership patterns before processing text.

entry.title: Rethinking Test-Time Training: Tilting The Latent Distribution For Few-Shot Source-Free Adaptation

author.name: Tahir Qasim Syed, Behraj Khan

entry.summary: Proposes training-free test-time adaptation via exponential tilting of latent embedding distribution using support set task-similarity scores.

entry.title: Assessing the Impact of Typological Features on Multilingual Machine Translation in the Age of Large Language Models

author.name: Vitalii Hirak, Jaap Jumelet, Arianna Bisazza

entry.summary: Analyzes how typological features affect translation quality in NLLB-200 and Tower+ models, finding target language typology drives quality for both encoder-decoder and decoder-only MT.

entry.title: They Said Memes Were Harmless-We Found the Ones That Hurt: Decoding Jokes, Symbols, and Cultural References

author.name: Sahil Tripathi, Gautam Siddharth Kashyap, Mehwish Nasim, Jian Yang, Jiechao Gao, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: CROSS-ALIGN+ is a three-stage framework for meme abuse detection that integrates knowledge graphs, reduces satire/abuse ambiguity, and provides interpretable reasoning.

entry.title: FARTrack: Fast Autoregressive Visual Tracking with High Performance

author.name: Guijie Wang, Tong Lin, Yifan Bai, Anjia Cao, Shiyi Liang, Wangbo Zhao, Xing Wei

entry.summary: FARTrack achieves fast autoregressive visual tracking through task-specific self-distillation and inter-frame autoregressive sparsification for efficiency.

entry.title: Multi-Resolution Alignment for Voxel Sparsity in Camera-Based 3D Semantic Scene Completion

author.name: Zhiwen Yang, Yuxin Peng

entry.summary: MRA addresses voxel sparsity in camera-based 3D scene completion through multi-resolution alignment to improve optimization efficiency.

entry.title: Quasi-multimodal-based pathophysiological feature learning for retinal disease diagnosis

author.name: Lu Zhang, Huizhen Yu, Zuowei Wang, Fu Gui, Yatu Guo, Wei Zhang, Mengyu Jia

entry.summary: Proposes quasi-multimodal framework for retinal disease diagnosis synthesizing FFA, MSI, and saliency maps for unified classification and grading.

entry.title: Hierarchical Proportion Models for Motion Generation via Integration of Motion Primitives

author.name: Yu-Han Shu, Toshiaki Tsuji, Sho Sakaino

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical imitation learning framework integrating motion primitives with proportion-based synthesis. Upper layer performs planning while lower layers learn individual primitives.

entry.title: Manipulation via Force Distribution at Contact

author.name: Haegu Lee, Yitaek Kim, Casper Hewson Rask, Christoffer Sloth

entry.summary: Introduces Force-Distributed Line Contact model for manipulation, comparing against point contact models. Uses bi-level optimization for contact force distribution.

entry.title: Human-in-the-Loop Failure Recovery with Adaptive Task Allocation

author.name: Lorena Maria Genua, Nikita Boguslavskii, Zhi Li

entry.summary: Proposes ARFA for adaptive allocation of robot failures to human operators. Models operator capabilities and continuously adapts allocation to minimize workload and task disruption.

entry.title: Stationarity and Spectral Characterization of Random Signals on Simplicial Complexes

author.name: Madeline Navarro, Andrei Buciulea, Santiago Segarra, Antonio Marques

entry.summary: Proposes probabilistic framework for random signals on simplicial complexes extending graph signal processing to topological spaces. Characterizes stationarity for signals on higher-order structures.

entry.title: DomusFM: A Foundation Model for Smart-Home Sensor Data

author.name: Michele Fiori, Gabriele Civitarese, Flora D. Salim, Claudio Bettini

entry.summary: DomusFM is a foundation model for smart-home binary sensor data, addressing the sparse, discrete nature of home sensors distinct from inertial sensor data used in existing activity recognition models.

entry.title: Synthetic Student Responses: LLM-Extracted Features for IRT Difficulty Parameter Estimation

author.name: Matias Hoyl

entry.summary: Investigates using LLM-extracted features (solution steps, cognitive complexity, misconceptions) combined with neural networks to estimate IRT difficulty parameters without traditional student pre-testing.

entry.title: The Impact of Machine Learning Uncertainty on the Robustness of Counterfactual Explanations

author.name: Leonidas Christodoulou, Chang Sun

entry.summary: Investigates robustness of counterfactual explanations under model and data uncertainty, finding explanations are highly sensitive to uncertainty even with small perturbations.

entry.title: VDE Bench: Evaluating The Capability of Image Editing Models to Modify Visual Documents

author.name: Hongzhu Yi, Yujia Yang, Yuanxiang Wang, Zhenyu Guan, Jiahuan Chen, Chenxi Bao, Tiankun Yang, Yixuan Yuan, Tianyu Zong, Xinming Wang, Tao Yu, Ruiwen Tao, Haijin Liang, Jin Ma, Jinwen Luo, Yeshani Xinyu Zuo, Jungang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes VDE Bench for visual document image editing evaluation, addressing gap in editing Chinese text and dense structured documents while preserving original style and context.

entry.title: DIAMOND: Directed Inference for Artifact Mitigation in Flow Matching Models

author.name: Alicja Polowczyk, Agnieszka Polowczyk, Piotr Borycki, Joanna Waczy\'nska, Jacek Tabor, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek

entry.summary: Proposes DIAMOND, training-free trajectory correction method for artifact mitigation in flow matching models like FLUX. Intervenes during inference without model modification.

entry.title: SEDformer: Event-Synchronous Spiking Transformers for Irregular Telemetry Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Ziyu Zhou, Yuchen Fang, Weilin Ruan, Shiyu Wang, James Kwok, Yuxuan Liang

entry.summary: Introduces SEDformer, a spiking transformer architecture for irregular multivariate time series that exploits the sparsity-event duality property where observations cluster in dense bursts.

entry.title: A Large-Scale Dataset for Molecular Structure-Language Description via a Rule-Regularized Method

author.name: Feiyang Cai, Guijuan He, Yi Hu, Jingjing Wang, Joshua Luo, Tianyu Zhu, Srikanth Pilla, Gang Li, Ling Liu, Feng Luo

entry.summary: Proposes a fully automated framework for generating molecular structure descriptions at scale using rule-based IUPAC parsing to create structured XML metadata for LLM guidance.

entry.title: PA-MIL: Phenotype-Aware Multiple Instance Learning Guided by Language Prompting and Genotype-to-Phenotype Relationships

author.name: Zekang Yang, Hong Liu, Xiangdong Wang

entry.summary: PA-MIL identifies cancer-related phenotypes from whole-slide images using genotype-phenotype relationships and language-guided learning for ante-hoc interpretable cancer subtyping.

entry.title: TopoPrune: Robust Data Pruning via Unified Latent Space Topology

author.name: Arjun Roy, Prajna G. Malettira, Manish Nagaraj, Kaushik Roy

entry.summary: TopoPrune uses persistent homology for topology-aware data pruning that captures stable intrinsic structure, avoiding instability of geometry-based methods under latent space perturbations.

entry.title: Geometry-Preserving Neural Architectures on Manifolds with Boundary

author.name: Karthik Elamvazhuthi, Shiba Biswal, Kian Rosenblum, Arushi Katyal, Tianli Qu, Grady Ma, Rishi Sonthalia

entry.summary: Proposes unified class of geometry-aware architectures for manifolds with boundary using projected dynamical systems, establishing universal approximation results for constrained neural ODEs.

entry.title: VOILA: Value-of-Information Guided Fidelity Selection for Cost-Aware Multimodal Question Answering

author.name: Rahul Atul Bhope, K. R. Jayaram, Vinod Muthusamy, Ritesh Kumar, Vatche Isahagian, Nalini Venkatasubramanian

entry.summary: VOILA uses value-of-information framework to select minimum-cost visual fidelity for VQA, predicting correctness likelihood from question features alone.

entry.title: Cognitively Diverse Multiple-Choice Question Generation: A Hybrid Multi-Agent Framework with Large Language Models

author.name: Yu Tian, Linh Huynh, Katerina Christhilf, Shubham Chakraborty, Micah Watanabe, Tracy Arner, Danielle McNamara

entry.summary: ReQUESTA is a multi-agent framework for generating cognitively diverse MCQs targeting text-based, inferential, and main idea comprehension using specialized LLM agents.

entry.title: Omnidirectional Solid-State mmWave Radar Perception for UAV Power Line Collision Avoidance

author.name: Nicolaj Haarh{\o}j Malle, Emad Ebeid

entry.summary: Presents omnidirectional mmWave radar system for UAV power line detection and collision avoidance. Integrates multiple solid-state modules for spherical sensing coverage.

entry.title: LLM-Driven Ontology Construction for Enterprise Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Abdulsobur Oyewale, Tommaso Soru

entry.summary: OntoEKG is an LLM-driven pipeline for generating domain-specific ontologies from unstructured enterprise data, using extraction and entailment modules to create RDF-serialized hierarchies.

entry.title: LingLanMiDian: Systematic Evaluation of LLMs on TCM Knowledge and Clinical Reasoning

author.name: Rui Hua, Yu Wei, Zixin Shu, Kai Chang, Dengying Yan, Jianan Xia, Zeyu Liu, Hui Zhu, Shujie Song, Mingzhong Xiao, Xiaodong Li, Dongmei Jia, Zhuye Gao, Yanyan Meng, Naixuan Zhao, Yu Fu, Haibin Yu, Benman Yu, Yuanyuan Chen, Fei Dong, Zhizhou Meng, Pengcheng Yang, Songxue Zhao, Lijuan Pei, Yunhui Hu, Kan Ding, Jiayuan Duan, Wenmao Yin, Yang Gu, Runshun Zhang, Qiang Zhu, Jian Yu, Jiansheng Li, Baoyan Liu, Wenjia Wang, Xuezhong Zhou

entry.summary: LingLanMiDian presents a large-scale benchmark for evaluating LLMs on Traditional Chinese Medicine across knowledge recall, reasoning, extraction, and clinical decision-making with consistent metrics.

entry.title: Federated Learning With Individualized Privacy Through Client Sampling

author.name: Lucas Lange, Ole Borchardt, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Adapts the SAMPLE algorithm from centralized settings to enable Individualized Differential Privacy in Federated Learning, allowing clients to set personal privacy preferences through client-specific sampling rates.

entry.title: What Artificial Intelligence can do for High-Performance Computing systems?

author.name: Pierrick Pochelu, Hyacinthe Cartiaux, Julien Schleich

entry.summary: Reviews ~1,800 publications (2019-2025) on AI applications for HPC systems, identifying 74 relevant papers across performance estimation, optimization, scheduling, surrogate modeling, fault detection, and LLM automation.

entry.title: AI-assisted Protocol Information Extraction For Improved Accuracy and Efficiency in Clinical Trial Workflows

author.name: Ramtin Babaeipour, Fran\c{c}ois Charest, Madison Wright

entry.summary: Evaluates AI system using LLMs with RAG for clinical trial protocol information extraction, achieving 87.8% accuracy and demonstrating operational efficiency improvements in simulated workflows.

entry.title: Modality as Heterogeneity: Node Splitting and Graph Rewiring for Multimodal Graph Learning

author.name: Yihan Zhang, Ercan E. Kuruoglu

entry.summary: Proposes NSG-MoE for multimodal graph learning that decomposes nodes into modality-specific components with relation-aware experts, addressing modality confusion in heterogeneous message flows.

entry.title: IC-EO: Interpretable Code-based assistant for Earth Observation

author.name: Lamia Lahouel, Laurynas Lopata, Simon Gruening, Gabriele Meoni, Gaetan Petit, Sylvain Lobry

entry.summary: Proposes IC-EO, a code-generating conversational agent for Earth Observation that transforms natural language queries into executable Python workflows over unified API for classification, segmentation, and detection.

entry.title: Joint Continual Learning of Local Language Models and Cloud Offloading Decisions with Budget Constraints

author.name: Evan Chen, Wenzhi Fang, Shiqiang Wang, Christopher Brinton

entry.summary: DA-GRPO enables joint learning of local SLM competence and cloud LLM offloading decisions under budget constraints. Addresses catastrophic forgetting and unstable offloading in continual learning settings.

entry.title: CamReasoner: Reinforcing Camera Movement Understanding via Structured Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Hang Wu, Yujun Cai, Zehao Li, Haonan Ge, Bowen Sun, Junsong Yuan, Yiwei Wang

entry.summary: CamReasoner reformulates camera movement understanding as structured inference using Observation-Thinking-Answer paradigm, compelling models to decode spatio-temporal cues within explicit reasoning blocks.

entry.title: Semantic-Aware Advanced Persistent Threat Detection Using Autoencoders on LLM-Encoded System Logs

author.name: Waleed Khan Mohammed, Zahirul Arief Irfan Bin Shahrul Anuar, Mousa Sufian Mousa Mitani, Hezerul Abdul Karim, Nouar AlDahoul

entry.summary: Proposes APT detection using LLM-generated semantic embeddings from system logs combined with autoencoders for anomaly detection, capturing semantic intent missed by statistical methods.

entry.title: Tri-LLM Cooperative Federated Zero-Shot Intrusion Detection with Semantic Disagreement and Trust-Aware Aggregation

author.name: Saeid Jamshidi, Omar Abdul Wahab, Foutse Khomh, Kawser Wazed Nafi

entry.summary: Federated IDS framework using three cooperative LLMs with semantic supervision, uncertainty estimation, and trust-aware aggregation for zero-shot detection of unseen attacks.

entry.title: Intelligent Reasoning Cues: A Framework and Case Study of the Roles of AI Information in Complex Decisions

author.name: Venkatesh Sivaraman, Eric P. Mason, Mengfan Ellen Li, Jessica Tong, Andrew J. King, Jeremy M. Kahn, Adam Perer

entry.summary: Framework for understanding AI decision support as collections of reasoning cues that individually influence clinical decision-making, validated through contextual inquiries with ICU teams treating sepsis.

entry.title: Opportunistic Promptable Segmentation: Leveraging Routine Radiological Annotations to Guide 3D CT Lesion Segmentation

author.name: Samuel Church, Joshua D. Warner, Danyal Maqbool, Xin Tie, Junjie Hu, Meghan G. Lubner, Tyler J. Bradshaw

entry.summary: Proposes extracting sparse radiologist annotations (line measurements, arrows) from PACS to generate 3D segmentations using promptable segmentation models, reducing annotation costs.

entry.title: A Conditional Companion: Lived Experiences of People with Mental Health Disorders Using LLMs

author.name: Aditya Kumar Purohit, Hendrik Heuer

entry.summary: Qualitative study of 20 people with mental health conditions using LLMs for support, finding conditional engagement patterns driven by immediacy, non-judgement, and self-paced disclosure.

entry.title: Quality-Diversity Optimization as Multi-Objective Optimization

author.name: Xi Lin, Ping Guo, Yilu Liu, Qingfu Zhang, Jianyong Sun

entry.summary: Reformulates Quality-Diversity optimization as multi-objective optimization with many objectives, enabling adoption of established MOO algorithms like decomposition methods.

entry.title: Sparse Shortcuts: Facilitating Efficient Fusion in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Jingrui Zhang, Feng Liang, Yong Zhang, Wei Wang, Runhao Zeng, Xiping Hu

entry.summary: SparseCut enables efficient multimodal fusion by integrating mid- and low-level visual features into LLMs, addressing information loss from using only high-level features.

entry.title: MoDEx: Mixture of Depth-specific Experts for Multivariate Long-term Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Hyekyung Yoon, Minhyuk Lee, Imseung Park, Myungjoo Kang

entry.summary: Introduces layer sensitivity metric and MoDEx architecture with depth-specific expert specialization for multivariate time series forecasting. Shows different layers specialize in modeling distinct temporal dynamics.

entry.title: Controlling Repetition in Protein Language Models

author.name: Jiahao Zhang, Zeqing Zhang, Di Wang, Lijie Hu

entry.summary: Addresses pathological repetition in protein language models by proposing UCCS (Utility-Controlled Contrastive Steering). Demonstrates negative impact of repetition on folding reliability.

entry.title: Multimodal Scientific Learning Beyond Diffusions and Flows

author.name: Leonardo Ferreira Guilhoto, Akshat Kaushal, Paris Perdikaris

entry.summary: Argues Mixture Density Networks provide principled alternative to diffusion/flow methods for multimodal uncertainty in scientific ML. Shows MDNs suited for low-dimensional structured problems.

entry.title: HERMES: A Holistic End-to-End Risk-Aware Multimodal Embodied System with Vision-Language Models for Long-Tail Autonomous Driving

author.name: Weizhe Tang, Junwei You, Jiaxi Liu, Zhaoyi Wang, Rui Gan, Zilin Huang, Feng Wei, Bin Ran

entry.summary: Proposes HERMES, risk-aware VLM-based autonomous driving framework for long-tail scenarios. Uses foundation-model-assisted annotation for structured risk context.

entry.title: Unifying Ranking and Generation in Query Auto-Completion via Retrieval-Augmented Generation and Multi-Objective Alignment

author.name: Kai Yuan, Anthony Zheng, Jia Hu, Divyanshu Sheth, Hemanth Velaga, Kylee Kim, Matteo Guarrera, Besim Avci, Jianhua Li, Xuetao Yin, Rajyashree Mukherjee, Sean Suchter

entry.summary: Unifies ranking and generation in query auto-completion through RAG and multi-objective DPO. Addresses hallucination and safety risks while handling long-tail queries.

entry.title: Personality Expression Across Contexts: Linguistic and Behavioral Variation in LLM Agents

author.name: Bin Han, Deuksin Kwon, Jonathan Gratch

entry.summary: Studies how identical personality prompts in LLMs lead to different behavioral expressions across conversational contexts (ice-breaking, negotiation, empathy tasks). Examines whether variations reflect inconsistency or context-sensitive adaptation.

entry.title: Learning from Anonymized and Incomplete Tabular Data

author.name: Lucas Lange, Adrian B\"ottinger, Victor Christen, Anushka Vidanage, Peter Christen, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Proposes novel data transformation strategies for learning from heterogeneously anonymized tabular data where records mix original, generalized, and missing values. Addresses privacy-preserving ML challenges.

entry.title: Sample Efficient Active Algorithms for Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Soumyadeep Roy, Shashwat Kushwaha, Ambedkar Dukkipati

entry.summary: Develops rigorous sample-complexity analysis for Active Reinforcement Learning through Gaussian Process uncertainty modeling, providing theoretical bounds for offline-to-online RL transitions.

entry.title: From Pragmas to Partners: A Symbiotic Evolution of Agentic High-Level Synthesis

author.name: Niansong Zhang, Sunwoo Kim, Shreesha Srinath, Zhiru Zhang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing HLS remains essential in the agentic AI era, serving as practical abstraction layer for agentic hardware optimization with faster iteration cycles than RTL.

entry.title: OpInf-LLM: Parametric PDE Solving with LLMs via Operator Inference

author.name: Zhuoyuan Wang, Hanjiang Hu, Xiyu Deng, Saviz Mowlavi, Yorie Nakahira

entry.summary: Proposes OpInf-LLM combining LLMs with operator inference for parametric PDE solving. Addresses generalization to unseen parameters and boundary conditions through principled framework.

entry.title: White-Box Neural Ensemble for Vehicular Plasticity: Quantifying the Efficiency Cost of Symbolic Auditability in Adaptive NMPC

author.name: Enzo Nicolas Spotorno, Matheus Wagner, Antonio Augusto Medeiros Frohlich

entry.summary: Presents white-box adaptive NMPC architecture using symbolic graph in CasADi for full auditability. Quantifies transparency cost: 72-102X latency increase versus compiled models.

entry.title: Making Avatars Interact: Towards Text-Driven Human-Object Interaction for Controllable Talking Avatars

author.name: Youliang Zhang, Zhengguang Zhou, Zhentao Yu, Ziyao Huang, Teng Hu, Sen Liang, Guozhen Zhang, Ziqiao Peng, Shunkai Li, Yi Chen, Zixiang Zhou, Yuan Zhou, Qinglin Lu, Xiu Li

entry.summary: Proposes InteractAvatar framework for generating talking avatars with grounded human-object interaction, using dual-stream architecture separating perception/planning from video synthesis.

entry.title: DREAMS: A Social Exchange Theory-Informed Modeling of Misinformation Engagement on Social Media

author.name: Lin Tian, Marian-Andrei Rizoiu

entry.summary: Introduces DREAMS framework for modeling misinformation engagement on social media, guided by social exchange theory. Uses disentangled representations and episodic adaptive modeling.

entry.title: Spectral Text Fusion: A Frequency-Aware Approach to Multimodal Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Huu Hiep Nguyen, Minh Hoang Nguyen, Dung Nguyen, Hung Le

entry.summary: Proposes SpecTF for multimodal time series forecasting using spectral decomposition to align textual features with different frequency components capturing short-term changes and long-term trends.

entry.title: TABX: A High-Throughput Sandbox Battle Simulator for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hayeong Lee, JunHyeok Oh, Byung-Jun Lee

entry.summary: TABX provides a JAX-based high-throughput multi-agent battle simulator enabling massive GPU parallelization for MARL research. Offers granular control for systematic investigation of emergent behaviors.

entry.title: One Size, Many Fits: Aligning Diverse Group-Wise Click Preferences in Large-Scale Advertising Image Generation

author.name: Shuo Lu, Haohan Wang, Wei Feng, Weizhen Wang, Shen Zhang, Yaoyu Li, Ao Ma, Zheng Zhang, Jingjing Lv, Junjie Shen, Ching Law, Bing Zhan, Yuan Xu, Huizai Yao, Yongcan Yu, Chenyang Si, Jian Liang

entry.summary: OSMF framework aligns diverse group-wise click preferences in advertising image generation via product-aware adaptive grouping and collective preference features.

entry.title: Auto-Comp: An Automated Pipeline for Scalable Compositional Probing of Contrastive Vision-Language Models

author.name: Cristian Sbrolli, Matteo Matteucci, Toshihiko Yamasaki

entry.summary: Introduces Auto-Comp, an automated pipeline for generating synthetic benchmarks to evaluate compositional reasoning in Vision-Language Models. The system creates paired images with minimal and contextual captions to isolate specific reasoning failures.

entry.title: DCoPilot: Generative AI-Empowered Policy Adaptation for Dynamic Data Center Operations

author.name: Minghao Li, Ruihang Wang, Rui Tan, Yonggang Wen

entry.summary: Introduces DCoPilot, a hybrid framework combining LLMs for high-level policy specification with DRL for execution, enabling adaptive data center operations under dynamic conditions.

entry.title: Unsupervised Physics-Informed Operator Learning through Multi-Stage Curriculum Training

author.name: Paolo Marcandelli, Natansh Mathur, Stefano Markidis, Martina Siena, Stefano Mariani

entry.summary: Proposes multi-stage physics-informed training for neural operators that progressively enforces boundary conditions and interior residuals to achieve stable convergence.

entry.title: Rethinking Generative Recommender Tokenizer: Recsys-Native Encoding and Semantic Quantization Beyond LLMs

author.name: Yu Liang, Zhongjin Zhang, Yuxuan Zhu, Kerui Zhang, Zhiluohan Guo, Wenhang Zhou, Zonqi Yang, Kangle Wu, Yabo Ni, Anxiang Zeng, Cong Fu, Jianxin Wang, Jiazhi Xia

entry.summary: Proposes ReSID, a recommendation-native semantic ID framework that rethinks representation learning and quantization for sequential recommenders from information preservation and predictability perspectives.

entry.title: CADENT: Gated Hybrid Distillation for Sample-Efficient Transfer in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Mahyar Alinejad, Yue Wang, George Atia

entry.summary: CADENT unifies strategic automaton-based knowledge with tactical policy distillation for transfer learning in RL, using experience-gated trust mechanism to balance teacher guidance with student exploration.

entry.title: Learning Consistent Causal Abstraction Networks

author.name: Gabriele D'Acunto, Paolo Di Lorenzo, Sergio Barbarossa

entry.summary: Framework for learning consistent causal abstraction networks using sheaf theory, with Gaussian SCMs and constructive linear causal abstractions optimized via edge-specific Riemannian problems.

entry.title: Entropy-Guided Dynamic Tokens for Graph-LLM Alignment in Molecular Understanding

author.name: Zihao Jing, Qiuhao Zeng, Ruiyi Fang, Yan Sun, Boyu Wang, Pingzhao Hu

entry.summary: EDT-Former generates dynamic tokens aligned with informative molecular patches using entropy guidance, enabling efficient graph-LLM alignment for molecular understanding without LLM fine-tuning.

entry.title: Joint Learning of Hierarchical Neural Options and Abstract World Model

author.name: Wasu Top Piriyakulkij, Wolfgang Lehrach, Kevin Ellis, Kevin Murphy

entry.summary: Proposes AgentOWL which jointly learns an abstract world model and hierarchical neural options in a sample-efficient manner. Demonstrates improved skill acquisition on Object-Centric Atari games compared to model-free baselines.

entry.title: Semantics-Aware Generative Latent Data Augmentation for Learning in Low-Resource Domains

author.name: Jae-Sung Bae, Minje Kim

entry.summary: Proposes GeLDA for data augmentation in low-resource settings using conditional diffusion in foundation model latent space. Generates samples conditioned on auxiliary features to preserve semantic structure.

entry.title: 3D-Learning: Diffusion-Augmented Distributionally Robust Decision-Focused Learning

author.name: Jiaqi Wen, Lei Fan, Jianyi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes 3D-Learning combining diffusion-augmented data generation with distributionally robust decision-focused learning to address OOD challenges in predict-then-optimize pipelines.

entry.title: Function-Space Empirical Bayes Regularisation with Large Vision-Language Model Priors

author.name: Pengcheng Hao, Huaze Tang, Ercan Engin Kuruoglu, Wenbo Ding

entry.summary: Proposes VLM-FS-EB using large vision-language models to generate semantic priors for function-space empirical Bayes regularization in Bayesian deep learning.

entry.title: Information-Theoretic Multi-Model Fusion for Target-Oriented Adaptive Sampling in Materials Design

author.name: Yixuan Zhang, Zhiyuan Li, Weijia He, Mian Dai, Chen Shen, Teng Long, Hongbin Zhang

entry.summary: Presents information-theoretic framework for target-oriented adaptive sampling in materials design, reframing optimization as trajectory discovery with dimension-aware information budgeting.

entry.title: Data-Driven Graph Filters via Adaptive Spectral Shaping

author.name: Dylan Sandfelder, Mihai Cucuringu, Xiaowen Dong

entry.summary: Introduces Adaptive Spectral Shaping for graph filtering that learns reusable spectral kernels with Gaussian modulation, enabling interpretable multi-scale responses. The Transferable variant (TASS) enables few-shot transfer across graphs.

entry.title: Robust Intervention Learning from Emergency Stop Interventions

author.name: Ethan Pronovost, Khimya Khetarpal, Siddhartha Srinivasa

entry.summary: Defines Robust Intervention Learning problem for learning from noisy emergency stop interventions in autonomous systems, proposing RIFT method for fine-tuning.

entry.title: Measuring Individual User Fairness with User Similarity and Effectiveness Disparity

author.name: Theresia Veronika Rampisela, Maria Maistro, Tuukka Ruotsalo, Christina Lioma

entry.summary: Introduces Pairwise User unFairness (PUF) metric that simultaneously accounts for user similarity and recommendation effectiveness disparity, filling gap in individual fairness measures.

entry.title: Eidolon: A Practical Post-Quantum Signature Scheme Based on k-Colorability in the Age of Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Asmaa Cherkaoui, Ramon Flores, Delaram Kahrobaei, Richard Wilson

entry.summary: Eidolon is a post-quantum signature scheme based on k-colorability with first empirical security analysis against GNN attackers, showing hardness for n≥60.

entry.title: DoubleTake: Contrastive Reasoning for Faithful Decision-Making in Medical Imaging

author.name: Daivik Patel, Shrenik Patel

entry.summary: DoubleTake introduces contrastive reference selection for medical imaging that optimizes for discrimination rather than similarity, balancing relevance, diversity, and provenance.

entry.title: Learning Fast Monomial Orders for Gr\"obner Basis Computations

author.name: R. Caleb Bunch, Alperen A. Erg\"ur, Melika Golestani, Jessie Tong, Malia Walewski, Yunus E. Zeytuncu

entry.summary: Casts monomial order selection for Gröbner basis computation as RL problem, showing learned policies outperform static heuristics on benchmark problems.

entry.title: Principled Federated Random Forests for Heterogeneous Data

author.name: R\'emi Khellaf, Erwan Scornet, Aur\'elien Bellet, Julie Josse

entry.summary: Proposes FedForest, a federated Random Forest algorithm for horizontally partitioned data that properly optimizes the global impurity criterion under diverse client heterogeneity, unlike existing heuristic-based federated RF implementations.

entry.title: PACE: Pretrained Audio Continual Learning

author.name: Chang Li, Kanglei Zhou, Liyuan Wang

entry.summary: Presents PACE, the first systematic benchmark for audio continual learning with pretrained models, analyzing why parameter-efficient fine-tuning strategies that work for vision fail for audio due to backbone focus on low-level spectral details.

entry.title: Symbol-Aware Reasoning with Masked Discrete Diffusion for Handwritten Mathematical Expression Recognition

author.name: Takaya Kawakatsu, Ryo Ishiyama

entry.summary: Presents a discrete diffusion framework for handwritten mathematical expression recognition that reformulates HMER as iterative symbolic refinement rather than sequential generation, achieving 5.56% CER on MathWriting benchmark.

entry.title: Generator-based Graph Generation via Heat Diffusion

author.name: Anthony Stephenson, Ian Gallagher, Christopher Nemeth

entry.summary: Proposes a novel graph generation framework adapting Generator Matching to graph-structured data using graph Laplacian and heat kernel for continuous-time diffusion, training a neural network to match the generator.

entry.title: AmharicStoryQA: A Multicultural Story Question Answering Benchmark in Amharic

author.name: Israel Abebe Azime, Abenezer Kebede Angamo, Hana Mekonen Tamiru, Dagnachew Mekonnen Marilign, Philipp Slusallek, Seid Muhie Yimam, Dietrich Klakow

entry.summary: Introduces AmharicStoryQA, a long-sequence story QA benchmark grounded in culturally diverse Ethiopian narratives, demonstrating that region-specific content substantially influences evaluation outcomes within a single language.

entry.title: Act or Clarify? Modeling Sensitivity to Uncertainty and Cost in Communication

author.name: Polina Tsvilodub, Karl Mulligan, Todd Snider, Robert D. Hawkins, Michael Franke

entry.summary: Studies when agents should act despite uncertainty versus ask clarification questions, formalizing the decision using expected regret that captures interaction between contextual uncertainty and action costs.

entry.title: Pursuing Best Industrial Practices for Retrieval-Augmented Generation in the Medical Domain

author.name: Wei Zhu

entry.summary: Analyzes RAG system components for medical domain and proposes practical alternatives, evaluating trade-offs between performance and efficiency across three task types.

entry.title: ACL: Aligned Contrastive Learning Improves BERT and Multi-exit BERT Fine-tuning

author.name: Wei Zhu

entry.summary: ACL introduces aligned contrastive learning that treats label embeddings as augmented samples, resolving conflicts between cross-entropy and contrastive objectives in supervised learning.

entry.title: WST-X Series: Wavelet Scattering Transform for Interpretable Speech Deepfake Detection

author.name: Xi Xuan, Davide Carbone, Ruchi Pandey, Wenxin Zhang, Tomi H. Kinnunen

entry.summary: WST-X uses wavelet scattering transform for interpretable speech deepfake detection, combining hand-crafted transparency with deep feature extraction capabilities.

entry.title: SceneLinker: Compositional 3D Scene Generation via Semantic Scene Graph from RGB Sequences

author.name: Seok-Young Kim, Dooyoung Kim, Woojin Cho, Hail Song, Suji Kang, Woontack Woo

entry.summary: SceneLinker generates compositional 3D scenes from RGB sequences using semantic scene graphs with a graph-VAE architecture. The framework addresses mixed reality content generation by capturing contextual relationships between objects.

entry.title: LSGQuant: Layer-Sensitivity Guided Quantization for One-Step Diffusion Real-World Video Super-Resolution

author.name: Tianxing Wu, Zheng Chen, Cirou Xu, Bowen Chai, Yong Guo, Yutong Liu, Linghe Kong, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: LSGQuant provides layer-sensitivity guided quantization for one-step diffusion video super-resolution with dynamic range adaptive quantization.

entry.title: SLIM-Diff: Shared Latent Image-Mask Diffusion with Lp loss for Data-Scarce Epilepsy FLAIR MRI

author.name: Mario Pascual-Gonz\'alez, Ariadna Jim\'enez-Partinen, R. M. Luque-Baena, F\'atima Nagib-Raya, Ezequiel L\'opez-Rubio

entry.summary: SLIM-Diff proposes compact joint image-mask diffusion for epilepsy MRI with shared bottleneck architecture and tunable Lp loss geometry.

entry.title: Zero-shot large vision-language model prompting for automated bone identification in paleoradiology x-ray archives

author.name: Owen Dong, Lily Gao, Manish Kota, Bennett A. Landmana, Jelena Bekvalac, Gaynor Western, Katherine D. Van Schaik

entry.summary: Demonstrates zero-shot VLM prompting for bone identification in paleoradiology archives, addressing heterogeneous archaeological radiograph collections.

entry.title: RAWDet-7: A Multi-Scenario Benchmark for Object Detection and Description on Quantized RAW Images

author.name: Mishal Fatima, Shashank Agnihotri, Kanchana Vaishnavi Gandikota, Michael Moeller, Margret Keuper

entry.summary: Introduces RAWDet-7, a large-scale dataset of ~25k RAW images across diverse conditions for object detection and description research. RAW images preserve unprocessed sensor data that can be more useful for machine reasoning than ISP-processed RGB images.

entry.title: Real-time topology-aware M-mode OCT segmentation for robotic deep anterior lamellar keratoplasty (DALK) guidance

author.name: Rosalinda Xiong, Jinglun Yu, Yaning Wang, Ziyi Huang, Jin U. Kang

entry.summary: Develops topology-aware M-mode OCT segmentation for robotic deep anterior lamellar keratoplasty guidance. Achieves real-time throughput exceeding 175 fps with anatomical consistency.

entry.title: Modular Isoperimetric Soft Robotic Truss for Lunar Applications

author.name: Mihai Stanciu, Isaac Weaver, Adam Rose, James Wade, Kaden Paxton, Chris Paul, Spencer Stowell, Nathan Usevitch

entry.summary: Introduces modular soft robotic truss for lunar applications using inflated fabric tubes. Achieves 1:18.3 stowed-to-deployed volume ratio with reconfigurable assembly.

entry.title: Deep-Learning-Based Control of a Decoupled Two-Segment Continuum Robot for Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection

author.name: Yuancheng Shao, Yao Zhang, Jia Gu, Zixi Chen, Di Wu, Yuqiao Chen, Bo Lu, Wenjie Liu, Cesare Stefanini, Peng Qi

entry.summary: Develops DESectBot with GRU-based controllers for dual-segment continuum robot in endoscopic submucosal dissection. Handles nonlinear coupling between segments.

entry.title: Fast Near Time-Optimal Motion Planning for Holonomic Vehicles in Structured Environments

author.name: Louis Callens, Bastiaan Vandewal, Ibrahim Ibrahim, Jan Swevers, Wilm Decr\'e

entry.summary: Proposes efficient optimization-based method for near time-optimal trajectory generation for holonomic vehicles using free-space corridors and motion primitives.

entry.title: Culinary Crossroads: A RAG Framework for Enhancing Diversity in Cross-Cultural Recipe Adaptation

author.name: Tianyi Hu, Andrea Morales-Garz\'on, Jingyi Zheng, Maria Maistro, Daniel Hershcovich

entry.summary: Analyzes RAG limitations in creative tasks, finding it overly relies on limited context portions and fails to produce diverse outputs. Proposes improvements for cross-cultural recipe adaptation as a case study.

entry.title: Construct, Align, and Reason: Large Ontology Models for Enterprise Knowledge Management

author.name: Yao Zhang, Hongyin Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Large Ontology Models (LOM) framework for enterprise knowledge management with construct-align-reason pipeline, enabling instruction-aligned reasoning through three-stage training.

entry.title: SITUATE -- Synthetic Object Counting Dataset for VLM training

author.name: Ren\'e Peinl, Vincent Tischler, Patrick Schr\"oder, Christian Groth

entry.summary: Presents SITUATE dataset for training VLMs on counting tasks with spatial constraints, showing fine-tuning improves out-of-distribution generalization on Pixmo count test data.

entry.title: PIMPC-GNN: Physics-Informed Multi-Phase Consensus Learning for Enhancing Imbalanced Node Classification in Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Abdul Joseph Fofanah, Lian Wen, David Chen

entry.summary: PIMPC-GNN combines physics-inspired dynamics (thermodynamic diffusion, Kuramoto synchronization, spectral embedding) for imbalanced node classification in GNNs.

entry.title: LEC-KG: An LLM-Embedding Collaborative Framework for Domain-Specific Knowledge Graph Construction -- A Case Study on SDGs

author.name: Yikai Zeng, Yingchao Piao, Jianhui Li

entry.summary: Presents LEC-KG, a framework combining LLM semantic understanding with knowledge graph embeddings for domain-specific KG construction, featuring hierarchical relation extraction and evidence-guided feedback.

entry.title: Cardinality-Preserving Structured Sparse Graph Transformers for Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Abhijit Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces CardinalGraphFormer, a graph transformer for molecular property prediction using structured sparse attention with cardinality-preserving unnormalized aggregation for improved drug discovery.

entry.title: Learnable Koopman-Enhanced Transformer-Based Time Series Forecasting with Spectral Control

author.name: Ali Forootani, Raffaele Iervolino

entry.summary: Proposes learnable Koopman operator variants (scalar-gated, MLP-shaped, low-rank) for transformers that enable explicit spectral control while maintaining compatibility with Patchtst, Autoformer, Informer.

entry.title: BinaryPPO: Efficient Policy Optimization for Binary Classification

author.name: Punya Syon Pandey, Zhijing Jin

entry.summary: BinaryPPO reformulates binary classification as offline RL reward maximization, using confidence-weighted rewards to handle label noise, class imbalance, and sparse supervision better than SFT.

entry.title: StepScorer: Accelerating Reinforcement Learning with Step-wise Scoring and Psychological Regret Modeling

author.name: Zhe Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Psychological Regret Model transforming sparse rewards into dense feedback by computing regret signal after each step, achieving 36% faster convergence to stable performance.

entry.title: POET: Protocol Optimization via Eligibility Tuning

author.name: Trisha Das, Katherine Kero, Dorinda Schumann, Tracy Ohrt, Sanjit Singh Batra, Gregory D Lyng, Robert E. Tillman

entry.summary: POET framework uses semantic axes (demographics, lab parameters, behavioral factors) to guide LLM generation of clinical trial eligibility criteria, balancing specificity and flexibility.

entry.title: PCBSchemaGen: Constraint-Guided Schematic Design via LLM for Printed Circuit Boards (PCB)

author.name: Huanghaohe Zou, Peng Han, Emad Nazerian, Alex Q. Huang

entry.summary: PCBSchemaGen is first training-free framework for PCB schematic design using LLM agents with constraint-guided synthesis and iterative verification.

entry.title: Small Shifts, Large Gains: Unlocking Traditional TSP Heuristic Guided-Sampling via Unsupervised Neural Instance Modification

author.name: Wei Huang, Hanchen Wang, Dong Wen, Wenjie Zhang

entry.summary: TSP-MDF framework enhances traditional TSP heuristics through unsupervised neural instance modification, enabling guided sampling without ground-truth supervision.

entry.title: Structured Self-Consistency:A Multi-Task Evaluation of LLMs on VirtualHome

author.name: Jiaqi Xu, Tao Huang, Kai Zhang

entry.summary: Structured Self-Consistency (SSC) enhances LLM decoding for embodied AI tasks through domain-specific voting mechanisms for structured generation on VirtualHome benchmark.

entry.title: Engineering AI Agents for Clinical Workflows: A Case Study in Architecture,MLOps, and Governance

author.name: Cl\'audio L\'ucio do Val Lopes, Jo\~ao Marcus Pitta, Fabiano Bel\'em, Gildson Alves, Fl\'avio Vin\'icius Cruzeiro Martins

entry.summary: Industry case study of 'Maria' clinical AI platform presenting four pillars for trustworthy clinical AI: Clean Architecture, Agentic AI, Automated MLOps, and Real-Time Observability.

entry.title: MissMAC-Bench: Building Solid Benchmark for Missing Modality Issue in Robust Multimodal Affective Computing

author.name: Ronghao Lin, Honghao Lu, Ruixing Wu, Aolin Xiong, Qinggong Chu, Qiaolin He, Sijie Mai, Haifeng Hu

entry.summary: MissMAC-Bench benchmark for missing modality issue in multimodal affective computing with unified evaluation standards for robustness under dynamic modality availability.

entry.title: EvoOpt-LLM: Evolving industrial optimization models with large language models

author.name: Yiliu He, Tianle Li, Binghao Ji, Zhiyuan Liu, Di Huang

entry.summary: EvoOpt-LLM framework for industrial MILP optimization supporting full lifecycle: automated model construction, dynamic constraint injection, and end-to-end variable pruning.

entry.title: Synesthesia of Vehicles: Tactile Data Synthesis from Visual Inputs

author.name: Rui Wang, Yaoguang Cao, Yuyi Chen, Jianyi Xu, Zhuoyang Li, Jiachen Shang, Shichun Yang

entry.summary: Proposes visual-to-tactile synthesis framework for autonomous vehicles using latent diffusion to predict road-induced excitations from camera inputs, enabling better dynamic control.

entry.title: Chained Prompting for Better Systematic Review Search Strategies

author.name: Fatima Nasser, Fouad Trad, Ammar Mohanna, Ghada El-Hajj Fuleihan, Ali Chehab

entry.summary: Proposes an LLM-based chained prompt engineering framework for automated systematic review search strategy development, replicating manual design while leveraging LLMs to extract PICO elements.

entry.title: Lightweight Edge Learning via Dataset Pruning

author.name: Laha Ale, Hu Luo, Mingsheng Cao, Shichao Li, Huanlai Xing, Haifeng Sun

entry.summary: Proposes dataset pruning framework for efficient edge learning, optimizing training by removing redundant local data rather than processing all available samples.

entry.title: SPGCL: Simple yet Powerful Graph Contrastive Learning via SVD-Guided Structural Perturbation

author.name: Hao Deng, Zhang Guo, Shuiping Gou, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Proposes SPGCL for robust graph contrastive learning using SVD-guided structural perturbation, integrating structure-aware augmentation with spectral methods.

entry.title: Radiomics in Medical Imaging: Methods, Applications, and Challenges

author.name: Fnu Neha, Deepak kumar Shukla

entry.summary: Provides end-to-end survey of radiomics pipelines analyzing how interdependent design choices across acquisition, preprocessing, feature engineering, modeling, and evaluation affect robustness.

entry.title: Stabilizing Diffusion Posterior Sampling by Noise--Frequency Continuation

author.name: Feng Tian, Yixuan Li, Weili Zeng, Weitian Zhang, Yichao Yan, Xiaokang Yang

entry.summary: Proposes noise-frequency continuation framework for diffusion posterior sampling that constructs intermediate posteriors enforcing measurement consistency only within frequency bands appropriate to the noise level.

entry.title: A Geometric Multimodal Foundation Model Integrating Bp-MRI and Clinical Reports in Prostate Cancer Classification

author.name: Juan A. Olmos, Antoine Manzanera, Fabio Mart\'inez

entry.summary: MFM-Geom is a geometric multimodal foundation model for prostate cancer classification integrating bi-parametric MRI with clinical reports, addressing expert subjectivity and data scarcity.

entry.title: MapDream: Task-Driven Map Learning for Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Guoxin Lian, Shuo Wang, Yucheng Wang, Yongcai Wang, Maiyue Chen, Kaihui Wang, Bo Zhang, Zhizhong Su, Deying Li, Zhaoxin Fan

entry.summary: MapDream formulates map construction for vision-language navigation as autoregressive BEV image synthesis, jointly learning map generation and action prediction in a map-in-the-loop framework.

entry.title: Optimal Transport-Guided Adversarial Attacks on Graph Neural Network-Based Bot Detection

author.name: Kunal Mukherjee, Zulfikar Alom, Tran Gia Bao Ngo, Cuneyt Gurcan Akcora, Murat Kantarcioglu

entry.summary: BOCLOAK uses optimal transport to guide adversarial attacks on GNN-based bot detectors under realistic constraint-aware scenarios including domain-specific and temporal constraints.

entry.title: LatentTrack: Sequential Weight Generation via Latent Filtering

author.name: Omer Haq

entry.summary: LatentTrack performs causal Bayesian filtering in latent space with hypernetwork generating predictive model parameters, enabling constant-time online adaptation without per-step gradients.

entry.title: Words that make SENSE: Sensorimotor Norms in Learned Lexical Token Representations

author.name: Abhinav Gupta, Toben H. Mintz, Jesse Thomason

entry.summary: SENSE predicts Lancaster sensorimotor norms from word embeddings, finding significant correlations between model predictions and human selection of nonce words for sensorimotor associations.

entry.title: Culturally-Grounded Governance for Multilingual Language Models: Rights, Data Boundaries, and Accountable AI Design

author.name: Hanjing Shi, Dominic DiFranzo

entry.summary: Articulates culturally-grounded governance framework for multilingual LLMs addressing systematic risks for low-resource languages and culturally marginalized communities.

entry.title: RecGOAT: Graph Optimal Adaptive Transport for LLM-Enhanced Multimodal Recommendation with Dual Semantic Alignment

author.name: Yuecheng Li, Hengwei Ju, Zeyu Song, Wei Yang, Chi Lu, Peng Jiang, Kun Gai

entry.summary: Proposes RecGOAT using graph optimal transport to bridge representational gap between LLMs and recommendation systems. Addresses incompatibility between semantic and ID-based representations.

entry.title: Towards Multiscale Graph-based Protein Learning with Geometric Secondary Structural Motifs

author.name: Shih-Hsin Wang, Yuhao Huang, Taos Transue, Justin Baker, Jonathan Forstater, Thomas Strohmer, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical graph framework for proteins using secondary structure motifs. Constructs fine-grained subgraphs for motifs and coarse-grained graph connecting them spatially.

entry.title: Offline Discovery of Interpretable Skills from Multi-Task Trajectories

author.name: Chongyu Zhu, Mithun Vanniasinghe, Jiayu Chen, Chi-Guhn Lee

entry.summary: Introduces LOKI for offline skill discovery in hierarchical imitation learning. Uses two-stage weakly supervised segmentation with alignment-enforced VQ-VAE.
