entry.summary: Proposes GVP-WM to ground video-generated plans from large video models into feasible action sequences using learned action-conditioned world models via video-guided latent collocation.

entry.title: Dissecting Outlier Dynamics in LLM NVFP4 Pretraining

author.name: Peijie Dong, Ruibo Fan, Yuechen Tao, Di Mou, Wenhu Hu, Zhenheng Tang, Yinghao Yu, Jiamang Wang, Wenbo Su, Guodong Yang, Liping Zhang, Xiaowen Chu, Baochun Li, Bo Li

entry.summary: Conducts longitudinal analysis of outlier dynamics during LLM NVFP4 pretraining, identifying architectural sources (Softmax, gating) and comparing Linear vs Softmax attention.

entry.title: Safety-Efficacy Trade Off: Robustness against Data-Poisoning

author.name: Diego Granziol

entry.summary: Shows backdoor attacks achieve high success while evading detection due to fundamental geometric mechanism. Proves clustered poisons induce rank-one spike with near-clone regime making attacks undetectable.

entry.title: Making Bias Non-Predictive: Training Robust LLM Judges via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Qian Wang, Xuandong Zhao, Zirui Zhang, Zhanzhi Lou, Nuo Chen, Dawn Song, Bingsheng He

entry.summary: Proposes Epistemic Independence Training (EIT) to make LLM judges robust to cognitive biases via RL where bias cues are made non-predictive of reward through balanced conflict strategy.

entry.title: Sparse Reward Subsystem in Large Language Models

author.name: Guowei Xu, Mert Yuksekgonul, James Zou

entry.summary: Identifies a sparse reward subsystem in LLMs containing 'value neurons' representing state value expectations and 'dopamine neurons' encoding prediction errors, drawing analogy to biological reward systems.

entry.title: Steering Vector Fields for Context-Aware Inference-Time Control in Large Language Models

author.name: Jiaqian Li, Yanshu Li, Kuan-Hao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Steering Vector Fields for context-aware inference-time control, learning locally effective steering directions that vary with activation position rather than using static global vectors.

entry.title: Seeing Is Believing? A Benchmark for Multimodal Large Language Models on Visual Illusions and Anomalies

author.name: Wenjin Hou, Wei Liu, Han Hu, Xiaoxiao Sun, Serena Yeung-Levy, Hehe Fan

entry.summary: Presents VIA-Bench, a benchmark for evaluating MLLMs on visual illusions and anomalies across six categories. Reveals that current models achieving human-level performance on standard benchmarks fail on these edge cases.

entry.title: Do Latent-CoT Models Think Step-by-Step? A Mechanistic Study on Sequential Reasoning Tasks

author.name: Jia Liang, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Mechanistically studies CODI latent CoT model using probes, attention analysis, and activation patching on sequential tasks. Finds intermediate states are formed and fused at end-of-thought boundary, but longer reasoning chains fail.

entry.title: Reasoning and Tool-use Compete in Agentic RL:From Quantifying Interference to Disentangled Tuning

author.name: Yu Li, Mingyang Yi, Xiuyu Li, Ju Fan, Fuxin Jiang, Binbin Chen, Peng Li, Jie Song, Tieying Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces LEAS framework showing reasoning and tool-use capabilities interfere during joint agentic RL training. Proposes disentangled tuning approach based on quantitative analysis of interference patterns.

entry.title: PersistBench: When Should Long-Term Memories Be Forgotten by LLMs?

author.name: Sidharth Pulipaka, Oliver Chen, Manas Sharma, Taaha S Bajwa, Vyas Raina, Ivaxi Sheth

entry.summary: Introduces PersistBench measuring safety risks from persistent long-term memories in conversational AI, identifying cross-domain leakage and memory-induced sycophancy. Evaluates 18 models finding surprisingly high failure rates.

entry.title: Not All Preferences Are Created Equal: Stability-Aware and Gradient-Efficient Alignment for Reasoning Models

author.name: Hui Wu, Hengyi Cai, Jinman Zhao, Xinran Chen, Ziheng Li, Zhejun Zhao, Shuaiqiang Wang, Yuchen Li, Dawei Yin

entry.summary: Proposes SAGE (Stability-Aware Gradient Efficiency), a dynamic framework for preference-based alignment that addresses inefficient training on trivial pairs and noise from uncertain samples by maximizing signal-to-noise ratio of policy updates.

entry.title: Evolving from Tool User to Creator via Training-Free Experience Reuse in Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Xintian Shen, Jiawei Chen, Lihao Zheng, Hao Ma, Tao Wei, Kun Zhan

entry.summary: UCT transforms agents from tool users to tool creators by harvesting problem-solving capabilities from reasoning traces to generate reusable tools without training.

entry.title: Reasoning in a Combinatorial and Constrained World: Benchmarking LLMs on Natural-Language Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Xia Jiang, Jing Chen, Cong Zhang, Jie Gao, Chengpeng Hu, Chenhao Zhang, Yaoxin Wu, Yingqian Zhang

entry.summary: NLCO benchmark evaluates LLMs on end-to-end combinatorial optimization reasoning from natural language, covering 43 problems with taxonomy of variable types, constraint families, and objective classes.

entry.title: Avenir-Web: Human-Experience-Imitating Multimodal Web Agents with Mixture of Grounding Experts

author.name: Aiden Yiliu Li, Xinyue Hao, Shilong Liu, Mengdi Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Avenir-Web, a web agent achieving new open-source SOTA on Online-Mind2Web benchmark through Mixture of Grounding Experts, experience-imitation planning, and task-tracking checklists. Addresses key limitations in autonomous web agents including element grounding and long-horizon task execution.

entry.title: LSSF: Safety Alignment for Large Language Models through Low-Rank Safety Subspace Fusion

author.name: Guanghao Zhou, Panjia Qiu, Cen Chen, Hongyu Li, Mingyuan Chu, Xin Zhang, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces LSSF for LLM safety re-alignment using low-rank projection to extract principal components of safety vectors, enabling efficient safety restoration after fine-tuning without full retraining.

entry.title: CARE-RFT: Confidence-Anchored Reinforcement Finetuning for Reliable Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Jincheng Cao, Bodun Hu, Aryan Mokhtari, Leqi Liu, Amy Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CARE-RFT using skew reverse KL divergence for reinforcement finetuning, providing confidence-sensitive penalty that preserves trustworthiness while enabling reasoning gains.

entry.title: The Illusion of Forgetting: Attack Unlearned Diffusion via Initial Latent Variable Optimization

author.name: Manyi Li, Yufan Liu, Lai Jiang, Bing Li, Yuming Li, Weiming Hu

entry.summary: Demonstrates that diffusion model unlearning is largely illusory - NSFW concepts remain as 'dormant memories'. Proposes IVO attack that reactivates forgotten content by reconstructing broken linguistic mappings.

entry.title: Detecting AI-Generated Content in Academic Peer Reviews

author.name: Siyuan Shen, Kai Wang

entry.summary: Detects AI-generated content in academic peer reviews, finding ~20% of ICLR reviews and ~12% of Nature Communications reviews classified as AI-generated in 2025, with substantial growth post-2022.

entry.title: Physiology as Language: Translating Respiration to Sleep EEG

author.name: Kaiwen Zha, Chao Li, Hao He, Peng Cao, Tianhong Li, Ali Mirzazadeh, Ellen Zhang, Jong Woo Lee, Yoon Kim, Dina Katabi

entry.summary: Introduces a novel task of synthesizing sleep EEG signals from respiration data using a waveform-conditional generative framework. Trained on 28,000+ individuals, achieves 7% MAE in EEG spectrogram reconstruction with downstream task performance comparable to real EEG.

entry.title: JTok: On Token Embedding as another Axis of Scaling Law via Joint Token Self-modulation

author.name: Yebin Yang, Huaijin Wu, Fu Guo, Lin Yao, Xiaohan Qin, Jingzhi Wang, Debing Zhang, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Proposes token-indexed parameters as a novel scaling axis orthogonal to dense dimensions and MoE, decoupling model capacity from FLOPs. JTok augments Transformers with modulation vectors retrieved from auxiliary embedding tables.

entry.title: Statistical MIA: Rethinking Membership Inference Attack for Reliable Unlearning Auditing

author.name: Jialong Sun, Zeming Wei, Jiaxuan Zou, Jiacheng Gong, Guanheng Wang, Chengyang Dong, Jialong Li, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Demonstrates that membership inference attack-based auditing for machine unlearning is flawed—failed detection doesn't imply true forgetting. Proposes reformulation as statistical hypothesis testing.

entry.title: Toward Cognitive Supersensing in Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Boyi Li, Yifan Shen, Yuanzhe Liu, Yifan Xu, Jiateng Liu, Xinzhuo Li, Zhengyuan Li, Jingyuan Zhu, Yunhan Zhong, Fangzhou Lan, Jianguo Cao, James M. Rehg, Heng Ji, Ismini Lourentzou, Xu Cao

entry.summary: Introduces Cognitive Supersensing training paradigm endowing MLLMs with visual imagery capabilities via Latent Visual Imagery Prediction head, enabling mental visualization during reasoning.

entry.title: HuPER: A Human-Inspired Framework for Phonetic Perception

author.name: Chenxu Guo, Jiachen Lian, Yisi Liu, Baihe Huang, Shriyaa Narayanan, Cheol Jun Cho, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: HuPER models phonetic perception as adaptive inference over acoustic-phonetics and linguistic knowledge, achieving SOTA error rates on English benchmarks with only 100 hours of training and strong zero-shot transfer to 95 languages. Open-sourced.

entry.title: Fast Autoregressive Video Diffusion and World Models with Temporal Cache Compression and Sparse Attention

author.name: Dvir Samuel, Issar Tzachor, Matan Levy, Micahel Green, Gal Chechik, Rami Ben-Ari

entry.summary: Identifies three sources of redundancy in autoregressive video diffusion (duplicate keys, slowly evolving queries, sparse prompt attention) and proposes temporal cache compression and sparse attention for efficiency.

entry.title: Spectral Superposition: A Theory of Feature Geometry

author.name: Georgi Ivanov, Narmeen Oozeer, Shivam Raval, Tasana Pejovic, Shriyash Upadhyay, Amir Abdullah

entry.summary: Develops theory for studying geometric structure of features in superposition by analyzing spectra of weight-derived matrices, introducing frame operator for global geometry analysis beyond pairwise interactions.

entry.title: Why Steering Works: Toward a Unified View of Language Model Parameter Dynamics

author.name: Ziwen Xu, Chenyan Wu, Hengyu Sun, Haiwen Hong, Mengru Wang, Yunzhi Yao, Longtao Huang, Hui Xue, Shumin Deng, Zhixuan Chu, Huajun Chen, Ningyu Zhang

entry.summary: Unified framework showing that local weight fine-tuning, LoRA, and activation interventions can all be understood as dynamic weight updates from control signals, with preference-utility analysis on shared log-odds scale.

entry.title: David vs. Goliath: Verifiable Agent-to-Agent Jailbreaking via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Samuel Nellessen, Tal Kachman

entry.summary: Slingshot RL framework discovers agent-to-agent jailbreaking attacks where tool-less adversary exploits trusted agent's tool privileges, revealing attacks converge to short instruction-like patterns.

entry.title: Flow Policy Gradients for Robot Control

author.name: Brent Yi, Hongsuk Choi, Himanshu Gaurav Singh, Xiaoyu Huang, Takara E. Truong, Carmelo Sferrazza, Yi Ma, Rocky Duan, Pieter Abbeel, Guanya Shi, Karen Liu, Angjoo Kanazawa

entry.summary: Shows flow matching policy gradients can effectively train expressive robot policies without requiring differentiable action likelihoods, demonstrating sim-to-real transfer on two humanoid robots.

entry.title: Why LoRA Resists Label Noise: A Theoretical Framework for Noise-Robust Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Brady Steele

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework explaining LoRA's inherent resistance to label noise. Proves rank-r LoRA cannot memorize arbitrary labels beyond O(r(d+k-r)) samples, derives optimal rank balancing bias-variance tradeoff, and shows temporal separation of clean vs noise learning.

entry.title: A Fragile Guardrail: Diffusion LLM's Safety Blessing and Its Failure Mode

author.name: Zeyuan He, Yupeng Chen, Lang Lin, Yihan Wang, Shenxu Chang, Eric Sommerlade, Philip Torr, Junchi Yu, Adel Bibi, Jialin Yu

entry.summary: Analyzes diffusion LLMs' intrinsic safety properties, finding stepwise reduction effect suppressing unsafe generations. Identifies 'context nesting' failure mode where harmful requests embedded in structured benign content bypass safety.

entry.title: Provably Protecting Fine-Tuned LLMs from Training Data Extraction

author.name: Tom Segal, Asaf Shabtai, Yuval Elovici

entry.summary: Proposes SCP-Δr, an algorithm to protect fine-tuned LLMs from training data extraction attacks with formal privacy guarantees (Near Access Freeness). The key insight is that only a small subset of token-level probability shifts are important for utility, allowing aggressive smoothing of low-impact tokens.

entry.title: Dynamic Expert Sharing: Decoupling Memory from Parallelism in Mixture-of-Experts Diffusion LLMs

author.name: Hao Mark Chen, Zhiwen Mo, Royson Lee, Qianzhou Wang, Da Li, Shell Xu Hu, Wayne Luk, Timothy Hospedales, Hongxiang Fan

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamic Expert Sharing (DES) for MoE diffusion LLMs, addressing expert explosion where parallel decoding activates too many experts. Shifts from token-centric to sequence-level expert optimization.

entry.title: On the Spectral Flattening of Quantized Embeddings

author.name: Junlin Huang, Wenyi Fang, Zhenheng Tang, Yuxin Wang, Xueze Kang, Yang Zheng, Bo Li, Xiaowen Chu

entry.summary: Proves that power-law decay in embedding singular value spectra is fundamental for semantic encoding, and that uniform quantization causes spectral flattening that truncates this tail. Provides theoretical bounds on stable rank increase.

entry.title: Self-Generative Adversarial Fine-Tuning for Large Language Models

author.name: Shiguang Wu, Yaqing Wang, Quanming Yao

entry.summary: Proposes SGALM, a self-generative adversarial framework for LLM fine-tuning that formulates alignment as a min-max game within a single LLM, jointly evolving generation and discrimination without external rewards.

entry.title: PolySAE: Modeling Feature Interactions in Sparse Autoencoders via Polynomial Decoding

author.name: Panagiotis Koromilas, Andreas D. Demou, James Oldfield, Yannis Panagakis, Mihalis Nicolaou

entry.summary: Proposes PolySAE extending sparse autoencoders with polynomial decoder terms to model feature interactions, enabling decomposition of compound concepts rather than monolithic features.

entry.title: Your Self-Play Algorithm is Secretly an Adversarial Imitator: Understanding LLM Self-Play through the Lens of Imitation Learning

author.name: Shangzhe Li, Xuchao Zhang, Chetan Bansal, Weitong Zhang

entry.summary: Connects self-play fine-tuning with adversarial imitation learning, showing LLM self-play is a min-max game between model and implicit reward player. Proves convergence to equilibrium.

entry.title: When Is Rank-1 Enough? Geometry-Guided Initialization for Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Haoran Zhao, Soyeon Caren Han, Eduard Hovy

entry.summary: Investigates why rank-1 LoRA is unstable, discovering that pretrained vision and text features form mismatched anisotropic regions with a dominant 'gap' direction that hijacks early gradients. Proposes geometry-aware initialization to address this.

entry.title: Self-Rewarding Sequential Monte Carlo for Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Ziwei Luo, Ziqi Jin, Lei Wang, Lidong Bing, Thomas B. Sch\"on

entry.summary: Presents self-rewarding SMC for masked diffusion language models that launches parallel diffusion processes with trajectory-level confidence as self-reward, addressing diversity collapse from greedy decoding.

entry.title: Efficient Swap Regret Minimization in Combinatorial Bandits

author.name: Andreas Kontogiannis, Vasilis Pollatos, Panayotis Mertikopoulos, Ioannis Panageas

entry.summary: Designs efficient no-swap regret algorithm for combinatorial bandits with polylogarithmic dependence on exponentially large action space N, resolving long-standing challenge.

entry.title: ECHO-2: A Large Scale Distributed Rollout Framework for Cost-efficient Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jie Xiao, Meng Chen, Qingnan Ren, Song Jingwei, Jiaqi Huang, Yangshen Deng, Chris Tong, Wanyi Chen, Suli Wang, Ziqian Bi, Shuo Lu, Yiqun Duan, Lynn Ai, Eric Yang, Bill Shi

entry.summary: Presents ECHO-2, distributed RL framework for LLM post-training with remote inference workers, treating bounded policy staleness as tunable parameter to enable overlap of rollout, dissemination, and training.

entry.title: MEG-XL: Data-Efficient Brain-to-Text via Long-Context Pre-Training

author.name: Dulhan Jayalath, Oiwi Parker Jones

entry.summary: MEG-XL is a brain-to-text model pre-trained with 2.5 minutes of MEG context (5-300x longer than prior work). Matches supervised performance with a fraction of data (1hr vs 50hrs) and outperforms brain foundation models.

entry.title: Trust in One Round: Confidence Estimation for Large Language Models via Structural Signals

author.name: Pengyue Yang, Jiawen Wen, Haolin Jin, Linghan Huang, Huaming Chen, Ling Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Structural Confidence, a single-pass method for estimating LLM output reliability using hidden-state trajectory analysis. Combines spectral, local-variation, and global shape descriptors from final-layer representations without multiple inference passes.

entry.title: Zero2Text: Zero-Training Cross-Domain Inversion Attacks on Textual Embeddings

author.name: Doohyun Kim, Donghwa Kang, Kyungjae Lee, Hyeongboo Baek, Brent Byunghoon Kang

entry.summary: Introduces Zero2Text, training-free framework for embedding inversion attacks on RAG systems via recursive online alignment. Demonstrates privacy risks of vector databases.

entry.title: Think Dense, Not Long: Dynamic Decoupled Conditional Advantage for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Keqin Peng, Yuanxin Ouyang, Xuebo Liu, Zhiliang Tian, Ruijian Han, Yancheng Yuan, Liang Ding

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamic Decoupled Conditional Advantage (DDCA) addressing verbose reasoning traces in RLVR by decoupling efficiency from correctness optimization with difficulty-adaptive penalties.

entry.title: Segment-Level Attribution for Selective Learning of Long Reasoning Traces

author.name: Siyuan Wang, Yanchen Liu, Xiang Ren

entry.summary: Uses integrated gradient attribution to identify meaningful segments in long reasoning traces, defining attribution strength and direction consistency metrics. Enables selective learning to avoid imitating verbose uninformative patterns.

entry.title: On the Power of (Approximate) Reward Models for Inference-Time Scaling

author.name: Youheng Zhu, Yiping Lu

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of why approximate reward models work for inference-time scaling, introducing formal notion of information utility for SMC-based reasoning.

entry.title: Out of the Memory Barrier: A Highly Memory Efficient Training System for LLMs with Million-Token Contexts

author.name: Wenhao Li, Daohai Yu, Gen Luo, Yuxin Zhang, Fei Chao, Rongrong Ji, Yifan Wu, Jiaxin Liu, Ziyang Gong, Zimu Liao

entry.summary: OOMB training system enables million-token context training with O(1) activation memory through chunk-recurrent training with on-the-fly recomputation, paged memory management, and asynchronous CPU offloading.

entry.title: Towards Interpretable Hallucination Analysis and Mitigation in LVLMs via Contrastive Neuron Steering

author.name: Guangtao Lyu, Xinyi Cheng, Qi Liu, Chenghao Xu, Jiexi Yan, Muli Yang, Fen Fang, Cheng Deng

entry.summary: Uses sparse autoencoders to decompose visual embeddings in LVLMs into interpretable neurons, identifying always-on and image-specific neurons to understand and mitigate hallucinations via contrastive neuron steering.

entry.title: Omni-Judge: Can Omni-LLMs Serve as Human-Aligned Judges for Text-Conditioned Audio-Video Generation?

author.name: Susan Liang, Chao Huang, Filippos Bellos, Yolo Yunlong Tang, Qianxiang Shen, Jing Bi, Luchuan Song, Zeliang Zhang, Jason Corso, Chenliang Xu

entry.summary: Presents Omni-Judge benchmark to evaluate whether omni-modal LLMs can serve as human-aligned judges for text-conditioned audio-video generation. Addresses evaluation gap for tri-modal outputs from models like Sora 2 and Veo 3.

entry.title: Q Cache: Visual Attention is Valuable in Less than Half of Decode Layers for Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Jiedong Zhuang, Lu Lu, Ming Dai, Rui Hu, Jian Chen, Qiang Liu, Haoji Hu

entry.summary: Reveals that visual attention in MLLMs is only valuable in less than half of decode layers, proposing Q Cache to eliminate redundant visual KV cache computations.

entry.title: Inject Once Survive Later: Backdooring Vision-Language-Action Models to Persist Through Downstream Fine-tuning

author.name: Jianyi Zhou, Yujie Wei, Ruichen Zhen, Bo Zhao, Xiaobo Xia, Rui Shao, Xiu Su, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Introduces INFUSE for injecting backdoors into VLA models that persist through downstream fine-tuning, demonstrating security vulnerabilities in embodied AI systems.

entry.title: Cross-Layer Transcoders are incentivized to learn Unfaithful Circuits

author.name: Georg Lange

entry.summary: Demonstrates that cross-layer transcoders (CLTs) can learn unfaithful circuits by rewriting deep multi-hop circuits into shallow single-hop approximations. Shows sparsity penalties incentivize this unfaithfulness, with preliminary evidence in real language models.

entry.title: Reasoning with Autoregressive-Diffusion Collaborative Thoughts

author.name: Mu Yuan, Liekang Zeng, Guoliang Xing, Lan Zhang, Yunhao Liu

entry.summary: Collaborative Thoughts unifies autoregressive and diffusion models for reasoning, where autoregressive models handle structured planning while diffusion models provide spatial grounding through closed-loop interaction.

entry.title: ProcMEM: Learning Reusable Procedural Memory from Experience via Non-Parametric PPO for LLM Agents

author.name: Qirui Mi, Zhijian Ma, Mengyue Yang, Haoxuan Li, Yisen Wang, Haifeng Zhang, Jun Wang

entry.summary: ProcMEM enables agents to learn procedural memory from interactions via Non-Parametric PPO, transforming episodic narratives into executable Skills with activation, execution, and termination conditions.

entry.title: Hunt Instead of Wait: Evaluating Deep Data Research on Large Language Models

author.name: Wei Liu, Peijie Yu, Michele Orini, Yali Du, Yulan He

entry.summary: DDR-Bench introduces Deep Data Research task where LLMs autonomously extract key insights from databases without explicit queries, evaluating investigatory rather than executional intelligence.

entry.title: Evolving Interpretable Constitutions for Multi-Agent Simulation

author.name: Ujwal Kumar, Alice Saito, Hershraj Niranjani, Rayan Yessou, Phan Xuan Tan

entry.summary: Presents Constitutional Evolution framework for discovering behavioral norms in multi-agent LLM systems through grid-world simulation. Shows designed constitutions fail while genetic evolution discovers stable rules achieving 87.1% reduction in agent death.

entry.title: Continuous-Utility Direct Preference Optimization

author.name: Muhammad Ahmed Mohsin, Muhammad Umer, Ahsan Bilal, Zihao He, Muhammad Usman Rafique, Asad Aali, Muhammad Ali Jamshed, John M. Cioffi, Emily Fox

entry.summary: Introduces CU-DPO replacing binary preference labels with continuous scores capturing fine-grained reasoning quality. Proves K strategies yield Θ(K log K) sample complexity improvement over binary preferences.

entry.title: Multi-LLM Adaptive Conformal Inference for Reliable LLM Responses

author.name: Kangjun Noh, Seongchan Lee, Ilmun Kim, Kyungwoo Song

entry.summary: Proposes MACI, using multi-LLM ensembles with conformal inference to provide distribution-free factuality guarantees while maintaining higher claim retention than conservative baselines.

entry.title: Beyond Mode Elicitation: Diversity-Preserving Reinforcement Learning via Latent Diffusion Reasoner

author.name: Haoqiang Kang, Yizhe Zhang, Nikki Lijing Kuang, Yi-An Ma, Lianhui Qin

entry.summary: LaDi-RL conducts RL exploration in continuous latent space via guided diffusion to prevent diversity collapse in LLM reasoning, preserving multiple solution modes without mutual suppression.

entry.title: Beyond Precision: Training-Inference Mismatch is an Optimization Problem and Simple LR Scheduling Fixes It

author.name: Yaxiang Zhang, Yingru Li, Jiacai Liu, Jiawei Xu, Ziniu Li, Qian Liu, Haoyuan Li

entry.summary: Analyzes RL instability for LLM training through optimization lens, showing training-inference mismatch escalates with training progress and can be suppressed by learning rate scheduling.

entry.title: Self-Consolidation for Self-Evolving Agents

author.name: Hongzhuo Yu, Fei Zhu, Guo-Sen Xie, Ling Shao

entry.summary: Proposes Self-Consolidation for agents to learn from both successful and failed trajectories, distilling experiences into model parameters to avoid context exhaustion and retrieval noise.

entry.title: Alignment of Diffusion Model and Flow Matching for Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Yidong Ouyang, Liyan Xie, Hongyuan Zha, Guang Cheng

entry.summary: Novel alignment framework for diffusion models by sampling from reward-weighted distributions. Decomposes score into pre-trained and reward gradient components, avoiding expensive fine-tuning.

entry.title: ConPress: Learning Efficient Reasoning from Multi-Question Contextual Pressure

author.name: Jie Deng, Shining Liang, Jun Li, Hongzhi Li, Yutao Xie

entry.summary: Discovers Self-Compression phenomenon where LRMs spontaneously produce shorter reasoning when multiple questions are in one prompt. Proposes ConPress fine-tuning to induce efficient reasoning.

entry.title: Unified Personalized Reward Model for Vision Generation

author.name: Yibin Wang, Yuhang Zang, Feng Han, Jiazi Bu, Yujie Zhou, Cheng Jin, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes UnifiedReward-Flex, a unified personalized reward model for visual generation that adapts to content-specific and user-dependent preferences rather than assuming monolithic preferences.

entry.title: World Models as an Intermediary between Agents and the Real World

author.name: Sherry Yang

entry.summary: Position paper by Sherry Yang arguing world models should serve as intermediary between agents and real world to reduce cost of acquiring reward signals. Discusses applications to robotics, ML engineering, and scientific experiments.

entry.title: Multi-Head Attention Is a Multi-Player Game

author.name: Kushal Chakrabarti, Nirmal Balachundar

entry.summary: Formalizes multi-head attention as implicit multi-player game where heads compete and coordinate. Proves Price of Anarchy bounds excess hallucination and redundancy, unifying two failure modes.

entry.title: Hard Constraints Meet Soft Generation: Guaranteed Feasibility for LLM-based Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Yang Liu, Chuan Zhou, Yancheng Chen, Shuai Zhang, Xixun Lin, Xiaoqing Wang

entry.summary: Introduces FALCON ensuring 100% feasibility for LLM combinatorial optimization through grammar-constrained decoding, repair layer, and adaptive sampling. Uses BOPO training weighting preferences by objective value.

entry.title: Predictive Scheduling for Efficient Inference-Time Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Katrina Brown, Aneesh Muppidi, Rana Shahout

entry.summary: Introduces Predictive Scheduling to dynamically allocate token budgets across queries based on predicted difficulty before generation, using lightweight predictors on hidden states or fine-tuned classifiers.

entry.title: Beyond Dense States: Elevating Sparse Transcoders to Active Operators for Latent Reasoning

author.name: Yadong Wang, Haodong Chen, Yu Tian, Chuanxing Geng, Dong Liang, Xiang Chen

entry.summary: LSTR elevates sparse transcoders from post-hoc analysis to active reasoning operators, performing multi-step computation through sparse semantic transitions with Latent Transition Transcoder architecture.

entry.title: Edit Knowledge, Not Just Facts via Multi-Step Reasoning over Background Stories

author.name: Ya Gao, Kalle Kujanp\"a\"a, Pekka Marttinen, Harri Valpola, Alexander Ilin

entry.summary: Argues knowledge editing should be framed as reasoning problem rather than memorization, proposing training strategy where new information is instrumental to task solving through multi-step reasoning.

entry.title: Live-Evo: Online Evolution of Agentic Memory from Continuous Feedback

author.name: Yaolun Zhang, Yiran Wu, Yijiong Yu, Qingyun Wu, Huazheng Wang

entry.summary: Live-Evo provides online self-evolving memory system decoupling Experience Bank from Meta-Guideline Bank, learning from continuous data streams rather than static train/test splits.

entry.title: Drift-Bench: Diagnosing Cooperative Breakdowns in LLM Agents under Input Faults via Multi-Turn Interaction

author.name: Han Bao, Zheyuan Zhang, Pengcheng Jing, Zhengqing Yuan, Kaiwen Shi, Yanfang Ye

entry.summary: Drift-Bench evaluates agentic pragmatics under input faults (implicit intent, missing parameters, false presuppositions) through multi-turn clarification in execution environments.

entry.title: How Hyper-Datafication Impacts the Sustainability Costs in Frontier AI

author.name: Sophia N. Wilson, Sebastian Mair, Mophat Okinyi, Erik B. Dam, Janin Koch, Raghavendra Selvan

entry.summary: Examines environmental, social, and economic costs of large-scale data in AI, identifying transition from building models from data to creating data for models as 'hyper-datafication' with sustainability implications.

entry.title: Responsible Evaluation of AI for Mental Health

author.name: Hiba Arnaout, Anmol Goel, H. Andrew Schwartz, Steffen T. Eberhardt, Dana Atzil-Slonim, Gavin Doherty, Brian Schwartz, Wolfgang Lutz, Tim Althoff, Munmun De Choudhury, Hamidreza Jamalabadi, Raj Sanjay Shah, Flor Miriam Plaza-del-Arco, Dirk Hovy, Maria Liakata, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Argues for rethinking AI evaluation in mental health through interdisciplinary framework integrating clinical soundness, social context, and equity. Analyzes 135 publications identifying recurring limitations in current evaluation practices.

entry.title: Mirage2Matter: A Physically Grounded Gaussian World Model from Video

author.name: Zhengqing Gao, Ziwen Li, Xin Wang, Jiaxin Huang, Zhenyang Ren, Mingkai Shao, Hanlue Zhang, Tianyu Huang, Yongkang Cheng, Yandong Guo, Runqi Lin, Yuanyuan Wang, Tongliang Liu, Kun Zhang, Mingming Gong

entry.summary: Presents Simulate Anything framework combining 3D Gaussian Splatting with physics-based dynamics for generating embodied training data from multi-view videos without expensive sensors or calibration.

entry.title: AI-Generated Image Detectors Overrely on Global Artifacts: Evidence from Inpainting Exchange

author.name: Elif Nebioglu, Emirhan Bilgi\c{c}, Adrian Popescu

entry.summary: Shows AI-generated image detectors primarily rely on global VAE-induced spectral shifts rather than locally synthesized content. Introduces Inpainting Exchange (INP-X) to isolate this effect.

entry.title: In-Run Data Shapley for Adam Optimizer

author.name: Meng Ding, Zeqing Zhang, Di Wang, Lijie Hu

entry.summary: Demonstrates data attribution is optimizer-dependent, showing SGD-based proxies fail under Adam (Pearson R≈0.11). Proposes Adam-Aware In-Run Data Shapley capturing adaptive dynamics.

entry.title: Data Distribution as a Lever for Guiding Optimizers Toward Superior Generalization in LLMs

author.name: Tushaar Gangavarapu, Jiping Li, Christopher Vattheuer, Zhangyang Wang, Baharan Mirzasoleiman

entry.summary: Theoretically analyzes how training data distribution affects optimizer behavior in LLMs, showing SAM induces lower simplicity bias than gradient descent. Proposes data distribution modifications to achieve SAM-like generalization with GD-like efficiency.

entry.title: Factuality on Demand: Controlling the Factuality-Informativeness Trade-off in Text Generation

author.name: Ziwei Gong, Yanda Chen, Julia Hirschberg, Chen Zhao, He He, Zhou Yu, Kathleen Mckeown

entry.summary: Introduces Factuality-Controlled Generation (FCG) enabling users to specify factuality constraints alongside queries. Proposes synthetic training approach that significantly improves factuality control.

entry.title: Autoregressive, Yet Revisable: In Decoding Revision for Secure Code Generation

author.name: Chengran Yang, Zichao Wei, Heminghao Deng, Jinfeng Jiang, Zhensu Sun, Ting Zhang, Tianyi Wu, Ming Wen, David Lo

entry.summary: Proposes Stream of Revision paradigm enabling autoregressive code generation to self-revise during decoding using special action tokens, leveraging model's intrinsic semantic reasoning for secure code.

entry.title: An Odd Estimator for Shapley Values

author.name: Fabian Fumagalli, Landon Butler, Justin Singh Kang, Kannan Ramchandran, R. Teal Witter

entry.summary: Proves Shapley values depend exclusively on the odd component of set functions, explaining why paired sampling works by filtering out irrelevant even components. Proposes improved estimator.

entry.title: Generative Visual Code Mobile World Models

author.name: Woosung Koh, Sungjun Han, Segyu Lee, Se-Young Yun, Jamin Shin

entry.summary: Proposes visual world modeling for mobile GUI via renderable code generation—predicting next GUI state as executable web code that renders to pixels, combining VLM strengths.

entry.title: On the Spatiotemporal Dynamics of Generalization in Neural Networks

author.name: Zichao Wei

entry.summary: Derives the SEAD architecture from physics postulates (locality, symmetry, stability), creating a neural cellular automaton that generalizes arithmetic operations from 16-digit to arbitrarily long sequences through spatiotemporal evolution.

entry.title: CoMeT: Collaborative Memory Transformer for Efficient Long Context Modeling

author.name: Runsong Zhao, Shilei Liu, Jiwei Tang, Langming Liu, Haibin Chen, Weidong Zhang, Yujin Yuan, Tong Xiao, Jingbo Zhu, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: CoMeT introduces collaborative memory transformer with dual-memory system (temporary FIFO queue + globally updated memory) enabling constant memory and linear time for arbitrarily long sequences as plug-in module.

entry.title: Breaking the Static Graph: Context-Aware Traversal for Robust Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Kwun Hang Lau, Fangyuan Zhang, Boyu Ruan, Yingli Zhou, Qintian Guo, Ruiyuan Zhang, Xiaofang Zhou

entry.summary: CatRAG addresses 'Static Graph Fallacy' in graph-based RAG by proposing context-aware traversal with query-dependent edge relevance, avoiding semantic drift into hub nodes that causes incomplete evidence retrieval.

entry.title: Rethinking Genomic Modeling Through Optical Character Recognition

author.name: Hongxin Xiang, Pengsen Ma, Yunkang Cao, Di Yu, Haowen Chen, Xinyu Yang, Xiangxiang Zeng

entry.summary: OpticalDNA reframes genomic modeling as OCR-style document understanding, rendering DNA into visual layouts and training vision-language model for compact, reconstructible representations.

entry.title: State Rank Dynamics in Linear Attention LLMs

author.name: Ao Sun, Hongtao Zhang, Heng Zhou, Yixuan Ma, Yiran Qin, Tongrui Su, Yan Liu, Zhanyu Ma, Jun Xu, Jiuchong Gao, Jinghua Hao, Renqing He

entry.summary: Comprehensive study revealing 'State Rank Stratification' phenomenon in linear attention LLMs: spectral bifurcation where some heads maintain near-zero effective rank while others rapidly grow to upper bounds, with consistent dynamics across diverse contexts.

entry.title: World-Gymnast: Training Robots with Reinforcement Learning in a World Model

author.name: Ansh Kumar Sharma, Yixiang Sun, Ninghao Lu, Yunzhe Zhang, Jiarao Liu, Sherry Yang

entry.summary: World-Gymnast examines whether training policies in learned world models can be more effective than supervised learning or software simulation for real robot performance.

entry.title: Reward-free Alignment for Conflicting Objectives

author.name: Peter Chen, Xiaopeng Li, Xi Chen, Tianyi Lin

entry.summary: RACO enables reward-free alignment with multiple conflicting objectives using pairwise preference data directly, resolving conflicts without explicit reward models that can distort preferences.

entry.title: Over-Alignment vs Over-Fitting: The Role of Feature Learning Strength in Generalization

author.name: Taesun Yeom, Taehyeok Ha, Jaeho Lee

entry.summary: Discovers optimal feature learning strength (FLS) for generalization in deep networks under practical early stopping. Reveals two distinct failure modes: over-alignment (low FLS) where too many features are learned, and over-fitting (high FLS) where too few are learned.

entry.title: Probing the Knowledge Boundary: An Interactive Agentic Framework for Deep Knowledge Extraction

author.name: Yuheng Yang, Siqi Zhu, Tao Feng, Ge Liu, Jiaxuan You

entry.summary: Proposes an interactive agentic framework to systematically extract and quantify LLM knowledge boundaries using adaptive exploration policies and three-stage knowledge processing pipeline.

entry.title: SFMP: Fine-Grained, Hardware-Friendly and Search-Free Mixed-Precision Quantization for Large Language Models

author.name: Xin Nie, Haicheng Zhang, Liang Dong, Beining Feng, Jinhong Weng, Guiling Sun

entry.summary: Proposes SFMP, a search-free hardware-friendly mixed-precision quantization framework using fractional bit-widths and block-wise precision allocation for LLMs.

entry.title: Tangent Space Fine-Tuning for Directional Preference Alignment in Large Language Models

author.name: Mete Erdogan

entry.summary: Proposes Tangent-Space DPO for multi-objective LLM alignment, using linearized fine-tuning to compose preference directions as additive vectors that can traverse the Pareto front.

entry.title: EDIS: Diagnosing LLM Reasoning via Entropy Dynamics

author.name: Chenghua Zhu, Siyan Wu, Xiangkang Zeng, Zishan Xu, Zhaolu Kang, Yifu Guo, Yuquan Lu, Junduan Huang, Guojing Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes EDIS, diagnosing LLM reasoning via entropy dynamics rather than static confidence. Identifies characteristic patterns (burst spikes, peak-valley spikes) distinguishing correct from incorrect reasoning.

entry.title: SNIP: An Adaptive Mixed Precision Framework for Subbyte Large Language Model Training

author.name: Yunjie Pan, Yongyi Yang, Hanmei Yang, Scott Mahlke

entry.summary: Proposes SNIP, adaptive mixed-precision training framework for LLM pretraining supporting subbyte precision, with metrics for loss divergence and model staleness to guide precision allocation.

entry.title: Rectified LpJEPA: Joint-Embedding Predictive Architectures with Sparse and Maximum-Entropy Representations

author.name: Yilun Kuang, Yash Dagade, Tim G. J. Rudner, Randall Balestriero, Yann LeCun

entry.summary: Proposes Rectified LpJEPA introducing rectified distribution matching that aligns representations to Rectified Generalized Gaussian distributions, enabling explicit control over sparsity while preserving maximum entropy.

entry.title: Universal Redundancies in Time Series Foundation Models

author.name: Anthony Bao, Venkata Hasith Vattikuti, Jeffrey Lai, William Gilpin

entry.summary: Discovers that leading transformer-based Time Series Foundation Models exhibit redundant components in intermediate layers. Introduces interpretability tools including ablations and direct logit attribution, finding models are robust to entire layer ablations.

entry.title: Interpretable Tabular Foundation Models via In-Context Kernel Regression

author.name: Ratmir Miftachov, Bruno Charron, Simon Valentin

entry.summary: Introduces KernelICL framework making tabular foundation models like TabPFN interpretable by replacing final layer with explicit kernel functions (Gaussian, dot-product, kNN).

entry.title: Learning Markov Decision Processes under Fully Bandit Feedback

author.name: Zhengjia Zhuo, Anupam Gupta, Viswanath Nagarajan

entry.summary: Studies episodic MDPs under fully bandit feedback where agent doesn't observe visited states/actions, only aggregate reward. Establishes that Θ(sqrt(T))-regret is achievable.

entry.title: Repurposing Protein Language Models for Latent Flow-Based Fitness Optimization

author.name: Amaru Caceres Arroyo, Lea Bogensperger, Ahmed Allam, Michael Krauthammer, Konrad Schindler, Dominik Narnhofer

entry.summary: CHASE repurposes protein language models for fitness optimization by compressing embeddings into a compact latent space and training conditional flow-matching with classifier-free guidance. Achieves SOTA on AAV and GFP benchmarks.

entry.title: Benchmarking Uncertainty Calibration in Large Language Model Long-Form Question Answering

author.name: Philip M\"uller, Nicholas Popovi\v{c}, Michael F\"arber, Peter Steinbach

entry.summary: First large-scale benchmark for evaluating uncertainty quantification in scientific QA across 20 LLMs (base, instruction-tuned, reasoning variants) and 7 scientific datasets.

entry.title: Alternating Reinforcement Learning for Rubric-Based Reward Modeling in Non-Verifiable LLM Post-Training

author.name: Ran Xu, Tianci Liu, Zihan Dong, Tony You, Ilgee Hong, Carl Yang, Linjun Zhang, Tao Zhao, Haoyu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Rubric-ARM for jointly optimizing rubric generator and judge using RL from preference feedback. Addresses non-verifiable domains like creative writing where scalar scores are insufficient.

entry.title: Stochastic Interpolants in Hilbert Spaces

author.name: James Boran Yu, RuiKang OuYang, Julien Horwood, Jos\'e Miguel Hern\'andez-Lobato

entry.summary: Extends stochastic interpolants to infinite-dimensional Hilbert spaces with rigorous well-posedness proofs and error bounds. Achieves state-of-the-art on PDE benchmarks for functional generation.

entry.title: Reasoning as State Transition: A Representational Analysis of Reasoning Evolution in Large Language Models

author.name: Siyuan Zhang, Jialian Li, Yichi Zhang, Xiao Yang, Yinpeng Dong, Hang Su

entry.summary: Analyzes reasoning evolution through internal representations, finding post-training yields limited improvement in static representation quality but reasoning involves significant continuous distributional shift.

entry.title: DreamOn: Diffusion Language Models For Code Infilling Beyond Fixed-size Canvas

author.name: Zirui Wu, Lin Zheng, Zhihui Xie, Jiacheng Ye, Jiahui Gao, Shansan Gong, Yansong Feng, Zhenguo Li, Wei Bi, Guorui Zhou, Lingpeng Kong

entry.summary: Proposes DreamOn for diffusion language models, enabling variable-length code infilling through two length control states. Addresses critical limitation of fixed-length mask requirement.

entry.title: ARTIS: Agentic Risk-Aware Test-Time Scaling via Iterative Simulation

author.name: Xingshan Zeng, Lingzhi Wang, Weiwen Liu, Liangyou Li, Yasheng Wang, Lifeng Shang, Xin Jiang, Qun Liu

entry.summary: Proposes ARTIS for risk-aware test-time scaling via simulated interactions before real-world execution. Decouples exploration from commitment for safer agent deployment.

entry.title: There Is More to Refusal in Large Language Models than a Single Direction

author.name: Faaiz Joad, Majd Hawasly, Sabri Boughorbel, Nadir Durrani, Husrev Taha Sencar

entry.summary: Challenges the view that LLM refusal is mediated by a single direction, showing eleven refusal categories correspond to geometrically distinct directions. However, steering along any refusal direction produces similar refusal-to-over-refusal tradeoffs.

entry.title: Training LLMs for Divide-and-Conquer Reasoning Elevates Test-Time Scalability

author.name: Xiao Liang, Zhong-Zhi Li, Zhenghao Lin, Eric Hancheng Jiang, Hengyuan Zhang, Yelong Shen, Kai-Wei Chang, Ying Nian Wu, Yeyun Gong, Weizhu Chen

entry.summary: Trains LLMs for divide-and-conquer reasoning to improve test-time scalability, addressing misalignment between general post-training and DAC-style inference. Enables more effective solution exploration than sequential CoT.

entry.title: Who Transfers Safety? Identifying and Targeting Cross-Lingual Shared Safety Neurons

author.name: Xianhui Zhang, Chengyu Xie, Linxia Zhu, Yonghui Yang, Weixiang Zhao, Zifeng Cheng, Cong Wang, Fei Shen, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Identifies cross-lingual shared safety neurons (SS-Neurons) in LLMs that jointly regulate safety across languages, enabling targeted interventions to improve multilingual safety alignment.

entry.title: Research on World Models Is Not Merely Injecting World Knowledge into Specific Tasks

author.name: Bohan Zeng, Kaixin Zhu, Daili Hua, Bozhou Li, Chengzhuo Tong, Yuran Wang, Xinyi Huang, Yifan Dai, Zixiang Zhang, Yifan Yang, Zhou Liu, Hao Liang, Xiaochen Ma, Ruichuan An, Tianyi Bai, Hongcheng Gao, Junbo Niu, Yang Shi, Xinlong Chen, Yue Ding, Minglei Shi, Kai Zeng, Yiwen Tang, Yuanxing Zhang, Pengfei Wan, Xintao Wang, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing that current world model research is fragmented, focusing on injecting world knowledge into isolated tasks rather than building unified frameworks. Proposes systematic analysis of limitations.

entry.title: How Well Do Models Follow Visual Instructions? VIBE: A Systematic Benchmark for Visual Instruction-Driven Image Editing

author.name: Huanyu Zhang, Xuehai Bai, Chengzu Li, Chen Liang, Haochen Tian, Haodong Li, Ruichuan An, Yifan Zhang, Anna Korhonen, Zhang Zhang, Liang Wang, Tieniu Tan

entry.summary: Introduces VIBE, a systematic benchmark for visual instruction-driven image editing with three-level hierarchy capturing deictic grounding, morphological manipulation, and causal reasoning.

entry.title: A Systematic Study of Data Modalities and Strategies for Co-training Large Behavior Models for Robot Manipulation

author.name: Fanqi Lin, Kushal Arora, Jean Mercat, Haruki Nishimura, Paarth Shah, Chen Xu, Mengchao Zhang, Mark Zolotas, Maya Angeles, Owen Pfannenstiehl, Andrew Beaulieu, Jose Barreiros

entry.summary: Presents large-scale empirical study examining five co-training data modalities for behavior model training: VL data, dense annotations, cross-embodiment data, human videos, and simulation.

entry.title: Concept-Based Dictionary Learning for Inference-Time Safety in Vision Language Action Models

author.name: Siqi Wen, Shu Yang, Shaopeng Fu, Jingfeng Zhang, Lijie Hu, Di Wang

entry.summary: Introduces concept-based dictionary learning for inference-time safety control in VLA models, identifying and suppressing harmful concept directions in activations.

entry.title: Aggregation Queries over Unstructured Text: Benchmark and Agentic Method

author.name: Haojia Zhu, Qinyuan Xu, Haoyu Li, Yuxi Liu, Hanchen Qiu, Jiaoyan Chen, Jiahui Jin

entry.summary: Formalizes entity-level aggregation queries over text requiring completeness (find all, not find one), introduces AGGBench benchmark, and proposes DFA agentic baseline for disambiguation-filtering-aggregation.

entry.title: ROMA: Recursive Open Meta-Agent Framework for Long-Horizon Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Salaheddin Alzu'bi, Baran Nama, Arda Kaz, Anushri Eswaran, Weiyuan Chen, Sarvesh Khetan, Rishab Bala, Tu Vu, Sewoong Oh

entry.summary: ROMA addresses long-horizon agent limitations through recursive task decomposition with dependency-aware subtask trees and structured aggregation, using four modular roles including Atomizer and Aggregator.

entry.title: TIDE: Trajectory-based Diagnostic Evaluation of Test-Time Improvement in LLM Agents

author.name: Hang Yan, Xinyu Che, Fangzhi Xu, Qiushi Sun, Zichen Ding, Kanzhi Cheng, Jian Zhang, Tao Qin, Jun Liu, Qika Lin

entry.summary: TIDE provides diagnostic evaluation framework for Test-Time Improvement in LLM agents, decomposing into temporal dynamics, error recovery, and working memory utility across task trajectories.

entry.title: From Junior to Senior: Allocating Agency and Navigating Professional Growth in Agentic AI-Mediated Software Engineering

author.name: Dana Feng, Bhada Yun, April Wang

entry.summary: Mixed-methods study on junior vs senior engineers using agentic AI, finding agency constrained by organizational policy, with seniors maintaining control through detailed delegation while juniors oscillate between over-reliance and avoidance.

entry.title: Adaptive Ability Decomposing for Unlocking Large Reasoning Model Effective Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhipeng Chen, Xiaobo Qin, Wayne Xin Zhao, Youbin Wu, Ji-Rong Wen

entry.summary: Proposes A²D (Adaptive Ability Decomposing) for enhancing RLVR in large reasoning models by training a decomposer to break complex questions into simpler sub-questions without relying on teacher models.

entry.title: PACER: Blockwise Pre-verification for Speculative Decoding with Adaptive Length

author.name: Situo Zhang, Yifan Zhang, Zichen Zhu, Hankun Wang, Da Ma, Danyang Zhang, Lu Chen, Kai Yu

entry.summary: Proposes PACER for speculative decoding with adaptive draft length via a trainable pre-verification layer that assesses draft tokens blockwise before target model verification.

entry.title: Rethinking LoRA for Data Heterogeneous Federated Learning: Subspace and State Alignment

author.name: Hongyi Peng, Han Yu, Xiaoxiao Li, Qiang Yang

entry.summary: FedGaLore addresses LoRA underperformance in non-IID federated settings by identifying update-space and optimizer-state mismatches, combining GaLore-style gradient subspace optimization with drift-robust state synchronization.

entry.title: Efficient Epistemic Uncertainty Estimation for Large Language Models via Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Seonghyeon Park, Jewon Yeom, Jaewon Sok, Jeongjae Park, Heejun Kim, Taesup Kim

entry.summary: Proposes efficient epistemic uncertainty estimation for LLMs using small draft models with Jensen-Shannon divergence among drafts (variance) and KL to target (bias), plus online stochastic distillation.

entry.title: BAPS: A Fine-Grained Low-Precision Scheme for Softmax in Attention via Block-Aware Precision reScaling

author.name: Zisheng Ye, Xiaoyu He, Maoyuan Song, Guoliang Qiu, Chao Liao, Chen Wu, Yonggang Sun, Zhichun Li, Xiaoru Xie, Yuanyong Luo, Hu Liu, Pinyan Lu, Heng Liao

entry.summary: Proposes BAPS using HiF8 format and block-aware precision rescaling for low-precision softmax in transformers, halving memory bandwidth while maintaining accuracy.

entry.title: LongVPO: From Anchored Cues to Self-Reasoning for Long-Form Video Preference Optimization

author.name: Zhenpeng Huang, Jiaqi Li, Zihan Jia, Xinhao Li, Desen Meng, Lingxue Song, Xi Chen, Liang Li, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Presents LongVPO, two-stage DPO framework enabling short-context VLMs to understand ultra-long videos without long-video annotations through anchored cue synthesis and recursive captioning.

entry.title: Unmasking Reasoning Processes: A Process-aware Benchmark for Evaluating Structural Mathematical Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Xiang Zheng, Weiqi Zhai, Wei Wang, Boyu Yang, Wenbo Li, Ruixiang Luo, Haoxiang Sun, Yucheng Wang, Zhengze Li, Meng Wang, Yuetian Du, Guojie Lin, Yaxuan Wang, Xiaoxiao Xu, Yanhu Mo, Xuan Ren, Hu Wei, Ze Xu

entry.summary: Introduces ReasoningMath-Plus benchmark of 150 problems testing structural reasoning including multi-constraint coordination and constructive synthesis. Addresses saturation on existing benchmarks that rely on template-based computation.

entry.title: Small-Margin Preferences Still Matter-If You Train Them Right

author.name: Jinlong Pang, Zhaowei Zhu, Na Di, Yichi Zhang, Yaxuan Wang, Chen Qian, Yang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes MixDPO showing small-margin preference pairs help when trained with SFT but hurt with preference losses. Uses difficulty-aware training that orders pairs by margin for different optimization objectives.

entry.title: Do All Individual Layers Help? An Empirical Study of Task-Interfering Layers in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Zhiming Liu, Yujie Wei, Lei Feng, Xiu Su, Xiaobo Xia, Weili Guan, Zeke Xie, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Investigates how individual layers in Vision-Language Models can actually hinder downstream task performance. Shows that zeroing certain 'task-interfering layers' improves results, suggesting VLMs have redundant or counterproductive components.

entry.title: TRIP-Bench: A Benchmark for Long-Horizon Interactive Agents in Real-World Scenarios

author.name: Yuanzhe Shen, Zisu Huang, Zhengyuan Wang, Muzhao Tian, Zhengkang Guo, Chenyang Zhang, Shuaiyu Zhou, Zengjie Hu, Dailin Li, Jingwen Xu, Kaimin Wang, Wenhao Liu, Tianlong Li, Fengpeng Yue, Feng Hong, Cao Liu, Ke Zeng

entry.summary: TRIP-Bench provides long-horizon benchmark for travel-planning agents with 18 tools, 40+ requirements, supporting up to 15 user turns and 150+ tool calls, emphasizing global constraints and evolving user behavior.

entry.title: Optimizing Prompts for Large Language Models: A Causal Approach

author.name: Wei Chen, Yanbin Fang, Shuran Fu, Fasheng Xu, Xuan Wei

entry.summary: Causal Prompt Optimization reframes prompt design as causal estimation problem, learning offline propensity model then deploying efficient test-time optimizer to select prompts based on causal effects.

entry.title: Small Generalizable Prompt Predictive Models Can Steer Efficient RL Post-Training of Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Yun Qu, Qi Wang, Yixiu Mao, Heming Zou, Yuhang Jiang, Weijie Liu, Clive Bai, Kai Yang, Yangkun Chen, Saiyong Yang, Xiangyang Ji

entry.summary: GPS introduces Generalizable Predictive Prompt Selection using lightweight generative model for Bayesian inference on prompt difficulty, enabling efficient RL post-training through intermediate-difficulty prioritization.

entry.title: Interpreting and Controlling LLM Reasoning through Integrated Policy Gradient

author.name: Changming Li, Kaixing Zhang, Haoyun Xu, Yingdong Shi, Zheng Zhang, Kaitao Song, Kan Ren

entry.summary: Proposes Integrated Policy Gradient for interpreting and controlling LLM reasoning, identifying components with sequential contribution to reasoning outcomes using outcome-oriented principles.

entry.title: AgentRx: Diagnosing AI Agent Failures from Execution Trajectories

author.name: Shraddha Barke, Arnav Goyal, Alind Khare, Avaljot Singh, Suman Nath, Chetan Bansal

entry.summary: Releases AgentRx, a diagnostic framework and benchmark of 115 annotated failed AI agent trajectories with a cross-domain failure taxonomy. Provides automated tools to pinpoint critical failure steps in agent executions.

entry.title: G-MemLLM: Gated Latent Memory Augmentation for Long-Context Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Xun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes G-MemLLM with a trainable Latent Memory Bank using GRU-style gated updates to address context limitations and maintain long-term factual consistency during multi-hop reasoning.

entry.title: Learning Physics-Grounded 4D Dynamics with Neural Gaussian Force Fields

author.name: Shiqian Li, Ruihong Shen, Junfeng Ni, Chang Pan, Chi Zhang, Yixin Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Neural Gaussian Force Field (NGFF) for predicting physical dynamics from visual data, integrating 3D Gaussian perception with physics-based modeling for interactive, physically realistic prediction.

entry.title: DIVERGE: Diversity-Enhanced RAG for Open-Ended Information Seeking

author.name: Tianyi Hu, Niket Tandon, Akhil Arora

entry.summary: DIVERGE addresses RAG systems' tendency to collapse to single dominant responses by introducing reflection-guided generation and memory-augmented retrieval for diverse answer generation.

entry.title: Semantics-Preserving Evasion of LLM Vulnerability Detectors

author.name: Luze Sun, Alina Oprea, Eric Wong

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM vulnerability detector robustness under semantics-preserving transformations, showing predictions flip under behavior-equivalent edits. Universal adversarial strings transfer across models.

entry.title: Rethinking Zero-Shot Time Series Classification: From Task-specific Classifiers to In-Context Inference

author.name: Juntao Fang, Shifeng Xie, Shengbin Nie, Yuhui Ling, Yuming Liu, Zijian Li, Keli Zhang, Lujia Pan, Themis Palpanas, Ruichu Cai

entry.summary: Proposes TIC-FM, an in-context learning framework for zero-shot time series classification that treats labeled training data as context and predicts labels in a single forward pass without parameter updates. Provides theoretical justification that in-context inference can subsume trained classifiers.

entry.title: Latent Shadows: The Gaussian-Discrete Duality in Masked Diffusion

author.name: Guinan Chen, Xunpeng Huang, Ying Sun, Shijin Wang, Yanyong Zhang, Chao Wang

entry.summary: Establishes explicit Masked Diffusion Duality, proving masked diffusion arises as projection of continuous Gaussian process. Enables deterministic sampling tools for masked discrete diffusion models.

entry.title: DISPO: Enhancing Training Efficiency and Stability in Reinforcement Learning for Large Language Model Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Batuhan K. Karaman, Aditya Rawal, Suhaila Shakiah, Mohammad Ghavamzadeh, Mingyi Hong, Arijit Biswas, Ruida Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces DISPO, a REINFORCE-style algorithm that decouples importance sampling clipping from gradient computation for stable and efficient RLVR in LLM mathematical reasoning, addressing trade-offs between PPO and REINFORCE approaches.

entry.title: Residual Decoding: Mitigating Hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models via History-Aware Residual Guidance

author.name: Xinrong Chen, Xu Chu, Yingmin Qiu, Hengyuan Zhang, Jing Xiong, Shiyu Tang, Shuai Liu, Shaokang Yang, Cheng Yang, Hayden Kwok-Hay So, Ngai Wong

entry.summary: Proposes Residual Decoding (ResDec), a training-free method that uses historical token information to correct biases and reduce hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models during decoding.

entry.title: Lotus: Efficient LLM Training by Randomized Low-Rank Gradient Projection with Adaptive Subspace Switching

author.name: Tianhao Miao, Zhongyuan Bao, Lejun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Lotus for efficient LLM training via randomized low-rank gradient projection with adaptive subspace switching, avoiding costly SVD operations.

entry.title: CIPHER: Cryptographic Insecurity Profiling via Hybrid Evaluation of Responses

author.name: Max Manolov, Tony Gao, Siddharth Shukla, Cheng-Ting Chou, Ryan Lagasse

entry.summary: Introduces CIPHER benchmark measuring cryptographic vulnerabilities in LLM-generated Python code under different security guidance conditions, with line-level attribution scoring.

entry.title: InfoTok: Regulating Information Flow for Capacity-Constrained Shared Visual Tokenization in Unified MLLMs

author.name: Lv Tang, Tianyi Zheng, Bo Li, Xingyu Li

entry.summary: Proposes InfoTok introducing capacity-constrained perspective for visual tokenization in unified MLLMs, arguing tokens should prioritize reusable structure over high-entropy variations.

entry.title: Boosting Maximum Entropy Reinforcement Learning via One-Step Flow Matching

author.name: Zeqiao Li, Yijing Wang, Haoyu Wang, Zheng Li, Zhiqiang Zuo

entry.summary: FLAME combines one-step flow matching with maximum entropy RL by deriving a Q-reweighted objective that bypasses partition function estimation and introduces a decoupled entropy estimator to avoid discretization bias. Addresses the high inference latency of diffusion policies.

entry.title: Backdoor Sentinel: Detecting and Detoxifying Backdoors in Diffusion Models via Temporal Noise Consistency

author.name: Bingzheng Wang, Xiaoyan Gu, Hongbo Xu, Hongcheng Li, Zimo Yu, Jiang Zhou, Weiping Wang

entry.summary: Backdoor Sentinel detects and detoxifies backdoors in diffusion models via temporal noise inconsistency between adjacent timesteps, working in black-box settings without parameter access.

entry.title: COLT: Lightweight Multi-LLM Collaboration through Shared MCTS Reasoning for Model Compilation

author.name: Annabelle Sujun Tang, Christopher Priebe, Lianhui Qin, Hadi Esmaeilzadeh

entry.summary: COLT proposes lightweight multi-LLM collaboration for compiler optimization using shared MCTS, showing small LLMs can match large model performance through coordinated reasoning.

entry.title: ClueTracer: Question-to-Vision Clue Tracing for Training-Free Hallucination Suppression in Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Gongli Xi, Kun Wang, Zeming Gao, Huahui Yi, Haolang Lu, Ye Tian, Wendong Wang

entry.summary: ClueTracer identifies 'reasoning drift' in multimodal reasoning models and proposes training-free hallucination suppression by tracing question-to-vision clues, addressing over-focus on irrelevant entities.

entry.title: Unifying Masked Diffusion Models with Various Generation Orders and Beyond

author.name: Chunsan Hong, Sanghyun Lee, Jong Chul Ye

entry.summary: OeMDM provides a unified framework for masked diffusion models with various generation orders, enabling interpretation of MDMs, autoregressive models, and block diffusion in a single framework, plus LoMDM which jointly learns generation order during training.

entry.title: OmniCode: A Benchmark for Evaluating Software Engineering Agents

author.name: Atharv Sonwane, Eng-Shen Tu, Wei-Chung Lu, Claas Beger, Carter Larsen, Debjit Dhar, Rachel Chen, Ronit Pattanayak, Tuan Anh Dang, Guohao Chen, Gloria Geng, Kevin Ellis, Saikat Dutta

entry.summary: OmniCode benchmark contains 1794 tasks spanning broader software engineering activities beyond code/patch generation, addressing the gap between narrow coding benchmarks and real-world development needs.

entry.title: Infinite-World: Scaling Interactive World Models to 1000-Frame Horizons via Pose-Free Hierarchical Memory

author.name: Ruiqi Wu, Xuanhua He, Meng Cheng, Tianyu Yang, Yong Zhang, Zhuoliang Kang, Xunliang Cai, Xiaoming Wei, Chunle Guo, Chongyi Li, Ming-Ming Cheng

entry.summary: Infinite-World maintains coherent visual memory over 1000+ frames through Hierarchical Pose-free Memory Compressor that recursively distills historical latents into fixed-budget representation without requiring ground-truth poses.

entry.title: On the Relationship Between Representation Geometry and Generalization in Deep Neural Networks

author.name: Sumit Yadav

entry.summary: Investigates representation geometry's relationship to neural network performance across 52 ImageNet models and extends to NLP. Shows effective dimension strongly predicts accuracy (partial r=0.75) independent of model size.

entry.title: Towards Building Non-Fine-Tunable Foundation Models

author.name: Ziyao Wang, Nizhang Li, Pingzhi Li, Guoheng Sun, Tianlong Chen, Ang Li

entry.summary: Proposes non-fine-tunable foundation models via Private Mask Pre-Training, concentrating learning in sparse subnetwork with private mask. Forces unauthorized fine-tuning to update misaligned parameters, limiting adaptation.

entry.title: Spectral Imbalance Causes Forgetting in Low-Rank Continual Adaptation

author.name: Hao Gu, Mao-Lin Luo, Zi-Hao Zhou, Han-Chen Zhang, Min-Ling Zhang, Tong Wei

entry.summary: Identifies spectral imbalance in low-rank adaptations as a root cause of catastrophic forgetting in continual learning. Shows that dominant singular components both disrupt prior knowledge and make updates vulnerable to subsequent interference.

entry.title: SALAAD: Sparse And Low-Rank Adaptation via ADMM

author.name: Hao Ma, Melis Ilayda Bal, Liang Zhang, Bingcong Li, Niao He, Melanie Zeilinger, Michael Muehlebach

entry.summary: Proposes SALAAD, a plug-and-play framework inducing sparse and low-rank structures during training via augmented Lagrangian with adaptive controller for constraint balancing.

entry.title: SAGE: Agentic Framework for Interpretable and Clinically Translatable Computational Pathology Biomarker Discovery

author.name: Sahar Almahfouz Nasser, Juan Francisco Pesantez Borja, Jincheng Liu, Tanvir Hasan, Zenghan Wang, Suman Ghosh, Sandeep Manandhar, Shikhar Shiromani, Twisha Shah, Naoto Tokuyama, Anant Madabhushi

entry.summary: Introduces SAGE, an agentic AI system for discovering interpretable computational pathology biomarkers grounded in biological evidence. Integrates literature-anchored reasoning with multimodal data analysis.

entry.title: TRACE: Scalable Amortized Causal Discovery from Single Sequences via Autoregressive Density Estimation

author.name: Hugo Math, Rainer Lienhart

entry.summary: Introduces TRACE for causal discovery from single event sequences using autoregressive models as pretrained density estimators for conditional mutual information. Scales linearly with vocabulary and supports GPU parallelism.

entry.title: Unraveling the Hidden Dynamical Structure in Recurrent Neural Policies

author.name: Jin Li, Yue Wu, Mengsha Huang, Yuhao Sun, Hao He, Xianyuan Zhan

entry.summary: Discovers that stable cyclic structures (limit cycles) consistently emerge in hidden states of recurrent neural policies across architectures and tasks, providing mechanistic explanation for generalization.

entry.title: MiTA Attention: Efficient Fast-Weight Scaling via a Mixture of Top-$k$ Activations

author.name: Qishuai Wen, Zhiyuan Huang, Xianghan Meng, Wei He, Chun-Guang Li

entry.summary: Proposes MiTA attention viewing attention as fast-weight MLP and introducing mixture of top-k activations for efficient scaling. Unifies various efficient attention methods under routing/compression framework.

entry.title: Mixture-of-World Models: Scaling Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning with Modular Latent Dynamics

author.name: Boxuan Zhang, Weipu Zhang, Zhaohan Feng, Wei Xiao, Jian Sun, Jie Chen, Gang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Mixture-of-World Models for multi-task RL combining modular VAEs, hybrid Transformer dynamics with task-conditioned experts, and gradient-based task clustering.

entry.title: Imperfect Influence, Preserved Rankings: A Theory of TRAK for Data Attribution

author.name: Han Tong, Shubhangi Ghosh, Haolin Zou, Arian Maleki

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of TRAK data attribution algorithm, characterizing when approximations are accurate and quantifying errors. Shows rankings are preserved even when influence estimates are imperfect.

entry.title: Improve the Trade-off Between Watermark Strength and Speculative Sampling Efficiency for Language Models

author.name: Weiqing He, Xiang Li, Li Shen, Weijie Su, Qi Long

entry.summary: Analyzes watermark strength vs speculative sampling efficiency trade-off, showing it's not absolute. Introduces quantitative measure maximized when tokens are deterministic functions of pseudorandom numbers.

entry.title: A Statistical Theory of Gated Attention through the Lens of Hierarchical Mixture of Experts

author.name: Viet Nguyen, Tuan Minh Pham, Thinh Cao, Tan Dinh, Huy Nguyen, Nhat Ho, Alessandro Rinaldo

entry.summary: Provides statistical theory of gated attention through hierarchical mixture of experts lens, showing gated attention entries can be viewed as hierarchical MoE. Explains benefits over standard attention.

entry.title: Revisiting Generalization Measures Beyond IID: An Empirical Study under Distributional Shift

author.name: Sora Nakai, Youssef Fadhloun, Kacem Mathlouthi, Kotaro Yoshida, Ganesh Talluri, Ioannis Mitliagkas, Hiroki Naganuma

entry.summary: Large-scale empirical study benchmarking 40+ generalization measures across 10,000+ hyperparameter configurations under distribution shift, extending evaluation beyond IID to synthetic and natural shifts.

entry.title: No Generation without Representation: Efficient Causal Protein Language Models Enable Zero-Shot Fitness Estimation

author.name: Furkan Eris

entry.summary: Introduces Proust, a 309M-parameter causal protein language model achieving competitive fitness prediction (Spearman ρ=0.390) with MLMs while enabling generation, using LLM architectural innovations.

entry.title: STILL: Selecting Tokens for Intra-Layer Hybrid Attention to Linearize LLMs

author.name: Weikang Meng, Liangyu Huo, Yadan Luo, Jiawen Guan, Jingyi Zhang, Yingjian Li, Zheng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes STILL for linearizing pretrained LLMs via Self-Saliency Score with local-global consistency for token selection and distribution-preserving linear attention.

entry.title: EvalQReason: A Framework for Step-Level Reasoning Evaluation in Large Language Models

author.name: Shaima Ahmad Freja, Ferhat Ozgur Catak, Betul Yurdem, Chunming Rong

entry.summary: EvalQReason quantifies LLM reasoning quality through step-level probability distribution analysis without human annotation. Introduces metrics for measuring local coherence between steps (CSD) and global alignment with final answers (SFC).

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Learning via Conformal Shapley Intervals

author.name: Mathew Chandy, Michael Johnson, Judong Shen, Devan V. Mehrotra, Hua Zhou, Jin Zhou, Xiaowu Dai

entry.summary: Conformal Shapley intervals combine Shapley values with conformal inference to construct uncertainty-aware importance intervals for each modality in multimodal learning, with provable optimality guarantees.

entry.title: Inference-Aware Meta-Alignment of LLMs via Non-Linear GRPO

author.name: Shokichi Takakura, Akifumi Wachi, Rei Higuchi, Kohei Miyaguchi, Taiji Suzuki

entry.summary: Proposes inference-aware meta-alignment (IAMA) enabling LLMs to be aligned to multiple criteria with limited compute at inference time via non-linear GRPO. Pre-trains base model for effective multi-task alignment.

entry.title: Transformers as Measure-Theoretic Associative Memory: A Statistical Perspective and Minimax Optimality

author.name: Ryotaro Kawata, Taiji Suzuki

entry.summary: Recasts transformers as measure-theoretic associative memory, showing softmax attention learns recall-and-predict map from mixture contexts. Proves minimax optimality for learned attention.

entry.title: Ultrafast On-chip Online Learning via Spline Locality in Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks

author.name: Duc Hoang, Aarush Gupta, Philip Harris

entry.summary: Demonstrates KANs enable ultrafast on-chip online learning by exploiting B-spline locality for sparse updates and robustness to fixed-point quantization. Implements on FPGA.

entry.title: Faithful-Patchscopes: Understanding and Mitigating Model Bias in Hidden Representations Explanation of Large Language Models

author.name: Xilin Gong, Shu Yang, Zehua Cao, Lynne Billard, Di Wang

entry.summary: Reveals systematic unfaithfulness in Patchscopes where LLMs override encoded contextual information with prior linguistic associations during interpretation. Proposes Faithful-Patchscopes to mitigate this bias.

entry.title: Distilling Token-Trained Models into Byte-Level Models

author.name: Zishuo Bao, Jiaqi Leng, Junxiong Wang, Bowen Peng, Yucheng Lu

entry.summary: Proposes efficient distillation recipe for converting token-trained LLMs to byte-level models through progressive knowledge distillation and byte-level SFT. Validates across Llama and Qwen families.

entry.title: Balancing Understanding and Generation in Discrete Diffusion Models

author.name: Yue Liu, Yuzhong Zhao, Zheyong Xie, Qixiang Ye, Jianbin Jiao, Yao Hu, Shaosheng Cao, Yunfan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes XDLM unifying Masked and Uniform-noise diffusion language models via stationary noise kernel, recovering each as special case. Provides algebraic simplification reducing memory bottleneck.

entry.title: From Latent Signals to Reflection Behavior: Tracing Meta-Cognitive Activation Trajectory in R1-Style LLMs

author.name: Yanrui Du, Yibo Gao, Sendong Zhao, Jiayun Li, Haochun Wang, Qika Lin, Kai He, Bing Qin, Mengling Feng

entry.summary: Analyzes internal mechanisms of R1-style LLMs during self-reflection, identifying three-phase activation trajectory: latent-control layers encoding thinking budget, semantic-pivot layers for discourse cues, and behavior-overt layers for reflection tokens.

entry.title: DuoGen: Towards General Purpose Interleaved Multimodal Generation

author.name: Min Shi, Xiaohui Zeng, Jiannan Huang, Yin Cui, Francesco Ferroni, Jialuo Li, Shubham Pachori, Zhaoshuo Li, Yogesh Balaji, Haoxiang Wang, Tsung-Yi Lin, Xiao Fu, Yue Zhao, Chieh-Yun Chen, Ming-Yu Liu, Humphrey Shi

entry.summary: DuoGen framework for interleaved multimodal generation addresses data curation, architecture design, and evaluation. Uses large-scale instruction-tuning dataset from curated websites and synthetic examples.

entry.title: MedAD-R1: Eliciting Consistent Reasoning in Interpretible Medical Anomaly Detection via Consistency-Reinforced Policy Optimization

author.name: Haitao Zhang, Yingying Wang, Jiaxiang Wang, Haote Xu, Hongyang Zhang, Yirong Chen, Yue Huang, Xinghao Ding

entry.summary: Introduces MedAD-38K, first large-scale multi-modal medical anomaly detection benchmark with CoT annotations, and proposes two-stage training with cognitive injection and consistency-reinforced policy optimization.

entry.title: Fact or Fake? Assessing the Role of Deepfake Detectors in Multimodal Misinformation Detection

author.name: A S M Sharifuzzaman Sagar, Mohammed Bennamoun, Farid Boussaid, Naeha Sharif, Lian Xu, Shaaban Sahmoud, Ali Kishk

entry.summary: Provides first systematic analysis of whether pixel-level deepfake detectors contribute useful signal for multimodal misinformation detection, finding they can introduce misleading priors.

entry.title: UniDriveDreamer: A Single-Stage Multimodal World Model for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Guosheng Zhao, Yaozeng Wang, Xiaofeng Wang, Zheng Zhu, Tingdong Yu, Guan Huang, Yongchen Zai, Ji Jiao, Changliang Xue, Xiaole Wang, Zhen Yang, Futang Zhu, Xingang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces UniDriveDreamer, a single-stage unified multimodal world model for autonomous driving that generates both multi-camera video and LiDAR sequences without intermediate representations.

entry.title: Latent Reasoning VLA: Latent Thinking and Prediction for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Shuanghao Bai, Jing Lyu, Wanqi Zhou, Zhe Li, Dakai Wang, Lei Xing, Xiaoguang Zhao, Pengwei Wang, Zhongyuan Wang, Cheng Chi, Badong Chen, Shanghang Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces LaRA-VLA, internalizing chain-of-thought reasoning into continuous latent representations for VLA models, eliminating explicit CoT generation at inference.

entry.title: Learning Modal-Mixed Chain-of-Thought Reasoning with Latent Embeddings

author.name: Yifei Shao, Kun Zhou, Ziming Xu, Mohammad Atif Quamar, Shibo Hao, Zhen Wang, Zhiting Hu, Biwei Huang

entry.summary: Introduces modal-mixed CoT interleaving text with visual sketches as latent embeddings for multimodal reasoning. Uses VLM as encoder with diffusion-based decoder to bridge modality gap without eroding original capabilities.

entry.title: MindGuard: Guardrail Classifiers for Multi-Turn Mental Health Support

author.name: Ant\'onio Farinhas, Nuno M. Guerreiro, Jos\'e Pombal, Pedro Henrique Martins, Laura Melton, Alex Conway, Cara Dochat, Maya D'Eon, Ricardo Rei

entry.summary: Introduces clinically grounded risk taxonomy for mental health AI with MindGuard-testset of expert-annotated multi-turn conversations. Distinguishes therapeutic disclosures from clinical crises.

entry.title: Probing RLVR training instability through the lens of objective-level hacking

author.name: Yiming Dong, Kun Fu, Haoyu Li, Xinyuan Zhu, Yurou Liu, Lijing Shao, Jieping Ye, Zheng Wang

entry.summary: Analyzes RLVR training instability through objective-level hacking framework, showing it emerges from token-level credit misalignment as spurious optimization signals. Focuses on MoE architecture failures.

entry.title: Workflow-R1: Group Sub-sequence Policy Optimization for Multi-turn Workflow Construction

author.name: Mingze Kong, Zikun Qu, Zhongquan Zhou, Pengyu Liang, Xiang Li, Zhiwei Shang, Zhi Hong, Kaiyu Huang, Zhiyong Wang, Zhongxiang Dai

entry.summary: Presents Workflow-R1, reformulating agentic workflow construction as multi-turn natural language decision-making instead of one-shot code generation. Introduces Group Sub-sequence Policy Optimization (GSsPO) for optimization.

entry.title: Mitigating loss of control in advanced AI systems through instrumental goal trajectories

author.name: Willem Fourie

entry.summary: Develops instrumental goal trajectories framework for mitigating AI loss of control by tracking how advanced systems gain capability through accessing technical and monetary resources.

entry.title: Rethinking the Role of Entropy in Optimizing Tool-Use Behaviors for Large Language Model Agents

author.name: Zeping Li, Hongru Wang, Yiwen Zhao, Guanhua Chen, Yixia Li, Keyang Chen, Yixin Cao, Guangnan Ye, Hongfeng Chai, Mengdi Wang, Zhenfei Yin

entry.summary: Finds strong positive correlation between entropy reduction and high-quality tool calls, proposing entropy-based reward strategies with sparse outcome rewards and dense shaping rewards.

entry.title: Thinking with Comics: Enhancing Multimodal Reasoning through Structured Visual Storytelling

author.name: Andong Chen, Wenxin Zhu, Qiuyu Ding, Yuchen Song, Muyun Yang, Tiejun Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Thinking with Comics as visual reasoning paradigm positioned between images and videos, preserving temporal structure and narrative coherence with lower computational cost.

entry.title: VoxServe: Streaming-Centric Serving System for Speech Language Models

author.name: Keisuke Kamahori, Wei-Tzu Lee, Atindra Jha, Rohan Kadekodi, Stephanie Wang, Arvind Krishnamurthy, Baris Kasikci

entry.summary: VoxServe is a unified serving system for speech language models with model-execution abstraction decoupling architecture from optimizations, enabling streaming-aware scheduling and async inference.

entry.title: LatentLens: Revealing Highly Interpretable Visual Tokens in LLMs

author.name: Benno Krojer, Shravan Nayak, Oscar Ma\~nas, Vaibhav Adlakha, Desmond Elliott, Siva Reddy, Marius Mosbach

entry.summary: LatentLens interprets visual tokens in VLMs by encoding large text corpus and comparing visual representations to contextualized token embeddings, revealing what information is encoded at each layer.

entry.title: Non-Contrastive Vision-Language Learning with Predictive Embedding Alignment

author.name: Lukas Kuhn, Giuseppe Serra, Florian Buettner

entry.summary: Introduces NOVA, a non-contrastive vision-language alignment framework that eliminates need for negative sampling, momentum encoders, and stop-gradients. Uses distributional regularization to maintain representation quality with a single hyperparameter.

entry.title: Neural FOXP2 -- Language Specific Neuron Steering for Targeted Language Improvement in LLMs

author.name: Anusa Saha, Tanmay Joshi, Vinija Jain, Aman Chadha, Amitava Das

entry.summary: Introduces Neural FOXP2 for steering language-specific neurons to make a chosen language primary in multilingual LLMs. Uses SAEs to localize language neurons and steers them to promote Hindi or Spanish.

entry.title: Dispelling the Curse of Singularities in Neural Network Optimizations

author.name: Hengjie Cao, Mengyi Chen, Yifeng Yang, Fang Dong, Ruijun Huang, Anrui Chen, Jixian Zhou, Mingzhi Dong, Yujiang Wang, Dongsheng Li, Wenyi Fang, Yuanyi Lin, Fan Wu, Li Shang

entry.summary: Identifies 'curse of singularities'—mutual reinforcement of weight and representation singularities during training leading to loss explosions. Proposes Parametric Smoothing for prevention.

entry.title: CoDiQ: Test-Time Scaling for Controllable Difficult Question Generation

author.name: Zhongyuan Peng, Caijun Xu, Changyi Xiao, Shibo Hong, Eli Zhang, Stephen Huang, Yixin Cao
