entry.summary: CoDiQ enables fine-grained difficulty control in question generation via test-time scaling, identifying that extended reasoning budget increases difficulty but reduces solvability, and deriving upper bounds on generation quality.

entry.title: IRIS: Implicit Reward-Guided Internal Sifting for Mitigating Multimodal Hallucination

author.name: Yuanshuai Li, Yuping Yan, Jirui Han, Fei Ming, Lingjuan Lv, Yaochu Jin

entry.summary: IRIS mitigates multimodal hallucination using implicit rewards in log-probability space to capture internal modal competition, enabling on-policy fine-grained optimization without external evaluators.

entry.title: Beyond RAG for Agent Memory: Retrieval by Decoupling and Aggregation

author.name: Zhanghao Hu, Qinglin Zhu, Hanqi Yan, Yulan He, Lin Gui

entry.summary: Argues agent memory should move beyond RAG similarity matching to decoupling and aggregation: disentangling memories into semantic components and organizing hierarchically for temporal coherence.

entry.title: Logic-Guided Vector Fields for Constrained Generative Modeling

author.name: Ali Baheri

entry.summary: Proposes Logic-Guided Vector Fields (LGVF) injecting symbolic constraints into flow matching generative models through differentiable logic relaxations during training and inference-time gradient steering.

entry.title: Revisiting Adaptive Rounding with Vectorized Reparameterization for LLM Quantization

author.name: Yuli Zhou, Qingxuan Chen, Luca Benini, Guolei Sun, Yawei Li

entry.summary: Proposes VQRound for efficient adaptive rounding in LLM quantization via codebook reparameterization, minimizing worst-case error under L∞ norm for heavy-tailed distributions.

entry.title: Certain Head, Uncertain Tail: Expert-Sample for Test-Time Scaling in Fine-Grained MoE

author.name: Yuanteng Chen, Peisong Wang, Nanxin Zeng, Yuantian Shao, Gang Li, Jing Liu, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: Discovers that fine-grained MoE routing exhibits a 'certain head' of high-confidence experts and 'uncertain tail' of low-confidence candidates. Proposes Expert-Sample method exploiting this pattern for test-time scaling.

entry.title: From Pixels to Facts (Pix2Fact): Benchmarking Multi-Hop Reasoning for Fine-Grained Visual Fact Checking

author.name: Yifan Jiang, Cong Zhang, Bofei Zhang, Yifan Yang, Bingzhang Wang, Yew-Soon Ong

entry.summary: Pix2Fact benchmark evaluates VLMs on fine-grained visual fact-checking requiring detailed grounding and multi-hop reasoning. 1,000 high-resolution images with PhD-annotated questions.

entry.title: Don't Judge a Book by its Cover: Testing LLMs' Robustness Under Logical Obfuscation

author.name: Abhilekh Borah, Shubhra Ghosh, Kedar Joshi, Aditya Kumar Guru, Kripabandhu Ghosh

entry.summary: Introduces Logifus framework for logical obfuscation and LogiQAte benchmark testing LLMs on logically equivalent but obfuscated problems. Shows LLMs fail when problems are reformulated.

entry.title: SSI-DM: Singularity Skipping Inversion of Diffusion Models

author.name: Chen Min, Enze Jiang, Jishen Peng, Zheng Ma

entry.summary: Proposes SSI-DM addressing mathematical singularity in diffusion model inversion that makes early noising steps ill-posed, achieving better Gaussian properties in inverted noise.

entry.title: AgenticLab: A Real-World Robot Agent Platform that Can See, Think, and Act

author.name: Pengyuan Guo, Zhonghao Mai, Zhengtong Xu, Kaidi Zhang, Heng Zhang, Zichen Miao, Arash Ajoudani, Zachary Kingston, Qiang Qiu, Yu She

entry.summary: Presents AgenticLab, a model-agnostic robot agent platform and benchmark for open-world VLM-based manipulation with closed-loop pipeline.

entry.title: How Far Are LLMs from Professional Poker Players? Revisiting Game-Theoretic Reasoning with Agentic Tool Use

author.name: Minhua Lin, Enyan Dai, Hui Liu, Xianfeng Tang, Yuliang Yan, Zhenwei Dai, Jingying Zeng, Zhiwei Zhang, Fali Wang, Hongcheng Gao, Chen Luo, Xiang Zhang, Qi He, Suhang Wang

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates LLMs on poker tasks including gameplay and reasoning traces, finding three failure modes: heuristic reliance, factual misunderstandings, and knowing-doing gap. Initial RL approaches improve style but not reasoning quality.

entry.title: Resource-Efficient Reinforcement for Reasoning Large Language Models via Dynamic One-Shot Policy Refinement

author.name: Yunjian Zhang, Sudong Wang, Yang Li, Peiran Xu, Conghao Zhou, Xiaoyue Ma, Jianing Li, Yao Zhu

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical lower bound on sample complexity for RLVR reasoning and proposes dynamic one-shot policy refinement for resource efficiency. Shows strong performance achievable with small training instances.

entry.title: SimGym: Traffic-Grounded Browser Agents for Offline A/B Testing in E-Commerce

author.name: Alberto Castelo, Zahra Zanjani Foumani, Ailin Fan, Keat Yang Koay, Vibhor Malik, Yuanzheng Zhu, Han Li, Meysam Feghhi, Ronie Uliana, Shuang Xie, Zhaoyu Zhang, Angelo Ocana Martins, Mingyu Zhao, Francis Pelland, Jonathan Faerman, Nikolas LeBlanc, Aaron Glazer, Andrew McNamara, Lingyun Wang, Zhong Wu

entry.summary: SimGym enables offline A/B testing for e-commerce using traffic-grounded synthetic buyers powered by LLM agents operating in live browsers, validated against real human outcomes.

entry.title: Controlling Exploration-Exploitation in GFlowNets via Markov Chain Perspectives

author.name: Lin Chen, Samuel Drapeau, Fanghao Shao, Xuekai Zhu, Bo Xue, Yunchong Song, Mathieu Lauri\`ere, Zhouhan Lin

entry.summary: Establishes equivalence between GFlowNet objectives and Markov chain reversibility, proposing α-GFNs that generalize mixing parameter for direct control over exploration-exploitation dynamics.

entry.title: SafeGround: Know When to Trust GUI Grounding Models via Uncertainty Calibration

author.name: Qingni Wang, Yue Fan, Xin Eric Wang

entry.summary: SafeGround provides uncertainty-aware GUI grounding framework using distribution-aware uncertainty quantification to enable risk-aware predictions before risky GUI interactions.

entry.title: When Agents "Misremember" Collectively: Exploring the Mandela Effect in LLM-based Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Naen Xu, Hengyu An, Shuo Shi, Jinghuai Zhang, Chunyi Zhou, Changjiang Li, Tianyu Du, Zhihui Fu, Jun Wang, Shouling Ji

entry.summary: Studies the Mandela effect (collective false memories) in LLM-based multi-agent systems, examining how agents can collectively misremember due to social influence and internalized misinformation.

entry.title: Eliciting Trustworthiness Priors of Large Language Models via Economic Games

author.name: Siyu Yan, Lusha Zhu, Jian-Qiao Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes novel method using iterated in-context learning to elicit LLM trustworthiness priors via the Trust Game from behavioral game theory. Documents systematic rationality bias in baseline LLM behavior.

entry.title: Context Dependence and Reliability in Autoregressive Language Models

author.name: Poushali Sengupta, Shashi Raj Pandey, Sabita Maharjan, Frank Eliassen

entry.summary: Proposes RISE method for context attribution in LLMs that handles redundancy by quantifying unique influence of context elements, addressing instability from overlapping information.

entry.title: The Strategic Foresight of LLMs: Evidence from a Fully Prospective Venture Tournament

author.name: Felipe A. Csaszar, Aticus Peterson, Daniel Wilde

entry.summary: Tests LLM strategic foresight via prospective Kickstarter prediction tournament using live projects after model training cutoffs. Compares frontier LLMs against experienced human managers and MBA-trained analysts.

entry.title: Learning Sparse Visual Representations via Spatial-Semantic Factorization

author.name: Theodore Zhengde Zhao, Sid Kiblawi, Jianwei Yang, Naoto Usuyama, Reuben Tan, Noel C Codella, Tristan Naumann, Hoifung Poon, Mu Wei

entry.summary: STELLAR resolves SSL conflict between semantic understanding and reconstruction by factorizing visual features into low-rank product of semantic concepts and spatial distributions, enabling both DINO-style alignment and reconstruction.

entry.title: SAME: Stabilized Mixture-of-Experts for Multimodal Continual Instruction Tuning

author.name: Zhen-Hao Xie, Jun-Tao Tang, Yu-Cheng Shi, Han-Jia Ye, De-Chuan Zhan, Da-Wei Zhou

entry.summary: SAME addresses router drift in multimodal continual instruction tuning for MLLMs, where expert routing changes as data distribution evolves, causing catastrophic forgetting of specialized capabilities.

entry.title: Efficient and accurate steering of Large Language Models through attention-guided feature learning

author.name: Parmida Davarmanesh, Ashia Wilson, Adityanarayanan Radhakrishnan

entry.summary: Introduces attention-guided steering framework for LLMs addressing: automatic token selection for concept extraction, heterogeneity across layers, and multi-concept interference. Shows seemingly non-steerable concepts become steerable with proper algorithmic choices.

entry.title: Learning to Route and Schedule LLMs from User Retrials via Contextual Queueing Bandits

author.name: Seoungbin Bae, Junyoung Son, Dabeen Lee

entry.summary: Proposes Contextual Queueing Bandits with MNL feedback (CQB-MNL) for joint LLM routing and scheduling, leveraging implicit feedback from user retrial behavior.

entry.title: Unlocking the Duality between Flow and Field Matching

author.name: Daniil Shlenskii, Alexander Varlamov, Nazar Buzun, Alexander Korotin

entry.summary: Shows Conditional Flow Matching and Interaction Field Matching coincide for forward-only IFM subclass, providing explicit constructions between frameworks.

entry.title: SPARKLING: Balancing Signal Preservation and Symmetry Breaking for Width-Progressive Learning

author.name: Qifan Yu, Xinyu Ma, Zhijian Zhuo, Minrui Wang, Deyi Liu, Shiyi Zhan, Yiyuan Ma, Liang Xiang, Xingyan Bin, Di He

entry.summary: SPARKLING enables mid-stage width expansion in progressive pre-training by balancing signal preservation (activation statistics) and symmetry breaking (gradient diversity). Addresses training instabilities that limited previous approaches.

entry.title: Shuffle and Joint Differential Privacy for Generalized Linear Contextual Bandits

author.name: Sahasrajit Sarmasarkar

entry.summary: First algorithms for generalized linear contextual bandits under shuffle and joint differential privacy. Addresses challenges of no closed-form estimator and privacy tracking across evolving design matrices.

entry.title: LLM-based Embeddings: Attention Values Encode Sentence Semantics Better Than Hidden States

author.name: Yeqin Zhang, Yunfei Wang, Jiaxuan Chen, Ke Qin, Yizheng Zhao, Cam-Tu Nguyen

entry.summary: Shows attention value vectors capture sentence semantics more effectively than hidden states. Proposes Value Aggregation pooling across layers and tokens, outperforming other LLM-based embeddings.

entry.title: From Directions to Regions: Decomposing Activations in Language Models via Local Geometry

author.name: Or Shafran, Shaked Ronen, Omri Fahn, Shauli Ravfogel, Atticus Geiger, Mor Geva

entry.summary: Uses Mixture of Factor Analyzers to decompose LLM activations into Gaussian regions rather than single directions, challenging linear separability assumptions. Shows centroids encode task distinctions while local variations capture output specifics.

entry.title: What Does Vision Tool-Use Reinforcement Learning Really Learn? Disentangling Tool-Induced and Intrinsic Effects for Crop-and-Zoom

author.name: Yan Ma, Weiyu Zhang, Tianle Li, Linge Du, Xuyang Shen, Pengfei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces MED framework to disentangle intrinsic capability changes from tool-induced effects in vision tool-use RL, finding improvements are dominated by intrinsic learning rather than tool use.

entry.title: PISCES: Annotation-free Text-to-Video Post-Training via Optimal Transport-Aligned Rewards

author.name: Minh-Quan Le, Gaurav Mittal, Cheng Zhao, David Gu, Dimitris Samaras, Mei Chen

entry.summary: Proposes PISCES for annotation-free text-to-video post-training using Dual Optimal Transport-aligned rewards. Bridges embedding misalignment without requiring human preference annotations.

entry.title: Show, Don't Tell: Morphing Latent Reasoning into Image Generation

author.name: Harold Haodong Chen, Xinxiang Yin, Wen-Jie Shu, Hongfei Zhang, Zixin Zhang, Chenfei Liao, Litao Guo, Qifeng Chen, Ying-Cong Chen

entry.summary: Introduces LatentMorph for text-to-image generation with implicit latent reasoning, using condenser, transformer, and decoder components to integrate reasoning without explicit text decoding.

entry.title: StreamVLA: Breaking the Reason-Act Cycle via Completion-State Gating

author.name: Hang Wu, Tongqing Chen, Jiasen Wang, Xiaotao Li, Lu Fang

entry.summary: Introduces StreamVLA with dual-system architecture separating high-level planning (System 2) from low-level control (System 1), using Lock-and-Gated mechanism to reduce redundant reasoning.

entry.title: SayNext-Bench: Why Do LLMs Struggle with Next-Utterance Prediction?

author.name: Yueyi Yang, Haotian Liu, Fang Kang, Mengqi Zhang, Zheng Lian, Hao Tang, Haoyu Chen

entry.summary: Introduces SayNext-Bench showing LLMs struggle to predict human speakers' next utterances despite conversational fluency. Evaluates both LLMs and MLLMs on anticipating responses from multimodal cues across real-world scenarios.

entry.title: Position: Human-Centric AI Requires a Minimum Viable Level of Human Understanding

author.name: Fangzhou Lin, Qianwen Ge, Lingyu Xu, Peiran Li, Xiangbo Gao, Shuo Xing, Kazunori Yamada, Ziming Zhang, Haichong Zhang, Zhengzhong Tu

entry.summary: Position paper defining Capability-Comprehension Gap where AI assistance improves performance while degrading user understanding. Proposes Cognitive Integrity Threshold (CIT) as minimum comprehension for meaningful oversight.

entry.title: Learning Abstractions for Hierarchical Planning in Program-Synthesis Agents

author.name: Zergham Ahmed, Kazuki Irie, Joshua B. Tenenbaum, Christopher J. Bates, Samuel J. Gershman

entry.summary: Introduces TheoryCoder-2, a theory-based RL agent that learns reusable abstractions using LLM in-context learning rather than relying on hand-specified ones. Inspired by cognitive science on human abstraction formation.

entry.title: FutureMind: Equipping Small Language Models with Strategic Thinking-Pattern Priors via Adaptive Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Shaoxiong Yang, Junting Li, Mengyuan Zhang, Chao Li, Wei Liu, Jian Luan

entry.summary: FutureMind equips Small Language Models with strategic reasoning capabilities through adaptive knowledge distillation from LLMs, using modular reasoning pipeline with problem analysis, logical reasoning, strategy planning, and retrieval guidance.

entry.title: Qrita: High-performance Top-k and Top-p Algorithm for GPUs using Pivot-based Truncation and Selection

author.name: Jongseok Park, Sunga Kim, Alvin Cheung, Ion Stoica

entry.summary: Qrita introduces efficient GPU algorithm for Top-k and Top-p sampling using pivot-based selection with Gaussian sigma-truncation, avoiding expensive sorting operations.

entry.title: Entropy-Guided Data-Efficient Training for Multimodal Reasoning Reward Models

author.name: Shidong Yang, Tongwen Huang, Hao Wen, Yong Wang, Li Chen, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Identifies correlation between response entropy and accuracy in multimodal reward models, proposing Entropy-Guided Training to address annotation noise and sample difficulty.

entry.title: Position: Explaining Behavioral Shifts in Large Language Models Requires a Comparative Approach

author.name: Martino Ciaperoni, Marzio Di Vece, Luca Pappalardo, Fosca Giannotti, Francesco Giannini

entry.summary: Position paper arguing behavioral shifts in LLMs (from scaling, fine-tuning, RLHF) should be explained comparatively, targeting intervention-induced changes between reference and intervened models.

entry.title: Unlocking Electronic Health Records: A Hybrid Graph RAG Approach to Safe Clinical AI for Patient QA

author.name: Samuel Thio, Matthew Lewis, Spiros Denaxas, Richard JB Dobson

entry.summary: Presents MediGRAF, a hybrid Graph RAG system combining Neo4j Text2Cypher for structured EHR data and semantic search for unstructured clinical text to reduce hallucinations in clinical AI.

entry.title: Interpreting and Controlling Model Behavior via Constitutions for Atomic Concept Edits

author.name: Neha Kalibhat, Zi Wang, Prasoon Bajpai, Drew Proud, Wenjun Zeng, Been Kim, Mani Malek

entry.summary: Introduces black-box interpretability framework learning natural language 'constitutions' describing how atomic concept edits in prompts affect model behavior, enabling verifiable model understanding.

entry.title: Block removal for large language models through constrained binary optimization

author.name: David Jansen, Roman Rausch, David Montero, Roman Orus

entry.summary: Formulates LLM block removal as constrained binary optimization mappable to an Ising model, enabling efficient exploration of non-trivial block removal configurations beyond consecutive regions.

entry.title: SA-VLA: Spatially-Aware Flow-Matching for Vision-Language-Action Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xu Pan, Zhenglin Wan, Xingrui Yu, Xianwei Zheng, Youkai Ke, Ming Sun, Rui Wang, Ziwei Wang, Ivor Tsang

entry.summary: Proposes SA-VLA, a spatially-aware RL adaptation framework for Vision-Language-Action models that preserves spatial grounding during policy optimization through aligned representation learning and reward design.

entry.title: RMFlow: Refined Mean Flow by a Noise-Injection Step for Multimodal Generation

author.name: Yuhao Huang, Shih-Hsin Wang, Andrea L. Bertozzi, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces RMFlow combining 1-NFE MeanFlow with a tailored noise-injection refinement step for efficient multimodal generation. Achieves near SOTA on text-to-image, molecule, and time-series generation with single NFE.

entry.title: Supervised Fine-Tuning Needs to Unlock the Potential of Token Priority

author.name: Zhanming Shen, Zeyu Qin, Jiaqi Hu, Wentao Ye, Hao Chen, Xiaomeng Hu, Haokai Xu, Gang Chen, Yi R. Fung, Haobo Wang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing supervised fine-tuning should leverage token-level priority to bridge the gap between empirical data fitting and human utility alignment.

entry.title: The Effect of Mini-Batch Noise on the Implicit Bias of Adam

author.name: Matias D. Cattaneo, Boris Shigida

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework for understanding how mini-batch noise in Adam influences implicit bias toward sharper or flatter loss regions, relevant for multi-epoch training and generalization in deep learning.

entry.title: GRAB: An LLM-Inspired Sequence-First Click-Through Rate Prediction Modeling Paradigm

author.name: Shaopeng Chen, Chuyue Xie, Huimin Ren, Shaozong Zhang, Han Zhang, Ruobing Cheng, Zhiqiang Cao, Zehao Ju, Gao Yu, Jie Ding, Xiaodong Chen, Xuewu Jiao, Shuanglong Li, Liu Lin

entry.summary: GRAB is a generative CTR prediction framework deployed at Baidu using Causal Action-aware Multi-channel Attention (CamA) for user behavior sequences, achieving 3.05% revenue and 3.49% CTR increase in full-scale deployment.

entry.title: Preserve-Then-Quantize: Balancing Rank Budgets for Quantization Error Reconstruction in LLMs

author.name: Yoonjun Cho, Dongjae Jeon, Soeun Kim, Moongyu Jeon, Albert No

entry.summary: SRR proposes rank allocation framework for quantization error reconstruction that preserves top-k singular subspace before quantization and uses remaining rank for error reconstruction with theory-guided selection.

entry.title: Scalable Spatio-Temporal SE(3) Diffusion for Long-Horizon Protein Dynamics

author.name: Nima Shoghi, Yuxuan Liu, Yuning Shen, Rob Brekelmans, Pan Li, Quanquan Gu

entry.summary: STAR-MD is an SE(3)-equivariant diffusion model that generates physically plausible protein trajectories over microsecond timescales using causal diffusion transformer with joint spatio-temporal attention.

entry.title: RACA: Representation-Aware Coverage Criteria for LLM Safety Testing

author.name: Zeming Wei, Zhixin Zhang, Chengcan Wu, Yihao Zhang, Xiaokun Luan, Meng Sun

entry.summary: RACA introduces representation-aware coverage criteria for LLM safety testing using representation engineering to systematically evaluate test adequacy for jailbreak detection.

entry.title: Advancing General-Purpose Reasoning Models with Modular Gradient Surgery

author.name: Min Cai, Yu Liang, Longzheng Wang, Yan Wang, Yueyang Zhang, Long Xia, Zhiyuan Sun, Xi Ye, Daiting Shi

entry.summary: Modular Gradient Surgery (MGS) resolves gradient conflicts at module level within transformers for multi-task LLM training, addressing cross-domain interference that limits sequential and mixed RL approaches.

entry.title: RE-TRAC: REcursive TRAjectory Compression for Deep Search Agents

author.name: Jialiang Zhu, Gongrui Zhang, Xiaolong Ma, Lin Xu, Miaosen Zhang, Ruiqi Yang, Song Wang, Kai Qiu, Zhirong Wu, Qi Dai, Ruichun Ma, Bei Liu, Yifan Yang, Chong Luo, Zhengyuan Yang, Linjie Li, Lijuan Wang, Weizhu Chen, Xin Geng, Baining Guo

entry.summary: RE-TRAC overcomes ReAct limitations through cross-trajectory exploration with structured state representations summarizing evidence, uncertainties, and plans to condition subsequent search trajectories.

entry.title: Dispersion Loss Counteracts Embedding Condensation and Improves Generalization in Small Language Models

author.name: Chen Liu, Xingzhi Sun, Xi Xiao, Alexandre Van Tassel, Ke Xu, Kristof Reimann, Danqi Liao, Mark Gerstein, Tianyang Wang, Xiao Wang, Smita Krishnaswamy

entry.summary: Identifies 'embedding condensation' phenomenon where token embeddings collapse into narrow cone-like subspace in small language models. Shows small models (GPT2, Qwen3-0.6B) exhibit severe condensation while larger models don't. Proposes dispersion loss to counteract.

entry.title: Provable Model Provenance Set for Large Language Models

author.name: Xiaoqi Qiu, Hao Zeng, Zhiyu Hou, Hongxin Wei

entry.summary: Introduces Model Provenance Set (MPS), a framework for identifying LLM sources with provable coverage guarantees at a prescribed confidence level. Uses sequential test-and-exclusion to construct small provenance sets.

entry.title: Optimal Budgeted Adaptation of Large Language Models

author.name: Jing Wang, Jie Shen, Dean Foster, Zohar Karnin, Jeremy C Weiss

entry.summary: Frames budget-aware LLM fine-tuning as a contextual Stackelberg game where the learner commits to a scoring policy while an adversarial environment selects challenging alternatives. Achieves O(d√T) regret.

entry.title: On the Expressive Power of Permutation-Equivariant Weight-Space Networks

author.name: Adir Dayan, Yam Eitan, Haggai Maron

entry.summary: Provides comprehensive expressivity analysis of permutation-equivariant weight-space networks, characterizing their ability to express maps on both weight and function spaces.

entry.title: WinFLoRA: Incentivizing Client-Adaptive Aggregation in Federated LoRA under Privacy Heterogeneity

author.name: Mengsha Kou, Xiaoyu Xia, Ziqi Wang, Ibrahim Khalil, Runkun Luo, Jingwen Zhou, Minhui Xue

entry.summary: Proposes WinFLoRA for federated LoRA under privacy heterogeneity, using aggregation weights as incentives with noise-aware estimation to handle different DP levels across clients.

entry.title: Generalized Radius and Integrated Codebook Transforms for Differentiable Vector Quantization

author.name: Haochen You, Heng Zhang, Hongyang He, Yuqi Li, Baojing Liu

entry.summary: Proposes GRIT-VQ for differentiable vector quantization using radius-based updates and integrated codebook transforms, addressing straight-through estimator limitations that cause codebook underutilization.

entry.title: PolicyFlow: Policy Optimization with Continuous Normalizing Flow in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shunpeng Yang, Ben Liu, Hua Chen

entry.summary: Proposes PolicyFlow, extending PPO to continuous normalizing flow policy models by avoiding expensive likelihood evaluation along full flow trajectories.

entry.title: Diving into Kronecker Adapters: Component Design Matters

author.name: Jiayu Bai, Danchen Yu, Zhenyu Liao, TianQi Hou, Feng Zhou, Robert C. Qiu, Zenan Ling

entry.summary: Analyzes Kronecker adapter component design, showing dimensions and number of components significantly affect capacity and alignment with full fine-tuning. Proposes Component Designed Kronecker Adapters.

entry.title: Gradient-Aligned Calibration for Post-Training Quantization of Diffusion Models

author.name: Dung Anh Hoang, Cuong Pham anh Trung Le, Jianfei Cai, Toan Do

entry.summary: Proposes gradient-aligned calibration for post-training quantization of diffusion models, using time-aware weighting for calibration samples based on their gradient contributions.

entry.title: Finding Differentially Private Second Order Stationary Points in Stochastic Minimax Optimization

author.name: Difei Xu, Youming Tao, Meng Ding, Chenglin Fan, Di Wang

entry.summary: Provides first study of finding differentially private second-order stationary points in stochastic minimax optimization, with unified treatment of empirical and population risks.

entry.title: The Inlet Rank Collapse in Implicit Neural Representations: Diagnosis and Unified Remedy

author.name: Jianqiao Zheng, Hemanth Saratchandran, Simon Lucey

entry.summary: Identifies 'Inlet Rank Collapse' as the root cause of why implicit neural representations struggle with fine details. Provides layer-wise NTK decomposition showing the input layer fails to span the embedding space, unifying explanations for why PE, SIREN, and BN work.

entry.title: Designing Time Series Experiments in A/B Testing with Transformer Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xiangkun Wu, Qianglin Wen, Yingying Zhang, Hongtu Zhu, Ting Li, Chengchun Shi

entry.summary: Proposes using transformer RL to design time series A/B testing experiments, establishing impossibility theorem showing suboptimality of not conditioning on full history and developing practical algorithm.

entry.title: Prediction-Powered Risk Monitoring of Deployed Models for Detecting Harmful Distribution Shifts

author.name: Guangyi Zhang, Yunlong Cai, Guanding Yu, Osvaldo Simeone

entry.summary: Proposes PPRM for semi-supervised monitoring of deployed models using prediction-powered inference to detect harmful distribution shifts with finite-sample false alarm guarantees.

entry.title: Embedding Perturbation may Better Reflect the Uncertainty in LLM Reasoning

author.name: Qihao Wen, Jiahao Wang, Yang Nan, Pengfei He, Ravi Tandon, Han Xu

entry.summary: Studies which uncertainty quantification metrics better reflect LLM 'intermediate uncertainty' during reasoning, finding that embedding perturbation methods capture step-level uncertainty better than output-based approaches.

entry.title: CAPA: Contribution-Aware Pruning and FFN Approximation for Efficient Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Samyak Jha, Junho Kim

entry.summary: CAPA improves VLM efficiency using 'Attention Contribution' (attention weighted by value magnitude) for visual token selection. Identifies heterogeneous visual attention sinks as Probability Dumps vs Structural Anchors.

entry.title: Zero-Flow Encoders

author.name: Yakun Wang, Leyang Wang, Song Liu, Taiji Suzuki

entry.summary: Zero-Flow Encoders use rectified flow's zero-flow criterion at t=0.5 to certify conditional independence and extract sufficient information for representation learning.

entry.title: Privacy Amplification by Missing Data

author.name: Simon Roburin (LPSM), Rafa\"el Pinot (LPSM), Erwan Scornet (LPSM)

entry.summary: Studies privacy amplification from missing data perspective, showing that missingness inherently provides privacy protection. Provides theoretical analysis of this connection.

entry.title: Lookahead-then-Verify: Reliable Constrained Decoding for Diffusion LLMs under Context-Free Grammars

author.name: Yitong Zhang, Yongmin Li, Yuetong Liu, Jia Li, Xiaoran Jia, Zherui Li, Ge Li

entry.summary: Proposes Lookahead-then-Verify for constrained decoding in diffusion LLMs under context-free grammars. Addresses challenges of non-autoregressive generation for syntactically valid formal language output.

entry.title: Unifying Adversarial Robustness and Training Across Text Scoring Models

author.name: Manveer Singh Tamber, Hosna Oyarhoseini, Jimmy Lin

entry.summary: Proposes unifying adversarial robustness study across dense retrievers, rerankers, and reward models. Shows current adversarial training formulations fail to generalize across attacks.

entry.title: NEAT: Neuron-Based Early Exit for Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Kang Liu, Yongkang Liu, Xiaocui Yang, Peidong Wang, Wen Zhang, Shi Feng, Yifei Zhang, Daling Wang

entry.summary: NEAT addresses overthinking in Large Reasoning Models by monitoring neuron-level activation dynamics to enable training-free early exits without additional computation. Identifies exit-associated neurons for efficient reasoning termination.

entry.title: Distill3R: A Pipeline for Democratizing 3D Foundation Models on Commodity Hardware

author.name: Brandon Leblanc, Charalambos Poullis

entry.summary: Introduces Distill3R for distilling 3D foundation models into compact students trainable on single workstations via offline caching and confidence-aware distillation loss.

entry.title: GPD: Guided Progressive Distillation for Fast and High-Quality Video Generation

author.name: Xiao Liang, Yunzhu Zhang, Linchao Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Guided Progressive Distillation (GPD) for accelerating video diffusion with teacher model progressively guiding student to larger step sizes.

entry.title: LoopViT: Scaling Visual ARC with Looped Transformers

author.name: Wen-Jie Shu, Xuerui Qiu, Rui-Jie Zhu, Harold Haodong Chen, Yexin Liu, Harry Yang

entry.summary: Proposes Loop-ViT with weight-tied recurrence for ARC-AGI benchmark, decoupling reasoning depth from model capacity with dynamic exit based on predictive entropy.

entry.title: FD-VLA: Force-Distilled Vision-Language-Action Model for Contact-Rich Manipulation

author.name: Ruiteng Zhao, Wenshuo Wang, Yicheng Ma, Xiaocong Li, Francis E. H. Tay, Marcelo H. Ang Jr., Haiyue Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces FD-VLA, which integrates force awareness into VLA models without physical force sensors by distilling force representations from visual observations.

entry.title: KEPO: Knowledge-Enhanced Preference Optimization for Reinforcement Learning with Reasoning

author.name: Fan Yang, Rui Meng, Trudi Di Qi, Ali Ezzati, Yuxin Wen

entry.summary: Introduces KEPO for reinforcement learning with reasoning, using knowledge-enhanced approach to address sparse trajectory-level rewards and credit assignment challenges. Proposes selective distillation to avoid learning from flawed trajectories.

entry.title: Dual Latent Memory for Visual Multi-agent System

author.name: Xinlei Yu, Chengming Xu, Zhangquan Chen, Bo Yin, Cheng Yang, Yongbo He, Yihao Hu, Jiangning Zhang, Cheng Tan, Xiaobin Hu, Shuicheng Yan

entry.summary: Proposes L²-VMAS framework addressing the 'scaling wall' in visual multi-agent systems where more turns degrade performance. Uses dual latent memories for perception and thinking to reduce semantic loss from text-centric communication.

entry.title: Inference-Only Prompt Projection for Safe Text-to-Image Generation with TV Guarantees

author.name: Minhyuk Lee, Hyekyung Yoon, Myungjoo Kang

entry.summary: Proposes inference-only prompt projection for safe text-to-image generation with total variation guarantees. Formalizes Safety-Prompt Alignment Trade-off (SPAT) showing unavoidable trade-off between safety and alignment.

entry.title: SetPO: Set-Level Policy Optimization for Diversity-Preserving LLM Reasoning

author.name: Chenyi Li, Yuan Zhang, Bo Wang, Guoqing Ma, Wei Tang, Haoyang Huang, Nan Duan

entry.summary: Introduces SetPO with set-level diversity objective using kernelized similarity over sampled trajectories. Addresses reduced outcome diversity from RL optimization while maintaining reasoning performance.

entry.title: RE-MCDF: Closed-Loop Multi-Expert LLM Reasoning for Knowledge-Grounded Clinical Diagnosis

author.name: Shaowei Shen, Xiaohong Yang, Jie Yang, Lianfen Huang, Yongcai Zhang, Yang Zou, Seyyedali Hosseinalipour

entry.summary: RE-MCDF addresses clinical diagnosis challenges in noisy medical records through multi-expert LLM reasoning with closed-loop collaboration, incorporating disease logical dependencies like mutual exclusivity.

entry.title: Autonomous Question Formation for Large Language Model-Driven AI Systems

author.name: Hong Su

entry.summary: Proposes framework enabling AI systems to autonomously form questions and set tasks by reasoning over internal states and environmental observations, treating question formation as first-class decision process.

entry.title: MACD: Model-Aware Contrastive Decoding via Counterfactual Data

author.name: Qixin Xiao, Kun Zhou

entry.summary: MACD proposes model-aware contrastive decoding for video LLMs using model feedback to identify hallucination-causing regions and generate targeted counterfactual visual inputs.

entry.title: INDIBATOR: Diverse and Fact-Grounded Individuality for Multi-Agent Debate in Molecular Discovery

author.name: Yunhui Jang, Seonghyun Park, Jaehyung Kim, Sungsoo Ahn

entry.summary: INDIBATOR grounds multi-agent debate in individualized scientist profiles constructed from publication and molecular history for molecular discovery, moving beyond generic role-based personas.

entry.title: Trust by Design: Skill Profiles for Transparent, Cost-Aware LLM Routing

author.name: Mika Okamoto, Ansel Kaplan Erol, Glenn Matlin

entry.summary: BELLA recommends LLM selection through interpretable skill-based profiling with multi-objective optimization balancing performance and cost, decomposing capabilities into granular skills.

entry.title: Towards Agentic Intelligence for Materials Science

author.name: Huan Zhang, Yizhan Li, Wenhao Huang, Ziyu Hou, Yu Song, Xuye Liu, Farshid Effaty, Jinya Jiang, Sifan Wu, Qianggang Ding, Izumi Takahara, Leonard R. MacGillivray, Teruyasu Mizoguchi, Tianshu Yu, Lizi Liao, Yuyu Luo, Yu Rong, Jia Li, Ying Diao, Heng Ji, Bang Liu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on agentic AI systems for materials science, presenting a pipeline-centric view from corpus curation through goal-conditioned agents interfacing with simulation and experimental platforms.

entry.title: Post-Training Probability Manifold Correction via Structured SVD Pruning and Self-Referential Distillation

author.name: Aaron R. Flouro, Shawn P. Chadwick

entry.summary: SparseKD combines structured SVD pruning with self-referential knowledge distillation, finding that self-distillation alone improves model quality by 39% relative to original checkpoint.

entry.title: From Associations to Activations: Comparing Behavioral and Hidden-State Semantic Geometry in LLMs

author.name: Louis Schiekiera, Max Zimmer, Christophe Roux, Sebastian Pokutta, Fritz G\"unther

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLM hidden-state geometry can be recovered from behavioral experiments, running similarity-based forced choice and free association across 8 models with 17.5M+ trials. Finds forced-choice behavior aligns substantially more with hidden-state geometry.

entry.title: CLAMP: Contrastive Learning for 3D Multi-View Action-Conditioned Robotic Manipulation Pretraining

author.name: I-Chun Arthur Liu, Krzysztof Choromanski, Sandy Huang, Connor Schenck

entry.summary: Proposes CLAMP, a 3D pre-training framework for robotic manipulation using point clouds and robot actions. Re-renders multi-view observations with depth and 3D coordinates from merged point cloud.

entry.title: Personality Expression Across Contexts: Linguistic and Behavioral Variation in LLM Agents

author.name: Bin Han, Deuksin Kwon, Jonathan Gratch

entry.summary: Studies how identical personality prompts lead to different linguistic, behavioral, and emotional outcomes across conversational contexts in LLMs, questioning whether variations reflect inconsistency or human-like adaptation.

entry.title: PolyGen: Fully Synthetic Vision-Language Training via Multi-Generator Ensembles

author.name: Leonardo Brusini, Cristian Sbrolli, Eugenio Lomurno, Toshihiko Yamasaki, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: Introduces PolyGen for synthetic vision-language training using multi-generator ensembles to maximize manifold coverage while marginalizing out generator-specific artifacts.

entry.title: Plain Transformers are Surprisingly Powerful Link Predictors

author.name: Quang Truong, Yu Song, Donald Loveland, Mingxuan Ju, Tong Zhao, Neil Shah, Jiliang Tang

entry.summary: Shows plain encoder-only transformers (PENCIL) with attention over sampled local subgraphs achieve strong link prediction without explicit structural heuristics or node embeddings.

entry.title: Game of Thought: Robust Information Seeking with Large Language Models Using Game Theory

author.name: Langyuan Cui, Chun Kai Ling, Hwee Tou Ng

entry.summary: Formalizes information-seeking as Strategic Language Search game and proposes Game of Thought framework using game theory to improve worst-case performance in adversarial information-seeking scenarios.

entry.title: VLM-Guided Experience Replay

author.name: Elad Sharony, Tom Jurgenson, Orr Krupnik, Dotan Di Castro, Shie Mannor

entry.summary: VLM-Guided Experience Replay uses frozen pre-trained VLMs to prioritize promising sub-trajectories in replay buffer without fine-tuning, leveraging semantic reasoning for sample efficiency in RL.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Off-Policy Learning

author.name: Arip Asadulaev, Maksim Bobrin, Salem Lahlou, Dmitry Dylov, Fakhri Karray, Martin Takac

entry.summary: Discovers theoretical connection between successor measures and stationary density ratios for zero-shot off-policy RL, enabling optimal importance sampling ratios from reward-free training data.

entry.title: AREAL-DTA: Dynamic Tree Attention for Efficient Reinforcement Learning of Large Language Models

author.name: Jiarui Zhang, Yuchen Yang, Ran Yan, Zhiyu Mei, Liyuan Zhang, Daifeng Li, Wei Fu, Jiaxuan Gao, Shusheng Xu, Yi Wu, Binhang Yuan

entry.summary: Introduces AREAL-DTA for efficient RL training of LLMs by exploiting prefix sharing through dynamic tree attention. Avoids recomputing identical prefixes across rollouts during forward and backward passes.

entry.title: Strong Linear Baselines Strike Back: Closed-Form Linear Models as Gaussian Process Conditional Density Estimators for TSAD

author.name: Aleksandr Yugay, Hang Cui, Changhua Pei, Alexey Zaytsev

entry.summary: Demonstrates simple linear autoregressive models with OLS consistently match or outperform deep TSAD detectors. Shows linear models estimate finite-history Gaussian process conditional density capturing broad anomaly types.

entry.title: Test-time Generalization for Physics through Neural Operator Splitting

author.name: Louis Serrano, Jiequn Han, Edouard Oyallon, Shirley Ho, Rudy Morel

entry.summary: Introduces neural operator splitting for zero-shot test-time generalization to unseen physics. Combines dictionary of pretrained operators with learned splitting strategy to adapt without modifying weights.

entry.title: Richer Bayesian Last Layers with Subsampled NTK Features

author.name: Sergio Calvo-Ordo\~nez, Jonathan Plenk, Richard Bergna, \'Alvaro Cartea, Yarin Gal, Jose Miguel Hern\'andez-Lobato, Kamil Ciosek

entry.summary: Improves Bayesian Last Layers by projecting NTK features onto last-layer feature space, enabling posterior inference accounting for full network variability at low computational cost.

entry.title: On Stability and Robustness of Diffusion Posterior Sampling for Bayesian Inverse Problems

author.name: Yiming Yang, Xiaoyuan Cheng, Yi He, Kaiyu Li, Wenxuan Yuan, Zhuo Sun

entry.summary: Provides theoretical stability analysis for diffusion posterior sampling in Bayesian inverse problems and proves lack of robustness to likelihood mismatch. Proposes adversarial noise injection for robustness.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Learning from Structural Invariance

author.name: Yipeng Zhang, Hafez Ghaemi, Jungyoon Lee, Shahab Bakhtiari, Eilif B. Muller, Laurent Charlin

entry.summary: Addresses the one-to-many mapping problem in joint-embedding SSL where each datum may map to multiple valid targets. Introduces latent variables to capture conditional uncertainty and derives a variational bound yielding a simple regularization term.

entry.title: RPP: A Certified Poisoned-Sample Detection Framework for Backdoor Attacks under Dataset Imbalance

author.name: Miao Lin, Feng Yu, Rui Ning, Lusi Li, Jiawei Chen, Qian Lou, Mengxin Zheng, Chunsheng Xin, Hongyi Wu

entry.summary: RPP is a certified backdoor detection framework that addresses how class imbalance amplifies backdoor vulnerability. Provides black-box detection using only output probabilities.

entry.title: RoDiF: Robust Direct Fine-Tuning of Diffusion Policies with Corrupted Human Feedback

author.name: Amitesh Vatsa, Zhixian Xie, Wanxin Jin

entry.summary: RoDiF enables robust Direct Preference Optimization for diffusion policies under corrupted human feedback using geometric hypothesis-cutting perspective and conservative cutting strategy.

entry.title: Bias in the Ear of the Listener: Assessing Sensitivity in Audio Language Models Across Linguistic, Demographic, and Positional Variations

author.name: Sheng-Lun Wei, Yu-Ling Liao, Yen-Hua Chang, Hen-Hsen Huang, Hsin-Hsi Chen

entry.summary: Presents BiasInEar, the first systematic investigation of speech bias in multilingual MLLMs. Creates 70.8-hour dataset across English/Chinese/Korean balanced by gender and accent.

entry.title: SEA-Guard: Culturally Grounded Multilingual Safeguard for Southeast Asia

author.name: Panuthep Tasawong, Jian Gang Ngui, Alham Fikri Aji, Trevor Cohn, Peerat Limkonchotiwat

entry.summary: Presents SEA-Guard, first multilingual safeguard models grounded in Southeast Asian cultural contexts, using novel agentic data-generation framework for region-specific safety datasets.

entry.title: Proof-RM: A Scalable and Generalizable Reward Model for Math Proof

author.name: Haotong Yang, Zitong Wang, Shijia Kang, Siqi Yang, Wenkai Yu, Xu Niu, Yike Sun, Yi Hu, Zhouchen Lin, Muhan Zhang

entry.summary: Proof-RM develops scalable reward model for math proof verification using LLM-generated 'question-proof-check' triplets, enabling automatic verification for proof-based mathematical problems.

entry.title: Differential Vector Erasure: Unified Training-Free Concept Erasure for Flow Matching Models

author.name: Zhiqi Zhang, Xinhao Zhong, Yi Sun, Shuoyang Sun, Bin Chen, Shu-Tao Xia, Xuan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DVE for training-free concept erasure specifically for flow matching models by identifying and manipulating semantic direction vectors, addressing safety concerns in generative models.

entry.title: Token Pruning for In-Context Generation in Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Junqing Lin, Xingyu Zheng, Pei Cheng, Bin Fu, Jingwei Sun, Guangzhong Sun

entry.summary: Introduces ToPi, a training-free token pruning framework for in-context generation in Diffusion Transformers. Uses offline calibration and role-aware pruning to reduce computation while maintaining quality.

entry.title: MIRROR: Manifold Ideal Reference ReconstructOR for Generalizable AI-Generated Image Detection

author.name: Ruiqi Liu, Manni Cui, Ziheng Qin, Zhiyuan Yan, Ruoxin Chen, Yi Han, Zhiheng Li, Junkai Chen, ZhiJin Chen, Kaiqing Lin, Jialiang Shen, Lubin Weng, Jing Dong, Yan Wang, Shu Wu

entry.summary: Proposes MIRROR for generalizable AI-generated image detection by reformulating as reference-comparison problem that verifies consistency with real-image manifold rather than fitting forgery cues.

entry.title: Learning to Accelerate Vision-Language-Action Models through Adaptive Visual Token Caching

author.name: Yujie Wei, Jiahan Fan, Jiyu Guo, Ruichen Zhen, Rui Shao, Xiu Su, Zeke Xie, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Proposes learnable policy for adaptive visual token caching in VLA models, reformulating inference acceleration as policy optimization rather than using static heuristics.

entry.title: Cross-Modal Memory Compression for Efficient Multi-Agent Debate

author.name: Jing Wu, Yue Sun, Tianpei Xie, Suiyao Chen, Jingyuan Bao, Yaopengxiao Xu, Gaoyuan Du, Inseok Heo, Alexander Gutfraind, Xin Wang

entry.summary: Introduces DebateOCR that compresses multi-agent debate histories by converting text to compact images processed by vision encoders. Achieves 92%+ token reduction while maintaining reasoning quality.

entry.title: DockSmith: Scaling Reliable Coding Environments via an Agentic Docker Builder

author.name: Jiaran Zhang, Luck Ma, Yanhao Li, Fanqi Wan, Di Qi, Xu Zhao, Jieyi Hou, Zhe Xie, Mengqiang Ren, Xin Wu, Zhewei Huang, Liangyu Chen, Yingwei Ma, Qi Han, Xiangyu Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces DockSmith, an agentic Docker builder trained on execution-grounded trajectories with loop-detection and cross-task memory. Shows environment construction is a core agentic capability that transfers to other tasks.

entry.title: Beyond Output Critique: Self-Correction via Task Distillation

author.name: Hossein A. Rahmani, Mengting Wan, Pei Zhou, Longqi Yang, Nick Craswell, Emine Yilmaz, Sujay Kumar Jauhar

entry.summary: Proposes SELF-THOUGHT framework adding task abstraction step before solution refinement, distilling tasks into structured templates before instantiation. Addresses deeper reasoning flaws beyond surface error patching.

entry.title: ConvexBench: Can LLMs Recognize Convex Functions?

author.name: Yepeng Liu, Yu Huang, Yu-Xiang Wang, Yingbin Liang, Yuheng Bu

entry.summary: Introduces ConvexBench testing whether LLMs can identify convexity under deep functional composition. Shows sharp performance degradation from F1 1.0 at depth 2 to 0.2 at depth 100, revealing parsing and transfer failures.

entry.title: Agyn: A Multi-Agent System for Team-Based Autonomous Software Engineering

author.name: Nikita Benkovich, Vitalii Valkov

entry.summary: Agyn presents a multi-agent system modeling software engineering as organizational process with specialized agents for coordination, research, implementation, and review roles.

entry.title: FlowSteer: Interactive Agentic Workflow Orchestration via End-to-End Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Mingda Zhang, Haoran Luo, Tiesunlong Shen, Qika Lin, Xiaoying Tang, Rui Mao, Erik Cambria

entry.summary: FlowSteer uses end-to-end reinforcement learning with lightweight policy model to automate workflow orchestration through multi-turn interaction with executable canvas environment.

entry.title: Geometric Analysis of Token Selection in Multi-Head Attention

author.name: Timur Mudarisov, Mikhal Burtsev, Tatiana Petrova, Radu State

entry.summary: Presents geometric framework for analyzing multi-head attention through top-N selection lens, defining Precision/Recall/F-score metrics for token separability with theoretical bounds.

entry.title: Context Learning for Multi-Agent Discussion

author.name: Xingyuan Hua, Sheng Yue, Xinyi Li, Yizhe Zhao, Jinrui Zhang, Ju Ren

entry.summary: M2CL addresses discussion inconsistency in multi-agent LLM systems by training context generators that dynamically produce context instructions per discussion round.

entry.title: Intelligent Reasoning Cues: A Framework and Case Study of the Roles of AI Information in Complex Decisions

author.name: Venkatesh Sivaraman, Eric P. Mason, Mengfan Ellen Li, Jessica Tong, Andrew J. King, Jeremy M. Kahn, Adam Perer

entry.summary: Reconceptualizes AI decision support as collections of intelligent reasoning cues, exploring eight types through contextual inquiry and think-aloud study with physicians treating sepsis patients.

entry.title: Multi-Speaker Conversational Audio Deepfake: Taxonomy, Dataset and Pilot Study

author.name: Alabi Ahmed, Vandana Janeja, Sanjay Purushotham

entry.summary: Proposes taxonomy for multi-speaker conversational audio deepfakes and introduces MsCADD dataset of 2,830 clips covering partial and full manipulations in multi-speaker settings.

entry.title: EchoReview: Learning Peer Review from the Echoes of Scientific Citations

author.name: Yinuo Zhang, Dingcheng Huang, Haifeng Suo, Yizhuo Li, Ziya Zhao, Junhao Xu, Zhiying Tu, Dianhui Chu, Deming Zhai, Xianming Liu, Xiaoyan Yu, Dianbo Sui

entry.summary: Proposes EchoReview, a framework that learns peer review by mining implicit evaluative signals from academic citations and transforming community judgments into training data for automated reviewers.

entry.title: Improving Flow Matching by Aligning Flow Divergence

author.name: Yuhao Huang, Taos Transue, Shih-Hsin Wang, William Feldman, Hong Zhang, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces new PDE characterization for error between learned and exact probability paths in flow matching, showing total variation gap bounded by CFM loss plus divergence loss. Proposes objective matching both flow and divergence.

entry.title: Calibrating Behavioral Parameters with Large Language Models

author.name: Brandon Yee, Krishna Sharma

entry.summary: Develops framework treating LLMs as calibrated measurement instruments for behavioral parameters (loss aversion, herding, etc.). Documents systematic rationality bias in baseline behavior and shows profile-based calibration induces stable shifts.

entry.title: Toward a Machine Bertin: Why Visualization Needs Design Principles for Machine Cognition

author.name: Brian Keith-Norambuena

entry.summary: Argues visualization design principles derived from human vision don't transfer to VLMs, calling for 'Machine Bertin'—design principles for machine cognition based on how VLMs process images.

entry.title: FreshMem: Brain-Inspired Frequency-Space Hybrid Memory for Streaming Video Understanding

author.name: Kangcong Li, Peng Ye, Lin Zhang, Chao Wang, Huafeng Qin, Tao Chen

entry.summary: FreshMem proposes brain-inspired frequency-space hybrid memory for streaming video understanding, using multi-scale frequency memory for global history and space thumbnail memory for salient events.

entry.title: T-LLM: Teaching Large Language Models to Forecast Time Series via Temporal Distillation

author.name: Suhan Guo, Bingxu Wang, Shaodan Zhang, Furao Shen

entry.summary: T-LLM teaches LLMs time series forecasting via temporal distillation from specialized forecasting models, addressing the time-bound constraint that limits scale-driven pretraining for time-dependent data.

entry.title: IntraSlice: Towards High-Performance Structural Pruning with Block-Intra PCA for LLMs

author.name: Meng Li, Peisong Wang, Yuantian Shao, Qinghao Hu, Hongjian Fang, Yifan Zhang, Zhihui Wei, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: IntraSlice applies block-wise module-intra PCA compression for LLM pruning, addressing activation distribution disruption from residual connections that affects prior inter-module approaches.

entry.title: Fat-Cat: Document-Driven Metacognitive Multi-Agent System for Complex Reasoning

author.name: Tong Yang (Henan Polytechnic University), Yemin Wang (University of Electronic Science and Technology of China), Chaoning Zhang (Henan Polytechnic University), Aming Wu (Henan Polytechnic University)

entry.summary: Proposes Fat-Cat document-driven agent architecture using Markdown documents for state management, improving signal-to-noise ratio over nested JSON representations.

entry.title: HopFormer: Sparse Graph Transformers with Explicit Receptive Field Control

author.name: Sanggeon Yun, Raheeb Hassan, Ryozo Masukawa, Sungheon Jeong, Mohsen Imani

entry.summary: Proposes HopFormer graph transformer using head-specific n-hop masked sparse attention without positional encodings, providing explicit receptive field control with linear complexity.

entry.title: FoundationalASSIST: An Educational Dataset for Foundational Knowledge Tracing and Pedagogical Grounding of LLMs

author.name: Eamon Worden, Cristina Heffernan, Neil Heffernan, Shashank Sonkar

entry.summary: FoundationalASSIST is the first educational dataset providing full question text, actual student responses, wrong answer choices, and Common Core alignment. Enables LLM research on how students learn.

entry.title: NPNet: A Non-Parametric Network with Adaptive Gaussian-Fourier Positional Encoding for 3D Classification and Segmentation

author.name: Mohammad Saeid, Amir Salarpour, Pedram MohajerAnsari, Mert D. Pes\'e

entry.summary: NPNet is fully non-parametric 3D point cloud classifier using only deterministic operators (FPS, kNN, pooling) with adaptive Gaussian-Fourier positional encoding. No learned weights.

entry.title: The Shape of Beliefs: Geometry, Dynamics, and Interventions along Representation Manifolds of Language Models' Posteriors

author.name: Rapha\"el Sarfati, Eric Bigelow, Daniel Wurgaft, Jack Merullo, Atticus Geiger, Owen Lewis, Tom McGrath, Ekdeep Singh Lubana

entry.summary: Studies how Llama-3.2 represents beliefs as curved manifolds in activation space when inferring distribution parameters from in-context examples. Finds linear steering pushes models off-manifold, motivating manifold-aware interventions.

entry.title: Med3D-R1: Incentivizing Clinical Reasoning in 3D Medical Vision-Language Models for Abnormality Diagnosis

author.name: Haoran Lai, Zihang Jiang, Kun Zhang, Qingsong Yao, Rongsheng Wang, Zhiyang He, Xiaodong Tao, Wei Wei, Shaohua Kevin Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Med3D-R1 for 3D medical VLM reasoning with residual alignment, abnormality re-weighting during SFT, and redesigned consistency reward for RL to incentivize clinical reasoning.

entry.title: Know Your Step: Faster and Better Alignment for Flow Matching Models via Step-aware Advantages

author.name: Zhixiong Yue, Zixuan Ni, Feiyang Ye, Jinshan Zhang, Sheng Shen, Zhenpeng Mi

entry.summary: Introduces TAFS-GRPO framework for aligning flow matching text-to-image models with human preferences using fewer denoising steps. Uses temperature annealing and group relative policy optimization.

entry.title: MLV-Edit: Towards Consistent and Highly Efficient Editing for Minute-Level Videos

author.name: Yangyi Cao, Yuanhang Li, Lan Chen, Qi Mao

entry.summary: Proposes MLV-Edit for minute-level video editing using divide-and-conquer with Velocity Blend for motion consistency and Attention Sink for style anchoring.

entry.title: ConLA: Contrastive Latent Action Learning from Human Videos for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Weisheng Dai, Kai Lan, Jianyi Zhou, Bo Zhao, Xiu Su, Junwen Tong, Weili Guan, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Proposes ConLA, using contrastive learning to extract latent actions from human demonstration videos for training VLA models without explicit action labels.

entry.title: Complete Identification of Deep ReLU Neural Networks by Many-Valued Logic

author.name: Yani Zhang, Helmut B\"olcskei

entry.summary: Uses Lukasiewicz many-valued logic to completely characterize all ReLU networks that compute the same function, proving connectivity between equivalent networks via algebraic rewrites. Provides theoretical foundation for understanding neural network functional equivalences.

entry.title: MHDash: An Online Platform for Benchmarking Mental Health-Aware AI Assistants

author.name: Yihe Zhang, Cheyenne N Mohawk, Kaiying Han, Vijay Srinivas Tida, Manyu Li, Xiali Hei

entry.summary: Presents MHDash, an open-source platform for evaluating mental health AI systems with multi-turn dialogue generation and risk-specific annotation. Addresses safety-critical evaluation gaps for suicide and self-harm detection.

entry.title: Diagnosing the Reliability of LLM-as-a-Judge via Item Response Theory

author.name: Junhyuk Choi, Sohhyung Park, Chanhee Cho, Hyeonchu Park, Bugeun Kim

entry.summary: Proposes IRT-based framework for diagnosing LLM-as-a-Judge reliability using Graded Response Model, measuring intrinsic consistency and human alignment. Reveals systematic variations across models, prompts, and domains.

entry.title: Optimizing Agentic Reasoning with Retrieval via Synthetic Semantic Information Gain Reward

author.name: Senkang Hu, Yong Dai, Yuzhi Zhao, Yihang Tao, Yu Guo, Zhengru Fang, Sam Tak Wu Kwong, Yuguang Fang

entry.summary: Introduces InfoReasoner framework for agentic reasoning with synthetic semantic information gain reward. Provides theoretical guarantees including non-negativity and telescoping additivity for retrieval optimization.

entry.title: Discovering Process-Outcome Credit in Multi-Step LLM Reasoning

author.name: Xiangwei Wang, Wei Wang, Ken Chen, Nanduni Nimalsiri, Saman Halgamuge

entry.summary: Proposes step-wise Marginal Information Gain mechanism for credit assignment in multi-step LLM reasoning with Monotonic Historical Watermark. Uses decoupled masking for process vs outcome rewards.

entry.title: S1-NexusAgent: a Self-Evolving Agent Framework for Multidisciplinary Scientific Research

author.name: NexusAgent Team

entry.summary: S1-NexusAgent is a self-evolving agent framework for scientific research using hierarchical Plan-and-CodeAct with dual-loop architecture, supporting Model Context Protocol and thousands of tools.

entry.title: PRISM: Parametrically Refactoring Inference for Speculative Sampling Draft Models

author.name: Xuliang Wang, Yuetao Chen, Maochan Zhen, Fang Liu, Xinzhou Zheng, Xingwu Liu, Hong Xu, Ming Li

entry.summary: PRISM disaggregates computation in speculative decoding draft models through architectural innovation, refactoring computational flow across different parameter sets.

entry.title: Thinking Like a Doctor: Conversational Diagnosis through the Exploration of Diagnostic Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Jeongmoon Won, Seungwon Kook, Yohan Jo

entry.summary: Proposes conversational diagnosis system that explores diagnostic knowledge graph in two steps: generating hypotheses and verifying through clarifying questions, with realistic patient simulator.

entry.title: More Than a Quick Glance: Overcoming the Greedy Bias in KV-Cache Compression

author.name: Aryan Sood, Tanvi Sharma, Vansh Agrawal

entry.summary: LASER-KV tests KV-cache compression limits using block-wise accumulation strategy with protection divisor, isolating compression effects from sliding window artifacts.

entry.title: AutoBinder Agent: An MCP-Based Agent for End-to-End Protein Binder Design

author.name: Fukang Ge, Jiarui Zhu, Linjie Zhang, Haowen Xiao, Xiangcheng Bao, Fangnan Xie, Danyang Chen, Yanrui Lu, Yuting Wang, Ziqian Guan, Lin Gu, Jinhao Bi, Yingying Zhu

entry.summary: Develops AutoBinder Agent using LLMs with Model Context Protocol (MCP) to coordinate protein binder design workflows, integrating MaSIF, Rosetta, and ProteinMPNN for end-to-end drug discovery.

entry.title: Happy Young Women, Grumpy Old Men? Emotion-Driven Demographic Biases in Synthetic Face Generation

author.name: Mengting Wei, Aditya Gulati, Guoying Zhao, Nuria Oliver

entry.summary: Audits 8 state-of-the-art T2I models for demographic biases in emotion-driven synthetic face generation, comparing models from different cultural/linguistic contexts and finding lineage-specific bias patterns.

entry.title: TextBFGS: Quasi-Newton Optimization for Discrete Executable Text via Gradient-Operator Retrieval

author.name: Zizheng Zhang, Yuyang Liao, Chen Chen, Jian He, Dun Wu, Qianjin Yu, Yanqin Gao, Jin Yang, Kailai Zhang, Eng Siong Chng, Xionghu Zhong

entry.summary: Introduces TextBFGS, a quasi-Newton optimization method for discrete text that approximates inverse Hessian by retrieving Gradient-Operators from memory, addressing slow convergence of first-order text optimization.

entry.title: Reversible Diffusion Decoding for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Xinyun Wang, Min Zhang, Sen Cui, Zhikang Chen, Bo Jiang, Kun Kuang, Mingbao Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Reversible Diffusion Decoding for diffusion language models, enabling backtracking when block-wise generation stagnates through cached model states and confidence-guided re-masking.

entry.title: RAPTOR: Ridge-Adaptive Logistic Probes

author.name: Ziqi Gao, Yaotian Zhu, Qingcheng Zeng, Xu Zhao, Ziqing Wang, Feng Ruan, Kaize Ding

entry.summary: RAPTOR introduces L2-regularized logistic probes for extracting concept vectors from LLMs that are accurate, stable under ablation, and efficient. Designed for probe-then-steer activation steering pipelines.

entry.title: Rank-and-Reason: Multi-Agent Collaboration Accelerates Zero-Shot Protein Mutation Prediction

author.name: Yang Tan, Yuyuan Xi, Can Wu, Bozitao Zhong, Mingchen Li, Guisheng Fan, Jiankang Zhu, Yafeng Liang, Nanqing Dong, Liang Hong

entry.summary: VenusRAR is a two-stage agentic framework for protein mutation prediction combining computational experts and virtual biologists. Achieves new SOTA on ProteinGym while producing interpretable reasoning.

entry.title: TokenTrim: Inference-Time Token Pruning for Autoregressive Long Video Generation

author.name: Ariel Shaulov, Eitan Shaar, Amit Edenzon, Lior Wolf

entry.summary: TokenTrim proposes inference-time token pruning to mitigate temporal drift in autoregressive video generation by identifying and removing unstable latent tokens before error propagation.

entry.title: Convergent World Representations and Divergent Tasks

author.name: Core Francisco Park

entry.summary: Develops a controlled framework to study how neural network representations encode world knowledge across different training tasks. Finds that multi-task training drives convergence of world representations even when trained on non-overlapping tasks.

entry.title: HyperOffload: Graph-Driven Hierarchical Memory Management for Large Language Models on SuperNode Architectures

author.name: Fangxin Liu, Qinghua Zhang, Hanjing Shen, Qinghua Zhang, Zhibo Liang, Li Jiang, Haibing Guan, Chong Bao, Xuefeng Jin

entry.summary: Proposes HyperOffload, a compiler-assisted memory management framework for LLMs on supernode architectures that uses graph-driven scheduling to exploit terabyte-scale shared memory pools effectively.

entry.title: LASS-ODE: Scaling ODE Computations to Connect Foundation Models with Dynamical Physical Systems

author.name: Haoran Li, Chenhan Xiao, Lihao Mai, Yang Weng, Erik Blasch

entry.summary: Proposes LASS-ODE for scaling ODE computations in foundation models using token-wise locally linear ODE representation that preserves physical fidelity while enabling attention-based cross-system knowledge sharing.

entry.title: VEQ: Modality-Adaptive Quantization for MoE Vision-Language Models

author.name: Guangshuo Qin, Zhiteng Li, Zheng Chen, Weihang Zhang, Linghe Kong, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces VEQ, a quantization framework for Mixture-of-Experts Vision-Language Models that addresses both cross-modal differences between vision/language tokens and heterogeneous expert contributions.

entry.title: Mechanistic Interpretability of Brain-to-Speech Models Across Speech Modes

author.name: Maryam Maghsoudi, Ayushi Mishra

entry.summary: Uses mechanistic interpretability techniques including activation patching and causal tracing to understand internal representations of brain-to-speech decoders across speech modes.

entry.title: Rod Flow: A Continuous-Time Model for Gradient Descent at the Edge of Stability

author.name: Eric Regis, Sinho Chewi

entry.summary: Proposes Rod Flow, an ODE approximation for gradient descent at edge of stability based on physical picture of GD iterates as extended 'rod' object. Better captures dynamics than Central Flow.

entry.title: Multimodal UNcommonsense: From Odd to Ordinary and Ordinary to Odd

author.name: Yejin Son, Saejin Kim, Dongjun Min, Younjae Yu

entry.summary: Introduces Multimodal UNcommonsense benchmark evaluating models on scenarios deviating from typical visual expectations, with retrieval-based in-context learning framework.

entry.title: Adaptive Rollout Allocation for Online Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Hieu Trung Nguyen, Bao Nguyen, Wenao Ma, Yuzhi Zhao, Ruifeng She, Viet Anh Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes a variance-informed predictive allocation strategy for GRPO that uses Gaussian processes to allocate rollout budgets based on per-prompt success probabilities, minimizing gradient variance. This addresses the inefficiency of uniform rollout allocation in RL with verifiable rewards.

entry.title: : One LLM Token for Explicit Graph Structural Understanding

author.name: Jingyao Wu, Bin Lu, Zijun Di, Xiaoying Gan, Meng Jin, Luoyi Fu, Xinbing Wang, Chenghu Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes representing graph structure with single special token through topology-aware tokenizer mapping graph topology to unified token space, addressing structural hallucination in LLM graph understanding.

entry.title: Probabilistic Performance Guarantees for Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yannik Schnitzer, Mathias Jackermeier, Alessandro Abate, David Parker

entry.summary: This work provides formal high-confidence performance guarantees for multi-task RL policies on unseen tasks by composing per-task lower confidence bounds with task-level generalization bounds from finite task samples.

entry.title: Vision-DeepResearch Benchmark: Rethinking Visual and Textual Search for Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Yu Zeng, Wenxuan Huang, Zhen Fang, Shuang Chen, Yufan Shen, Yishuo Cai, Xiaoman Wang, Zhenfei Yin, Lin Chen, Zehui Chen, Shiting Huang, Yiming Zhao, Yao Hu, Philip Torr, Wanli Ouyang, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Vision-DeepResearch Benchmark addresses limitations of existing VQA benchmarks where answers can be found through textual cues or prior knowledge rather than actual visual search, providing more rigorous evaluation of MLLM search capabilities.

entry.title: OpenSeal: Good, Fast, and Cheap Construction of an Open-Source Southeast Asian LLM via Parallel Data

author.name: Tan Sang Nguyen, Muhammad Reza Qorib, Hwee Tou Ng

entry.summary: OpenSeal demonstrates that parallel data can efficiently improve Southeast Asian language performance in LLMs through controlled experiments, providing truly open-source model with disclosed training data.

entry.title: TTT-Parkour: Rapid Test-Time Training for Perceptive Robot Parkour

author.name: Shaoting Zhu, Baijun Ye, Jiaxuan Wang, Jiakang Chen, Ziwen Zhuang, Linzhan Mou, Runhan Huang, Hang Zhao

entry.summary: TTT-Parkour uses real-to-sim-to-real test-time training to rapidly fine-tune humanoid locomotion policies on novel terrains reconstructed from real-world captures.

entry.title: Didactic to Constructive: Turning Expert Solutions into Learnable Reasoning

author.name: Ethan Mendes, Jungsoo Park, Alan Ritter

entry.summary: Shows expert human solutions can be converted from didactic (implicit reasoning gaps for humans) to constructive form suitable for LLM training, enabling learning from problems too hard for current models.

entry.title: Abstract Activation Spaces for Content-Invariant Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Gabriele Maraia, Marco Valentino, Fabio Massimo Zanzotto, Leonardo Ranaldi

entry.summary: Introduces Abstract Activation Spaces to make formal deduction less sensitive to semantic content, addressing content effect where LLMs conflate semantic plausibility with formal validity.

entry.title: PixelGen: Pixel Diffusion Beats Latent Diffusion with Perceptual Loss

author.name: Zehong Ma, Ruihan Xu, Shiliang Zhang

entry.summary: PixelGen shows pixel diffusion can beat latent diffusion using perceptual losses (LPIPS for local patterns, DINO for global structure) to focus on meaningful perceptual manifold rather than full pixel space.

entry.title: ALIGN: Aligned Delegation with Performance Guarantees for Multi-Agent LLM Reasoning

author.name: Tong Zhu, Baiting Chen, Jin Zhou, Hua Zhou, Sriram Sankararaman, Xiaowu Dai

entry.summary: Proposes ALIGN, formulating multi-agent LLM reasoning as an aligned delegation game where a principal delegates to multiple agents with designed incentives. Provides formal guarantees that ensembling improves reasoning quality.

entry.title: Parallel Stochastic Gradient-Based Planning for World Models

author.name: Michael Psenka, Michael Rabbat, Aditi Krishnapriyan, Yann LeCun, Amir Bar

entry.summary: Proposes parallel stochastic gradient-based planner for world models treating states as optimization variables with soft dynamics constraints. Introduces stochasticity for exploration and modifies gradient structure for stability through high-dimensional vision models.

entry.title: Depth, Not Data: An Analysis of Hessian Spectral Bifurcation

author.name: Shenyang Deng, Boyao Liao, Zhuoli Ouyang, Tianyu Pang, Yaoqing Yang

entry.summary: Demonstrates Hessian bulk-and-spike spectral structure arises from network depth, not data imbalance as previously thought. Proves even with balanced data covariance, deep linear networks exhibit spectral bifurcation.

entry.title: LocalV: Exploiting Information Locality for IP-level Verilog Generation

author.name: Hanqi Lyu, Di Huang, Yaoyu Zhu, Kangcheng Liu, Bohan Dou, Chongxiao Li, Pengwei Jin, Shuyao Cheng, Rui Zhang, Zidong Du, Qi Guo, Xing Hu, Yunji Chen

entry.summary: Introduces LocalV, a framework for generating industrial IP-level Verilog code using LLMs by exploiting information locality. Addresses key challenges of handling long specifications and generating syntactically/semantically correct long RTL code.

entry.title: Reliability-Aware Determinantal Point Processes for Robust Informative Data Selection in Large Language Models

author.name: Ahmad Sarlak, Abolfazl Razi

entry.summary: Proposes ProbDPP for LLM data selection that accounts for reliability/availability of data under storage outages or communication failures. Shows original DPP formulation collapses under such conditions.

entry.title: ChronoSpike: An Adaptive Spiking Graph Neural Network for Dynamic Graphs

author.name: Md Abrar Jahin, Taufikur Rahman Fuad, Jay Pujara, Craig Knoblock

entry.summary: Proposes ChronoSpike, combining spiking neural networks with graph neural networks for dynamic graphs via learnable LIF neurons, multi-head spatial aggregation, and Transformer temporal encoder.

entry.title: Analyzing and Improving Diffusion Models for Time-Series Data Imputation: A Proximal Recursion Perspective

author.name: Zhichao Chen, Hao Wang, Fangyikang Wang, Licheng Pan, Zhengnan Li, Yunfei Teng, Haoxuan Li, Zhouchen Lin

entry.summary: Analyzes diffusion models for time series imputation through proximal recursion lens, identifying non-stationarity and objective inconsistency as key challenges. Proposes modifications based on analysis.

entry.title: A Meta-Knowledge-Augmented LLM Framework for Hyperparameter Optimization in Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Ons Saadallah, M\'aty\'as and\'o, Tam\'as G\'abor Orosz

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-AutoOpt combining Bayesian optimization with LLM-based contextual reasoning for hyperparameter optimization in time series forecasting, encoding meta-features and historical outcomes.

entry.title: Provable Cooperative Multi-Agent Exploration for Reward-Free MDPs

author.name: Idan Barnea, Orin Levy, Yishay Mansour

entry.summary: Studies cooperative multi-agent reward-free exploration, characterizing tradeoff between number of learning phases and agents. Identifies sharp transition governed by horizon H.

entry.title: Multi-Scale Wavelet Transformers for Operator Learning of Dynamical Systems

author.name: Xuesong Wang, Michael Groom, Rafael Oliveira, He Zhao, Terence O'Kane, Edwin V. Bonilla

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Scale Wavelet Transformers (MSWTs) for learning dynamical systems that address spectral bias in neural operators by operating in a tokenized wavelet domain. This explicitly separates low- and high-frequency content, improving stability in long-horizon predictions for applications like weather forecasting.

entry.title: FUPareto: Bridging the Forgetting-Utility Gap in Federated Unlearning via Pareto Augmented Optimization

author.name: Zeyan Wang, Zhengmao Liu, Yongxin Cai, Chi Li, Xiaoying Tang, Jingchao Chen, Zibin Pan, Jing Qiu

entry.summary: Proposes FUPareto for federated unlearning that uses Minimum Boundary objective and Pareto-augmented optimization to balance forgetting, utility preservation, and MIA resistance across multiple clients.

entry.title: Robust Domain Generalization under Divergent Marginal and Conditional Distributions

author.name: Jewon Yeom, Kyubyung Chae, Hyunggyu Lim, Yoonna Oh, Dongyoon Yang, Taesup Kim

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework for domain generalization under compound distribution shifts where both P(Y) and P(X|Y) vary, deriving novel risk bound with explicit decomposition.

entry.title: Interpretability in Deep Time Series Models Demands Semantic Alignment

author.name: Giovanni De Felice, Riccardo D'Elia, Alberto Termine, Pietro Barbiero, Giuseppe Marra, Silvia Santini

entry.summary: Argues interpretability in deep time series models should pursue semantic alignment where predictions are expressed in user-meaningful variables with constrained spatial-temporal mechanisms.

entry.title: MoLF: Mixture-of-Latent-Flow for Pan-Cancer Spatial Gene Expression Prediction from Histology

author.name: Susu Hu, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: MoLF introduces a generative model for pan-cancer spatial transcriptomics prediction from histology images, using Mixture-of-Experts with Flow Matching to handle heterogeneity across cancer types. This enables scalable histogenomic profiling even in data-scarce scenarios by leveraging shared biological principles.

entry.title: RLAnything: Forge Environment, Policy, and Reward Model in Completely Dynamic RL System

author.name: Yinjie Wang, Tianbao Xie, Ke Shen, Mengdi Wang, Ling Yang

entry.summary: RLAnything dynamically co-optimizes environment, policy, and reward models through closed-loop optimization. Uses step-wise and outcome signals for policy training, consistency feedback for reward model, and automatic environment adaptation.

entry.title: Singular Bayesian Neural Networks

author.name: Mame Diarra Toure, David A. Stephens

entry.summary: Singular Bayesian Neural Networks use low-rank parameterization W=AB^T inducing posteriors concentrated on rank-r manifolds. Derives PAC-Bayes bounds scaling with sqrt(r(m+n)) instead of sqrt(mn).

entry.title: CRAFT: Calibrated Reasoning with Answer-Faithful Traces via Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Hop Question Answering

author.name: Yu Liu, Wenxiao Zhang, Cong Cao, Fangfang Yuan, Weizhuo Chen, Cheng Hu, Pin Xu, Yuling Yang, Kun Peng, Diandian Guo, Qiang Sun, Yanbing Liu, Jin B. Hong, Zhiyuan Ma

entry.summary: Proposes CRAFT framework for multi-hop QA addressing reasoning collapse, reasoning-answer inconsistency, and format control loss through reinforcement learning with answer-faithful traces.

entry.title: Online Fine-Tuning of Pretrained Controllers for Autonomous Driving via Real-Time Recurrent RL

author.name: Julian Lemmel, Felix Resch, M\'onika Farsang, Ramin Hasani, Daniela Rus, Radu Grosu

entry.summary: Proposes using Real-Time Recurrent RL (RTRRL) for online fine-tuning of pretrained autonomous driving policies, synergizing with Liquid-RC RNNs for adaptation to environmental changes.

entry.title: HumanX: Toward Agile and Generalizable Humanoid Interaction Skills from Human Videos

author.name: Yinhuai Wang, Qihan Zhao, Yuen Fui Lau, Runyi Yu, Hok Wai Tsui, Qifeng Chen, Jingbo Wang, Jiangmiao Pang, Ping Tan

entry.summary: Presents HumanX, a framework for training humanoid robots on interaction skills from human videos without task-specific rewards. Includes XGen for data synthesis with augmentation and XMimic for unified imitation learning.

entry.title: Kanade: A Simple Disentangled Tokenizer for Spoken Language Modeling

author.name: Zhijie Huang, Stephen McIntosh, Daisuke Saito, Nobuaki Minematsu

entry.summary: Presents Kanade, a single-layer disentangled speech tokenizer that separates phonetics and prosody from speaker identity without auxiliary methods. Achieves state-of-the-art speaker disentanglement.

entry.title: Scaling Search-Augmented LLM Reasoning via Adaptive Information Control

author.name: Siheng Xiong, Oguzhan Gungordu, Blair Johnson, James C. Kerce, Faramarz Fekri

entry.summary: Proposes DeepControl framework for adaptive information control in search-augmented reasoning, using formal information utility measure and granularity control mechanisms.

entry.title: S3-CoT: Self-Sampled Succinct Reasoning Enables Efficient Chain-of-Thought LLMs

author.name: Yanrui Du, Sendong Zhao, Yibo Gao, Danyang Zhao, Qika Lin, Ming Ma, Jiayun Li, Yi Jiang, Kai He, Qianyi Xu, Bing Qin, Mengling Feng

entry.summary: S3-CoT enables efficient chain-of-thought by self-sampling succinct reasoning traces using activation steering, without requiring teacher models or external supervision. Addresses redundancy in CoT reasoning.

entry.title: D-CORE: Incentivizing Task Decomposition in Large Reasoning Models for Complex Tool Use

author.name: Bowen Xu, Shaoyu Wu, Hao Jiang, Kai Liu, Xin Chen, Lulu Hu, Bin Yang

entry.summary: D-CORE addresses 'Lazy Reasoning' in LRMs for tool use by incentivizing task decomposition through self-distillation followed by diversity-aware reinforcement learning to restore reflective reasoning.

entry.title: Any3D-VLA: Enhancing VLA Robustness via Diverse Point Clouds

author.name: Xianzhe Fan, Shengliang Deng, Xiaoyang Wu, Yuxiang Lu, Zhuoling Li, Mi Yan, Yujia Zhang, Zhizheng Zhang, He Wang, Hengshuang Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Any3D-VLA to enhance Vision-Language-Action models by incorporating diverse point clouds from simulators, sensors, and model estimates, addressing data scarcity and domain gaps for robot manipulation.

entry.title: PISA: Piecewise Sparse Attention Is Wiser for Efficient Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Haopeng Li, Shitong Shao, Wenliang Zhong, Zikai Zhou, Lichen Bai, Hui Xiong, Zeke Xie

entry.summary: Proposes PISA for efficient diffusion transformers by approximating non-critical attention blocks rather than discarding them, discovering distributional stability in attention scores.

entry.title: One-Step Diffusion for Perceptual Image Compression

author.name: Yiwen Jia, Hao Wei, Yanhui Zhou, Chenyang Ge

entry.summary: Proposes single-step diffusion for image compression, significantly reducing inference latency compared to multi-step approaches. Uses a discriminator on compact feature representations instead of raw pixels to improve perceptual quality.

entry.title: Mind-Brush: Integrating Agentic Cognitive Search and Reasoning into Image Generation

author.name: Jun He, Junyan Ye, Zilong Huang, Dongzhi Jiang, Chenjue Zhang, Leqi Zhu, Renrui Zhang, Xiang Zhang, Weijia Li

entry.summary: Introduces Mind-Brush, an agentic framework for image generation that integrates cognitive search and reasoning, simulating human 'think-research-create' paradigm.

entry.title: LangMap: A Hierarchical Benchmark for Open-Vocabulary Goal Navigation

author.name: Bo Miao, Weijia Liu, Jun Luo, Lachlan Shinnick, Jian Liu, Thomas Hamilton-Smith, Yuhe Yang, Zijie Wu, Vanja Videnovic, Feras Dayoub, Anton van den Hengel

entry.summary: Introduces LangMap benchmark for hierarchical open-vocabulary goal navigation across four semantic levels with comprehensive annotations and 18K+ navigation tasks.

entry.title: KAN We Flow? Advancing Robotic Manipulation with 3D Flow Matching via KAN & RWKV

author.name: Zhihao Chen, Yiyuan Ge, Ziyang Wang
