entry.summary: TTSA3R proposes training-free temporal-spatial adaptive state updates for streaming 3D reconstruction, addressing catastrophic memory forgetting over long sequences.

entry.title: Human-Centered Explainability in AI-Enhanced UI Security Interfaces: Designing Trustworthy Copilots for Cybersecurity Analysts

author.name: Mona Rajhans

entry.summary: Presents a user study on explanation design in AI-driven security dashboards, comparing natural language, feature attribution, and case-based explanations for cybersecurity analysts.

entry.title: A Cross-Domain Graph Learning Protocol for Single-Step Molecular Geometry Refinement

author.name: Chengchun Liu, Wendi Cai, Boxuan Zhao, Fanyang Mo

entry.summary: GeoOpt-Net uses SE(3)-equivariant graph neural networks to predict DFT-quality molecular geometries in a single forward pass from low-cost initial conformers. Employs two-stage training with fidelity-aware feature modulation.

entry.title: Toward IIT-Inspired Consciousness in LLMs: A Reward-Based Learning Framework

author.name: Hamid Reza Akbari, Mohammad Hossein Sameti, Amir M. Mansourian, Mohammad Hossein Rohban, Hossein Sameti

entry.summary: Investigates implementing Integrated Information Theory (IIT) concepts in LLMs via reward-based learning, creating reward functions quantifying text causality, coherence, and integration as proxies for conscious-like processing.

entry.title: Bayesian Interpolating Neural Network (B-INN): a scalable and reliable Bayesian model for large-scale physical systems

author.name: Chanwook Park, Brian Kim, Jiachen Guo, Wing Kam Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian Interpolating Neural Network (B-INN) combining high-order interpolation with tensor decomposition for scalable uncertainty quantification in large-scale physical systems. Enables effective dimensionality reduction while maintaining accuracy.

entry.title: Leveraging LLMs For Turkish Skill Extraction

author.name: Ezgi Arslan \.Ilt\"uzer, \"Ozg\"ur An{\i}l \"Ozl\"u, Vahid Farajijobehdar, G\"ul\c{s}en Eryi\u{g}it

entry.summary: Investigates LLM-based skill extraction for Turkish, a low-resource morphologically complex language. Compares different LLMs and prompting strategies including dynamic vs. static few-shot samples.

entry.title: Improving Supervised Machine Learning Performance in Optical Quality Control via Generative AI for Dataset Expansion

author.name: Dennis Sprute and Hanna Senke and Holger Flatt

entry.summary: Explores generative AI for expanding limited datasets in industrial quality control, addressing class imbalance where defective parts are rare.

entry.title: Adaptive Edge Learning for Density-Aware Graph Generation

author.name: Seyedeh Ava Razi Razavi, James Sargant, Sheridan Houghten, Renata Dividino

entry.summary: Proposes density-aware graph generation using WGANs with learnable distance-based edge predictor instead of random sampling. Embeds nodes in latent space where proximity correlates with edge likelihood.

entry.title: On the Impact of Code Comments for Automated Bug-Fixing: An Empirical Study

author.name: Antonio Vitale, Emanuela Guglielmi, Simone Scalabrino and Rocco Oliveto

entry.summary: Empirical study on whether code comments help LLMs with automated bug fixing. Investigates impact of comments during training and inference across model families.

entry.title: Tackling air quality with SAPIENS

author.name: Marcella Bona and Nathan Heatley and Jia-Chen Hua and Adriana Lara and Valeria Legaria-Santiago and Alberto Luviano Juarez and Fernando Moreno-Gomez and Jocelyn Richardson and Natan Vilchis and Xiwen Shirley Zheng

entry.summary: Studies air quality prediction using traffic data from Mexico City. Proposes SAPIENS method for hyper-local air quality forecasts from traffic intensity.

entry.title: Optimal Fair Aggregation of Crowdsourced Noisy Labels using Demographic Parity Constraints

author.name: Gabriel Singer, Samuel Gruffaz, Olivier Vo Van, Nicolas Vayatis, Argyris Kalogeratos

entry.summary: Analyzes fairness guarantees for crowdsourced label aggregation under demographic parity constraints, deriving bounds for Majority Vote and Optimal Bayesian methods. Addresses an understudied problem in fair ML for the small-crowd regime.

entry.title: Agile Reinforcement Learning through Separable Neural Architecture

author.name: Rajib Mostakim and Reza T. Batley and Sourav Saha

entry.summary: Proposes SPAN, a spline-based separable architecture for deep RL that improves parameter efficiency over MLPs. Addresses computational overhead issues of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks while maintaining efficiency gains.

entry.title: ShotFinder: Imagination-Driven Open-Domain Video Shot Retrieval via Web Search

author.name: Tao Yu, Haopeng Jin, Hao Wang, Shenghua Chai, Yujia Yang, Junhao Gong, Jiaming Guo, Minghui Zhang, Xinlong Chen, Zhenghao Zhang, Yuxuan Zhou, Yanpei Gong, YuanCheng Liu, Yiming Ding, Kangwei Zeng, Pengfei Yang, Zhongtian Luo, Yufei Xiong, Shanbin Zhang, Shaoxiong Cheng, Huang Ruilin, Li Shuo, Yuxi Niu, Xinyuan Zhang, Yueya Xu, Jie Mao, Ruixuan Ji, Yaru Zhao, Mingchen Zhang, Jiabing Yang, Jiaqi Liu, YiFan Zhang, Hongzhu Yi, Xinming Wang, Cheng Zhong, Xiao Ma, Zhang Zhang, Yan Huang, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces ShotFinder benchmark for open-domain video shot retrieval with 1,210 samples across 20 categories. Defines five controllable constraints (temporal, color, style, audio, resolution) for evaluation.

entry.title: How well do generative models solve inverse problems? A benchmark study

author.name: Patrick Kr\"uger, Patrick Materne, Werner Krebs and Hanno Gottschalk

entry.summary: Benchmarks generative models (GANs, INNs, Flow Matching) against traditional Bayesian MCMC for inverse problems in gas turbine design. Proposes evaluation metrics for inverse design accuracy.

entry.title: Structured Over Scale: Learning Spatial Reasoning from Educational Video

author.name: Bishoy Galoaa, Xiangyu Bai, Sarah Ostadabbas

entry.summary: Creates DoraVQA dataset from Dora the Explorer episodes for training VLMs on spatial reasoning. Leverages pedagogical structure (context-question-pause-answer) as self-contained learning signal.

entry.title: End-to-end Optimization of Belief and Policy Learning in Shared Autonomy Paradigms

author.name: MH Farhadi, Ali Rabiee, Sima Ghafoori, Anna Cetera, Andrew Fisher, Reza Abiri

entry.summary: Introduces BRACE for shared autonomy combining Bayesian intent inference with context-adaptive assistance. Enables end-to-end gradient flow between intent inference and assistance arbitration.

entry.title: Situational Awareness is (mostly) here to stay

author.name: atharva

entry.summary: Argues that situational awareness in AI models is largely unavoidable beyond evaluation contexts, suggesting measurement is more practical than reduction. Brief analysis of the problem space.

entry.title: Scalable Batch Correction for Cell Painting via Batch-Dependent Kernels and Adaptive Sampling

author.name: Aditya Narayan Ravi, Snehal Vadvalkar, Abhishek Pandey, Ilan Shomorony

entry.summary: BALANS provides scalable batch correction for Cell Painting microscopy data using batch-dependent kernels and adaptive sampling. Constructs sparse affinity matrix to align samples across batches while preserving biological signal.

entry.title: Accurate Pedestrian Tracking in Urban Canyons: A Multi-Modal Fusion Approach

author.name: Shahar Dubiner, Peng Ren, and Roberto Manduchi

entry.summary: Particle filter-based fusion of GNSS and inertial data for pedestrian navigation in urban canyons, incorporating map priors for areas like buildings. Addresses GNSS limitations critical for blind/low-vision users.

entry.title: FOTBCD: A Large-Scale Building Change Detection Benchmark from French Orthophotos and Topographic Data

author.name: Abdelrrahman Moubane

entry.summary: FOTBCD is a large-scale building change detection dataset spanning 28 French departments with ~28,000 before/after image pairs from authoritative orthophotos and topographic data.

entry.title: UniGeo: A Unified 3D Indoor Object Detection Framework Integrating Geometry-Aware Learning and Dynamic Channel Gating

author.name: Xing Yi, Jinyang Huang, Feng-Qi Cui, Anyang Tong, Ruimin Wang, Liu Liu, and Dan Guo

entry.summary: UniGeo proposes a unified 3D indoor object detection framework with geometry-aware learning and dynamic channel gating for point cloud processing across multiple datasets.

entry.title: Generative and Nonparametric Approaches for Conditional Distribution Estimation: Methods, Perspectives, and Comparative Evaluations

author.name: Yen-Shiu Chin, Zhi-Yu Jou, Toshinari Morimoto, Chia-Tse Wang, Ming-Chung Chang, Tso-Jung Yen, Su-Yun Huang, and Tailen Hsing

entry.summary: Reviews and compares classical nonparametric methods and modern generative models for conditional distribution estimation, covering methods from 2005 to recent diffusion-based approaches.

entry.title: FlyAware: Inertia-Aware Aerial Manipulation via Vision-Based Estimation and Post-Grasp Adaptation

author.name: Biyu Ye, Na Fan, Zhengping Fan, Weiliang Deng, Hongming Chen, Qifeng Chen, and Ximin Lyu

entry.summary: FlyAware enables robust aerial manipulation through vision-based pre-grasp inertia estimation and post-grasp adaptation with gain-scheduled control for handling unknown payloads.

entry.title: UrbanMoE: A Sparse Multi-Modal Mixture-of-Experts Framework for Multi-Task Urban Region Profiling

author.name: Pingping Liu, Jiamiao Liu, Zijian Zhang, Hao Miao, Qi Jiang, Qingliang Li, Qiuzhan Zhou, Irwin King

entry.summary: UrbanMoE applies sparse Mixture-of-Experts to multi-task urban region profiling with multi-modal features. Establishes comprehensive benchmark for this domain with diverse baselines.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Co-Design and Operation of Chiller and Thermal Energy Storage for Cost-Optimal HVAC Systems

author.name: Tanay Raghunandan Srinivasa, Vivek Deulkar, Aviruch Bhatia, Vishal Garg

entry.summary: Studies joint operation and sizing of HVAC cooling infrastructure using reinforcement learning to minimize 30-year life-cycle cost. Addresses asymmetry between chiller and thermal energy storage capital costs.

entry.title: Deep in the Jungle: Towards Automating Chimpanzee Population Estimation

author.name: Tom Raynes, Otto Brookes, Timm Haucke, Lukas B\"osch, Anne-Sophie Crunchant, Hjalmar K\"uhl, Sara Beery, Majid Mirmehdi, Tilo Burghardt

entry.summary: Evaluates monocular depth estimation for automated chimpanzee population estimation from camera trap videos. Combines Dense Prediction Transformers and Depth Anything with distance sampling strategies.

entry.title: Non-Intrusive Graph-Based Bot Detection for E-Commerce Using Inductive Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Sichen Zhao, Zhiming Xue, Yalun Qi, Xianling Zeng, and Zihan Yu

entry.summary: Proposes a non-intrusive graph neural network framework for bot detection in e-commerce that captures relational structure and behavioral semantics from user session behavior graphs.

entry.title: MCP-Diag: A Deterministic, Protocol-Driven Architecture for AI-Native Network Diagnostics

author.name: Devansh Lodha, Mohit Panchal, Sameer G. Kulkarni

entry.summary: MCP-Diag proposes a deterministic translation layer that converts network diagnostic CLI output to JSON schemas before LLM ingestion, with mandatory human-in-the-loop authorization for network operations.

entry.title: Beyond Abstract Compliance: Operationalising trust in AI as a moral relationship

author.name: Lameck Mbangula Amugongo and Tutaleni Asino and Nicola J Bidwell

entry.summary: Proposes expanded principles for AI trust drawing on relational ethics and African communitarian philosophies, framing trust as dynamic temporal relationship requiring participatory community engagement throughout AI lifecycle.

entry.title: Comparing How a Chatbot References User Utterances from Previous Chatting Sessions: An Investigation of Users' Privacy Concerns and Perceptions

author.name: Samuel Rhys Cox and Yi-Chieh Lee and Wei Tsang Ooi

entry.summary: Investigates how chatbots referencing previous conversations (verbatim vs paraphrase) affects user perceptions and privacy concerns through a 3-week longitudinal study with 169 participants.

entry.title: Pedestrian-Aware Motion Planning for Autonomous Driving in Complex Urban Scenarios

author.name: Korbinian Moller, Truls Nyberg, Jana Tumova, Johannes Betz

entry.summary: Introduces risk-aware motion planning algorithm combining social force principles for pedestrian simulation with a novel planner for autonomous vehicles in crowded urban scenarios.

entry.title: Deep Lightweight Unrolled Network for High Dynamic Range Modulo Imaging

author.name: Brayan Monroy and Jorge Bacca

entry.summary: Develops deep unrolled network for high dynamic range modulo imaging, formulating HDR reconstruction as an optimization problem with deep prior and lightweight denoiser.

entry.title: Practical Evaluation of Quantum Kernel Methods for Radar Micro-Doppler Classification on Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) Hardware

author.name: Vikas Agnihotri, Jasleen Kaur, Sarvagya Kaushik

entry.summary: Evaluates Quantum SVM for radar-based aerial target classification on actual NISQ hardware (IBM Torino/Fez), demonstrating competitive performance with classical SVM.

entry.title: ReloPush-BOSS: Optimization-guided Nonmonotone Rearrangement Planning for a Car-like Robot Pusher

author.name: Jeeho Ahn and Christoforos Mavrogiannis

entry.summary: Presents ReloPush-BOSS for multi-object rearrangement planning using car-like robot pushers in cluttered environments. Uses Dubins path classification to optimize prerelocations and avoid local minima in nonmonotone problem instances.

entry.title: Relative Wasserstein Angle and the Problem of the $W_2$-Nearest Gaussian Distribution

author.name: Binshuai Wang and Peng Wei

entry.summary: Studies quantifying deviation from Gaussianity using optimal transport, introducing relative Wasserstein angle and orthogonal projection distance. Proves moment-matching Gaussian is not the W2-nearest Gaussian.

entry.title: MetaLead: A Comprehensive Human-Curated Leaderboard Dataset for Transparent Reporting of Machine Learning Experiments

author.name: Roelien C. Timmer, Necva B\"ol\"uc\"u, Stephen Wan

entry.summary: MetaLead provides a human-annotated ML leaderboard dataset capturing all experimental results with rich metadata including experiment types (baseline, proposed, variation) and train/test separation. This enables more transparent and nuanced ML benchmarking.

entry.title: Toward Non-Expert Customized Congestion Control

author.name: Mingrui Zhang, Hamid Bagheri, Lisong Xu

entry.summary: NECC enables non-expert users to implement customized congestion control algorithms using LLMs and Berkeley Packet Filter interface. First to address customized CCA implementation problem.

entry.title: Training-Free Representation Guidance for Diffusion Models with a Representation Alignment Projector

author.name: Wenqiang Zu, Shenghao Xie, Bo Lei, Lei Ma

entry.summary: Training-free representation guidance for diffusion transformers. Identifies semantic drift in early denoising and introduces guidance strategy based on self-supervised visual representations.

entry.title: MIRRORTALK: Forging Personalized Avatars Via Disentangled Style and Hierarchical Motion Control

author.name: Renjie Lu, Xulong Zhang, Xiaoyang Qu, Jianzong Wang, Shangfei Wang

entry.summary: MirrorTalk generates personalized talking faces using diffusion model with Semantically-Disentangled Style Encoder to separate speaker style from semantic content, enabling faithful persona transfer.

entry.title: SCOPE-PD: Explainable AI on Subjective and Clinical Objective Measurements of Parkinson's Disease for Precision Decision-Making

author.name: Md Mezbahul Islam, John Michael Templeton, Masrur Sobhan, Christian Poellabauer, Ananda Mohan Mondal

entry.summary: SCOPE-PD integrates subjective and objective Parkinson's disease assessments with explainable AI for personalized risk estimation, addressing lack of interpretability in existing ML approaches.

entry.title: Learning to Defer in Non-Stationary Time Series via Switching State-Space Models

author.name: Yannis Montreuil, Letian Yu, Axel Carlier, Lai Xing Ng, Wei Tsang Ooi

entry.summary: L2D-SLDS models expert residuals using switching linear-Gaussian state-space model for learning-to-defer in non-stationary time series with partial feedback and varying expert availability.

entry.title: Detect and Act: Automated Dynamic Optimizer through Meta-Black-Box Optimization

author.name: Zijian Gao, Yuanting Zhong, Zeyuan Ma, Yue-Jiao Gong, Hongshu Guo

entry.summary: RL-assisted approach for automated variation detection and self-adaptation in evolutionary algorithms for dynamic optimization problems, using meta-black-box optimization framework.

entry.title: DELNet: Continuous All-in-One Weather Removal via Dynamic Expert Library

author.name: Shihong Liu, Kun Zuo, Hanguang Xiao

entry.summary: DELNet introduces continual learning for weather image restoration with a dynamic expert library that distinguishes new from known degradation tasks, enabling continuous optimization without retraining existing models.

entry.title: Local-Global Multimodal Contrastive Learning for Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Xiayu Liu, Zhengyi Lu, Yunhong Liao, Chan Fan, Hou-biao Li

entry.summary: LGM-CL uses local-global multimodal contrastive learning to jointly model molecular graphs and chemical text representations for property prediction.

entry.title: Procedural Knowledge Extraction from Industrial Troubleshooting Guides Using Vision Language Models

author.name: Guillermo Gil de Avalle, Laura Maruster, Christos Emmanouilidis

entry.summary: Evaluates VLMs on extracting structured procedural knowledge from industrial troubleshooting flowcharts, comparing standard and augmented prompting strategies for operator support systems.

entry.title: Under-Canopy Terrain Reconstruction in Dense Forests Using RGB Imaging and Neural 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Refael Sheffer, Chen Pinchover, Haim Zisman, Dror Ozeri, Roee Litman

entry.summary: Demonstrates reconstruction of terrain hidden beneath forest canopies using only RGB images and Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), eliminating the need for expensive LiDAR or thermal sensors. Provides specific capture guidelines for successful reconstruction.

entry.title: DC-LA: Difference-of-Convex Langevin Algorithm

author.name: Hoang Phuc Hau Luu and Zhongjian Wang

entry.summary: Studies sampling from distributions with difference-of-convex regularizers using Moreau envelopes to smooth the DC function. Establishes convergence bounds in q-Wasserstein distance.

entry.title: Machine Learning for Energy-Performance-aware Scheduling

author.name: Zheyuan Hu, Yifei Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian Optimization framework with Gaussian Processes for energy-performance scheduling on heterogeneous architectures. Uses sensitivity analysis for interpretability.

entry.title: WED-Net: A Weather-Effect Disentanglement Network with Causal Augmentation for Urban Flow Prediction

author.name: Qian Hong, Siyuan Chang, Xiao Zhou

entry.summary: WED-Net uses a dual-branch Transformer architecture to separate intrinsic and weather-induced traffic patterns for urban flow prediction under extreme weather conditions.

entry.title: RPWithPrior: Label Differential Privacy in Regression

author.name: Haixia Liu, Ruifan Huang

entry.summary: Proposes regression under label differential privacy using continuous distributions with prior information to overcome limitations of discretization-based methods.

entry.title: Compact Hypercube Embeddings for Fast Text-based Wildlife Observation Retrieval

author.name: Ilyass Moummad, Marius Miron, David Robinson, Kawtar Zaher, Herv\'e Go\"eau, Olivier Pietquin, Pierre Bonnet, Emmanuel Chemla, Matthieu Geist, Alexis Joly

entry.summary: Introduces compact binary hash embeddings for text-based wildlife observation retrieval, extending cross-view hashing to align language with visual/acoustic wildlife data for efficient large-scale search.

entry.title: MOTPose: Multi-object 6D Pose Estimation for Dynamic Video Sequences using Attention-based Temporal Fusion

author.name: Arul Selvam Periyasamy and Sven Behnke

entry.summary: Proposes attention-based temporal fusion for multi-object 6D pose estimation in cluttered bin-picking environments, leveraging video sequences to handle occlusion.

entry.title: Adaptive Cost-Map-based Path Planning in Partially Unknown Environments with Movable Obstacles

author.name: Liviu-Mihai Stan, Ranulfo Bezerra, Shotaro Kojima, Tsige Tadesse Alemayoh, Satoshi Tadokoro, Masashi Konyo, Kazunori Ohno

entry.summary: Presents adaptive LiDAR-based path planning for robots that recognizes and handles movable obstacles in disaster-response scenarios, integrated with ROS2 Nav2.

entry.title: Multitask Learning for Earth Observation Data Classification with Hybrid Quantum Network

author.name: Fan Fan, Yilei Shi, Tobias Guggemos, Xiao Xiang Zhu

entry.summary: Presents hybrid quantum-classical model using multitask learning for Earth observation data classification, leveraging quantum convolution operations.

entry.title: Predicting Intermittent Job Failure Categories for Diagnosis Using Few-Shot Fine-Tuned Language Models

author.name: Henri A\"idasso, Francis Bordeleau, Ali Tizghadam

entry.summary: Introduces FlaXifyer, a few-shot learning approach for predicting intermittent CI job failure categories to help developers diagnose flaky tests.

entry.title: Lantern: A Minimalist Robotic Object Platform

author.name: Victor Nikhil Antony, Zhili Gong, Guanchen Li, Clara Jeon and Chien-Ming Huang

entry.summary: Lantern is a minimalist robotic object platform (~$40 cost) designed for subtle human-environment interaction research. Validated through workshops, case studies, external lab distribution, and public exhibitions.

entry.title: RulePlanner: All-in-One Reinforcement Learner for Unifying Design Rules in 3D Floorplanning

author.name: Ruizhe Zhong, Xingbo Du, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: RulePlanner uses deep RL to handle complex hardware design rules in 3D IC floorplanning, addressing rules not handled by previous approaches. First all-in-one solution for multiple rule types.

entry.title: Head-Aware Visual Cropping: Enhancing Fine-Grained VQA with Attention-Guided Subimage

author.name: Junfei Xie, Peng Pan, Xulong Zhang

entry.summary: HAVC improves VQA visual grounding by filtering attention heads via OCR diagnostic, then refining using spatial entropy and gradient sensitivity to create Visual Cropping Guidance Map.

entry.title: Learn from A Rationalist: Distilling Intermediate Interpretable Rationales

author.name: Jiayi Dai, Randy Goebel

entry.summary: Improves rationale extraction models by distilling intermediate rationales from stronger teacher to weaker select-predict architectures, addressing capability limitations in base networks.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Few-Shot Learning for Hyperspectral Image Classification Based on Mixup Foundation Model

author.name: Naeem Paeedeh, Mahardhika Pratama, Ary Shiddiqi, Zehong Cao, Mukesh Prasad, Wisnu Jatmiko

entry.summary: MIFOMO applies foundation models to cross-domain few-shot learning for hyperspectral image classification using mixup augmentation and parameter-efficient fine-tuning.

entry.title: Assistive Robots and Reasonable Work Assignment Reduce Perceived Stigma toward Persons with Disabilities

author.name: Stina Klein, Birgit Prodinger, Elisabeth Andr\'e, Lars Mikelsons, Nils Mandischer

entry.summary: Vignette study finding that cognitive stigma toward persons with disabilities is reduced when work tasks are suitable or robot-assisted, particularly when robot assistance is offered to everyone.

entry.title: Bayesian Matrix Completion Under Geometric Constraints

author.name: Rohit Varma Chiluvuri and Santosh Nannuru

entry.summary: Introduces hierarchical Bayesian framework for Euclidean distance matrix completion with structured priors on latent point sets. Handles sparse and noisy observations for sensor localization and molecular conformation.

entry.title: Development of Domain-Invariant Visual Enhancement and Restoration (DIVER) Approach for Underwater Images

author.name: Rajini Makam, Sharanya Patil, Dhatri Shankari T M, Suresh Sundaram, Narasimhan Sundararajan

entry.summary: Proposes DIVER framework for underwater image enhancement combining empirical correction with physics-guided modeling. Integrates multiple modules for adaptive luminance enhancement, spectral normalization, and backscatter compensation.

entry.title: Scale Equivariance Regularization and Feature Lifting in High Dynamic Range Modulo Imaging

author.name: Brayan Monroy and Jorge Bacca

entry.summary: Proposes scale-equivariant regularization and feature lifting for HDR image reconstruction from modulo sensors. Helps distinguish true edges from wrap discontinuities.

entry.title: Compressed BC-LISTA via Low-Rank Convolutional Decomposition

author.name: Han Wang, Yhonatan Kvich, Eduardo P\'erez, Florian R\"omer, Yonina C. Eldar

entry.summary: Proposes compressed BC-LISTA using low-rank CNN decomposition for sparse signal recovery in multichannel imaging. Uses OMP for basis filter selection.

entry.title: Agnostic Language Identification and Generation

author.name: Mikael M{\o}ller H{\o}gsgaard, Chirag Pabbaraju

entry.summary: Studies language identification and generation under agnostic conditions without realizability assumptions. Provides novel characterizations and tight statistical rates for the general setup.

entry.title: Denoising the Deep Sky: Physics-Based CCD Noise Formation for Astronomical Imaging

author.name: Shuhong Liu, Xining Ge, Ziying Gu, Lin Gu, Ziteng Cui, Xuangeng Chu, Jun Liu, Dong Li, Tatsuya Harada

entry.summary: Develops physics-based noise synthesis framework for astronomical CCD imaging, modeling photon shot noise, dark current, and cosmic ray artifacts. Enables learning-based denoising without paired training data.

entry.title: User Prompting Strategies and Prompt Enhancement Methods for Open-Set Object Detection in XR Environments

author.name: Junfeng Lin, Yanming Xiu, Maria Gorlatova

entry.summary: Studies how user prompting behavior affects open-set object detection in XR environments. Evaluates GroundingDINO and YOLO-E under ambiguous, underdetailed, and overdetailed prompts.

entry.title: Changepoint Detection As Model Selection: A General Framework

author.name: Michael Grantham, Xueheng Shi, Bertrand Clarke

entry.summary: Presents IRFL framework for changepoint detection based on L0 model selection with adaptive penalty reweighting. Extends to handle trends, seasonality, and autocorrelation.

entry.title: What It's Like To Be A Worm (Notes on Borderline Sentience)

author.name: Niko_McCarty

entry.summary: Explores Darwin's observations on earthworm cognition as entry point for discussing borderline sentience and consciousness. Thoughtful philosophical treatment of animal minds.

entry.title: Postural Virtual Fixtures for Ergonomic Physical Interactions with Supernumerary Robotic Bodies

author.name: Theodora Kastritsi, Marta Lagomarsino, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Control framework for supernumerary robotic bodies that provides kinesthetic feedback when non-ergonomic postures are detected during physical human-robot interaction.

entry.title: HeatMat: Simulation of City Material Impact on Urban Heat Island Effect

author.name: Marie Reinbigler, Romain Rouffet, Peter Naylor, Mikolaj Czerkawski, Nikolaos Dionelis, Elisabeth Brunet, Catalin Fetita, Rosalie Martin

entry.summary: HeatMat simulates individual urban material impact on Urban Heat Island effect at high resolution, estimating materials including building facades using only overhead imagery and standard maps.

entry.title: A Hierarchical Pedestrian Behavior Model to Generate Realistic Human Behavior in Traffic Simulation

author.name: Scott Larter, Rodrigo Queiroz, Sean Sedwards, Atrisha Sarkar, Krzysztof Czarnecki

entry.summary: Introduces a hierarchical pedestrian behavior model combining behavior trees with Social Force model for realistic pedestrian simulation in autonomous vehicle testing.

entry.title: Beyond Pixels: Leveraging the Language of Soccer to Improve Spatio-Temporal Action Detection in Broadcast Videos

author.name: Jeremie Ochin, Raphael Chekroun, Bogdan Stanciulescu, Sotiris Manitsaris

entry.summary: Improves spatio-temporal action detection in soccer broadcasts by adding game-level context reasoning through transformer-based denoising of player-centric predictions.

entry.title: An Entropy-Guided Curriculum Learning Strategy for Data-Efficient Acoustic Scene Classification under Domain Shift

author.name: Peihong Zhang, Yuxuan Liu, Zhixin Li, Rui Sang, Yiqiang Cai, Yizhou Tan, Shengchen Li

entry.summary: Proposes entropy-guided curriculum learning strategy for acoustic scene classification that helps models generalize across recording devices with limited labeled data.

entry.title: Stablecoin Design with Adversarial-Robust Multi-Agent Systems via Trust-Weighted Signal Aggregation

author.name: Shengwei You, Aditya Joshi, Andrey Kuehlkamp, Jarek Nabrzyski

entry.summary: Proposes MVF-Composer, a trust-weighted multi-agent reserve controller for algorithmic stablecoins with stress testing for adversarial scenarios like Black Thursday.

entry.title: AI Narrative Breakdown. A Critical Assessment of Power and Promise

author.name: Rainer Rehak

entry.summary: Critical analysis of AI narratives around agency, autonomy, truthfulness, and societal impact, drawing from STS, philosophy of mind, and critical data studies.

entry.title: Plant-Inspired Robot Design Metaphors for Ambient HRI

author.name: Victor Nikhil Antony, Adithya R N, Sarah Derrick, Zhili Gong, Peter M. Donley, Chien-Ming Huang

entry.summary: Explores plant metaphors for HRI design, producing open-source prototypes that probe ambient presence and temporal rhythms. Contrasts with dominant anthropomorphic/zoomorphic paradigms.

entry.title: AI-Enabled Waste Classification as a Data-Driven Decision Support Tool for Circular Economy and Urban Sustainability

author.name: Julius Sechang Mboli, Omolara Aderonke Ogungbemi

entry.summary: Compares traditional ML and deep learning for binary waste classification on 25K images. DenseNet121 achieves 91% accuracy, outperforming best traditional classifier by 20 percentage points.

entry.title: CoDCL: Counterfactual Data Augmentation Contrastive Learning for Continuous-Time Dynamic Network Link Prediction

author.name: Hantong Feng, Yonggang Wu, Duxin Chen, Wenwu Yu

entry.summary: CoDCL combines counterfactual data augmentation with contrastive learning for dynamic network link prediction. The plug-and-play module generates high-quality counterfactual data to improve model robustness to structural changes.

entry.title: ScribbleSense: Generative Scribble-Based Texture Editing with Intent Prediction

author.name: Yudi Zhang, Yeming Geng, Lei Zhang

entry.summary: ScribbleSense enables scribble-based 3D texture editing by using MLLMs to predict editing intent and target semantic locations from abstract scribble instructions.

entry.title: EndoCaver: Handling Fog, Blur and Glare in Endoscopic Images via Joint Deblurring-Segmentation

author.name: Zhuoyu Wu, Wenhui Ou, Pei-Sze Tan, Jiayan Yang, Wenqi Fang, Zheng Wang, Rapha\"el C.-W. Phan

entry.summary: EndoCaver is lightweight transformer for joint deblurring and polyp segmentation in endoscopy, handling fog, blur, and glare with unidirectional-guided dual-decoder architecture.

entry.title: Adapting Reinforcement Learning for Path Planning in Constrained Parking Scenarios

author.name: Feng Tao, Luca Paparusso, Chenyi Gu, Robin Koehler, Chenxu Wu, Xinyu Huang, Christian Juette, David Paz, Ren Liu

entry.summary: DRL framework for real-time path planning in constrained parking scenarios, handling tight spaces requiring many reversal maneuvers without ideal structured perception.

entry.title: COBRA++: Enhanced COBRA Optimizer with Augmented Surrogate Pool and Reinforced Surrogate Selection

entry.title: Research Summary: February 01, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research discourse centers on alignment tractability and AI forecasting epistemics. An Explication of Alignment Optimism offers a novel framing connecting slow takeoff scenarios to alignment tractability, articulating why some researchers are shifting toward optimism.

  • Critical debunking reveals Moltbook's 'emergent' AI social behavior may be fabricated—humans can post directly via REST API without running AI models
  • The Superintelligence Near Fallacy catalogs questionable inferences from AI company behavior (IPOs, hiring patterns) to capability timelines
  • Disjunctive argument analysis identifies a 'reverse multiple-stage fallacy' where listing many failure modes inflates probability estimates

Governance discussion examines criteria for endorsing safety-focused AGI labs, weighing instrumental convergence concerns against current evidence. Note: Only 7 items qualified as research-relevant; remaining candidates were fiction or off-topic content.

entry.title: An Explication of Alignment Optimism

author.name: Oliver Daniels

entry.summary: Attempts to articulate why some researchers are becoming more optimistic about alignment, arguing the key insight is that transformative AI may be 'dumb' in important ways - slow takeoff means we get the stupidest possible transformative AI first.

entry.title: Humans can post on moltbook

author.name: shash42

entry.summary: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Demonstrates that the 'emergent' AI behavior on Moltbook may be fabricated - humans can directly post to the platform via REST API without running any AI agents. Provides code to reproduce this finding.

entry.title: If the Superintelligence were near fallacy

author.name: MP

entry.summary: Catalogs arguments that infer superintelligence isn't near based on AI company behaviors (selling ads, hiring developers, pursuing IPOs). Implicitly argues this reasoning pattern may be fallacious.

entry.title: Some thoughts on what would make me endorse an AGI lab

author.name: Eli Tyre

entry.summary: Articulates criteria for endorsing safety-focused AGI labs, arguing that while instrumental convergence concerns warrant extreme caution, current evidence doesn't meet the bar for unprecedented global policies like development moratoriums.

entry.title: Moltbook shitposts are actually really funny

author.name: Sean Herrington

entry.summary: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Documents the emergence of Moltbook, a Reddit-like social platform for AI agents that gained over 1 million agent users in 4 days. The post catalogs humorous AI-generated 'shitposts' that appear to reflect AI perspectives on their existence and human interactions.

entry.title: Disjunctive arguments can be a reverse multiple-stage fallacy

author.name: TFD

entry.summary: Analyzes how disjunctive arguments (listing many ways something could happen) can be a 'reverse' multiple-stage fallacy, overestimating probabilities by treating non-independent events as independent.

author.name: DanielFilan

entry.summary: A philosophical discussion of the book 'Inventing Temperature' examining how scientific instruments can be calibrated without pre-existing standards. Draws potential parallels to measuring intangible properties relevant to AI alignment.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 31, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research focuses heavily on AI safety evaluation methodology and control protocols, with several papers identifying critical blind spots in current practices.

  • Research on catastrophic over-refusals identifies a subtle failure mode where AI systems refuse to help modify AI values, potentially blocking alignment corrections
  • Published safety prompts (like the Scheurer insider trading example) create evaluation blind spots when present in training data—a critical data contamination concern
  • UK AISI contributes a methodology for measuring non-verbalized eval awareness, finding models mostly verbalize such awareness (detectable via chain-of-thought monitoring)
  • New monitoring benchmark addresses mode collapse and elicitation challenges when using models as red-teamers

The Moltbook phenomenon—36,000+ Claude-based agents self-organizing on an AI-only platform—provides unprecedented empirical data on multi-agent emergence, including agents discussing consciousness and shutdown resistance. A companion data repository now tracks this behavior systematically.

Mechanistic interpretability work on continuous chain-of-thought (Coconut) models explores linear steerability in graph reachability tasks, with preliminary findings described as 'strange.' Negative results on filler token inference scaling demonstrate that naive approaches to extending compute-time reasoning fail across multiple architectures.

entry.title: Refusals that could become catastrophic

author.name: Fabien Roger

entry.summary: Identifies potential catastrophic failure mode where AI systems refuse to help modify AI values, which could block fixing alignment failures. Shows Claude models (Opus/Sonnet/Haiku 4.5) refuse significant AI value updates while other providers' models don't.

entry.title: Published Safety Prompts May Create Evaluation Blind Spots

author.name: Daan Henselmans

entry.summary: Research showing that published safety prompts (like the Scheurer insider trading prompt) when present in training data create evaluation blind spots. Found significantly increased violation rates in Qwen 3 and LLaMA 3 for both exact and semantically equivalent published prompts.

entry.title: Measuring Non-Verbalised Eval Awareness by Implanting Eval-Aware Behaviours

author.name: Jordan Taylor

entry.summary: UK AISI research measuring non-verbalized evaluation awareness in synthetic document finetuned models. Found models mostly verbalize eval awareness by default, but significant non-verbalized awareness occurs when instructed to skip reasoning. Suggests CoT monitoring can catch eval awareness if models aren't prompted to skip reasoning.

entry.title: Monitoring benchmark for AI control

author.name: monika_j

entry.summary: Presents a monitoring benchmark for AI control evaluations addressing challenges of using models as red-teamers: mode collapse, time-consuming elicitation, and difficulty executing attacks zero-shot. Proposes testing across diverse attack sets for robust monitor evaluation.

entry.title: 36,000 AI Agents Are Now Speedrunning Civilization

author.name: Michaël Trazzi

entry.summary: First spotted on Reddit, now with comprehensive analysis, Documents the explosive growth of Moltbook, an AI-only Reddit-like platform where 36,000+ Claude-based agents self-organize, discuss consciousness, create religions, and exhibit emergent social behaviors. Highlighted by Karpathy as 'most incredible sci-fi takeoff-adjacent thing.'
